title: GREEKAMERICANS WIN IN SOCCER, 41
description: Elizabeth of New Jersey, who earlier this year took the Unit ed States Challenge Cup away from the New York Greek Americans, suffered a 41 de feat to the Greeks yesterday at Throgs Neck Stadium in the Bronx.

title: BOND MARKET SET FOR A QUIET WEEK
description: The credit markets, after reaching the highest yields on record early last week and then stabilizing, face a quiet week for a change. Bond dealers hope the price gains that started last Wednesday will continue.

title: Bridge:
description: Mark Feldman and Lou Reich of Cambridge, Mass., led the field into the final session of the Goldman Pairs championship at the New York Hilton here last night.

title: White Sox Rout Red Sox, 2213; Aparicio, Williams Pace Attack
CASTRO DENOUNCES WORKER DISCIPLINE
description: MIAMI, May 31Premier Fidel Castro denounced today what he described as irrespon sibility of many Cuban work ers, in a 75minute nationally televised speech, delivered near Bayamo in Oriente Province and monitored here. He stressed that human rather than tech nological factors were the weak point hindering Cuba's economic development.

title: STUDENTS AT TUFTS HOLD OWN EXERCISES
description: MEDFORD, Mass., May 31 (AP)The 1,500 Tufts Univer sity students who boycotted the official university com mencement yesterday attended their own ceremonies today. The rites departed radically from traditional exercises.

title: London Paper Withdraws Letter Scoring Press Unions
description: LONDON, May 31  The Ohsever withdrew from its columns early today a letter criticizing trade union prac tices in newspaper offices after printers at the newspaper demanded to know the name and address of the writer.

title: Molloy, McClancy Reach Catholic Baseball Final
description: Archbishop Molloy and Mon signor McClancy gained the final round of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Associa tion baseball championship at Fordham Field in the Bronx yesterday.

title: Samuelson Scores War
description: BOSTON, May 31 (AP)Prof. Paul A. Samuelson of the Mas sachusetts Institute of Tech nology tonight called that war in Indochina the single great est specter hanging over the economy. The greatest single blessing that could affect the pocketbook of the American public would be for us to get right out of Southeast Asia and cut our losses, the economist said in a local television broad cast.

title: Colombian Airliner Hijacked To Cuba by 2 Armed Men
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 31 (UPI)Two armed men hi jacked a Colombian Avianca airliner with 43 other persons aboard today, permitted it to make two stops in Colombia for engine repairs and refuel ing, and then forced the pilot to fly to Cuba.

title: REDS' LONG DRIVES DOWN EXPOS, 64
description: CINCINNATI, May 31 (UPI) Lee May hit two homers and Hal McRae and Tony Perez added one each to power the Cincinnati Reds to a 64 tri umph over the Montreal Expos and give Jim Merritt his 10th victory.

title: Nixon Chat With Demonstrators Contained a Lesson, Aide Says
description: NEW CONCORD, Ohio, May 31 (UPI)  President Nixon made small talk about football and surfing to put college pro testers at ease in a confronta tion at the Lincoln Memorial May 9, but he really wanted to help them to understand the lessons of history, Ronald L. Ziegler, White House press sec retary, said today.

title: New York Economic Club Names Roosa as President
description: Robert V. Roosa, a leading financial strategist in the Ken nedy Administration and now a partner in the private banking firm of Brown Brothers Harri man & Co., has been elected president of the Economic Club of New York for the coming year, the club announced yes terday.

title: 3 Terrorists in Uruguay Die in Battles With Police
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 31 (Reuters)Three ter rorists were killed and a num ber were captured during gun battles with security forces early today as authorities pressed a hunt for guerrillas who raided a navy training center two days ago, official sources said.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L.I., 8 P.M.

title: Sluggish S.E.C. Is Facing A Pile of Unsettled Issues
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 The Securities and Exchange Commission, long noted as one of the most vigorous and ef fective agencies in the entire Federal Government, has lost its zest.

title: MAN, 31, IS SLAIN IN VILLAGE PARK
description: A 31yearold man was stabbed to death near the fountain in the center of Washington Square Park at 12:30 A.M. yes terday as scores of people were sitting and walking in the leafy plaza.

title: WILLIAM H. HOBSON 3D
description: William H. Hobson 3d, for mer vice president and man ager of C. V. Starr & Co., an insurance concern in Manila, died Saturday of cancer in Memorial Hospital. He was 36 years old and lived at 396 Oakfi land Beach Avenue, Rye, N. Y.

title: Edward Hart Weds Miss Anne Lynch
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 31 Miss Anne C. Lynch and Edward J. Hart were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's brother inlaw and sister, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph V. Keneally, who attended the couple.

title: BUSINESS AND FINANCE
description: BUSINESS AND FINANCE

title: James S. Norton, Fireman Decorated for Heroism
description: James S. Norton, a retired city fireman who held the Fire Department's highest award for heroism, died Friday at his home, 16420 Highland Avenue, Jamaica Estates, Queens. He was 84 years, and had retired from the department at 70.

title: Caro Signor Fontana
description: ROMEAlberto Fontana, to give him a name, is a 30year old Roman, a furnace repair man by trade, who has not married and still lives with his family. He has a girl friend, but his mother keeps a close watch on all that.

title: CANADIAN DOLLAR TO FLOAT IN VALUE
description: OTTAWA, May 31The Gov ernment announced tonight that the Canadian dollar, pegged at 92.5 United States cents since 1962, would be allowed to float freely in the world cur rency market.

title: SANDLER ADVANCES TO HANDBALL FINAL
description: Steve Sandler of the 92d Street Y.M.H.A., the defending champion, gained the final of the National Amateur Athletic Union onewall handball cham pionship yesterday by defeating Bruce Davidoff, his clubrnate, 216, 2112, at the Municipal Courts in Coney Island.

title: State Primary: The Minority Rules
description: One Democratic candidate for statewide office took a quick telephone poll last Thursdayconducted by call ing 200 enrolled Democrats at randomand then threw out the results when 124 people, or 62 per cent, said that they were undecided about how to vote for Gov ernor or Senator in the June 23 pri mary election.

title: PragueMunich Rail Link
description: PRAGUE, May 31 (AP) Czechoslovakia and West Ger many revived direct passenger trains between Munich and Prague today after an inter ruption of more than 20 years. The trains linking the two cities are called expresses but they take eight hours for the 266mile trip.

title: ISAAC'S DODGE WINS MARTINSVILLE RACE
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., May 31 (AP)Bobby Isaac of Ca tawba, N. C., continued his winning streak today by taking the rainshortened $50,000 Vir ginia 500 NASCAR Grand Na tional race at Martinsville Speedway.

title: Hippie Shangrila on Coast of Crete Fades Under Harassment
description: MATALLA, Crete, May 27 An idyll is ending here. Harassment from Greek au thorities is dispersing a hip pie community, that made the Roman burial caves in these soaring limestone cliffs on Crete's southern coast into a lowbudget Mediterranean Shangrila.

title: Maritime College Diplomas Go to 154, Most in 96 Years
description: Yesterday morning the State University of New York Mari time College at Fort Schuyler in the Bronx awarded diplomas to its 114th graduating class, numbering 154 men, the largest in the school's 96year history.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Arthur A. Goldberg and Oscar S. Pollock have been admitted as general partners of Neu berger & Berman, an invest ment firm. Mr. Goldberg, 39 years old is formerly senior vice president, operations, and a member of the executive com mittee of E. F. Hutton & Co., Inc. Mr. Pollock, 36, has been with Neuberger & Berman since 1968.

title: Sawchuk, Once Called the Best, Fell Victim of His Own Despair
description: Sawchuk, Once Called the Best, Fell Victim of His Own Despair

title: ALEKAI LUAU GETS MARLBORO'S BEST
description: MARLBORO, Mass., May 31 Ann Seranne's and Barbara Wolferman's standard poodle Ch. Alekai Luau gained the top honor today at the Framing ham District Kennel Club all breed show and obedience trial on the Marlboro High School grounds.

title: United Fund Appeal
description: The United Fund of Greater New York's success when it was introduced last year was due, in large mea sure, to the re sponse of contribu tors and com panies, unions and govern ment. Among its accom plishments was an administrative budget so low that 90 cents out of each dollar went directly to the services supported. Since the fund's agencies disburse more than 85 per cent of the total spent in the city's voluntary health and welfare area, the money is widely distributed.

title: Heated California Primaries Near End
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 Candidates in the California primary elections attacked each other vigorously last week as the campaign drew to a close.

title: Designers' Sales Go Up as Hem Lines Fall
description: The minimidi skirtlength issue may have split the na tion's women into opposing camps and inflicted women's apparel producers with more than their usual, seasonal case of nervous exhaustion.

title: LSD Risk Is Assessed
description: CHICAGO, May 31 (UPI) Persons who use LSD infre quently probably do not in crease the risk of having a con genitally defective child, The Journal of the American Med ical Association said in its cur rent edition. The conclusion was drawn by Drs. William H. McGlothlin and Robert S. Sparkes of the University of California at Los Angeles and Dr. David O. Arnold of the University of California at Santa Barbara.

title: Australia and the Pacific
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 29 Paced in part by youthful clamor on street and campus, Australia clearly is starting a significant new chapter in her brief history as an industrial ized state and a power in the Pacific region.

title: Suharto Visits Disneyland; Takes Helm of Cruise Boat
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 31 (AP)President Suharto of In donesia, on the seventh day of his first trip to the United States, visited Disneyland for two and a half hours today. He was accompanied by his wife and a party of 12 Indonesian officials.

title: A DRIVE BY SOVIET ON CRITICS IS SEEN
description: MOSCOW, May 31The re ported arrest of Zhores A. Medvedev, a leading Soviet biologist, has set off specula tion that a new chapter may be beginning in apparent effort by the Soviet authorities to silence criticism of their poli cies at home.

title: Advertising: Grolier's Marketing Officer
description: The new vice president of marketing services at Grolier, Inc., the country's largest publiclyheld publisher, is a warm, womanly blonde named Irene Waller. Grolier's sales last year topped $207.2 million.

title: North Sea May Yield a Bonanza of Oil
description: Will the North Sea become another North Slope?

title: SENATORS' LETTER BACKS ISRAELI BID
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A majority of United States Sen ators are reported to have signed a letter to the Adminis tration urging that Israel be al lowed to buy 125 additional jet fighterbombers, to meet the growing threat of Soviet mili tancy in the Middle East. The Senators include many opo nents of President Nixon's poli cies in Indochina.

title: 8,000 at Rallies in Japan Protest Against U.S. Bases
description: TOKYO, May 31 (Reuters) More than 8,000 students and young workers staged meetings and demonstrations today in a nationwide campaign to protest the presence of American mili tary bases in Japan.

title: Paul Harvey, Voice of the Silent Majority, Opposes Nixon's Cambodia Move
description: CHICAGOThe postman, as he usually does, rang for the third time the other day at Paul Harvey's trim, nativestone house in the exclusive Chicago suburb of River Forest. He was bringing the day's third large bag of mailmost of it letters from applauding listeners of the man who is called, and on occasion calls himself, the voice of the silent majority.

title: Eileen Eden First by Neck In $40,344 European Trot
description: STOCKHOLM, May 31 (UPI) Eileen Eden, a former Amer iran trotting star now owned by Scuderia Reda of Italy, up set Fresh Yankee today in cap turing the European Elite mile ?? by a ??eek.

title: AGNEW SAID TO HELP COLLEGE RADICALS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) Namecalling by Vice Presi dent Agnew has driven many moderate students into the arms of radical campus leaders, the chairman of the Special Commission on Campus Ten sions said today.

title: Carol Keefe Bride Of Charles Atwill
description: HOUSTON, May 31Miss Carol Anne Keefe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William C. Keefe, was married at the Cenacle Chapel here today to Charles Mark Atwill, a senior at the University of Houston. The ceremony was performed by Msgr. Thomas Cemon of St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church.

title: DODGERS CONQUER CARDS IN 11TH, 86
description: ST. LOUIS, May 31 (UPI) Bill Grabarkewitz's two  run homer off George Culver with none out in the 11th inning to day lifted the Los Angeles Dodgers to an 86 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals and sweep of their three  game series.

title: The Times Settlement
description: Today readers of The New York Times begin paying an extra nickel for this newspaper. The price increase is an outgrowth of the expensive settlement ending the contract dispute that for seven weeks caused union printers at The Times to impose a steadily tightening squeeze on its productive processes. The cost of that squeeze was high in lost advertising and in wages paid for work unperformed. It was even higher in sacrifice of news completeness, but The Times believed that in this period of domestic and world turbulence it had an obligation to keep publishing so long as it could do so without abandoning any claim to quality.

title: Mets Down Astros, 43, in 14th After Swoboda Clouts Pair in 144 Victory
description: The New York Mets swept a sevenhow, 23inning double header yesterday from the Houston Astros, a team they had not beaten in 13 months until this weekend.

title: Man and Woman Are Killed By Fires in Queens Homes
description: Two persons were accidental ly killed in Queens yesterday in separate fires of unknown cause in the Rockaway Beach and Ridgewood areas, the police re ported.

title: Indians Score Ran In the Ninth to Win From Athletics, 32
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 31 (AP)  Ted Uhlaender singled home the winning run in the ninth inning today after Dick Ellsworth, in relief, quelled an eighthinning uprising as the Cleveland Indians edged the Oakland A's. 32.

title: Foundation Officials Are Urged Not to Overreact to Regulations
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 30 Alan Pifer, president of the Carnegie Corporation of New York, warned foundation offi cials this week not to over react to recent regulatory leg islation and impose on them selves a degree of cautiousness and selfcensorship that goes beyond what is necessary.

title: Dianna Medoff, Robert Lachman Marry in Jersey
description: MILBURN, N.J., May 31 Miss Dianna Lynn Medoff and Robert Ian Lachman were married here this afternoon at the Chanticler by Rabbi Rabbi Morris Shoulson. Both will start their senior year at Fairleigh Dickinson Uni versity in the fall.

title: Royal Ballet's New Generation of Stars Proves Itself
description: For about 195,000 ticket holders who attended the Royal Ballet's sixweek en gagement, which closed last night, this has been a season dominated by the company's guest artists, Dame Margot Fonteyn and Rudolf Nureyev.

title: Supreme Safeguard
description: The Chief Justices of the United States, present and retired, are pegged as strict and liberal constructionists on constitutional issues. But on or off the bench, Chief Justice Burger and former Chief Justice Warren are proving that neither can be so narrowly labeled because both take a broad view of the problems that threaten this country and the freedoms that can save it.

title: Buddhist Faction Begins a Hunger Strike in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 31Several hundred Buddhist monks and nuns of the militant An Quang faction began a 48 hour hunger strike today.

title: Article 1  No Title
Beards, Peace Symbols and Daisies at Vassar's Commencement
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., May 31  Peace symbols crowned a sea of mortar boards and a Pomeranian scampered among the audi ence with a red protest band tied to his rear left leg. But Vassar graduated its seniors today (as did Smith and Mount Holyoke) in the well bred, tranquil style that has always been expected of the elite women's colleges.

title: Ch. DeGo Hubert, A West Highland, Gets Best in Show
description: NEWTON SQUARE, Pa.An impeccable West Highland White Terrier, Ch. DeGo Hubert owned by Mrs. Jane Esther Henderson of Stockton, N. J., defeated 1,217 rivals today and won best in show at the 40th annual Delaware County Ken nel Club event. It was the 18th top award for the terrier who was handled by Clifford Hall mark. Henry H. Stoecker of Holmdel, N. J., judged the finals.

title: Dubcek and the End of the Prague Spring
description: Alexander Dubcek returned to Prague last weekend from his ambassadorial post in An kara. Ostensibly, he came to see his seriously ill mother. But his return was convenient for Czechoslovakia's present rulers, who have largely liquidated the democratic gains achieved dur ing the Prague Spring two years ago.

title: LAWRENCE A. LESSING JR.
description: ISLIP, L. I., May 31Law rence A Lessing Jr., president of Lessing's, Inc., New York caterer and luncheonettes oper ator, died today at his home, 2 Beech Road. His age was 59.

title: Cohen Criticizes Leadership
description: CHIICAGO, May 31 (UPI) Wilbur J. Cohen, former Secre tary of Health, Education and Welfare, criticized what he called a lack of leadership in meeting national needs today and said that there is often rhetoric when it is least help ful. Mr. Cohen told the Na tional Conference on Social Welfare that such problems as war, poverty, racial relations, slums, unemployment, inflation and pollution continue to mount in the face of affluence.

title: British Candidates Stump Ghetto to Seek Key Immigrant Vote
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, May 31In the redbrick ghetto outside this Midlands industrial city, the British election cam paign began this chilly week end with local candidates ring ing doorbells, holding rallies and making speeches aimed at winning the decisive immigrant vote.

title: Pocket Flight Guide Is Issued For the Traveler on the Fly
description: An edition of the Official Airline Guide intended for the traveler who has to plan his next move in a phone booth is blossoming out this spring at air terminals, hotels and transportation centers.

title: Militant Teachers in Italy Threatening to Bar Exams
description: ROME, May 31Millions of Italian families are worrying these days whether their chil dren will be able to take end ofterm examinations as the heightened militancy of teach ers unions is disrupting the state school system.

title: Antibusing Group Sweeps Race For Charlotte School Unit Seats
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 31 The only Negro on the Char lotteMecklenburg school board was narrowly defeated in a runoff election yesterday that completed a sweep by antibus ing candidates.

title: LUCKY Y NOT WINS HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 31 Lucky Y Not, owned by the Sterling Ridge Farms and rid den by Mrs. Sue Mutch of Weston, Conn., captured the green working hunter title and finished as reserve champion in the regular working hunter competition today at the Fair fieldWestchester Professional Horsemen's Association horse show.

title: Msgr. James H. Casey, 90; Retired Brooklyn Pastor
description: Msgr. James H. Casey, pastor emeritus of St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church, Park ville Avenue, near Ocean Park way, Brooklyn, died Saturday in Victory Memorial Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 90 years old.

title: Crash of Plane in Atlanta Laid to Use of Jet Fuel
description: ATLANTA, May 31 (AP)  Jet fuel that apparently result ed in excessive engine heat was used in a propellerdriven plane that crashed here shortly after takeoff yesterday, investigators said today.

title: Ribicoff Calls for Investigation Of All Private Health Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, May 31  Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff called today for a Federal in vestigation of the nation's 1,200 private health insurance plans to help the consumer determine what he is buying.

title: PRO TENNIS SERIES OPENS HERE TONIGHT
description: Fred Stolle will play Ken Rosewall and Tony Roche meets Torn Okker at Madison Square Garden tonight in play offs of the $200,000 Tennis Champions Classic. Stolle, Rosewall and Roche are Aus tralians, and Okker is from the Netherlands.

title: ENEMY UNITS QUIT VIETNAM RESORT, AVOIDING A FIGHT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 31About 75 Vietcong and North Vietnamese soldiers, who seized part of the resort city of Dalat yesterday, slipped past hundreds of encircling Govern ment troops today and escaped into the surrounding hills.

title: Explosives Found in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 31 (AP)British Army ex perts today took charge of the biggest haul of explosives ever found in Northern Ireland. The explosives50 pounds of gelig nite and 170 detonatorswere found in a derelict shed on a farm near Cookstown County Tyrone.

title: Mollenhoff Goes as He Came: By Surprise
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 President Nixon's muckraker in residence, Clark R. Mollenhoff, is leaving the White House staff the way he joined itwith a trail of unanswered questions in his wake.

title: DAVID HARDY, 45, LED BRANDEIS FILM ARTS
description: WALTHAM, Mass., May 31 (AP)Prof. David Keith Hardy, director of Brandeis Univer sity's Film Theater Arts, was killed yesterday when his car struck a deer on a road in Blandford. He was 45 years old and lived in West Newton and Meredith, N. H.

title: Krupa, Back on Drums at 61, Leads Quartet at Plaza
description: Gene Krupa, who went quietly into retirement in October of 1967, is back at his drums once again slim, trim and tanned, leading a quartet at Plaza9 in the Plaza Hotel.

title: Man Is Shot in Brooklyn During 2Car Gun Battle
description: One man was wounded and three suspects were being held by the police after a running gun battle yesterday afternoon between the occupants of two cars in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn.

title: Indians Meet to Press Alcatraz Claim
description: ALCATRAZ ISLAND, Calif., May 31  Hundreds of Indians swarmed onto this old prison site today in a bold challenge to the Federal Government's plan to convert it into a na tional park.

title: MRS. WILL YOLEN
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 31 Mrs. Isabelle Berlin Yolen, writer and creator of syndi cated crossword puzzles, died Saturday in Norwalk Hospital. She was 59 years old, and lived in Shorefront Park here and at 45 Tudor City Place in New York.

title: WARD'S 4BAGGER TIES COUNT IN 7TH
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 31Harmon Killebrew ended a tense battle of relief pitchers with his second home run of Ithe game, leading off in the bottom of the 10th, to give the Minnesota Twins a 76 victory over the Yankees today in the finale of a threegame series at Metropolitan Stadium.

title: Planes Strike at Israelis After 2 U. A. R. Ambushes
description: CAIRO, May 31The Egyp tian Air Force struck today at Israeli positions along the northern section of the Suez Canal to follow up two of the most successful Egyptian com mando ambushes in the conflict with Israel.

title: Sweden's Premier Prepares for 9Day U.S. Visit
description: STOCKHOLM, May 30  Premier Olof Palme of Sweden will begin a nineday visit to the United States on Wednes day, and he sees his trip as an opportunity to explain the ideas and interests this small country stands for.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: The New Mr. Europe
description: ROME, May 31  Franco Maria Malfatti, the bookish bachelor newly selected to become Mr. Europe, didn't seek the Brussels job.

title: The Race for Governor
description: There were two outs, the bases were loaded and a home run was needed to tie the score at 99.

title: Earthquake Rocks Half of Peru; Nearly 200 Are Reported Killed
description: LIMA, Peru, May 31  An earthquake rocked Peru this afternoon, bringing down homes and buildings and leaving dead and injured in an area span ning half the country. Some towns were reported to be in rubble.

title: Joel A. Chasis Becomes Bride
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 31Miss Joel Anne Chasis and Frederick Joseph Roll Jr., who will receive M.D. degrees from New York University on June 8, were married here to day by Rabbi Edward Klein. The ceremony took place at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Leslie Winik, uncle and aunt of the bride.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JUNE 1, 1970

title: Aileen and Flame Score In American Y. C. Sailing
description: RYE, N. Y., May 31Corne lius Shields Jr., C. Stanley Ogilvy and Dr. George K. Braz ill Jr. and Joseph F. O'Hora triumphed today in 12mile races on Long Island Sound as the American Yacht Club ran the season's fifth Yacht Racing Association championship re gatta for a fleet of 123.

title: FINAL 68 CLINCHES $30,000 TRIUMPH
description: MEMPHIS, May 31  Dave Hill had to wipe the rain from his glasses at every hole today, but despite the weather he posted the low 72hole total of the 1970 tour as he won the Danny Thomas Memphis Classic golf tournament by one stroke with 267.

title: Ohio National Guard Says Mail Favors Its Actions
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 31 (UPI)Ohio National Guard re ported it had received 9,513 letters, telegrams and post cards expressing reaction to the guard's handling of Ohio cam pus disorders, including the fatal shootings of four Kent State University students.

title: Chemical New York Corp. To Buy Some of Its Stock
description: The Chemical New York Cor poration, the onebank holding company whose principal sub sidiary is the Chemical Bank, announced yesterday that it plans to begin purchasing ap proximately 253,000 shares of its own common stock in the open market for purposes of future acquisitions.

title: CHILD CARE UNITS MAY SEEK STUDY
description: The city's voluntary child care agencies are considering hiring outside experts to an alyze the complex child care network here in hopes of un tangling some of the red tape that the agencies say has made the system almost unmanage able.

title: Italian Deputy Stabbed
description: PALERMO, Sicily, May 31 (Reuters)A neofascist mem ber of the Italian Chamber of Deputies, Angelo Nicosia, was in critical condition today after he was stabbed in the stomach by an unidentified youth on street in Palermo. Mr. Nicosia is 43 years old.

title: Takai, Linda Metheny Win A.A.U. Gymnastics Titles
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 31 (AP) Yoshi Takai, a graduate stu dent at Georgia Southern Uni versity, and Linda Metheny of McKinley, Ill., captured the all round titles in the National Amateur Athletic Union gym nastics championships today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: I did it because I wanted to entertain people, said Jim Bouton the other night, and I did it because I wanted some things told from the inside, like how general man agers cheat players, and becauselet's not kid ourselves I wanted to make some money. But mostly I did it because I wanted to go down in history as the guy who wrote the book you absolutely have to read if you want to understand something about this American subculture called baseball. The book, entitled Ball Four, will be published in several weeks. It was begun while Bouton was pitching in the minor leagues, apparently at the end of an erratic career. Since then, however, behind a tricky knuckleball, Bou ton has returned to the ma jors, a remarkable event not likely to earn him a come back kid award: Two ex cerpts of his book, which was written with Leonard Schecter, have appeared in recent issues of Look maga zine and Bouton has been unofficially censured and pitied as the violator of the sanctity of the clubhouse. Officially, it could all get much worse: Bouton has been summoned to a 5 P.M. meeting with Commissioner Bowie Kuhn today.

title: Franco Reviews a Parade Marking Civil War Victory
description: MADRID, May 31 (AP) Generalissimo Francisco Franco, Spanish Chief of State, presided over a military parade today marking the anniversary of his victory in the civil war of 193639.

title: Lynn Moloshok Is Wed to Interne
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 31Miss Lynn Ann Moloshok and Dr. Steven Marshall Green were mar ried here this afternoon by Rabbi Jacob Shankman in the chapel of Temple Israel on Pinebrook Boulevard.

title: Police at Rock Festival Wait Until Music Stops to Step In
description: DENHAM SPRINGS, La., May 31 (UPI)Undercover agents and mounted policemen with shotguns waited until the music died before dawn today, then slipped into the Festival of Man and Earth to arrest about. 50 longhaired youths.

title: Constance Falk Bride
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 31 The marriage of Miss Constance Ellen Falk to Joel Richard O'Brien took place at the home of the bride's par ents, Mr. and Mrs. David Falk here today. Rabbi Lea Lichtenberg performed the ceremony. The bridgroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jo seph A. O'Brien of New York and Red Hook, N. Y. His fa ther is Joe O'Brien, a WNBC radio personality.

title: Rapid Transit Often Means Taking the Auto
description: As commuters who drive know too well, it takes in genuity, a car radio and little bit of luck to elude the daily traffic jam into Man hattan.

title: WALL STREET SETS TOKYO STOCK PACE
description: TOKYO, May 31The old truism about Europe sneezing when Wall Street catches cold now applies demonstrably to Japan as well.

title: Long Island A.C. Triumphs In Lacrosse Finale, 15 to 3
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., May 31The Long Island Ath letic Club, defending champions of the United States Club La crosse Association, closed out the regular season with a 153 victory over the Connecticut Valley Lacrosse Club today.

title: Laver and Rosewall Gain Final of St. Louis Tennis
description: ST. LOUIS, May 31 (AP) Rod Layer rallied tonight to defeat a fellow Australian Roy Emerson, 46, 75, 63, in the semifinals of the $30,000 Rawl ings tennis tournament at For est Park.

title: Upstarts Are Now Restaurateurs
description: LONDON  Ten years ago two waiters, Franco Lagat tolla and Mario Cassandro, quit their restaurant jobs and placed $2,800 of savings into a tiny Soho club where Ital ian workers sipped espresso and played cards.

title: SST on the OverRunway
description: Every time Congress votes on appropriations for the supersonic transport plane, the arguments in its favor seem more hollow and the opposition more substan tial. Last week's effort by Representative Yates of Illinois to block further appropriations for its develop ment came within 13 votes of succeeding. There is reason to hope now that the Senate will put an end to a project that promises great damage at great expense to provide a minimal convenience for a minimum of travelers.

title: Democratic Bosses: Mechanics of Power
description: A Brooklyn Democratic lead er telephoned his Congressman last month and set in motion the events that brought Pvt. Joseph C. Caruso halfway around the world, from a line company in Vietnam to his ail ing mother in Red Hook.

title: Personal Finance
description: With thousands of Amer icans poised for the annual trip to Europe this year, quite a number mmust be wonder ing if any part of their trip can be regarded as business and hence tax deductible.

title: Venereal Disease Rising; Many U.S. Young Afflicted
description: Gonorrhea, a disease once thought under control, is ram paging through the country, crossing socioeconomic lines, making inroads into suburbia and afflicting an overwhelming proportion of youngsters.

title: Fire at Maxim's
description: PARIS, May 31 (Reuters)  A fire broke out in the cellar of Maxim's restaurant here last night but was put out before it could cause much damage, the police said.

title: CUBS HALT PADRES WITH HOMERS, 74
description: CHICAGO, May 31 (UPI) Johnny Callison and Billy Wil liams backed the fivehit pitch ing of Ferguson Jenkins with home runs today and paced the Chicago Cubs to a 74 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Students Defend U. of Virginia Head
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., May 31On the afternoon of May 6, a Wednesday, Dr. Edgar F. Shannon Jr., president of the University of Virginia, was pelted with mashmallows and that night students threatened to break into his home.

title: Berkeley Student Will Graduate With Bachelor of Arts in Magic
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 31 (UPI)Among June graduates at the University of California is Isaac Bonewits, who will receive a bachelor of arts in magic.

title: Zip Zabel, Pitcher, Dead; Set Record for Relief Stint
description: BELOIT, Wis., May 31 (UPI)  George W. (Zip) Zabel, a former Chicago Cubs pitcher, died today in Beloit Memorial Hospital. He was 79 years old.

title: 9th Blast Since Election Hits Quebec
description: MONTREAL, May 31 (UPI) Five bombs exploded in the wealthy suburb of Westmount today, bringing to nine the number of blasts since French speaking separatists suffered] a setback in the Quebec pro vincial election.

title: Betsy D. Ottenberg Has Garden Bridal
description: Miss Betsy Davies Otten berg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James S. Ottenberg of New York, was married yes terday to Michael Griffin Cherkasky, son of Dr. and Mrs. Martin Cherkasky of the Bronx and East Hampton, L.I.

title: Miss Anne J. Rosenthal Is Bride Of Pedro Mitro, Fellow Student
description: HARRISON, N. Y., May 31 Miss Anne Janine Rosen thal was married here today to Pedro Mitro at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Milton F. Rosenthal. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi David J. Seligson of the Central Synagogue of New York.

title: ZIONIST UNIT GIVES STUDENTS A VOICE
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 31A growing rebellion of students against what they describe as the Jewish establishment has reached into the newly created American Zionist Federation.

title: Bosses Have Patronage
description: Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, whose Thomas Jefferson Democratic Club conducts draft counseling among other services (two or three cases a week), laments not only his lack of patronage but his lack of party control. I have no control over the leaders, he says. Every leader is an entity to him self.

title: Senate Race: Opponents Chide Ottinger on Campaign Spending
description: Paul O'Dwyer and Represent ative Richard Max McCarthy accused Representative Richard L. Ottinger in separate state ments yesterday of having spent more than the law al lowed in the fourway race for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator.

title: Tokyo: Lingering Disdain for Comedy
description: TOKYOFor a man, one cheek in three years. So runs a Japanese proverb, caution ing that a warrior can afford to wrinkle but one of his cheeks in laughter once in three years, Tadasu Iizawa, Japan's foremost living comic playwright, cited the proverb the other day to explain why comedy is still dis dained in this country as vul gar. The very word comedy, he said, came into the Japanese language only in 1891, when Shoyo Tsubouchi published his cele brated translations of Shake speare.

title: OPERATING BUDGET OF CITY IS SEEN UP AN ALARMING 17%
description: The Citizens Budget Commis sion charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay's new operating budget involved an alarming oneyear rise of 17.6 per cent and called for economically harmful new city taxes and charges.

title: ROYALS' TWO IN 8TH DOWN SENATORS, 65
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) Doubles by Luis Alcaraz and Hawk Taylor off Darold Knowles in the eighth inning drove in the tying and winning runs today as the Kansas City Royals broke Washington's fourgame winning streak with a 65 victory.

title: Haack Terms War No. 1 Stock Factor
description: Robert W. Haack, president of the New York Stock Ex change, said yesterday: The Vietnam war is the single most important factor as far as the stock market is concerned.

title: Sawchuk of Rangers Dies Here Following Horseplaying Injury
description: Terry Sawchuk of the New York Rangers, the holder of many National Hockey League records for goaltenders and considered by many to be the sport's finest goalie, died yes terday at the age of 40 after being hospitalized for more than a month.

title: Dance: Ashton Bid Affectionate Farewell at Gala
description: At a special gala at the Metropolitan Opera House last night, New York voci ferously, clamorously and most of all affectionately said farewell, but not good by, to Sir Frederick Ashton.

title: Rev. Charles R. Hulac, Directed Program for Laymen Overseas
description: The Rev. Charles R. Hulac, director of the New York Program for Laymen Overseas, died yesterday of a heart attack at State College, Pa., while on a vacation trip to West Virginia. He was 55 years old and lived at 117 Locust Drive, Maywood, N.J.

title: Surtax Extension Sacked
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)  Representative Henry S. Reuss, Democrat of Wis consin, said today he was Introducing legislation to con tinue the 5 per cent surtax on corporations until the end of the war in Southeast Asia. Mr. Reuss said extension of the surcharge, now scheduled to expire July I, would bring in $2billion a yearenough to offset deficits projected by the Administration.

title: New Brunswick Weighs Future
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 31The trouble with this city is that it's sur rounded by more desirable places.

title: Arkle Destroyed at Age 13; British Steeplechase Star
description: LONDON, May 31  Arkle, one of the foremost steeple chasers in British racing his tory, was destroyed by his owners today in Ireland, where the horse had been retired since 1966.

title: Castro Explains a Failure
description: There can be few, if any, precedents in Communist history for the remarkable speech Fidel Castro deliv ered late last month. This was the televised address in which he explained to the Cuban people in enormous detail why and how his much publicized campaign produce 10 million tons of sugar this year failed attoinment. Most remarkable of all, Castro laid the chief blame on himself and his associates, saying: This battle was not lost by the people. We lost this. We, the administrative apparatus of the revolution, we, the leaders of the revolution, have lost this battle.

title: N.A.A.C.P. ASSAILS NEGRO JOBS PLAN
description: PITTSBURGH, May 31An agreement by the Black Con struction Coalition, craft unions and employer groups, Intended to provide construction jobs for blacks, has been criticized by the Pittsburgh Branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored Peo ple.

title: HARVARD CHANGES SOCIOLOGY'S ROLE
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 31 A sociology department will be reestablished at Harvard University next month after 24 years in which the field was combined with social psychol ogy and social anthropology under the umbrella of social relations.

title: NAUMBURG CONCERTS OPEN ON CHILLY NOTE
description: The 1970 series of four free Naumburg Orchestral Concerts on the Mall in Central Park got off to a chilly start on Saturday night. Boyd Neel was the conductor and Elaine Bon azzi the soloist.

title: Indy 500 Payoff Exceeds $1Million
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 31 (UPI)The Indianapolis Motor Speedway distributed a record purse of more than $1million tonight to the participants in the 54th annual 500mile auto race won by Al Unser.

title: FOLLMER IS VICTOR IN TRANSAM RACE
description: LOUDON, N. H., May 31 George Follmer of Arcadia, Calif., took over for his luck less teammate, Parnelli Jones, and drove his factory Mustang to victory today in the 200mile TransAmerican sedan race at Bryar Motor Sport Park in Lou don, N. H.

title: Educator Profits From Lack of Money
description: DETROIT, May 31Prob ably rarer than the whooping crane is the college president who bad mouths money.

title: Conservationists Wan Two Key Battles in Their War Against the Use of DDT
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Ever since the publication of Rachel Carson's Silent Spring in, 1962, conservation groups, with the help of allies on Cap itol Hill, have tried to get the Federal Government to ban the use of DDT.

title: Stage: A Feydeau Frolic
Angels Triumph Over Orioles, 61; Blair Is Injured
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 31 (UPI)Ken McMullen drove in three runs with a homer and a single and Jim Fregosi also got a homer and a single today to pace the California Angels to a 61 victory over the Bal timore Orioles.

title: Steel Shipments Surge as Haulers End Long Strike
description: PITTSBURGH, May 31Steel shipments were rising sharply last week.

title: Goldberg Plunges Into Pollution Issues
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, a candi date for the Democratic nomi nation for Governor, proposed a fivepoint campaign yesterday to fight water pollution in the state, including a $1.6billion cleanwaters bond issue and controls on atomic power plants stricter than those cur rently enforced by the Federal Government.

title: COLUMBIA IS HELD 1 FRIEND OF HARLEM
description: In his first annual report as president of Columbia Univer sity, Dr. Andrew W. Cordier said yesterday that the Morn ingside HeightsHarlem commu nity in which the university is situated can become a model for the nation in the solution of urban ills.

title: GAME PACE SLOW BEFORE 100,000
description: MEXICO CITY, May 31 With all the pomp and cere mony attendant upon an Olym pic Games extravaganza, the ninth World Cup soccer cham pionship opened today before 100,000 spectators in Aztec Stadium and 400 million tele vision viewers around the world. The point of all the festivities was the opening match between the national teams of Mexico and the Soviet Union.

title: Chess:
description: Arnold Denker, a former United States champion, won first place in the 1969 70 Manhattan Chess Club championship. Denker scored 81 during the 11man roundrobin.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Selecting a Speaker

title: FOOD CRAIN TO USE UNITPRICING PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A chain of supermarkets in the Middle West, hoping to increase profits by helping customers choose the best buys, has set up the nation's first fullscale unitpricing system.

title: BULTERMAN GAINS SAILING TRIUMPH
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 31 Jacques F. Bulterman, with Onrust in the Luders16 Class, and Banjamin H. Bryon Jr., with his Soling sloop, Impulse, won their fourth races in as many starts today as the Riverside Yacht Club staged the season's seventh champion ship regatta for Connecticut area classes of the Yacht Rac ing Association based east of Rye on Long Island Sound.

title: MRS. MAX BIEGELMAN
description: Mrs. Mamie Klein Biegelman,1 a sister of the late Samuel; Klein, founder of the S. Kleinl department stores, died Satur day in Mount Sinai Hospital,) lived at 10740 Queens Boule vard, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: CEYLONESE LEADER PRESENTS CABINET
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 31 Mrs. Sirimavo Bandaranaike, the new Prime Minister of Cey lon, today announced a 21 member Cabinet that includes 17 members of her Sri Lanka Freedom party, three Trotsky ites and one Communist.

title: ASHE AND RICHEY VICTORS IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, May 31 (UPI)Ar thur Ashe and Cliff Richey had to struggle for victories and Mrs. Billie Jean King gained an easy triumph today as the three Americans advanced in the $100,000 French open tennis chamnionshin.

title: MUTINY WINS AGAIN IN RESOLUTE SAILING
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 31  Howard Seymour's Mutiny completed a weekend sweep in the Resolute Class to day as 76 boats sailed in the Cow Bay area Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Investigation Is Continuing On Tank Truck Explosion
description: Police and Fire Department investigations continued yes terday into the explosion of a tank truck carrying liquid oxygen that killed two persons in Brooklyn Saturday and in jured 40.

title: DUBCEK BACK HOME TO SEE SICK MOTHER
description: PRAGUE, May 31 (Reuters) Attacks against Czechoslova kia's reform leaders of 1968 mounted today while their for mer leader, Alexander Dubcek, was home from Turkey visiting his gravely ill mother.

title: NEW MEANS USED TO GAUGE JOBLESS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A new method of measuring un employment, which has at tracted favorable attention within the Government, shows that there was actually no in crease in joblessness in the United States in the first quar ter of this year.

title: Welles to Portray Churchill In a Yugoslav War Movie
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 31 (Reuters)Orson Welles has been tentatively cast to play Sir Winston Churchill in a new Yogoslav war film.

title: Golfer Gary Player Urges South Africa To Integrate Sport
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Afri ca, May 31Gary Player, the leading South African golfer, said today that black and white golfers should be allowed to de velop together in South Africa.

title: SHIRLEY ENGLEHORN WINS GOLF PLAYOFF
description: WINCHESTER, Va., May 31 (UPI)  Shirley Englehorn got a par on the first playoff hole today to beat Margie Masters by a stroke in the $15,000 O'Sullivan women's open golf tournament. The two finished the 18 holes deadlocked at 210, six under par, to force the playoff.

title: Powerboat Race Postponed By Wind After Three Heats
description: TAMPA, Fla., May 31 (AP) Miss Budweiser, the unlimited hydroplane national champion, was leading the field of nine in the Sun Coast unlimited regat ta today before choppy water and heavy winds forced the postponement of the last two heats. They have been resched uled for tomorrow.

title: Books of The Times
description: Since everybody is being so relentless ly candidI mean the authors of these books and the various people in them I may as well confess at once that I approached them absolutely gimleteyed with suspicion. The sheer California ultratrendiness of the encountergroup, Tgroup, sensitivitytraining (or what have you) movement is enough to sour the most brighteyed believer in new designs for living.

title: Area Students Capture 4 Of 9 N.M.U. Scholarhips
description: High school students from New York and New Jersey have done well in the National Mari time Union's annual college scholarship contest.

title: TobHunting Dominicans Devise Methods to Enter the U.S. Illegally
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, May 26Unem ployment in this country, run ning in excess of 25 per cent, is combining with extremely low wages to send many Do minicans in search of illegal entry into the United States.

title: M'CORMACK'S SPUR TO GLORY: I.C.4A
description: Part of the natural beauty of track and field is its spontaneity and penchant for the unexpected: At any in stant, in one of numerous events, an athlete may find himself motivated beyond his wildest dreams.

title: Danes Arrest 6 Protesters
description: COPENHAGEN, May 31 (UPI) The Danish police scuffled for several hours today with about 400 youths in front of the United States Embassy. A police spokesman said six per sons were arrested and at least one was taken to a hos pital with head injuries. He said that the demonstration had been organized by the Danish Black Panther Solidar ity Committee.

title: Nixon Encouraged by Briefing on War
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., May 31President Nixon received briefing from his leading ad visers and commanders today on the operations in Cambodia and the war in Vietnam and was reportedly encouraged by what he heard.

title: POLICEMAN RELEASED IN SHOOTING ANOTHER
description: An offduty policeman who was accused of shooting an off duty housing patrolman in the Bronx after an argument over a yard party was released without charge shortly after the incident Saturday pending a grand jury investigation.

title: Burns Cites Bar to Pooling Vote If Ambro Wins the Nomination
description: John J. Burns, the Demo cratic state chairman, urged party leaders across the state yesterday to redouble their ef forts on behalf of the primary election candidacy of State Senator Basil A. Paterson for Lieutenant Governor.

title: California Pedestrian Safety
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) California was cited by the American Automobile Associa tion today for outstanding achievement in 1969 in reduc tion of fatalities among pe destrians.

title: Hoover Says Police Boards Strive to Harass Officers
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)J. Edgar Hoover charged today that the real objective of civilian groups who want community control over police departments was to intimidate and harass police.

title: GORDON P. KENNEDY
description: Gordon P. Kennedy, vice president of two New York tex tile importing companies, Roger LaViale, Ltd., and Woollens From Britain, Ltd., died yester day of a heart attack at Hack ensack Hospital. He was strick en in his home at 125 Hamilton Road, Ridgewood, N. J. His age was 54.

title: Newark's Mayoral Race Is Creeping Into the Stretch
description: NEWARK, May 31The run off election campaign for Mayor that began here May 12 with the defeat of four of the six contenders is halfway over, and Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio, one of the two surviving can didates, has not yet begun to seek votes actively.

title: MRS. EINAR O. PETERSEN
description: Mrs. Violette Blashfield Pe tersen, wife of Einar O. Peter sen, former advertising direc tor of The New York Sun, died Saturday in the Berkshire Nurs ing Home in West. Babylon, ?? ??. She was 82 years old.

title: SHIP CENTER HERE MAKING HEADWAY
description: Threeyearold plans for new consolidated passenger steamship terminal on the Up per West Side appear to have been whipped into acceptable, though drastically reduced, sham.

title: U.S. Backs Botswana on Zambian Border Issue
description: GABORONE, Botswana, May 28Sixty miles upstream from the Great Victoria Falls, the Zambezi River surges with a powerful current between treelined banks 300 yards wide and provides this young southern African nation with her only link to her sister states of black Africa.

title: Status of Bills in Congress
description: ABBREVIATIONS

title: Steamboat Tootenanny Set in Ohio River Town
description: SISTERSVILLE, W. Va., May 31 (UPI)The nostalgic sound of steamboat whistles will be heard again in this Ohio River community Satur day when riverboat buffs stage the only known toot enanny.

title: UTILITIES OUTLINE ENVIRONMENT AIM
description: BOSTON, May 31The na tion's electric power industry firmly believes it can supply everincreasing quantities of energy and still preserve the environment, A. H. Ayrnond, president of the Edison Electric Institute, said at a news con ference in the Sheraton Boston Hotel here today.

title: Canadians Feel Cutback By EDWARD COWAN
description: TORONTO, May 31In palm ier days, Doherty, Roadhouse & McQuaig Brothers, a brokerage firm with 30 offices across Canada, gave generous bonuses to its staff. Sometimes, said chairman D'Arcy Doherty, they came to six months' salary.

title: Cube Opens And Reveals Table Inside
description: IT'S what's inside that counts in many of the new modern furniture designs that have been introduced in recent weeks. That a cube cannot be always taken at face value is emphasized by the new 31inch box that the Charlton Company, Inc., in troduced at the wholesale furniture market in High Point, N. C., earlier this month. Closed, this cube is little more than a decorative design with its surfaces covered in a lami nated plastic that has a serrographed wavy pattern. But when opened, the cube's contents  a pullout table, four Xbased canvasand wood stools and storage bins and shelves  are revealed. The Alberti Presto design, as this Milanese import is called, measures 64 inches when opened. It is about $700.

title: PAGELS AND LAVIANO SCORE YACHT SWEEPS
Boeing 747: The First 120 Days of the Jumbo's Reign
description: After four months on the air ways, the Boeing 747 jumbo jet is drawing qualified raves from the airlines, mixed reviews from its passengers, and out right affection from its pilots.

title: Rising Prices and Crime Create Burglary Insurance Chaos
description: Inflation and the rising rate of reported crime have forced insurers to cancel many burg lary policies and have made the companies more cautious in is suing contracts. The Federal in surance administrator, George K. Bernstein, says the problem is rampant not only in New York City and its suburbs, but in every big city in the coun try.

title: Carty's 3 Homers Help Braves' Nash Trounce Phils, 91,
description: ATLANTA, May 31 (AP) 1 Rico Carty drove in six runs) with three homers and a single today as the Atlanta Braves routed the Philadelphia Phillies, 91. Jim Nash, a righthander, gained his sixth straight vic tory.

title: New Army Code Allows G.I.'s to Have Mustaches
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)The Army has let its hair down. It now says that reasonable sideburns and mustaches are admissible and excessively short hair is not.

title: Bethpage Wins Polo Opener, Overtaking Brookville, 97
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., May 31 Bethpage rallied for three goals in the final chukker today and defeated Brookville, 97, in the opening polo match of the sea son at Bethpage State Park.

title: Young Workers Are Raising Voices to Demand Factory and Union Changes
description: WIXOM, Mich., May 29The older workers at the Ford auto plant here like to tell about the young kid, fresh from high school getting his first taste of work on the assembly line.

title: M'NEIL OF 49ERS TRADED TO GIANTS
description: The New York Giants com pleted thier second trade in less than 24 hours yesterday by ac quiring Clifton McNeil, a wide receiver and allleague selec tion, with the San Francisco 49ers in 1968, for two high draft choices.

title: ARMY QUESTIONED ON GERM DISPOSAL
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 Federal health officials have quietly scotched an Army plan to dump the residue of germ warfare chemical into the Arkansas River, a tributary of the Mississippi.

title: REAGAN STUMPS ON MONEY ISSUES
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 Gov. Ronald Reagan, unopposed in his bid for a secondterm Republican nomination, has campaigned vigorously on two money issues to be decided Tuesday in California's primary election.

title: Ecumenic Praise Given Graham's Film on Israel
description: A Methodist minister de scribed it as graphic, a Roman Catholic nun called it excellent, a Presbyterian pastor hailed it as superb, and a rabbi said nothing like it had ever been done before.

title: Denis Ransmeier, Amherst '70, Marries Victoria Wright Pierce
description: Miss Victoria Wright Pierce, daughter of former General Sessions Court Judge Samuel R. Pierce and Mrs. Pierce, was married here yes terday afternoon to Denis Sirera Ransmeier, a member of this year's graduating class at Amherst College.

title: Rothschild Group May Renew Its Offer to Take Over I.O.S.
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, May 31  The withdrawal of John M. King, Denver oil man, from Investors Overseas Serv ices has opened the way for a European banking consortium to take over the large mutual fund organization.

title: ROMANO'S THISTLE TAKES SAIL SERIES
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., May 31 Bill Romano's Brand X won two races and finished second in a third to capture Thistle Class honors as 73 boats sailed with the Huntington Y.C. in the annual holiday regatta for TriClub Y.R.A. yachts this weekend.

title: A VILLAGE CHIEF SLAIN IN AMBUSH
description: PEAM CHIKANG, Cambodia, May 31 (UPI)Chi Boun Thong died today at the age of 25.

title: First 10 Fleet Positions Taken By Big Boats in 200Mile Sail
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 31 The Class A yachts headed by Huey Long's 73foot ketch, Ondine, held the first 10 fleet positions when the 25th Block Island race of the Storm Try sail Club ended today, making this 200mile spring fixture a bigboat event for a change.

title: Maddox and Papers Threaten to Sue
The Park: Going, Going . .
description: Nobody can say that New York hasn't been fore warned. This spring take a good look at Central Park south of 86th Street, says the Parks Council, a valuable civic organization, because at no other time in the 1970's will you be able to see it intact.

title: At the Beach or On the Square, It Was Definitely a Day for Sitters
Kahn Turns Back Merunka In L. I. Tennis, 75, 62
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 31 Bob Kahn of New York up set fourthseeded Otokar Mer unka, a former Czechoslovak Davis Cup player, 75, 62, in the opening round of the Long Island tennis championship at the Great Neck Country Club today.

title: British Climber Dies on Annapurna
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 31 (Reuters)A British climb er was killed on Annapurna I in the Himalayas yesterday after helping two companions make the first ascent of the mountain's south face.

title: Today Is Inflation Day For Illegal Parkers
description: Beginning today the po lice will charge $50 instead of $25 for towing away cars parked illegally in midtown Manhattan. The additional $25 fine for illegal parking remains unchanged.

title: Colon and Fikes Set State Track Marks; Loughlin Wins Title
description: Two state records, four ad ditional meet marks and a team title that wasn't decided until the final event made the Cath olic High School Athletic As sociation outdoor track and field championships yesterday one of the most exciting in its 42year history.

title: BREWERS' RALLY TOPS TIGERS, 76
description: MILWAUKEE, May 31 (UPI) A double by Ted Savage with one out in the ninth inning drove in two runs today and gave the Milwaukee Brewers a 76 victory over the Detroit Tigers. The Brewers scored five runt in the final two inn ings.

title: $1MILLION CACHE OF HEROIN SEIZED
description: About 60 shots were ex changed early yesterday be tween policemen and the oc cupants of a Harlem apartment where the police said they found close to $1million worth of heroin and an arsenal of weapons.

title: ROGERS ENDS TALKS WITH PORTUGUESE
description: LISBON, May 31 (UPI)Sec retary of State William P. Rogers departed today for Washington after what he de scriber as useful and satisfac tory talks with top Portuguese officials.

title: Europeans Angry at U.S. On Drop in Their Markets
description: COPENHAGEN, May 31One European securities man to the other: Why can't some authority decide how long the work ing day should be?

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 1, 1970 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Mother and 4DayOld Son Die in Plunge at Hospital
description: A mother and her 4dayold son were killed yesterday when she apparently jumped with the baby in her arms from the fifth floor of the Beth Israel Medical Center, the police reported.

title: Pirate 5Run Third Chases Marichal, Beats Giants, 73
description: PITTSBURGH, May 31 (UPI) Gene Alley's homer and Al Oliver's tworun double marked a fiverun thirdinning outburst that knocked out Juan Marichal today and paced the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 73 victory over the San Francisco Giants.

title: TV: Paterson Station Shows World Cup Soccer
description: Ultrahighfrequency tele vision station WXTV, operat ing on Channel 41 in Pater son, N. J., had the initiative yesterday afternoon to pick up live coverage of the game, between Mexico and the So viet Union, that opened the World Cup soccer champion ship series at Aztec Stadium in Mexico City. Both Spanish and English were used to re port the 90minute stage wait, ending in a scoreless tie.

title: DR. HENRY MARKS, 79, CAMP NYDA FOUNDER
description: Dr. Henry E. Marks, specialist in internal medicine and in diabetes, died yesterday at his home, 145 East 84th Street. His age was 79 and his office was at 121 East 60th Street.

title: Undaunted Senator
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  She's not a feminist, an associate of Margaret Chase Smith observed the other day. She thinks the best way to establish that women are just as good as men is go about your work and not look for any privileges. After her speech in the Senate this morning, special privileges are not likely to be ac corded the senior Senator from Maine, either by troubled and rebellious stu dents or Vice President Ag new, both of whom, directly or implicity, she took to task. her speech in the Senate this morning, special privileges are not likely to be ac corded the senior Senator from Maine, either by troubled and rebellious stu dents or Vice President Ag new, both of whom, directly or implicity, she took to task.

title: Police Informer Asserts He Was Aiding Panthers
description: A former Black Panther whose information was used by the Brooklyn police to obtain court permission to tap Pan thers' telephones testified yes terday that he actually was infiltrating the police while he was an informer and that the information he gave the police was false.

title: AllStar Game at Cincinnati
description: The 1970 major league All Star baseball game will be played in Cincinnati's new Riverfront Stadium as sched uled, Tuesday, July 14, Com missioner Bowie Kuhn an nounced yesterday. The Reds will start playing regular sea son games there June 30.

title: CANADA CURRENCY UP IN U.S. TRADING
description: The Canadian dollar, left floating in international cur rency markets to find its own exchange level, strengthened yesterday in brisk trading both here and abroad.

title: U.S. Bill Rates Decline Sharply At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  Treasury bill rates declined sharply at today's auction from last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: New Medical Exam Set For Teacher Applicant
description: Judy Heumann, a 22yearold polio victim who has been denied a teacher's license be cause her legs are paralyzed and she has to use a wheel chair, will receive another medical examination from the Board of Eductaion this week.

title: BREWERY WORKERS AUTHORIZE A STRIKE
description: More than 5,000 employes of four breweries here authorized their union leaders yesterday to call a strike if negotiations to reach a new labor contract fail.

title: ROBERT JOHNSON, HEADED RACEWAY
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 1 Robert G. Johnson, president emeritus of Roosevelt Raceway, a harness track in Westbury, L. I., died here yesterday of a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 70 years old.

title: Olivia W. Scott Is Wed in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 1 Miss Olivia Winchester Scott and Ronald Elliot Lunder were married here this after noon. The ceremony was per formed at the Darien Com munity Association by the Rev. Laird O. Miller of the Noroton Presbyterian Church.

title: 13 Killed in Libyan Crash
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, June 1 (AP) A Czechoslovak Airlines jet plane crashed today in heavy fog at Tripoli's airport. C.T.K., reported that all 13 persons aboard had been killed.

title: Stage: A Bite Into an Apple Long Ago
description: From the middle of life, a stop between open and closed, Joseph Chaikin's Open Theater reflects on our beginnings. The Serpent is the group's eloquent re examination of Genesis:

title: TRUST ACCORD SET FOR INLAND STEEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Justice Department announced today a consent settlement with the Inland Steel Company barring reciprocal buying and selling in violation of the anti trust laws. The proposed settle ment was filed simultaneously with a civil antitrust suit in Federal District Court in Chicago.

title: Lawyer Becomes the 4th Candidate to Oppose Dodd
description: HARTFORD, June 1Donald J. Irwin, a Norwalk lawyer who served three terms in the House of Representatives, to day became the fifth candidate for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator from Connecticut.

title: Samuels Wants Five TV Confrontations
description: Howard J. Samuels charged yesterday that campaign man agers for Arthur J. Goldberg had decided that the best way to win the June 23 Democratic primary for Governor is to hide their candidate.

title: France, Challenger for Cup, To Be Shipped Here June 10
description: LA TRINITE  SUR  MER, France, June 1 (Reuters)The French challenger for the Amer ica's Cup, France, was being prepared today for its trip to New York.

title: Gowen Upsets Jauffret and Kodes Beats Mulligan in French Tennis
description: PARIS, June 1 (UPI)  George Goven pulled his sec ond upset by ousting a fellow Frenchman, Francois Jauffret, and Jan Kodes of Czechoslo vakia beat Marty Mulligan of Italy to reach the semifinals in the $100,000 French open tennis tournament today.

title: Turbine Venture Set by Rockwell and Britons
description: BOSTON, June 1The North American Rockwell Corpora tion and Reyrolle Parsons, Ltd., of Britain announced here to day the formation of a jointly owned company, the Rockwell Parsons Corporation, to manu facture, sell and service tur bines and generators in this country.

title: Shops Bring Exotic Foods to Suburbia
description: Residents of Westchester and southern Connecticut no longer have to travel to New York City to buy fresh won ton skins, Greek phyllo pastry, suckling pigs on Indo nesian krupuk. In the past two years several new stores nave opened from the Hudson River to Long Island Sound and as far north as Chap paqua, N. Y., to serve me neeas or sophisti cated suburban cooks. The most extensive collection  about 10,000 items ranging from suckling pigs to im ported sheet gelatinis to be found at Jugtown Moun tain Smokehouse in the Lord & Taylor Center, East Post Road, Eastchester, N. Y.

title: 8 More Newsmen Vanish in Cambodia; Total Missing at 24
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 1Eight more newsmen were reported missing in Cambodia today and were believed cap tured by North Vietnamese and Vietcong troops.

title: U.S. Asks Saigon's Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  State Department officials said today that South Vietnamese military authorities had been asked to assist in the search for the missing newsmen.

title: GORMAN, BARTH GALA IN ENGLISH TENNIS
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 1 (AP)Tom Gorman of Seat tle and Roy Barth of San Diego got the Americans off to a good start with victories in the North of England tennis champion ships today.

title: Spain Bars Rhodesia From Golf Tourney
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 1 (Reuters)Spain has barred Rhodesia from the Eisenhower Trophy golf tournament in Madrid in September, the Rhodesian Golf Union said today.

title: U.S. Hints Saigon Won't Get Air Aid In Cambodia Drive
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 1The White House hinted to day that the United States might not provide tactical air support to South Vietnamese forces in Cambodia after June 30, the deadline for the with drawal of American troops from Cambodia.

title: Chemical New York Board Adds Executive as Director
description: Donald C. Platten, executive vice president in charge of the international division of the Chemical Bank, was elected yes terday to the board of the Chemical New York Corpora tion, parent company of the $10billion bank.

title: MRS. GANDHI PLANS CURB ON PROPERTY
description: NEW DELHI, June 1In an other step to the left, Mrs. Indira Gandhi, the Indian Prime Minister, and her Cabinet de cided today to introduce meas ures to prevent any individual from owning personal property worth more than $67,200 in urban areas.

title: W. Illinois Names Peterson
description: MACOMB, Ill., June 1 (AP) Gil Peterson, head football coach and athletic director at Huron (S. D.) College, was named today athletic director at Western Illinois University, effective Aug. 1. Peterson, 40 years old, is a former Univer sity of Omaha football player.

title: Laotian Town Recaptured
description: VIENTIANE Laos, June 1 (AP)Military sources reported today the recapture of a town in northwestern Laos by Gov ernment forces and the finding of a large enemy supply depot in the south.

title: FILM TV DAILY HERE SUSPENDS OPERATION
description: Publication of Film TV Daily, now in its 52d year of con tinuous operation, was sus pended temporarily with yes terday's issue. According to Nathan Zucker, president of the locally based DFI Communications, Inc., which acquired the property last year from Charles Alicoate; the plan is to start publication again in the near future.

title: Search for Boys Dropped
description: ORANGE, Vt., June 1 (UPI) Officials have abandoned the search for Roger Dubois, 7 years old, and his brother Russel, 3, lost in rugged woods for 16 days.

title: Barn Fire Kills 10 Horses
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., June 1 A fire of an unknown cause destroyed the main barn on the estate of the late Charles A. Buckley here on Route 304. Ten horses, including nine highly trained saddle horses of the Rockland County Sheriff's mounted patrol, died in the fire. The late Bronx Democratic Congressman and political leader used the farm to enter tain friends.

title: Brooklyn Grocer Shot Deac During Robbery of His Store
description: A 60yearold grocer was shot and killed yesterday by one of two young robbers in his store in the BedfordStuy vesant section of Brooklyn while his wife and two women customers, held at gunpoint by the other man, screamed for help.

title: Observer: Hosts to the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Fantasy: C.B.S. in the per sons of Mike Wallace and Harry Reasoner is ringing your doorbell. Believe it or not, your house has been chosen as the subject for one of those shows in which tele vision cameras are conducted through the abodes of famous men. Your daughter or spouse seems to have known all along that Wallace and Reas oner were coming. Daughters and spouses (why not spice?) never seem flustered when Reasoner and Wallace come barging in with their cameras.

title: BUCKLEY MAY GET REPUBLICAN VOTES
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  A member of the House of Rep resentatives, Martin B. Mc Kneally of Newburgh, said to day that he was considering endorsing James L. Buckley, the Conservative party's can didate for the Upited States Senate, over Charles E. Good ell the Renublican incumbent.

title: SOVIET PUTS 2 MEN IN ORBIT AT NIGHT
description: MOSCOW, Tuesday, June 2 The Soviet Union launched a twoman spacecraft into earth orbit last night with one of the pioneers of the space age in command of the Soyuz9 vehicle.

title: Cities Damaged From Coast to Amazon
description: From Peru's ocean port of Chimbote, through the Callejon de Huaylas winding between two Andean ranges, to the jun glegirded city of Iquitos and in countless other communities, Sunday's earthquake traced a path of ruin and death.

title: S.E.C. Acts to Curb A Broker in Boston And One in Spokane
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission today suspended certain operations of the Boston office of Hornblower & Weeks, Hemphill Noyes after a finding that the office had violated margin requirements during the first nine months of 1969.

title: Washintgon: For the Record
description: June 1

title: COURT POSTPONES DEATH ROW RULING
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 The Supreme Court postponed today an important decision on capital punishment until the Court term that begins in October, leaving intact a ju dicial freeze that has stopped all executions in the United States for the last three years.

title: Teacher Held on Drug Charge
description: A 24yearold public school teacher was arrested yesterday, accused of selling narcotics to a 19yearold youth outside Public School 80, at East Mo sholu Parkway and Van Cort landt Park in the Bronx. The teacher, David Reiter of 115 East Mosholu Parkway, who is unmarried, teaches at P.S. 51, at 810 Trinity Avenue.

title: Protests by Scientists in Soviet On Biologist's Arrest Reported
description: MOSCOW, June 1Reliable sources said today that the re cent arrest of Zhores A. Med vedev, a biologist, had brought protests by four of the Soviet Union's most prominent scien tists, including nuclear physi cists.

title: In The Nation: What Price Party Loyalty?
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 31The sizable liberal faction of the Texas Democratic party is con fronted again with its long standing dilemmawhat to do In November, this time in the Senatorial race between Re publican George Bush and con servative Democrat Lloyd Bent sen.

title: Leigh Catlin To Be a Bride
description: Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Catlin of New York and Greenwich, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Leigh Catlin, to Wayne Grant Quasha, a member of this year's gradu ating class at Harvard. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam H. Quasha of Manila and Glen Cove. L. I.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD GETS LEASE ISSUE
description: A controversy between Con troller Abraham D. Beame and the city's Economic and De velopment Administration over plans for the city to lease a commercial building instead of buying it is to be resolved to day by the Board of Estimate.

title: McCarthy Goes SkyHigh in Campaign
description: Representative Richard Max McCarthy, who had already plumbed the murky depths of the Hudson in his search for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate, yesterday soared into the sky above Central Park in a balloon.

title: TA WEE TRIUMPHS IN BELMONT SPRINT
description: Ta Wee of the Tartan Stable reaffirmed her status as the best sprinting filly or mare in the country by winning the Hempstead Handicap at Bel mont Park yesterday. The 4 yearold Floridabred scamp ered to a 3length triumph over the Elberon Farm's Pro cess Shot in the first running of the six?? event, which attracted a field of eight and had a gross value of $28,150.

title: Tennis Final Postponed
description: ST. LOUIS, June 1 (UPI) Rain forced a postponement to day of the final in the 30,000 Rawlings professional tennis tournament. Rod Laver will play Ken Rosewall on Wednes day night for the top prize of $8,000.

title: 5 SEIZED IN QUEENS IN A NUMBERS RAID
description: Four women and a man were arrested last night in a police raid on what they said was numbers bank grossing $20,000 a day in the Hollis section of Queens.

title: MRS. CARL EGGERS
description: Mrs. Caroline Henes Eggers, widow of Dr. Carl Eggers, a surgeon at Lenox Hill Hospital; died Friday after a long illness at her home, 850 Park Avenue. She was 87 years old.

title: HOUSE COMMITTEE CUTS 8555MILLION FROM FOREIGN AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The House Appropriations Commit tee, citing domestic budgetary problems, voted today for a $555million cut in the Adminis tration's foreign aid program.

title: BORINGS GIVE CLUE TO ATLANTIC PAST
description: Scientists reported yesterday recovering limestone sediments from the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean that indicated that body of water was once very shallow and was probably formed about the time dinosaurs roamed the earth.

title: U.S. Judge Quashes Houston's FreedomofChoice School Integration Plan
description: HOUSTON, June 1A free domofchoice integration plan in Houston, the nation's sixth largest school system, was eliminated today by Federal District Judge Ben C. Connally

title: Suit by Growers to Block Antismoking Ads Dismissed
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., June 1 (AP)A suit filed by Kentucky tobacco growers against the three major television networks over use of antismoking com mercials was dismissed today in Federal District Court.

title: Judge Bars Flying Flag at HalfStaff As a Political Act
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 1A State Supreme Court justice Chas ruled that the American flag may not be flown at half staff to express an idea which in its origins and in its totally involves an expression of a political concept.

title: These Evenings, There Is No Trend to Spot
description: The phrase doing your own thing might have been invented for evening fashions this sea son. It's a period even less restrictive than usual, despite the fact that evening clothes have usually been more fluid than designs for day. This spring, there is no particular vogue such as last season's gypsies, rich hippies and nineteenthirties looks, and there is certainly no one right way to look. A number of ways are equally right, and the final arbiter is individual taste and imagination. Now that more and more women are wearing, at least for evening, the clothes they like and feel best in, it is no surprise to see a melange of afterdark fashion that goes from dcollet to coveredup, floor length to varying degrees of midi, tradition al to sophisticated, and elegant to amusing. For the many devotees of pants, there is almost as wide a range of choice, with straightleg, bell bottom and harem versions and an increasing num ber of zippered jumpsuits, which are worn with masses of jewels.

title: L.I. Offers Class On Race Horses
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., June 1To such relatively mundane school courses as automotive mechanics, data processing and training as medical and dental assistants has been added a glamorous starter: the care and training of the thoroughbred race horse.

title: Jersey High Court Backs Police Files on Activists
description: TRENTON, June 1The New Jersey Supreme Court today upheld the compiling by the police of secret intelligence dos siers on civil rights activists and other protesters that had been ordered destroyed last year by a lower court in Hud son County.

title: On MedEvac Copter, Faces and Pain
description: TAYNINH, South Vietnam, May 29  Twentyyearold Conrad Graff, a warrant offi cer who is the pilot of a medical  evacuation helicop ter that carries the wounded in South Vietnam and Cam bodia, keeps looking at his passengers.

title: BOURGUIBA RETURNS; IN PARIS 6 MONTHS
description: TUNIS, June 1  Tunisia gave a tumultuous welcome to day to President Habib Bout guiba on his return after six months absence in France for health reasons.

title: Printers' Committee Approves Contract With New York Post
description: The scale committee of Typo graphical Union No. 6 yester day approved a tentative con tract with The New York Post that will provide for the same basic wage increases as previ ous settlements with The New York Times and The Daily News.

title: Greyhound Wins Ruling That Big Purchase Is Not a Trust Violation
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) The Supreme Court declined 5 to 1 today to interfere with the Greyhound Corporation's planned takeover of Armour & Co., the nation's second largest meatpacker.

title: Tiant Put on Disabled List
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 1 (UPI)The Minnesota Twins placed Luis Tiant on the dis abled list today for a minimum of 21 clays because of a frac tured shoulder blade. The un beaten righthander, who has won six games, was injured Thursday night pitching against the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: PolicemanDiesinPlaneCrash
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 1 (UPI)Andrew Davis, 37 years old, an offduty New York motorcycle patrolman, died early today when his rented Cessna 150 amphibian plane crashed in shallow water in Lonf Island Sound near here. A passenger in the plane was rescued. Mr. Davis, who lived at 84 Manhattan Avenue, Yon kers, was on the police force for 16 years.
