description: LONDON, June 2Clare Con suelo Sheridan, sculptor, nove list and journalist and a cousin of Sir Winston Churchill, died on Sunday in Sussex. She was 84 years old.

title: Abbatiello Is Trying to Prove He's Best Trot Driver in World
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 2 Carmine Abbatiello is the world's best harness racing driveraccording to Car mine Abbatiello.

title: 4 Albanians End Athens Trade Visit, First in 30 Years
description: ATHENS, June 2  A four member trade mission from Al bania, the first to visit neigh boring Greece in 30 years, to day ended a twoweek explora tory visit here that resulted in commercial orders worth about $300,000 on both sides.

title: CREW OF SOYUZ 9 SWITCHES ORBIT
description: MOSCOW, June 2 (AP)The Soviet Union's manned Soyuz switched orbit today and suf fered fouled portholes, appar ently as a result of the ma neuver.

title: McLaren Killed in Crash Testing His Own Car at 180 Miles an Hour
description: GOODWOOD, England, June 2 (AP)Bruce McLaren, one of the world's top racing driv ers, was killed here today when he crashed at 180 miles an hour while testing an ex perimental car of his design.

title: Washington: The Student Invasion
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The capital is full of university students these days, lobbying the Congress for peace in Southeast Asia. Potentially, they are a powerful new politi cal force in the nationthere are 7 million college students and half the population of the country is under age 25but they are inexperienced and disorganized and sorely in need of leadership.

title: Particle of a Human Cell Produced in Laboratory
description: The first manmade part of a human cell, the lysosome, has been produced by two New York University scientists.

title: FRANULOVIC TOPS ASHE IN FIVE SETS
description: PARIS, June 2  Arthur Ashe's hopes for the grand slam disintegrated today, ground into the red clay of Roland Garros Stadium by Zeljko Franulovic.

title: Columbia Men of '68 T ell About Change
description: Many Columbia graduates of the class of '68, recalling the tumultuous spring of their last term on Morningside Heights, say they have moved to the left politically, but also have de veloped an antipathy for vio lence.

title: Gibson and 22 Clerics Protest Hate Campaign Literature
description: NEWARK, June 2Kenneth A. Gibson, today accused his opponent in the mayoral race. Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio, of distributing fear and hate liter ature in an effort to make race an issue in the June 16 runoff election.

title: Complete Synthesis of Gene Reported
description: A team at the University of Wisconsin reported yesterday the first complete synthesis of a gene  the inherited, coded message that tells a cell how to perform a certain chemical function.

title: Article 2  No Title
747 Begins Flights to Rome
description: ROME (AP)Regular Boeing 747 airline service between New York City and Rome be gan today. A PanAmerican Airways jumbo jet arrived here today from New York and left 5 hours later for the return flight.

title: McCarthy Says Buckley Could Not Defeat Him
description: Representative Richard Max McCarthy said yesterday that he was the only one of the four Democrats running for the United States Senate who could preclude a November vic tory by James L. Buckley, the Conservative party's candidate.

title: AREA DEVASTATED BY QUAKE IN PERU APPEALS FOR HELP
description: LIMA, Peru, June 2Govern ment and private radio stations were dominated today by ur gent calls for doctors, medical supplies and food for northern Peru, which was devastated by an earthquake Sunday, but roads blocked by landslides kept the most seriously affected communities isolated.

title: DISTRICT 50 HEAD WINS UNION VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Top officials of an ousted division of the United Mine Workers of America have won a union election struggle against can didates reportedly backed by the parent U.M.W. and its pres ident, W. A. Boyle, election re turns showed today.

title: HARDIN REPORTS GAINS FOR FARMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) Agriculture Secretary Clifford M. Hardin told President Nixon today that the nation's farm economy was on the upswing and that major steps had been taken to meet Administration agricultural goals.

title: Aramburu's Fate Unclear; A Note Says He Was Shot
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 2 (Reuters)The fate of the kid napped former President, Pedrol Eugenio Aramburu, remained unclear today in the wake of threats gainst his life and a highlevel attempt to save him.

title: Cambodian Staff in U.S. Waiting and Wondering
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  The building at 4500 16th Street N. W. is still known of ficially as the Royal Embassy of Cambodia.

title: HYNDMAN, MOREY ADVANCE IN GOLF
description: NEWCASTLE, Northern Ire land, June 2 (UPI1)Bill Hynd man and Dale Morey, America's top hopes in the British Ama teur golf championship, gained impressive firstround victories today.

title: RALPH J. MITCHELL, MARINE AIR CHIEF
description: CORONADO, Calif., June 1 (AP) Lieut. Gen. Ralph J. Mitchell, U.S.M.C., retired, an aviation commander, died here Sunday at the age of 78.

title: CORPORATE BONDS ARE SOLD QUICKLY
description: The three corporate bond is sues priced late Monday sold quickly yesterday when they were offered to investors, but the recent recovery in prices for issues already outstanding has lost some steam.

title: M.E. GREEN REPORTS FINANCIAL INABILITY
description: M. E. Green Co., Inc., com modities brokers, has reported to the, commodity exchanges with which it deals that it is unable to meet its financial ob ligations.

title: Japanese Utilities Will Buy $1.6Billion of Natural Gas
description: Coldgas Trading, Ltd., jointly owned by the Royal Dutch Shell group and Royal Shoji Kaisha, Ltd., announced yesterday the signing of final documents for the shipment of $1.6billion of natural gas over 20 years to three Japanese util ities. The deal is among the largest natural gas contracts ever slimed.

title: U.S. Says Newark Area Slights Minority Workers
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The Labor Department's Of fice of Federal Contract Com pliance said today there was an acute lack of job opportunities for Negroes and other minority group workers on construction projects in the Newark area.

title: Masefield Admirers Meet In Tribute to His Poetry
description: The days of the literary salon are not over. That was clear at 6 P.M. on Monday when four large rooms of the National Arts Club over flowed with guests who came to hear the praiseas well as the voiceof the late John Masefield.

title: Mao's Wife Shapes Operas Anew to Fit Ideological Needs
description: HONG KONG, June 2 Chiang Ching, the wife of Chair man Mao Tsetung, is again in the limelight.

title: San Juan Budget $1 Billion
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., June 2 (UPI)Puerto Rico's budget for the fiscal year 197071 will ex ceed a billion dollars for the first time, Budget Director Luis Montanez Reyes reported to day. The budget will total $1.031billion, an increase of $66.5million over the present budget, of which $870million is Commonwealth funds and $161million is Federal.

title: CLOSER CHECK URGED ON MEDICAID IN CITY
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The deputy head of New York City's Health Department, Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, told the Senate Fi nance Committee today that medicaid was paying for much of the substandard health care in the city.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 3, 1970

title: New Troupe Gives London First Bill Of 2 Silent Plays
description: LONDON, June 2  Two years ago James RooseEvans, director of the Hampstead The ater, detached himself from the newplay treadmill and launched an experimental act ing unit, Stage Two, which is now offering London its first fruits in a converted veneer factory near Regents Park.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: June 2. 1970

title: Suspect in Bank Holdup Indicted in Escape Effort
description: NEW HAVEN, June 2 (AP) One of two brothers sus pected of blowing up the Dan bury police station and robbing a nearby bank of more than $26,000 has been charged with trying a second time to escape from jail.

title: MARKET CLOSES ON AN EVEN KEEL
Business Records BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS
description: Southern District Tuesday, June 2, 1970

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) The Defense Department to day identified the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: POLICE IN BUFFALO ORDERED IN LINEUP
description: BUFFALO, June 2  Sixty two Buffalo policemen have been commanded to appear tomorrow in a lineup at Police Headquarters following com plaints that the police attacked a man and sprayed a caustic substance on two infants in home last April 6 in an East Side Negro neighborhood.

title: Washington High Girl Guarded After Harassment by Students
description: Protective escorts have been assigned to an 18yearold girl senior at George Washington High School to guard her from harassment by a gang of stu dents.

title: WELLINGTON PLANS INCOMETYPE FUND
description: The Wellington Management Company announced yesterday that it plans to add an income type mutual fund to the 11 other funds it manages.

title: Unruh, Murphy, Tunney Capture California Races
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 2  Assemblyman Jess Unruh was nominated by California Democrats tonight to run against Gov. Ronald Reagan, who was unopposed for the Re publican nomination.

title: Payoffs to Jersey Officials Laid to Cleaning Firms
description: TRENTON, June 2A form er building maintenance com pany executive told the State Commission of Investigation to day about what he said were bribes paid by the company to elminate public bidding on cleaning contracts for such state agencies as the New Jer sey Turnpike Authority and the Department of Transportation.

title: WALLACE DEFEATS BREWER IN RUNOFF FOR GOVERNORSHIP
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 2 George Corley Wallace, the voice of segregation and the South in national politics for almost a decade, was returned to office tonight by the voters of Alabama.

title: Rogers and Dobrynin Meet On Mideast but Gain Little
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Secretary of State William P. Rogers today met with the Soviet Ambassador, Anatoly F. Dobrynin, for a renewed attempt to defuse ArabIsraeli tensions, but the two appar ently made little headway toward a political or military understanding.

title: Aborting Abortion Reform
description: The right of women to end unwanted pregnancies and the physical, emotional and economic strains they can cause has been recognized in a new New York State law which takes effect July 1. If properly implemented, this law should make legalized abor tions available to the poor and nearpoor just as they have always been available to the welltodo who could travel to jurisdictions already sanctioning them.

title: Article 3  No Title
Dartmouth and Connecticut Oust Providence in Baseball
description: HANOVER, N. H., June 2 Darmouth and Connecticut scored victories over Provi dence and thus eliminated the Friars from the National Col legiate District I baseball cham pionship at Rolfe Field today.

title: Austrian Medal forBernstein
description: VIENNA, June 2 (UN) Leonard Bernstein today re ceived one of the highest Aus trian civilian decorations, the Gold Medal for Services Ren dered to the Republic. Leopold Gratz, the Minister of Educa tion, awarded the conductor the medal 10 days after the mae stro led a triumphant produc tion of Beethoven's Fidelio, the gala opening of the current Vienna Festival.

title: Miss Rothberg, J. Brian Barnett To Wed June 21
description: PEORIA, Ill., June 2Miss Kathleen Michele Rothberg and J. Brian Barnett plan to be married here June 21 at the home of the bridetobe's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Rothberg, who are also of New York.

title: Nixon Speech on TV And Radio at 9 Tonight
description: President Nixon is sched uled to deliver a report to the nation on the Cambo dian military operation at 9 P.M. Eastern Daylight time tonight. The address will be carried live on radio and television.

title: Wallace Votes for Himself 8th Time
description: CLAYTON, Ala., June 2 After voting for himself, George Corley Wallace paused on his way out of the Barbour County Courthouse today to speak to an old friend.

title: MICHIGAN BEGINS COED KILLING CASE
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., June 2 The trial of John Norman Collins, charged with killing one college coed here and held as a suspect in a halfdozen other slayings, opened today.

title: Eight Escape From Jail On 6th Floor in Camden
description: CAMDEN, N.J., June 2 The Camden County Prosecu tor's Office and the Federal Bureau of Investigation opened inquiries today into the escape of eight dangerous prisoners last night from the sixthfloor jail of the Camden County Courthouse Building.

title: Pratt Names Lindsay's Aide
description: The appointment of Richard Streiter as dean of students was announced yesterday by Dr. Louis D. Sass, vice presi dent for academic affairs at Pratt Institute. Mr. Streiter has been an educational aide to Mayor Lindsay.

title: Canada Chief to Join Shell Board
description: Harry Bridges, president of Shell Canada, Ltd., will be proposed to the board of the Shell Oil Company for elec tion as a director and execu tive vice president and chief operating officer of Shell Oil in the early fall.

title: N.B.C. Special on Cambodia
description: The National Broadcasting Company will televise a special onehour edition of Meet the Press at 7:30 P. M. tomorrow. It will deal with Cambodia. The first portion will examine the military aspects of the situation with a panel of newsmen inter viewing an Administration military spokesman. The sec ond portion will treat the Con stitutional issues. A different panel of newsmen will inter view Senator Frank Church, Democrat of Idaho, and another Senator, still to be named.

title: Five Plead Guilty in a Plot To Ransack Dow Complex
description: MIDLAND, Mich., June 2 (AP)Five members of a group calling itself Beaver 55 en tered pleas of guilty today to charges of conspiracy to will fully and maliciously damage property of the Dow Chemical Company.

title: Babies vs. the G.N.P.
description: Concern over the quality of life in America has blos somed so swiftly and so pervasively in the last few years that it is hard to imagine a time when air and water pollu tion, congestion and, indeed, the environment in general were not active social and political issues. As might be expected of any new mass movement, the environmentalists have been quick to acquire an orthodoxy and a litany all their Economic own. Of all the Analysis cries that have arisen, perhaps none is quite so superficially appealing, or so profound in its longrange social and economic implications, as zero population growthZPG in the slogans of the day.

title: Oliver Goes Head Over Heels to Come Up With Tag
Article 1  No Title
Black Students Urge Baptists To Follow Principles of Jesus
description: DENVER, June 2  A group of black university students made an unscheduled appear ance at the annual meeting of the Southern Baptist Conven tion today and urged the vir tually allwhite assembly to, live up to the precepts of Jesus Christ in racial rela tions.

title: Bank Robbery Suspect's Arrest Surprises Friends
description: As Raphael Pavia, the 44 yearold bartender accused of robbing 20 banks in the last three months, was arraigned yesterday, his wife leaned over to the handcuffed prisoner and whispered, Why did you do it?

title: Shostakovich Improves After Crippling Ailment
description: MOSCOW, June 2 (AP) Dmitri Shostakovich, the com poser, is improving under treat ment in Western Siberia for an ailment that crippled his wrists and legs, Tass, the Soviet Gov ernment press agency, reported today. The ailment was not identified.

title: Awards Post Given Dr. Wood
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 2 Dr. Robert C. Wood, president of the University of Massachu setts and former Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, has been named chair man of the selection commit tee for the Rockefeller Public Service Awards. The $10,000 grants, administered by Prince ton University's Woodrow Wil son School of Public and In ternational Affairs, are given annually to truly distinguished civilians making careers in Federal Government.

title: Patriots' Eisenhauer Retires
description: BOSTON, June 2 (UPI) Larry Eisenhauer, a defensive end for nine years with the Boston Patriots, retired from professional football today. The 30yearold said he retired be cause his business with Data Metal Company was going ex tremely well and a knee he injured in 1967 still bothered, him.

title: Banker Assails Bad Analysis
description: John R. Bunting, a former Federal Reserve economist who now heads Philadel phia's largest bank, chided fellow economists yesterday for notoriously bad anal ysis in the last couple of years, adding that if they did not offer more imaginative solutions to economic prob lems they were in danger of being relegated to a role like that of a court jester.

title: GORDON D. CATES, 63, AD EXECUTIVE, DEAD
description: Gordon D. Cates, an adver tising executive, died of cancer yesterday at his home, 17 Lin den Avenue, Larchmont, N. Y. He was 63 years old.

title: U.S. Vietnam Policy: An Assessment
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 1  There is widespread doubt among the most experi enced American observers in South Vietnam that current United States policies will bring lasting peace. Although 110,000 American troops, have been withdrawn from Viet nam and enormous strides have been made in pacification in the last 18 months, the United States still faces vast problems in extricating itself.

title: Panthers Charge Grand Jury With Prejudice in Indictment
description: Lawyers for 13 Black Pan thers sought to prove yesterday in Manhattan Supreme Court that the New York County grand jury that indicted them was heavily weighted against the young, the poor and the black.

title: Columbia Head Assails War, but Hundreds Walk Out
description: President Andrew W. Cordier of Columbia University evoked applause from an outdoor com mencement audience of 8,000 persons on the campus yester day when he declared that the Indochina war's 44.000 Ameri can dead, 300,000 wounded and $100billion cost cannot be justified either by its char acter or any conceivable re sult.

title: Books of The Times; Sociology (2): Rent a Liberal Technologue, Cheap
description: The crisis of Western sociology enters its second day. Next month, almost as though the professors had been reading Alvin W. Gouldner's book, Harvard will reestablish an independent department of sociology, ending 24 years of interdisci plinary groupgrope (sociologists, psy chologists, anthropologists) under the social relations umbrella. One reason for the change, as reported by Robert Rein hold in The New York Times on Monday, is that American sociology is shifting its emphasis away from microscale anal yses of individual behavior, toward urban and racial problems instead. Sociologists will thus have more in common with economists and political scientists than with psychologists and anthropologists.

title: Louisiana Festival Arrests
description: DENHAM SPRINGS, La., June 2 (UPI)The three own ers of Thunderbird Beach and the promoter of a pop festival held there Memorial Day week end were arrested today by the Livingston Parish County Sheriff's office in connection with a city ordinance passed to block the festival.

title: Mayer Cards 150 and Captures Hochster Golf Event by a Stroke
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 2 Jim Mayer of Winged Foot celebrated his 21st wedding anniversary today by winning the 37th annual Hochster Mem orial golf tournament at the Quaker Ridge Golf Club.

title: South Vietnamese Losses Heavy at Post
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 2 (AP) North Vietna mese sappers overran part of a Government fire base in the far northern part of South Vietnam today but were beat en back after inflicting heavy casualties on the South Viet namese defenders.

title: U.S. SAID TO INSIST ON ABM AT CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 American negotiators at the Vienna talks on limitations of strategic arms are said to have told Soviet representatives that, at a minimum, the United States insists on having one missile defense siteto defend Wash ington.

title: Holiday Death Toll 396
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (AP) Traffic accidents during the Memorial Day weekend claimed 396 livesa record for any twoday observance of a warm weather holiday, the National Safety Council reported today. The previous record was set over the 1959 Memorial Day weekend, when 310 persons died in traffic accidents.

title: RISE IN AIR FARES URGED BY UNITED
description: Unless a general fare increase is granted the airlines soon, United Air Lines, the No. 1 of the industry, may not be able to report a profit this year, ac cording to George Keck, presi dent of the airline and its par ent, UAL, Inc., the holding company.

title: A Correction
description: CLEVELAND, June 2Mem bership dues in the 21st Dis trict Caucus, formed by Negro Democratic party officials in a split with the Cuyahoga Coun ty Democratic organization, are $2 a person a year and are the same for whites as for blacks, a caucus spokesman said today. An article in Sun day's New York Times Indi cated that there were two dues scales, for blacks and for whites. The caucus spokesman said that this was untrue.

title: Two Peruvians Here in Quest for Capital
description: Two officials of the Peruvian Government were in New York yesterday seeking capital investment for their country and understanding from the American Government and people of their revolution.

title: 1.0.5. in Comeback, Fund Head States
description: GENEVA, June 2Investors Overseas Services is on the comeback road after having faced up to management problems of serious propor tions, the president of the financial empire's parent com pany said today.

title: Democratic Senate Candidates Stressing Foreign Policy Issues
description: Foreign policy issues occu pied the four candidates for the Democratic nomination for Sen ator from New York yester day.

title: Theater: Moby Dick
description: Deep with levels of mean ing, richly textured with am biguities, resonant with sym bols and images, Moby Dick would seem impossible to dramatize effectively. But it is also one of the most dra matic and theatrical of Amer ican novels. In size, style and language, it is Shakespearean trap for unwary play wrights.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Ex change scored its fifth consecu tive advance yesterday as the fist closed higher in active trading.

title: Heyerdahl Boat Progresses
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., June 2 (UPI)Thor Heyerdahl's papy rus boat, the Ra II, caught fresh breezes northeast of the Canary Islands today, accord ing to a radio message moni tored here, and made good headway on its voyage toward Mexico across the Atlantic Ocean.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL SURGES IN WEEK
description: Steel production rose 2.3 per cent last week from the pre ceding week's level, the Amer ican Iron and Steel Institute re ported yesterday. It was the largest weektoweek advance in more than three months.

title: Agencies Start Interview Service
description: Dissatisfied with the quality of field interviewing and market research now available, 25 memberagencies of the American Association of Advertising Agencies have estab lished a nonprofit company to do something about it.

title: PHYSICIANS PROD CITY ON HOSPITALS
description: A group of city hospital physicians called on the direc tors of the Health and Hospi tals Corporation yesterday to resign in a body unless funds were provided for a reason able standard of care in our municipal hospitals.

title: Disaster in Peru
description: The devastating earthquake that has rocked a 600mile stretch of coastline in Peru and taken the lives of unknown tens of thousands in scores of towns in the Andes is another brutal reminder that scientific energies must be directed much more inten sively toward the forecasting and prevention of natural disasters.

title: 4 Mafia Members Arrested Upstate At Lunch Meeting
description: BATAVIA, N.S. June 2 Four Mafia members, including two who had attended the 1957 gangland gathering at Apa lachin, N. Y., were arrested at lunch here today in Mancuso's Restaurant. Two men who were lunching with them also were taken into custody by the po lice.

title: Site Urged at Andersonville
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) Congress was urged today to establish Andersonville prison in Georgia. the most publicized of the Confederate prisons in the Civil War. and its cemetery as a National Historic Site.

title: NIEKRO IS VICTOR ON A FOURHITTER
description: ATLANTA, June 2  On a rainy night in Georgia, the Braves finally beat the Mets, eight months too late for the 1969 pennant.

title: Khrushchev Stays in Hospital
description: MOSCOW, June 2 (UPI)  Nikita S. Khrushchev, 76 years old, has been hospitalized with a burst blood vessel and will probably be there for two or three weeks, sources close to his family said today. His con dition was not considered dan gerous.

title: Nassau Grand Jury Will Hear Testimony on Sawchuk's Death
description: The Nassau County Dis trict Attorney decided yes terday to let a grand jury determine whether a crime had been committed in the death of Terry Sawchuk, the New York Rangers' goalie.

title: Sales in City Stores Inch Ahead As Merchants Stress Values
description: New York department stores last month managed to push their sales to a figure slightly above the level of that in May of 1969. The city's leading stores registered a 1 per cent average gain in their downtown stores and went ahead by 2 per cent in their suburban branches. per cent average gain in their downtown stores and went ahead by 2 per cent in their suburban branches.

title: Frank Catapano, 62, Dies; Brooklyn Democratic Aide
description: Frank L. Catapano, Demo cratic leader of the 38th Assem bly District in Brooklyn and formerly aide to former Assem bly Speaker Anthony J. Travia, died Saturday at Interboro Hos pital in Brooklyn of a diabetic ailment.

title: Legislator's Car Bombed
description: JOLIET, III., June 2 (AP) State Representative William Barr was injured critically when his car was demolished today by a bomb that exploded as he turned on the ignition. Mr. Barr, a millionaire real es tate developer, underwent sur gery at St. Joseph's Hospital. The police announced no mo tive in the explosion.

title: Big Four's Volume Fell to 267,548 During the May 2123 Period
description: DETROIT, June 2The four major auto makers reported re tail sales today of 267,548 Unit ed Statesmodel cars during May 2131 compared with 304, 627 a year before.

title: Pipe Bomb Is Exploded Near Queens Restaurant
description: A pipe bomb exploded early yesterday morning outside La Stella Restaurant in Forest Hills, Queens, the scene of a police roundup four years ago of 13 reputed Mafia leaders

title: EDWIN C. STEIN, 60, OF VOICE OF AMERICA
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP)  Edwin Carroll Stein, an editor for the Voice of America, died of cancer yesterday in DeWitt Army Hospital, Fort Belvoir, Va. He was 60 years old.

title: Soviet Believed Having Trouble Drafting 5Year Plan
description: MOSCOW, June 2The So viet Union appeared today to have encountered difficulties in drawing up a final draft for the next fiveyear plan for 197175, which was due to be announced later this year.

title: SWIFT INCREASES QUARTER PROFITS
description: Swift & Co. showed substan tially larger earnings in the second fiscal quarter and half year ended May 2 although sales were only slightly ahead of the preceding year's periods, the report disclosed yesterday.

title: Danube Flood Toll 161; Record Crest on Way
description: VIENNA, June 2 (Reuters) Rumania announced today the death of 161 people in the worst Danube floods for cen turies and said 16 were miss ing. The river rose meanwhile to record heights with a new flood crest on the way, threat ening to engulf areas inhab ited by 550,000.

title: PUBLIC REPORTED MISLED ON SAFETY
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 Three major Federal safety laws have created a facade of consumer protection that has misled the public, accord ing to a report made public, today by the National Com mission on Product Safety.

title: Fordham Names Dean Of Lincoln Center Unit
description: The appointment of Dr. George W. Shea as dean of Fordham University's Liber al Arts College at Lincoln Center was announced yester day by the Rev. Michael P. Walsh, president of the uni versity.

title: $5,000 FEE IS PAID FOR SPEEDY COLT
description: The 102d Belmont Stakes picked up a speedball and an oddball yesterday with the ad dition of Delaware Chief and Hark the Lark.

title: M'DANIEL RESCUES SOUTHPAW IN 9TH
description: The New York Yankees, who climbed into second place this season without much frontline pitching, got some of it from Fritz Peterson last night as they defeated the Kansas City Royals, 32.

title: Military Officers Join Drive Against the War
description: WASHINGTON, June 2, (AP)The antiwar move ment has reached the United States military officers corps.

title: 2 POLICE INDICTED IN NARCOTICS CASE
description: Two policemen and a civil ian have been indicted on fel Ony charges of possessing dan gerous drugs, Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts an nounced yesterday.

title: Christine Blaine, '64 Debutante, Betrothed to David G. McNellis
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 2Dr. Graham B. Blaine Jr., chief of psychiatry at the Harvard University Health Services here, and Mrs. Blaine have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Christine Carson Blaine, to David G. McNellis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip S. McNellis of Riviera Beach, Fla.

title: Knowles and Goldman Set Pace In Senior Links Tourney at Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., June 2  More than 400 competitors started play in six age divisions in the United States Seniors' Golf As sociation's annual twoday event today, and when the opening round was finished, a familiar name was on top of one of the sections.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Arrogance of Ignorance II
description: MOSCOWPresident Nixon correctly estimated the advance military and diplomatic impli cations of his decision to order U. S. troops into Cambodia to clean out Vietnamese Commu nist sanctuaries and, as dis cussed in a previous column, enormous booty was seized while Russia and China dis played prudence in their initial reactions. However, where Nix on made a grievous miscalcula tion was in judging repercus sions at home.

title: Opera: Lucia at the Met
PERU'S AID PLEA CAUSES U.S. SNARL
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  A breakdown in communications among United States Govern ment officials developed here last night as earthquake stricken Peru appealed for emergency aid.

title: RCA Strike Continues
description: CAMDEN, N. J., June 2 (AP)  A strike against 13 RCA plants continued today, with pickets at five of the plants. The strike against the com pany, the first in 20 years, is being staged by the Interna tional Union of Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers, representing 12,000 employes in five different states. The issue is the company's latest pay offer.

title: Mrs. Smith's Good Counsel
description: As she did twenty years ago in her declaration of conscience against the rightwing excesses of Senator Joseph R. McCarthy, Senator Margaret Chase Smith is attempting to rally the country to modera tion and good sense. One can only hope profoundly that it will not take four years this time for her counsel to be heeded.

title: Pacifica Back on the Air
description: HOUSTON, June 2, (UPI) The city's Pacifica radio station was back on the air today, three weeks after saboteurs dynamited the station's trans mitter. KPFTFM is supported by the Pacifica Foundation and broadcasts political opinion from groups ranging from the Weathermen to the Ku Klux Klan.

title: Grambling Game Shifted
description: PITTSBURG June 2 (UPI) Grambling College will meet Morgan State Sept. 12 in the first college football game at Pittsburgh's new Three Rivers Stadium. The two Negro power houses played in the Yankee Stadium in New York the last two seasons, Morgan State win ning, 97, in 1968 and Gram bling winning, 3012, last year.

title: AUSSIE DOMINATES WITH HIS SERVICE
description: Hitting with the precision, depth and confidence of a world champion, Rod Laver beat Richard (Pancho) Gon zales, 63, 63, 61, last night in the $200,000 Tennis Cham pions Classic at Madison Square Garden.

title: Transport Expert Calls Streets Here a Disgrace
description: WASHINGTON  Every time I think of New York I'm consoled by the fact that it's an exception to the rules, said Wilfrid Owen, the trans portation specialist and senior fellow at the Brook ings Institution here.

title: Blair in Good Condition
description: ORANGE, Calif., June 3 (UPI) Paul Blair, Baltimore Orioles outfielder, was resting com fortably and in good condition today following surgery to cor rect multiple facial fractures.

title: Air Force Cuts 10 More F111F's From Its Plane Purchase Order
description: Cost adjustments have chip ped away 10 more planes from the planned Air Force purchase of the most advanced of its F111 attack bombers, the F model.

title: ARCHITECTS ELECT GIORGIO CAVAGLIERI
description: Giorgio Cavaglieri was elected president of the New York Chapter of the American Insti tute of Architects for 197071. He succeeds David F. M. Todd. Announcement of the organiza tion's new officers and yearly awards were made yesterday at the group's 103d annual meet ing in Delmonico's Hotel.

title: GRISCOM CUP WON BY PHILADELPHIA
description: HUNTINGDON, Pa., June 3 The Philadelphia women's golf team, captained by Mrs. Charles Wilson, won the 64th Griscom Cup matches today by defeating teams from New York and Boston.

title: 8Cent Stamp Delay Seen
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount conceded today that Congressional approval of an 8 cent stamp was unlikely in this session of Congress. He said that the Post Office, faced with a promise to raise postal sal aries when postal reform legis lation was approved, might have to ask Congress for extra money if not granted authority to make interim financing ar rangements.

title: Coal Miners to Be Tested
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The Environmental Health Service will examine 90,000 coal miners for black lung dis ease in a chest Xray program beginning July 1. The primary purpose of this program will be to warn miners who show Xray evidence of significant pneumoconiosis [black lung], said Charles C. Johnson, head of the service.

title: F.L. DUPONT SETS A MAJOR MERGER
description: Francis I. duPont & Co., one of the nation's largest broker age firms, disclosed plans yes terday to merge with Glore Forgan Staats, Inc., a major in vestment banking house, in one of the largest consolidations in Wall Street history.

title: Transcript of President's Address on Situation in Indochina
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's televised address to the nation last night on the war in Indo china, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Ethel Cardwell Is Wed at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 3In the Appleton Chapel at Harvard University at noon today, Miss Ethel Par mele Cardwell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Guy Adams Cardwell of Chapel Hill, N. C., was married to Patrice Louis Ren Higonnet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ren Alphonse Hi gonnet of Montreux, Switzer land, and Lloret del Mar, Spain. The Rev. Lawrence Hill performed the Episcopal ceremony.

title: Arroyo Assumes New Role at Met
description: Martina Arroyo assumed the role of Santuzza in Mas cagni's Cavalleria Rusti cana for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera on Tuesday night in a double bill with Leoncavallo's Pa gliacci.

title: Supplies U.S. Seized in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Following, as made public by the White House tonight, is a list of enemy equipment reported captured or destroyed in Cambodia between April 30, when allied troops began their offensive there, and P.M. today:

title: Beame Assails Projected Pay For City Hospitals Corporation
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday criticized the projected salaries of the new Health and Hospitals Corpora tion as officers of the corpora tion asked the city for an addi tional $60million to run the innnicipal hospitals during the next fiscal year.

title: CHAPLAINS URGED TO DOFF UNIFORMS
description: Rabbi Arthur Hertzberg, a former Air Force chaplain and now a professor of history at Columbia University, yesterday proposed that all military chap lains get out of uniform, be come civilian chaplains paid by their denominations and return to the business of being priests, rabbis and ministers.

title: Transit Policeman Seized In Theft of T.W.A. Tickets
description: A transit patrolman was ar rested early yesterday on charges that he stole $40,000 to $50,000 worth of airline tickets from Trans World Air lines when he was in its em ploy.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: NEW MODELS SET BY CONTROL DATA
description: The data processing industry had a busy day yesterday as the Control Data Corporation introduced four new computer models and Recognition Equip ment, Inc., announced a like number of character recogni tion systems.

title: BUSINESS OUTLAY SAID TO INDICATE AID TO ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 American business has revised downward somewhat its for merly exuberant plans to invest in plant and equipment this year, a new Government sur vey disclosed today.

title: Yankees Down Royals, 53, as Cater's 2Run Homer in 5th Breaks 33 Tie
description: The long ball, once an almost everygame occurrence with the New York Yankees but a rarity in recent seasons, came to the fore last night at Yankee Sta dium before 6,891 fans.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: This year's Shinnecock Swordfish Tournament re turns to Nick's Marina; Shinnecock, L. I., according to Bill Tomasek, president of the Shinnecock Anglers' Club.

title: Tower Endorses Gross
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) Senator John G. Tower, Re publican of Texas, head of the Senate Republican Campaign Committee, wired his support today to New Jersey senatorial ?? ??on It Gross.

title: L.I. Commuter Air Service Starts
description: A commuter airline serv ice was started yesterday be tween Republic Airport in Farmingdale, L. I., and the three major metropolitan air ports.

title: 71 7Pound Tuna Sets Record
description: CHARLOTTETOWN, Prince Edward Island, June 3 (Cana dian Press)A 717hound blue fin tuna caught off North Lake, Prince Edward Island, last sum mer by Doris R. Watts of Wil liamsport, Pa., was a world record for a woman angler using 80pound test line, the International Game Fish As sociation has ruled. fin tuna caught off North Lake, Prince Edward Island, last sum mer by Doris R. Watts of Wil liamsport, Pa., was a world record for a woman angler using 80pound test line, the International Game Fish As sociation has ruled.

title: Columbia Peace Group Urges Draft Board Members to Resign to Protest Against War
description: An antiwar group at Colum bia University has written let ters to most of the city's draft board members urging them to resign as a protest over the war to which you now send young men and the process you use in selecting them.

title: FMC Gets a Contract
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The FMC Corporation has re ceived a $78,482,370 Navy con tract, it was announced today. The contract is for construc tion of 542 LVTP7 assault am phibious landing craft.

title: Heath Off and Running and Enjoying It
description: CARDIFF, Wales, June 3 With a style that blends anger and amusement, Edward Heath moves quickly across the Brit ish countryside, grinning and waving at the swarms of gray haired women with I Trust Ted buttons and the elderly men and local Conservative candidates gripping banners reading: For a Better Tomor row.

title: FULTON IS VICTOR IN IOWA PRIMARY
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June (UPI)Former Lieut. Gov. Rob ert Fulton won a narrow vic tory in Iowa's Democratic gubernatorial primary yester day and earned the right to challenge Gov. Robert D. Ray in the November general elec tion.

title: Districting Struck Down
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court ruled today that the existing apportionment of the state's 40 member Senate is unconstitu tional and cannot be the basis for the fall election. The ruling opened the possibility of at large Senate elections unless the legislature passes an accept ble reapportionment bill.

title: Communist Paper Invaded By Jewish Defense League
description: About 30 members of the Jewish Defense League yester day invaded the offices of the Communist newspaper The Daily World to protest what they said was the newspaper's failure to report on the plight of Soviet Jews.

title: Lindsay Says Budget Is Heading Into a Hard Fight
description: Mayor Lindsay declared yes terday that his proposed $7.8 billion budget faced a perilous problem in the City Council and Board of Estimate, and that not a single voice had supported new revenue mea sures without which the record budget would be in default.

title: AGNEW SALUTES WEST POINT CLASS
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 3  Vice President Agnew praised the leadership qualities of graduates of the United States Military Academy today while attacking what he termed criminal misfits and charla tans of peace who cause na tional confusion.

title: Challengers of Lefkowitz Waging Active Campaign
description: It was late in the day and Adam Walinsky, the 33year Odld designated Democratic can idate for State Attorney Gen eral, had just changed into a fresh shirt and tie for what was to be a routine evening lof political activities  a Man hattan cocktail party; a meet ing with college students in Brooklyn; a dinner dance in Hempstead, L. I.

title: I.O.S. to Shun Sale Of Any Subsidiary
description: GENEVA, June 3Investors Overseas Services said today it would not dismember its finan cial empire by disposing of subsidiaries piecemeal.

title: Teamster Spokesman Calls Goldberg Unaware of Issues
description: A spokesman for New York Teamsters Joint Council 16 which has endorsed Governor Rockefeller for reelection, said yesterday it had not endorsed Arthur J. Goldberg because he did not know anything about the issues in New York State.

title: Cicada Revisits the State
description: The periodic cicada is begin ning to reappear in the state after an absence of 17 years, according to the American Museum of Natural History. Though it swarms somewhat like a locust, it is not so destructive, the museum says.

title: Chargers Trade Mix to Raiders
description: About Pro Football

title: Ministers Discuss Impasse Of Honduras and Salvador
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  The foreign ministers of the five Central American countries met today in San Jos, Costa Rica, in an attempt to break a deadlock between Honduras and El Salvador.

title: Entertainment Events
description: TONIGHT

title: Mayor Honors Apollo 13 Crew at Lincoln Center
description: The three astronauts on the aborted Apollo 13 moon flight were honored by the city yes terday at a luncheon in Phil harmonic Ha11 at Lincoln Cen ter.

title: A.E.C. Seeks Dumping Site
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (Reu ters)The Atomic Energy Com mission said today that a search would begin soon for suitable sites where highly radioactive waste material can be dumped in deep underground salt de posits. Most such waste is now buried in concrete tanks in Hanford, Wash., an earthquake risk zone.

title: Dartmouth and Broberg Halt Connecticut Nine, 82
description: HANOVER, N. H., June 3 Pete Broberg pitched Dart mouth to an 82 victory over Connecticut today in a game delayed two hours by rain.

title: Something New on Dog Judging
description: The Nicholas Guide to Dog Judging, a book by Anna Katherine Nicholas of White Plains brings something new, at least for this era, into the large literature of the dog. Miss Nicholas draws on wide experience in the show rings since she started at the age of 17 in 1934 to tell judging aspirants what to look for in dogs, how to go about the task and even whether one should try to be come a judge in the first place through being suited for the job.

title: Gunman Shoots 2 in Belfast In Second Night of Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 3 (AP)A gunman fired four shots into a crowd tonight and wounded two men as vio lence erupted in this trouble torn city for the second straight night.

title: ONGANIA CONDEMNS ARAMBURU SEIZURE
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 3 President Juan Carlos Ongania last night condemned the kid napping on Friday of the for mer President, Pedro Eugenio Aramburu, and charged that it had been supported by foreign ideologies.

title: Chess:
Mood of the Electorate
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 3 If President Nixon's handling of the economy, student unrest and Indochina has moved the electorate to the left, as some politicians believe it has, you couldn't prove it by the results of yesterday's primary elec tions. It was not a good day for liberals or for doves. InAlabama, George C. Wallace showed that race is still the dominant fac tor in his state's politics, 105 years after the last Union soldier fired the last shot. But the ef ficacy of appeals to racial fears is not what it once was, even in Alabama. Only 51 of every 100 Alabamans who voted stood up for George, and most of the welleducated whites and nearly all the blacks were among those who sat down.

title: Views Explained
description: CORNING, N. Y., June 3 Picketed by 20 parochial school children who wanted his views on aid to nonpublic schools, Arthur J. Goldberg fed them hamburgers, milk and cookies today and won their applause with a brief lecture on the so called Blaine amendment.

title: Article 1  No Title
Old Grads' June Reveries Fall Victim to Turmoil on Campuses
description: In this soft time of the year, when members of the city's university clubs are wont to loll in their leather armchairs savoring sweet summer memories of long gone commencements and class days, many are finding this June thateven in their thoughtsthey can not go home again.

title: Syvertsen Had Covered War Since '67
description: George Syvertsen, the Co lumbia Broadcasting System correspondent presumed dead in Cambodia, was no stranger to the violence of war in South east Asia.

title: Suspect in Drug Smuggling Seized at Buffalo Airport
description: BUFFALO, June 3A retired seaman, Nicolas Abalos Sagon of New York City, was ar rested here today on a charge of smuggling cocaine worth $1 million into the United States aboard an Eastern Airlines plans from Toronto, Ontario, to Greater Buffalo International Airport.

title: Libyan Aide Says U.S. Jet Sale to Israel Might Bring Final Break With Arabs
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, June 2 The secondranking man in the revolutionary junta ruling Libya said today that if the United States sold more Phan tom fighterbombers to Israel it may be the final break in relations with the Arab world.

title: UTILITY OFFERING HAS SLOW SALES
description: Interest rates inched lower yesterday, cautiously continuing a trend that began a week ago.

title: 32 NIXON HECKLERS HELD IN TENNESSEE
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 3  Fortyseven warrants have been issued in connection with, the heckling of President Nixon at a rally by the Rev. Billy Graham in the University of Tennessee Stadium last Thurs day night.

title: RICHMOND COLLEGE CANCELS EXERCISES
description: Richmond College has can celed its commencement exer cises because business as usual at this time In our history . . . would tend to divide us fur ther, according to Herbert Schueler, its president.

title: ... and Youthful Energies
description: Elsewhere in the country Tuesday's primaries were the usual mixed bag. Perhaps their greatest signifi cance lay in the fact that young citizens, rejecting the extremism of the streets to work within the demo cratic context, made a showing that should at least convince them that they are on the right track.

title: Author Seeks Kennedy Seat
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)Ber nard M. Bane, 45 years old, of Brookline, author and the head of the BMB Pubishing Company, announced today his candidacy, as an independent, for the seat held by Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat.

title: Louisiana House for Tighter Definition of Negro
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 3  The Louisiana State House of Representatives passed yester day a bill to tighten the official definition of a Negro in Louisi ana.

title: Excess Military Stockpiles Found at 3 Supply Centers
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The General Accounting Of fice says its investigation of three of the Pentagon's five defense supply centers dis closed $254.3million worth of stockpiled goods that were in excess to all known military needs.

title: Grant of $50,000 Aids Vandalized Laboratory
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass June 3 (AP)A grant of nearly $50,000 from a New Jersey foundation has temporarily saved a vandalized laboratory animal research program in Cambridge that is studying heart disease and cancer.

title: ISRAELIS REPORT DOWNING 3 JETS; EGYPT CLAIMS 2
description: TEL AVIV, June 3  Israel reported downing three Egyp tian MIG21's within three minutes today in dogfights over the northern sector of the Suez Canal. The Egyptian planes had been attempting to halt a sustained bombardment of targets there.

title: NIXON DESCRIBES CAMBODIAN DRIVE AS GREAT SUCCESS
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  President Nixon said tonight that the allied drive into Cam bodia was the most successful operation of this long and dif ficult war and that he was now able to resume his with drawal of American troops from South Vietnam.

title: Drawing Will Help Draft A Congressional Ballot
description: The Board of Education announced yesterday that it would hold a drawing tomor row to determine the posi tion on the June 23 primary ballot of the candidates for the United States House of Representatives from this city.

title: Morton Sultanoff, Expert In HighSpeed Photography
description: ABERDEEN, Md., June 3 Morton Sultanoff, a civilian physicist at the Aberdeen Prov ing Ground, who developed camera in 1950 that would take pictures at a 100,000,000a second clip, died yesterday of a heart attack. His age was 50.

title: Miss Ann Shedlin Planning Nuptials
description: Miss Ann Shedlin and Daniel Tucker Kamin plan to be married here in August.

title: POLICE ACCUSE TWO OF OFFERING A BRIBE
description: A Bronx man and woman were arraigned in Bronx Crim inal Court yesterday on charges of offering a bribe to two po licemen not to arrest the man for allegedly possessing and selling narcotics.

title: U.S. Seizes Tuna Here
description: United States marshals im pounded a shipment of 4,896 cans of imported Japanese tuna yesterday that were said to have been ordered by the city for use in its hospitals. The fish was decomposed, accord ing to a complaint filed by Cyril Hyman, assistant United States attorney, in Brooklyn Federal Court. fish was decomposed, accord ing to a complaint filed by Cyril Hyman, assistant United States attorney, in Brooklyn Federal Court.

title: GRADUATION HELD FOR COAST GUARD
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., June 3  Under Secretary of Trans portation James M. Beggs told the 135 graduating cadets at the Coast Guard Academy to day he saw an expanded role for the Coast Guard in protect ing the environment and de veloping oceanography tech niques.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: June 3, 1970

title: QUESTIONS POSED TO UTILITY CHIEFS
description: BOSTON, June 3  As the sixstate New England area went through its second con secutive day of 5 per cent elec tricvoltage reductions, speak ers at the final sessions of the 38th annual convention of the Edison Electric Institute de bated the merits of promoting sales of electricity.

title: Xerox Executiye Retires; Introducer of Photo Copier
description: ROCHESTER, June 3 (AP)4 The executive credited with in teresting what is now the Xerox Corporation in a photocopying process has retired as vice chairman of the Xerox board. The process helped build Xerox into an industrial giant.

title: Labor Bids Congress Direct Nixon to Speed Up Housing
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Indus trial Organizations urged Con gress today to direct President Nixon to take the necessary steps to implement discretion ary credit controls and help meet this critical housing need.

title: Bridge:
description: The Reisinger Knockout Team Championship will con tinue tonight at the New York Hilton with 16 teams in contention in the fourth round. This is the premier event in the Eastern Region als, which will end Sunday.

title: Lindsay Proclaims This Week to Honor The Fresh Air Fund
description: Mayor Lindsay has proclaim ed June 1 to 7 as Fresh Air Fund Vacations Week.

title: Inflation Hits Bananas: 4 Feet to Cost $1.98
description: Chiquita Brands is prepar ing to offer the youth of America 4foot bananas. That should keen them busy.

title: Chevron Pleads Not Guilty To U.S. Pollution Charges
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 3 (AP) In the first case of its kind, the Chevron Oil Company pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges stemming from massive water pollution.

title: A Fighting General
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 3At least a dozen times in the last month when his troops were stalled on Cambodian battlefields, Lieut. Gen. Do Cao Tri has swooped down to them in his helicopter, strode to the front of their ranks and assumed temporary com mand to get them moving. Once, in his impatience, he scrambled atop an armored car and, jabbing his swagger stick toward Viet cong sniper positions in a Cambodian farmhouse, shout ed an order to charge, giving it all the authority he could muster in his compact 5foot 4inch, 140pound frame.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Williams Campaigns
description: United States Senator Harri son A. Williams Jr., who won a decisive victory in Tuesday's Democratic Senate primary election in New Jersey, showed every indication yesterday of unifying badly split Democrats in the state for the first time since 1965.

title: LTV Aerospace Leaves SST Building Program
description: DALLAS, June 3 (AP)The LTV Aerospace Corporation has withdrawn as a subcontractor to the Boeing Corporation in the supersonic transport pro gram, LTV announced today.

title: Brink's Sentence Commuted
description: BOSTON, June 3 (AP)The Governor's Council voted today to commute the life sentence of the last of the original Brink's robbers in Walpole State Prison, Anthony Pino. He will be trans ferred to the Suffolk County House of Correction on Deer Island, where he faces a two year term for conspiracy.

title: Keep Your Cool, Dow Advises Targets of Antiwar Protesters
description: The Dow Chemical Company does not make napalm any more, but the company has had so much experience in deal, ing with the uproar it caused that Carl A. Gerstacker, Dow's chairman, came up with an in dustry primer yesterday on how other companies might handle similar confrontations.

title: Birch Member and Black Among Victors on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3  Ronald V. Dellums, an out spoken black insurgent, won the Democratic Congressional nomination in the Berkeley Oakland area yesterday by de feating the incumbent, Repre sentative Jeffery Cohelan.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest re port of changes in ownership of shares by directors, officers and large stockholders in listed corporations. The list included the following:

title: Dempsey's 75th Birthday Celebration Will Be Early
description: Jack Dempsey's mother, Cecelia, always insisted the former heavyweight cham pion was born on June 24, 1895. His father, Hyrum, said the date was June 23, 1895. The family's difference of opinion was never resolved.

title: Misdirected Economy
description: The deep cut in foreignaid funding voted by the House Appropriations Committee is another glaring example of this country's misplaced priorities.

title: Men's Socks: Onward and Upward . . .
description: The soxiest fashion show was given yesterday at the Peacock Alley in the Waldorf Astoria. It started with four barechested male manne quins and ended with a bo somy woman model clad in a swim suit and nudging a re luctant peacock down the runway. All the models were wearing what an untutored visitor from middle America might have called loud knee socks.

title: Advertising: Richfield in Marketing Shifts
description: Against a backdrop of multihued onequart oil cans and using a gasoline pump as a lectern. Thornton F. Bradshaw, president of the Atlantic Richfield Company, announced yesterday a $60 million marketingunification program.

title: Integration Raises the Issue of Coeducation in South
description: MACON, Ga., June 2  Ne gro students desegregating the local high schools this week un der a court order are getting their first taste of a kind of separatism that white students here have objected to for years, sexual segregation.

title: Connecticut Doctor Quits Draft Job to Protest War
description: PUTNAM, Conn, June 3 (AP) Dr. David if. Bates has re signed as medical adviser to the local draft board, saying he can no longer be part of system that makes men fight In a war that is stupid, illegal and against the best interests of the country,

title: CoWorker Held in Slaying Of Bronx Welfare Employe
description: A 50yearold welfare work er was fatally wounded yes terday morning by a coworker in the Bronx Social Services Center at 1790 Grand Con course, the police said.

title: Saigon Force Relieves Mountain Post
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 3 (AP)A fresh South Vietnamese force reached a mountain outpost in the north west corner of the country today and relieved a garrison hard hit by two days of heavy fighting. Field reports said enemy pressure on the post was easing.

title: Jersey Given U.S. Funds To Aid Commuter Trains
description: A $10.2million Federal grant was awarded to New Jersey yesterday to finance the second phase of a program to revital ize Penn Central commuter service between Trenton and New York.

title: Goldman Cards 72 for 144 and Wins U.S. Senior Golf Crown by One Stroke
description: RYE, N.Y., June 3After two nearmisses for victory in his three previous tournaments, David (Spec) Goldman, an aggressive, 61yearold sharp shooter from Dallas, captured his first United States Senior Golf Association crown today.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: THOMAS J. LOVELY

title: 2 CONCERNS DROP PLAN ON RACEWAY
description: The Madison Square Garden Corporation and the Transna tion Development Corporation announced yesterday they had decided not to become equal partners in the ownership of Roosevelt Raceway, Inc.

title: Federal Judge Grants Mitchell Delay on Proposed Indictment
description: BALTIMORE, June 3Fed eral District Judge Roszel C. Thomsen agreed today to delay for two weeks his decision on whether to make public a pro posed indictment by a special grand jury. The jury has been investigating government cor ruption for more than a year.

title: WHITE HOUSE SENDS GROUP ON WAR TOUR
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) A special White House mis sion left today on an inspec tion tour of Vietnam and Cam bodia. The group was heavily weighted with Governors and Congressmen who support President Nixon's policy in In dochina but included one dis senting Senator, Thomas J. McIntyre.

title: Unruh and Reagan Trade Charges After Gaining California Governor Nominations
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 3 Ronald Reagan and Jess Unruh were attacking each other to day even before the votes were all counted in the primary elec tions that made them rivals in November for the governorship of California.

title: Japanese to Follow Alcoa In Okinawa Smelter Bid
description: TOKYO, June 3 (UPI)  Five Japanese aluminum con cerns said today they would ask the Ryukyu Government by midJune for approval to build a smelter on Okinawa.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
Obituary 1  No Title
description: DANIEL A. SKELLYELIZABETH, N. J., June 3, Daniel A. Skelly, formerly tele graph editor of The Daily Jour nal here, died yesterday at Annie Warner Hospital, Gettys burg, Pa. He was 75 years old, and had retired in 1959.

title: Docker Found Slain Here; Brother Wounded in 1959
description: A 38yearold Brooklyn long shoreman was found shot to death yesterday in what the police called a ganglandstyle slaying.

title: Syvertsen of C.B.S. News Feared Dead in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 3The discovery today of the clothes of George Syvertsen, a missing newsman, and a dis figured body in a shallow grave raised fears that Mr. Syvertsen, who disappeared Sunday, was dead.

title: Figuration, $49.60, Takes Stakes Race at Arlington
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (AP)  Figuration, owned by Gerry Robins of Miami Beach, pulled away from the favored Misty Joy today to win the $17,100 Mademoiselle Stakes before 9.411 at Arlington Park.

title: JERSEY DETECTIVE TIED TO PAYOFFS
description: TRENTON, Jane 3 (AP)A Jersey City detective was in dicted by a state grand jury today on a charge that he accepted payoffs from two reputed Mafia figures to pro tect gambling in Hudson County.

title: GULF & WESTERN SHOWS PROFIT DIP
3 Asian Nations to Meet On Cambodia on Weekend
description: OSAKA, Japan, June 3  Foreign Minister Kiichi Aichi said today that representatives of Japan, Indonesia and Malay sia would meet in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on Satur day and Sunday to decide on ways to attempt to revive the International Control Commis sion in Cambodia.

title: Some Soxology Theories
description: Following are excerpts from a study by Dr. Ernest Dichter titled Soxology: a Strategy for Stimulating Sock Sales.

description: LOS ANGELES, June 3 (UPI)  While awaiting the outcome of his California primary election race last night, Representative John V. Tunney got a call from his father, Gene Tunney, the for mer heavyweight champion, who asked:

title: WINNERS ANNOUNCED FOR 3D SCHOOL BOARD
description: Additional winners in last Thursday's community school board elections in Manhattan were announced yesterday by the Board of Elections.

title: Mrs. King, Hobbled by Leg Cramps, Loses to Miss Niessen in French Tennis
description: PARIS, June 3Billie Jean King remembered to take her salt pills today. The French open tennis tournament, she said, is the one I want to win before I retire. She was leav ing no detail unattended.

title: Hello Rise Wins Juvenile Stakes
description: The 94th running of the Juvenile yesterday showed two 4to5 favorites on the betting board in quick succession, but neither was able to make his way to the winner's circle.

title: Chaplain's AntiJewish Booklet Distributed Within Greek Army
description: ATHENS, May 30  A ve hemently antiSemitic pamphlet that was written by a Greek armed forces chaplain, printed on the armed forces press and officially distributed to military units in Greece in no way rep resents official policy or beliefs, a highranking army spokesman has declared here.

title: State Will Award A $1Million Prize In Special Lottery
description: New York State will sweeten the pot for lottery players this summer by adding a special drawing for a $1million prize.

title: Roundup: Hickman Rated OneMan Team for Cubs
description: When Leo Durocher isn't running off to boys' camps or throwing people out of his clubhouse, he can come up with some fairly astute ob servationsabout baseball, that is.

title: In The Nation: The Fence Is Down
description: ATLANTA, June 2Gov. Les ter G. Maddox, having spied the international Communist conspiracy at work on The At lanta Journal and Constitution, has prohibited sales of the newspapers in the state capital and announced he will picket their offices on Forsyth Street. So across the way in the up stairs quarters of the American Civil Liberties Union's South ern staff, director. title: Ross to Make Met Debut In Role Replacing Nilsson
description: Elinor Ross, the American dramatic soprano, will make her Metropolitan Opera debut in the title role of Puccini's Turandot on Saturday night.

title: Congress Hears Caldera Chide U.S. Over Trade
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 President Rafael Caldera of Venezuela said at a joint meeting of Congress today that it was difficult to realize that Americans, who reached the moon, are not able to make a decisive contribution toward the development of other countries.

title: Giuseppe Ungaretti, Italian Poet, Dies
description: ROME, June 3 (AP)  Giu seppe Ungaretti, the celebrated Italian poet, died of a lung clot Monday night in Milan, where he was on holiday. The 82 yearold writer had just re turned to this country after receiving the first $10,000 Books Abroad International Prize at the University of Oklahoma.

title: Photo Show at Modern Surveys 20's
description: The art of photography, which most of us tend to take for granted as a work aday medium of visual in formation, has, like other branches of the fine arts, an esthetid as well as a techni cal and social history. In the annals of this esthetic his tory, the 1920's constituted a crucial decade.

title: N.Y.U. Appoints Social Work Dean
description: The appointment of Alvin L. Schorr, a professor at Brandeis University and a former official of the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare, as dean of New York University's Graduate School of Social Work, was announced yesterday by James M. Hester, president of the university.

title: GOVERNOR PICKS ANTICRIME CHIEF
description: Broome County Judge Robert E. Fischer has been chosen to head the statewide crime task force created by the Legislature during the last session.

title: Foes of Cambodia War Win Senate Test, 5436
description: WASHINGTON, June 3In a key test of strength on the Indochinawar issue, a biparti san coalition in the Senate demonstrated today that the coalition commands a clear majority supporting legislative restrictions on future military activities in Cambodia.

title: Prices Are Raised For Chemical Soda
description: Major chemical companies announced yesterday that they were raising their price tags on liquid caustic soda, a chemical widely used by the pulp and paper, textile, petroleum and chemical manufacturing indus tries.

title: Market Place:
description: Let's hear it for the bulls. Blond, baldish James H. Southard, a 36yearold bro ker who manages $30million for his customers in Atlanta, had been basically bearish for about two years.

title: CITIES SAID TO LAG ON LAKE CLEANUP
description: DETROIT, June 3  Federal investigators charged today that most cities and some in dustries were falling far behind their pledges to clean the water that flows into Lake Erie.

title: Sorensen Attacks 3 Rivals for the Senate
description: For the first time, one of the candidates in the campaign for the Democratic nomination for Senator from New York at tacked the other three yester day.

title: Proposal on Silver Coins
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The Federal Reserve Board proposed today to amend its rules so that banks could not count in their reserves any silver coins being held for their bullion or numismatic vaues. Comments will be received until July 13. The announcement said that permitting these coins to be included in reserves in effect subsidizes, and therefore en courages, speculation in silver bullion.

title: TICKETS TO SCHOOL WILL GET U.S. TEST
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 1 The Federal Government is planning in the fall of 1971 to establish in one or two locali ties an education voucher system under which par ents who are dissatisfied with their neighborhood schools could buy alternative forms of education for their children.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHAT WE OWE CHILDREN. The Subordina tion of Teaching to Learning. By Caleb Gattegno. 118 pages. Outerbrulgs & Dienstfrey. $4.95.

title: PRICES RISE AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
description: It's too good to be true. This comment by a broker summarized his opinion of the performance of the American Stock Exchange yesterday. Prices on the exchange made their sixth consecutive advance in the second heaviest trading of the year.

title: Observer: Finals
description: WASHINGTON, June 3Here is your examination. Good luck. Or more appropriately perhaps, better luck next year. Remem ber, the honor system is in force.

title: SEAVER IS PAYING PENALTY OF FAME
description: ATLANTA, June 3  Tom Seaver looks tired. He says he's had a sinus cold for a month.

title: SOUTH AFRICA CITES GOLD SALES TO I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (Reu ters)South Africa sold $17.5 million in gold to the Interna tional Monetary Fund during May it was reported today.

title: McLaren's Death Traced To Car's Loosened Tail
description: LONDON, June 3 (AP) Bruce McLaren of New Zealand had no chance to save himself when he was killed yesterday in a 180mileanhour crash while testing a sports car, an examination showed today.

title: 43 NOBEL LAUREATES BID NIXON QUIT WAR
description: Fortythree American win ners of Nobel prizes in science have subscribed to a letter calling on President Nixon to rise to the heroism that these times demand through a swift end to United States participa tion in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Richard K. Mellon, Financier, Is Dead
description: PITTSBURGH, June 3Rich ard King Mellon, financier and philanthropist, died today at West Penn Hospital. He entered the hospital Saturday, after feeling ill several days. His death was ascribed to a heart ailment. He was 70 years old.

title: HAROLD SMITH, 76, PAPER EXECUTIVE
description: Harold Stephen Smith, for many years a leader in the newsprint industry, died yes terday of cancer at his home, 475 Park Avenue. He was 76 years old.

title: 3 BASEBALL MEN SUPPORT SYSTEM
description: Three presidents and part owners of major league base ball clubsFrank Dale of Cin cinnati, John McHale of Mont real and Bob Reynolds of the California Angelstestified yes terday that their investments would be endangered if the reserve clause system were changed. They also said they would not have invested in baseball without the belief it was immune to Federal anti trust laws.

title: PreGrand Jury Talks Are Held With Stewart in Sawchuk Case
description: Ron Stewart, shaken and som ber in contrast to his effort less style as a hockey player, met with the Nassau County District Attorney for 50 min utes yesterday and discussed some of the circumstances that led to the death of Terry Saw chuk, his New York Ranger teammate.

title: Albany Mall Cited
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., June 3 Howard J. Samuels accused Arthur J. Goldberg and Gov ernor Rockefeller today of ir responsible liberalism that would bankrupt the state.

title: El Shafei Beats Ralston
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco, June 3 (Reuters)  Ismail El Shafei of the United Arab Re public defeated Dennis Ralston of Bakersfield, Calif., 64, 46, 26, 63, 62, in the first round of the Moroccan international tennis tournament today. Marty Riessen of Evanston, Ill., ousted Ron Holmberg of New York, 64, 63, 64.

title: City Addiction Agency's Head Resigns
description: Larry Alan Bear, who has been Commissioner of the city's Addiction Services Agency for the last year and a half, has resigned the $28,000ayear job, effective June 19.

title: Mrs. Nell Hickey Ridder, Mother of 3 Publishers
description: Mrs. Nell Hickey Ridder of 555 Park Avenue, mother of three newspaper publishers, died Tuesday in St. Luke's Hospital. She was 78 years old. Her marriage to Bernard H. Ridder, chairman of the board of Ridder Publications, ended in divorce.

title: Putting Fake Jewels Among the Real
description: It mixes beautifully with the real stuff, Pauline Tri gre said with animation. She was pointing to the chunky pin with a fringe of chains hanging from it that looked like antique silver. Miss Trigre demonstrated its versatility by plucking it from a pegboard, pinning it to the dcolletage of a man nequin who just happened to amble by, fastening it to the girl's bun and attaching it to a chain that she draped alternately around the neck and the waist.

title: Southern Baptists Bar Liberal Treatise on Bible
description: DENVER, June 3Represen tatives of the nation's 35,000 Southern Baptist churches re volted against their national leadership today and ordered it to recall a new commentary on the Book of Genesis that casts doubt on traditional views of the infallibility of the Bible.

title: PAUL GHALI, WROTE FOR CHICAGO NEWS
description: CHICAGO, June 3  The Chicago Daily News was noti fied today of the death in Paris of its editorial consultant on European affairs, Paul Ghali. Earlier in the day the 64year old Mr. Ghali, who suffered from heart disease, had been in the Paris office. He collapsed and died on his way home.

title: Seale Loses Dining Privilege For Speech Made in Jail
description: MONTVILLE, Conn., June 3 Bobby G. Seale, the Black Panther national chairman whol, is awaiting trial on a murder charge in Connecticut, has been put in administrative Segregation for making an un authorized speech at the Connecticut Correction Center here.

title: BEJART'S DANCERS TO BOW IN JANUARY
description: Maurice Bejart's company from Brussels, the Ballet of the 20th Century (Ballet du XXe Siecle), will make its United States debut as part of the Brooklyn Academy of Music's 197071 Festival of Dance. The subscription series for the festi val will be announced this month.

title: USE OF ANTIBIOTICS ON FARMS STUDIED
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) Three federally financed studies are under way on the use of antibiotics in agriculture. The studies were ordered after a report in Britain argued that the use of drugs on animals made disease in humans harder to treat.

title: New Delay in Brown Trial
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 3 Another delay was granted to day in the case of H. Rap Brown, black militant who is charged with intimidating an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Federal DistrictJudge Alvin B. Rubin granted Government attorneys until July 23 at 9 A.M. to answer motion by Mr. Brown's lawyer, William M. Kunstler, who con tends that Mr. Brown is being denied a speedy trial.

title: 2 ExNavy Ships Here Turned Over to Saigon
description: Two crews of South Viet namese sailors took com mand here yesterday of two former United States Navy ships in a transfer ceremony described by an American admiral as an example of Vietnamization of the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Banker Urges President To Hold Inflation Parley
description: Gaylord A. Freeman Jr., chairman of the First National Bank of Chicago and one of the most influential business voices in the nation's indus trial heartland, called on Presi dent Nixon yesterday to con vene a conference of business and labor leaders to hammer out national standards for in creases in wages, prices, prof its and dividends.

title: Lag in Rise of World Reserves Found Causing Liquidity Crisis
description: PARIS, June 3A civil servant from a 22nation eco nomic body has published evidence that the world's mone tary reserves are not expanding fast enough to finance the growing volume of interna tional transactionsthe con ditions for what economists term a liquidity crisis.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: REV. C. J. JESSBERGER

title: Huey Newton Denied Bail
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 3 (AP)The State Court of Ap peal denied without comment today a request for bail for Huey P. Newton, a founder of the Black Panther party, who has been held in the 1967 shooting of an Oakland police man. His attorney asked bail Monday. The 28yearold Pan ther's manslaughter conviction was set aside by the appellate court last Friday. The state is expected to appeal the decision setting he conviction aside.

title: Thieves Ransack Rooms Of Peruvian Soccer Team
description: LEON, Mexico, June 3 (Reu ters)Thieves have ransacked the quarters of the Peruvian soccer team at the Mitla Hotel here, taking thousands of dol lars worth of television, radio and recording sets and clothing the players bought in the Unit ed States before the World Cup competition.

title: CARGO ATTRIBUTES DEFEAT TO UNREST
description: SANTA FE, N.M., June 3 Gov. David F. Cargo today blamed student unrest for his defeat yesterday in the Republi can primary for the United States Senate nomina tion.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: I must express first my un qualified respect for the free dom of expression of The Times and its right to discuss the internal problems of the Domin ican Republic.

title: Dissidents Confront Rockefeller After Speech to Museum Group
description: An address to the American Association of Museums con vention yesterday brought Gov ernor Rockefeller a standing ovation  and a confrontation afterwards by a group of dis sident artists.

title: Ribicoff Expected to Back Duffey in Connecticut Race
description: HARTFORD, June 3In the next few days Senator Abraham Ribicoff is expected to endorse the Rev. Joseph Duffey for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator from Connecticut.

title: 830 Receive Degrees From Naval Academy
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June (AP)  With the traditional cheer of Beat Army and the blizzard of white caps, the United States Naval Academy graduated 830 men today.

title: Thwarted Backers Of Rock Fete Find Haven in Catskills
description: Forced by local opposition to abandon plans for a Woodstock type of rock concert later this month, a group of promoters has turned instead to creating a permanent youth colony in the Catskills.

title: Mrs. Horace Dodge Dies at 103; Among World's Richest Women
description: GROSSE POINTE FARMS, Mich., June 3 Mrs. Anna Thompson Dodge, widow of Horace E. Dodge, the automo tive pioneer, and one of the richest women in the world, died last night at her home, Rose Terrace. She was 103 years old and had been con fined to a wheelchair for seven years.

title: Jury Decides on Death Penalty For Man in Housewife's Murder
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June (AP)A Superior Court jury recommended tonight that Louis Cofone be sentenced to death for firstdegree murder in the strangulation of a Wilton housewife in a robbery in Janu ary.

title: 82% in Gallup Poll Opposed To Student Strikes as Protests
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 3 Eightytwo per cent of the na tion's adults oppose student strikes as a way to protest the way things are run in this country, the Gallup Poll said today.

title: Rights Aide in Houston Charges Threats to Victims of Job Bias
description: HOUSTON, June 3A Hous ton Urban League official told the Equal Employment Oppor tunity Commission today that she had been forced to repress a prepared statement in which she planned to cite specific in stances of job discrimination.

title: 3 Die in Jersey Collision
description: UNION TOWNSHIP, N. J., June 3 (AP)Three persons were killed early today when two cars collided on an isolated stretch of State Highway 72, which runs through this Ocean County community. The vic tims were identified as James Waldrop, 24 years old, of Kan sas City, Mo., and Raymond Magorgey, 51, and his wife Muriel.

title: CONSUMER GROUP REBUFFED BY F.T.C.
