description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) Turning aside objections by a consumer group and by two of its own members, the Fed eral Trade Commission today accepted the Campbell Soup Company's promise to remove the marbles from its soup ad vertisements.

title: TIMES OFFERS GUILD RAISE LIKE PRINTERS'
description: The New York Times offered a money package to the News paper Guild yesterday similar to the one in a tentative agree ment with the typographical union.

title: Sports of The Times
description: B & L Wines and Liquors is doing fine. It doesn't satisfy any urge in me to see my name up in lights, said Willis Reed. B & L does a community busi ness in Harlem, it did well before I bought it, it does a little better now. I'm being realistic, there's no need to call Willis Reed's Liquor Store. When I'm gone and Joe Doe is playing center for the Knicks, I'm going to have something that's still a business, not based on my name, but based on its product, its service, and because it's the nearest place around to get a bottle of gin.

title: Inflation and Crime Fuel Public Housing Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, June 3In cities across the country, thousands of families are on the waiting lists for public housing. Many housing au thorities are on the verge of bankruptcy.

title: WCBSTV Backs Ottinger
description: Representative Richard L. Ot linger was endorsed by station WCBSTV last night for the Democratic nomination for Sen ator. The station said that his three terms in the House of Representatives have been marked by activism, innovation and effectiveness. The station praised Mr. Ottinger for his ability to lead people as well as represent them.

title: Senate Vote on Dole Amendment
Opponents of Electoral College See a Gain in Wallace's Victory
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The victory of George C. Wallace in the Alabama primary was publicly discounted today by disappointed Republicans and privately savored by unsympa thetic Democrats in the capital.

title: 2,000 French Students Drive Police Off Grenoble Campus
description: GRENOBLE, France, June 3 (AP)  Some 2,000 French students throwing firebombs and stones tonight forced a large force of policemen off the Grenoble University campus and set up barricades to pre vent the police from returning.

title: Letchworth Gets Hospital
description: THIEL'S, N. Y., June 3A 162bed medicialsurgical facil ity for patients and employes, of Letchworth Village, a cen ter for the mentally retarded, was dedicated here today. The $5.5million facility will be known as the Harry C. Storrs MedicalSurgical Building named in honor of the late Dr. Storrs, who was director of Letchworth Village from 1937 to 1956.

title: BRAZIL 41 VICTOR IN WORLD SOCCER
description: MEXICO CITY, June 3 (UPI) Brazil, one of the leading contenders in the World Cup soccer championship, trounced Czechoslovakia today, 41, but West Germany, a finalist in 1966, was given a fright before it defeated Morocco, 21.

title: Dunlop Tire to Pay $22,500 For Violating Safety Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) The Dunlop Tire and Rubber Corporation has agreed to pay the Government $22,500 for violating tire safety standards, the Department of Transporta tion said today.

title: All Bessie Smith's 78's Due in LP Series
description: The entire recorded work of Bessie Smith, the great blues singer of the 1920's, will be reissued in a series of five twodisk LP sets.

title: Police Unit Backs Governor
description: The Police Conference of New York has endorsed Gov ernor Rockefeller and Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson for re election. The Police Conference of New York is the parent organization for all the branches of the Police Benev olent Association in New York State.

title: PEACE CORPS GROUP PETITIONS FOR PEACE
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  Protests within the Peace Corps against the expanded fighting in Southeast Asia have been brought home to Joseph H. Blatchford, the director, in antiwar petitions signed by a few hundred members on two continents.

title: VOTING AGE PLAN OPPOSED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The House Rules Committee was urged today to spare the Su preme Court an impossible di lemma by permitting the House to strike from the voting rights bill a rider lowering the voting age to 18.

title: Nijinsky's Widow Misses Race
description: LONDON, June 3 (Reuters) Mrs. Romola Nijinsky, widow of the celebrated ballet dancet after whom the Epsom Derby winner was named, missed see ing the colt's triumph.

title: 2 Syndicates Submit Identical Stock Bids
description: Two underwriting syndi cates submitted identical bids yesterday afternoon for 1.2 million shares of Amer ican Natural Gas Company common stock, but the tie was broken in a runoff when one group raised its bid while the other stood pat.

title: THREATS IN PARIS CANCEL WAR FILM
description: PARIS, June 3Anonymous phone calls threatening bomb ings as well as protests from Rightist organizations led to the cancellation tonight of the scheduled opening in three movie houses here of The Bat tle of Algiers, a prizewinning film based on the FrenchAl gerian war.

title: Rise in Canadian Dollar Not Affecting Air Fares
description: MONTREAL, June 3 (Cana dian Press)Air Canada and Eastern Air Lines are con tinuing to charge the same rates they charged before the Canadian dollar was un pegged during the weekend.

title: Mistrial Ordered in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, June 3 (UPI)Al Federal judge ruled today that one of 11 defendants charged with ransacking a Chicago Se lective Service office and burn ing its records was mentally incompetent to stand trial at this time. United States Dis trict Judge Edwin A. Robson ordered a mistrial for Edward; Hoffmans and directed that he be sent to a mental institution for treatment.

title: Miss Brandt, C. A. Cornelius Wed in Suburbs
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., June 3Miss CherylLynne Brandt and George Andrew Cornelius were married to day in the First Congrega tional Church by the Rev. Merton E. Libby.

title: Equity on Strikes
description: The Supreme Court has corrected an injustice by upholding the right of Federal judges to stop strikes called in violation of nostrike contracts. There never was much discernible merit to the Court's 1962 deci sion that the acknowledged power of judges enforce labormanagement contracts did not extend to the issuance of injunctions against walkouts in cases where both sides had voluntarily agreed to submit all disputes to binding arbitration.

title: Companies Change Names
description: The Hotel Corporation of America changed its name yes terday to the Sonesta Interna tional Hotels Corporation. In terstate Department Stores changed its name to Interstate Stores, Inc.

title: HYNDMAN SUBDUES TWO LINKS RIVALS
description: NEWCASTLE, Northern Ire land, June 3 (AP)Bill Hynd man of Huntington Valley, Pa., and Michael Bonallack of Eng land, the defending champion, survived strenuous matchplay battles today in the British Amateur golf championship.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JUNE 4, 1970

title: JURY IS SELECTED TO TRY ADDONIZIO
description: TRENTON, N. J., June 3A jury of seven men and five women was chosen today for the Federal Court trial of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio and seven other defendants charged with the extortion of $253,000 from Constrad, Inc., an engineering concern that built sewers for Newark.

title: Kent Votes Flag Law
description: KENT, Ohio, June 3 (UPI) An ordinance prohibiting the burning or desecration of Amer ican and Ohio flags was passed yesterday by the City Council. A student at Kent State Uni versity here burned an Ameri can flag May 4, the day four students at the university were shot and killed by Ohio Na tional Guardsmen. Charges against the youth were dropped after officials discovered there was no city law against the action. The new law, effective immediately, provides for a maximum penalty of one year in jail and a $1,000 fine. students at the university were shot and killed by Ohio Na tional Guardsmen. Charges against the youth were dropped after officials discovered there was no city law against the action. The new law, effective immediately, provides for a maximum penalty of one year in jail and a $1,000 fine.

title: PRESIDENT TO MEET WITH TEXTILE MEN
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) President Nixon will meet Monday with leaders of the American textile and apparel industries to discuss problems caused by increasing imports.

title: Plimpton Resigning as President of Amherst in 1971
description: Dr. Calvin H. Plimpton, the 13th president of Amherst Col lege, has announced his resig nation effective at the end of the 1971 school year.

title: HARPER DISPUTE CAUSES A PROTEST
description: Most of the toplevel edi torial staff of Harper & Row's trade division stayed away from their jobs yesterday in A oneday protest against the ex clusion of three women editors from a forthcoming sales con ference.

title: Party Chiefs in Congress Offer Shriver a New Role
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The Democratic. Congressional lead ership publicly asked Sargent Shriver today to head a new party council that would op erate outside existing organiza tions to revive popular support for the party and its candidates.

title: Split Hoof Imperils Racing Career of Lindy's Pride
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 3 Is Lindy's Pride finished?

title: Opposing Soviet Repression
description: For the past several years the Soviet secret police have been applying salami tactics against opposi tion elements. In Stalin's time, all the dissenters might have been arrested in one swoop and finished off accordance with the precedent set in the 1930's.

title: MINORITIES' ROLE IN SCHOOLS CITED
description: The director of a Puerto Rican self  help organization charged yesterday that the city's Board of Education had developed a failsafe method of excluding Puerto Ricans from professional positions in the New York Pub lic School system.

title: 2 JOIN CITY BALLET ON PERMANENT BASIS
description: Helgi Tomasson, formerly with the Harkness Ballet, and Peter Martins, who has just left the Royal Danish Ballet, have joined the New York City Bal let as permanent members.

title: 350 in Hospital Evacuated As Nearby Fire Threatens
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., June 3 About 350 patients at the Nassau County Medical Center were evacuated from three wings of the 627bed hospital today when a fire of undeter mined cause broke out nearby.

title: ALBERT LAMORISSE DIES IN AIR CRASH
description: PARIS, June 3  Albert Lamorisse, film writer and pro ducer who won International renown for his use of camera work from the air in several prizewinning films, died yes terday in an air crash near Teheran, according to word re ceived here today. Mr. Lamo risse, creator of The Red Bal loon and White Mane, was 48 years old.

title: Southern Strategies ...
description: George Wallace's nomination for the governorship of Alabama confronts President Nixon with some extremely hard choices. By placing Mr. Wallace in a favorable position to run for President again in 1972, it presents the Nixon strategists with three alterna tives, none of them as attractive as dealing with a South bereft of its ablest demagogue.

title: A.C.L.U. COMES OUT AGAINST THE WAR
description: The American Civil Liberties Union has adopted a resolution to work for the immediate termination of the war in Southeast Asia in what was termed a major departure from the organization's tradi tional role as a defender of in dividual rights.

title: Adrian Doyle, Son of the Writer, Dies
description: GENEVA, June 3  Adrian Conan Doyle, the only surviving son of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, the creator of Sherlock Holmes, died here :today of a heart attack. He was 59 years old.

title: Rockefeller Praises Revenue Sharing
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., June 3Governor Rockefeller called the revenuesharing plan passed by the 1970 Legislature the single greatest fiscal advance in the history of rela tions between the state and local government.

title: Mrs. Amory Is Remarried
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., June 3Mrs. Louise Lionberger Amory of Boston and Boca Grande, Fla., widow of Roger Amory, a banker, was mar ried here today to I. Sheldon Tilney of Llewellyn Park and Palm Beach, Fla. The Ven erable Trevor Thomas per formed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Holy Innocents.

title: Stage: Whispers on the Wind Opens
description: A gentle musical is some thing of a rarity, and, yet, gentleness is the pervading quality of Whispers on the Wind, which opened last night at the Theater de Lys.

title: President Argues Time Is on His Side
description: WASHINGTON, June 3The unprecedented success that President Nixon proclaimed to night for the American military venture into Cambodia is not subject to statistical proof or challenge. For his calculations dealt essentially not with what has happened but with what will result in the future: fewer casualties for American troops, more training time for South Vietnam ese troops and firmer understand ing of Mr. Nixon's resolve in the mind of the enemy.

title: Sonny and Cher Singing Variety Of Rock Tunes
description: Sonny and Cher, the hus bandandwife singing team, are making their first regular New York appearance through .Tune 13 at the Empire Room of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: United Gas Rights Issue
description: TULSA, June 3 (UPI)Rights to subscribe to 4 million shares of common stock of United Gas. Inc., were issued to Penn zoil United, Inc., stockholders of record today. Subscription price is $13 a share. United is the new company formed to acquire Pennzoil United's na tural gas distribution proper ties in Texas, Louisiana and Mississippi in compliance with an S.E.C. order issued under the Public Utility Holding Com pany Act. The rights expire June 23. Eight rights will be needed for a common share.

title: Armstrong Tells Russian Scientists U.S. and Soviet Should Cooperate in Space Projects
description: MOSCOW, June 3Neil A. Armstrong, the first man to walk on the moon, obviously pleased an audience of several hundred Soviet scientists today by advocating closer United StatesSoviet cooperation in space exploration and imply ing that the space programs of the two nations would eventu ally converge.

title: S. S. Kresge Co. Reports Sales Gain for 4 Weeks
description: The S. S. Kresge Company, Detroit, reported yesterday an 18.1 per cent gain in sales for the four weeks ended May 27 and a 20 per cent gain for the 17week period.

title: Wallace Says Nixon Fails To Keep School Pledges
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 3  George C. Wallace, buoyed by his narrow, whitebacklash victory yesterday in a runoff primary for Governor, chal lenged President Nixon today to fulfill campaign promises to the South or answer to the wrath of Mr. Wallace's Ala bama movement.

title: OIL MEN TESTIFY AGAINST A TARIFF
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)  Opponents of the Adminis tration's proposed tariff system for oil imports brought their case before another Congres sional group today.

title: Miss Neilson To Be Bride Of Classmate
description: DORSET, Vt., June 3Mr. and Mrs. Louis Neilson Jr., formerly of Unionville, Pa., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Madeline Borland Neilson, to Charles E. Rockwell Jr., son of Mr. Rockwell of Smith town, L. I., and Mrs. E. Mon roe O'Flyn of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Hearing on Guard Delayed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 3 (UPI)  A hearing was post poned today until June 11 in a suit by the American Civil Lib erties Union charging Adjutant General S. T. Del Corso of Ohio with using state funds to coerce National Guardsmen into sup porting the Indochina war. The suit also said that General Del Corso, commander of the Ohio National Guard, used state per sonnel to get the guardsmen to line up behind President Nixon and his policy in Vietnam.

title: 2,500 SURVIVORS SIGHTED IN PERU
description: LIMA, Peru, June 3The Peruvian Air Force found 2,500 survivors of the former 20,000 residents of the city of Yungay clinging to a mountainside cemetery this afternoon.

title: Reports of Inclement Weather Spur Grain and Soybean Prices
description: Inclement weather in the na tion's agricultural areas sent grains and soybeans futures prices up yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade.

title: Muskie Hints Slogan in '72 May Be the Whole Society
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, in a speech today outlining the political path to victory for Democrats this November, struck what may be his own Presidential campaign slogan in 1972the whole society.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE IN A LATE RALLY
description: The stock market, continuing to amaze and befuddle its fol lowers, staged a strong rally yesterday afternoon with petroleum and the battered con glomerate issues posting some of the best gains.

title: 4 Killed in Train Derailment
description: OLUSTEE, Okla., June 3 (AP)  Four crew members of a freight train were killed early today when the train derailed near this southwestern Okla homa community.

title: Laird Says U.S. Will Trim Armed Forces by a Million
description: COLORARO SPRINGS, June 3 (UPI)The United States will further reduce its military manpower and call on its allies to take a larger role in world affairs, Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird said today.

title: A.E.C. Fund Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill authorizing the appropria tion of $2.29billion to the Atomic Energy Commission in the fiscal year starting July 1. It was $7.7million higher than the amount requested by the Administration.

title: Democratic Party Workers Meet With Mrs. Goldberg
description: The Democrats invited 50 women party workers yesterday to meet Mrs. Arthur J. Gold berg, the wife of the organiza tion's gubernatorial candidate. Two hundred showed up and in a short time most of them were calling the candidate's wife Dorothy.

title: Rothschilds To Have Dances By Michael Kidd
description: Michael Kidd, the Broad way and Hollywood choreog rapherdirector, has agreed to create the choreography for The Rothschilds, the $850,000 musical based on Frederic Morton's best selling biography of the legendary banking family.

title: Policeman Describes Panther Inquiry
description: The Black Panther party has been classified as hostilely subversive by the New York City Police Department, which has been investigating the party since its beginning, a police sergeant testified yesterday.

title: CHARLOTTE GOLF IS PREP FOR OPEN
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 3 The pro golf stop on the tour this week, the $150,000 Kem per open starting tomorrow, has special meaning for many.

title: 12 Councilmen Offer a Plan With Lower Rent Rises
description: A dozen City Councilmen at tacked Mayor Lindsay's pro posed revisions of rent control yesterday as too hard on ten ants and put forth their own plan calling for smaller rent increases for fewer residents.

title: 40 Seoul Legislators Battle in a FreeforAll
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 3About 40 legislators fought in a freeforall in the Na tional Assembly today during a debate on the Government's seizure yesterday of an op position newspaper.

title: Executive Changes
description: Edward L. Palmer, executive vice president of the First National City Bank, has been elected a director of the Corning Glass Works. Charles D. LaFollette and Howard C. Sheperd resigned as directors and were elected directors emeritus.

title: Time Magazine Not Involved In F.T.C. Plaint, Luce Says
description: Time, the weekly news maga zine, is not involved in a recent complaint by the Federal Trade Commission regarding maga zine subscription selling prac tices, Henry Luce 3d, the magazine's publisher, said yes terday.

title: SAVINGS BONDS EBB 18TH MONTH IN ROW
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)  Savings bond redemptions exceeded sales by $11million in May, the 18th consecutive month of net decline, the Treasury Department reported today.

title: NIJINSKY SCORES IN $233,920 DERBY
description: EPSOM, England, June 3 (UPI)Unbeaten Nijinsky gave his owner, Charles Engelhard of Far Hills, N. J., his first vic tory in the Epsom Derby today by outclassing 10 rivals to win the $233,920 1mile classic.

title: LAOTIAN CHALLENGES ASSEMBLY ON POLICY
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  Pre mier Souvanna Phouma chal lenged the National Assembly today to vote a motion of cen sure leading to a Cabinet crisis if it was so dissatisfied with his neutralist policy that it wanted a different government.

title: Lutz and Gorman Victors In Tennis; Seewagen Beaten
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 3 (AP)  Bob Lutz of Los Angeles struggled to a 97, 810, 63 victory over an un heralded Australian, Colin Dib ley, today and gained the quar terfinals of the North of Eng land tennis championship.

title: City in New Drive to Seal Offensive Apartment Incinerators
description: The city tried a new ma neuver yesterday in its often frustrated battle against air pol lution from apartment house in cinerators.

title: Laver Defeats Rosewall In Rawlings Tennis Final
description: ST. LOUIS, June 3 (UPI) Rod Laver beat Ken Rose wall, an Australian country man, tonight to win the $30,000 Rawlings tennis clas sic.

title: BROTHER OF NIXON AND ONASSIS IN DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP) F. Donald Nixon, younger brother of the President, re cently made a substantial com mercial sale to Aristotle Onas sis, the Greek shipping tycoon, it was learned today.

title: Miss Carola Teegen Engaged To Prof. Guy Walton of N.Y.U.
description: Miss Carola Teegen, who is on the socialwork staff of the New York Hospital, and Guy Edward Walton, an as sistant professor of fine arts at New York University, plan to be married here in September.

title: U.S. Importers Attack SellingPrice System
description: The American Importers Association opened a cam paign yesterday to do away with the American Selling Price system of customs valu ation, calling it a tricky tariffboosting protectionist device.

title: College Elects President
description: MOUNT CARROLL, III., June 3 (AP)Dr. Robert Spencer Long, 42 years old, dean of Roger Williams College in Bristol, R. I., was elected today as 10th president of Shimer College. He will assume his new duties immediately as successor to Milburn P. Akers, president since 1968, who was killed in an automobiletruck collision May 27.

title: Pope Honors John XXIII
description: ROME, June 3 (AP)Pope Paul VI celebrated a mass today on the seventh anniversary of the death of his predecessor, John XXIII.

title: The Joys of Growing Herbsand Using Them With Abandon
description: EASTON, Pa.It was one of those blissful, cloudless, warm and sunny days and, sitting on a stone terrace dining on an omelet aux fines herbes and sipping a wellchilled Meursault, someone remarked that it was almost like being in Europe. Far below at the foot of a grassy slope was the Dela ware River, which reminded someone of the Arno, and June Dunbar recalled a dish that had impressed her mightily in Italy. of the Arno, and June Dunbar recalled a dish that had impressed her mightily in Italy.

title: ROSEWALL FACES EMERSON TONIGHT
description: In the old days, the pro tennis players piled into a sta tion wagon or beatup Thunder bird and drove from Dubuque to Des Moines for their one night stands. It was a nomadic, lonely existence, but the pros were outcasts seeking respecta bility in their snort.

title: Sports of The Times
description: They just took away my best play, said Joe Kapp with, a disarming grin. The quarterback of the Minnesota Vikings laughs a lot off the field when he turns on the charm of his electrifying per sonality. On the field, though, he generates electricity of a different sort as a grim, tough competitor with a lust for bodily contact that is uncharacteristic of quar terbacks. He enjoys running into or over tacklers.

title: Negro Leader in Syracuse Gets Pentagon Rights Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  Frank Render 2d, of Syra cuse, an educational and civil leader, was chosen by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird to day to become Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Civil Rights.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 3, 1970

title: Siamese Twins Improve
description: ATLANTA, June 4 (UPI) Angie and Tony Horton, Sia mese twins born three months ago and successfully separated yesterday in a threeandahalf hour operation, were reported in satisfactory condition to day. They had been joined at the base of the spine.

title: State G.O.P. Opens Drive With a $1,000,000 Dinner
description: Governor Rockefeller was the head cheerleader last night as the Republican party offi cially opened its 1970 cam paign at the largest and most lucrative fundraising dinner in its history.

title: Roundup: Andrews Takes Fixed Position at Second
description: Mike Andrews, who con tinued his torrid batting streak yesterday, appears too tall and gangly for a second baseman. But second base men come in all sizes; Jackie Robinson was a muscular footballplayer type, while Bobby Richardson was com paratively small.

title: Tonga's 150 Polynesian Islands Now Independent
description: NUKUALOFA, Tonga, June 4  This Polynesian monarchy, which has been a British pro tectorate for 70 years, was proclaimed an independent na tion today by its king, Taufa'ahau Tupou IV.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW A DECLINE
description: The American Stock Ex change ended in the minus col umn yesterday for the first time in seven sessions as profit taking in the last two hours of trading erased most of the ear lier gains.

title: Fishing Report
description: AREA AJohnny Falkie wicz of Surf City reports very little action along the shore. A few small striped bass and king fish are being taken from the surf, and the Atlantic mackerel have left. Local anglers are doing well on small bluefish in bay waters, usually with plugs, at dawn and dusk. Capt. El wood Colvin, a saltwater fly rod enthusiast of Seaside Park, says that most of the stripers appear to have moved out of Barnegat Bay. Light tackle anglers are doing well with 2 to 3pound blues in the bay and blowfish are present in great numbers. Crabbing is also excellent in the bay. Ken's Landing at Point Pleasant reports black fish (tautog) and a few sea bass being taken offshore. Charter boats are enjoying for blues.

title: Stock Exchanges Planning to Merge Service Functions
description: The New York and Ameri can Stock Exchanges dis closed plans yesterday for a farreaching program to con solidate many key service and computer operations in central facilities.

title: HYNDMAN TAKES 2 MORE MATCHES
description: NEWCASTLE, Northern Ire land, June 4 (AP)Bill Hynd man of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., was the Only American to gain the quarterfinals of the Brit ish Amateur golf championship today, winning two extrahole matches on the 6,928yard, par 71 Royal County Down course.

title: TV: Reaction to Nixon Speech Varies
description: Regular Commentators and Guests Divided the reaction of television commentators and invited studio guests to President Nixon's speech Wednesday evening on the Indochina war ranged from succinct skepti cism, sharp criticism and a degree of support to a broad conclusion that not much news had come from the White House.

title: Times Reporter Is Threatened With Contempt by U.S. Judge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 4 Earl Caldwell, a reporter for The New York Times, was or dered today to appear before United States District Judge Al fonso J. Zirpoli to show cause why he should not be held in contempt.

title: Fly Klipper Wins Twice At Jersey Horse Show
description: CHERRY HILL; N. J., June Peggy Baj's Fly Klipper from Philadelphia was the Only dou ble winner tonight as the three clay West Jersey Hospital horse show got under way at Garden State Park.

title: Foreign Affairs: Suez and the Soviets
description: MOSCOWThree years after the Six Day War began, Mos cow's Middle East strategy is perhaps no longer based only on rearming the Arabs so they can overcome Israel while the Soviet Union and the United States warn each other to stay away. Indeed, Russia may be preparing deliberately to par ticipate in a limited conflict, reckoning it can get away with this at little risk.

title: PRESIDENT CREATES A COUNCIL ON CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP) President Nixon created to day a National Council on Organized Crime to coordinate strategic Federal planning.

title: CALIFORNIA ENDS A BOND BLACKOUT
Miller Is Appointed Head Of Salvation Army Here
description: Brig. Andrew S. Miller yes terday was named head of the Salvation Army's 10county Greater New York Unified Com mand.

title: L. SETON LINDSAY, 91, NEW YORK LIFE AIDE
description: L. Seton Lindsay, a former vice president of the New York Life Insurance Company, died Wednesday in Concord, N.H. He was 91 years old and lived in Bristol, N.H., and formerly in Islip, L.I., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Menasha Skulnik, Yiddish Star And a Broadway Success, Dies
description: Menasha Skulnik, the theatri cal star of two worldsYid dish comedy and the Broadway stagedied yesterday at Beth Israel Hospital after a short ill ness. He was 78 years old and lived at 535 East 86th Street.

title: HOSPITAL WAGES RISING SHARPLY
description: Average wage gains of hos pital workers in New York City have outpaced those of most other workers in recent years, according to a survey by the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Japan to Voluntarily Curb Textiles to United States
description: GIFU, Japan, June 4 (AP) Japan: will have to voluntarily restrict synthetic and woolen textile shipments to the United States on a provisional basis, Kiichi Miyazawa, International Trade and Industry Minister, said today.

title: Vietnamese Reds, in Paris, Denounce Nixon's Address
description: PARIS, June 4The Viet namese Communist delegates, speaking at today's session of the Vietnam peace talks, de nounced President Nixon's address last night on Cambo dia and expressed satisfaction at the opposition in the United States to his Asian policies.

title: 4 Police Accused Of Roles in Bribe To Free a Suspect
description: The Police Department has brought charges against two Manhattan patrolmen, a ser geant and a lieutenant. It acted after a person arrested on a charge of firstdegree robbery was allegedly released in re. turn for a $90 bribe.

title: U.S. Takes Jumping Event In Lucerne Horse Show
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, June 4 (UPI)  The American team won the Prix des Nations in the show jumping event today at the Lucerne equestrian com petition.

title: ISADORE SILVERMAN
description: Isadore Silverman, who was in the real estate business here for 50 years, died Tuesday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 1050 Fifth Avenue.

title: Department Store Sales Dip
description: WASHINGTON, June 4The Department Of Commerce re ported today that department store sales for the latest week, ended May 30, were an esti mated $627million, slightly lower than the $628million sales for the corresponding week last year.

title: GEROLD M. LAUCK, 78, AYER VICE PRESIDENT
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 4 Gerold M. Lauck, who retired in 1951 as executive vice presi dent of N. W. Ayer & Son, Inc., the advertising concern, died to day in Princeton Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at Lawrenceville Road.

title: G.I.'s at Tayninh Just Kids and Crazy to a 41YearOld Maid
description: TAYNINH, South Vietnam, May 30Nguyen Thi Khao is 41 years old and the American soldiers that she works for are the age of her oldest children.

title: U.S. Investigating Complaint That Lower East Side School Districting Fosters Segregation
description: The Office of Civil Rights of the Department of Health, Edu cation and Welfare is investi gating a complaint by Puerto Rican parents on the Lower East Side that the Board of Education's redistricting plan for Manhattan schools fosters segregation.

title: Anne C. Foster Wed at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 4Miss Anne Colvin Foster was married this afternoon to Lieut. Paul David Terry Jr., U.S.A., in the Cadet Chapel. The Rev. James D. Ford, a civilian chaplain at the acad emy, performed the Protes tant ceremony.

title: COACH LINES GROUP BIDS FOR DIRECTORS
description: The Committee for Distribu tion of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., submitted to stock holders yesterday a formal proxy statement calling for election of its 10member slate of directors.

title: Barbra Streisand's 5Story Compromise
description: Barbra Streisand, the househater, the art nouveau, art deco and cranberry glass collector, the German Expressionist admirer, the cupcake baker and decor maker, looked serious, spoke softly. and moved swiftly through her unfurnished town house at 49 East 80th Street the other night.

title: Letter About Army Costs a Recruiter His Air Force Post
description: MERIDEN, Conn., June 4 (AP)An Air Force recruiting sergeant who described the Air Force as virtually noncombat ant and called Army draftees cannon fodder has been re lieved of his duties here.

title: Article 4  No Title
Powers Reports Progress In PrintersL.I. Press Talks
description: Bertram A. Powers, president of Typographical Union No. 6, reported yesterday that prog ress had been made in contract negotiations with The Long Is land Press. Another bargaining session has been scheduled tentatively for today, he said.

title: Driver Stalemate Continues
description: CHICAGO, June 4 (AP)A 55day strike and lockout of Chicago truck drivers remained stalemated today and Federal mediators said no meetings were scheduled with either em ployers or union negotiators.

title: Branch McCracken Dies
description: Branch (Big Bear) Mc Cracken, who led the Indiana University basketball team to two national titles during his 24 years as coach, died yes terday at the age of 61. His obituary appears on Page 35.

title: ROTZ IS ASSIGNED TO HIGH ECHELON
description: Although at does not com pare to last year's running, when previously undefeated Majestic Prince and Arts and Letters held the public interest, this year's Belmont Stakes is attracting more than mild at eention. The main reason is the presence in the field of Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs's Personality and High Echelon.

title: Advertising: Agency Job Market Tightens
description: Advertising budget cut backs and slow client pay ments have led to agency personnel parings, a tight job market and a stop to the escalation of creative sal aries. At least that's what neonle close to the scene say.

title: Ky Gets Royal Welcome in Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 4Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam, wel comed like a visiting potentate, arrived today for a conference with the new Cambodian lead ers to resolve the delicate ques tion of Saigon's military role in this embattled country.

title: Addonizio's Day: Hospital, Trial and Campaign
description: NEWARK, June 4  It was a busy day today for Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio, who is running for a third fouryear term under unusual circumstances.

title: Market Place:
description: With the cost of money at nearrecord levels, one might assume that the commercial banks could improve their earnings quarterbyquarter just by picking and choosing among prime borrowers.

title: Downed Jet, Cairo Says
description: CAIRO, June 4 (AP)The Egyptian military command an nounced that an Israeli Sky hawk jet was downed today by antiaircraft fire and fell on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal.

title: Reserve Extendsrolicy Of Slight Credit Easing
NINE HONORED HERE BY JEWISH SEMINARY
description: The Jewish Theological Sem inary of America presented its annual awards last night at the New York Hilton Hotel to nine persons active in business, civic, cultural, educational and communal affairs.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE ROSE 4.4% IN WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Freight traffic of United States railroads in the week ended May 30 was reported above the comparable period of last year.

title: V.F.W. THREATENS TO SHIFT MEETING
description: The national commander of the Veterans of Foreign Wars said yesterday that he would urge the group's national coun cil to rescind its selection of New York City as the site of its 1972 convention because the Mayor is doing a disservice to American youth by encour aging resistance to the draft.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Curtis
description: Miss Christina Curtis and William Lee McHenry will be married next month.

title: Music: Timpani Recital
description: Solo timpani recitals, or recitals of chamber music with timpani, are rare in deed, but there's no reason they shouldn't work. With five timpani of different sizes in front of a performer, a considerable amount of va riety is available.

title: Hijacker's Discontent Is Traced To the Loss of His Job in 1963
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 4 (AP) Arthur G. Barkley's troubles apparently began in 1963, when he lost his job as a salesman driver for the Continental Bak ing Company in Phoenix.

title: School Board Winners On West Side Announced
description: The Board of Elections an nounced additional winners yesterday in the community school board elections in Man hattan.

title: Gen. Clifton B. Cates, ExMarine Chief, 76, Dies
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 4 (AP).  Gen. Clifton B. Cates, Commandant of the Marine Corps from 1948 to 1952, died in the Naval Hospital here to day after a long illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Good Time to Be Alive, Nixon Tells Scholars
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP) President Nixon today told a group of 119 high school seniors, chosen by a commis sion as 1970 Presidential Scholars, that despite fears turmoil and uncertainty, this was a fortunate time to be alive.

title: Oil Tariff Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) Tariffs usually are enacted to protect domestic prices, but the proposed oil import tariff would do just the opposite, Representative Wayne N. As pinall, Democrat of Colorado, contended today.

title: JUDICIARY PANEL IS EXPANDED TO 24
description: The Mayor's Committee on the Judiciary, which screens and recommends candidates for judgeships, was expanded yesterday from 15 to 24 mem bers, including, for the first time, nonlawyers.

title: SEAVER LOSES 5TH IN LAST 6 STARTS
description: ATLANTA, June 4  Tom Seaver struck out his boyhood idol, Henry Aaron, tonight, but while he was doing it, he lost his temper and the ball game, in that order.

title: DR. SCHACHT DIES; NAZIS' ECONOMIST
description: MUNICH, West Germany, June 4 (Reuters)  Dr. Hjalmar H. G. Schacht, who guided Hitler's economic policies, in early years, died today in a Munich hospital. He was 93 years old.

title: BROKERAGE FIRMS TO INSURE PUBLIC AGAINST FAILURES
description: Most of the nation's inves tors would be protected against losses in the event of brokerage house failures by a private in surance corporation that the securities industry has decided to establish in a rare example of industrywide cooperation.

title: Dr. Clarence B. Farrar, 96, Dies; Edited Journal of Psychiatry
description: Dr. Clarence B. Farrar, for 34 years editor of The Ameri can Journal of Psychiatry, who built the magazine into one of the leading periodicals in medi cine, died Wednesday at his home in Toronto. He was 96 years old.

title: Soviet Biologist, Tested Anew, To Be Held Month for Checkup
description: MOSCOW, June 4  Soviet authorities have ordered Zhores A. Medvedev, a biologist, de tained for at least a month for psychiatric examinations, reli able sources said tonight.

title: Jersey Agency Employs Cahill's Son for Summer
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J., June 4 (AP)John P. Cahill, the 19 yearold son of Gov. William T. Cahill, arrested twice this year on marijuana charges, has been hired by a state agency for the summer.

title: 114 Letters Mailed To GI., Now Dead, Never Reached Hirn
description: VERMILION, Ohio, June 4 (UPI)An investigation began today after parents of a Viet nam war casualty learned that 114 letters mailed to their son in a military hospital were never delivered.

title: 11 PROFESSORS BID AGNEW CURB TONE
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Eleven University of Minnesota professors told Vice President Agnew today that his public rhetoric was driving moderates into the arms of extremists.

title: Springfield, Mass., Aided
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., June 4 (AP)  Springfield's $2  million Model Cities proposal won ap proval today from the Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development, Represent ative Edward P. Boland, Demo crat of Massachusetts, reported. The grant will finance the first year of a demonstration proj ect on raising neighborhood standards. The program will in clude rehabilitation of 125 houses and construction of 100 housing units.

title: Conflict and Change Tear Italy; Daily Life Is Verging on Chaos
description: ROME, June 4Italy, never a dull country, has seemed in recent days to verge on the chaotic.

title: For Art, 5th Ave. Is a 2Way Street
description: Is it art? Or is it like a stone around a man's neck? Should the East Side reject what the West Side would gladly take in?

title: GRADUATE CENTER DEDICATES MALL
description: A 75footwide pedestrian mall, forming a midblock con nection from 42d to 43d streets between Fifth Avenue and The Avenue of the Americas was unveiled yesterday during dedi cation ceremonies of the newly renovated City University Graduate Center building.

title: For Weekend Chefs, Lamb Shanks au Vin Rouge
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Books of The Times
description: Rosalyn Drexler may very well be the first Marx Sister. Her new novel, One or Another, has no more plot than Horse Feathers (far less, in fact), but she has filled it up with so many sight, sound and word gags, so many sillinesses and sur realitiesnot to mention little grinning ob scenitiesthat the reader soon begins to flinch in anticipation of the next verbal skit and to bark with relieved laughter when it works.

title: Trucking Strike Cited
description: The prolonged trucking strike, particularly in the Mid dle West, combined with con tinuing cautious buying by consumers to hold down sales last month among seven of the country's largest retail chains.

title: New York's Electoral Mess
description: The inexcusable failure of the State Legislature to reform New York's antiquated and dangerous election laws at its last session threatens to create difficult problems as the primary elections approach on the 23d of this month and, beyond them, the general elec tion for top statewide offices in November.

title: Michaels, Whose Vote Passed Abortion Bill, Will Stay in Race
description: Assemblyman George M. Michaels, who cast the key vote to liberalize New York's abor tion law, and who has been hospitalizea for a week follow ing an automobile accident, an nounced yesterday that he would continue as a candidate for reelection.

title: Madrid Questions Petitioners of Rogers
description: MADRID, June 4The police today began to question, one by one, Spaniards who signed an opposition petition, given to Secretary of State William P. Rogers during his visit here last week.

title: A Correction
description: A report on the Indianapolis 500 race, published in Sunday's editions of The New York Times, erroneously attributed the retirement of Peter Rev son's McLarenOffenhauser to a spinout. The cause of retire ment was mechanical, a broken distributor shaft.

title: American League
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Stratford Offered A Violent Hamlet By New Director
description: STRATFORDONAVON, Eng land, June 4T. S. Eliot's com plaint that Hamlet's emotion is in excess of his given circum stances certainly applies to Trevor Nunn's new produc tion at Stratford's Royal Shakespeare Theater.

title: Pentagon Says ABM and MIRV Can Be Halted if Arm Pact Develops
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Dr. John S. Foster Jr., the Pen tagon's director of defense re search and engineering, told a Senate subcommittee today that the Nixon Administration's de cision to proceed with deploy ment of missiledefense systems and multiple missile warheads could be reversed by an agree ment with the Soviet Union on strategicarms control.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Victim Earns Doctorate at 66
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 4As 50 elderly men and women looked on, Milton Goell, a 66 yearold chronically ill resident of a nursing home here, was awarded a Doctorate of Educa tion in a special ceremony to day.

title: Swingline Fills Top Posts
description: Jack Linsky has been elected chairman and John H. Behr has been named president and chief executive officer of Swingline, Inc. Mr. Linsky, formerly president and chairman of the board, is the founder of Swing line, one of the largest pro ducers of stapling equipment. Mr. Behr previously vice presi dent, has headed the company's Wilson Jones division in Chi cago since 1966. Swingline is a subsidiary of American Brands, lnc.

title: Chiefs Sign No. 1 Draftee
description: KANSAS CITY, June 4 (AP  The Kansas City Chiefs signed today 260pound, 6foot 4inch Sid Smith, their No. ?? draft choice and an offensive tackle from Southern Califor nia.

title: GEORGE R. BEACH, 97, HEADED BANK BOARD
description: MONTCLAIR. N. J., June 4 George R. Beach, former presi dent and chairman of the board of the Provident Institution for Savings of Jersey City, who had been a trustee and alumni leader of Columbia. University, died today at his home, 167 South Mountain Avenue. He was 97 years old.

title: FARM EXPORTS SEEN AT A RECORD LEVEL
description: A United States farm ofticial said yesterday that agricultural exports this fiscal year will jump $400million above pre vious estimates and predicted they could set new levels in 197071.

title: Suit Filed in Village Blast
description: The owner of a building adjacent to the Greenwich Vil lage townhouse shattered by dynamite blasts March 6 filed a $20,000 damage suit yester day against the owner of the demolished house. Arthur Levin, owner of the fivestory, build ing at 20 West 11th Street, sued James B. Wilkerson, whose house at number 18 was de stroyed in what the police theorize was a blast coming from socalled bomb factory for leftist revolutionaries. Mr. Levin contended that his house was damaged in the blast and that Mr. Wilkerson had failed to repair the damage.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Soybean futures, together with soybean meal rose again yesterday, setting new seasonal highs on the Chicago Board of Trade. Soybean oil futures also rose.

title: For Ottinger, the Big Picture Is on TV
description: Six new Ottinger Delivers television commercials rolled across a tiny screen in David Gart's office 14 floors above Fifth Avenue yesterday.

title: CLARKE FOILS BID BY ROOKER IN 9TH
description: The New York Yankees com pleted a threegame sweep of the Kansas City Royals last night at Yankee Stadium, spoil ing Jim Rooker's nohit bid in the ninth inning, then winning the game in the 12th, 21, on Horace Clarke's basesloaded sacrifice fly to center field.

title: Panther Fund Supported
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, June 4(UPI)A donation of $2,500 has been given to the Black Panther Legal Defense Fund by a faeultystudent com mittee at Antioch College. Anti och faculty members voted May 5 a voluntarary selfimposed tax of 1 per cent of their sal aries to be given to the fund, and students later joined with a selfimposed tax of 1 per cent of annual tuition.

title: Dartmouth Nine Wins, 123, From Connecticut in Final
description: HANOVER, N. H., June 4 Dartmouth College, behind an 18hit attack and the sixhit pitching of Charlie Janes, routed the University of Connecticut, 123, today to win the National Collegiate Athletic Association District One baseball tourna ment final.

title: Israeli General Confident Despite Soviet Aid to Foe
description: JERUSALEM, June 4Lieut. Gen. Haim BarLev, the Israeli Chief of Staff, said today that Israel would be able to stand off the enemy armies and guer rilla forces on her borders in the foreseeable future despite the help the Soviet Union is providing for the Arabs.

title: LawnMowing Dispute Stirs Seaway Walkout
description: MONTREAL, June 4 (Cana dian Press)A walkout by at least 140 employes of the St. Lawrence Seaway Au thority over a job security issue had tied up 22 ships between Montreal and King ston, Ontario, a seaway of fical said today.

title: Vorster Arrives in Lisbon
description: LISBON, June 4 (neuters) Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa flew here today to begin his first European tour since taking office in 1966. He spent the afternoon preparing for talks with Premier Marcello Caplano tomorrow. Mr. Vorster will also visit Madrid and Paris.

title: FRANULOVIC BEATS RICHEY IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, June 4Cliff Richey won an argument with a lines man, lost his concentration and was beaten today in the semi finals of the French open tennis tournamentby himself, the wind, bad umpiring and Zeljko Franulovic.

title: Bennett Victor in Decathlon, Sets N.A.I.A. Vault Mark
description: BILLINGS, Mont., June 4 (AP) Jeff Bennett, a stocky 150 pounder from Oklahoma Chris tian, set a pole vault record today as he took his second straight decathlon champion ship in the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics track and field championships.

title: Article 2  No Title
G.E. CUTS PRICES OF REFRIGERATORS
description: The General Electric Company said yesterday that it had cut the fairtrade price for New York on four of its refrigerator models by $5 to $15. A fair trade price is the minimum price, determined by the manu facturer, at which a retailer I may sell a product.

title: 12 Women to Get AMITA Awards At Benefit Event
description: Twelve women of Italian descent will receive Ameri canItalian Women of Achievement Awards at the 14th annual AMITA dinner at the Biltmore tomorrow night.

title: FIRST GEORGIA BLACK RUNS FOR GOVERNOR
description: ATLANTA, June 4  C. B. King, a 46yearold. Albany, Ga., lawyer, became today the first black man in Georgia's history to qualify officially as a candi date for Governor.

title: NIXON AIDES VOW WIDE INTEGRATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Despite the new political chal lenge posed by George C. Wal lace's victory in Alabama, Nix on Administration officials say they are determined to achieve more school integration in the South next fall than has been accomplished in any previous year.

title: Swedish Leader, in U.S., Avows Amity
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 Europe's youngest Premier, the intellectual and leftist Olof Palme of Sweden, today began a nineday visit aimed at per suading Americans that his country's opposition to the war in Vietnam did not mean it was hostile to the United States.

title: Ohio G.O.P Panel Repudiates 2 of Own Candidates in Scandal
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 4 Ohio's Republican State Central Committee repudiated today the party's candidates for At torney General and Treasurer.

title: Luisa Turrin Bride in Italy
description: Miss Luisa Turrin and Er hard Robert Fernholz were married yesterday in a civil ceremony in Pisa, Italy, where the bride is working for an advanced degree in mathematics and the bride groom is doing research in mathematics at the Scuola Normale Superiore.

title: Two U.S. Judges Vary Terms In Separate Plane Hijackings
description: MIAMI, June 4 (UPI)Two Federal judges handed down sentences of 20 years and two years to airplane hijackers to dy. The man who hijacked the larger plane got the lighter sen tence.

title: Aided Several Regimes
description: Consiaeren a bold innovator in economics and finance, Dr. Schacht owed to a sturdy talent for protective coloring and general good luck as well as ability the fact that he did very well under every German Government from that of Kaiser Wilhelm II in preWorld War I days to the postWorld War II period of Chancellor Konrad Adenauer.

title: Exhibit to Stir Opinion on P.O.W.'s Open in Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  A lifesized, chillingly realistic looking exhibit, designed to arouse public opinion in behalf of the release of American pris oners of war by the North Viet namese, was installed at the Capitol today with the backing of House Speaker John W. McCormack.

title: Maddox Pickets 2 Atlanta Papers
description: ATLANTA, June 4A citi zen named Maddox picketed the offices of the two major Atlanta newspapers today and said he Was just doing his part to help rid the coun try of Communists, anarch ists and nasty people.

title: Altman Says Rent Control Plan Of City Council Unit Is Naive
description: The city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance Benjamin Altman, used the forum of a City Council Hous ing Committee meeting yester day to attack as naive, ir responsible, illadvised and po litically motivated a proposal for modifying rent control put forth Wednesday by 12 coun cilmen.

title: The Other War in Cambodia
description: Nine hours before President Nixon delivered his interim report to the nation on Indochina, the Senate decisively turned down an effort to nullify the Cooper Church Amendment which would restrict future mili tary activities in Cambodia. Nothing the President subsequently said in his nationwide address has lessened the need for Congressional action to curb further arbitrary moves that might extend the South east Asian conflict.

title: 7 Catchers Are Selected On First Round of Draft
description: Although seven players selec ted in the first round of major league baseball's twoday sum mer draft of free agents were catchers, the Yankees and Mets picked a pitcher and a short stop yesterday at the Hotel Americana.

title: Valentino for the Masses Well, Almost
description: Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis, his best known fan, will un doubtedly continue to order her originals from Rome, but starting this fall, women will have a chance to buy their Valentino fashions closer to home.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Falls
description: OTTAWA, June 4 (Canadian Press)New 91day Govern ment of Canada Treasury bills auctioned today totaled $150, 000,000 at an average price and yield of 98.549 and 5.91 per cent, against 98.443 and 6.4 per cent last week. The 182 day bills totaled $40,000,000 at 97.129 and 5.93 per cent, com pared with 96.931 and 6.35 per cent a week earlier.

title: WACHOVIA WINS MERGER RUING
description: The Wachovia Corporation of WinstonSalem, N.C., a holding company that owns one of the largest banks in the South, won a major battle yesterday against the Justice Department.

title: Honor America Day Set for Capital July 4
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Plans for an Honor America Day, scheduled as a Fourth of July rally on the grounds of the Washington Monu ment, were announced today by a citizens committee headed by Bob Hope, the ac tor, and the Rev. Billy Gra ham, the evangelist.

title: Prospect of an Empty Saddle Can Fill a Man's Day With Ifs
description: All morning long, the spe culation swirled around Bel mont Park yesterday like in side information off a tout sheet.

title: In Memoriam
description: BESTARDBartolome. Is sadly missed by his friends, S & A.

title: JOB BIAS CHARGES FILED IN HOUSTON
description: HOUSTON, June 4Charges of racial and sex discrimination have been filed against four companies and 15 labor unions in Houston by two members of the Equal Employment Op portunity Commission.

title: VOTING BILE READY FOR HOUSE ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Leg islation to continue protection for Negro voters in the South and to lower the voting age to 18 years was cleared by the House Rules Committee today for action on the House floor. The bill has already passed the Senate.

title: Tonga's Lord High Everything
description: NUKU ALOFA, Tonga, June 4I'm a bit of a PoohBah, you know, except that I don't cut off any heads.

title: U.S. Quake Victims
description: LIMA, Peru, June 4 (UPI) Following, as made public by the United States Embassy here, are the names of Ameri cans reported dead or missing in the aftermath of the earth quake Sunday:

title: Bitter Debate in Bonn Makes State Elections a Test for Brandt
description: BONN, June 4  Forthcom ing state elections in West Ger many have suddenly been trans formed into a plebiscite or Chancellor Willy Brandt's East European policy and pos sibly on his coalition of Social Democrats and Free Democrats

title: L.I. STUDENTS PLAN BOYCOTT OF SCHOOL
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 4  A group of Oceanside High School seniors said today that they would boycott their gradu ation because Representative Allard K. Lowenstein had been refused permission by the school authorities to speak at the exercises.

title: JAY IRVING, 69, DREW COMIC STRIP TOTTSY
description: Jay Irving, originator of the comic strip Pottsy, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart atack, in his home at 650 West End Avenue. He was 69 years old.

title: DEXTER CUP TROT DRAWS FIELD OF 11
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 4 A field of 11 3yearold trotters were entered today in the $111,514.24 Dexter Cup Trot, to be staged at Roosevelt Race way a week from Saturday. The Dexter is the first of the big five trotting events. The others are the Hambletonian, the Yonkers Futurity, the Ken tucky Futurity, and the Colo nial.

title: U.S. Appeals Court Notes the Long Delays in Civil Trials Here
description: A Suit that was dismissed in Federal Court to years ago because the plaintiff was out of town when the case finally came to trial 32 months after he had filed it was reinstated yesterday by the Second Cir cuit Court of Atmears.

title: Nixon Daughter in Maine
description: PORTLAND, Me., June 4 (AP)Mrs. David Eisenhower, younger daughter of President and Mrs. Nixon, is on a pri vate visit here with a former Smith College classmate, Ann Davis, who was a bridesmaid at her wedding. She arrived by plane yesterday. Miss Davis said her guest wanted the visit to be private and had no plans to talk with newsmen. The length of Mrs. Eisenhower's stay was not disclosed.

title: Garden Sets $8.50 Top For Knicks and Rangers
description: It will now cost a couple $17 to see a Knickerbocker or Ranger game from the best seats in the house.

title: O'BRIEN OPPOSES POST FOR SHRIVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 4A sharp intraparty dispute erupt ed today between Lawrence F. O'Brien, the Democratic Na tional Chairman, and Sargent Shriver, whose friends have been promoting him for an independent role as a party reformer and a builder of grassroots support for the Democrats.

title: United Hospital Fund Names Head of Drive
description: The appointment of Gus tave L. Levy, senior partner of Goldman, Sachs & Co. as general chairman of the 1970 campaign of the United Hos pital Fund of New York was announced yesterday by Douglas T. Yates, president of the fund.

title: Washington: The President's Report on Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 President Nixon made Cam bodia sound so good on the TV the other night that it almost seems a pity to leave the place. All our military objectives have been achieved, he said, and the whole adventure was the most successful operation of this long and difficult war.

title: Antiwar Amendment Group Opens 5th Avenue Office
description: A committee seeking an amendment to the New York City Charter to provide a legal test of the constitutionality of the war in Indochina opened a campaign headquarters yester day at 650 Fifth Avenue, at 52d Street.

title: Councilmen and Estimate Board Complete City Budget Hearings
description: A top official of the school system protested at a city budg et hearing yesterday that the city was taking a miserly ap proach to the interscholastic athletic programallotting less than $1,000 annually to each of the city's 90 high schools.

title: LUTZ AND GORMAN REACH SEMIFINALS
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 4 (AP)Bob Lutz of Lo. Angeles and Torn Gorman of Seattle moved into the semi finals today in the Northern lawn tennis championships, a warmup event for Wimbledon.

title: Federal Study Group Says U.S. Should Release Products Data
description: WASHINGTON, June 4An interagency study group agreed today that the Government should make its wealth of data about household products avail able to the consumer.

title: RapidAmerican Corp.
description: The RapidAmerican Corp. ration had a net loss of $356, 000 in the quarter ended April 30, in contrast to $4,380,000 earned in the corresponding three months last year, Meshu lam Riklis, chairman and presi dent, reported yesterday. Sales were $493,394,000 compared with $326,896,000.

title: Troy Calls Lindsay on Carpet As Draperies Draw His Wrath
description: Mayor Lindsay was chided by a Councilman yesterday for refurbishing his office with new drapes and carpet during an austerity period. The Coun cilmanMatthew J. Troy Jr., Democrat of Queenspleaded that the old drapes be used to rehabilitate a crumbling Coun cil chamber.

title: Jane Pratt and John D. Shilling, Candidates for Ph.D., Married
description: DETROIT, June 4Miss Dorothy Jane Pratt, a doc toral candidate in political science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and John David Shilling, who is studying for his Ph. D. in economics there, were mar ried today at the Mariners' Episcopal Church. The Rev. Richard Ingalls performed the ceremony.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Widening the Peace

title: Walinsky Is Ruled Eligible
description: ALBANY, June 4 (Uri)The Court of Appeals ruled today that Adam Walinsky is eligible to run for the Democratic nomi nation for Attorney General in the June 23 primary. The effort to bar the former aide of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy from the primary ballot was undertaken by Robert Meehan, District Attorney of Rockland County, who is challenging him for the nomination. Mr. Mee han contended that Mr. Walin sky failed to meet the five year residency requirement of the State Constitution to run for statewide office

title: Peter Brook Is Setting Up a Theater Center in Paris
description: PARIS, June 4A revolu tionary International Center of Theater Research has been dreamed up by Peter Brook, the British stage and film di rector.

title: MAYOR LOSING POST AFTER RAID ON DALAT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 4 (Reuters)The Mayor of Dalat, the Central Highlands resort city that was infiltrated by Vietcong guerrillas last weekend, will be replaced, the official South Vietnamese press agency reported today.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: Nixon to Appoint Lodge Vatican Intermediary
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  White House sources said to night that former Ambassa dor Henry Cabot Lodge would be appointed tomorrow as an informal intermediary with the Vatican.

title: Anniversaries
description: FARNSWORTHMarybeth, thank you very much for five beautiful years. Husband Michael.

title: Odds Grow That Slump Will Be Classed as Recession
description: The odds are growing that the current business downturn will be classified as the nation's fifth postwar business recession the director of research for the National Bureau of Economic Research said yesterday.

title: TeknaMedia President Leaves to Go to a Client
description: Edward A. Grey, who founded TeknaMedia, a media buying service a year ago, is giving up the presi dency to Edmund Burke, for merly of SPEEData and sev eral ad agencies. Mr. Burke will also be chief executive officer. Mr. Grey, who will become chairman and a di rector, is going to a client, MONITEL, as president of its advertising sales division. MONITEL is a programming and advertising service for the cable television industry.

title: FOE SEIZES POST NEAR PNOMPENH, THEN IS REPULSED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 4  Communist troops seized a village called Sethbo today and then lost it to a Cam bodian counterattack in a bat tle only 10 miles southeast of Pnompenh, officers in the field reported. It was the closest major fighting to the Cam bodian capital so far.

title: Revenues Up for Half
description: Armour & Co. had higher revenues but little change in earnings in the first half of this year compared with the 1969 period, according to re sults issued yesterday by Charles P. Orem, president of the nation's second largest meat packer. Swift & Co. is the biggest.

title: 10 Senators Press Rogers On Sale of Jets to Israel
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Ten leading Senate advocates of the sale of additional aircraft to Is rael conferred for an hour to day with Secretary of State William P. Rogers, and emerged expressing guarded optimism that the Administration would soon give the Israelis a favor able resnonse.

title: DANE IS FLOORED IN 6TH AND 10TH
description: COPENHAGEN. Denmark, June 4 (AP)Emile Griffith, the former world welterweight and middleweight champion, floored Tom Bogs twice tonight on his way to gaining a de cisive 10round decision over the previously unbeaten Euro pean middleweight champion from Denmark.

title: Underdog Hopeful
description: Howard J. Samuels returned tonight from a twoday stump ing tour by air in central and western New York State, con vinced that while he is still the underdog, he is steadily closing the gap on Arthur J. Goldberg, frontrunner in the race for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI) The Defense Department to day identified the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: G.I.Pullout Plans Await End of Drive in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird disclosed tonight that President Nixon's senior military advisers would meet at a site in the Pacific forwhat he called a major re deployment conference short ly after the last American troops are withdrawn from Cambodia on June 30.

title: BROOKLYN COLLEGE GRADUATES 4,284
description: Brooklyn College yesterday awarded 4,284 degrees to the largest graduating class in its 40year history in outdoor cere monies at its Flatbush compus as a light rain began to fall.

title: Screen: Godard Treatise
Unueilings
description: WASSERMANRose. An unveiling of a monument to the memory of a beloved sister, Sunday, June 7 at 1 P.M., Wash ington Cemetery, Brooklyn, Section 5, Road 1. No postponement.

title: Emmett J. Culligan, 77; Devised Water Softener
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., June 4Emmett J. Culligan, founder and retired chairman of Culligan, Inc., a water sof tening company with more than 1,000 dealerships in 85 nations, died here yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: A.B.A. Pipers Select McMahon as Coach
description: PITTSBURGH, June 4 (UPI) The American Basketball Association's Pittsburgh Pi pers selected Jack McMahon as their coach today. The 40 yearold McMahon was a coach for eight seasons in the rival National Basketball Association. He was dis missed in the middle of last season after 2 years with the San Diego Rockets.

title: SHOOTING REPORT IS BEING STUDIED
description: BUFFALO, June 4Federal, state and local authorities are investigating reports that Buf falo policemen fired shotgun pellets, wounding students on the campus of the State Univer sity here, during a disturbance last month.

title: 100 Mississippi Blacks Held
description: STARKVILLE, Miss., June 4 (UPI)More than 100 black demonstrators were arrested here today when they attempted to hold a protest march at the county courthouse. The dem onstration, involving a total of about 250 blacks, was called to protest the dismissal of about 30 black school teach list of grievances submitted car ers and to seek action on a lier this year to city officials.

title: Jet Hijacker, Lured by Ransom, Captured in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 4A disgruntled 49yearold Phoenix truck driver hijacked a Wash ingtonbound Trans World Air lines jet with 51 passengers aboard this morning and was captured at gunpoint at Dulles International Airport tonight after being ??ured back to the airport to collect what he thought was almost $100mil lion in ransom money.

title: Mohawk Reduces Its Staff
description: UTICA, N. Y., June 4 (AP) Mohawk Airlines said today it was reducing its work staff by 94 employes. The airline said the reduction brought to 124 the number of employes it has let go since April 26.

title: Playground Opens in Subway's Path
description: The rain failed yesterday to keep away about 30 youngsters who went to Central Park to participate in opening ceremo nies for a new $106,000 play ground near Fifth Avenue at 32d Street.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Black America, edited by John F. Szwed (Basic Books, $7.95). 23 essays on AfroAmerican cul ture.

title: Lacrosse AllStars
description: FIRST TEAM

title: For Nigerian Reconciliation
description: The Federal Government of Nigeria has taken two important actions to carry forward its policy of recon ciliation with the Ibos and its promise to alleviate suffering in the former Biafran enclave.

title: Royals' Owner Would Pay Flood $100,000 to Play for His Team
description: Ewing Kauffman, sole owner of the Kansas City Royals, said yesterday that he would pay Curt Flood $100,000 to $125,000 in sal ary this year if Flood were available to his baseball team, and possibly more for a longterm contract.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JUNE 5, 1970

title: G.O.P. SCANS RACE AGAINST WALLACE
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 4Republican leaders here are seriously considering a vig orous campaign against George C. Wallace in the November general election, not in pursuit of victory but as a means of portraying him nationally as a man of diminishing political stature.

title: Opera: Met's Traviata
description: As with many operas, La Traviata in performance takes on the personality of the soprano singing the title role. On Wednesday night, the Violetta in the Metropoli tan Opera's performance of the Verdi work was Pilar Lorengar. She is not an ar tist of strong dramatic tem perament, and there was nothing tragic in her por trayal. It was a womanly characterization, very ap pealing, with touches of pathos now and then.

title: Theater: Initiation Into Civilization
description: Akokawe, the evening of African music, dance, poetry and story that opened last night at the St. Marks Play house as the final show of Abe Negro Ensemble Com pany's current season, means initiation. This is not, as might be expected, a re ference to any tribal ritual (although Akokawe draws from traditional as well as modern sources) but initiation into civilization.

title: U.F.T. WILL SUPPORT PARAPROFESSIONALS
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teachers, announced yesterday that the city's teachers had voted 3 to 1 in favor of sup porting the paraprofessionals should the latter decide to strike the public school system before the end of the school vear.

title: TRADING IS QUIET ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London stock market moved narrowly yester day in extremely quiet trading.

title: Lachman Will Head Better Business Bureau
description: Lawrence Lachman, chair man and chief executive offi cer of Bloomingdale's, was elected yesterday as chair man of the Better Business Bureau of Metropolitan New York. He succeeds William S. Renchard, chairman of the Chemical Bank, who has been chairman of the New York B.B.B. since 1968.

title: LIBERALS IN HOUSE PUSH FOR REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  All of the House Democrats who are competing to succeed Speaker John W. McCormack when he retires at the end of the year were challenged today to endorse a basic pro gram of reform in House rules and practices.

title: MRS. R. TURNER WILCOX
description: Mrs. R. Turner Wilcox, fash ion editor of Women's Wear Daily from 1910 to 1915 and the author and illustrator of seven books on costume, died Wednesday at her home, 24 Ravine Road, Tenafly, N. J. She was 82 years old.

title: U.S. Demands War Critic Quit Jersey Draft Board
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., June 4Should a person openly hostile to the draft be allowed to sit on a draft board?

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Crime. The President set up a national council on or ganized crime. He named At torney General John N. Mitchell to head the council, which also included the F.B.I. director, J. Edgar Hoover, and the Secret Service direc tor, James J. Rowley. Other Cabinet members named were Labor Secretary George P. Shultz, Treasury Secretary David M. Kennedy and Post master General Winton M. Blount. Members will also in clude Hamer H. Budge, chair man of the Securities and Ex change Commission, and rep resentatives of every Govern ment agency having major re sponsibilities affected by criminal activity. clude Hamer H. Budge, chair man of the Securities and Ex change Commission, and rep resentatives of every Govern ment agency having major re sponsibilities affected by criminal activity.

title: MORE OIL COMING FROM VENEZUELA
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP) The White House announced today that the United States would increase imports of oil from Venezuela during the second half of 1970. It also in dicated that an increase in Venezuelan imports may be ex tended beyond this year.

title: U.S. Funds Are Changing World of Sioux
description: MISSION, S. D.The latest of the white man's trappings to change the traditional ways of the American Indian is. Federal spending. Like gunpowder and fire water, it often seems to produce mixed blessings. Here on the million acre Rosebud Reservation among the poverty rid den remnants of the Sioux  and on reservations elsewhere  the increasing flow of money from Washington has created a few new jobs and financed a number of new houses.

title: SENATE UNIT DENIED PEACE GROUP'S DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Co lumbia temporarily blocked a Senate subcommittee today from subpoenaing records of an antiwar organization that oper ates coffeehouses and publishes underground newspapers near military bases.

title: City of Hope Award Set
description: Mortimer Marcus will receive the ManoftheYear Award of the City of Hope at the philan thropy's annual fundraising dinner at the New York Hilton Hotel Sunday, it was announced yesterday. Mr. Marcus is senior partner of Marcus & Co., mem hers of the New York Stock Exchange

title: Catastrophe in Rumania
description: The most severe floods in the history of Rumania have devastated that country during the past three weeks. The combination of longcontinued rains plus torrents of water from melted snow in the mountains have turned many of Rumania's rivers into agents of mass destruction. Already 200 people are known to have died, while hundreds of thousands have become refugees. The damage to Rumanian industry and agri culture as well as to homes and personal property is immense, and may well run to hundreds of millions of dollarsor morewhen a final accounting is made.

title: JOSEPH H. KENNY, 60, JERSEY SURROGATE
description: JERSEY CITY, June 4Jo seph H. Kenny, Surrogate of Hudson County, who had been nominated for a second five year term in the Democratic primary Tuesday, died yester day at his home, 287 Pavonia Avenue. He was 60 years old.

title: Museum's Big Plans Spark Big Debate
description: A vivid debate between friends and foes of the plans to expand the Metropolitan Museum of Art took place last night at a public hearing in the auditorium of the Ameri can Museum of Natural His tory.

title: C.A.B. Widens Authority On Flights From Abroad
description: The United States announced yesterday a tougher bargaining position with foreign nations that restrict operations by United States airlines.

title: Actors' Fund of America Honors Brooks Atkinson
description: Brooks Atkinson, retired drama critic of The New York Times, has been awarded the Actors' Fund Medal by the Ac tors' Fund of Amercia, Louis Lotito, president of the Fund, announced yesterday.

title: Red Troops Are Reported In District of Angkor Wat
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 4Communist troop activity was reported today in Siemreap Province, the site of the famed Angkor Wat temples, one of Asia's leading tourist attrac tions.

title: LINDSAY PROPOSES 62 LOCAL BOARDS TO HELP RUN CITY
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday a broad plan for a decentralized system of neigh borhood government through out the city, based on the crea tion of community boards in 62 districts.

title: Rockefeller Assailed
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, returning yesterday from a threeday up state votegetting tour, predicted a big sweep in November.

title: Rip Torn Dropped From Steambath, a New Play
description: Rip Torn, the Broadway and Hollywood actor, was dismissed yesterday from Bruce Jay Friedman's new play, Steambath, for al legedly failing to fulfill all of the values of the script.

title: French Assembly Passes Law to Combat Violence
description: PARIS, June 4The Pom pidou Government's controver sial antiwrecker law was passed today after a renewed outbreak of the violence at which it is aimed.

title: Buffalo Loses Baseball Club; League Rejects Bid to Stay
description: The International League took away Buffalo's baseball franchise yesterday after re jecting a bid by the Bisons to keep the financially troubled team in the city.

title: Purchase of 144 New Cars For Penn Central Delayed
description: HARTFORD, June 4 (AP) The process of buying 144 new passenger cars for the New Haven division of the Penn Central has been delayed again.

title: Shuk, Thrown Before Race, Suffers a Fractured Pelvis
description: STANTON, Del., June 4 (AP) Nick Shuk, the jockey, was hospitalized today after a fall before the racing program at Delaware Park. He was report ed to have suffered a fractured pelvis and a possible spleen injury.

title: Chile Urges U.N. Action
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 4  Jos Piera, Chile's chief delegate at the United Na tions, asked Secretary General Thant today to call for an emergency plenary meeting of the Economic Commission for Latin America to mobilize all possible aid to Peru in the present earthquake emergency.

title: CAROL REED, 44, TV WEATHER GIRL
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 4  Carol Reed, the former weather reporter on WCBSTV, whose cheery signoff, Have a happy, became a popular American expression, died of cancer today at her home, 421 North Barry Avenue. Her age was 44.

title: City Relief Roll Is Rising At Faster Pace Than in '69
description: The continuing rise in New York City's relief rolls has speeded up slightly this year amid troubles in the nation's economy, but city officials say the increase still remains within budget forecasts.

title: GOVERNOR URGES MORE HOME RULE
description: Governor Rockefeller joined state legislative leaders and both Democratic candidates For Governor yesterday by sup porting a proposal for greater autonomy for cities.

title: ADDONIZIO JURORS READY FOR TRIAL
description: TRENTON, N. J., June 4 The selection of six alternate jurors here today completed the jury for the Federal trial of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark and seven others on 66 counts of conspiracy to ex tort $253,000 from Constrad, Inc., an engineering company that has done work for the City of Newark.

title: Du Pont President Scores Asian War
description: For the second time in two days, a major corporate execu tive has hit out against the country's involvement in Viet nam and its effect on the econ omy.

title: sank to Supervise Mellon's Interests
