description: PITTSBURGH, June 4  The most asked question in Pitts burgh financial circles today Who will replace Richard King Mellon as steward of the vast Mellon financial empirewas answered today.

title: Bridge:
description: One major upset and one nearupset marked the third round of play in the Rei singer Knockout Team Cham pionship at the New York Hilton Wednesday night.

title: Northern Strategy Is Altering Southern Baptists
description: DENVER, June 4The South ern Baptist Convention, which for 125 years has preached the gospel with a drawl and func tioned like the Confederacy at prayer, is increasingly turning toward a Northern strategy.

title: Downed Jet, Cairo Says
description: CAIRO, June 4 (AP)The Egyptian military command an nounced that an Israeli Sky hawk jet was downed today by antiaircraft fire and fell on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal.

title: Halle in Pact to Acquire Half of 10 Orvis Offices
description: The consolidation movement among Wall Street brokerage houses continued yesterday as Halle & Stieglitz, Inc., an nounced an agreement to take over five offices of Orvis Broth ers & Co. in the New York area.

title: The Owners Insist it's a Rice Shoppe
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicinity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: Cancer Care Benefit
description: A Night in New Orleans will be the theme of a dinner dance Saturday at Delmon ico's Hotel for the benefit of Frances Levy MidWest chester Cancer Care. Pro ceeds will aid advanced can cer patients and their fam ilies. Mrs. Jay I. Lamstein is president of the organiza tion. Tickets, available from Mrs. Louis Flamer, are $75 a couple.

title: Stewart to Attend Rites For Sawchuk Today
description: Ron Stewart and 10 Ranger teammates will attend the funeral of Terry Sawchuk today in Berkley, Mich.

title: Politics Against Freedom
description: The Regents of the University of California are pre paring for the dismissal of Miss Angela Davis, an assistant professor of philosophy with a background of black militancy and membership in the Communist party. This action will set the Regents, who are doing Governor Reagan's bidding, on a collision course not only with the faculty of the university's campus at Los Angeles but with all defenders of academic freedom.

title: U.S. Envoy Surveys Peru From Air and Finds Chaos
description: LIMA, Peru, June 4Moun tains haveshifted. Great clouds of dust rise from the valleys that you can't see through or fly over. But we did manage to get a glimpse of Yungay, or what was once that lovely city of 20odd thousand.

title: Gilbert and Lionel Hebert Card 66's to Share Kemper Golf Lead
description: CHARLOTTE, N, C., June 4 C. L. Gilbert, who prefers to be called Gibby, left the golf tour last week and went home to Hollywood, Fla., while his wife gave birth to their third son. Back on the circuit to day with a new club affilia tion, the 29yearold profes sional scored a 66 in the $150,000 Kemper open to tie 42yearold Lionel Hebert for the firstday lead.

title: ExMental Health Director Takes Temporary U.S. Job
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI) Dr. Stanley F. Yolles, direc tor of the National Institute of Mental Health until Tuesday, has accepted a temporary new job with the Department of Health, Education and Welfare,

title: Article 1  No Title
13 U.S. AIDES ARRIVE FOR INDOCHINA STUDY,
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 4 (AP)A 13man fact finding party of members of Congress and officials arrived today. One of them said they intended to look at the bunk ers uncovered by allied forces inside Cambodia.

title: Vehicles on Air Cushion To Be Tested on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, June 4 Tracked aircushioned vehicles will soon carry passengers at 150 miles an hour from Los Angeles International Airport to the suburban San Fernando Valley, hopefully by late 1972, John A. Volpe, Secretary of Transportation, said today.

title: PALESTINIANS END CAIRO UNITY TALKS
description: CAIRO, June 4  A dozen oftencontentious Palestinian commando organizations made some progress in a meeting here aimed at unifying their ranks, according to a statement made public at the end of sixday session of the Palestin ian National Council.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Branch McCracken Dead at 61; Basketball Coach at Indiana U.
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., June 4 (AP) Branch. (Big Bear) Mc Cracken, who twice coached Indiana University to the Na tional collegiate basketball championship, died today of a heart ailment. He was 61 years old.

title: Cerro to Buy Own Stock
description: The Cerro Corporation an nounced yesterday that its hoard of directors had author ized t he purchase of up to 250, 000 shares of the company's stock to he used for acquisi tions and other corporate pur poses, The copper producer has 8.14 million shares out standing.

title: Two New Graduates Killed
description: COMMERCE CITY, Colo., June 4 (AP)Two 17yearold boys were killed early today when their speeding car ran off a rural road and overturned three times. The authorities said that the victims, John Gustin and James Thames, had attended a party following their graduation from high school a few hours earlier. Three other 17yearold new graduates in the car were hurt.

title: Judith Shepard Will Be Wed
description: ST. LOUIS, June 4  Mr. and Mrs. Palmer Shepard have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Judith Ann Shepard, to Mal colm Joel Barnett, son of Mrs. Minna K. Barnett of New York and the late Dr. Sidney N. Barnett, who was chairman of the social studies department at the High School of Music and Art there. Mrs. Barnett is on the planning and program staff of New York City School District 3.

title: End Paper
description: A prodigious amount of work has gone into this history of Glory of the Seas, an allwood sailing ship, the last merchant vessel created by Donald McKay, builder of the famous clipper Flying Cloud. Mr. Mjelde has searched through ships' logs, manifests and bills of sale; he has looked at all sorts of commercial papers and newspaper accounts and tracked down firsthand reports by those who sailed on her or were involved with her in some way.

title: CHARLES E. PALMER, CLAIROL EXECUTIVE
description: Charles E. Palmer, a vice president of Clairol, Inc., died here Wednesday after a heart attack. He was 46 years old and lived at 720 Milton Road, Rye, N. Y.

title: BIG BOARD DROPS ON PROFIT TAKING
14 Accused of Attempting An Illegal Entry Into U.S.
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., June 4 (UPI)The United States Im migration Service reported to day the arrest of 13 Dominicans and one Haitian on charges of attempting to enter the United States illegally.

title: A Drug for Parkinson's Disease Gets Cautious F.D.A. Approval
description: WASHINGTON, June 4The Food and Drug Administration approved today the marketing of the much discussed Ldopa as a prescription drug for treat ing Parkinson's disease.

title: Expenditure of Federal Funds Is Changing World of the Sioux
Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 7 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal waters.

title: In Peru, a Tour of Devastated Valley
description: HUARAS, Peru, June 5 The clock in the cathedral of Huaras stopped at 3:27 P.M. In the Huaylas valley, and a nightmare began.

title: Israelis Bomb Suez Area 11 Hours on Anniversary of Start of 1967 War
description: JERUSALEM, June 5  Is raeli planes bombed Egyptian positions along the Suez Canal for 11 hours today in what of ficials here termed the longest and most intense foray iin a week of prolonged attacks.

title: Role for Volunteers Hinted
description: PARIS, June 5A member of the insurgent Cambodian group under Prince Norodom Silhanouk said today that Chi nese Communist volunteers might intervene in the Cam bodian war.

title: PRICES INCREASED ON FLOOR SUPPLIES
description: The Armstrong Cork Com pany announced yesterday that it would raise prices as of July 1 on selected lines of sheet vinyl flooring, rotogravure floors, floor coverings, resilient tile and sundries. The increase will range between 2.5 and 6 per cent.

title: German Linked to '19 Death Of Communist Leaders Dies
description: DUSSELDORF, West Ger many, June 5 (Reuters)Wal demar Pabst, a former German army major who is said to have admitted that he was responsi ble for the 1919 murders of Rosa Luxemburg and Karl Lieb knecht, died here on May 29 at the age of 89.

title: U.N. Aids Peru and Puts Dead at 50,000
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 5  The United Nations announced today that urgent measures were under way by its various agencies to rush food, medical supplies and other aid to victims of Sunday'S earth quake in Peru.

title: Miss Herrick to Wed
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., June 5Mr. and Mrs. Bayard Brooks Herrick have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Bayanne Leacock Herrick, to Lieut. Comdr. James Norval Hau hart, U.S.N. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Norval Reitz Hauhart of Dobbs Ferry, N. Y. An October wedding is planned.

title: Rev. Dr. Frank Pehrson, Jersey Presbyterian Aide
description: The Rev. Dr. Frank A.P. Pehrson, an executive of the Presbyterian Synod of New Jersey since 1960, died yester day in University Hospital, after a short illness. He was 53 years old and lived In Fredon, N. J.

title: RATE OF JOBLESS UP TO 5% FOR MAY, HIGHEST SINCE '65
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 Unemployment rose further in May and reached 5 per cent of the labor force, the Labor De partment reported today. In April, the unemployment rate was 4.8 per cent.

title: Problem of Vietnamese Minority Tops Ky's Agenda in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 5The potentially explo sive issue of how to resolve the fate of the Vietnamese minority of 400.000 in Cambo dia is the most difficult prob lem on the agenda of Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky's current visit to Pnompenh.

title: Companies Making Plans To Purchase Own Shares
description: The trend for companies to repurchase their own shares which has picked up speed as the stock market has declined accelerated yesterday.

title: Britannica Picks James Parton Of Heritage as New President
description: James Parton, whose outrage over the sanctioning of slang in dictionaries prompted him to publish his own and make it a bestseller, is moving from American Heritage to the En cyclopaedia Brittanica publish ine empire of William Benton.

title: Sarah Lawrence Graduates Forgo Gowns
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June Under gray skies, Sarah Law rence College graduated its 42d class today in a solemn out door ceremony that included poetry and music but no caps and gowns.

title: Kirsten Portrays A Met Butterfly Of Infinite Detail
description: Dorothy Kirsten's portray al of the tragic heroine of Puccini's Madama Butter fly is admirable in itself, but it is also fascinating as an example of shrewd, intelli gent professionalism. On Thursday night, in her only performance of the role with the Metropolitan Opera here this season, the soprano gave a lesson in how to use one's vocal resources to best ad vantage.

title: DRUG ABUSE HELD A MAJOR PROBLEM
description: Howard J. Samuels declared yesterday that narcotics addic tion had reached epidemic proportions in black and Puerto Rican areas and he called for sweeping reforms in the enforcement of antinar cotics laws.

title: L.I. Students Vote to Reject Commencement Speaker
description: OCEANSIDE, L. L, June 5 (AP)Graduating students at Oceanside High School voted today against having any speaker at commencement ex ercises, following a controversy over their choice of an anti Vietnam war Congressman.

title: Robert Lovat Colby Is Fiance Of Miss Gretchen H. Rogers
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 5 Miss Gretchen Harwood Rogers and Robert Lovat Colby plan to be married in September.

title: EARNINGS IN QUARTER OFF AT ALEXANDER'S
description: Alexander's, Inc., the New Yorkbased promotional store chain, reported yesterday lower earnings for the third fiscal quarter but higher income for the 40 weeks ended May 2.

title: ECONOMIC MODELS SPLIT ON OUTLOOK
description: Two of the nation's leading econometriclansboth using largescale, computerbased mathematical models of the economyoffered sharply dif fering views of the business outlook yesterday.

title: Sorensen Voices Doubt On Help of State Party
description: Theodore C. Sorensen, they Democratic State Committee's designated candidate for United States Senator, said yesterday that he was not sure that or ganization support would help him in the June 23 primary.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Defense Department to day identified the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: Rep. Anderson to Run Again
description: MURFREESBORO, Tenn., June 5 (AP)  Representative William R. Anderson, Demo crat of Tennessee, announced to an audience of nonvoters today his intention to seek re election to a fourth term. His formal announcement came in an address at the Tennessee Girls State Convention. Mr. Anderson was captain of the nuclearpowered Navy subma rine Nautilis on its historic voyage under the North Pole.

title: Artists to Withdraw Work at Biennale
description: Twenty artists of the 44 se lected so far to show in the American Pavilion at this year's Venice Biennale have with drawn their work as an act of dissociation from United States Government sponsorship, ac cording to the Emergency Cul tural Government Committee of the New York Art Strike.

title: RUTH S. DURAND, 89,  CHILDREN'S AUTHOR
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., June 5 Mrs. Ruth Sawyer Durand, a leading contributor to children's literature, died Wednesday at the age of 89.

title: Elizabeth Drew Bride Of Daniel J. Carlsson
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 5  Miss Elizabeth Connell Drew was married here this afternoon to Daniel Joseph Carlsson. The Rev. Dr. Dud ley J. Stroup performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of St. James the Less.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In 1928, a flamboyant Broadway ticket broker named Isidor Bieber entered into partnership with a reserved young horse trainer named Hirsch Jacobs. Bieber, nearly 20 years older than his partner, was already a legendary, scrapper, dude and philosopher. Jacobs had some small reputation as a pigeonbreeder. The partnership, based on Bieber's money and Jacobs's confidence that hard work, patience and common sense could win horse races, was considered an unlikely one. Forty years later people still wondered now it could last, even after Jacobs had sad dled a record 3,596 winners, and the odd couple's horses earned more than $15 million. In the beginning, BieberJacobs bought nickel horses, sick horses, malad justed horses and rehabili tated them. When Jacobs picked up expensively bred horses discarded from a great society stable, and won with them, it was sometimes suggested that he was nerving the horses, or deadening the pain of their injuries so they would run. Investigators made unan nounced raids on Jacobs's barns but never found any thing illegal. When he sent out dozens of claimers into cheap races, he was com pared to a taxicab fleet owner.

title: 4 in South Bronx Seeking Nomination for City Council
description: Four candidates, including the appointed incumbent, Barry Salman, are seeking the Demo cratic nomination for the seat from the 11th Councilmanic District in the South Bronx in the June 23 Democratic primary. This is the only spe cial election for the City Council in the coming prim aries.

title: Addonizio Is Linked To Dummy Account
description: TRENTON, June 5  The prosecution in the trial of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark and seven others told the court today that a dummy bank account had been used to funnel extorted funds to the accused.

title: A YALE PROTESTER IS KEPT OFF TEAM
description: The thirdranking member of Yale's varsity tennis team charged yesterday that he had been excluded from the Pren tice Cup matches against Ox fordCambridge because of his participation last April in a stu dent strike in support of a fair trial for Black Panthers.

title: India and Pakistan On Second Avenue
description: In the midst of the bustle of Second Avenue, Claude Le Tourneau has set up a pleasant oasis that's the next best thing to a trip to India or Pakistan. More prosaically, Mr. Le Tourneau is running a sort of import department store with two floors crammed with unusual things for the house or the person. Mr. Le Tourneau used to have a small shop, which concen trated mainly on house things, next door to his pres ent location at 1226 Second Avenue (between 64th and 65th Streets). There are still hundreds of pillows covered mainly in Indian fabrics, some old and all one of a kind, priced from $4 to $100. The basement level also has some shaggy throws woven in Iran of goat hair ($75) and a wonderful, patchwork tent ($600) from India that would convert a New York room into a setting for the Arabian Nights.

title: Church Installs Leader
description: AMHERST, Mass., June 5 (AP)The Rev. Avery D. Post of Scarsdale, N. Y., was in stalled today as president and conference minister of the Massachusetts Conference of the United Church of Christ at its 171st annual meeting.

title: Council Panel Opposing Car Tax and Ferry Rise
description: Mayor Lindsay's proposed $10 autouse tax and the 5cent Staten Island ferry fare appear doomed, a City Hall source said yesterday.

title: JOHAN A. PENGEL, 54, EXSURINAM PREMIER
description: THE HAGUE, June 5 (Reu ters)Johan A. Pengel, former Premier of Surinam, died in hospital in Paramaribo, the capital of Surinam, today. Mr. Pengel, who was 54 years old, had been Premier from 1963 to 1969.

title: U. S. Withdraws Announcement Of Airline Agreement With Italy
description: WASHINGTON June 5 (AP) Shortly after announcing the signing today of a new bi lateral air transport agreement between the United States and Italy, the Transportation De partment withdrew the an nouncement as erroneous.

title: Margaret Todd Becomes Bride
description: Miss Margaret Sherman Todd, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George M. Todd of Perrysburg, Ohio, was mar ried in the chapel of Christ Methodist Church here yes terday afternoon to Michael Onose Braun, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael A. Braun of Tokyo.

title: Texans' Charter Flight to Europe in Double Bind
description: The first major breakdown of the year afflicting an airline charter group headed for sum mer vacation in Europe occurred this week.

title: Air Controller Group Says Dismissals Were Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization said today that Secretary of Trans portation John A. Volpe had or dered delays in the proposed dismissal of hundreds of con trollers accused of taking part in the recent controller sick out.

title: City Plans to Close Fifth Ave. and 18 Other Streets on Some Saturdays
description: The city is planning to turn portions of Fifth Avenue and 18 other thoroughfares in the five boroughs into pedestrian shopping malls on several Sat urdays this summer.

title: Embattled Rumanian City Bolsters Dike for Next Phase of Flood
description: GALATI, Rumania, June 3 Seen from the embankment pro tecting the upper part of this industrial city and river port, the Danube looks like a sea and not a river.

title: Gulf Gets Oil Concession
description: TOKYO, June 5 (UPI)The Gulf Oil Corporation announced today the acquisition of a 38, 000squaremile oil concession in Indonesia from the Dearborn Computer and Marine Corpora tion and the South East Asia Oil and Gas Company. Terms were not disclosed. The conces sion covers an offshore area around the southern part of Sulawesi, an island in the Celebes, and inland areas with in the offshore area.

title: New Books
description: A More Perfect Union, by Robert Stapp (Harper's Magazine Press, $7.50). A view of the hemisphere if the Union and the Confederacy had developed side by side.

title: Thompson, Barrier Share Kiwanis Open Lead at 138
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., June 5 (AP)Rocky Thompson, ty ing the course record of 68, moved into a deadlock with Jerry Barrier today in the sec ond round of the $25,000 Ki wanisPeninsula open golf tour nament.

title: Mississippi's Governor Upholds Police in the Killing of 2 Negroes
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 5 (AP) Gov. John Bell Williams says that a state investigation showed the police acted in self defense in killing two young Negroes in a confrontation with students May 15 at Jackson State College.

title: Salvador and Honduras Agree to Set Up a DMZ
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, June 5 (UPI)El Salvador and Hon uras agreed last night to set up a demilitarized zone along their border where fighting broke out last summer.

title: Soviet Nobel Winner Joins Protest Over a Detention
description: MOSCOW, June 5Igor Y. Tamm, a physicist and Nobel Prize winner, has joined other prominent Soviet scientists in vehemently protesting the de tention of Zhores A. Medve dev, a biologist, as illegal, reliable sources said today.

title: Court in Boston Bars a Vote On a Constitutional Parley
description: BOSTON, June 5 (AP)  The State Supreme Court ruled to day that a constitutional con vention might not be called by popular vote.

title: EndRun on Rent Control
description: Few challenges confronting the city are more insist ent or put a sterner test on political courage than the necessity for basic changes in New York's World War II rent control law. These needed changes, now within grasp after years of timorous sidestepping at City Hall, have been placed in jeopardy by the efforts of some reform elements in the City Council to make votes by posing as protectors of tenants.

title: FRANK E. LALLEY
description: DURHAM, N.H., June 5 Frank E. Lalley, a former re gional advertising manager for This Week magazine, who later worked for the International Paper Company and most re cently at the resources develop ment center of the University of New Hampshire, died yester day, apparently of a heart attack. He was (60 years old and ?ved at 12 Grove Court, Exeter.

title: The Army's Political File
description: The Federal Court of Appeals in the District of Co lumbia is now considering a request for an expedited appeal, if not summary reversal, of a case that con cerns the civil rights of many people engaged in law ful dissent. It involves the Army's practice of collect ing information and keeping secret files on the political activities of civilians and organizations.

title: Learned Journals Are Inundating Scholars
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 28  If an average reader tried to catch up with one year's output of learned pub lications in the sciences, it would take him about 50 years of reading 24 hours day seven days a week.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Unwanted Power

title: April's Retail Sales Rose To a Record for a Month
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Re tail sales in April rose by near ly $600million, the largest in crease for a month in more than a year, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: College Honors Swigert
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., June 5 (AP)American International College awarded an honorary doctorate of science tonight at a special precommencement ceremony to John L. Swigert Jr., the Apollo 13 astronaut. Mr. Swigert was once stationed at nearby Barnes Airport. The col lege set up the special cere mony because he had a commit ment tomorrow in Alaska and could not he on hand for the regular commencement.

title: Richard T. Flanagan, 56, ExWebb & Knapp Official
description: Richard T. Flanagan, a pub lic relations counselor and a former senior vice president of Webb & Knapp, Inc., the real estate concern, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital, after long illness. He was 56 years old and lived at 205 East 78th Street and in West Hampton, L. I., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: FurWearing Is Months Off, but the Season for Looking Is Now
description: Furriers, who for so long have been villains in many eyes, are becoming heroes. These days, they're almost sprouting halos. Not only have most of them kissed and made up with the con servationists by avoiding endangered animals, but they're becoming dogood ers.

title: Rosewall Defeats Emerson
description: In a threehour match unpar alleled for drama, tension and the level of quality throughout, Ken Rosewall beat Roy Emer son, 46, 61, 64, 46, 75, last night at Madison Square Gar den and advanced to the final round of the $200,000 Tennis Champions Classic.

title: Charles D. Hamel,88, Dies; Headed Federal Tax Board
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., June 5 Charles D. Hamel, the first chairman of the United States Board of Tax Appeals, died to day at Fairfax Hospital after a long illness. He was 88 years old and lived in McLean, Va.

title: Philharmonic And Met Plan Parks Concerts
description: The Metropolitan Opera and the New York Philharmonic will again give free perform ances in New York City parks this summer as they have in re cent years.

title: Australian Miners Rush To Stake Nickel Claims
description: PERTH, Australia, June 5 (AP)  Hundreds of private prospectors and mining compa nies began pegging claims in the outback country north of Kalgoorlie today in the biggest nickel rush Western Australia has ever known.

title: Cup Scores on WQXR
description: Please do not telephone the New York Times or WQXR for scores of World Cup soc cer matches. The calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and the radio station. World Cup results will be given on WQXR lateevening hourly news reports.

title: White House May Widen Summer Youth Job Plans
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Nixon Administration, under sustained criticism from cities that say they face grim pros pects for the summer, is ex pected to announce shortly in creases in its summer job programs for idle youth.

title: U.S. WILL INCREASE QUOTAS ON SUGAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Deficits in Puerto Rican sugar output coupled with rising requirements in the Uni ted States will be covered by increased quotas from domestic and foreign sources, the Agri culture Department announced; today.

title: Suburban Libraries: Paperbacks to Paintings
description: Suburban libraries, grown increasingly professional and diversified in recent years, find themselves today in a state of good health that few other municipal services can claim.

title: Bradshaw Is Hospitalized
description: PITTSBURGH, June 5 (AP) Terry Bradshaw, the Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback who un ??erwent minor surgery May 25, was returned to Divine Provi dence Hospital today for what doctors said was intestinal flu.

title: Clothes Sale Scheduled
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 5The Grenville Baker Boys' Club will hold its an nual nearly new clothes sale on Wednesday, Thurs day and Friday at the Mews, a former carriage house on Lattingtown Road. Mrs. R. Brinkley Smithers is honor ary chairman of the event and Mrs. Walter S. Gubel mann is chairman.

title: 73 on Beirut Faculty Ask U.S. to Bar Jets to Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 5 (Reuters)  Seventythree fac ulty members at the American University of Beirut today countered the call by 73 United States Senators for more aircraft for Israel by sending a letter to President Nixon advising against the sale.

title: Indian Staff Cut Sought
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said to day that he had introduced an amendment to cut the staff of the Bureau of Indian Affairs to save more than $1million, Mr. Proxmire said the bureau em ployed architects, engineers and support personnel for de sign and construction of Indian projects, but that it often costs from 200 to 300 per cent more for the bureau to design and administer than it would to ob tain comparable architectural and engineering services from private firms.

title: Noontime Demonstration Disrupts Traffic in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 5 Demonstrators identified as students disrupted traffic in the center of the business district here today for the first time in more than a year and a half of strict police controls.

title: NIXON BIDS AGENCIES CUT PUBLICITY COST
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) The Nixon Administration ha ordered all Federal agencies to report how much money they are spending on public relations activities and, in effect, show why the amount should not be cut by 25 or even 50 per cent.

title: E.E.C. Currency Moves
description: PARISAs a move toward the monetary integration they envisage by 1980, the Finance Ministers of the European Eco nomic Community have decid ed that under no conditions will they widen the margins of fluctu ation between their currencies. Outlin ing the broad lines by which they could bring their economic sys tems more closely together, the Ministers of the six nations  France, West Germany, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg  furthermore agreed on the progressive nar rowing of their currency mar gins, but left until later a de cision on just when this proc ess should begin.

title: Aldeburgh Festival Hall, Razed In '69 Fire, Reopened by Queen
description: ALDEBURGH, England, June 5Queen Elizabeth II reopened the main concert hall of the Aldeburgh Festival today, just two days less than a year after it was destroyed by fire.

title: RISK IS TOO GREAT, TRAINER EXPLAINS
description: John Jacobs spoke in a wavering voice, but the mes sage was clear.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, JUNE 6, 1970

title: Nixon Bids Officials in Knoxville Put Off Legal Action in Heckling
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 President Nixon today urged officials in Knoxville, Tenn., to postpone legal action against professors and students who heckled him last week at a rally conducted by the Rev. Billy Graham on the campus of the University of Tennesse.

title: P.S.C.'s Head Reports Gains, but Fears Brownouts
description: The chairman of the Public Service Commission reported yesterday that the state's major utility companies had taken significant steps to increase their power supplies to meet peak summer loads, but that some brownouts were still likely.

title: NIXON BUOYS FOES OF CURBS ON WAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 President Nixon's personal in tervention appeared today to have buoyed hopes of Senators seeking to block an amendment that would curb the President's authority to mount future Unit ed States military operations in Cambodia.

title: MELLON RITES DRAW 1,600 IN PITTSBURGH
description: PITTSBURGH, June 5High ranking Government and corpo rate leaders were among ap proximately 1,600 persons who filled the East Liberty Presby terian Church today at a fu neral service for Richard King Mellon, the financier, who died here Wednesday at the age of 70.

title: AUCKLAND INQUIRIES INVOLVE AGNEW VISIT
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, June 5New Zealand's ombuds man, the official who inquires into complaints by the public against Government depart ments, began an investigation today into the aftermath of Vice President Agnew's twoday visit here last January.

title: MARY C. HATCH DIES; LIBRARIAN 29 YEARS
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 5 Mary Cottam Hatch, a staff member of the New York Pub lic Library for 29 years, died at St. Agnes Hospital Wednes day after an illness of several months. She lived at 22 West Hartsdale Avenue, Hartsdale, N. Y., and was the wife of Ed gun V. Wulff, an artist and illustrator.

title: B. S. ROSENST ADT,74, LITHOGRAPHER HERE
description: Bernard S. Rosenstadt, who retired two years ago as head of two graphic arts firms here, Ardlee Service, a directmail house, and Affiliated Lithogra phers, which produced chil dren's books for major publish ing houses, died Thursday at Albert Einstein Hospital in the Bronx. He was 74 years old and lived at 920 Greacen Point Road, Mamaroneck, N. Y.

title: Roundup: Baby of Twins Grows Upin Mound Debut
description: The Minnesota Twins sent The Baby to the mound last night against the Washing ton Senators and he grew up quickly.

title: NIXON PICKS LODGE AS VATICAN ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 The White House announced to day that President Nixon had named Henry Cabot Lodge as his personal envoy to the Vati can.

title: St. Lawrence Strike Ends
description: MONTREAL, June 5 (UPI) A twoday strike of 60 St. Law rence Seaway lockworkers ended late last night with an agreement by the men to re turn to work while negotiations on unresolved issues continued. The strike choked off the east ern end of the waterway for 36 hours, stopping 37 ships.

title: EisenhowerNixon Reunion
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Nixons and the Eisen howers plan a twofamily re union over the weekend at Camp David, the Presidential retreat in the mountain of Western Maryland: Among the Elsenhowers expected to as semble by late tomorrow after noon, a White House spokes man said, are the President's soninlaw, David; David's sis ter, Susan; their parents, Am bassador to Belgium John and Mrs. Eisenhower; and their grandmother, the former first grandmother, the former first lady Mrs. Dwight D. Eisen hower.

title: Ormandy and Philadelphia Are Hailed by Portuguese
description: LISBON, June 5 (AP)The Portuguese press said today that the performance of the Philadelphia Orchestra under Eugene Ormandy at the Gul benkian Music Festival was an exceptional artistic event.

title: REPORTER GUILTY IN CONTEMPT CASE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 5 Earl Caldwell, 32 years old, a reporter for The New York Times, was found guilty today of civil contempt by Federal District Judge Alfonso J. Zir poli for refusing to testify be fore a grand jury investigating Negro militant organizations.

title: NEGLECT OF OLD LAID TO GOVERNOR
description: Arthur J. Goldberg accused Governor Rockefeller yesterday of shameful neglect and dis regard of the elderly and promised elderly citizens that if elected he would work for the establishment of a $100 minimum monthly Social Secu rity payment.

title: NEWISSUE PACE HAS SMALL GAIN
description: Underwriters of new stock issues managed to assist few companies to go public this week, but the market re mained depressed despite a modest pickup in activity.

title: Rural Police Face Rising Crime
description: JEFFERSON, Iowa  The late spring wind was bend ing the foothigh cornshoots to the ground and tearing at the broken shutters on the abandoned farmhouse.

title: NIXON TO PROPOSE POLLUTION AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 President Nixon has approved a proposal by a White House advisory panel to create a new independent agency that would have responsibility for many of the antipollution programs now handled by severalv depart ments.

title: 4 Cargo Handlers Charged in Theft Of Gems at Airport,
description: Four aircargo handlers were arraigned yesterday in Brook lyn on a charge of stealing a $15,000 shipment of sapphires at Kennedy International Air port on Thursday.

title: Judge Basel Says He Was Offered Political Deal
description: Criminal Court Judge Amos S. Basel said yesterday that a leading Reform Democrat had offered him a deal in which, if the judge would quit the Democratic primary race for Surrogate, the incumbent Sur rogate would support court re forms.

title: Labor Consultant Gets 2 Years In Teamster Loan Conspiracy
description: Jack McCarthy, a labor con sultant who was convicted with two other men in April of con spiracy to take at least $42,000 in kickbacks for arranging a Teamsters union pensionfund loan, was sentenced to two years in prison yesterday.

title: MRS. MORGAN WHEELOCK
description: Mrs. Sylvia B. Wheelock, wife of Morgan Dix Wheelock, president of Braislin, Porter & Wheelock, Inc., a realestate concern, died Thursday, appar ??ntly of a stroke, in her home ?? 850 Park Avenue. She was ?? old.

title: DuPont to Build Plant
description: WILMINGTON, Del., June 5 (UPI)E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co. announced today it will build a formaldehyde plant with an annual capacity of over 200 million pounds at Healing Springs, N. C. Value of the plant was not disclosed.

title: Luger Vows to Upgrade State Narcotics Agency
description: Someone went up to Milton Luger recently  not long after he had been sworn in as the chairman of the New York State Narcotic Addic tion Control Commission and said, I don't know whether to offer you con gratulations or condolences. If you say that again, Mr. Luger replied, I'll spit in your eye.Those who know the ener getic, affable 45yearold ad ministrator might find it dif ficult to imagine any situa tion that would ruffle him. But in the relatively short time since he was sworn in on April 25, Mr. Luger has learned first hand why those condolences might not have been entirely out of order. It's wild, he says of his new job, but it's great. I don't want any condolences.

title: Vigilantes by Any Name
description: The selfappointed vigilantes of the Jewish Defense League have disrupted services, marred parades, picketed museums and radio stations, defaced photo graphic exhibits, broken up concerts. Their leader hinted strongly that the organization took credit but could not admit it for attacks on Arab representatives in offices near the United Nations. The police have not yet identified the criminals responsible.

title: DISCORD REPORTED ON BOARD OF I.O.S.
description: GENEVA, June 5Dissension has broken out again on the board of Investors Overseas Services as the troubled mu tualfund giant assesses at tempts to rescue it by pres tigious financial institutions.

title: Down Under, Where Buffalo Still Roam
description: DARWIN, AustraliaHaving found a home where the buffalo roam, about 30 American cattle men are making a new life in the vast, burning plains of the Top End, as Australian's call their country's far north.

title: Lutz, Gorman Gain Final
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 6 (AP)  Bob Lutz and Tom Gorman scored victories over South Africans today to make it an allAmerican final in the North of England grass championship.

title: BAR ON CUT RATES ON FUNDS SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Securities and Exchange Com mission, in a reversal of previ ous actions, proposed a rule today that would severely re strict the circumstances in which mutual funds may be sold with a reduced sales charge to employes of concerns affiliated with mutual fund organizations.

title: Antiques:
description: Faking antique furniture is a fine art that often goes unrecognized and unap plauded.

title: Doctors on the Cheap?
description: New Jersey has long been a disaster area so far as medical education is concerned. It has so few medical school facilities that the overwhelming majority of its young people who would become physicians must go elsewhere for their training. Its resources for graduate medical education are so unattractive that, as Gov. William T. Cahill pointed out last month, the state's hospitals can fill less than 75 per cent of their intern and residency vacancies, and then only by relying overwhelmingly on foreigners. Yet by any criterion New Jersey is one of the nation's wealthiest states.

title: Argentina Arrests a Suspect In Kidnapping of ExPresident
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 5 (UPI) The Argentine Government has arrested a suspect in the kidnapping of former President Pedro Eugenio Aramburu and believes General Aramburu to be alive despite a statement that he was killed.

title: Shift at John Carroll U.
description: CLEVELAND, June 5 (AP) The Rev. Joseph O. Schell has resigned as president of John Carroll University and the Rev. Henry Birkenhauer, dean of the graduate school, has been named acting president, the university announced today. The university said that Father Scholl, 56 years old, had re signed because of ill health.

title: Democrats Seeking to Heal ShriverO'Brien Rift
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Efforts were under way here today to conciliate an angry dispute between the Democratic National Chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, and Sargent Shrivel over the terms of a bid to Mr. Shriver to head a Democratic Congressional cam paign.

title: Fairchild Hiller Awarded SST Contract by Boeing
description: The Boeing Company an nounced yesterday the award of a $34.5million contract to the Fairchild Hiller Corpora tion for production of the fuselage section and tail as sembly for the supersonic transport prototype. Two com plete sets for the SST will be built by Fairchild for delivery to Boeing in 1971. The work will be performed at the Re public Aviation Division in Farmingdale, L. I., and at the Aircraft Division at Hagers town. Md.

title: Lord FrancisWilliams Dead; Journalist Was Aide to Attlee
description: LONDON, June 5Lord Fran cisWilliams, author, editor and public relations adviser to Prime Minister Clement Attlee, died today at his home in Abinger Hammer, Surrey.

title: Ottinger Says M.T.A. Ignores Safety Problems in the Subways
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger visited the Metropoli tan Transportation Authority yesterday and delivered a re port an alleged safety defects in the city subways.

title: LESTER DANIELSON
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 5 Lester C. Danielson, who retired 15 years ago as president of James E. Ward & Co., New York ship brokers, died today in Princeton Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived In James burg and formerly in Brielle.

title: AIR FORCE PLANS FOR PROTOTYPES OF NEW BOMBER
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Air Force announced today that it would proceed to design and build seven prototypes of a new bomber as the possible successor to the aging B52.

title: Nuptials for Miss Ingrid Junker And Roger Conant on June 22
description: Miss Ingrid Junker, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Arne Johan Junker of Kristian sand, Norway, plans to be married there on June 22 to Roger Royce Conant, a doc toral candidate at Columbia University.

title: Police Set Up Safety Unit
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary said yesterday that 640 patrolmen would be assigned to safety duty this summer at beaches, parks and other places of amusement. The men will be taught elementary forms of water rescue, resuscitation and first aid.

title: Uneasy Ulster Will Vote, Too, but Problems Remain
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 5Northern Ireland is the only part of Britain where the calling of a general elec tion means a call for more troops.

title: Suns Select Fitzsimmons
description: PHOENIX, June 5 (AP) Lowell (Cotton) Fitzsimmons, the coach at Kansas State Uni versity, was named today as the coach of the Phoenix Suns of the National Basketball Asso ciation.

title: ITALIAN PICKETS AT F.B.I. ARE SUED
description: Complaining of unbearable noise the tenants and man agements of three East Side apartment buildings filed a suit here yesterday demanding re lief from nightly picketing by Italian  Americans and their supporters outside the offices of the Federal Bureau of In vestigation.

title: Ranger Teammates Join Sawchuk's Family at Funeral Rites in Michigan
description: PONTIAC, Mich., June 5 (AP)Terry Sawchuk's seven children wept quietly this afternoon as their 40year old father was buried while many of his friends, team mates and former teammates looked on.

title: Charley's Aunt to Return
description: Brandon Thomas's comedy, Charley's Aunt, will be re vived at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, beginning July 1, un der the auspices of Jay H. Fuchs and Jerry Schlossberg in asso ciation with John Murray. Louis Nye will be costarred in it with Maureen O'Sullivan, Martyn Green, Melville Coop er and Eric Berry.

title: U.S. Marketing Aide Retires
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) Roy W. Lennartson, head of an Agriculture Department agency that operates food in spection, grading and market ing programs, announced today that he planned to retire July 31 from the Consumer and Marketing Service.

title: 10 FOES OF DRAFT GUILTY IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, June 5Ten per sons, including a Roman Catho lic priest and a seminarian, were found guilty today of burning the draft records of a Chicago Selective Service board.

title: SUIT ASKS A HALT TO DDT DISCHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Three conservation organiza tions filed suit in Federal Dis trict Court today, asking that the Olin Corporation be en joined from discharging wastes containing DDT into waters of a national wildlife refuge in Alabama.

title: FRENCH INAUGURATE A VASARELY MUSEUM
description: PARIS, June 5A museum assembling much of the life work of Victor Vasarely, the Hungarianborn abstract artist, was inaugurated today at Gordes, a medieval hilltop town ship in Provence.

title: ASTRONAUTS FIND HAIR OFFENSIVE
description: Capt. James A. Lovell Jr. and John L. Swigert Jr., the Apollo 13 astronauts, walked out of the rock musical Hair at the Biltmore Theater here Thursday night, apparently over what they considered to be slurs di rected toward the American flag.

title: Belmont Stakes Field
description: Owner

title: THAI BORDER FORCES PUT ON FULL ALERT
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 5 (UPI)A high official said to day that Thailand had put her forces on full alert along the border with Cambodia after North Vietnamese and Vietcong units were sighted north of Tonle Sap, the great lake of Cambodia.

title: My Dad George Becomes Favorite in Belmont as Personality Is Scratched
description: The longrange favorite for today's Belmont Stakes, Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs's Personality, was scratched by his trainer, John Jacobs, late yesterday afternoon. That reduced the number of contestants in the 102d running of the 1mile event to 10, with Raymond Curtis's My Dad George now occupying the favorite's role.

title: ARBOUR IS PICKED TO COACH BLUES
description: ST. LOUIS, June 5 (UPI) Al Arbour, the tirelesss, be specticled, captain of the St. Louis Blues, was named today as the team's coach, succeed ing Scotty Bowman.

title: MISS MANN CARDS 68 TO LEAD BY STROKE
description: BALTIMORE, June 5 (AP) Carol Mann of Towson, Md., playing five miles from her home, shot a fiveunderpar 68 today to take a 1stroke lead in the $22,500 Lady Carling open at the 6,449yard Pine Ridge golf course.

title: Mrs. Dolly Lurie Cohen, Philanthropist, 73, Dies
description: CINCINNATI, June 5Mrs. Dolly Lurie Cohen, a million aire benefactor of many philan thropic, interfaith, cultural and athletic organizations, died here last night after her fourth cancer operation in 30 years. Her age was 73.

title: PILCH TO AID MAILERS IN NEWSPAPER TALKS
description: George E. McDonald, presi dent of Mailers Union No. 6, said yesterday that John J. Pilch, president of the Interna tional Typographical Union, was coming here this weekend to assist the mailers in their negotiations with the city's four maior daily newspapers.

title: Transport Aides Call for a Commission on Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON, June 5De partment of Transportation of ficials said today, that they had endorsed the Air Line Pi lots Association's appeal last March for a Presidential com mission on aircraft hijacking.

title: Court Upsets Law Giving Incumbents Top Ballot Spot
description: State Supreme Court Justice Myles J. Lane yesterday in validated a recently enacted law that gave New York City incumbents the top line on the ballot for the June 23 primary.

title: Mrs. Chapin's Appaloosas Take 3 Blues in Jersey
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June Mrs. Elaine Chapin of Burl ington, N. J., scored a triple with her horses tonight in the West Jersey Hospital horse show.

title: Bargaining Gains Cited in Flood Case
description: The professional negotiator who was hired by baseball club owners three years ago to rep resent them in bargaining with the players' association testified yesterday that he felt the play ers have equal bargaining strength with the owners even under the reserve system.

title: Cards Get Cowboys' Wilbur
description: ST. LOUIS, June 5 (UPI) The St. Louis football Cardinals acquired John Wilbur, a start ing guard for the Dallas Cow boys the past two seasons, in exchange for a high draft choice today.

title: I. F. Stone, at. Amherst, Praises Youth
description: AMHERST, Mass., June 5 The graduating seniors of Am herst College heard I. F. Stone, the Washington journalist who has espoused various radical causes, applaud their genera tion and attack the American military establishment today.

title: Emily Galenson Is Married Here To a Psychiatrist
description: Miss Emily Galenson and Dr. Charles Harold Taylor Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon. Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick per formed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: GRAIN PRICES FALL ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Profit taking and speculative liquidation wiped out early gains in the major commodities fu tures traded on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Birth Control Case Appeal
description: BOSTON, June 5 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the First District has taken under advisement an appeal of William R. Baird, sentenced to jail for 90 days for giving a birth control device to a coed. Mr. Baird was freed on bail after serving 36 days when it was disclosed that three mem bers of the Massachusetts Su preme Judicial Court considered his conviction unconstitutional.

title: CHARLEY RETZLAFF
description: DETROIT LAKES, Minn., June 5 (AP)Charley Retzlaff, who was knocked out by Joe Louis in the first round in a bout in 1936, died yesterday at the age of 63.

title: Mets Wives to Model At a Hospital Benefit
description: The wives of a dozen Mets players will act as models at Shea Stadium on Tuesday when the Doctors Wives Auxiliary of Flushing Hospi tal holds its seventh annual benefit luncheon and fashion show at the Diamond Club. The proceeds of the $10a person event will be used to provide equipment for the hospital, the oldest nonprofit, voluntary hospital in Oueens.

title: Topics: The Art of Red Barn Campaigning
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y. In the 1966 campaign for Governor, Frank O'Connor of New York City stepped out of an airplane at Binghamton, ready to read a statement care fully prepared for the occasion. It was a lyrical tribute to Broome County, queen of dairy land.

title: Bond Club of New York Chooses New President
description: The Bond Club of New York has elected Avery Rockefeller Jr. as president. He succeeds Robert A. Pow ers of Smith, Barney & Co., who headed the club for the past year. Robert M. Gardi ner of Reynolds & Co. was elected the club's vice presi dent, succeeding Mr. Rocke feller, who is president of Dominick & Dominick. Inc.

title: Coast Bus Drivers Vote Pact
description: SAN DIEGO, June 5 (AP) Striking bus drivers voted to day to accept a new contract and end a walkout that had stopped buses since April 18. A union spokesman said the contract was for three years and gave $1.12 more an hour over three years to $5.28. The first step is 38 cents an hour more, retroactive to March 30, when a 32month contract ended.

title: U.S. Group Briefed in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 5 (UPI)A White House dele gation, including Governors and members of Congress, spent to day in closed military and eco nomic briefings before going to the Mekong Delta and Cam bodian border regions to see the Vietnam war first hand.

title: An Old House Means 1731, Not 1950
description: WEST NYACK, N. Y.  When the Daniel Brouns went house hunting six years ago, their first problem was semantic.

title: LONDON STOCKS ARE AGAIN MIXED
SLACK POLICE SEEK GUIDE ON ARMS USE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 5 The leaders of a national organ ization of black policemen asked the Federal Department of Justice today to assist in formulating sane firearms pol icies for all law enforcement agencies.

title: $12,616 REPAYMENT IS MADE BY MURPHY
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Senator George Murphy, Re publican of California, has in formed the Securities and Ex change Commission that he has paid to Technicolor, Inc., the $10,413 illegal profit he had made from the sale of company stock.

title: Robert Kennedy Theater Needs Funds for Summer
description: The Robert F. Kennedy Theater for Children may have to abandon its season of free outdoor performances of Toby Tyler at the Circus this sum mer for lack of funds.

title: SECOND DOWNPOUR ENDS GAME IN 8TH
description: CINCINNATI, June 5 Rain continued to splatter the Mets tonight, but it was the lightning of Bob Tolan's speed and the thunder of Tony Perez's bat that did the most damage.

title: HIJACKER DIVERTS PLANE TO DENMARK
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 5 (Reuters)A hijacker held a hand grenade to the neck of a Polish Airlines pilot today and forced him to fly over Sweden and land here.

title: San Marino Pledges To Bar Atomic Arms
description: SAN MARINO, June 5 (AP)The republic of San Marino pledged today not to acquire nuclear weapons for her army of 180 men.

title: HOBART STUDENTS CONFRONT POLICE
description: GENEVA, N. Y., June 5 (AP) A narcotics raid at Hobart College early today turned into a confrontation with students who were apparently outraged over the use by the police of young informer known as Tom my this Trawler.

title: Seoul Tells of Incident
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June  Two North Korean gunboats attacked and captured a South Korean naval craft with 20 crewmen aboard today near the seaward extension of the armistice demarcation line in the Yellow Sea, the Defense Ministry announced.

title: PARIS ENDS BOYCOTT OF EUROPEAN UNION
description: BONN, June 5France epded her 15month boycott of the Western European Union to day by attending a twoday routine session here of the or ganization's Ministerial Council.

title: Yanks Rout White Sox, 101, as Murcer Belts 2 Homers
description: It was like the good old times at Yankee Stadium last night.

title: Racism Issue Grows in Newark
description: NEWARK, June 5Charges of racism are playing an in creasing role in the runoff elec tion for Mayor here despite ear lier assurances by both candi dates to stay away from the volatile racial issue.

title: Soviet and France Assail Asia Action
description: PARIS, June 5France and the Soviet Union joined today in deploring the foreign inter vention that is widening and prolonging the conflict in In dochina.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON A BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market pulled back along a broad front yesterday in what Wall Street observers described as a consolidation move after the recent dramatic advance. The DowJones indus trial average dropped 11.50 points to 695.03.

title: Crowds Cheer Nasser
description: CAIRO, June 5  President Gamal Abdel Nasser drove through cheering crowds today to attend prayers for those killed in the 1967 war and for victory in a new conflict with Israel.

title: Miss Winifred Dickey Plans September Bridal
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 5 Daniel D. Dickey has an nounced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Winifred Cameron Dickey, to Spencer Kellogg 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Kellogg 2d of Old Brookville, L. I. Miss Dickey is also the daughter of the late Mrs. Mary Turner Dickey. A September wedding is planned.

title: Gambling Casino Computerized
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 The gambling casino has en tered the computer age. A system that was patented this week keeps a constant check on What is going on at all the tables, controlling the cash, chip and credit transac tions. Robert Howard and Dr. An Wang received Patent 3,516,068, assigning it to the Centronics Data Computer Corporation, of which Mr. Howard is president. The company reports that the system has been installed at El Conquistador, near San Juan, and at other Puerto Rican casinos.

title: MONTREAL IS ROCKED BY ANOTHER BLAST
description: MONTREAL, June 5 (AP)  A bomb exploded early today at the rear of an office build ing in downtown Montreal, the ninth blast in two weeks in the Montreal area.

title: In Memoriam
description: HIRSCH  Anna. In loving memory of my darling wife and mother. You shall always be remembered. Rest in peace.

title: Man Dies in Restaurant Fire
description: A twoalarm fire took the life of an elderly porter, and de stroyed the Shoals Restaurant, at 2 Shell Road, Great Kills, Staten Island, yesterday morn ing. The victim was Julius Kar dell, 88 years old, an employe of the restaurant for more than 50 years.

title: PERCIVAL WHITE MARKETING AIDE
description: Percival White, a leader in market research who wrote an early standard work on the subject, Market Analysis, in 121, and became first presi dent of the Market Research Council, died Thursday in New York Hospital, Westchester Di vision, in White Plains. He was 8 years old and lived in Pound Ridge and Fishers Island, N. Y.

title: But 'Twas a Famous Victory
description: LONDON, June 5Ironists who write our history will take much pleasure in the Cambo dian adventure. For in the end it seems likely to confound both the claims of its author, President Nixon, and some of the fears of its critics.

title: Peru Will Receive Aid From U.S. Red Cross
description: A team of four American Red Cross disaster  relief specialists is being sent to Peru to help administer the aid program for the victims of last Sunday's earthquake.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: Ra II Making Headway
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., June 5 (UPI)Norman Baker, naviga for on the Ra II, reported today in a radio message received here that Thor Heyerdahl's papyrus boat was making good headway in sunny weather in her transAtlantic voyage.

title: Outboards Finish One, Two In Bahamas Ocean Race
description: LUCAYA, Bahamas, June 5 (AP)An outboard boat won the Bahamas 500 today for the first time in the fouryear his tory of the island race.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOWS DIP AGAIN
description: The American Stock Ex change registered its second straight decline yesterday as the list sagged in slower trading.

title: SCHOOLS' BUDGET LOSES A 2D TIME
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y. June 5 Voters last night defeated the school budget here for the sec ond time in a month.

title: Maj. Gen. E. F. Harding, 83, ExDivision Commander
description: FRANKLIN, Ohio, June 5 (AP)Maj. Gen. Edwin Forest Harding, World War II com mander of the 32d Infantry Division, which saw service in New Guinea, died at his home here today. He was 83 years old.

title: A Calm Pilot's Pilot Billy Neal Williams
description: Billy Neal Williams, who grew up on the Oklahoma plains and wanted to be a pilot as long as he could re member, crouched behind a seat in the Boeing 727 Thurs day and, with his left thumb, cocked the hammer of a re volver thrown to him from the ground seconds earlier.

title: Tributes Are Paid To Senator Kennedy 2 Years After Death
description: Relatives of Senator Robert F. Kennedy and people who were his friends and political colleagues eulogized him in a memorial mass here yesterday, the second anniversary of his assassination.

title: Mrs. Bryant Posts Victory By 3 Strokes in Jersey
description: NORTHFIELD, N. J., June 5 Mrs. A. J. Bryant of Rockland captured the 20th Uebelecker Memorial Women's New Jersey Golf Association tournament today at the Atlantic City Country Club. Her total of 79, 87166 won by three strokes, competing over the 6,235yard, par 74 course.

title: RICHARD, CAM, BERT PLAY COUNTRYFOLK
description: Richard, Cam and Bert, who make up a very promising folk trio, will be appearing through tomorrow at the Gaslight Cafe, 116 Macdougal Street.

title: Goodtobegone, $8.40, First After 2 Are Disqualified
description: STANTON, Del., June 6 (AP) A double disqualification marred the running of the Tom Rolfe Purse at Delaware Park today.

title: Graham Leads Kemper Open by Stroke at 135
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 5 Lou Graham of Nashville, the only golfer ever to win a major tournament over the site of the forthcoming United States Open at Chaska, Minn., gained further distinction today. He carded a fourunderpar 68 for a 135 total that gave him a onestroke lead in the $150,000 Kemper open.

title: COMPANY REPORTS
description: Periods ended March 31 unless otherwise Indicated.

title: Court Bars Move To Halt Stock Bid For Detroit Steel
description: A spokesman for the Cleve landCliffs Iron Company an nounced last night that the Federal District Court in Chi cago had denied a motion by two shareholders of the Detroit Steel Company that would have blocked an offer by eleveland Cliff to purchase shares of Detroit Steel.

title: RACING DAYS OVER FOR LINDY'S PRIDE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 5 The retirement of Lindy's Pride, last season's fastest, most suc cessful and most affluent 3year old trotter, was disclosed today by Frank Lomangino, a member of the Lindenhurst (L. I.) syn dicate that owns the son of Star's Pride and Galena Han over.

title: Court Gets Hall for Kunstler
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., June.5 (UPI)  United States District Judge William A. McRae Jr. ordered the city today to make available the Civic Auditorium for a speech by William Kun stler, lawyer for the Chicago 7, Monday night.

title: TYSON RESIGNING MANPOWER POST
description: Mayor Lindsay announced with great regret yesterday the resignation of Cyril D. Ty son as Commissioner of Man power and Career Development

title: 4 Seized in Bronx As Loan Sharks For Taxi Drivers
description: Four men, two of them al legedly soldiers in the Mafia family of the late Vito Geno vese, were indicted by the Bronx County Grand Jury yes terday on charges of loan sharking, criminal contempt and perjury.

title: November Gains Net Final
description: Ricky November of Adelphi and Andre Heimann of Long Island University, won semi final matches in the metropoli tan college championship yes terday at the West Side Tennis Club, Forest Hills, Queens. No vember, seeded No. 1, defeated Kevin Graham of St. John's, 60, 61. Heimann defeated Walter Sadowski of Brooklyn Poly, 64, 36, 6363.

title: Stylish Bullfighter Wins Oles in Spain
description: MADRID, June 5Paco Camino, a wispy figure with a childlike, expressionless face, switched his cape be hind him, thrust his stomach out and advanced slowly on the black bull.

title: JOHN L. ADANK, 62, CHEMICAL OFFICIAL
description: John L. Adank, vice chair man of the Chemetron Corpora tion and, between 1963 and 1968, its president and chief executive officer, died yesterday lat his home in Chicago, after is long illness. His age was 62.

title: SONNY TUFTS, 59, ACTOR IN MOVIES
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., June 5 (AP)Sonny Tufts, the actor, died last night, a hospital spokesman disclosed here to day. A spokesman at St. John's Hospital said Mr. Tufts, who was 59 years old, had entered the hospital early this week, but refused to give further in formation.

title: Books of The Times
description: In a symposium on contemporary poetry sponsored by the National Book Awards in 1968, John Ashbery, who remarked that he doubted that there was such a school as a New York school of poets; that in any case the term had been thought up during the 10 years he had been away from the United States and that if the school did in fact have a program, it was only the ab sence of one. Poetry, he said, should be everything it wants to be.

title: EDGAR B. KAPP
description: Edgar B. Kapp, a senior as sociate of Lehman Brothers, the investment banking firm, died yesterday at Long Beach (L. I.) Memorial Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: CONSOLIDATED OIL WILL TRADE AGAIN
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced yester day that it would allow trading in the stock of the Consolidated Oil and Gas Corporation to re sume next Wednesday.

title: Market Place:
description: The worst part about pil ing a lot of losses in the stock and bond marketaside from walking to work  is that dreadful sensation of failure.

title: KREMLIN WARNS INDOCHINA REDS AGAINST CHINESE
description: MOSCOW, June 5The So viet Union warned the Indo chinese Communists today that they would be courting defeat and destruction if they let their actions be dictated by Communist China.

title: 3 Charged With Protesting In Temple Will Stand Trial
description: Three antiwar protesters charged with disrupting serv ices at Temple EmanuelEl were ordered to trial yesterday despite the synagogue's request that the charges be dropped.

title: Nixon on Potomac Cruise
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) President Nixon cruised on the Potomac River tonight aboard the executive yacht Se quoia. He was accompanied by staff members.

title: IllEquipped Cambodians Face Foe Near Pnompenh
description: SVAY ROLOM, Cambodia, June 5Two Cambodian battalions, poorly equipped but with high morale, are. trying to dislodge a wellarmed force of North Vietnamese and Vietcong only 11 miles south east of Pnompenh.

title: Stevens Applauds Dance For Its Special Allure
description: Dance, long a minority art In the nation, now has a special appeal that the American theater cannot match, Roger L. Stevens, the theatrical producer and chairman of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Per forming Arts, suggested yester day.

title: Mrs. Robb Gives Birth To a Second Daughter
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UN) Lynda Bird Robb gave birth, today to an ??pound, 13ounce baby girl, her sec ond child and former Presi dent Lyndon B. Johnson's fourth grandchild.

title: Parvin Files Suit On Stock Profits
description: The ParvinDohrmann Com pany has filed a suit in Federal District Court here asserting that it was entitled to short term trading profits made in its stock last year by two invest ment groups.

title: Hyndman, Bonallack Will Meet In British Amateur Final Today
description: NEWCASTLE, Northern Ire land, June 5 (APBill Hynd man of Huntingdon Valley, Pa., continued his cliffhanging play today with a 2up victory in the British Amateur golf cham pionship and gained a rematch in the final against Michael Bonallack of England, the de fending champion.

title: Paid Time Off Proposed So Workers Can Stump
description: A proposal that corporations give their employes two extra weeks off with pay prior to the November election to campaign for local candidates has been made by a Leading businessman. Lawr ence S. Phillips, president of PhillipsVan Heusen Corpora tion, said yesterday that his company would make this offer to its own workers who request such an opportunity because of the urgency of the matter and the divisive ness within the country.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
U.S. SPY SHIP SUNK, PYONGYANG SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 North Korea reported having sunk a heavily armed spy ship of the United States within its territorial waters to day, but the claim was immedi ately denied by the Defense De partment here.

title: Bridge:
description: The Eastern Regional Championships continue at the New York Hilton today with attention divided be tween two major events.For the majority of players the Master Pairs is scheduled at 1:30 P.M. and 7:30 P.M., in three flights according to masterpoint status. For the elite minority there is the semifinal stage of the Reis inger Knockout Team Cham pionship.

title: Dance: 2 OldFashioned Balanchines
description: Dancing, at its admittedly infrequent best, is such a joy to watch. There is a feel to it, a guts to it, a sheerly physical exhilaration to it, that hopefully makes the World feel better.

title: Swedish Premier Pledges Continued P.O.W. Effort
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Pre mier Olof Palme said today that Sweden would continue to try to help American prisoners of war in Southeast Asia.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Welsh Nationalists Think Time Has Come
description: CARDIFF, Wales, June 4 Each morning now in the steep, wet valleys of South Wales, the trucks and jeeps with loudspeakers meander along roads hemmed in by slagheaps and gray hills.

title: AMES ASKS PRIORITY IN U.S. ARTS OUTLAY
description: Aymas Ames, chairman of Lincoln Center for the Per forming Arts, called yesterday for a new priority in Gov ernment spending to aid the performing arts in the United States

title: Quake Reported in Sinkiang
description: WASHINGTON, June 5, (Reuters)A large earthquake rocked a remote mountainous region of Sinkiang in Commu nist China, the National Earth quake Reporting Center an nounced here early today. The quake registered 6.8 on the Richter scale, according to the center.

title: Blackmun to Be Sworn Into Court on Tuesday
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI)  Judge Harry A. Blackmun will take a com bined oath on Tuesday when he takes his seat on the Sunreme Court.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Disasters. The President declared North Dakota and central and southeastern Kentucky major disaster areas because of floods and authorized the use of all nec essary Federal aid to supple ment state and local disaster relief.

title: Racism in Britain's Election
description: An otherwise dull British election campaign has been livened up in the worst way. Once again, Enoch Powell, a George C. Wallace with an Oxford accent, has done his demagogic worst to arouse fears of white Britons about black inundation. He calls immi gration from Commonwealth countrieshe means colored immigrationthe greatest danger facing Britain.

title: Garrett Says He'll Quit Football for Baseball
description: Mike Garrett, the No. 1 running back for Kansas City's Super Bowl champions, said yesterday he would for mally announce plans next Monday to quit playing pro football after the 1970 sea son and begin a professional baseball career.

title: MRS. COURT GAINS FRENCH NET FINAL
description: PARIS, June 5It was over quickly.

title: C.B.S. Confirms the Death Of Syvertsen in Cambodia
description: The Columbia Broadcasting system issued an announce ment yesterday confirming the death of its correspondent, George Syvertsen, in Cambodia.

title: EINTRACHT DOWNS MILAN IN SOCCER
description: Eintracht Frankfurt, playing a strong game before 3,433 fans, defeated Milan of Italy, 10, last night in the United States Apollo Soccer Cup competition at Randalls Island.

title: E. F. Hutton Takes Two Orvis Offices
description: Robert M. Fomon, president of E. F. Hutton & Co., an nounced last night that Hutton had acquired the Chicago and Washington, D. C., offices of Orvis Brothers & Co., and that beginning Monday Orvis clients may be assured of the full in vestment services of the Hutton Company.

title: Counter And Amex Make Gains
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the over theconnter market continued to advance last week for the second consecutive week in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Lutz Captures GrassCourt Tourney at Manchester, Tuneup for Wimbledon
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 6 (AP)Bob Lutz, a United States Davis Cup player from Los Angeles, ended a barren spell today by defeating Tom Gorman of Seattle, 62, 97, in the final of the North of Eng land grass tennis championship.

title: New Plants to Look For
description: THE Federal plant breed ing program places most of its emphasis on food and commer cial crops. But every once in a while, budget and time are found for the development of new ornamentals. Many are in the background, awaiting multiplication for commercial release but a few are now available.

title: North Korea Is Asked to Confer At Panmunjom on Ship Seizure
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 6 The United Nations Com mand proposed to North Korea today that a meeting of the Mixed Military Armistice Com mission be held at Panmunjom on Monday to discuss the re ported seizure yesterday of South Korean craft by North Korean vessels in the Yellow Sea.

title: Synagogue Council Elects Brooklyn Rabbi as Head
description: Rabbi Solomon J. Sharfman of the Young Israel of Flat bush synagogue in Brooklyn, has been reelected to a second oneyear term as president of the Synagogue Council of America, the coordinating agency of Orthodox, Conserva tive and Reform Judaism in the United States.

title: Spotlight:
description: For the last 18 months of a grueling bear market, Blue Monday has become a famil iar phrase to the chagrin of millions of investors. It re fers, of course, to a down day in stock prices as a new week begins. With a Holly woodstyle touch, it even has rained  or snowed  on some of these bearmarket Mondays.

title: Miss Ellen Foster Huntington Married to Robert L. Bryant
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June  Miss Ellen Foster Hunting ton was married here this afternoon to Robert Laurie Bryant. The Rev. Dr. Donald M. Meisel performed the ceremony in the First Pres byterian Church. A reception was given at the home here of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Foster Huntington.

title: Fiery Run. Va. Who's for a Vacation?
description: FIERY RUN, Va., June 6 What this country needs is good long vacation. The people who are running the Federal Government, the states, the cities, the great commercial and industrial enterprises and the universities are bone tired and need to get away.

title: Concern About War and Racism Alters Commencement Rites
description: College commencements, tra ditionally as predictable in style and form as in oratory, have been substantially changed at many schools in the metropol itan area this year to reflect concern over the war in Viet nam, campus strife and racial injustice.

title: Pettit Is Elected Captain Of Lacrosse at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 6 William D. Pettit, a 5foot8 inch 150pound junior, was elected captain today of Prince ton University's 1971 lacrosse team.

title: 2,300 in Tokyo Protest War
description: TOKYO, June 6 (AP)An estimated total of 2,300 demonstrators paraded through Tokyo streets today, carrying antiwar placards and shouting for peace in Indochina, the police said. The demonstration was orderly.

title: Samuels Urges Language Aid for Poor
description: LEVITTOWN, L.I., June 6 Howard J. Samuels called to day for a massive state pro gram of remedial language training for the Spanishspeak ing peoples as a means of solv ing their economic problems.

title: 9 Fire Devices Damage Goods In Woolworth's on Times Sq.
description: Nine dicesized incendiary devices exploded in the Wool worth's store at Broadway and 44th Street shortly after 9:30 last night, touching off small fires and causing moderate damage to merchandise. There were no injuries.

title: Soccer a Rewarding Occupation
description: Many of the soccer players performing in the World Cup in Mexico enjoy incomes larger than the salaries of some heads of state. And this doesn't include income from extra activities such as endorsements, television commercials, newspaper columns and industrial investments.

title: P.S.A.L. Nines to Play At Stadium for Title
description: For 50 cents and a G.O. (General Organization) card, any student in the city can see the Public Schools Ath letic League baseball cham pionship and the New York YankeesMinnesota Twins game at Yankee Stadium Tuesday night.

title: 5 Years After Space Walk
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., June 6 (UPI)  Five years ago last Wednesday Lieut. Col. Edward H. White Jr. became the first American to walk in space. The occasion was honored with an Aviation Museum opening in a World War I hangar at Brooks Air Force Base. It was named for Colonel White, who was killed in a fire aboard an Apollo space capsule along with two other astronauts Jan. 27, 1967.

title: Andretti in Colorado Race
description: DENVER, June 6 (AP)Mario Andretti, the United States Auto Club's reigning national champion, submitted his entry today for the Rocky Mountain 150 scheduled for June 28 at Castle Rock, Colo.

title: Article 19  No Title
Military CallUps May Decide Major League Pennant Races
description: Military service for major league baseball Players, rang ing from two weks in sum mer camp to weekend meet ings with reserve units, could have an important bearing on the 1970 pennant races.

title: Moynihan, at Fordham, Decries Irrational Fear Plaguing Youth
description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan counselor to President Nixon, as serted yesterday that increas ingly nonrational, even irra tional fear and growing dis trust of all social institutions' were spreading among the na tion's youth.

title: Bettina Fitzpatrick Is Bride of Arthur Courtlandt Ely 3d
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., June 6The marriage of Miss Bet tina Fitzpatrick to Arthur Courtlandt Ely 3d took place here this afternoon at Larch meadow Farm, home of Mr. and Mrs. Guido Fridolin Ver beck Jr., stepfather and moth er of the bride. Justice of the Peace G. Campbell Becket performed the ceremony.

title: F. A. A. Unveils 4th Plan For Air Traffic Control
description: The Federal Aviation Ad ministration unveiled last week its fourth version of a controversial air traffic con trol regulation designed to reduce the risk of midair collisions over New York.

title: Article 15  No Title
Recordings
description: OUTLAW: EUGENE Mc DANIELS (Atlantic SD 8259). Eugene Mc Daniels has composed songs for Roberta Flack and, in the now distant sixties, wrote a few tunes that rode high on the pop charts. He is now a young musicbusi ness veteran, a fine singer and a stunningly inventive song writer. It is difficult, in fact, to think of any com poser since Bob Dylan who has managed so well to find musical expression for the swirling cultural currents that envelope us.

title: Kerr on Chicago 70
description: CHICAGO 70 is a jackinthebox en tertainment in which the transcript of the trial of the Chicago Seven, snippets of Alice in Won derland. tape recordings of banjos and organs and Arlo Guthrie and a handful of happy hippies riding Pogo sticks and white motorbikes are all crammed into the same container and then let fly as the lid comes off. Watching the lid come off is fun.

title: French Premier Gets A Victory Under Alias
description: PARIS, June 6 (Reuters) Premier Jacques ChabanDel mas reached the final of the senior doubles at the French open tennis championships today, but few in the crowd of 11,000 realized he was playing.

title: MT. VERNON HELPS WIN TRACK CROWN
description: ROCHESTER, June 6With a large contribution from Mount Vernon High School, Section I (schools from Westchester, Putnam and Dutchess Counties) won the intersectional track and field championships of the New York State Public High Schools Athletic Association to day at the University of Rochester.

title: McLaren's Epitaph: Man's Life Not Measured in Years Alone
description: The death of Bruce Mc Laren last Tuesday diminishes all of us. This gentle, kindly man was more than a race driver, more than a carbuild er. He was a friend to every one in racingin the pits, the stands, the business of fice, the motel lobby. Bruce didn't go out of his way to make friends he simply at tracted them. As a team captain he worked as hard as his men, and he was considerate of their well  being. He helped his competitors, and generously. One day last summer at St. Jovite, McLaren and his team mate, Denis Hulme, and his chief mechanic pitched in to help Lothar Motschenbacher start his car in a CanAm race. At Road America he worked strenuously on Mario Andretti's car.

title: Shades of Sadie Linger In Space Age Samoa
description: PAGO PAGO, Tutuila, American Sa moa  This bluesky place has doubled its images. No longer is it associated only with Sadie Thomp son standing in a pouring rain and Mar garet Mead surrounded by naked na tives and anthropology notebooks.
