It Is now in the jettourist orbit with a regu lar schedule of flights and an expansion of accommodations, and it has even been part of the space age since the April splashdown of Apollo 13.

title: Foster in Public Drill Today
description: Mac Foster, the undefeated heavyweight who meets Jerry Quarry at Madison Square Garden on June 17, will hold public workout today at the Garden's Felt Forum. Admission will be free.

title: $200,000 Tennis Final Set July 16 at Garden
description: The final match of the $200,000 Tennis Champions Classic will be held at Madison Square Garden on Thursday, July 16, according to Alvin Cooperman, execu tive vice president of Madi son Square Garden Center.

title: Crime Insurance Is Urged By Federal Administrator
description: He told a House banking sub committee that the problem of inadequate insurance must be solved, preferably through the private insurance industry.

title: Basis for Cambodia Drive Is Challenged
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee issued today a staff re port challenging the military reason given by President Nix on for ordering the Cambodian intervention and suggesting that the military gains claimed by the Administration were out weighed by the risks of a broadened war in Indochina.

title: Quiz No. 98
description: The position below occurred during the finals of the 1970 Marshall Chess Club championship. The piquant setting arose between J. Jacobs and Carl Weldon, with Black on the m??ve. White's pawn had simultaneously at tacked the foe's king and queen apparently on the assumption of always check, it may be mate.

title: Mobutu Arrives in Zambia
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, June 6 (Agence FrancePresse)Presi dent Joseph D. Mobutu of the former Belgian Congo flew to Lusaka today for a twoday state visit as The Times of Zambia carried a front page editorial urging him to curb the criminal activities of Congo lese nationals in Zambia.

title: VOTE IS DELAYED ON MINE NOMINEE
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Senate Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs has post poned for a second time a vote on the confirmation of Dr. J. Richard Lucas, President Nixon's nominee to be director of the Bureau of Mines.

title: AGNEW CONFIRMS SUMMER JOB PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Vice President Agnew an nounced today that the Nixon Administration would seek an additional $50million for ex pansion of job opportunity pro grams for young people this summer.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Most Political Science
description: MOSCOW  Genetics is the most politicized Soviet science because it impinges on the Communist system's most per plexing unsolved question adequate agricultural produc tion. Any geneticist who man ages to persuade the leadership he knows some surefire meth od of getting bigger and better crops inevitably acquires spon sorship at the top.

title: Rosemary Keenan Bride of a Lawyer
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 6  In the Roman Catholic Church of SS. John and Paul here this afternoon, Miss Rosemary Brady Keenan, daughter of John Gorman Keenan and the late Mrs. Kathleen Brady Keenan, was married to Brian Edward Lorenz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert E. Lorenz of Pelham Manor. The Rev. Philip Carey performed the ceremony.

title: Cup Scores on WQXR
description: Please do not telephone the New York Times or WQXR for scores of World Cup soc cer matches. The calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and the radio station, World Cup results will he given on WQXR lateevening hourly new reports.

title: Elections 1: Wallace Victory May Affect '72 Race
description: WASHINGTON  It was after midnight in the dispirited headquarters of Gov. Albert P. Brewer in an old hotel in Montgomery, Ala., and one of the workers was trying to ex plain things to a visiting Yankee. When you boil it down, he said, it was the rednecks versus the niggers and the Jay cees. Even in 1970, there are still more of them than us.

title: Susan Fordyce Bride Of C. M. Dunaway Jr.
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 6St. John's of Lat tingtown Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Gordon For dyce to Carlyle Manning Dunaway Jr. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. How ard M. Lowell, was followed by a reception at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. D. MacElree Fordyce, in Mill Neck.

title: OffDuty Patrolman Foils Cab Robbery in Brooklyn
description: Two armed cab passengers were routed in a running gun fight in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn early yesterday morning when they made the mistake of attempting to hold up the driver, an offduty tran sit patrolman, the police of the East New York station house in Brooklyn said.

title: Voices of Fisk '70
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. THE Revolution has visited Fisk University in Nashville, as it has most other American col leges. But with a difference. Perhaps Fisk itself is different, as it perceives itself to be. Founded in 1866, the school is alma mater to generations of influential blacks, among them the late W. E. B. Du Bois, probably the most celebrated scholar Black Amer ica has produced; Congressman Wil liam Dawson of Chicago; A. Maceo Walker, millionaire Memphis banker and insurance company president; John Hope Franklin, chairman of the department of history at the Univer sity of Chicago, and Frank Yerby, bestselling novelist. While Fisk has a scattering of white students, the school has always considered itself to represent the aristocracy of Negro education, and the Fisk tradition, though contested by other good schools like Morehouse in Atlanta, still suggests to many black house holds the best education available at a black college.

description: Trained in Ireland

description: Today  LongshoreSouthport K.C. allbreed show, Wilton Jun ??or High School, Route 7, Wil ton, Conn.; 1,728 entries; R A.M.

title: Is All Black Theater Beautiful? No
description: IN trying to be racially relevant, the theater is tearing at its own guts. It is caught in a bind, pulled one way by a sense of racial crisis, the other way by objective standards of quality. Overcome by black urgency, eager for black approval, impelled by a desire to be involved in contemporary problemsand to do something about themintimidated by the idea that only blacks can write about blacks (in fact, intimidated by black militancy in general), the theater has given in to artistic racism.

title: Louisa M. Howland Is Married To Frank William Miller 3d
description: Miss Louisa Meredith How land, daughter of Mrs. Murdoch Howland and Mc Clure Meredith Howland, was married in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church here yesterday afternoon to Frank William Miller 3d. son of Mr. Miller Jr. of Belle Meade, N. J.. and Mrs. A. S. B. Miller of Bronxville, N. Y. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read performed the ceremony.

title: Where John Kennedy Spent His Childhood
description: BROOKLINE, Mass.Every mother can influence her son to a great extent. . . .And what you do with him, and for him, has influence not for a day or for a year, but for time and eternity. The recorded voice is that of Mrs. Joseph P. Kennedy as she guides visitors through the three story frame house Where the 35th.Presi dent of the United States was born on May 29, 1917.

title: Olympic Advances American
description: Olympic Airways announced yesterday that it had named Victor H. Harrell a vice presi dent. The company said this was the highest post ever given to an American by the Greek airline.

title: SAMUEL BERLINER JR.
description: Samuel Berliner Jr., associate controller and funeral director at Temple EmanuEl, Fifth Avenue and 65th Street, died Friday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 150 East 77th Street.

title: Right On With the Young Lords
description: SUDDENLY in East Harlem last summer people began throw ing garbage and wrecked furni ture into the middle of the streets. Traffic was stopped frequently; mid town businessmen avoiding the clog of the East River Drive found them selves stalled inside stifling cars in an area whose residents looked upon their discomfiture with little sym pathy. The police and sanitation workers would clear one intersec tion and find that two blocks away east or west, downtown or up another one was blocked with the kind of debris that in middleclass sections of the city is not allowed to languish on the sidewalks. The Mayor's office got the message and a 24hour pickup of garbage was be gun. For a while El Barrio, that part of Harlem where the first Puerto Rican migrants settled, was cleaner than anyone remembered. With this garbage riot, the Young Lords first made their presence felt in New York.

title: VICTOR PAYS $11
description: High Echelon stepped into the spotlight as the big horse in the stable of Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs by winning the $158,750 Belmont Stakes at Belmont Park yesterday. Considered by the cognoscenti as a sort of poorrelative stablemate of the highly regarded Personality, High Echelon enacted the role of the understudy achieving stardom in notching the tri umph.

title: GEORGE PARKER, 70; HEADED ESSO EXPORT
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 6 George Macdonald Parker, who retired as chairman of the board of Esso Export Corpora tion in 1965, died yesterday at his home, 28 Patterson Avenue here. His age was 70.

title: Road Unit Honors Ethiopian
description: The International Road Fed eration has selected Dr. Haile Giorgis Workneh, Lord Mayor of Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, as its 1970 man of the year. The award is given annually for contributions in the highway and highway transportation field. Mr. Workneh is a former Minister of Public Works of Ethiopia and former chairman of the Ethiopian Imperial High way Authority.

title: Piranhas Owners Told To Dispose of Their Fish
description: ALBANY, June 6 (AP) Owners of any piranhas, the bloodthirsty tropical fish, will have to dispose of them by the end of this year, the State Conservation Depart ment warned today.

title: ENGLISH SETTER IS BEST IN SHOW
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 6 The naming of an English set ter as best in show early this evening brought a welcome end to a dreary day of intermittent, drenching rain at the 38th Green wich Kennel Club dog show. The winner was Dr. and Mrs. George Rosen's Canberra's Leg end of Commack, L. I., a 5 yearold orange Belton handled by Mrs. Rosen.

title: Aid to Peru Planned By Salvation Army
description: The national commander of the Salvation Army said here yesterday that the or ganization's institutions had been alerted to accept blank ets and winter clothing as well as cash donations to aid the victims of the earthquake in Peru.

title: U. S. Favors Allied Pacification Program in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The United States is known to fa vor a longrange pacification program in Cambodia and the, urgent training of Cambodiani troops by South Vietnamese and Thai advisers to prevent a Communist takeover of the country.

title: NIXON BACKS PLAN TO CONSULT YOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) President Nixon has endorsed a project to draw on the ideas young people have about fram ing Government policy. He said the proposal seems an excit ing experience.

title: Sukarno Marks Birthday
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, June 6 (Reuters)Former President Sukarno spent his 69th birth day today under military con finement in Jakarta.

title: Le Sport, C'est L'homme or Something Like That
description: Escape, escape! To what, to where? Well, to the pure ozone and relative solitude of wooded streams or the sea, to name two, listening to the screaking of gulls and the secrets the cicadas are eager to tell. But tastes differ. Le sport, c'est l'homme, as Hugo said, or something very close to it. Others, less contemplative, may choose headtohead competition on the links or battles on measured courts  some even prefer the re freshing postrace march to the pari mutuel clerk's window. Still others may be wafted to other places and times by simply communing with an author, himself involved in some form of sport. Here are some books that should add to the sportsmanathlete's pleasures of competing, of commun ing, of being somewhere else.

title: TransBeacon's Star Now in Eclipse
description: A stark drama with many of the elements of a Holly wood mystery is current ly being written by the TransBeacon Corporation, an entertainment  oriented com pany with approximately 15, 000 stockholders and two million shares outstanding.

description: Miss JoAnn Philomena Al bano, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent F. Albano Jr., was married here yesterday afternoon to James A. Cohen, a recent graduate of the New York University Law School.

title: A Horseback Journey Through an Oasis Of the PreJet Age
description: CORA, Wyo.It was midJuly, but snow still blocked the horseback approach to New Fork Canyon. As we reached the peak of mountain well above the timber line, multiple flashes of lightning illuminated the boulders like an El Greco painting. A nearby boulder smoked after a direct hit. The horses began to buck and neigh.

title: Milk Prices Rise

Consumers in major cities surveyed paid an average of 57 cents a halfgallon for milk at retail stores, the same as in April, but 3 cents more than in May, 1969, the department said.

When Interstate 95 is completed from Houlton, Me., on the border of New Brunswick (Canada), to Mi ami, it will be possible to drive this entire distance of 1,866 miles in 31 hours 6 minutes without exceeding 60 miles an hour. If walking had been a delight in the busy Bronx streets of my childhood and in the busier Manhattan streets of young married days, how much more enjoyable, I thought it would be, to be able to walk regularly in the green of the country.

Taken with President Nixon's recent announcement that his special $1.5billion school fund would go primarily for desegregation this suggests that the Administration is at last settling down to complete the job of ending dual school systems in the smalltown and rural South.
