description: Controller Abraham D. Beams urged yesterday that city agencies be prevented from hiring consultants without pub lic notice or prior approval of the Board of Estimate.

title: GRAHAM, WITH 206, HOLDS SHOT EDGE
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., June 6 Three holes earlier Lou Graham said his heart was pounding as he played through trees and over a lake to save a par. Then at the 18th green of the Quail Hollow Country Club, the 32 yearold Nashville professional sank an 18foot putt for a birdie 3 and held the lead after 54 holes in the $150,000 Kemper open. That final putt completed a 1underpar round of 71 for aggregate of 206.

title: Roger Sayers, Ray Vaughn Named to Hall of Fame
description: KANSAS CITY, (AP)Roger Sayers, former University of Omaha star, and Ray Vaughn, coach of Oklahoma Christian College have beeen named to the National Association of In tercollegiate Athletics track and field Hall of Fame. Omaha is now a branch of the Uni versity of Nebraska.

title: FIRST WET VOTE IGNORED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, June 6Cali fornia had its first wet general primary election of the century this week, but few seemed to care.

title: Saints Sign Easley, Otis
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 6 (AP) The New Orleans Saints to day signed Mel Easley, a sixth round draft choice from Ore gon State, and Jim Otis, a ninthround draft choice from Ohio State. Easley is a safety and Otis a running back.

title: Girl in a Pink Suit Keeps 3 Dolphins In Line at Aquarium
description: Three whitesided dolphins are put through a series of training exercises five days a week before fascinated audi ences at the Coney Island Aquarium.

title: Schoolboy Discus Mark Set
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 6 (AP)Chris Adams of Los Altos broke the national high school discusthrow record to day for the second time this year with a toss of 206 feet 3 inches in the California State track meet.

title: Chinese way with lettuce
description: Lettuce in the average American household is strictly for the salad bowl, but it has other, fascinating uses. Europeans braise it and serve it as a vegetable; they sometimes cook in soup. The Chinese use the fresh leaves sandwichstyle finger food, as it werewith fillings like hot minced squab hot fried rice. There is a recipe here for lettuce filled with ginger fried rice and one for Jim Lee's Young Jewel fried rice, in which shredded lettuce is mixed with chicken, pork and shrimp. (Young Jewel is a corruption of Yeung Chau, a province of ancient China famous for its friedrice dishes.)

title: Black Police Urge Arrest Of White Ones for Murder
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 6 (UPI)A national group of black policemen adopted a res olution today approving on thespot arrests of white po licemen in cases where they perpetrate the murders of black brothers.

title: Coal Order Expected to Ease Shortage for T.V.A.
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 6 A $217,175,000 order for coalin two longterm con tractsis expected to help case a serious shortage of coal for Tennessee Valley Authority steam plants in the sevenstate region served by the T.V.A.

description: Regulations on Conversions to Coops Debated

title: City Hires Engineering Firm To Study New Subway Trench
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city had hired an engineering consultant firm to explore the feasibility of using tunneling or mining methods in Central Park rather than opencut construction to build part of the new 63d Street subway from Queens.

title: U.S. Income Maintenance Plan Urged by Welfare Conference
description: CHICAGO, June 6The Na tional Conference on Social Welfare called yesterday for an adequate, federally financed income maintenance program for the nation's poor.

title: Arfons Clips Own Mark In QuarterMile Race
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., June (AP)Art Arfons shattered the world quartermile elapsedtime record today, gunning his 34,000horse power jet car down Bristol International Speedway in 6.07 seconds.

title: NONBETTING RACES LURE YOUNG FANS
description: WESTBURY, L. The last item was an allexpense paid trip to Mon treal and David Brenner of Copiague, L. I., was the winner of the draw that will send, him to the Man and His World extravaganza.

description: MILWAUKEE, June 6 (AP) Danny Walton hit a two run homer today as Milwaukee topped Baltimore, 64, ending the Brewers' losing string at five games.

Steve Tannen of Florida, Richard Caster of Jackson State and Dennis Onkotz of Penn State, the Jets' top selections, plus Jim Files of Oklahoma, first choice of the Giants, were on the squad of 54 players selected by Otto Graham, the coach, to meet the Kansas City Chiefs in Soldier Field, Chicago on July 31.

title: HOUSING PROPOSALS BACKED AT HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) The Council of Housing Pro ducers agrees with the objec tives of the Nixon Adminis tration's proposal to consoli date various federally assisted housing projects, Congress has been told by a former Federal Housing Administration chief.

description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 6Valiant, an America's Cup hopeful, was on hand today for a practice run when the first day of the 116th annual New York Yacht Club re gatta was put off because of lack of wind as 58 skippers failed to complete the first race.

title: Rise Predicted In Farm Exports
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)  Agriculture Depart ment economists say the decade of nineteenseventies holds some promise of an increase in United States farm exports if prices of commodities are competitive with foreign supplies.

title: Carrier Develops Odor Process
description: The Carrier Corporation announced last week that it had developed a new odor destruction process to curb the discharge of industrial odors into the atmosphere.

title: U.N. to Discuss Cyprus Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 6The Security Council will meet Tuesday afternoon to consider the possible extension of the United Nations peace keeping force in Cyprus. The force, which was established in March, 1964, to stop the fight ing between Cypriotes of Greek and of Turkish origin, ends its latest sixmonth term op June 25.

title: Goldberg Hits Rockefeller on Housing
description: Arthur J. Goldberg discussed the myriad problems of housing yesterday in the living room of a neatly kept but crowded apartment in a slum building, and accused Governor Rocke feller of being insensitive to the need for rehabilitation and of having misallocated funds for construction.

title: Youth Jailed in Flag Case
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio, June 6 (AP)A Youngstown judge has sentenced a suburban Board man youth to 10 days In jail long enough, the judge said, for the youth to write the Pledge of Allegiance 500 times. William Short, 19 years old, was ar rested May 8 for allegedly tak ing some small American flags from Central Square in down town Youngstown. The arrest ing officer said the youth had told him that he did not like the police and he did not like ??.

title: Miss Susan McConnell Is a Bride
description: GREENVILLE, Del., June 6 Miss Susan du Pont Mc Connell and John Anthony Mahler Jr. were married here this afternoon in Christ Church Christiana Hundred (Episcopal). The Rev. Dr. John O'Hear, assisted by the Rev. Dr. Charles Clarkson, Performed the ceremony.

title: PHILLIES TRIUMPH OVER ASTROS, 73
description: HOUSTON, June 6 (UPI) Larry Hisle hit a tworun homer and Doc Edwards, a coach ac tivated as a catcher before the game, contributed three hits to account for three other runs tonight as the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Houston As tros, 73.

title: Dickens After One Hundred Years
description: Charles Dickens died on the evening of June 9, 1870. The news of his death flashed around the world and was carried in the June 11 edition of The New York Times. In those days the front page of The Times was made up of seven unbroken columns of type. The article reporting on the sad and unexpected event (Dickens was only 58) occu pied more than five of those columns. In addition, a leading editorial of more than two columns in length was devoted to the same subject. During the following two weeks stories of varying size but comparable prominence were published regularly. Such was the nature of Dickens's fame, such was the world in 1870, such, even, was its superior journalism.

title: Hij acking Still a Problem But There Is Progress
description: The president of Trans World Airlines, Forwood C. Wiser, was waiting for an elevator at mid day Thursday, en route home to nurse a bug picked up on a trip to Damascus after a hijack ing last summer. Then someone came running out of his office to stop him. It had happened again, and again it was no routine diversion to Havana.

title: DOUBLE DARE WINS IN SHIELDS SAILING
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 6Joseph F. O'Hora and Dr. George K. Brazill Jr., coskip pers of Double Dare, won their fourth consecutive Shields Class race on Long Island Sound to day as the Beach Point Yacht Club Conducted the season's sixth Yacht Racing Association championship regatta_ limit.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 6 Although his manslaughter conviction was overturned by the courts more than a week ago, Huey P. Newton, the Black Panther leader, remains in prison.

title: Turkey's Turquoise Coast
description: ANTALYA, Turkey  For years, even decades, a visit to Turkey meant simply a visit to Istanbul. Then the Aegean Coast opened up, with its snug harbors, coastal vil lages and evocative ruins. Now there is something elsethe Turquoise Coast, a 250milelong playground beside the Mediterranean.

title: A Molester Suspect Shoots L.I. Detective and Is Slain
description: NORTH PATCHOGUE, LT., June 6A man about 35 years old was shot and killed here, this afternoon by the Suffolk County police just after he al legedly shot and seriously wounded a detective who was about to question him.

title: Hadden, Top QuarterMiler, Named Captain at Lafayette
description: Douglas W. Hadden, a junior from Medford, N. J., has been named captain of the 1971 La fayette College track and field team.

title: Mexican Standoff?
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, June 6At noon, local time, at the Jalisco Stadium to morrow, England, the World Cup holder, will play Brazil, its predecessor, in a match that has fascinated and im passioned the world of foot ball.

title: CURTIS'S SOLING LEADS IN REGATTA
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., June 6 David Curtis of Marblehead, Mass., at the helm of Black Widow, won the opening race of the Pequot Yacht Club invi tation Soling Class regatta on Long Island Sound today in light and tantalizing breezes.

title: Denver Post Gets Award for Aiding Safety on Highway
description: The Alfred P. Sloan awards for highway safety were pre sented last week at the Plaza Hotel. They were given in three categories, broadcasting, print media and creative work for efforts in promoting safety on the highways and better driv ing.

title: Elections 2: California Gives Clues To Trends In Nation
description: LOS ANGELESFinding a co herent pattern in the results of the California primaries is about as easy as finding one in a psychedelic light show. But last Tuesday's elections offered at least fragmentary insights into the political temperament of the largest state, and perhaps the country as a whole.

title: Belgium Abandons Plan For a Giant Tanker Port
description: BRUSSELS, June 6The Bel gian Government has decided to develop the three national ports  Antwerp, Ghent and Zeebruggefor handling ships of up to 125,000 tons.

title: Trinity Professor, 33, Named to Head Oberlin
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, June 6 (AP)Rohert W. Fuller, 33 yearold dean of the faculty and a professor at Trinity College in Hartford, was named the 10th president of Oberlin College today.

title: Odd Thing to Worry About, Ethics
description: MINNEAPOLIS. HE Walker Art Center's new exhi bition, Figures/Environments, combines works by eight Ameri cans classifiable to one degree or another as sculptors. They represent the strength today of a formidable strain in American art that one would have expected to yield to the double triumphs of the camera on one hand and abstract art on the other. You can go back as far as you want and find American artists fascinated by (appar ently) objective realism, with Copley's portraits, before he Anglicized himself, among early examples. The Whitney's exhibition of 19thcentury American still life painting, The Appearance of Reality, illustrates another phase.

title: MOTHERS MOURN IN L.I. CEMETERY
description: PINELAWN, L. I., June 6 The mother of a young soldier who died In Vietnam last year was joined by more than 100 other mothers in a simple cere mony yesterday before a small white headstone at the national cemetery here to commemo rate her son's 20th birthday.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: A Selection of Recent Titles
description: The following list has been select ed from titles reviewed since the Christmas Issue of December 7, 1969. Such a list can only suggest the high points in the main fields of reader interest. Books are arranged alphabetically under subject head ings. Quoted comments are from ear lier issues of the Book Review.

title: FundRaising Policies of U. S. Ski Association Facing a Strong Challenge
description: The annual convention of the United States Ski Association, which opens a fiveday stand in San Francisco Tuesday, is like ly to develop into one of the Most heated sessions in that organization's 66year history.

title: Burns Center to Cut Service
description: CINCINNATI, June 6 (UPI) The Shriners' Burns Institute here, which is regarded as one of the best treatment centers in the country for burned chil dren, will reduce its patient capacity by half because of cut backs in the budget. Richard Duncan, chairman of the in stitute's board of directors, said Wednesday that the insti tute would reduce its present patient load from 19 to 15. The institute can normally accept about 30 children.

title: Child to the Watsons
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., June 6A daughter was born on May 21 to Mr. and Mrs. Russell E. Watson 3d at the Phelps Memorial Hospital in North Tarry town. Mrs. Watson is the former Miss Susan Jane Waterbury, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Waterbury of IrvingtononHudson. The child, named Sarah Ford de Mott Stevens, is a grand daughter also of Mr. and Mrs. Russell E. Watson Jr. of Kalamazoo, Mich. The child's father is a general editor of Newsweek maga zine in New York.

title: WOMEN TO START TOURNEY TUESDAY

This 54 hole medal play championship will continue through Thurs day, with Mrs. Mark A. Porter of the Riverton (N. J.) Country Club, defending the title she won last year.

title: Laird Arrives in Venice
description: VENICE, Italy, June 5 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird arrived in Venice on a military plane today to take part in a meeting of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's nuclear planning committee.

description: ROME, June 6The strains of The Internationale min gled with Puccini's Hymn to Rome this week as the cam paign for Italy's local elections reached a finale.

description: CHARLESTON, S. C., June 6 (AP)The first giant C5A Galaxy to be turned over to the Air Force lost one wheel and blew out a tire today as it landed at the Charleston Air Force Base.

description: BOSTON, June 6 (UPI)  A bill to require the recitation of either the Pledge of Allegiance or certain parts of the Declara tion of Independence in school was vetoed yesterday by Gov. Francis W. Sargent.

title: Counting Sheep in New England
description: THE abandoned pasture across the road from our house in Connecticut seemed to beg for occupants, and after much thought we decided to populate it with a small flock of Hamp shire sheep.

title: Constance Martin Wed on Coast To Richard Goodyear, Lawyer
description: HILLSBOROUGH, Calif., June 6Guests were trans ported on motorized cable cars up the driveway of the home of Mr. and Mrs. Fran cis Augustus Martin Jr. for the garden. wedding that unit ed their daughter, Miss Con stance Martin, and Richard Goodyear of New York, son of Mrs. John Goodyear of Washington and the late Mr. Goodyear.

title: Skies Brighten Early for Baeza's Supporters
description: When the rain let up, some of the horseplayers held their palms out, testing for the all clear.

title: Article 3  No Title

description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 6Miss LisaMargaret Stev enson and Airman Alexander Campbell Sanger, U.S.A.F., a grandson of the late Mrs. Margaret Sanger, the birth control pioneer, have become engaged.

title: Best Seller List
We May Never Know How Many Died in Peru Quake
description: LIMAThe Callejon de Huay las is a steep northsouth valley known as the Switzerland of Peru. Its inhabitants live on agri culture and tourism and boast such lovely Spanishcolonial cen ters as Yungay, Ranrahirca rebuilt and expanded following an earthquake there eight years ago  and other towns. There are also innumerable Indian set tlements in the surrounding high lands and valleys.

title: Hockey's Violent World
description: The irony in Terry Saw chuk's death is that after 20 years of holding down one of hockey's most dangerous positions  goalie  he suc cumbed to injuries suffered on the lawn of a rented house after the season was over.

title: Blazers Sign 2 Draftees
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 6 (AP) The Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Associ ation today signed Billy Gas kins of the University of Ore gon and Claude English of the University of Rhode Island. Gas kins was a No. 9 draft pick and English, No. 7.

title: SIHANOUKSAYSCHINA FINANCES HIS REGIME
description: PARIS, June 6 (UPI)Prince Norodom Sihanouk said in an interview broadcast today that Communist China was giving him a loan to finance his gov ernmentinexile, and providing him with arms and transport for a bid to overthrow the new Cambodian regime that ousted him in a coup.

title: YOUTH SLAIN, SECOND KNIFED IN A HOLDUP
description: One youth was killed and another was stabbed last night in a Brooklyn park when, the police said, the man they hoped to buy heroin from at tempted to rob them.

title: FOREST SERVICE SCORED IN REPORT
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5A United States Forest Service in vestigative team has formally lodged some sweeping com plaints about the service's own policies and practices in its re lation with the timber industry and other commercial interests.

title: Editor Is Elected to Board
description: ARLINGTON HEIGHTS, ??., June 6 (UPI)  Norman E. Isaacs, executive editor and vice president of The Louisville CourierJournal and The Louis ville Times, has been elected to the board of directors of Pad dock Publications, Inc., a group of 10 daily and five triweekly suburban newspapers serving 18 communities with a com bined population of 300,000. Mr. Isaacs' election was an nounced Wednesday.

title: AllAmericas
description: Aquarius, a deep pink grandiflora shown above, is one of three AllAmerica Rose Selections awarded for 1971. The other two are Command Performance, an orange red hybrid tea, and Redgold, a bicolor floribunda with chrome yellow and red flowers. Two of these roses, the grandi flora and the hybrid tea, were hybridized by Dr. David Armstrong while the flori bunda is an Irish import by Dickson and has already won a Certificate of Merit of the Royal National Rose Society in Vic toria, Australia. These three roses have gained the AARS award after receiving two years of testing in 23 trial rose gardens throughout the United States. The plants are selected for performance, quality, vigor, hardiness and endurance. The varieties will be ready for sale at fall planting season.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, JUNE 7, 1970

title: Presbyterians to Raise $70Million for the Poor
description: The 3.2 millionmember Unit ed Presbyterian Church has begun preliminary work on a campaign to raise more than $70million to be used in de pressed areas and among de prived people.

title: Everything was wrong about Shirley, including her name
description: Dividing the world up into Us and Them is a sin, a blunder and a thing we blundering sinners find ourselves doing all the time whether we mean to or not. Mavis Gallant has written a book about a woman who can't manage this feat. It is very funny and very frightening. Any reader (ex cept Them, those callous louts) is going to be caught in a whirlpool of mirth and shame, wincing with help less laughter and horrified recogni tion, remembering gaffes and faux pas and hallucinated love affairs where each partner was going in a different direction and talking an other language. The resemblance of Miss Gallant's characters to most of humanity, living or dead, is far from coincidental.

title: Penn Outrows Georgetown by 3 Lengths to Win Steward's Cup on Schuylkill
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6 The Penn varsity eight, beaten only by Harvard in the Eastern sprint championship, won its sixth cup race of the season on a calm Schuylkill today.

title: They Listen When Mrs. Smith Speaks
description: WASHINGTON  From the press gallery 20 feet above her desk, the aye and the no of Margaret Chase Smith on a rollcall vote are often so soft as to be indistinguishable. But when the senior Senator from Maine raises her voice in de bate, the Senate, and often the nation, listens.

title: Getting to the Airport Is a Cinch in Cleveland
description: CLEVELANDAnyone in Cleveland who wants to get to Hopkins International Airport, which lies 14 miles southwest of Public Square, the center of downtown Cleve land, needs only 40 cents and enough ability to find the Cleveland Transit System's rapidtransit line. Twenty min utes later, he can disembark right at the airport and walk under shelter into the terminal building.

title: High Echelon Triumphs
description: Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs's High Echelon won the 102d run ning of the $158,750 Belmont Stakes yesterday at Belmont Park and paid $11 to win. Needles n Pens was second and Naskra third. (Details in Section 5)

title: Economy: Sometimes The Bad News May Be Good
description: WASHINGTON  The United States economy has been for months in the unusual situation where many persons, particular ly in the financial markets, re gard good news as bad and bad news as good.

title: Hundreds Executed in Kwangtung as Drive Against Criminals and Counterrevolutionaries Intensifies
description: HONG KONG, June 6 Many hundreds have been publicly executed in Kwang tung Province in southern China over the last two months on a wide variety of charges. This is an assessment made by specialists in Chinese affairs on the basis of reports from trav elers and refugees.

title: OFFICIALS APPROVE DRUG FIGHT PLAN
description: A plan to set up a standing committee of mayors and town supervisors from the metro politan area to deal with the problem of drug abuse was ap proved yesterday by the repre sentatives of 20 communities.

title: GraduatestoHearArmstrong
description: OXFORD, Ohio, June 6 (UPI) Neil A. Armstrong, the first man to walk on the moon, will deliver the main address at Miami University's 131st com mencement here June 14. Mr. Armstrong and another former astronaut, Col. James A. Mc Divitt of the Air Force, will re ceive honorary doctor of sei lence degrees.

title: Wildest Street in the West Tamed by Bulldozers
description: DODGE CITY, KansFront Street, once the most lawless boulevard in the world, is being gobbled up by the 20th century. It will be come a fourlane divided highway, com plete with a huge parking lot, thus eas ing the way for the more than 400,000 tourists who flock here each year to explore the replica of the famous street. The replica lies several blocks north west of the original Front Street.

title: White House Blocks a Bill on Creating New Cities
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 The White House has over ruled plans by the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment to send to Congress this year comprehensive legislation to assist in the creation of new cities.

title: Pirates Subdue Dodgers, 7 to 6, on May's 2Out Pinch Single in 12th Inning
description: PITTSBURGH, June 6 (AP) Jerry May hit a twoout pinch single in the 12th inning to night to drive in Pittsburgh's winning run as the Pirates to??ed Los Anopleg 76.

title: TOWN NEAR BORDER SHELLED IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, June 6 (Reuters) Arab guerrillas shelled the Israeli border town of Qiryat Shmona today from across the Lebanese frontier, but the So vietmade Katyusha rockets caused no damage or casualties, an Israeli Army spokesman said. He added that Israeli ar tillery had fired back at the rocket bases, on the western s??o??es of Mount Hermon in an area overrun by an Israeli task force last month.

title: Son of Dearborn Mayor Withdraws From Race
description: DEARBORN, Mich., June 6 (AP)  John Hubbard, 35 years old, says he still wants to be Mayor of Dearborn but has decided to wait a few years before seeking the of fice that his father, Orville Hubbard, has held for 29 years.

title: Lauretta Jane Bruno Married To James Greenhalgh, Yale '70
description: Miss Lauretta Jane Bruno was married here yesterday to James Dieter Greenhalgh, who will graduate tomorrow from Yale College. The Most Rev. Fulton J. Sheen, titular Archbishop of Newport, Eng land, and former Bishop of Rochester, performed the ceremony at St. Vincent Fer rer Roman Catholic Church. A reception was held at the St. RegisSheraton.

title: Heart Recipient in Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Va., June 6 (AP Louis B. Russell Jr., the world's longest living hear transplant recipient, has been scheduled to be the featured speaker at the annual meeting of the Virginia Heart Associa tion June 20. Mr. Russell, a?? Indianapolis schoolteacher, re ceived his new heart at the Medical College of Virginia in August, 1968.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: Airport, Satyricon, Women's Lib

title: STUDY FINDS RISE IN TEEN SMOKING
description: WASHINGTON, June 6  A Governmentsponsored survey shows that more American teen  agers are smoking ciga rettes while the trend among adults is in the opposite direc tion.

title: Last of the Red Hot Prizes?
description: NOW that the Drama Critics Circle has spread its seasonal favors, playgoers are awaiting the judgment of a critical body that represents a wider spread of opinion, the Greater Metropolitan Thea ter Reviewers Association. GMTRA awards will not be announced until July, but some informed guesses on where the kudos will fall can be made on the basis of clues that filtered down to the boil er room of Manhattan Cen ter last Tuesday night through an airshaft from the Grand Ballroom, where the annual vote was held. My source had to scribble his notes in bituminous on the back of a shovel, but his sketchy report should at least provide a rough guide as to what box offices may soon get hot. Here it is:

title: Glenn Waters, Miss Houseal Marry in South
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 6  Miss Catherine Sumner Houseal, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Bennet Houseal Jr., was married in St. Paul's Lutheran Church here this evening to Glenn Eric Wa ters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eric Waters, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hartley Waters of Scarsdale, N. Y. The ceremony was per formed by the Rev. Leroy Cauble Trexler, assisted by the Rev. George Elias Meetze.

title: Miss Bonnie Ruth Hall Is a Bride
description: NORTON, Conn., June 6 Miss Bonnie Ruth Hall was married this afternoon to Arthur James Rowbotham. The Rev. Dr. Nelson R. Back, the rector, performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Epis copal Church. The Rev. George C. Hoeh, the rector of St. John's Church in Brooklyn, New York, as sisted.

title: Madeleine Lawrence Is Wed Here
description: Miss Madeleine Anne Dean Lawrence and Elliott Hallock Johnson, a descendant of Peter Hallock, who settled Hallock's Point, L. I., in 1640, were married yesteday after noon in the Community Church of New York. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Chadbourne A. Spring.

title: Lupe a 4Length Victor In Rich Oaks at Epsom
description: EPSOM, England, June 6 (AP)Sandy Barclay rode Lupe to a fourlength victory in the $111,000 Oaks today and shattered a dream foc Lester Piggott, Britain's champion jockey.

title: BAFFLE TRIUMPHS IN $54,160 STAKE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 6 (UPI)Frank McMahon's Baffle stretched his speed for 1 miles today to capture the 30th running of the $54,150 Ingle wood Handicap at Hollywood Park.

title: Susan Barbara Poor Wed in Jersey
description: HILLSDALE, N. J., June 6 Miss Susan Barbara Poor, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard W. Poor of Ridge wood, was married in S. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church here today to Stephen Edmund Breiten bach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry R. Breitenbach of Hills dale.

title: Across the Aegean to Sappho's Fabled Isle
description: MYTILENE, LesbosThe venture to Lesbos, call it a mini cruise, weaves across the broad sea boulevard of the Piraeus, past the venders of warm cheese pastries and sesame rings, past the magic signs announcing sailings to islands known to Homer and Plato as well as Onassis and past roses planted by a public relationsminded Mayor.

title: FINCH IS SHIFTED FROM CABINET JOB TO NIXON'S STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 President Nixon replaced Rob ert H. Finch today as Secretary of the beleaguered Department of Health, Education and Wel fare in the Administration's first Cabinet shift.

title: So Far Britain's Election Is a Bore War
description: LONDON  The British election campaign is just over a week old and it has already begun to stir about as much national passion and emotion as a cold steak and kidney pie. Apathy and bore dom appear rampant in the land along with Prime Min ister Wilson and Edward Heath, his Conservative party challenger, who roam about hurling platitudes at each other. They are uttering plenty of words, but the question is whether the peo ple are listening.

title: Laguna Retains Crown
description: PANAMA CITY, June 6 (UPI) The world lightweight cham pion, Ismael Laguna of Panama, kept his crown tonight against Itsimatsu Suzuki of Japan with a technical knockout at 2 min utes 45 seconds of the 13th round.

title: LUCAS SEEDED NO. 1 FOR COLLEGE TENNIS
description: Warren Lucas of Fairleigh Dickinson, the defending cham pion, has been seeded No. 1 in the varsity singles division of the 48th annual Eastern inter collegiate tennis championships starting tomorrow at the Uni versity of Rochester. Twenty one colleges and universities are represented.

title: Tenant Issues Stir Passions in Court
description: IT is as old as jurispru dence and deals with what Paul Porter, the lawyer, once described as the second most passionate relationship in the world. It is LandlordTenant Court, part of the civil court of the City of New York with representation in each of the five boroughs.

title: Reds to Take Ticket Orders By Mail for AllStar Game
description: CINCINNATI, June 6 (UPI) The Cincinnati Reds announced today the procedures for ob taining tickets to the 1970 All Star baseball game to be played in the new Riverfront Stadium here July 14.

title: South's Hopes Will Sail With Heritage in Cup Trials
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., June 6If there were such a thing as a form sheet for the America's Cup sailing matches, few would desert the established magic of Olin Stephens. But the plungers that inevitably will show up at Newport, R. I., this sum mer will want a good look at a new yacht named Heritage in the JulyAugust trials.

title: EnglandBrazil Cup Struggle On Television at Garden Today
description: The first of a series of three closedcircuit telecasts of the World Cup soccer matches in Mexico City will be presented today at Madison Square Gar den beginning at 2 P.M.

title: Maine and U.N. On U.S. Program
description: THE United States is joining many nations in postally commemo rating the quarter century anniversary of the United Nations, founded with the signing of the world or ganization's charter on June 26, 1945, in, oddly enough, the War Memorial Building in San Francisco. The design and date of issue are to be announced.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Once again, I have the pleasure of writing a note about a new novel by Andrea Newman. A BOUQUET OF BARBED WIRE de serves bouquets and no barbs, although it is like her other writing, distinguished by plenty of both.

title: Ridland and Kathy Kusner Win Swiss Jumping Event
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, June 6 (AP)Two United States riders, Robert A. Ridland on Blue Plum and Kathy Kusner on Night Hawk, won the St. Gotthard pairs jumping event of the international horse show today.

title: Sports Chiefs to Present Awards for Boy Scouts
description: The four commissioners of the major professional team sportsbaseball, basketball, football and hockeywill be cohosts with the Greater New York Council of the Boy Scouts of America at the first Sports Lunch  0  Ree on Thursday at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Headliners
description: Captain Cook named it Friendly Islandfrom the demeanor of its inhabitantswhen he discovered it two centuries ago, and the name later was applied to the whole group of 150 islands that lies between New Zealand and Samoa. Last week everything was still friendly on the islands as, after 70 years as a British protectorate, they became the independent nation of Tonga (population 80,000). The pivot of the ceremonies was Tonga's 300pound 6foot2 monarch, King Taufa'ahau Tupou IV. Before becoming king he had been Prime Minister, Minister of Radio and Tele phonic Communications, chairman of the Broadcasting Com mission, ministerial head of the Justice and Auditing Department, and chairman of the Copra Board, among other titles. I'm a bit of a PoohBah, you know, he once said, except that I don't cut off any heads.

title: H. E. W. Eases School Case Stand
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 6 A desegregation plan that leaves four allblack elementary schools undisturbed and eight others more than 95 per cent black has been approved for Columbia by the Department of Health. Education and Welfare.

title: That Perilous Path to the Catskills
description: TRAFFIC on the Route 17 Quick way, the express highway to the Catskills, was bumper to bumper as far as the eye could see. I was near the village of Goshen, N. Y., and, as I looked ahead, I concluded there must be an accident. Old State Route 17the Gateway to the Cats killsused to pass right through here, I remembered; maybe I could find it and get out of this mess.

title: Clark Calls Curb on Rights Greater Peril Than Unrest
description: Ramsey Clark, the former United States Attorney General, said last night that any abridge ment of basic civil rights as a countermeasure to social un rest could prove to be a greater daneer than the unrest itself.

title: TIGERS VANQUISH ATHLETICS BY 64
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 6 (AP)Two home runs by Bill Freehan and one by Norm Cash powered the Detroit Tigers to a 64 victory over the Oakland Athletics today before a record Bat Day crowd of 48,758.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Chicago at New York (2 P.M.) John (48) vs. Peterson (82).

title: G.I.'S VIETNAM DUTY IS STAYED BY WHITE
description: Associate Justice Byron R. White of the Supreme Court signed an order yesterday pre venting a New York soldier from being shipped out of the country until further action by the United States Solicitor Gen eral could be taken in the case.

title: PROMENADE BILL PROVES APPEALING
description: Undoubtedly this writer is partial, but the Promenade that Andre Kostelanetz intro duced on Friday night and called Lands of the Midnight Sun was one of the most ap pealing in the eightyearold spring series of concerts at Philharmonic Hall.

title: Maddox Has His Own Ideas Of What's Fit to Print
description: ATLANTANot long ago, Gov. Lester G. Maddox decided to celebrate the opening of an in terstate highway by perching himself on the hood of an auto mobile and being rammed through a paper barrier, much in the fashion of the television commercial for a gasoline. The paper was stronger than he had anticipated, however. The im pact nearly disloged him and he came through the barrier sprawled across the grille of the car, hanging on for dear life.

title: Canadians Take 20 Lead In Davis Cup Zone Series
description: WINNIPEG, Mannitoba, June 6 (AP)Mike Belkin, Canada's No. 1 tennis player, gave the Canadians a 20 lead against the Commonwealth today with a fiveset victory over Lance Lumsden in the North Ameri can Zone Davis Cup elimina tion round. The scores were 62, 46, 61, 36, 60.

title: French Maoist Students, Young and Tough, Alarm Many Citizens by Determination to Use Violence
description: PARIS, June 6Pretty Sor bonne coeds ambled past the Deux Magots cafe, but the stu dent who called himself Chris tian Durand looked right through them.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: NEW JERSEY

title: HICKEL, AT STEVENS, ASKS INDUSTRY CARE
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., June 6 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel said today that the world needed a new indus trial technology that was in harmony with nature.

title: Start Them from Seed
description: WHAT is a biennial, anyway? Technic ally, the plant com pletes its lifecycle in two years. Seed sown this month or in early July will produce plants by late sum mer but it will not flower until next year. Then it will set seed and die.

title: Hobart College Upset by Police Agent
description: GENEVA, N.Y., June 6The president of Hobart College said today that the presence of a police undercover agent pos ing as a campus radical had created an atmosphere of ten sion that led early yesterday to an angry confrontation between students and the police in which violence was narrowly averted.

title: Country girls
description: Some of the prettiest summer dresses look as if they belonged on the farmer's daughter. They boast basque bodices with puffy sleeves in peasantprinted cali coes and skirts that just skim the ground. With the addition of ribbon chokers, white stockings and baby shoes, these country girl dresses are among the most refreshing summer clothes in many a season.

title: Curtis Takes Singles Title In N.C.A.A. Regional Tennis
description: EAST STROUDSBURG, Pa., June 6 (AP)  Neil Curtis of East Stroudsburg State College captured the singles champion ship of the National Collegiate Athletic Association Coast Col lege Division tennis tourna ment today. He defeated Bill Morton of Hampton Institute, 63. 63.

title: A Cool Welcome For Palme
description: All of this was deliberate. The Nixon Administration took pains to explain, art fully to be sure, that Swe den's boyishlooking, intel lectual, leftist leader was the man nobodywell, almost nobodyhad invited to din ner. The Administration's reasons for this attitude were unstated, but not hard to divine: Sweden has recog nized the Hanoi Government, taken in American deserters, promised North Vietnam $40million in aid and been the setting for eggs, epithets and demonstrations aimed at American Ambassador Jerome H. Holland.

title: Dr. Lewis L. Lorwin, Economist And Labor Historian, 86, Dies
description: Dr. Lewis L. Lorwin, econo mist and labor historian, died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hos pital. He was 86 years old an?? lived at 45 Christopher Street

title: Angry Passengers at Orly Try Twice to Storm Tower
description: PARIS, June 6A group of irate air travelers twice tried to storm the control tower at Orly Airport last night because they believed a delay in flights was being caused by traffic controllers.

title: INDIANA TRIUMPHS IN CENTRAL TRACK
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., June (UPI)Indiana, the host school, managed a onepoint victory in the Central Collegiate track meet today.

title: GRADUATION PARTY HELD AT CAMP DAVID
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) The Nixons and the Eisen howers celebrated tonight the college graduations of David Eisenhower and his wife, Julie Nixon. with a dinner of steak, potatoes and corn on the cob at Camp David, Md.

title: Brazen Brother Captures $28,775 Liberty Bell Race
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6 (AP) Jaclyn Stable's Brazen Broth er, a promising 2yearold homebred son of Boldestan, won the $28,775 Dragoon Stakes at Liberty Bell Race Track today by 3 lengths under Frank lanelli.

title: He Refuses to Be With It
description: BY no stretch of the imagination can Ron ald Ribman be called a fashionable play wright. In fact, as personali ties go, Ribman seems singu larly devoid of magnetism or even charm. He's rather a plain fellow, living in a most ordinary apartment on the upper West Side, with a sweet, rather shy young wife and a 4monthold baby boy who, when I came to call, was tucked away somewhere, fast asleep.

title: SAVAGE OF ROSELLE WINS 880 IN 1:50.8
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J., June 6Four schoolboy stars who will compete in the mile run at the Eastern States track and field championships at Randalls Island next Wednes day won group titles in the New Jersey state meet today at Highland Park High's field

title: Goodell Stresses The Need to End Vietnam Fighting
description: BABYLON, L. I., June 6 Senator Charles Goodell told a peace rally today in this gen erally conservative South Shore community that it is wrong to wave the Vietcong flag but it is also wrong to wave the American flag to cov er our sins.

title: Brazil Plans Relief for DroughtStricken Northeast
description: RECIFE, Brazil, June 6 (Reu ters)  The Government an nounced a relief program today to help at least 500,000 victims of a drought affecting five Northeast states.

title: U.S. AIDES RECEIVE PLEA IN CAMBODIA
description: KOMPONG TRACH, Cam bodia, June 6  President Nixon's 11man factfinding mission of Senators, Represen tatives and Governors heard an urgent appeal for arms today from a Cambodian field com mander in this southern town near the South Vietnamese border.

title: In Brief: Other Places
description: Kate Simon writes for trav elers who want to possess Italy, not for vacationers seek ing a brief flirtation. The trail she follows skirts Rome, Flor ence and the other well trod den cities; it leads instead to a tiny church in Lucca, Sig norelli's frescoes in Orvieto, a restaurant noted for its bollito misto in Ferrara, to little towns on the Southern Adriatic coast.

title: Infrared and Chlorophyll Pinpoint a Colonial Site
description: PORT TOBACCO, Md.The latest in infrared aerial photography, a grant of $170,000 and the enthu siasm of a few dedicated ama teur archeologists are combining in the first stages of the restoration of Port Tobacco, one of the oldest continuously inhabited English settlements in North America.

title: DOCTORS IN BRITAIN FIGHT RULING ON PAY
description: LONDON, June 6 (Reuters) British doctors rebelled tonight over a Government decision to reduce a recommended pay rise.

title: The Effect of Gamma Raves
description: HEARD any good suc cess stories lately? Listen to Paul Zin del's. The 34yearold exscience teacher from Staten Island is not only the author of Off Broadway's smash hit, The Effect of Gamma Rays on Maninthe Moon Marigolds, but he is also in the happy position of standing by as two major producers hid against one another for the movie rights to his play.

title: Big Daddy Keeps Firm Hand on Wheel
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Sir Frank Packer, the 33yearold backer of Australia's 1970 challenger for the America's Cup, is a man who in busi ness or sport competes toughly and vigorously.

title: ZIM'S MR. SPOONS GAINS SHOW TITLE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 7 Zim's Mr. Spoons, a 5year old brown gelding with an un usual name but a smart step, captured the green working hunter championship today at the Greenwich Horse Show.

title: TV: Positively Black
description: The premiere of the new local weekly series, Posi tively Black, was offered yesterday afternoon on WNBCTV (Channel 4). Its appeal and potential strength lie in the lowkey presenta tion of the problems of blacks. The program stressed the affirmative whenever possible but let facts rather than emotionalism underscore racial abuses.

title: De Gaulles Cheered in Spain
description: CAMBADOS, Spain, June 7 (AP)Gen. Charles de Gaulle and his wife were on the fourth day today of their motoring vacation in this country. A crowd cheered and applauded the former French President and Mrs. de Gaulle here before they drove toward the village of Madrigal de las Altas Torres.

title: Youth Killed in Crash
description: DEWITTVILLE, N. Y., June 7 (AP)Dennis L. Heglund, 18 years old, of nearby Jamestown, was killed Sunday night when his automobile spun out of con trol on Route 17 and struck a pile of bricks and a tree.

title: Twins Triumph Over Senators With 3Run Surge in 11th, 109
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) Jim Holt's tworun single capped a threerun 11thinning rally today that carried the Minnesota Twins to a 109 victory over the Washington Senators.

title: Three American Cellists Gain In 4th Tchaikovsky Competition
description: MOSCOW, June 7  Three musicians from the United States were among 16 cellists who survived the first elimina tion round in the fourth Tchai kovsky Music Competition that began last week and will con tinue until June 25.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 8, 1970

title: A's Sink Tigers in Ninth, 52, On Belts by Fernandez, Rudi
CAR OUT OF CONTROL KILLS MAN, HURTS 2
description: Three workers were injured, one fatally, yesterday by a car that struck them at the south east corner of Second Avenue and 50th Street.

title: Jersey Democrats Pick Chief
description: NEWARK, June 7 (UPI) Joseph A. Gannon, a 35year old business executive and labor lecturer from Scotch Plains, has been named full time executive director of the New Jersey Democratic Com mittee. Mr. Gannon, who lectures at Rutgers University and St. Peter's College, suc ceeds John T. Connor Jr., who held the job parttime.

title: OFFICIAL ADMITS C.I.A. ROLE IN LAOS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) Dr. John A. Hannah, director of the Agency for International Development, acknowledged to day that the United States aid program was being used as a cover for operations of the Cen tral Intelligence Agency in Laos.

title: Deborah Robb, A. H. Twombly Are Married
description: LOUDONVILLE, N. Y., June 7Miss Deborah Mary Robb and Angus Holbrook Twom bly were married here this evening at the home of Mrs. Gene Robb, mother of the bride. The Rev. John H. Mc Combe, dean of the Hendricks Chapel at Syracuse Univer sity, performed the cere mony.

title: Copter Plucks Hurt Woman From Shore as Boat Sinks
description: The police used a helicopter yesterday afternoon to lift a 63yearold woman from the rocky Hudson River shore off 250th Street after she had been injured while abandoning a foundering cabin cruiser.

title: French Undertakers at Odds on Sharing of Business
description: PARIS, June 7The French way of death has become an issue in the running struggle between French small business men and big entrepreneurs.

title: Strike at Iron Works Ends; 70Cent Increase Ratified
description: BATH, Me., June 7Produc tion workers at the Bath Iron Works Corporation, who have been on strike since April 27, voted today to accept a new contract.

title: Steinkraus Captures Jump As Show in Lucerne Ends
description: LUCERNE, Switzerland, June 7 (AP)  The Lucerne horse show wound up today with American and Swiss riders sharing honors.

title: CANADA CAPTURES DAVIS CUP SERIES
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, June 7 (Canadian Press)  Canada clinched the firstround series of the North American Zone Davis Cup tennis competition against the Commonwealth Caribbean today by taking the doubles for a 30 lead.

title: Carl and Ruby Obert Gain In A.A.U. Handball Doubles
description: Carl and Ruby Obert of the New York Athletic Club, the topseeded team, defeated Ken Bollinger and Tom Calandrino of the Brownsville Handball Club, 211, 215, yesterday in the second round of the Na tional Amateur Athletic Union onewall handball champion ship at the Municipal courts, Coney Island.

title: U.S. PAYS THAILAND 50MILLION A YEAR FOR VIETNAM AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Sen ate testimony disclosed today that under the secret agreement entered into in 1967, the Unit ed States has been paying Thai land $50million a year for sending a combat division to South Vietnam.

title: Boom in Houston No Boon to Blacks
description: HOUSTON, June 6  On the white side of the tracks, Hous ton is a boom town, with new office buildings going up to complement others recently built to give the downtown area a very spic and span gleam.

title: The Choice for H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Early in 1969, Elliot Lee Richardson, then the new Under Secretary of State, was making courtesy calls on Capitol Hill. As he left the office of a senior Republican on the Senate Foreign Rela tions Committee, the Senator remarked mischievously to a friend: Remind you a little bit of the late George Apley? The com parison with the hero of Mar quand's satirical novel, a man virtually imprisoned in the stuffy folkways of the Boston aristocracy, is less then fair but inevitable. True, the ca reer of Mr. Richardson, mov ing now from a short but celebrated tour with the State Department to become Secre tary of Health, Education and Welfare, is a striking contrast to Apley's provincialism.

title: New On Your Toes Introduces Ohman In Role of Hoofer
description: Bad performances can be bet ter than good ones, as the New York City Ballet's Slaughter on Tenth Avenue demonstrat ed Saturday at the State Thea ter. In the afternoon, George Balanchine's revision of his ballettap sequence from the 1936 musical On Your Toes gave Frank Ohman the oppor tunity for an exuberantly effec tive debut as the Hoofer oppo site Linda Merrill's Strip Tease Girl.

title: Scientist Says a Baby Walrus Will Smother You With Love
description: Beware the baby walrus. Its affection can be over whelming.

title: John B. Shethar, Broker, Dies; ExOfficer of Yacht Clubs, 78
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., June 7John Burke Shethar, a lead ing yachtsman for many years and a member of the New York Stock Exchange since March 9, 1916, died today in United Hos pital. He was 78 years old and lived at Milton Point, Rye, and at Hillsboro Beach, Fla.

title: Ohio College Puts Students On Its Board of Trustees
description: WESTERVILLE, Ohio, June 7  The 30  member board of trustees of Otterbein College has approved a proposal to let three students and three fac ulty members join the board with full voting power.

title: Chess:
MYR'S IS VICTOR IN POTOMAC RACE
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Bill Muncey of Seattle won his fourth President's Cup regatta today, piloting Myr's Sheet Metal to a 100  yard victory over four other unlimited hydroplanes on the Potomac River.

title: United Fund
description: It is frequently difficult for New Yorkers to decide which of the many hospitals, health and welfare agencies and services is most deserving of support even among those visible in one's own neighborhood. It is especially difficult for a transient office worker in Manhattanresident or commuterto distinguish among the scores of good causes.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Monday, June 8, 1970

title: Ministers to Meet In Common Market
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 7 (Reuters)The Common Mar ket's foreign ministers will meet here tomorrow for their last scheduled session before negotiations with Britain and other applicants open June 30.

title: Eased Laws on Abortion Failing to Achieve Goals
description: The reform of abortion laws has thus far made barely a dent in the criminal abortion rate and has failed to produce anything resembling a revolu tion in medical practice or atti tude in any of the five states that have had two or more years of experience with eased restrictions on legal abortions.

title: Graduation: A Tale of 2 Generations
description: SYRACUSE, June 7Be neath the statues and in front of the porticos of the hill side campus this weekend, the family groups clustered. Mothers and aunts in color ful taffeta and carefully coiffed hair. Fathers and uncles neat in ties and jackets. And framed in the rangefinders of their cameras were the graduates, as often as not hairy, or wearing shorts and sandals.

title: Israelis Trade Fire With Syrian Force On Golan Heights
description: TIBERIAS, Israel, June 7 (Reuters)One Israeli soldier was killed in a 90minute artil lery and mortar duel between Israeli and Syrian forces in the Golan heights today, military sources said here. They denied a Syrian report that the Israelis suffered heavy casualties.

title: Miss Glickman Has Nuptials
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., June 7Miss Joanne Gale Glick man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin S. Glickman of New York and Pound Ridge, was married here this after noon to Elliott Hilton Singer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Singer of Atlanta. Rabbi Alex J. Goldman performed the ceremony in the garden of her parents' home here.

title: U.S. BOOKSELLERS MEET IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The American Booksellers Associa tion's annual convention, de scribed by its organizers as the largest since the group was formed 70 years ago, opened to day with emphasis on stimula tion of business through wider advertising and more books on current events.

title: Antiques Center Offers Wares From Folk Art to Furniture
description: A permanent antiques show has been installed in New York, and, for the moment at least, it seems to be defy ing the slump that has hit most luxury businesses.

title: Elinor Ross Displays Big Voice In Her Met Debut as Turandot
description: There are few sopranos in the world could or would choose the title role of Puc cini's Turandot for a Metro politan Opera debut, but Elinor Ross made her first appearance with the company on Saturday night in the spectacular part (with its triply spectacular cos tume) and managed the feat pretty well.

title: PLAN TO TRAIN POOR AS POLICEMEN IS SET
description: ALBANY, June 7New York State has approved a $974,000 training program designed to place up to 200 disadvantaged persons in the New York City Police Department.

title: Leader of Presbyterians Honored by Catholic U.
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The Re. Dr. Eugene Carson Blake, General Secretary of the World Council of Churches and a Protestant leader in the ecumenical movement, was awarded an honorary doctorate of hu mane letters today by Cath olic University of America.

title: Votes of Week In Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Fol lowing are the votes of delega tions from New York, New Jer sey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yester day:

title: 2 Cambodian Units Fight
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 7The firing last night here that resulted in an alert for one hour has turned out to be a personal fight between two units of the Cambodian armed forces.

title: Fryman Beats Astros, 103
description: HOUSTON, June 7 (UP1) Deron Johnson hit a threerun homer and Byron Browne drove in three runs with a homer and a triple today to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to a 103 victory over the Houston As tros.

title: Cairo Paper Says France Will Sell Missiles to Arabs
description: CAIRO, June 7 (UPI) France, which is maintaining a temporary embargo against arms shipments to Israel, will begin delivery of surfacetoair rockets next year to several Arab nations, the semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram said to day.

title: Record Crowd at Expo
description: OSAKA, Japan, June 7 (AP) A crowd of 627,094 persons  a oneday record  visited Expo '70 today, bringing to 25, 167,672 the total of visitors to the exposition since it opened March 15, Japanese officials reported. The officials expect 50 million people to visit the fair by its close, Sept. 13.

title: FRED W. STEIN, 64, EDITORPUBLISHER
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., June 7 (AP)Fred W. Stein, editor publisher of The Binghamton Evening Press, died here today of a cardiac arrest after a brief illness. He was 64 years old.

title: Advertising: MacManus Adding Palmolive
description: MacManus, John & Adams, New York, will become the eighth name on the Colgate Palmolive Company agency list on Sept. 1 when it takes over the advertising assign ments for Palmolive Soap, Palmolive Gold Deodorant Soap and LustreCreme Shampoo. The brands billed almost $5million last year.

title: Heritage Not Expected Here For First Cup Test Today
description: Heritage, the Florida yacht built for this year's America's Cup defense, is not expected to be ready for today's open ing of the preliminary trials on Long Island Sound.

title: Books of The Times
description: What a perfectly marvelous idea! one thinks at first: the madcap life and times of Mr. and Mrs. F. Scott Fitzgerald, Amer ica's alltime numberone fun couple, as seen through the eyes of crazy Zelda. Now we'll find out just how drunk she was when she dove into the fountain at Wash ington Square, and if she really did exclaim, while trav eling by train through Europe, Good God, Scott! We forgot the baby! On deeper reflection, and about a quarter of the way into Nancy Milford's biography, one has second thoughts. Maybe it's really just a gimmick to tell that irresisti bly romantic story once again. After all, except for her earliest years, when she was standing Montgomery, Ala., on its collec tive ear, Zelda's life seems largely to have been a role she played in her husband's improvizations. And sure enough, by page 118 of Mrs. Milford's book, when it is 1926 and the Fitzgeralds are living it up on the French Riviera, Scott has com pletely taken command of the story and Zelda is seen as through a champagne glass darkly.

title: Sick Call by Police In Stockholm Brings Outburst of Looting
description: STOCKHOLM, June 7 (AP) A band of 150 looters in a fleet of 50 cars rampaged through Stockholm last night, meeting no resistance from the police, whose ranks had been thinned by a sickcall job action.

title: Theft of $200,000 Laid to 2 Workers At Kennedy Airport
description: Two Kennedy International Airport baggage handlers were arrested by the Port Auhhority police yesterday morning and charged with the theft of $200, 000 in cash from a mailbag on a Swissair flight last month.

title: BOMBERS' STREAK ENDED AT 5 GAMES
description: Fine weather, a fivegame New York winning streak and the lure of Bat Day attracted 65,880 fans, the largest major league baseball crowd in al most five years, to Yankee Stadium yesterday.

title: U.S. Finds Buying Power Of Factory Workers Dips
description: The Labor Department yester day reported that the purchas ing power of factoryworker earnings in New YorkNorthern New Jersey declined in April, reflecting a 0.7 per cent rise in consumer prices.

title: Centennial Tribute to Dickens Begins in Britain
description: LONDON, June 7A cen tury after Charles Dick ens suffered a stroke and died in his small chalet near Rochester, Britain begins a major tribute this week to the novelist whose dark por traits of Victorian London remain classic entertainments.

title: NEW H.E.W. HEAD CALLS SELECTION OUT OF THE BLUE
description: LOWELL, Mass., June 7 Elliot L. Richardson said today that his selection by President Nixon as the new Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare had been a complete surprise.

title: AUSSIE STAR WINS FINAL BY 62, 64
description: PARIS, June 7Mrs. Marga ret Court is halfway home.

title: Austrian Leader Weathers First Crisis, Over ExNazi
description: VIENNA, June 1 Austria's new Socialist Chancellor, Bruno Kreisky, has weathered his first political crisis, a furor over the appointment of a former Nazi to his Cabinet, and has turned it to his advantage.

title: Australia Supports U.S.
description: CANBERRA, Australia, June 7 (UPI)American and South Vietnamese intervention in Cambodia has been remark ably successful, William Mc Mahon, Australian Minister for External Affairs, said today. He said it had bought time for the Cambodian Government to make diplomatic moves to keep the country independent and neutral.

title: Woolworth Store Bombing In Times Sq. Investigated
description: The police continued their investigation yesterday into the firebombing at the Woolworth store at Broadway and 44th Street on Saturday night.

title: Personal Finance
description: Every year, for one rea son or another, several hun dred credit unions go out of business. It's not that any thing went wrong but, per haps, members lost interest, a military base was phased out, a plant closed or two companies merged.

title: Most Stores Are Investing Heavily in Longer Length Fashions
description: Those fashionable stores that were reassuring their customers as recently as last February that the mini would not join the bustle and the hoop in limbo plan to bury it this fall.

title: STABILITY URGED IN CANADA DOLLAR
description: BASEL, Switzerland, June 7 With a flareup in the cur rency markets last week, inter national monetary authorities were quietly urging Canada to day to speed up the process of establishing a new rate for her dollar.

title: Leonard First, Unser 3d In Rex Mays 150 Race
description: MILWAUKEE, June 7 (AP) Joe Leonard whipped past Roger McCluskey on the 140th lap and went on to win the Rex Mays 150mile Indianapolis type car race today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JUNE 8, 1970

title: PIRATES' 4HITTER TOPS DODGERS, 31
description: PITTSBURGH, June 7 (AP) Freddie Patek cracked a two run triple and Bob Veale stopped Los Angeles on four hits as the Pittsburgh Pirates defeated the Dodgers, 31, to day for their third victory in a row.

title: MUSTANGS FINISH ONE, TWO IN OHIO
description: MANSFIELD, Ohio, June 7 A factory team of butterscotch brown Ford Mustangs recorded its fourth consecutive victory today in the TransAmerican championship, taking first and second places in a 180mile race over the MidOhio Sports Car Course.

title: Fire Base Spruced Up for a Visit
description: FIRE SUPPORT BASE SHAKEY, Cambodia, June 7 The men of Company A, Fifth Battalion of the 60th In fantry, who are manning this muddy base high on a moun taintop northeast of the Fish hook, wore their hair short and had their faces shaven clean today. Some got new fatigues to replace those that they were wearing 38 days ago when they left the Mekong Delta to go on what they were told would be a threeday mission.

title: DeGarmo Is Assigned Mazola by Best Foods
description: Little deGarmo, McCaffery, Inc., billing some $9.5mil lion, has gotten a big shot in the arm from the Best Foods division of CPC International. The product assignment, ef fective July 1, is Mazola Mar garine, which was backed by over $3million in adver tising in 1969.

title: Gubernatorial Rivals Differ on Approaches to TV
description: Howard J. Samuels stood on the sidewalk on East 39th Street, in front of State Democratic party headquar ters the other day and de manded reform of the party's internal structure. Later that same day, Arthur J. Goldberg was driven 15 miles outside of Binghamton, up a steeply inclined dirt road to the top of a mountain in the Appala chian foothills for a chat about his concepts of state government.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: Miss Mary D. Goodwin Bride of Edmund Cabot
description: WESTON, Mass., June 7 Miss Mary Devereux Good win, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Willard E. Goodwin of Los Angeles, was married here today to Edmund Billings Cabot, youngest son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Dudley Cabot of Weston.

title: REDS ROUT GENTRY IN 17 HIT ATTACK
description: CINCINNATI, June 7Given their choice, the Mets undoubt edly would have preferred the locusts, even swarms of them, to the Reds in Cincinnati this weekend.

title: YACHT RACE WON BY RUNNING TIDE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 7 The 116th annual New York Yacht Club Regatta fell consid erably short of a complete suc cess as only 17 of the 58 handi cap boats that started today managed to finish. Yesterday, none of the boats managed to finish within their allotted time.

title: Proxmire Calls Nixon Decent and Intelligent
description: MILTON, Wis., June 7 (UPI) Senator William Proxmire, a frequent critic of President Nixon's war and economic policies, today called Mr. Nixon a decent and intelli gent man and denounced personal attacks against him.

title: CITY SCHOOL BOARD FACES JOB INQUIRY
description: The City Commission on Hu man Rights announced yester day it would conduct an inves tigation of the poor minority hiring practices of the Board of Education.

title: Ron Swoboda, Mets' Right Fielder, Presides at Crab Cookout in His Garage
description: SYOSSET, L. I.It hap pened on a drizzly day earlier this season. The New York Mets had no game scheduled and Ron Swoboda, who plays right field and hits home runs for the world champions, had planned to take advantage of the idle day with a come for a barbecue outing at his ranchstyle home here.

title: Soccer TV Draws 19,000 to Garden and Felt Forum
description: More than 19,000 soccer fans filled Madison Square Garden's two arenas yester day, cheering as though they were in Guadalajara instead of in plush seats watching gigantic television screens.

title: MISS ENGLEHORN IS CARLING VICTOR
description: LUTHERVILLE, Md., June 7 (UPI)Shirley Englehorn shot a closing 71 for a 210 and beat Carol Mann by one stroke in the Lady Carling open golf tournament today.

title: Shipping/Mails
Drive Smacks Koosman In Mouth During Drill
description: CINCINNATI, June 7Jerry Koosman, already plagued by a tender pitching elbow, ran into more trouble today. He was hit in the mouth by a line drive during batting prac tice.

title: British Election Stresses the Soft Sell
description: LONDON, June 7The imagebuilders for the Labor and Conservative parties in the election campaign are at work in neighboring build ings on Smith Square, a tree lined area not far from West minster Abbey but a long way from Madison Avenue.

title: The Aramburu Kidnapping
description: The abduction of former President Aramburu in Argentina has plunged the Government of President Ongania into the worst political crisis of its four years in power.

title: Politicians Cross Party Lines In a Number of State Contests
description: With most of the political at tention focused on the Demo cratic statewide primary, the traditional line between Demo crats and Republicans has be come blurred in a number of other races  particularly Con gressional contests.

title: Brewster Tells Yale Class of '70 Old Political Labels Are Useless
description: NEW HAVEN, June 7In his baccalaureate address to 1,000 members of the last all male graduating class of Yale undergraduate colleges, Yale's president, Kingman Brewster Jr., today decried such political characterization as liberal and moderate.

title: Rapid LivingCost Rise Attributed to Inefficiency
description: Howard J. Samuels charged yesterday that inefficient, ram shackle state government was the single greatest factor con tributing to the rapidly rising cost of living in New York State this year.

title: Excerpts From the Transcript of Interview With Police Commissioner Leary
description: A. Well, I think the first thing we should consider is what our definition of cor ruption is, and also, relate that definition, not only to the Police Department, but to bureaucracy in general, to the business community and to the hypocrisy of society. Specifically in the Police De partment, corruption, to de fine it, is a policeman who accepts some gifts, gratuities, money, something of value, for either doing something against the law or supplying information or for some type of protection.

title: Indian Refugee Camp Raided
description: CALCUTTA, India, June 7 (AP)  About 1,500 persons raided a refugee settlement yes terday near Jalpaiguri, 750 miles north of here, burning houses and looting storehouses. The police said that 10 persons had been killed and 41 had been injured.

title: SWISS REJECT BID TO REDUCE ALIENS
description: GENEVA, June 7A consti tutional amendment that would have expelled 300,000 foreign workers from Switzerand was defeated today in a nationwide referendum.

title: McCarthy Assails Tricks and Spending
description: Representative Richard Max McCarthy, one of the candi dates for the Democratic nom ination for Senator, criticized two of his opponents yester day, charging one with exces sive campaign spending and another with gimmickry.

title: Students Stage New Yiddish Musical
description: Yiddish and the legendary RussianPolish village of Chelm, recalled by such folklorists as Sholem Aleichmen, live. This was illustrated yesterday by the Yugntruf Ensemble, a group of Jewish high school and col lege students, who presented an original Yiddish musical, ChelmUndser Shtetl(Chelm Our Village) before a packed house at the 92d Street Young Men's Hebrew Association.

title: Newcombe Wins in Morocco
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco, June 7 (Reuters)John Newcombe of Australia won the men's sin gles final in the Casablanca tennis tournament today, de feating Andres Gimeno of Spain, 64, 64, 64. In a match for third place, Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia defeated Pierre Barthes of France, 60, 97.

title: R. E. Kopelman Weds Carol Fialkov
description: The marriage of Miss Carol Fran Fialkov to Richard Eric Kopelman took place here yesterday afternoon. The cer emony in the Terrace Room at the Plaza was performed by Rabbi Maurice Aranov, assisted by Cantor Melvin Etra.

title: 20,000 Workers in St. Louis March in ProNixon Parade
description: ST. LOUIS, June 7 (AP) Flagwaving workers marched more than three miles through St. Louis today to demonstrate support for the Nixon Adminis tration's Southeast Asia poli cies.

title: Maryland Requires Car Makers to Post Bond on Warranties
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 7 (AP)One of the many new laws that become effective in Maryland on July 1st is a lit tle noted piece of legislation enacted by the 1970 General Assembly that will require au tomobile manufacturers to post bond of $100,000 each with the Department of Motor Vehicles to back up their warranties.

title: Three in South Carolina Challenging 32Year Veteran of House
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 7 For 32 years, Representative John L. McMillan has defeated all challengers in South Caro lina's Sixth Congressional Dis trict, a ninecounty wedge in the northeast corner of the state.

title: Leary Links Graft to Hypocrisy
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary, in a farranging dis cussion of police corruption, said that dishonesty existed in police ranks but contended that it should be considered in the larger context of a hypo critical society.

title: Forster Dies; Wrote A Passage to India
description: LONDON, June 7E. M. Forster, the novelist, died to day in Coventry. He was 91 years old.

title: Tommy Is Poignantly Sentimental
description: Why, do you suppose, have its admirers thought it necessary and useful to label Tommy, an extended bal lad in concert form, as a rock opera? The hourlong piece, which the rock group called The Who brought to the stage of the Metropolitan Opera House yesterday, could hardly qualify as opera under any except the most propa gandistic definition.

title: Beagle Best at Batavia
description: BATAVIA, N.Y., June 7 Ch. King's Creek Triple Threat, a 15inch beagle owned by Lullaby Kennels and Tom Foy Jr., took top honors today at the Tonawanda Valley Kennel Club show.

title: Talk of Hijacking Charged
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7 (UPI) An A.W.O.L. 17yearold Ma rine Corps recruit was arrested today after he allegedly re marked to a fellow airline pas senger that he intended to hi jack the plane. The police said that George T. Anthony of Allentown, Pa., boarded Trans World Airlines Flight 15 for San Francisco and, shortly be fore takeoff, remarked to an Army colonel that he was go ing to hijack the aircraft. The officer reported the conversa tion, the police said.

title: Evaluating Drug Programs
description: One of the fundamental needs in combating drug addiction in New York City, and elsewhere across the nation as well, remains an honest, thorough, out side evaluation of current treatment methods. Incred ibly there has been noneno authoritative, compara tive assessment of the various forms of treatment now being prescribed at hospitals, in clinics and, more dangerously, at makeshift neighborhood store front centers.

title: Liquori Fails for the 4th Time to Capture Compton Mile
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7 Too many elbows, too big a field, said Marty Liquori after he was beaten in last night's Compton invitation mile race at Los Angeles Me morial Coliseum.

title: Article 1  No Title
Mayer, Van Nostrand Pace Advance in State Tennis
description: Sandy Mayer and King Van Nostrand, the fourth and fifth seeded players, scored easy vic tories in the New York State tennis championship yesterday at the North Shore Tennis and Racquets Club in Bayside, Queens.

title: Rebuilding the Ibo Homeland After Biafra's Collapse
description: ENUGU, Nigeria  Ukpabi Anthony Asika is a young Ibo intellectual from Onitsha who remained loyal to Nigeria in the civil war and in 1967 was named Administrator for the EastCentral State, the Ibo homeland.

title: JAIRZINHO SCORES ON PASS BY PELE
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, June 7  In a superb match that did credit to the competi tion, Brazil beat England, 10, at Jalisco Stadium today and thus became the first soccer team to win against her in the World Cup since 1962.

title: A Gauguin and a Bonnard Stolen From London Home
description: LONDON, June 7 (UPI)Two paintings valued at $372,000 were stolen yesterday from a house in Regent's Park. They are Gauguin's Still Life of Apples and Grapes, whose price was put at $288,000, and Bonnard's Les Deux Sau teuils, $84,000.

title: Problems of Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 7While President Nikon's delegation of Governors, Sen ators and Representatives was being shown the former Com munist sanctuaries in eastern Cambodia, cleaned out in the recent allied drive, not too far away, teenage Cambodian soldiers were dying because they did not have enough arms and ammunition. The American and South Vietnamese invasion may have helped Vietnam, said one in formed military source here last week, but it hasn't saved Cambodia.

title: Max S. Wilkes, Art Teacher And Painter, Is Dead at 85
description: YONKERS, June 7Max S. Wilkes, artist and teacher, died today at his home, 189 Valen tine Lane. His age was 85.

title: Storm in Summer Wins Emmy as the Best Drama
description: A Storm in Summer, a Hallmark Hall of Fame drama about the friendship of a bitter old Jewish grocer and a black ghetto youngster, was named the outstanding dra matic program last night at the 22d annual Emmy Awards presentations of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.

title: Rose Gets Gehrig Award
description: CINCINNATI, June 7 (AP) Pete Rose, the twotime Na tional League batting cham pion, received the 1969 Lou Gehrig award today before the New York MetsCincinnati game. Phi Delta Theta, the national college fraternity, is sponsor of the award in me mory of Gehrig, who was a member of the fraternity as a Columbia University under graduate.

title: Saigon to Call Cambodia Kampuchea in Messages
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 7 (UPI)The world's atlas compilers got another terminology headache today.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
description: June 5, 1970

title: Miss PousetteDart Married in Suffern
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., June 7 Miss Joanna PousetteDart, daughter of Richard Pou setteDart, the artist, and Mrs. PousetteDart, was mar ried here this afternoon to Jay Wholley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Wholley of Dan vers, Mass. The Rev. Ronald Grimes, a graduate student at Union Theological Semi nary, performed the cere mony at the PousetteDart home.

title: Braves Trounced, 101
description: ATLANTA, June 7 (AP)Bob Bailey rapped two home runs and Coco Laboy one today as the Montreal Expos completed a sweep of a threegame series over the Atlanta Braves, 101.

title: ROLL OF HONOUR 2D IN 1MILE EVENT
description: PARIS, June 7Sassafras, a colt owned by Arpad Plesch, won the $359,000 Prix du Jockey Club at Chantilly to day. The race is conducted by two of the most exclusive clubs in the worldthe Acadmie Franaise and the French Jockey Club.

title: Yarborough Narrow Victor Over Hamilton in Car Duel
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., June 7 (AP)Cale Yar borough held off Pete Hamilton in a wheeltowheel duel in the final 100 miles today and won the Motor State 400mile stock car race by twotenths of a sec ond.

title: Lungs Washed With Salt Water In Fight Against a Rare Disease
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6  Since the first amphibian pushed its head through the murky surface of a primeval ocean and took a breath of air, land animals have been plagued by a variety of lung diseases.

title: M. P. Poriss Weds Karen Lee Sobol
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., June 7Miss Karen Lee Sobol and Martin Peter Poriss, students of Radcliffe and Harvard, respectively, who will both be graduated magna cum laude in the colleges' joint commencement ceremony on Thursday, were married here this afternoon.

title: FIRMNESS NOTED IN STEEL DEMAND
description: PITTSBURGH, June 7Re ports from steel producers re main surprisingly optimistic.

title: Libya Soon Gets Wheelus, Including Bowling Alleys
description: WHEELUS AIR FORCE BASE, Libya, May 31A ceremonial contingent of 52 military men is all that remains in opera tion at the last United States Air Force base on the African continent.

title: G.I. News Service Formed To Expose Army Activities
description: DENVER, June 7  Three Vietnam veterans, active for several months in war protests in the Colorado Springs area, say they have formed an un derground G.I. news service to report on the Army's many illegal activities.

title: Academic Experts In U.S. on Vietnam Almost Nonexistent
description: Despite nearly a decade of costly United States involve ment with Vietnam and her people, American scholarly expertise on Vietnam, par ticularly North Vietnam, is almost nonexistent.

title: A Yankee Town Fears Creeping Cityhood
description: GUILFORD, Conn., June 7 There is an uneasiness in this little town, noticeable in the newcomers as well as those who trace their an cestry to the original settlers of 1639.

title: FOUR CONTENDERS ARE BEATEN OFF
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., June 7 During the week some specta tors asked Dick Lotz for an autograph, thinking he was Gary Player. I didn't mind, Lotz said today after he had won the Kemper open golf tour nament by two strokes with a 72hole total of 278, holing a 55foot putt en route.

title: Unemployment Grows
description: Unemployment is in its steepest rise since the recession of 1960. Last month the unemployment rate reached 5 per cent of the labor forceup from 3.5 per cent in December. There are now 1.3 million more people out of work than five months ago.

title: RoundLot Traders Called Key to Market's Rebound
description: Welltodo individuals, those who generally buy stocks in 100share round lots, appear to have been responsible for halting the great stockslide of April and May.

title: PROGRAM HELPING MORTGAGE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7One of the Government's most un usual programsa program de signed to defer repayment of debts due to a Government lending agencyis having a greaterthanexpected success.

title: Rally Sinks Padres, 107
description: ST. LOUIS, June 7 (UPI) Vic Davalillo, pinchhitter, de livered a recordtying two hits during a fourrun seventh in ning today and sparked the St. Louis Cardinals to a 107 vic tory over the San Diego Padres.

title: INDIANS, WITH HAND, TOPPLE ANGELS, 64
