description: ANAHEIM, Calif., June 7 (UPI)  Jack Heidemann's double drove in two runs in the top of the eighth inning and helped 21yearold Rich Hand gain his first major league pitching victory as the Cleveland Indians beat the California Angels, 64, today.

title: Bank on Coast Is Attacked By Youths 4th Night in Row
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., June 7 (AP)Young people at tacked a bank for the fourth night in a row tonight, break ing windows and knocking out street lights with stones. They tried to set the building on fire before they were dispersed by the police.

title: Overseas Shipholding Group Is Adding 3 Shins to Fleet
description: The Overseas Shipholding Group has ordered two new vessels and acquired a third at a cost of about $35million. The company was formed in January.

title: TollRoad Designers Confess Their Myopia
description: The people who planned the nation's tollroads agree that their original designs under estimated the demand that has grown for the highways.

title: Kentucky County Bans Strip Mines
description: HINDMAN, Ky., June 7In a decision that could have far reaching effects in Kentucky, Knott County's legislative coun cil has voted to outlaw strip mining in the county.

title: Melon Strike Is Settled
description: EL CENTRO, Calif., June 7 (UPI)A $30,000aday melon strike was settled at a secret weekend meeting when the Abatti Brothers Produce Com pany and the United Farm Workers Organizing Committee agreed to hold a workers vote on union representation. The union pledged to withhold for one year further attempts to unionize workers of Abatti, a major Imperial County melon grower, if the union loses the vote.

title: Gulf Minerals Scouts Uranium
description: RABBIT LAKE, Saskatche wan.  Beneath the pure, cold water of Rabbit Lake, one of countless puddles on the face of northern Sas katchewan, are buried hun dreds of millions of dollars worth of uranium.

title: PRESIDENT AND WIFE BACK IN WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon flew back to the White House from Camp David, Md., today after a weekend marked by a gathering of the Nixon and Eisenhower families to observe three graduations.

title: Puerto Rican Day Parade Mixes Pride and Politics With Protest
description: The sun came out just as tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans began an annual march up Fifth Avenue at 1 P.M. yes terday, an event Governor Luis Ferr of Puerto Rico hailed as showing they were becoming a creative part of the city and state

title: Sports of The Times
description: Every winter, from the south, come words like distant hoofbeats: We have the horse, the great big horse, Mr. Horse, the one that can do it all. Mr. Horse will take the Derby, snatch the Preakness driving, and come from way out of it to win the Belmont Stakes. Mr. Horse will be a sound animal, which means he will not spring his ankle before the race, and he will have impeccable breeding, which means he will make millions as a stud.

title: Senate SST Opponents Acquire New Allies and Ammunition
description: WASHINGTON, June 7A Senate vote on a further appro priation of $290million for construction of two prototypes of the supersonic transport is probably two months away, but Senate opponents of the con troversial plane were already marshaling arguments and forces against it this weekend.

title: The Envy of Less Happier Lands
description: ALDEBURGH, England, June 7In the parish church yester day afternoon eight members of the Suffolk Guild of Ringers attempted a peal of Rutland Surprize Major. So the an nouncement said beforehand. Those who remember their Dorothy Sayers will understand what is involved in ringing church bells for hours in a complex, changing order. Lis tening through the birds on a warm, hazy afternoon, the un initiated visitor thought the attempt at the peal had succeeded.

title: NEW TOWER STIRS STORM IN LONDON
description: LONDON, June 7  A new tower looming over Hyde Park has brought cries of outrage from Londoners and rekindled controversy about highrise buildings in this city of inti mate vistas.

title: Cambodians Battle Enemy At City Near Angkor Wat
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, June 8Fighting continued today around the provincial capital of Siemreap in Cambodia. Informants said that if the city should fall, the North Vietnamese and Vietcong troops would have a major psychological victory because Siemreap is just six miles south of the historic ruins of Angkor Wat.

title: RED SOX SET BACK ROYALS, 74, 52
description: BOSTON, June 7 (UPI)Rico Petrocelli's grandslam homer in the eighth inning gave the Boston Red Sox a 52 victory over the Kansas City Royals today and a sweep of a double header. Tony Conigliaro's three runs batted in produced a 74 triumph in the opener.

title: GREEKAMERICANS PLAY SOCCER DRAW
description: The GermanHungarians and the New York GreekAmericans, division winners, battled to a 22 tie yesterday in the opener of the GermanAmerican Soc cer League playoffs at Metro politan Oval in Maspeth, Queens before about 500 fans.

title: Goldberg's Campaign
description: At Goldberg  for Governor headquarters in the Lancaster Hotel, workers refer to the June 23 Democratic primary election against Howard J. Samuels as a dry run and say they have polls showing their candidate winning by al most 3 to 1. Few Democratic politicians would disagree with the opinion that Arthur J. Gold berg is winning now, but there are enormous differ ences of opinion within the party about his chances against Governor Rockefeller in November.

title: BASENJI IS BEST AT WILTON SHOW
description: WILTON,Conn., June 7  Champion Reveille ReUp, the foremost Basenji in competi tion, became best in show to day in the 38th event of the LongshoreSouthport Kennel Club. The show attracted 1,731 dogs to the spacious athletic field of the Wilton Junior High School.

title: LINDSAY DEFENDS TAXES FOR BUDGET
description: Mayor Lindsay defended his proposed $7.8billion expense budget yesterday and said that requested new taxes on auto use, hotels and commercial oc cupancy were necessary for the maintenance of a decent qual ity of life in New York City.

title: An Eye for Individuals
description: At King's College, Cam bridge, where E. M. Forster was an honorary fellow, the young people used to call him Morgan, sip his sherry and take apart their own writings and sometimes, his. Whatever the gap in years, there was a closeness in sympathy and understanding.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Drug Programs

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Jubilant Shrimpers Return to the Sea After Tragedy of Camille
description: BILOXI, Miss., June 7An ancient mariners' ritual, hon ored by time and deepened by calamity, was repeated here to day as a long time of shrimp boats chudded past a Roman Cath?? priest for the blessings of the church.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Ceylon Seeks Shift In Rubber Contract
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, June 7  Ceylon's new united front Gov ernment of Mrs. Sirimavo Band aranaike wants Communist China and Poland to release Ceylon from commitments to trade 27,000 tons of sheet rub ber so that it can be sold on the open market for badly needed sterling and dollars.

title: Veteran of Vietnam Accuses an Officer In Death of 28 G.I.'s
description: LONDON, Monday, June 8 (Reuters)An American soldier on leave from West Germany said ata rally against the war in Vietnam here last night that the stupidity of an officer had cost the lives of 28 of American servicemen in South Vietnam.

title: Lindsay Urges New Center in Politics
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., June 7Mayor Lindsay called today for a new center in national politics that rejects the polari zation and bitterness of the ex treme right and the far left.

title: Hovley of Brewers on Block After Refusing to Pay Fine
description: MILWAUKEE, June 7 (UPI)  Steve Hovley, Milwaukee Brewers' outfielder, is out of uniform and on the trading block because he refused to pay a fine for being late for a game, Marvin Milkes general manager, disclosed today.

title: Business Governor
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yesterday that the contention of Howard J. Samuels that the state needed a tough busi nessman at the top resembled a posture adopted by Governor Rockefeller who, in his 12 years in office, has botched the job.

title: Dr. Lloyd Dropkin Weds Miss Deutsch
description: Miss Ronnie Sue Deutsch and Dr. Lloyd Richard Drop kin were married here last evening at the St. Regis Sheraton Roof. Rabbi Na than A. Perilman performed the ceremony.

title: Keogh Takes Bicycle Race
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., June 7 (AP)  James Keogh of the Bronx took first prize today in the 75mile Essex County bi cycle race.

title: McDonagh, 45, Wins Run
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., June 7 (AP)Jim McDonagh of New York, 45 years old, represent ing the Millrose Athletic Asso ciation, won the Holyoke Marathon today for the third year in a row, covering the 26mile385yard distance in 2 hours 35 minutes 9 seconds Ron Johnson of Garden City Ill., finished second in 2:38:57.

title: Laguna Keeps Title By Stopping Suzuki In the 13th Round
description: PANAMA, June 7 (AP) Ismael Laguna of Panama mounted a methodical, relent less attack against Ishimatsu Suzuki and pounded out a technical knockout victory over the Japanese challenger in the 13th round to maintain his world lightweight title last night.

title: Limited Sale of U.S. Planes To Israel Hinted by Rogers
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the United States would announce fairly soon its decision on the sale of jet warplanes to Israel, but he strongly hinted that it would be only partly favorable.

title: Orioles Turn Back Brewers, 76, As Watt Checks Rally in Eighth
The Who and Tommy Rock the Met
description: For five hours yesterday the Metropolitan Opera House became the Fillmore North.

title: DR. PAUL L. KIRK, CRIMINOLOGIST, 68
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 7 (AP)  Dr. Paul L. Kirk, who founded the criminalistics de partment at the University of California in Berkeley and who was a defense witness in the Sheppard murder trial, died Friday. He was 68 years old.

title: Braque Jewelry Stolen
description: NIMES, France, June 7 (UPI) Six pieces of jewelry, valued at $272,000, designed by Georges Braque, the cubist painter, were stolen from the Fine Art Mu seum here last night, the police said. The stolen pieces, part of a larger collection on exhibi tion, included a 10pound piece of gold in the shape of a fish entitled Glaucos. It was val ued at $136,000, the police said. The total collection on display at the museum was in sured for $2.7million, museum spokesmen said.

title: MRS. KNAUER URGES POWER CRISIS STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer sent a warning to urban officials and utility companies today to re view plans for handling a pow er crisis this summer.

title: Koch Disagrees With Rao On Vietnam Troop Pullout
description: The two candidates in the Democratic primary in the 17th Congressional District in Man hattan differed sharply yester day on the issue of American troop withdrawals from South east Asia.

title: A Cabinet Change With Questions
description: WASHINGTON, June 7It is said here of the Cabinet job that President Nixon has now transfered from Robert H. Finch to Elliott L. Richardson that whoever holds it for any length of time is bound to grow in education and to diminish in both health and welfare.

title: Fame Was LongLasting
description: Edward Morgan Forster, regarded as one of the great men of English letters, wrote his lastand most popular novel more than 40 years ago, but unlike others who retire to greatness, he had been heard from since.

title: Badillo Sees U.S. Torn by Worsening Civil War
description: Herman Badillo, former Bronx Borough President and a Democratic candidate for a House seat in the new 21st Congressional District, assert ed yesterday that the United States was in a steadily worsening civil war.

title: BELGIAN GRAND PRIX WON BY RODRIGUEZ
description: FRANCORCHAMPS, Belgium, June 7 (AP)Pedro Rodriguez of Mexico stayed just ahead of the favored Chris Amon of New Zealand for the last 23 laps to day and won the Belgian Grand Prix by one second in a BRM.

title: PICKUP IS SLATED IN BOND ACTIVITY
description: The bond markets rallied last week for the first time since early spring, and then its re covery faltered. With a larger supply of new issues for sale this week, there is relatively little hope that the advance in prices can be made to con tinue.

title: Laverne Hanover Scores
description: MONTREAL, June 7 (Cana dian Press)Laverne Hanover, driven by George Sholty, won the $75,000 Prix d'Ete, Canada's richest harness race, at Blue Bonnets Raceway today. He covered the mile in 1:57 25.

title: Businessmen Urged to Reduce Students' Mistrust
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa.Recruit ers from 100 companies last week heard a plea from a prominent educator to help reduce the litany of macro problems which disturbs college students and causes them to shun business ca reers.

title: Now It's High Echelon Who Is Coughing
description: According to John Jacobs, the trainer of High Echelon, the colt went into the Belmont Stakes just in time.

title: Indians Pour Into Peru's Cities, Causing Concern in Government
description: LIMA, Peru, June 7Thou sands of Indians are pouring out of their Andean settlements this weekend and moving to ward valley and coastal com munities.

title: Extent of Drug Use and Addiction in Armed Forces Appears Wider Than Pentagon's Statistics Show
description: John Little joined the Ma rines to get away from a drug habit. Within a year he had advanced to the rank of lance corporal. Then last March 15 the 18yearold Minnesotan was found dead in a gear cleaning room at the Quantico Marine base in Virginia. He had died of an overdose of heroin.

title: Train Hits Brick Wall In Flatbush Mystery
description: Someone ran a Long Island Railroad train through a brick wall last night at the Flatbush yard in Brooklyn and the police are searching for a youth who may have been responsible.

title: MAY GROWTH RATE OF MONEY DROPPED
description: The nation's money supply expanded at an annual rate of 6 per cent during the month of May, according to pre liminary data, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yesterday.

title: The Wrong Prescription
description: Bureaucracies easily succumb to the virus of self satisfaction and rigidity. Public education has not been immune to the disease, and many parents feel that the public schools' responsiveness to their children's needs leaves much to be desired. To this creeping dissatis faction has more recently been added the charge by Negro and Puerto Rican parents that the schools are failing their children.

title: Japanese Leftist Seized
description: TOKYO, JUNE 7 (UPI)  A leader of Japan's radical left was arrested today in the hi jacking of a Japanese jetliner to North Korea on March 31. He was identified as Hiroyuki Takahara, 26 years old.

title: In Memoriam
description: ABUGOVAlan. Our thoughts are with you on this the eleventh anniversary of your passing. DAD, MOTHER and LESLEY.

title: Barrier Wins by 3 Strokes
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., June 7 (AP)Jerry Barrier fired a 70 over the 7,352yard par72 Newport News municipal course today to win the Kiwan isPeninsula open golf tourna ment with a 72hole score of 286, three shots ahead of Rives McBee and Rocky Thompson.

title: British Princess Visits Tito
description: BRIONI ISLAND, Yugoslavia. June 7 (Reuters)  Princess Margaret of England and Lord Snowdon, her husband, relaxed today at President Tito's Adri atic island residence here after a 1,500mile tour of Yugo slavia.

title: Costa Rican Official Urges Military Uprising in Cuba
description: MIAMI, June 7Foreign Min ister Gonzalo Facio of Costa Rica has urged Latin Americans to foster an uprising of disaf fected elements in the Cuban armed forces against the Gov ernment of Premier Fidel Castro.

title: Italy Votes in Local Elections, First for 15 Regions
description: ROME, June 7  Elections started today for local admin istrations throughout Italy.

title: Bridge:
description: Teams headed by Edgar Kaplan of New York and Hal Fein of Eastchester, N.Y., survivors of a field of 98 teams, battled yesterday at the New York Hilton in the final of the Reisinger Knock out Team Championship. Af ter 48 deals of a scheduled 64, Kaplan led by 8 interna tional match points.

title: Regions of Poverty Begin to Trouble Australians
description: WALGETT, Australia, May 29On the outskirts of this colorless market town for sheep raisers in the flat, grim Out back, Mrs. Annie Solomon, an aboriginal woman, is rearing four children in an improvised humpy, a shack or salvaged corrugated metal sheets, with out electricity, water or a tilet.

title: MIKE QUARRY ON CARD WITH BROTHER JERRY
description: Mike Quarry, the undefeated younger brother of Jerry Quar ry, will meet Ray Ayala of Puerto Rico in a 10round light heavyweight bout at Madison Square Garden on June 17.

title: Transplant Patient Dies
description: MILWAUKEE, June 8Mrs. Elverna Fillner, 37 years old, who received the heart of a 45 yearold Illinois man in a trans plant operation May 13, died last night at St. Luke's Hospital here. Mrs. Fillner had been in satisfactory condition until May 29, when signs of rejection and lung infection appeared. She received the heart of Garol E. Gaylor, who had a cerebral hemorrhage.

title: BUFFALO NEGROES TALK TO GOVERNOR
description: BUFFALO, June 8Governor Rockefeller came here today to break ground for part of a massive state building program and stayed to search for an agreement i n a dispute that has held up the program for two years.

title: RING BODY SUPPORTS DISCIPLINING LAGUNA
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 8 (AP)The World Boxing Coun cil has voted unanimously to support the California Athletic Commission's suspension of Is mael Laguna, the lightweight champion, the commission's ex ecutive officer, Robert Turley, said today.

title: Venturi,64 Open Victor,Fails70 Trial
Job Letter Is Clarified By Health Department
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) While sending out a follow up letter of clarification, of ficials acknowledged today, that a letter had gone out to about 30 college deans say ing that any candidate they suggested for a top Federal health job ought to be a Republican.

title: Arthritis Fund Plans Art Show On L.I. Saturday
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 8Art Al Fresco, the annual art exhibition and sale for the benefit of the Arthritis Foundation, will be held in Thomas Park here on Saturday from 11 A.M. to 6 P.M. In case of rain the show will be postponed un til Sunday.

title: 8 Major Banks Planning An International Loan Unit
description: LONDON, June 8 (UPI) Eight major international banks are forming a new joint enter prise to be known as United International Bank, Ltd., which will be incorporated soon in London, subject to approval by regulatory authorities in cer tain memberbank countries. The international merchant bank will specialize in making mediumterm loans to major in ternational companies and gov ernment agencies.

title: North Vietnam Asks Efforts in Economy; Reports Slow Gains
description: HONG KONG, June 8 (Reu ters)Premier Pham Van Dong of North Vietnam has reported slow economic progress and called for efforts to meet in creasing demands arising from the Indochina war.

title: Mets Top Astros, 20, on Shamsky's 2Run Homer and McAndrew's 5Hitter
description: HOUSTON, June 8  The Mets took the advice of a bill board advertisement in this Astroeverything town and had fun tonight.

title: PRINTING PAPERS GO UP $20 A TON
description: The Hammermill Paper Com pany announced yesterday it planned to increase prices for its uncoated fine and printing grade papers by $20 a ton, effective July 6. The papers are used in business com munications.

title: Army Seen Ready to Drop Case Against Mylai Officer
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., June 8 (UPI)  The Army is reported planning to drop all charges tomorrow against one of four officers charged in the alleged Mylai massacre.

title: 20th Certury Fund Panel Would End S pending Limit in Congress Campaigns
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 A special study committee re ported today that the problem of financing Senate and House campaigns had reached crisis proportions but recommended that no spending ceilings be established.

title: Bonn, Buoyed by Support at Home and Abroad, Presses Talks With the Soviet Bloc
description: BONN, June 8Encouraged by signs of support both at home and abroad, the coalition government headed by Chan cellor Willy Brandt today, stepped up its Eastern policy of seeking better relations with Communist Europe.

title: FRED C. MACDONALD
description: Fred C. Macdonald, professor of science education in the Jamaica (Queens) Teachers Col lege until it closed In 1933, and later chairman of the science department at Girls High School in Brooklyn, died Satur day at his home In Setauket, L. I. He was 95 years old.

title: TWO U.S. OFFICIALS MEET WITH LON NOL
description: SAIGON, Shuth Vietnam, June 8 (AP)Two members of President Nixon's 13man fact finding team flew to Pnomperrh early today for a meeting with Premier Lon Nol of Cambodia.

title: Earth Satellites Viewed as Vital Tool in Protecting World Resources as Population Soars
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 Earth satellites will be need ed to help man husband the world's resources, keep peace with the environment and per haps even prevent starvation, a Government report suggests.

title: The Dickens Ideal
description: Charles Dickens died a century ago todayand that is greater news than the forgotten anniversaries of monarchs and generals in the world that still cele brates the kingdom of letters. Rather than by memorial services in Westminster Abbey or by Pickwickian literary toasts here, he is still receiving the only recognition dreamed of by serious writers: to have their books and ideas live.

title: Miss Mary A. C. Swaney Fiancee Of Willard,Bunn 3d, a Bank Aide
description: Miss Mary Ann Chambers Swaney, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Charles Arthur Swaney of WinstonSalem, N. C., and Willard Bunn 3d are planning an August wed ding in New York.

title: Commencement Speakers Across the Nation Stress the Theme of Reconciliation
description: Most of the major difficulties beset ting America in 1970the Indochina war, pollution, rebellion and reaction, racism and the struggle for equality have provided ready material for col lege commencement speakers through out the nation.

title: PRESIDENT IS TOLD OF STUDENT ANGER
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 President Nixon was told to day that nonpolitical sons and daughters of the middle class were becoming increasingly suspicious of the Administra tion's policies and were rapidly being pushed into the radical camp by some of the Ad ministration's rhetoric.

title: HARTFORD DEAL PUSHED BY I.T.T.
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, confronted by a new round of legal actions by Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said yesterday that it was acting on the advice of its Connecticut lawyers and going ahead with its plans to merge with the Hartford Fire Insurance Com pany.

title: Women Athletes to Share Spotlight in Metropolitan A.A.U. Meet Saturday
LEMON WORK ADDED BY BALLET THEATER
description: The Moor's Pavane, the Jose Limn modern dance work, has been added to the schedule of the American Bal let Theater, whose engagement at the New York State Theater begins next Tuesday and runs through July 12. The Limn work will have its first per formance of the season on Sat urday evening, June 27.

title: WAYNE C. GROVER, U.S. ARCHIVIST, 64
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Dr. Wayne C. Grover, archivist of the United States from 1948 to 1965, died today of cancer at his home in Silver Spring, Md. He was 64 years old.

title: Rightist Party Bombed
description: CHICAGO, June 8 (UPI)A grenadetype bomb shattered four windows today at the Chicago headquarters of the National Socialist White Peo ple's party, once known as the American Nazi party. No one was injured. The party changed its name after George Lincoln Rockwell, American Nazi party leader, was shot to death in 1467.

title: Siberiap Red Tape Delays Tourist Flight From U.S.
description: ANCHORAGE, June 8 (AP) American aviation's first com mercial flight to Siberia got caught in red tape, and as a result was delayed for four and a half hours.

title: Palisades Park Body Fights Can Plant
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., June 8A suit by State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz to halt con struction of an aluminumcan manufacturing plant in nearby Congers was put over today until June 16 in Rockland Coun ty Supreme Court.

title: Intrepid Takes Measure of Valiant Twice in Start of America's Cup Trials
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 8 Intrepid looked Valiant straight in the eye today and trounced the new boat twice as the pre liminary America's Cup defense trials got under way on Long Island Sound.

title: Even on the East Side, Tenants' Cause Can Inspire Camaraderie
description: They wear hair styles by Sassoon, Monsieur Marc or Kenneth instead of polk bonnets, and their menfolk carry Gucci briefcases Instead of sixshooters. But if their methods are 20th century, their motives are Early Homestead.

title: N.C.A.A., Big 10 Investigating Iowa Recruiting, Athletic Aid
description: IOWA CITY, June 8 (AP) The National Collegiate Athletic Association and the Big Ten Conference are conducting an investigation of the athletic de partment at the University of Iowa concerning the recruit ment and financial assistance of athletes, Sam Fahr, chair man of the Board in Control of Athletics, revealed today.

title: Union Leaders Reject Canadian Plan for Pay Curbs
description: OTTAWA, June 8Canada's labor union leaders today firmly rejected Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's pro gram for pricewage restraint and left the Government in a dilemma over future antiinfla tion procedures.

title: S Missing TV Newsmen Reported Held by Enemy
description: The National Droadoasting Company quoted a Cam bodian Army spokesman yes terday as having said that a television correspondent and four cameramen had been taken to a safe mountain hideout by the Vietcong.

title: U.S. Funds to Help Develop PhosphateFree Detergents
description: BOSTON, June 8 (AP)A Federal grant of $344,000 to develop phosphatefree laundry detergents has been awarded to the Gillette Company's Re search Institute in Rockville, Md., the company announced today.

title: O.A.S. CONFERENCE IS MOVED TO U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Council of the Organization of American States voted unani mously today to transfer from Santo Domingo to Washington the site of the forthcoming conference of hemisphere for eign ministers.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today the names of the following men from the New York area as having been killed in the war in Southeast Asia:

title: ARGENTINE CHIEF IS FORCED TO QUIT IN MILITARY COUP
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 8 The Commanders in Chief of Argentina's Army, Navy and Air Force announced today that Lieut. Gen. Juan Carlos Onga nia had been deposed as Presi dent and that they were taking over the Government.

title: SEALE'S SUPPORTERS CLASH WITH POLICE
description: CHICAGO, June 8 (UPI) United States marshals and the police tussled today with shout ing supporters of Bobby Seale in the lobby of the Federal Building after members of the Chicago Seven had exhorted demonstrators to free the Black Panther national chairman by any means necessary.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A Scout is brave. He has courage to face danger and to stand up for the right against the coaxings of friends or the jeers or threats of enemies, and defeat does not down him. The Boy Scout Handbook.

title: Article 1  No Title
BENJAMIN ELIASOPH, MOUNT SINAI DOCTOR
description: Dr. Benjamin Eliasoph, a physician at Mount Sinai Hos pital who was a pioneer in the design of the oxygen tent, died Sunday at the hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Profits and Sales Set Mark for Year At BrownForman
BRUCE FLOWERS, 65, LIGHTWEIGHT BOXER
description: HAWTHORNE, N. Y. June 8 (AP)Bruce Flowers, a prom inent lightweight boxer in the 1920's and l930's, died yester day at a nursing home here after a long illness. He was 65 years old.

title: Col. Jane E. Wrieden, 64, Salvation Army Consultant
description: Col. Jane E. Wrieden, na tional consultant for the wo men's and children's services of the Salvation Army, died Sunday at her home, 3 Wash ington Square Village. She was 64 years old.

title: France Holds Common Market Cannot Exist With E.F.T.A. Bloc
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 8 France told its five partners in the European Economic Com munity today that a European free trade area could not exist together with the community.

title: F. I. duPont and Hirsch Join Merger Trend
description: One of the largest consolida tion trends in Wall Street his tory continued to take shape yesterday with the surprise an nouncement that Francis I. du Pont & Co. and Hirsch & Co. would merge July 1.

title: Observer: Planning Troubles on Men's Feet
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The men's socks industry  and please don't ask who that is has decided to give itself a shot in the arm. (All right, pedants, a shot in the foot.) What with men's underwear becom ing more colorful by the day, men's shirts beginning to look like Victorian wallpaper and men's neckties assuming the prerogatives once exclusive to neon signs in Las Vegas, the men's socks game with its same old blues, blacks, greys, greens, whites and reds has obviously been mired back in the 1960's.

title: Jackson Mayor Says Study Finds City Police Didn't Fire
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 8 Mayor Russell Davis said today investigations had shown that the Jackson city police did not fire a shot when gunfire into a Jackson State College dormi tory last month left two stu dents dead.

title: Names of Artists in Biennale Released
description: A list of 44 artists whose prints have been chosen for ex hibition in the United States Pavilion at the Venice Biennale was released for the first time yesterday by officials of the Smithsonian Institution's Inter national Art Program, which sponsors participation in art programs abroad.

title: Air Force Says North American Had Lowest Bid for B1 Bomber
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Air Force said today that North American Rockwell Cor poration, Los Angeles, had been the lowest bidder and had the highest rated proposal in win ning a contract to develop an advanced bomber.

title: Court Lets Farber Run as Liberal for Congress
description: Representative Leonard Farb stein failed yesterday to pre vent Barry Farber from running in November on the Liberal party line for Congress in the 19th Congressional District.

title: COMPUTER COMPLEX DROPPED BY XEROX
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif., June 8 (AP)Xerox Data Systems has canceled plans to build a $35 million headquarters complex and has laid off 350 of its 5,500 employes, blaming the nation's economic slowdown for poor computor sales.

title: OFFICER CHANGES CONTINUE AT I.O.S.
description: GENEVA, June 8The fu ture of Investors Overseas Services remained clouded to day with the disclosure of more board and management changes by the battered mutualfund empire.

title: SWISS TIGHTEN CURB ON FOREIGN WORKERS
description: GENEVA, June 8The Swiss Government today tightened restrictions on the admission of temporary foreign workers. Ac cording to political sources, this constituted the first move by the Government to concili ate the more than half a mil lion Swiss males who voted yesterday for a constitutional amendment that would have resulted in the expulsion of 300,000 of the 600,000 foreign workers. The amendment was defeated.

title: Egypt Budgets $1.2Billion For '70 Defense Spending
description: CAIRO, June 8The United Arab Republic has budgeted $1.2 billion for military spend ing and related war expenses in the fiscal year starting July 1, it was announced here today.

title: TOP OFFICER QUITS AT PENN CENTRAL IN CASH SQUEEZE
description: Stuart T. Saunders resigned yesterday as chairman of the board and chief executive offi cer of the Penn Central Trans portation Company, the nation's largest railroad.

title: CORSON INSTALLED AS HEAD OF CORNELL
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 8 Dale R. Corson was installed today as president of Cornell University in a combined in vestiture and commencement ceremony before almost 10,000 people.

title: Army Psychiatrist Challenges Order To Go to Vietnam
description: An Army psychiatrist ob tained an order yesterday from Federal Judge John F. X. Mc Gohey for a hearing today at 10 A. M. at the United States Court House at Foley Square to seek the blocking of his assignment to Vietnam.

title: Nassau Grand Jury Exonerates Stewart After a Hearing on Sawchuk's Death
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 8 The Nassau County Grand Jury exonerated Ron Stewart today of any responsibility in what District Attorney William Cahn called the tragic, senseless, bizarre death of Terry Saw chuk.

title: Advertising: Weekly Is Rural  and Happy
description: If major national maga zines want to concentrate their circulation in the metro politan markets, that's just fine with Grit, the small town weekly. Rural America has been its bag for 87 years.

title: Art in Boston Kindles Hope for Cities
description: BOSTON, June 8What would our cities look like if artists were allowed to re design them? This question, which has sometimes led to some highly theoretical (not to say, farfetched) answers, is currently the subject of a very pragmatic exhibition. So pragmatic, indeed, that the exhibition itself, called Proj ect '70, is installed not at the Institute of Contemporary Art, which organized the show, but in the exhibition galleries of Boston's beautiful new City Hall.

title: Franco Meets de Gaulle, on Visit, for the First Time
description: MADRID, June 8Former President Charles de Gaulle of France and Generalissimo Francisco Franco of Spain met today for the first time.

title: Primitive Spanish Village Puts Up ForSale Sign
description: PAZUENGOS, Spain  The heads of the 49 families that still live in this isolated north ern villageabout six miles beyond maintained roadshave unanimously decided to put a Town for Sale sign on the homes and lands where their ancestors have lived since the 15th century. The asking price is about $335,000.

title: Asia and the Peking Khans
description: In an article with the provocative title quoted above, the Soviet weekly New Times has spelled out Mos cow's deep disquiet at Communist China's recent polit ical gains in Southeast Asia. New Times indicts Peking as partly responsible for Sihanouk's fall from power in Cambodia, and obliquely warns Hanoi that it runs the risk of defeat and destruction if it follows China's advice.

title: SAMUELS, RANGEL BACK EACH OTHER
description: Howard J. Samuels, a candi date for the Democratic nomi nation for Governor, won the support yesterday of Assembly man Charles B. Rangel, who is seeking the nomination for The House of Representatives from Harlem.

title: The Outlook for Latin America: Persistence of Strongman Rule
description: BUENOS AIRESThe rule of the strongman in Latin Amer ica, once thought to be on the decline, seems more pervasive than ever.

title: Court Gets $100MillionDemand Linked to Suspect in Hijacking
description: WASHINGTON. June 8 (AP)  A petition demanding $100million from the Federal Government was received by the Supreme Court today from Auther G. Barkley of Phoenix, Ariz., the name given by a man who hijacked an airliner here last Thursday.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW PRICE DROP
description: Prices generally sagged on the London stock market yes terday in a continuance of the downtrend that had persisted through most of last week.

title: Addonizio Trial Is Shifted to Hospital
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., June 8A paralyzed witness, unable to move his arms or legs, was wheeled into an improvised courtroom at the Veterans Ad ministration Hospital here to day for a preliminary examina tion by Federal Judge George H. Barlow in the trial of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio and seven other defendants charged with extortion.

title: Badillo Scores Young Lords For Attack on Puerto Rican
description: Former Bronx Borough pres ident Herman Badillo scored members of the Young Lords yesterday for throwing eggs and tomatoes at Puerto Rico's Gov. Luis Ferre in Sunday's Puerto Rican Day parade here.

title: Commandos in Jordan Kidnap, Then Release, a U.S. Diplomat
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 8 (Reuters)  Palestinian com mandos kidnapped an Ameri can diplomat, Morris Draper, as he drove to a dinner party here last night and released him today, a United States Em assv snokesman announced.

title: Elevation or Demotion?
description: An obvious question is raised by President Nixon's first Cabinet change. If the President was prompted to move Robert Finch into the White House in order to have the benefit of his advice, why did he so often ignore the advice offered by Mr. Finch as Secre tary of Health, Education and Welfare? In that capac ity the man who supposedly is now to be the Kis singer of domestic policy was overruled repeatedly on both appointments and policy.

title: PADRES GIVE ROOKIE $100,000 CONTRACT
description: ATLANTA, June 8 (UPI) Mike Ivie, 17yearold catcher, the major leagues' top draft choice, was reported to have signed a contract in the $100, 000plus range with the San Diego Padres of the National League.

title: CLIFFORD DAVIS, 72, EXHOUSE MEMBER
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) Clifford Davis, former Demo cratic Representative from Ten nessee, died after a stroke here today. His age was 72.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Joins Campaign To Collect Bail for Joan Bird
description: Representative Shirley Chis holm joined members of a women's liberation organization yesterday in announcing a drive to raise $100,000 bail, money for Joan Bird, one of the Black Panthers on trial on charges of attempted murder and conspiracy to bomb public places.

title: Justices to Weigh Curbs on Housing
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Supreme Court has decided to rule on the constitutionality of referendum laws that permit a majority of the voters in a community to block the con struction of lowcost housing for the poor.

title: 10 SOCCER TEAMS ARE STILL KICKING
description: As the World Cup soccer tournament moves toward the quarterfinals, the outcome of each game becomes more im portant and the game of let's suppose more popular.

title: Art Sale to Assist Studio School
description: The New York Studio School of Drawing, Painting and Sculpture will benefit from a sale of paintings at the Leo Castelli Gallery, 4 East 77th Street, Thursday through June 27. Artists represented include Robert Rauschenberg, Jasper Johns, Larry Rivers, Andy Warhol and Alexander Calder.

title: DR. FRANK C. KEIL
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 8 Dr. Frank C. Kell, a pediatri cian with offices here at 1010 Park Avenue, died Saturday morning at Muhlenburg Hos pital following a heart attack. He was 48 years old and lived at 1411 Highland Avenue here.

title: New Frozen Coffee System Offered by Minute Maid
description: A new Minute Maid coffee system, designed to help solve the cost, labor and consistency problems of coffee making by restaurateurs and institutional food service managers, was an nounced yesterday by the Coca Cola Company.

title: Ezzak Ruvenoff, ExDancer With Imperial Ballet, 96
description: MONTREAL, June 8Ezzak Ruvenoff, a dance master and former star of the Imperial Russian Ballet, died in a hos pital here yesterday. He was 96 years old.

title: 47 RABBIS ORDAINED IN CEREMONIES HERE
description: Two major institutions of American Conservative and Re form Judaism held annual com mencement ceremonies yester day, awarding honorary degrees and ordaining 47 seminary graduates as rabbis.

title: Baseball Players Ratify Pact With Owners, 54154
description: The major league baseball players have ratified, by a vote of 54154, the terms of a new basic agreement with the club owners. The owners ratified the threeyear pact, which has provisions retroactive to Jan. 1, several days ago.

title: Libyan Leader, in Lebanon, Honors the Unknown Soldier
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 8 (Reuters)Col. Muammar el Qaddafi, chairman of the Libyan Revolutionary Com mand Council, placed a wreath on the tomb of Lebanon's un known soldier today, then left with senior army officers for a tour of Lebanese military posts.

title: SYRIA AND ISRAEL IN GOLAN BATTLE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 8 Syria reported a fivehour ar tillery, tank and air battle along the entire length of her front with Israel today. A Da mascus military communiqu said that as many as 60 Israeli soldiers had been killed or wounded.

title: Arab States Will Blacklist 73 Senators Backing Israel
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 8 (AP)The 73 United States Senators who recently signed a letter urging President Nixon to sell more warplanes to Israel will be blacklisted in the Arab world, according to the Com missioner General of the Arab League's boycott of Israel of fice.

title: Settlement Bank Calls Recession Inescapable If Inflation Goes On
description: BASEL, Switzerland, June 8One of Europe's most influential banking Institutions said today a world recession would be inescapable if inflation was not brought under control. It also criticized in uncharacteristically blunt terms the newest lines of United States monetary di plomacy. Bleakly assessing, the problems of the dollar, the Bank for International Settlements, for 40 years a central bankers' central bank, also issued a call for an Amer ican incomes policy, joining such other international bodies as the Organization for Eco nomic Cooperation and De velopment (O.E.C.D.) and the International Monetary Fund (I.M.F)

title: Insurance Agents Oppose Expansion of Prudential
description: The Prudential Insurance Company, which recently an nounced plans to go into the automobile and homeowner in surance business, ran into op position yesterday from the National Association of Insur ance Agents.

title: Assessment in Cambodia
description: TAYNINH, South Vietnam, June 8United States military commanders and intelligence analysts estimate that allied forces have found only 30 per cent to 40 per cent of the enemy arms and supply stock piles in Cambodian sanctuaries.

title: NEW WIRE OFFERED BY GENERAL CABLE
description: The General Cable Corpora tion announced yesterday that it would market a building wire to consist 70 per cent of alumi num, as an alternative to cop per wire. The new product will have an aluminum core bonded to a copper sheath.

title: Bridge:
description: The Reisinger knockout team championship, a highly prized honor for four dec ades, was decided in the small hours of yesterday morning with a victory for Edgar Kaplan, Jeff Rubens and Leonard Harmon, all of New York, Norman Kay of Philadelphia, Monroe Ingber man of New Paltz, N. Y., and Alfred Sheinwold of Los Angeles.

title: Rubber Union to Vote
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 8 (AP) The United Rubber Workers union said today that its mem bers would vote tomorrow and Wednesday on a proposed new threeyear contract with the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, the nation's largest rubber, concern. The contract, given tentative approval by ne gotiators Friday night, covers 23,000 U.R.W. members in Goodyear plants in 12 states.

title: Janice Broder Married Here
description: Miss Janice Broder, who was graduated May 31 from the University of Bridgeport, was married here last evening to Thomas Charles Burne, who received an A.B. degree June 1 from Brown Univer sity. Rabbi Ronald Sobel per formed the ceremony at the Regency.

title: SEASONAL HIGHS SET IN SOYBEANS
description: Seasonal highs in the July, August and September futures contracts for soybeans were at tained yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Grains futures prices were irregular, however, with December wheat register ing seasonal lows as local trad ers and commission houses sold rather heavily.

title: Sales of Mobile Homes Halt Trend with Gains
description: Shipments of mobile homes, which slumped during the first quarter, rose sharply in April, the Mobile Homes Manufacturers Association said yesterday.

title: PEKING SUPPORTS KOREAN CHARGES
description: HONG KONG, June 8  Communist China denounced the United States today for what it called aggressive acts against the North Koreans.

title: OUTPUT FOR STEEL IS ALMOST STEADY
description: Steel production last week edged down 0.4 per cent, com pared with output the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yester day.

title: Belmont Double Returns $1,043
description: Large figures of a different sort were the main topic at Belmont Park yesterday. On Saturday, of course, major in terest centered on the $158,750 gross purse of the Belmont Stakes, and the $115,000 that went to the winner, Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs's High Echelon. The Monday crowd of 27,726 had a daily double payoff of $1,043.20 to think and talk about.

title: JUSTICES REFUSE ESTATE TAX CASE
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The United States Supreme Court refused without explana tion today to hear an appeal on a case that sought to change the ruling that bases the Fed eral estate tax on mutual funds on the bid price rather than the higher asked price.

title: Vote Recess Is Rejected At Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 8  Declaring that Harvard University's central function was learning and scholarship, the faculty of arts and sci ences refused today to sus pend classes for two weeks next fall to free students for election campaign work.

title: F.T.C.MAPS CHANGE TO AID CONSUMER
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Federal Trade Commission, which has been accused in re cent years of being lax in protecting consumer interests, announced today a major re organization of its staff to increase the consumer's faith in the market place.

title: BONANZA REDUCES PAIN OF YANKEES
description: The financial bonanza of 65, 880 fans at the Yankees' Bat Day promotional extravaganza on Sunday helped take some of the bitterness out of the 12 inning 43 defeat at the hands of the Chicago White Sox.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Olin Corporation to Stop Producing DDT June 30
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Olin Corporation announced to day that it would halt pro duction of the pesticide DDT on June 30.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Farbstein Faces a Strong Challenge by Bella Abzug
description: Representative Leonard Farb stein of Manhattan, who has turned back formidable reform challengers in each Democratic Congressional primary since 1962, is facing formidable op position from a woman this year.

title: BIG BOARD GAINS ON LOW VOLUME
description: The stock market posted a mild advance yesterday as vol ume of only 8.04 million shares, the lowest in a month, reflected the caution that still prevails in the investment community.

title: Light on State Issues
description: The contest for the Democratic gubernatorial nomi nation in this state is turning into a strangely one sided affair insofar as any serious discussion of state issues is concerned.

title: Rates for Bonds Renew Uptrend As NewIssue Supply Increases
description: Interest rates, after declining slightly last week, are climbing once again. The renewal of the downward trend in bond prices resulted from the increasingly large supply of new issues scheduled for sale over the next several weeks. Since bonds offered last week failed to attract investors yields were raised.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: SST Claims Disputed

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Wallace Ads Thank Voter
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 8 (UPI)George C. Wallace took advertisements in Alabama newspapers today, thanking the people of the state for his gubernatorial primary victory last Tuesday and promising voters the best years of our lives.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 9, 1970

title: AMEX PRICES GAIN IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Most issues on the American Stock Exchange managed to make slight gains yesterday al though increased selling pres sure in the last two hours of trading erased some of the earlier advances.

title: President Tells Industry Leaders Decision Will Be Made June 17
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Administration probably will not oppose Congressional ef forts to impose quotas on for eign imports of textiles, in formed Government and indus try sources disclosed today.

title: M'MANUS UPSETS EL SHAFEI AT NET
description: BRISTOL, England, June 8 (Reuters)Unseeded Jim Mc Manus of Berkeley, Calif., gained the second round of the Wills open tennis tournament today by eliminating Ismael El Shafei of the United Arab Re public, 86, 16, 64.

title: BID IS ACCEPTED FOR UNE DE MAI
description: WESTBURY, L.I., June 8  Count Pierre de Montesson of Bouce, Normandy, the owner of Une de Mai, has accepted the invitation to have his French mare compete in the Roosevelt International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway on July 18. The acceptance was announced by track officials today.

title: NICKEL ASKS STAY ON FLORIDA CANAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Secretary of the Interior Wal ter J. Hickel has asked the Army to delay work for 15 months on the CrossFlorida Barge Canal to permit a de tailed study of the canal's ef fects on regional ecology.

title: N.H.L. SHORTENS CURVE OF STICKS
description: MONTREAL, June 8 (UPI) National Hockey League play ers will have to use sticks with a shallower curve, the league's rules committee decided today.

title: HOUSE IS SENDING OWN INQUIRY TEAM ON INDOCHINA WAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The House of Representatives voted today to send a factfinding mission of its own to study all aspects of United States mili tary involvement in Southeast Asia.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 9, 1970

title: Owner Is Hoping to Free Ship From Legal Shoals
description: The first great passenger liner built primarily for cruis ingonce the Cunarder Caro nia, now the Caribia of Panamanian registryswings with the tide running through the Red Hook anchorage off the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn.

title: Nixon Proclaims Flag Day
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) President Nixon today offi cially proclaimed June 14 as Flag Day, to begin Flag Week, a traditional celebration of the adoption of America's flag by the Continental Congress June 4, 1777. Mr. Nixon requested that all Americans fly the flag next week.

title: Newark G.O.P. Liberal Backs Gibson
description: NEWARK, June 8Kenneth A. Gibson, a 38yearold Negro engineer, continued today to pick up bipartisan support for his campaign to be Mayor of Newark.

title: Diana G. Donovan Is Betrothed
description: Miss Diana Genevieve Don ovan, daughter of Lieut. Gen. Stanley Donovan, U.S.A., re tired, and Mrs. Donovan of Madrid, plans to be married there in July to Jos Ignacio del Campo y Ruiz, a student of economics at the Univer sity of Madrid.

title: GIANTJET GAME TO BE ON LOCAL TV
description: The first regularseason meet ing of the New York Giants and New York Jets, scheduled for Nov. 1 at Shea Stadium, will be televised in the metro politan area, the clubs an nounced jointly yesterday.

title: U.S. COURT VOIDS BAN ON OBSCENE MATTER
description: The Federal Court of Appeals here ruled unconstitutional yes terday a section of a Federal statute that prohibits the im portation of obscene materials for private use. The threejudge panel unanimously called it an infringement of rights under the First Amendment.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS BAN ON PICKETING
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Supreme Court limited today the authority of Federal judges to interfere when state judges order railroad employes to stop picketing in labor disputes.

title: Marion Watts to Be Wed July 18
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 8Miss Marion Everett Watts and Allen George Swan plan to be married here July 18.

title: JUDGE DENIES DELAY IN PANTHER TRIAL
description: NEW HAVEN, June 8 Superior Court Judge Harold M. Mulvey, ruling on a defense claim that massive adverse publicity makes the selection of an impartial jury impossible, today denied for the time being a motion to postpone the trial of a Black Panther charged with murder and kidnapping.

title: 7 G.I.'s Killed in Demolition Class Blast
description: FORT BRAGG, N.C., June 8 Seven Green Beret soldiers were killed and five wounded this morning when 20 pounds of T.N.T. exploded prematurely at their feet during a class in de molition at the John F. Kennedy Center for Military Assistance.

title: TRANSPORT NOTES: SEAMAN WINS SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Supreme Court ruled to day that foreign registering, of a ship did not exempt the owner from paying damages to seamen injured in United States waters.

title: FIGHTING GOES ON NEAR ANGKOR WAT
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 8Sporadic fighting continued today at Siemreap, near the historic ruins of Angkor Wat, after Government forces retook the Siemreap airfield, a Cam bodian spokesman reported.

title: INQUIRY IS SOUGHT ON METHADONE PLAN
description: Proponents of a methadone program for narcotics addicts in city jails filed a State Su preme Court petition yesterday in an effort to force the Lind say administration to explain why it has not implemented such a program as provided for in legislation that the City Council passed last September over the Mayor's veto.

title: One of 6 Cleared in Case Involving Mafia Suspects
description: BATAVIA, N. Y., June 8 (AP)One of six men arrested last Tuesday during a meeting between reputed Mafia figures and two contractors won dis missal of the charge against him today.

title: OIL PIPELINE ROAD IS VOTED IN ALASKA
description: JUNEAU, June 8The Alaska Legislature in its last day yes terday authorized the state to construct a $120million road from the Yukon River to the North Slope to avert a critical employment situation in the Fairbanks area and hasten con struction of the proposed North Slope oil pipeline.

title: Bank of Montreal to Cut Prime Rate Next Monday
description: MONTREAL, June 8 (Cana dian Press)The Bank of Montreal announced today it would reduce its prime lending rate to 8 per cent from 8 per cent next Monday.

title: Medical Schools Reported in Trouble
description: The National Fund for Medi cal Education has reported that American medical schools are in serious financial difficulties I and that in some schools the situation is so critical that one must be concerned about their maintenance of quality and even about their ability to sur vive.

title: Raises May Lead To $6Billion Cut In Defense Activity
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 Top Defense Department of ficials have warned military budget planners that fore seeable pay increases over the next two years may re quire cuts of $6  billion or more in existing forces and programs to keep the next defense budget at or below the $71.8billion budget re quest currently before Con gress.

title: Crazy Horse Sculptor Works on Big Scale
description: CRAZY HORSE. S. Dak. Everything is big in the world of Korczak Ziolkowski, even the effort required to pronounce his Polish name (it is COREchok juleKUFF ski).

title: Oil Is Sought Off Scotland
description: LONDON, June 8Twenty four international oilexplora tion groups, drawn by the Phil lips Petroleum Company's oil strike in Norwegain waters of the North Sea, were awarded 30 licenses today to explore for gas and oil in 8,000 square miles of Britain's Continental Shelf.

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) United Press International re ported erroneously May 25 that the number of Army generals had increased by about 50 per cent during the Vietnam War. Actually, there were 491 Army generals in 1960 and 501 in 1965, compared with 513 at present.

title: U.S. Troop Level in Vietnam Is 425,450, Lowest Since '67
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8 (UPI)The size of the United States force in Vietnam has dropped to its lowest level in more than three years, ac cording to figures issued today by the United States command.

title: Andy Williamses Separate
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 8 (UPI) Andy Williams and his wife of eight years, the French ac tress Claudine Longet, have separated. A spokesman for the couple said yesterday: Both parties acknowledged the sepa ration, on the friendliest of terms. The Williamses have three children.

title: ATOMS T. C. COACH EYES RELAY MARK
description: The liberation is on in women's track and field, and the 80th annual Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union cham pionships is the latest example of equal opportunity.

title: Bills Go in Opposite Directions At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Treasury bill rates moved in opposite directions at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: HOUSE FUND BILL ASSAILED BY S.E.C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission, contrary to the ex pectations of many in the mu tual fund industry, has gone on record as opposing reform legis lation now before the House Commerce Committee.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: HARRY PERLSTEIN
description: OCEAN TOWNSHIP. N. J., June 8  Harry Perlstein, a founder and the first president of the Garden State Symphony Orchestra died Saturday at his home here, 149 Garden Drive. His age was 56.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: June 8, 1970

title: NUCLEAR SESSION OPENED BY NATO
description: VENICE, Italy, June 8The defense ministers of eight coun tries of the North Atlantic Al liance met here today to discuss nuclear strategy in the event of conflict with the Soviet Union in Central Europe.

title: Lieut. Gen. Keller E. Rockey, 81, 5th Marines' Commander, Dead
description: HARWICH PORT, Mass., June 8 (AP)Lieut. Gen. Keller E. Rockey, who commanded the Fifth Marine Division at the battle of Iow Jima, died Satur day at the age of 81.

title: Stockton Subdues Mayer In L.I. Net Semifinal, 6.1,63
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., June 8 Dick Stockton of Garden City, L. I., seeded second, defeated Sandy Mayer of Woodmere, L. I., 61, 63, today to gain the final round of the Long Island men's tennis championship at the Great Neck Country Club.

title: Ocean Hill and 201 May Keep Identities
description: The Board of Education has promised to strongly recom mend that the Ocean Hill Brownsville demonstration dis trict in Brooklyn and the Inter mediate School 201 complex in East Harlem be maintained as special units when they are ab sorbed on July 1 by new com munity school districts.

title: Scientific and Welfare Groups Open a 4Day Study of Population Growth
description: CHICAGO, June 8  As a humanometer on the mezza nine of the PickCongress Hotel clicked off the world's current population increase at the rate of more than two a second, representatives of hundreds of academic, scientific and wel fare organizations met today for the most intensive scrutiny to date of the problem of the global population bomb.

title: Two Celtics to Lecture
description: TOKYO, June 8 (AP)Gen eral manager Red Auerbach and John Havlicek of the Boston Celtics of the National Basket ball Association are being sent by the United States State De partment to Tokyo for a series of lectures to 200 Japanese bas ketball managers and coaches. The lectures will be held June 15 through 17.

title: Tigers Recall Timmerman
description: DETROIT, June 8 (UPI) Tom Timmerman, a right handed pitcher, has been re called from the Toledo Mud Hens of the International League by the Detroit Tigers today. Norm McRae, a right hander, is being returned to the Toledo club to make room for Timmerman.

title: Miss Kristen Karlen Betrothed
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 8Mrs. Sven B. Karlen has made known the engagement of her daughter, Miss Kristen Landsborough Karlen, to Jon Arlington Joseph, son of Mr. and Mrs. George B. Joseph of Boston and New London, N. H. The wedding will take place on Aug. 29.

title: Mrs. Hicks to Seek McCormack's Seat; Will Stress Crime
description: BOSTON, June 8 (AP) Louise Day Hicks, controversial Boston City Council member, announced today that she would seek the Congressional seat of the retiring House Speaker, John W. McCormack, Democrat of Massachusetts.

title: Kolker, A. & S. Executive, Announces His Retirement
description: Kenneth Kolker, senior vice president of merchandising for Abraham & Straus, announced yesterday his retirement from fulltime business activity after 22 years with the Brooklyn based department store chain. Mr. Kolker is 49 years old.

title: Byrd, Spong and Percy To Oppose SST Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Sen ators Harry F. Byrd and Wil liam B. Spong, both Virginia Democrats, said today that they would vote to cancel Govern ment spending on the super sonic transport (SST). Both men had opposed SST appropriations in past years.

title: HalleEquity Deal Bridges Generations
description: A generation gap of sorts was bridged on Wall Street yesterday as Milton A. Gor don, a 61yearold financier, and John Westergaard, a 38 yearold investment research specialist, announced they had agreed to join forces.

title: In The Nation: A Good Move by Mr. Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Whatever the deepest motives of those involved, which may be some time in emerging, the RichardsonforFinch swap at the troubled Department of Health, Education and Welfare looks like an intelligent move by the President and maybe even for the country. This could be canceled out if the new Under Secretary of State is not chosen with care.

title: Tighter Airport Security
description: The arrest of two baggage handlers at Kennedy International Airport on charges of stealing $200,000 from an airline mailbag is a reminder that cargo theft ranks second only to hijacking as a hazard to aviation security.

title: BEARINGS CLOSE FOR 13 PANTHERS
description: The oftenstormy pretrial hearings of 13 Black Panthers accused of plotting to bomb public places were adjourned yesterday to permit preparation and submittal by both sides of written briefs.

title: Soviet Reports Quake Near China
description: MOSCOW, June 8 (Reuters) An earthquake shook Kirghi zia close to the Soviet border with Sinkiang in western China, destroying 5,000 houses and leaving 20,000 people homeless, Tass, the So viet press agency, reported today.

title: South African Leader Goes To Spain From Portugal
description: MAIDRID, June 8 (Reuters)  The South African Prime Minister, John Vorster, drove into Spain today on a three day private visit that has puzzled diplomats. He is ex pected to call on Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: Gardner Sees Peril in Dissent; Offers Plan to Rebuild Society
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  John W. Gardner, sounding much like a political candidate, offered today a sevenpoint program of national con ciliation to rebuild a cohesive society despite the tensions of daily life.

title: Baseball Finance Base Seen Imperiled
description: Financial figures that sug gest major league baseball is teetering on the brink of eco nomic disaster were made public yesterday during the Curt Flood antitrust trial in Federal Court here. These startling implications were imbedded in statistics pro duced by Dr. John Clark Jr., testifying for the defense, while he was talking about how player sal aries had gone up in recent years.

title: Barry James Holloway Dies; Newsman and Educator, 66
description: WAPPINGERS FALLS, N. Y., June 8 (UPI)Barry James Hol loway, a former newsman and educator, died tonight in the Walpingers Falls Nursing Home. He was 66 years old.

title: Argentina: Again the Coup
description: President Onganfa never really regained his political grip on Argentina after the bloody rioting and popular upheaval of May and June, 1969. From then on it was mostly downhill for the shy, taciturn Army general who did not seek the presidency but came to enjoy political power and tried clumsily to build a popular base in order to retain it.

title: Garrett Going Home to Baseball
description: Everything's up to date in Kansas City, now that the Chiefs are the defending cham pions of the entire football world. But after the coming season their leading rusher and receiver, Mike Garrett, will be singing another tune: Going Home.

title: Laird Says Arms Agency Understates Soviet Data
description: WASHINGTON, June 8In a private letter to the White House, Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird has complained that a study of world military expenditures by the United States Arms Control and Dis armament Agency makes Amer ian military outlays look high by underrating the Soviet Un ion's.

title: New Paramount Opens With Catch22 June 24
description: New York's newest motion picture theater, the Para mount, will open on June 24 with the world premiere of Catch22, the World War II satire. The movie of Joseph Heller's popular novel was directed by Mike Nichols for Paramount Pictures. The film will run simultaneously at the Sutton Theater, Third Avenue and 57th Street.

title: Vietnam Will Resume Repatriation Program
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8  Social Welfare Min ister Tran Nguon Phieu said today that the Goyernment, after two weeks of controversy, had reversed its decision to halt the evacuation of ethnic Vietnamese from Cambodia.

title: Birth and Death Forms To Rise 50c Thursday
description: The price of certified birth and death certificates will in crease by 50 cents to $2.50 Thursday, the city Health De partment announced yester day.

title: Reputed Mafia Figure Linked to Picketing of F.B.I.
description: Associates of Joseph Co lombo, a reputed boss of organ ized crime, said yesterday that he was the man behind the picket lines that have been set up nightly around Federal Bureau of Investigation head quarters here for the last month.

title: Bayonne War Deaths Disturb Its Mayor
description: BAYONNE, N. J., June 8 The Mayor of Bayonne has written to the President of the United States, and very respectfully has said: Enough

title: State Study Finds Chicago Schools Near Collapse
description: CHICAGO, June 8A joint committee of the Republican dominated Illinois General As sembly issued a report today contending that Chicago's pub lic school system was near collapse. Democrats promptly termed the report political.

title: Mrs. Mitchell's Press Aide To Take Job in Colorado
description: WASHINGTON, June, 8Wil liam Woestendiek, the televi sion news editor here who was dismissed last April when his wife took a job as press secre tary to the wife of Attorney General John N. Mitchell, will be named editor of The Colo rado Springs Sun tomorrow.

title: Ousted Strongman
description: We believe that the army, forces should not govern. They should be obedient to civil power.

title: Goldberg Visits Wall St.; Scores Governor's Aims
description: Arthur J. Goldberg carried his campaign for the Demo cratic nomination for Governor yesterday to the financial cen ter of the country at Broad and Wall Streets to denounce Gov ernor Rockefeller for his sup port of Nixon Administration war and fiscal policy.

title: 3 Democrats Endorse Rival of Rooney
description: Three local Democratic Rep resentatives yesterday broke with political custom to endorse a primary opponent of an in cumbent Democratic member of New York's House delega tion.

title: ITALIAN PREMIER RETAINS HIS HOLD
description: ROME, Tuesday, June 9The Christian Democratic party of Premier Mariano Rumor suf fered a setback in Italy's na tionwide elections of Sunday and yesterday, and the Com munist partystrongest in the Westheld its own.

title: Market Place:
description: Glancing over performance records of the mutual funds for the last 12 months, it is possible to find a number that have slid more than 50 per cent in value.

title: Eight, Seeking Asylum, Hijack Czech Plane to West Germany
description: BONN, June 8A Czecho slovak airliner on a short do mestic flight was hijacked to day by four young men and four young women and forced to land at Nuremberg, about 70 miles inside West Germany.

title: Politics: 4 in Democratic Senate Race Speak of Youth, the Aged, War and Draft
description: Paul O'Dwyer won a 30,000 member union's official endorse ment for the Democratic nom ination for United States Senator last night, despite a fervent appeal for support by Theodore C. Sorensen, one of his three rivals in the June 23 primary.

title: ArtSavers' Meeting Hears of Statue's Peril
description: About 300 delegates to a con ference here on the ills of works of art and their possible cures, meeting here yesterday, heard a German scholar de scribe exhaust fumes as the chief reason for the decay of Donatello's marble St. Mark in Florence, Italy.

title: MARTIN M. JORDAN
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., June 8 Martin M. Jordan died at the Englewood Hospital Saturday of heart failure. He was 64 years old.

title: WILLIAM REPUCCI
description: William Repucci, a vice pres dent of the Republic National Bank of New York, died at St. Vincent's Hospital Sunday after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived at 300 East 40th Street.

title: U.S. Working Mothers Cautioned by Dr. Mead
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)  Millions of American families with working moth ers away from home all day had better change their way of living for the sake of their children, and for the national good, Dr. Margaret Mead advises.

title: A Correction
description: In an article in Sunday's New York Times, the date of a MaskedArt Ball, a bene fit for the Hampton Day School to be held at the Par rish Art Museum in South ampton, L.I., and the ticket price were incorrect. The event is scheduled for June 20 and tickets are $250 a couple. They are available from Mrs. David W. Dignan, 63 Huntting Lane, East Hampton, L.I.

title: Samuel R. Cohen, Officer Of Apparel Importer, 56
description: ROSLYN, L. I., June 8Sam uel R. Cohen, executive vice president and cofounder of the RepublicCellini Corporation, an importer of wearing apparel, died of cancer today at North Shore Hospital in Manhasset. He was 56 years old and lived at 27 Stirrup Lane.

title: After 17 Years, Cicada Brood's Love Call Is Expected Again
description: Any day now the Loreleis of the insect worldthe periodical cicadas  are expected to emerge from their underground burrows in the New York area and drum their compelling love song to herald yet another cycle of their amazing and mysterious 17year life span.

title: Broker in Salt Lake City Agrees to a Suspension
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI)  The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that Weston & Co. had agreed to suspend most of its securities operations until it can meet the commission's net capital and cash balance requirements.

title: MORRIS LIEB
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., June 8 Morris Lieb, a partner in Lieb Brothers, contractors on the Scott Field Air Base in Illinois and the Veterans Hospital in Syracuse, died yesterday at Beth Israel Medical Center in Newark. He was 64 years old and lived at 15 Ball Place.

title: Ogden, Carp, Majors' Draftees, Pitch in P.S.A.L. Final Today
description: Jack Ogden of Far Rockaway and Steve Carp of Canarsie, selected last Thursday in the major league's draft of free agents, will be the opposing pitchers today in the Public Schools Athletic League base ball championship at Yankee Stadium.

title: STOCKHOLM IS QUIET AS POLICE RETURN
description: STOCKHOLM, June 8The majority of the policemen who reported sick over the week end returned to duty today and officials were hopeful that the looting and violence that oc curred in their absence had come to an end.

title: STRICKEN PERU GIVEN $10MILLION BY U.S
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) President Nixon announced today a $10million grant to Peru and plans for massive assistance to the country, which was struck by a major earthquake last week.

title: LEARY SEEKS 2,000 FOR AUXILIARY FORCE
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary appealed yesterday for 2,000 more volunteers to join the auxiliary police force, which currently has a member ship of 3,000.

title: Dishes That Coddle Hostess
description: Easyonthehostess recipes are especially welcome when the temperature starts to rise. The curried appetizer given here can be made the day before. The casserole can be assembled early the same day and baked just prior to serving.

title: Tulsa Insurer Chief Admits Fraud Guilt
description: Jimmie J. Ryan, president of the Community National Life Insurance Company, of Tulsa, Okla., pleaded guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to con spiring in a scheme that de frauded banks in several parts of the country.

title: Beaches Here Are Found Still Unsafe
description: Health officers in New York, Connecticut and New Jersey expressed cautious optimism yesterday about holding the line against further pollution of the area's bathing beaches this summer.

title: JERSEY APPROVES COLLEGE MERGER
description: TRENTON, June 8Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill won a major victory tonight when the Re publican majority in the Sen ate gave final legislative ap proval to his controversial measure that merges New Jer sey's two public medical schools.

title: Enemy Strength Evaluated
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8American commanders have nearly doubled their esti mate of enemy strength in Cambodia and in the sector of South Vietnam immediately north of Saigon. The reevalu ation follows the reported dis covery of traces of some pre viously unknown and unex pectedly intricate Communist organization.

title: L. I. PRESS REACHES UNION AGREEMENT
description: Typographical Union No. 6 and The Long Island Press reached tentative agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract retroactive to last March 31, the day after the last contract expired.

title: Clay Lawyer Files Bid For Boxer to Leave U.S.
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 8 (AP)Cassius Clay, the de. posed world heavyweight boxing champion, said today he did not support an appeal filed with the United States Supreme Court to allow him to fight his successor, Joe Frazier in Canada.

title: Executive Changes
description: Ray R. Herrmann Jr., has been named executive vice president and general manager of the wine and spirit division of Schieffelin & Co. He formerly was with National Distillers and Chemical Corpo ration.

title: WELFARE HOUSING REJECTED ON L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 8A controversial proposal to spend $175,000 to rehabilitate bar racks at Mitchel Field for wel fare families now living in mo tels was defeated by Nassau County Board of Supervisors to day after a lengthy, emotional meeting attended by 400 people.

title: Foreign Fund to Aid Building in Midtown Of Two Skyscrapers
description: Two midtown Manhattan of fice skyscrapers with a total of nearly three million square feet of floor space will be built at a cost of $200million with the financial aid of an Ameri canmanaged overseas invest ment fund.

title: Hudson County Freeholder Cited in 2Count Indictment
description: JERSEY CITY, June 8 (AP) The Hudson County grand jury indicted Freeholder Chester J. Wojtycha of Jersey City today on charges of conspiring to violate the laws in connection with the award by the Hudson County Board of Freeholders of a $57,233 contract to a surgical supply firm he headed.

title: Books of The Times
description: According to Gore Vidal, the relation ship between consumer and advertiser is the last demonstration of necessary love in the West. Jerry Della Femina, a 33 yearold success story who heads his own New York ad agency (a staff of 53, $20 million a year in billings), puts it a little differently: I honestly believe that advertis ing is the most fun you can have with your clothes on. Deciding to let the consumer in on the fun, Mr. Della Femina apparently recorded his story on tape, and Charles Sopkin, the author of Seven Glorious Days, Seven FunFilled Nights, was en gaged to edit the transcription. What re sults is a very funny approximation of a book, a plague of anecdotes, an exercise in transcendent vulgarity. The effect is rather as though a mad friend has kept you awake late one stoned night telling midget jokes, until your eyes tear and your stomach aches; only at dawn does it occur to you that midgets, after all, aren't so amusing.

title: Fireman Braves Flames To Save Brooklyn Infant
description: A 9monthold boy, trapped on the top floor of a building engulfed in flames, was res cued yesterday by a fireman who rushed through a curtain of fire to find the child and apply mouthtomouth resusci tation, the Fire Department re ported.

title: Klecatsky and Quinn Win Frankfurt Senior Sculls
description: FRANKFURT, Germany, June 8 (UPI)United States oars men added another victory at the Frankfurt international row ing regatta today.

title: Jewelry to Wear or Play With
description: Never mind about rubies, emeralds and diamonds. Or even platinum, gold and silver. All that precious stuff can stay in the vaults as far as some new designers of body ornaments and jewelry are concerned. Leather thongs, wood beads and even coils of rope are more their thing.

title: Reserve Unit Discloses a Vote To Back Rise in Money Supply
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Open Market Committee of the Federal Reserve System, while voting to continue the policy of moderate increases in the money supply, expressed seri ous concern at its March 10 meeting about the possibility that monetary policy might zig zag too widely.

title: Music: Poetry and Jazz
description: Jazz and poetry are apt to step on each others toes when they are put on the same platform together, but a poet with the instincts of a jazz soloist showed Sun day night at Carnegie Hall that the two can swing to gether.

title: Affluent Englewood Is Feeling the Pinch a Bit
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., June 8Signs of affluence are easy to find in this com muter town.

title: Italian Coalition Asserts Election Has Bolstered It
description: ROME, June 9Leaders of the fourparty partnership that governs Italy maintained today that it had been strengthened in the regional elections this week, although the conserva tive senior partner, the Chris tian Democratic party, suffered a setback.

title: Apse Takes New Tonic At Cloisters
description: New methods of preserving stone, devised since 1968 by a New York University chem istry professor, may have provided a new lease on long life for the Romanesque Spanish apse, added to the Cloisters in 1961.

title: SILVER FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Silver futures prices rose yes terday on the New York Com modity Exchange in line with increased prices received at the Government's weekly silver auction in Washington.

title: Cup Scores on WQXR
description: Please do not telephone The New York Times or WQXR for scores of World Cup soccer matches. The calls tie up lines and inter fere with the work of the newspaper and the radio sta tion. World Cup results will be given on WQXR late evening hourly news reports.
