Or the same amount for a not so youthful belter who was slowed down by a spinal fusion operation? Or for a young defenseman who flunked out in each of his three chances?

title: Laotian Army Losses Put At 320 in Fall of Saravane
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 11 (UPI)Some 320 Laotian Gov ernment soldiers were killed or are missing in the fall Tuesday of Saravane, a key town at a highway junction in southern Laos, official sources said to day.

title: The Senate Reasserts Itself
description: The Senate took a reassuring step toward re asserting its constitutional checks over the war making powers of the President yesterday in rejecting an effort to transform the CooperChurch amendment into a virtual blank check for future military opera tions in Cambodia.

title: Commodity Exchange Set For West Coast by October
description: LOS ANGELES, June 11 (AP) The first major commodity exchange in the Western United States will open for trading by October, one of its founders said today.

title: Battler for Southern School Desegregation Now Fears Gains Will Bring Trouble in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, June 11By all rights, Mrs. Ruby Martin could consider this a year for celebration.

title: A Bride 3 Weeks Ago, Girl, 14, Dies of Cancer
description: MOULTON, Ala., June 1I Shirley Smith Roden, 14 years old, died of cancer last night in the small hospital where she was married three weeks ago.

title: Spartans to Share List of U.S. Shoplifters
description: Spartans Industries, Inc., one of the largest retailers in the United States, has as sembled a list of about 250, 000 names of confessed shoplifters and dishonest re tailing employes.

title: WHEAT PRICES UP ON CROP ESTIMATE
description: Prices of wheat futures stole the play away from soybean futures yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade and shot upward while soybeans closed irregular. Other grain prices also closed mostly higher.

title: Angkor the Masterpiece Of a Vanished Empire
description: Angkor, now in the hands of North Vietnamese forces, is generally regarded as the consummate masterpiece of the vanished Khmer Empire, which flourished from the 9th to the 13th century.

title: U.S. Troop Cut in South Korea Reported Sought to Save Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 11A leading Defense Department of ficial said today that strong budgetary pressures were fore ing the Administration to seek agreement for the removal of a large part of America's 64,000 man military force from South Korea over two or three years, starting next year.

title: Mayo Sees New Job
description: FRENCH LICK, Ind., June 11 (UPI)Presidential Counselor Robert P. Mayo said today that President Nixon had asked him to keep himself available pos sibly for a Cabinet appointment.

title: Congressional Races Vital, Humphrey Tells Democrats
description: Former Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey warned Demo crats here last night that losing the 1970 Congressional elec tions would mean losing the 1972 Presidential contest as well.

title: CUBANS SUGAR CROP IS 8.8 MILLION TONS
description: MEXICO CITY, June 11  Cuba announced today that sugar production from the cur rent harvest had reached a record total of 8.8 million metric tons. The previous high was a 7.9millionton crop in 1952.

title: 10% MAKES A SALE IN BOND MARKET
description: A 9 per cent yield for bonds did not attract investors on Wednesday, so underwriters yesterday tried 10 per cent. It worked.

title: David D. Dixon, Sarah H. Smith Engaged to Wed
description: SALISBURY, Conn., June 11Miss Sarah Hervey Smith and David Debs Dixon, can didates for master's degrees in architecture at the Univer sity of Pennsylvania, plan to be married in St. John's Episcopal Church here on Aug. 29.

title: Cambridge, Mass.: The Changing Campus Mood
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 11 There is something new in the air on the campuses of America at the end of this uni versity year. All the same prob lems and arguments remain, but the moderates are beginning to challenge the extremists of the right and left and change the tone and maybe even the direc tion of the student debate.

title: CONTINENTAL CAN PLANS EXPANSION
description: The Continental Can Compa ny announced yesterday that it would spend $100million to modernize and expand its paper mill in Hodge, La.

title: BUDGET BODY CITES CRONKITE, CATLEDGE
description: Medals for distinguished serv ice were presented last night to Walter Cronkite, news cor respondent of the Columbia Broadcasting System, and Tur ner Catledge, retired vice presi dent of the New York Times Company.

title: LEADPAINT BILL SIGNED BY MAYOR
description: Mayor Lindsay signed a bill yesterday to permit landlords to deduct from their real es tate taxes threefourths of the cost of removing or boarding over leadbased paint in their buildings.

title: Stokes Assistant Resigns
description: CLEVELAND, June 11 (UPI)  Richard D. Peters has re signed as executive assistant to Mayor Carl B. Stokes. Mr. Peters said he planned to de vote his time to traveling, I teaching and writing.

title: Misses Whitworth, Mills Lead Golf
Craig Cited by Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. .J., June I I; Gordon Alexander Craig, for mer professor of history at Princeton University and later professor of history at Stianford University, received an honor ary Doctor of Letters degree at the Princeton commencement Tuesday. His name was omitted from the list of recipients of honorary degrees published in Wednesday's New York Times.

title: Dr. Allen Says Partisan Restraints Interfered With His Duties
description: WASHINGTON, June 11  Dr. James E. Allen Jr., who was forced to resign yester day as the Government's chief education official, declared to day that the partisan con straints placed on him by the Nixon Administration had made it impossible for him to administer the Federal educa tion bureaucracy properly.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Film

title: STOCKS OFF AGAIN ON LONDON BOARD
Groza to Get Colonels' Post
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., June 11 (UPI)Alex Groza, an all America at the University of Kentucky in the late nineteen forties, will he the new business manager of the Kentucky Colonels, it was learned today. Groza has been associated with the American Basketball Asso elation club as a scout and spe cial events director.

title: Article 1  No Title
Miss America Boom Result Of Dreams and Boosterism
description: MARION, Ohio  By the time the curtain opened not long ago on the Miss Heart of Ohio pageant in the baroque old Palace Theater here, the local Jaycees were confident that their eight months of planning had paid off.

title: N.C.A.A. Ski Site Picked
description: LEAD, S. D.. June 11 (AP) The National Collegiate Athlet ic Association announced today the 1971 intercollegiate ski championship meet would be held at Terry Peak, in the Black Hills of South Dakota, March 4 to 6. South Dakota State Uni versity will be the host.

title: Calgary Gets '72 Skating
description: OTTAWA, June 11 (AP) The 1972 world figure skat ing championships will be held in Calgary, the Canadian Fig ure Skating Association an nounced today.

title: Wednesday Fights
description: Nagoya, JapanCassius Nai to, 160 pounds, Japan, out pointed Manfredo Alipala, 161, the Philippines, 10 rounds.

title: ALLEN CONSIDERED FOR QUEENS POST
description: The chancellor of the City University of New York has sounded out Dr. James E. Allen Jr., the ousted United States Commissioner of Education, about whether he might be interested :n becoming presi dent of Queens College.

title: Delancy Smith Wins Title
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 11 Delancy Smith of the Park Country Club, Snyder, N. Y., won the 59th annual women's Eastern Golf Association cham pionship today by six strokes.

title: Retail Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The Department of Commerce reported today that total retail store sales for the latest week, ended June 6, were an esti mated $7.116billion, an in crease of 3 per cent above the $6.977billion in sales for the corresponding week of 1969.

title: NAMING OF SHULTZ HAILED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The appointment of George P. Shultz to head the Govern ment's reorganized and expand ed budget and management operation has been greeted with enthusiasm by Federal officials responsible for national eco nomic policy.

title: NIXON SCORES LAG IN BILLS ON CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 11  President Nixon warned today that the public might retaliate at the polls against members of Congress who failed to support anticrime proposals endorsed by his Administration.

title: Ground Workers in Iceland Threaten Strike at Airport
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 11 (UPI)Ground workers at Keflavik Airport have threaten a strike for tomorrow that would hamper international flights. They are demanding a 25 per cent pay increase. A series of strikes by carpenters, miners, steel workers and long shoremen have already forced the closing of other industries in Iceland.

title: HOUSING CHECK SET FOR PARTNERSHIPS
description: Ray A. Watt, president of the National Corporation of Housing Partnerships, received a check for $10.5million from Raymond T. O'Keefe, senior vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank yesterday, providing the new corporation with its first working capital.

title: MEXICO, ENGLAND SCORE IN SOCCER
description: MEXICO CITY, June 11 (AP)  The Mexican soccer team gained the World Cup quarter finals tonight for the first time. The host nation beat Belgium, 10, before 112,000 fans in Az tec Stadium to tie the Soviet Union for first place in Group I.

title: Terrorists in Brazil Kidnap Bonn Envoy
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 11 The West Germany Ambassa dor, Ehrenfried von Holleben, was kidnapped by terrorists tonight as he was being driven home from the embassy.

title: American Rock Group to Tour 3 Countries in Eastern Europe
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The popular music group Blood, Sweat and Tears will perform in three Eastern European coun tries this month and next, the State Department announced today. It will be the first such contemporary American musical group to be sent to Communist countries under the State De partment's cultural presenta tions program.

title: Excellent Buffet, Striking View, but the Napkins ...
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vicin ity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: BETTER SERVICE ON PHONES FOUND
description: Telephone service in New York City was found to have improved in some respects dur ing the month of March but in other facets was no better than in January, when a Fed eral Communications Commis sion survey indicated that serv ice here was the worst in the country.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Fishing Report
description: AREA A  Fishing con tinues to improve In this sec tion, according to John Falkiewicz and Johnny Bogan. Some kingfish have been reported off the beach in Surf City as well as in the bay, while an occasional striped bass. tardy in leav ing, has also been taken.

title: When Those BigName Dress Designers Turn Talents to Furs
description: Who's afraid of the big, bad bear market? Obviously not furriersthey're going blithely ahead with the most lavish season in years. Since they're notoriously not gamblers, it would seem that the shrewd men who deal in sable and mink have lost their minds.

title: Swedish Leader Senses Kind of Division in U.S.
description: Premier Olaf Palme of Sweden said last night that he sensed a kind of division in this na tion and an emotionally charged atmosphere very unlike what he knew as a college boy in Ohio or when he had visited 36 states by the hitchhiking method.

title: Nasser Denounces Fighting
description: CAIRO, June 11  President Gamal Abdel Nasser tonight denounced the fighting between Palestinian commandos and Jordanian troops as a tragedy and a massacre and said that the Arab world had a right to expect guarantees for stability in Jordan.

title: British Petroleum Reports Dip in Net
description: Continued low prices and high market freight rates along with rising operating costs were mainly responsible for the decline in firstquarter earnings of the British Petroleum Com pany, Ltd., from the yearago period, the company reported in London yesterday.

title: McCarthy Planning Legislation To Ease Plight of Unemployed
description: Representative Richard Max McCarthy, a candidate for the Democratic nomination for Sen ator, said yesterday that he was preparing legislation that would case the effects of inflation on the unemployed and underem ployed.

title: ROME DOME WINS 2 JUMP CLASSES
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 11  Last year, Kip Rosenthal's Rome Dome entered the open jumper division in five horse shows and didn't win a class.

title: Layer Downs Drysdale and Pilic Ousts Riessen in English Tennis
description: BRISTOL, England, June 11 (UPI)  Rod Laver and Mrs. Margaret Court were in top form today as they advanced in the Wills open lawn tennis tournament.

title: DEMOCRATS OFFER CITY BUDGET CUTS
description: Budget cuts that would mean a smaller increase in real estate taxes and the elimination or re duction of some new taxes were proposed yesterday by Demo crats on the Board of Estimate and two Democratic leaders of the City Council.

title: OTTINGER URGES A V.A. DRUG PLAN
description: Persisting in the pace that took him on a 17hour upstate tour the day before, Represen tative Richard L. Ottinger cam paigned through the city yes terday, visiting a Veterans Ad I ministration hospital to propose a program to combat drug abuse among veterans, than shaking hands on the sidewalk of Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Traffic Regroups For Rock Concerts At Fillmore East
description: Traffic plays tasteful rock, and if that sounds like a con tradiction in terms, it is none theless a sign of the progress that rock has made over the last several years.

title: New Labor Secretary
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 James Day Hodgson, Presi dent Nixon's choice to be come the new Secretary of Labor, would seem to per sonify the new Cabinet style: less extra dimension than Mr. Nixon saw in his first round appointees, but an un usual breadth of experience and administra tive talent to serve the White House's increas ingly centralized policy leadership. As Under Secretary to George P. Shultz for the last year and a half, Mr. Hodgson (who pronounces his name as if had no G) was considered the ideal No. 2 man. He was so intimately identified with his boss that sometimes he nearly disappeared.

title: Drama: A Rorem Double
description: Because of Ned Rorem's estimable accomplishments as a composer, his acknowledged gift for language, and his musical involvement with theater, one looks forward to his work as a playwright.

title: Miss Marian Jenner Rea to Marry
description: PITTSBURGH, June 11 Mr. and Mrs. William H. Rea have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Marian Jenner Rea, to Dr. Robert C. Haight, son of Dr. and Mrs. Cameron Haight of Ann Arbor. Mich.

title: 3 Seized After Police Car Is Burned in Brooklyn
description: Three young men were ar rested early today after a fire bomb destroyed a police car on a Brooklyn street. A crowd of 200 people later marched on the 73d Precinct station house to protest the arrests but dis persed after police reinforce ments arrived.

title: Yanks Go West With a Bomber Image as Mets Return Home Under Pressure
description: New York's baseball teams reversed courses yesterday, the Yankees heading west in strength and the Mets return ing home under their severest pressure of the season.

title: West Berliners Protest Law Giving Police Machine Guns
description: BERLIN, June 11  Thou sands of young West Berliners took to the streets today in a peaceful march to protest Alliedbacked legislation to le galize the equipping of West Berlin's policeforce with ma chine guns and hand grenades.

title: Dr. Frank C. Laubach, Crusader Against Illiteracy, Dead at 85
description: SYRACUSE, June 11 (AP) Dr. Frank C. Laubach, a mis sionary who fought illiteracy around the world, died today in a hospital here. He was 85 years old.

title: Man, 61, Slain in Village; Girl, 14, Held in Mugging
description: A retired teacher who had returned here from Central America for the funeral of his mother was beaten and killed in Greenwich Village early yes terday by two young men who allegedly used a 14yearold runaway girl as a decoy pan handler.

title: White House Centralization...
description: The designation of Secretary of Labor Shultz as President Nixon's chief aide in managing the vast Federal bureaucracy could represent a great extension in the responsibility and influence of a Cabinet officer who without question has been one of the brightest stars of this Administration.

title: Kekkonen to Visit U.S.
description: HELSINKI, Finland, June 11 (Reuters)President Urho Kek konen will make a threeday visit to the United States be ginning July 23. He leaves for the United States a week after a visit to the Soviet Union.

title: MISS HORNE SINGS AT JERSEY CENTER
description: The Garden State Arts Center opened its third season Wednes day night in the home built for it by the New Jersey Highway Authority at Telegraph Hill Park on the Garden State Parkway.

title: Morgenthau Accused
description: WASHINGTON, June 11A New York lawyer who repre sents I.O.S. today accused Rob ert M. Morgenthau, former United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York of making irresponsible and politically motivated statements about I.O.S.

title: Campaign for Sorensen Emphasizes Kennedy Tie
description: The confidential schedule  the one marked in blue among the redprinted public events in SorensenforSenator head quarters  listed fundraising luncheon.

title: Goodrich and Goodyear Battle To Win a Dutch Tire Producer
description: The battle between the B. F. Goodrich Company and the Goodyear Tire & Rubber Com pany for control of a large tire manufacturer in the Nether lands intensified yesterday.

title: Heritage Beaten Twice in America's Cup Trials
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 11 Heritage made her debut in the America's Cup trials today and Intrepid and Valiant promptly tore into her like a couple of piranhas attacking a goldfish.

title: Westinghouse Pact Ended
description: Siemens, A. G., of Berlin and Munich, the giant West German electronics and heavy equip ment manufacturer, and the Westinghouse Electric Corpora tion announced yesterday termi nation of a mutual agreement for the exchange of information in the fields of power technol ogy and nuclear energy.

title: Foreign Affairs: Russia's Silent Spring
description: SUKHUMI, U.S.S.R.The So viet Union, which covers one sixth of the earth's surface, is fighting the same grim battle against pollution that increas ingly engrosses the United States. Neither capitalism nor Communism has developed A successful formula for curbing man's sins against the atmos phere enveloping him and, if the ecology of this vast country has not yet been so seriously dam aged as America's, the process is well under way.

title: REPUTED MAFIOSI SEIZED IN RAIDS
description: Thirtyfive reputed under world figures were arrested yesterday in eight counties in and around New York City as District Attorney Eugene Gold of Kings County announced their indictment on charges of criminal contempt.

title: Mary Costa Is Extending Singing Tour in the Soviet
description: MOSCOW, June 11 (UPI)  Soviet music officials an nounced today a threeweek extension of a tour by Mary Costa, the American singer after a series of successful per formances in three Soviet cities.

title: GOODYEAR RAISES PRICES FOR TIRES
description: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company, the nation's largest tire producer, which just con cluded a costly labor contract, announced yesterday that it will increase tire prices by 5 to 6 per cent beginning Monday.

title: Emergency Session Is Called To Head Off Walkout on L.I. R.
description: An urgent effort to head off a Long Island Railroad strike Sunday morning got under way here yesterday afternoon under Federal auspices.

title: Canadian Bills Auctioned
description: OTTAWA, June 11 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $150million of new 91day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.565 and average yield of 5.84 per cent, compared with last week's 98.549 and 5.91 per cent. To day's $40million of 182day bills brought 97.101 and 5.99 per cent, against last week's 97.129 and 5.93 per cent.

title: MONEY AND CREDIT GROWING RAPIDLY
description: Money and credit are expand ing at a rapid rate, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: ROCKEFELLER ADDS 2 UNIONS' SUPPORT
description: Two locals of the International Longshoremen's Association pledged their support yesterday to Governor Rockefeller's bid for reelection, and leaders of the union indicated that the full association would shortly take the same action.

title: Prestige Termed Reds' Aim in Angkor Area
description: SIEMREAP, Cambodia, June 10The Cambodians clustered around a truck to stare at the two dead men sprawled in back as if something could still be learned from their gray faces and cold bodies.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 6:30 P. M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal waters.

title: Anniversaries
description: DEAR CLAUDIAHappy Anniversary. Just want to let YOU know It's been a great first year. Love, Husband Andy.

title: Jones Drives Ford Bronco To Victory in Baja Race
description: ENSENADA, Mexico, June 11 (AP)  Parnelli Jones won the Baja 500 offroad race today in a record time of 11 hours 55 minutesfive hours under the winning time last year.

title: Senate Vote on Byrd Amendment
Ring Rivals Say There Is More Than Meets the Eye in Training
description: On the small gray movie screen, Mac Foster was pum meling Cleveland Williams in a slowmotion barrage of punches. Watching the film in the Felt Forum yesterday, Foster and Jerry Quarry, opponents in next Wednes day's 10round bout at Mad ison Square Garden, sat in silence.

title: PENN AND CORNELL REACH I.R.A. FINAL
description: SYRACUSE, June 11 Var sity eights from Pennsylvania, Washington and Cornell qual ified for Saturday's finals on Onondaga Lake today at the Intercollegiate Rowing Associa tion's annual regatta. The first two rowed true to expectations while the third was a sur prise, the Cornellians upsetting Princeton, which also trailed Wisconsin.

title: MAJOR NETWORKS IN ECONOMY MOVE
description: A tightening of belts is under way at the three major televi sion networks, prompted by uncertain economic conditions throughout the country and the certainty of a sharp cut in reve nue when cigarette advertising is dropped in 1971.

title: BREWERS' HOVLEY IS TRADED TO A'S
description: MILWAUKEE, June 11 (UPI)  The Milwaukee Brewers traded Steve Hovley, an out fielder, to Oakland today for Tito Francona, an infielder, and Al Downing, a lefthanded pitcher.

title: 3 Arrested in War Protest
description: Two young men and a teen age boy described by the police as demonstrators protesting the war in Vietnam were arrested yesterday after entering the draft board at 201 Varick Street and reading the names of war dead from a list they had carried with them. The three were identified as William J. Dorfer Jr., 26 years old, of 430 Columbus Avenue, a clerk; Wil liam J. McGuire, 23, of Hilltop Road, Port Washington, L. I., a tutor, and Stephen Kurzyna, 16, of 2885 Briggs Avenue, the Bronx, a student.

title: GUARD IS ALERTED AT SANTA BARBARA
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., June 11The office of Gov. Ronald Reagan said today that National Guard troops had been placed on alert in case of further trouble in Isla Vista, a tense community adjacent to the University of California at Santa Barbara.

title: JOHN D. ANGELIDES, A GYNECOLOGIST, 53
description: Dr. John D. Angelides, an obstetrician and gynecologist in New York and Nassau Coun try for many years, died yester day at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He lived at 18621 Chelsea Street, Jamaica Es tates, Queens, and was 53 years old.

title: Caution Is Urged In Curbing Abuses At Banks Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (AP)The head of the New York Stock Exchange sug gested today that Congress, in seeking to curb abuses of secret foreign bank accounts, tread softly so as not to dis turb legitimate transactions between American and for eign business associates.

title: Wedding Set By Miss Stone
description: SOUTH NEWFANE, Vt., June 11Miss Margaret Ann Stone and Lane Eaton Jen nings plan to be married in early September. Their en gagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Shepard Stone of South Newfane and Paris, parents of the bride tobe, whose fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert K. Jennings of Washington.

title: DEFECT REPORTED IN SOME '69 FORDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (AP) The International Associa tion of Chiefs of Police has distributed a report warning that some models of 1969 Ford automobiles may be a serious hazard to motorists be cause of mechanical failures.

title: Court Asked To Examine Jail for Boys
description: Officials of the city's Of fice of Probation were ac cused of criminal neglect yesterday in the operation of the Spofford Juvenile Center, a Bronx detention house.

title: S.A.S. Names Manager Of North American Unit
description: Scandinavian Airlines has an nounced the appointment of B. John Heistein as vice president and general manager of its North. American division, effec tive July 1.

title: Alexander Kerensky Dies Here at 89
description: Alexander Kerensky, who led the first phase of the Russian Revolution in 1917 until he was overthrown in the Bolshe vik coup, died yesterday of arteriosclerotic heart disease at St. Luke's Hospital. He was 89 years of age.

title: GEN. H. L. EARNEST DIES IN RICHMOND
description: RICHMOND, June 11 (AP) Maj. Gen. Herbert L. Earnest, whose Fourth Armored Division units broke the German circle at the Battle of the Bulge in World War II, died here today.

title: Entry Finishes 1, 2 in Belmont Chase
description: Sidney Watters Jr., the coun try squire from Middleburg, Va., saddled National Anthem and Attribution for yesterday's 54th running of the grueling Meadow Brook Steeplechase Handicap at Belmont Park and then watched them finish one, two, respectively.

title: Bomb Jitters Grip Small Town
description: STRATFORD, N. J., June 11 Myriel Jones, a local his torian, wrote this about Stratford in 1965:

title: 4 Bank Robbers Captured After Gun Fight at Quantico
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 Four armed bank robbers fought a gun battle today with the military police at the Quantico Marine Base near here, took thre hostages on an hourlong chase through north ern Virginia and then were captured by the Virginia state police and agents of the Fed eral Buearu of Investigation.

title: Plea Made for Safety Of Temples at Angkor
description: Several prominent New Yorkers, including Thomas P. F. Hoving, director of the Metropolitan Museum, sent a telegram to President Nixon and Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird yesterday, urging that the Angkor tern ple complex on Cambodia be spared from damage or destruction during the cur rent fighting there.

title: Syria Proclaims Support For Guerrillas in Jordan
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 11 The Syrian Government an nounced today that it would stand by the Arab guerrillas all the way and at all cost in their struggle with the Jor danian authorities.

title: Wightman Cup Foes Begin Play Today; Close Series Seen
description: LONDON, June 11  Spin a coin and take your pick for the 42d contest for the Wight man Cup between the United States and Britain at Wimble don tomorrow and Saturday. It could be that close.

title: Ontario Postmen Walk Out
description: TORONTO, June 11 (AP) About 2,600 postal workers throughout the province of On tario walked off their jobs today in support of union de mands in contract negotiations. The walkout was ordered by the Ottawa headquarters of the Canadian Council of Postal Unions.

title: U.S. Hands Over Base to Libyans
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, June 11 (AP)Several hundred Lib yans stood silently today as the United States flag came slowly down for the last time at Wheelus Air Force Base near here and a Libyan band played The Star Span gled Banner.

title: Oil Find Made in Norway
description: OSLO, Norway (Reuters) Reserves of about one billion tons of commercially exploit able low sulphurous oil have been found in the Norwegian sector of the North Sea conti nental shelf.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, JUNE 12, 1970

title: Cable Saves 2 in Fall From Broken Scaffold
description: ATLANTA, June 11Two window washers plunged eight stories from a broken scaffold today in the heart of downtown Atlanta before an electric cable broke their fall about 150 feet above the heads of horrified shoppers.

title: Allied Drive Into Cambodia Causing New Protests in South Vietnam, With Students Playing a Major Role
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 11The allied intervention in Cambodia has resulted in a new wave of protests by South Viet namese against the Saigon Government.

title: 8 Manhattan Justices to Handle Cases From Filing to Judgment
description: An experimental program in the handling of both civil and criminal litigation in Man hattan under which judges in State Supreme Court will be assigned to handle cases from initiation to judgment was an nounced yesterday.

title: Chicago Teamsters Reach Tentative Accord on Wages
description: CHICAGO, June 11 (AP) The head of the Federal Media tion and Conciliation Service announced today that the Teamsters Union and trucking concerns in the Chicago area had agreed on a tentative con tract that would give striking drivers a $1.65 an hour wage increase over 45 months.

title: Market Place:
description: T. Rowe Price is getting old. At 72, he says, I should have retired a long time ago. But he likes what he's doing and he does it well.

title: U.S. WON'T DISCUSS FRANCO FOE'S CASE
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The State Department said to day that the Spanish Govern ment's action in penalizing a leading opposition figure for at tempting to meet with Secre tary of State William P. Rog ers in Madrid last month was an internal matter of Spain.

title: Suspect Is Seized in Holdup Of Bronx Bank on Tuesday
description: After two days of doorto door questioning, the police last night arrested James Horton of 827 Union Avenue, the Bronx, and charged him with robbing a branch of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, 801 Westchester Avenue, of nearly $10,000 on Tuesday. They said they had recovered $9,450 of the loot.

title: CORNFELD BACKS I.O.S.BANK TALKS
description: GENEVA, June 11Bernard Cornfeld, founder of Investors Overseas Services, said today he could easily regain control of the company if he felt an unsatisfactory arrangement was being negotiated with an inter national banking consortium.

title: War Protested in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 11 Five women chained them selves to the railings of the public gallery in the House of Representatives in Canberra today in protest against Aus tralia's conscription and in volvement in the Vietnam war. Policemen cut the five women free. The House Speaker, Sir William Aston, ordered that the women not be charged.

title: White House Plans Conference of, by and for Youth
description: WASHINGTON. June 11 A national conference intended to be of young people, by young people and for young people was announced today by the White House.

title: President Asks End Of 20 Oil Contracts Off Santa Barbara
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 President Nixon asked Con gress today to approve legis lation canceling 20 Federal oil leases in the Santa Bar bara Channel, where a blow out in January, 1969, polluted miles of beaches and de stroyed much marine life.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: ADDONIZIO AIDES SEEK SOFTER LINE
description: NEWARK, June 11  Black members of the administration of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio attempted today to minimize reports of violence and poten tial violence during the May or's campaign for reelection against Kenneth A. Gibson, Negro engineer.

title: CHOU SCORES SOVIET; PRAISES RUMANIANS
description: HONG KONG, June 12Pre mier Chou Enlai of Communist China made an indirect attack on the Soviet Union yesterday at a banquet for a visiting Rumanian delegation and re called by implication the Soviet invasion of Czechoslovakia.

title: House Votes $345Million for ABM
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 Critics of the Safeguard anti ballistic missile system lost an other round today as the House passed a $1.9billion money bill that includes $354million in funds for ABM construction.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX LOWEST FOR WEEK
description: The American Stock Ex change turned in its poorest performance of the week yes terday as the list declined in slow trading.

title: BUSINESSMEN END U.S.JAPAN PARLEY
description: TOKYO, June 11 (UPI)A meeting of United States and Japanese businessmen end ed today on the same note on which it began  the United States group asking for a speedy relaxation of Japanese import restrictions and the Jap anese pleading for patience.

title: NIXON IS REBUFFED BY SENATE, 5247, ON CAMBODIA ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 In a rebuff to President Nixon, the Senate refused today to modify proposed legislative re strictions on future American military operations in Cam bodia.

title: Patricia Smith Plans Nuptials
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., June 11Mrs. George Robert Les lie Jr. of Englewood, New York and Fishers Island, N.Y., has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Patricia Ann Smith, to David Harris Perron, son of Col. Gregory H. Perron, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Perron of Fairfax, Va.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
HUSSEIN ACCEPTS GUERRILLA TERMS; OUSTS 2 GENERALS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 11 After five days of the bloodi est fighting ever between Arab guerrillas and the Jordanian Army, King Hussein yielded to night to the two principal com mando demands by removing his uncle as Commander in Chief and dismissing the com mander of the Third Armored Division, which surrounds the capital.

title: Wedding in Texas Jail
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., June 11 (UPI)A man and a woman serving 90day jail terms for possession of LSD were mar ried yesterday in the jailer's apartment. I'm the luckiest man in the world, said Dennis Loen O'Dell, 22 years old, at the wedding reception, com plete with a cake provided by local church women. He and his wife, the former Namoa Padgett, 21, were arrested May 15. Officials said with good be havior the couple's 90day terms could be reduced by as much as 30 days.

title: Barbara Schwartz Becomes a Bride
description: Miss Elaine Barbara Schwartz and Edward Straus man were married here last evening at the St. Regis Sheraton. Rabbi Jacob Polish performed the ceremony. State Supreme Court Justice Hyman Barshay assisted.

title: Ribicoff, ExH. E.W. Secretary, Advises Richardson on Perils
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The incoming Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare received a stern lecture today from a former Secretary of the department on the frustrations of serving in the post.

title: FLOOD OF DOLLARS PLEASES SCHILLER
description: BONN, June 11West Ger many's economics minister, Dr. Karl Schiller, said today that yesterday's mammoth dollar flow into West Germany ought to be considered a compli ment to domestic price stabil ity and the mark's purchasing power.

title: Hughes Purchase Backed
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., June 11 (UPI)  The Nevada Gaming Control Board has recommend ed approval of Howard Hughes's application to purchase Harolds Club in Reno for $11.5million. If the deal is approved, Mr. Hughes will have 221 table games and 2,275 slot machines in his seven  casino gambling operation in Las Vegas and Reno. Only Del Webb, who owns four clubs, is licensed for more slot machines  2,291. There are 33,614 one  armed bandits in the state.

title: Washington: For the Record
VIOLENCE RESUMED IN JERSEY CITY AREA
description: JERSEY CITY, Friday, June 12 (UPI)Small bands of dis sident Puerto Ricans roamed streets early today, smashing windows and hurling bottles in the city's second consecutive night of violence.

title: RUSSIANS IN SPACE PLAY CHESS MATCH
description: MOSCOW, June 11 (UPI)  Andrian Nikoleyev and Italy Sevastianov took a break from their spaceflight duties today and played history's first chess match between space and earth, the press agency Tass reported.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES CONSUMER PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 11  Legislation for establishment of an independent agency to represent the interests of con sumers before Federal courts and regulatory bodies and to test and evaluate consumer products was unanimously ap proved today by a House sub committee.

title: Addonizio Trial Witness Hints at Fears for Family
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., June 11The paralyzed prosecution witness in the trial of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark and seven other defendants on charges of extortion said here today he had withheld informa tion from the United States At torney because he was afraid.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS 4.4% DROP
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended June 6 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year. Continued work stop pages at major truck terminals throughout the country con tributed to the large year to year decrease tonnage.

title: Racial Question Clouds Issues, Paterson Says
description: State Senator Basil A. Pater son, the first Negro to run for Lieutenant Governor in New York, said yesterday that he had encountered no antiblack feeling while campaigning around the state but that he believed his positions on issues had been obscured by the black candidacy question.

title: Executive Changes
description: Gordon H. Oosting, senior vice president and national retail sales manager of Dean Witter & Co., has been named to the investment firm's board of directors. He fills the post left vacant by the retire ment of Phelps Witter Sr.

title: Theater: Irene Worth Brilliant in Hedda Gabler
description: STRATFORD, Ontario, June 11Irene Worth is one of the most illuminating act resses of the Englishspeak ing theater. She is of those rare creaturesFay Compton is anotherwho can take a role and mold it to herself, even wrap it around her own soul. Eighteen years ago, Miss Worth helped initiate this Stratford Festival, which has done so much for the North American theater. Last night she returned once more to Stratford to stake her claim to the title role of Ib sen's Hedda Gabler.

title: GIZZ KIDS TO RISK WHEELCHAIR TITLE
description: Expecting a challenge from the Chicago Sidewinders, De troit Sparks and Arizona Road Runners, the Illinois Gizz Kids open defense of their title in the 14th annual National Wheelchair games at the Joseph Bulova School of Watchmaking in Woodside, Queens, today.

title: Bookmen's Thoughts Stray to Dollars
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 You could have substi tuted transistors for books and everybody would have thought we were at a conven tion of electronics corpora tions, the vice president of a major publishing house re marked as he left a session at the annual convention of the American Booksellers Associ ation.

title: Feeler by the Russians
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 11East European diplomatic sources report that the Soviet Union has extended feelers to the Lon Nol Government and to Hanoi to see whether there is a basis for an agreement to end the fighting in Cambodia. Nei ther side is said to have re sponded favorably.

title: Jobless Car Washer Charged in Murder Of Woman Teacher
description: A 22yearold unemployed car washer who told the police he had a $60aday drug habit was arrested yesterday in As toria, Queens, and charged with the murder of a woman teacher from Long Beach whose body was found in an abandoned lot near La Guardia Airport Saturday.

title: Two Officers Get Stars and Kisses
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (AP)A general kissed gen erals at the Pentagon today as the Army handed stars to women for the first time in its 196year history.

title: THREAT TO POLICE LAID TO PANTHER
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 11 The police last night arrested a local representative of the Black Panther party, his wife and three other persons after, the police said, a patrolman was threatened with a shotgun.

title: Bituminous Coal Output Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (UPI) The National Coal Associa tion estimated today that bitu minous coal production in the I United States for the week end ed June 6 was approximately 11,645,000 tons. Production for the corresponding period in 1969 was 11,630,000 tons. Pro duction from Jan. 1 through June 6 was estimated at 252, 000,000 tons.

title: For B.B. King, Blues Reign Supreme
description: A nightclub show of more than usual significance is winding up an engagement tomorrow at the Royal Box of the Americana Hotel, where B. B. King, the blues singer and guitarist who has pro vided the cutting edge for the current wide popularity of the blues, has been appear ing.

title: Deborah S. Cheney to Be Bride Of Frederick Lazar on July 11
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 11 Miss Deborah Sue Cheney and Frederick Daniel Lazar, both of whom were gradu ated Monday from Cornell University, will be married July 11 in the First Presby terian Church here.

title: The Dove, a light plane seating 6 to 11. Fortyeight are in active service in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 The Federal Aviation Admin istration has ordered emer gency inspection of a wing fitting on DeHavilland Dove and Heron aircraft.

title: A Lightweight Body Armor Is Devised
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Lightweight body armor in vented for the Goodyear Aerospace Corporation, Ak ron, Ohio, is protecting Amer ican aircraft and helicopter crewmen from en emy bullets. The company says the invention sparked an armor revolu tion and marked the first major advance in ballistic protection since the Civil War.

title: Frank W. Mitchell, 65, Dies; Publisher of St. Louis Argus
description: ST. LOUIS, June 12 (AP) Frank W. Mitchell Sr., publisher of The St. Louis Argus, died of cancer today at St. Mary's Hos pital in suburban Richmond Heights. He was 65 years old.

title: Japan Registers a Deficit In Payment of $70Million
description: TOKYO, June 12 (Reuters) Japan had a deficit of $70 million in its balance of inter national payments in May, the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: Bridge:
description: Several of the leading coun try clubs in the New York metropolitan area issue an annual invitation to top ranked experts to play in competition with their mem bers. In the first such event of the summer season, the host was the Old Oaks Coun try Club, Purchase, N. Y., and the result caused some hilar ity.

title: Music: Whales Sing Out
description: And God Created Great Whales, a score by Alan Hovhaness that received its first performance Thursday night at the New York Phil harmonic's Promenades, al ternated taperecorded sing ing by our most consequential mammalian relative with fairly inconsequential orches tral music. His whales spoke profoundly, but Mr. Hovha ness stayed on the surface.

title: LATE RALLY CUTS MARKET'S LOSSES
Samuels Warns Upstate Of a BigCity Ticket
description: ROCHESTER, June 12 Howard J. Samuels, campaign ing in Buffalo and Rochester, warned upstate voters today that an allManhattan Demo cratic ticket headed by Arthur J. Goldberg, his rival for the Democratic gubernatorial nom ination, would have no chance of defeating Governor Rocke feller.

title: QE2 Joins Search for Vessel Missing in Crash Off Canada
description: HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, June 2 (AP)The British liner Queen Elizabeth 2 and four smaller ships were searching off Nova Scotia today for a fishing ves sel missing with four men aboard after she sent a distress signal at 4 A.M. reporting a collision.

title: Grace Bumbry, As Salome, Strips in London Production
description: LONDON, June 12 (AP)  Grace Bumbry took off all seven veils as promised in a new pro duction of Salome here to night. Before her dance was finished, she had stripped to my jewels and perfume, but a copious amount of jewelry covered her like a modest bikini.

title: MONMOUTH STAKES DRAWS FIELD OF 13
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June 121 (UPI)  Rex C. Ellsworth's Plenty Old and Ford Stable's Parasol Pete head a field of 3 yearolds named to run in the $30,425 Long Branch Stakes at Monmouth Park tomorrow.

title: Laura L. Kerstetter Married in Indiana
description: GREENCASTLE, lnd., June 12Miss Laura Lamson Ker stetter, whose father Dr. Wil liam E. Kerstetter, is presi dent of DePauw University, was married this afternoon to Christopher Lloyd King. The bridegroom, who will teach at AixMarseille Uni versity in France in Septem ber, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas W. King of Newcastle  Upon  Tyne, Eng land. Mr. King also is a schoolmaster.

title: Wendy Mairs Wed in Jersey To Yale Man
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 12 Miss Wendy Whitaker Mairs of New York was mar ried here tonight to Gerard Guyot Cameron 2d. The Rev. E. Rugby Auer performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church.

title: Daily News Delayed As Mailers Discuss Halt in Bargaining
description: Publication of the first edi Lon of The Daily News was delayed about an hour last night when mailers held union meetings at the News plants to hear union officials criticize publishers after talks on a new contract agreement were brok en off yesterday.

title: Resignation of Three Directors Announced by Penn Central Co.
description: The resignation of three directors of the Penn Central Company and of that holding company's railroad subsidiary, the Penn Central Transportation Company, was announced yesterday.

title: AllStar Lacrosse Today
description: LEXINGTON, Va., June 12 (UPI)A potent North offense will test a rockhard South de fense tomorrow in the 19th an nual AllStar lacrosse game at Washington and Lee University. The South leads, 15\11, in the series.

title: Regrets Are Few in Kent, Ohio
description: KENT, Ohio, June 12One thing that's definitely come out of this is an increase in patriot ism, said Jim Purcell as he filled out a sales slip in his downtown men's store. You can spot the patriotic people showing their flags.

title: ParvinDohrmann Changes
description: The ParvinDohrmann Com pany announced yesterday that Kenneth J. Sullivan Jr. had withdrawn his resignation as a director at the request of Gov. Paul Laxalt of Nevada. The resignation of Mr. Sullivan, executive vice president of the Valley Bank of Nevada, was announced on Thursday. Mr. Sullivan was elected to the board in April.

title: Budge Asserts S.E. C. May Drop Some Reviews of Corporate Data
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Hamer H. Budge, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, disclosed today that his agency faces such a large task in reviewing the backlog of quarterly and other corporate reports that it may not review all of them.

title: U.S. WRIT BLAMED IN PRISON UNREST
description: The State Attorney General's office has charged that a de cision by Federal Judge Con stance Baker Motley awarding damages to a prisoner for un constitutional solitary confine ment created so much unrest at Wallkill State Prison that the warden felt the Commis sioner of Corrections might be, wholly justified shutting it down.

title: ISRAEL BARZELAI, ISRAELI MINISTER
description: TEL AVIV, June 12  Israel Barzelai, a Kibbutz member who rose to cabinet rank, died of a heart attack at Hadassah Hospital in Jerusalem today. He was 57 years old.

title: Hickel Rift With Nixon Deeper; Resignation or Dismissal Seen
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  The relationship between Presi dent Nixon and Secretary of the interior Walter J. Flickel has deteriorated to the point where there is widespread speculation here that Mr. Hickel will soon resign or be dismissed.

title: SOYUZ 9 STRESSING MANUAL NAVIGATION
description: MOSCOW, June 12 (AP)  The official Soviet press agency Tass reported today the Soyuz 9 flight was au tonomous navigation, manual piloting by its two crewmen without assistance from ground control.

title: Industrial Output in May Dropped to 18Month Low
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  The output of the nation's fac tories, utilities and mines fell in May to its lowest level in a year and a half, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Patera to Seek WeightLifting Record at A.A.U. Meet
description: CULVER CITY, Calif., June 12 (AP)Ken Patera, who has been involved in weight lifting less than two years, thinks it's about time somebody in the sport broke the 500pound bar rierand he's pretty sure he'll be the one to do it.

title: Offering Is Oversubscribed
description: The General Public Utilities Corporation said yesterday that based on preliminary tabula tions its subscription offering of approximately 1.4 million shares of common stock to stockholders had been oversub scribed by between 175,000 and 200,000 shares. The offering ended yesterday.

title: Marilynne N. Brown Plans June 28 Bridal
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., June 12Mr. and Mrs. James Brown have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Marilynne Nancy Brown, to Richard Alan Schweitzer, son of New York State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer. The wedding is planned for June 28.

title: CONGRESS TARGET OF NIXON 2D TIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 President Nixon criticized Con gress today for what he said was its failure to act swiftly to meet a crisis need for financ ing housing purchases by hun dreds of thousands of people.

title: Massachusetts Democrats Name Slate
description: AMHERST, Mass., Saturday, June 13Maurice A. Donahue, the austere and crafty presi dent of the Massachusetts State Senate, won the endorsement of the Democratic Convention for Governor this morning after a tumultuous display of old style Irish politics.

title: REPUTED LEADER IN MAFIA IS DEAD
description: Gaspare DiGregorio, a small garment manufacturer who was catapulted to national notori ety in 1965 as the reputed successor to Joseph (Joe Banan as) Bonanno as boss of a far flung Mafia empire, has died in the obscurity to which he retired four years ago.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: PACIFIC LUTHERAN PULLS STRONG OAR
description: SYRACUSE, June 12  One of the points of interest at the Intercollegiate Rowing Associa tion's regatta finals tomorrow will be Pacific Lutheran's chances of beating Harvard again in the varsity fouroared event. Pacific who?

title: Vatican Owns Fiat Stock
description: ROME, June 12 (Reuters) The Vatican disclosed today that it has a few thousand shares in the Fiat Motor Com pany, the biggest car manufac turer in Italy. The Vatican spokesman, Msgr. Fausto Val lainc, made the disclosure in reply to a question at hi weekly news conference. Th Fiat company, which is based i?? Turin, has signed an agreemen?? with the Soviet Union for a Fiat car factory in the city of Togliatti, which is now nearing completion.

title: Finch Tells Ohio State Audience Backlash Threatens Universities
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 12  Secretary of Health, Educa tion and Welfare Robert H. Finch warned in a commence ment address today at Ohio State University that univer sities were becoming the vic tims of a disastrous backlash in which they were being blamed for causing all the problems of our society and then being punished for fail ing to solve them.

title: Victory in Dexter Trot Tonight To Make Someone 11 Feet Tall
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 12 John Froehlich's Gil Hano ver figures to be the favorite in the Dexter Cup Trot at Roosevelt Raceway tomor row night, but No. 11 is the figure to be reckoned with in the mile classic for 3year olds.

title: Marketplace:
description: It looks like it will be months or even years before Wall Street is ready for an other speculative boom. More and more brokerage houses  many with substantial losses of their own  are stressing longneglected is sues.

title: INTEGRATION PLAN FOUGHT IN DETROIT
description: DETROIT, June 12A move by Detroit's school board to mix more white and black stu dents in the schools here has exploded into a recall campaign against board members and a drive in the State Legislature to block the integration effort.

title: U.S. Court of Claims
Agee's 2 Homers Help Mets Rout Braves, 81
description: Tommie Agee and Bud Har relson demonstrated the inade quacy of the baseball box score as a guide to an individu al's contributions last night as the New York Mets defeated the Atlanta Braves, 81, at Shea Stadium.

title: PACT IS REPORTED ON CITY'S BUDGET
description: The Lindsay administration announced last night that it had reached tentative agree ment with the City Council leadership and a majority of the Board of Estimate on the Mayor's proposed expense bud get for 197071.

title: Edward S. Greenbaum, Lawyer, Is Dead at 80
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 12 Edward S. Greenbaum, one of New York's leading lawyers and court reformers, died today in Princeton Hospital after a long illness. He was 80 years old and lived at 104 Mercer Street.

title: Seven Indicted by Swiss For Illegal Arms Export
description: GENEVA, June 12The De partment of Justice announced today that it had filed charges against seven persons in con nection with the illegal export of arms by the Swiss manufac turer, OrlikonBhrle.

title: Blacks Believe Gibson Would Help Them
description: NEWARK, June 12Among the predominantly Negro resi dents of the Scudder Homes housing project here, there is a vision of hope in the grow ing confidence that a black manKenneth A. Gibson will be elected Mayor of Newark next Tuesday.

title: Filipinos Mark Anniversary
description: MANILA, June 12 (Reuters) President Ferdinand E. Mar cos led millions of Filipinos in a pledge of allegiance today to mark the 72d anniversary of the Philippines declaration of independence from Spain in the SpanishAmerican War. Troops and policemen stood by in sev eral areas of the city to avert possible violence.

title: JORDAN'S EMBASSY IN BEIRUT BURNED
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 A mob of some 3,000 leftist demonstrators shouting Death to Hussein! and We want a republic! set fire to the roy al Jordanian Embassy tonight and hoisted the flag of the Pal estinians on the roof. About half the building was burned.

title: Indochina Debate in Senate Shifts to Mercenaries Issue
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The Senate's debate on Indo china shifted today to the issue of whether the Administration should be permitted to finance the introduction of foreign troops into Cambodia.

title: Folk Art Museum Starts Fund Drive For Larger Home
description: The Museum of American Folk Art, a small and young museum that is winning a grow ing following, has announced plans for expansion, a new home and a $4million fund drive to underwrite its future.

title: With the High Cost of Dining Out, More People Are Thinking in Terms of Eating In
description: With many people looking for an alternative to the in creasingly expensive practice of dining out, many specialty food stores and caterers, particu larly in suburban areas, are find ing the sale of quality ingre dients and prepared foods on the rise. In Chappaqua, N. Y., for instance, there is The Sign of the Turtle, a pickup cater ing service at 115 King Street in an old twingabled barn that James A. Hands reno vated and painted himself. Mr. Hands graduated 10 years ago from Horace Greeley High School in Chappaqua and, after getting a B.A. in history from Transylvania University in Lexington, Ky., and an advanced diploma in culinary arts from the Culi nary Institute in New Haven, Conn., returned to his home town to open the catering service.

title: June White House Services
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI) President Nixon has cancelled White House religious services scheduled for Sunday, June 21,

title: 15 Climbers in Peru Dead
description: LIMA, Peru, June 13 (AP) The bodies of 14 Czechoslovak mountain climbers and one Chilean climber have been found buried in snow, accord ing to reports reaching here today. They had left the city of Yungay the day before the May 31 earthquake to climb Andean peaks.

title: DODD WITHDRAWS FROM PARTY RACE
description: HARTFORD, June 12Sena tor Thomas J. Dodd withdrew today from the contest for the Democratic nomination for the Senate from Connecticut but left open the possibility that he might seek reelection as an independent.

title: ADDONIZIO JURY HEARS ENGINEER
description: TRENTON, June 12A sani tary engineer testified here to day in the trial of Hugh J. Addonizio, Mayor of Newark, and seven other defendants charged with extortion, that an unidentified Mr. B tried in June 1966, to shake down his company for $15,000 on a $250,000 contract with the city.

title: Two Airlines Propose Revising And Simplifying Atlantic Fares
description: Pan American World Air ways and Trans World Airlines have drafted proposals for sweeping changes in transAt lantic air fares designed to end some of the confusion that travelers experience when they buy a ticket to Europe.

title: Mrs. Wilkinson Committed
description: LONDON, June 12Mrs. Joan Wilkinson, 30yearold daughter of Gene Tunney, the former world heavyweight box ing champion, was ordered to be detained in Broadmoor, a hospital for insane criminals, by a court here today, after pleading guilty to charges of killing her husband, Lynn Car ter Wilkinson, last March. The court heard evidence that Mrs. Wilkinson had suffered from schizophrenia for nine years.

title: Carol Nickels Wed To Robert Smith
description: Miss Carol Anne Penelope Nickels and Robert Joseph Smith were married here yes terday morning by Dr. Richard Gambino, a leader of the New York Society for Ethical Cul tural, at the society.

title: Holy Cross Club Protests Bid to DeEmphasize Sports
description: WORCESTER, Mass., June 12 The Holy Cross Varsity Club flied a sharp protest today against a recommendation by the faculty committee that sports be deemphasized at the school.

title: Coach of Yale Eight To View The Race For the First Time
description: GALES FERRY, Conn., June 12When Yale's varsity crew meets Harvard on the Thames tomorrow in America's old est intercollegiate eventthe 105th race between the col legesat least one of the ob servers will be watching the classic for the first time.

title: Dance: Youth Has Its Day
description: Ballet schools are like vine yards in that they have good years and bad years. The School of American Ballet gave a couple of perform ances on Thursday afternoon at the New York State Thea ter for those admirably friendly Friends of City Cen ter. These performances have been welcome annual events for four years now, but this was by far the most impres sive. This is a great vintage year that deserves to be re membered.

title: General Dynamics Offers Its Presidency to Knudsen
description: The presidency of the Gen eral Dynamics Corporation has been offered to Semon E. (Bunkie) Knudsen, former pres ident of and Ford Motor Com pany and top executive of the General Motors Corporation.

title: Olivier Is First Actor to Be Named to the Peerage
description: LONDON, June 12Sir, Laur ence Olivier was named a life peer today, the first actor in British history to be sent to the House of Lords.

title: Bicentennial Decision May Be Revised
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12  The executive committee of President Nixon's Bicentennial Advisory Commission will prob ably revise the first draft of its recommendations for celebrat ing the country's 200th birthday in 1976, Dr. J. E. Wallace Ster ling the commission chairman, said in a telephone interview today.

title: Politics: Goldberg Urges Educational Reform
description: Arthur J. Goldberg declared yesterday that this country's educational institutions were not working properly and that the educational process must be made far more diverse.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Saturday, June 13, 1970

title: New Chief at Labor
description: The friendliness with which organized labor has greeted the naming of James D. Hodgson to succeed George P. Shultz as Secretary of Labor is a sign of increased political sophistication on the part of most top unionists.

title: 5THJAPANESE SHIP DEVELOPS CRACKS
description: KOBE, Japan, June 12 (AP)  A fifth Japanese tanker, built five years ago, has developed cracks in its hull, the Japan Ma rine Association has reported.

title: Topics: Arms Talks and Mutual Verification
description: For the past twenty years ever since we discovered that the Russians had developed the atomic bombwe have lived in its shadow. The menace has grown so great that negotia tions for arms limitations and control are the most crucial and urgent enterprise in which our Government is engaged.

title: MAYOR IS SILENT ON ROCKEFELLER
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell, who tried to promote Mayor Lindsay for Vice President at the 1968 Republican National Convention and who was an early Lindsay backer in last year's mayoral race, yesterday received Mr. Lindsay's endorse ment in the 1970 Senate elec tion.

title: A DEBATE MARKS REUNION AT YALE
description: NEW HAVEN, June 12Yale University alumni were told by students and professors today that their alma mater was a threatened institution, but the speakers differed widely on the, nature of the trouble and they way to solve it.

title: Partial Accord Set In Technicolor Fray
description: Technicolor, Inc., the color film processor, reached at least a partial understanding yester day with Harry Saltzman, one of its largest stockholders, who has been trying to take control of the company in a proxy fight.

title: Casualties Termed High
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 (Reuters)  Officials of the Palestine Red Crescent, the equivalent of the Red Cross, said today that casualties in the fighting in Amman were at least 700.

title: JOHN J. SCANLAN, 60, EXCHANGE OFFICIAL
description: John J. Scanlan, president of the New York Mercantile Ex change, died Thursday after a long illness. He was 60 years old and lived at 447 100th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Aerospace Group Studies Public Relations Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Aerospace Industries Associa tion, representing the major companies in that industry, is considering embarking on a million  dollar public relations drive to create greater under standing of the real facts be hind the relationship between industry and Government in procurement of national secur ity materials.

title: SOVIET WILL SIGN RUMANIAN TREATY
description: MOSCOW, June 12The So viet Union announced today that Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party leader, would head a delegation of party and state officials to visit Rumania early next month to participate in the signing of a new friend ship treaty.

title: Antiques: Joseph McMullan's Carpets
description: Seventyfive Oriental or, to be more precise, Islamic car pets from the Joseph V. Mc Mullan Collection make for an illuminating exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum.

title: W. GERMANY TAKES CUP ZONAL SINGLES
description: NUERNBERG, West germany, June 12 (AP)  West Germany took a 20 lead over Belgium today in their European Zone B Davis Cup competition as Wilhelm Bungert and Christian Kuhnke posted singles victories.

title: Penguins, Flyers in Trade
description: PITTSBURGH, June 12 (AP) The Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League traded today George Swarbrick, a right wing, to the Philadel phia Flyers for Terry Bell, defenseman.

title: O'Dwyer, Campaigning on L.I., Retains His Youth Identification
description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I., June 12Surrounded by youngsters, Paul O'Dwyer carried his cam paign for the Democratic nomi nation for Senator to Long Island today.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: SST Benefits

title: Medicine and Genetics
description: Medicine may be on the threshold of a revolutionary new era, in which physicians have the means of curing the depressingly long list of diseases that originate the genes the victims inherit from their ancestors.

title: Food Relief Is Reduced in Former Biafran Region
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, June 12 Mary K., a war widow with three young children, lives in a bush village just east of Owerri, the last capital of the land that was Biafra.

title: Bodies of 2 More C.B.S. Newsmen Found
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System announced yesterday that Gerald Miller, a reporter producer, has been killed in the ambush of a jeep in Cam bodia on May 31.

title: H. T. Dyett 2d Marries Miss Eleanor Gillespie
description: Miss Eleanor Gillespie and H. Thomas Dyett 2d were married at the main alter of St. Patrick's Cathedral yes terday afternoon by Dom Luke Childs, a member of the faculty of the Ports mouth (R. I.) Priory School. There were 24 friends and relatives of the couple in the bridal party and 500 guests.

title: U.S.Aceepts Argentine Junta
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI) A State Department spokes man said today that the United States recognizes the new mil itary leadership of Argentina as the country's legal government. The spokesman, John F. King, said the State Department has concluded that the change of leadership does not give rise to a question of recognition as there is no basic discontinuity in the military Government of Argentina.

title: The Misery of Rising Expectations
description: NEWCASTLE  UPON  TYNE, EnglandAnyone interested in inflation as a psychological phenomenonthe emotions it arouses in an industrial society might try some field work here in the urban center of Northeast England. A little can vassing in the midst of the British election campaign shows that rising prices are the main subject on the voters' minds. And it is a preoccupation going beyond the rational.

title: Ton of Marijuana Seized
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) Seizure of more than a ton of marijuana concealed in the wall panel of a truck crossing the Mexican border at Tecate, Calif., yesterday was reported today by the Bureau of Cus toms.

title: 2 IRISH HEROES GET A MUSICAL TRIBUTE
description: Thomas Moore, the Irish poet, was born on May 28, 1779. James Connolly, the Irish martyr, was executed by the British on May 12, 1916. These two dates were celebrated Thursday evening in a Carnegie Recital Hall concert that had originally been scheduled for May. It had been prepared by Wilbur Broms, a Moore author ity as well as a tenor.

title: Reuther Honored Here
description: Walter P. Reuther, the late president of the United Auto Workers, was posthumously awarded an honarary doctor of laws degree yesterday by the Polytechnic Institute of Brook lyn.

title: A 7Month Review Of Antipoverty Unit Yields Fifth Arrest
description: Investigation Commissioner Robert K. Ruskin announced yesterday the fifth arrest in the continuing inquiry into the Satellite Program, which was financed by the Human Re sources Administration's Yout?? Service Agency.

title: U.S. and Soviet Weigh Possibility of New U.N. Mediation Effort in the Mideast
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The United States and the Soviet Union began a detailed exploration today of the possi bilities of resuming United Na tions mediation in the Arab Israeli conflict as American officials emphasized that this week's crisis in Jordan added new urgency to the search for a political settlement.

title: TOWNS ATACKED NEAR PNOMPENH
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 12  North. Vietnamese and Vietcong forces were reported to have launched two more at tacks today in their continuing campaign of harassing the Cam bodian Government.

title: Sports of the Times
description: You think you'd really be charged up for the nation als, said Bob Wieland, a weight lifter. I mean, this is the national championships, wow. But I used to get much more turned on before a college football game. I guess it's because I don't really want to be here. This is a substitute, the best there is, but still a substitute. I'd rather have legs.

title: FOOD FAIR PROFIT DOWN IN QUARTER
description: Food Fair Stores, Inc., an nounced yesterday that net in come fell to $1,191,000, or 16 cents a share, in the quarter ended May 9 from $2,063,000, equal to 28 cents a share, in the comparable period last year.

title: O'Neill Takes Net Title
description: HAYWARD, Calif., June 12 (AP)Topseeded Earl O'Neill of the University of California at Irvine won the singles title today in the National Collegiate Athletic Association college division tennis tournament. O'Neill beat his teammate, Craig Neslage, 63, 63.

title: U.N. Council Plans Periodic Meetings At Ministers' Level
description: UNITED NATIONS. N. Y., June 12The Security Council agreed today to hold periodic meetings at the cabinetmin ister level to consider pending world problems before they reach the crisis stage.

title: Allies Foresee an Increase In Terrorism by Vietcong
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 12The enemy's slaying of civilians in a hamlet near Danang early yesterday is being pointed out by allied officials here as clear evidence of increasing Vietcong ter rorism aimed at thwarting Saigon's gains in the country side.

title: Lawyer Marries Mrs. Diana Rockwell
description: Mrs. Diana Hutchins Rock well of New York, widow of James Rockwell of St. David's, Pa., was married here yesterday to Manuel R. Angulo, a partner in the law firm of Curtis, MalletPre vost, Colt & Mosle here. Su preme Court Justice Matthew M. Levy performed the cere mony in his chambers.

title: LAYER ADVANCES IN WILLS TENNIS
description: BRISTOL, Engand, June 12 (UPI)Rod Laver rallied to night to beat a fellow Austral ian professional, Owen David son, 46, 62, 86, and gain the men's singles final of the Wills $25,000 open lawn tennis championship.

title: 4Day Press Strike In London Settled; 10% Pay Rise Given
description: LONDON, Saturday, June 13 A strike by printing workers that has closed national news papers for four days ended late last night.

title: Miss Rankin, Duke Alumna, Carolina Bride
description: DURHAM, N. C., Jung 12 Miss Dorothy Battle Rankin and Robert Houston Robinson of Rehoboth Beach, Del., were married this noon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Stanley Rankin, parents of the bride. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. J. Thomas Robinson of Georgetown, Del., and the late Mr. Robin son.

title: Historians Worried by Cutbacks In Access to Presidential Papers
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Historians are increasingly, worried that legal and bu reaucratic complications sur rounding the preservation of Presidential papers may he crippling their efforts to ana lyze the world's most powerful office.

title: The Chief Awards
description: Model Green Conformation HuntersLansonl Farms South's Anita's Lad.

title: Porsche Counts on the Organizer
description: LE MANS, France, June 12 The Organizer looked tired. His eyes were barely open and it was an effort to lift a glass of scotch.

title: Powell's Racial Opinions Causing a Crisis for Tories
description: LONDON, June 12  Enoch Powell's attacks on Britain's colored minority are presenting the Conservative party and its leader, Edward Heath, with crisis of the dimensions that faced the Republican party in the days of Senator Joseph R. McCarthy.

title: I.O.S. TO RELEASE 1969 AUDIT TODAY
description: GENEVA, June 12As inter national banks move into a dif ficult and delicate phase of ne gotiations with Investors Over seas Services, Ltd., the mutual fund company unexpectedly announced today that it had moved up the date for release of its audited 1969 annual re port from Monday to tomorrow.

title: Red Cross Sends Jordan Aid
description: GENEVA, June 12  The International Committee of the Red Cross said tonight that it was dispatching immediately to Amman, Jordon, a chartered plane with a doctor and six tons of medical supplies.

title: Houston Gas Earnings Up
description: The Houston Natural Gas Corporation and subsidiaries re ported yesterday operating revenues and sales of $150,826, 000 for the nine months ended April 30. This compared with $102,605,000 in the like period of fiscal 1969. Net income rose to $12,250,000, or $2.05 a share, from the $10,113,000, or $1.84 a share, reported on few er shares a year earlier.

title: 16th Session in Vienna Talks
description: VIENNA, June 12 (AP)Ne gotiators at the United States Soviet talks on the limitation of arms met for about two, hours today in the 16th session since the talks began here April 17.

title: Monsanto Saccharin Price Rises by 30 Cents a Pound
description: The Monsanto Company an nounced yesterday that it had raised the price of all grades of saccharin by 30 cents a nound.

title: WESTCHESTER WINS WOMEN'S TEAM GOLF
description: PARAMUS, N. J., June 12 Led by Mrs. Albert Bower, Westchester won the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association's 45th annual team match for the Golf Illustrated Trophy today for the second year in a row.

title: FLIGHT SAFETY, INC., ENDS COPTER RUNS
description: Flight Safety, Inc., discon tinued its midtown helicopter taxi service yesterday.

title: FirstGrade Teacher Heldu pat Gunpoint As 30 Pupils Watch
description: A young substitute teacher at Public School 40 in the South Bronx Was robbed at gunpoint in her classroom while 30 first grade students looked on inl horror yesterday.

title: F.C.C.Meets on Proposals to Regulate Cable TV
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission began a special meeting yesterday on proposals to regulate ownership of cable television systems.

title: STONITSCH CLIPS MARK FOR 6 MILES
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., June 12 Ron Stonitsch of C. W. Post scored a stirring victory tonight in the sixmile run at the Na tional Collegiate Athletic Asso ciation College division track and field championships.

title: NEW ISSUES LAG IN SLOW TRADING
description: An oil drilling concern, an electronics company and a Florida operator of funeral homes made first public offer ings of their common stock this week in a market that con tinued in the depressed state of the last several months.

title: The Endangered Consumer ...
description: Consumer protection in two of the most funda mental areas of American lifeautomobiles and fabrics for personal clothing and home useis shock ingly inadequate despite the existence of Federal laws and testing agencies.

title: Policeman Is Held in Death Of HitRun Victim, 72
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 12 (AP)An offduty New York City patrolman was arrested early today on charges of driv ing while intoxicated and leav ing the scene of an accident in connection with the death of a 72yearold woman, the police said.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London stock market closed mixed yesterday after an early decline.

title: Reports of Rain in Southwest Spur a Rise in Wheat Futures
description: A late wave of profit taking trimmed sharp early advances in wheat futures on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, but prices showed a gain for the day.

title: Unveilings
description: FINKELSTEINEva. Unveiling of monu ment will take place June 14 at 10:30 A.M. at Mount Lebanon Cemetery, Iselin, N. J. All invited.

title: WESTON W. HILL
description: PASSAGRILLE, Fla., June 12 Weston W. Hill, an adver tising consultant in New York, Chicago and Florida, died Wednesday at St. Petersburg (Fla,) General Hospital after a brief illness. He was 74 years old and had lived here for the last six years.

title: F.B.I. May Resume Checks
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Federal Bureau of In vestigation said today that it hoped additional funds would make it possible to resume checks of its fingerprint files for various applicants after July 1. It said it had asked for an additional $2.75million to permit resumption of check ing fingerprints on job or li cense applications sent in by state or local agencies, which had been discontinued because of a lack of money to hire enough personnel to handle a growing number of requests.

title: 155 U.S. CITIZENS IN JORDAN LEAVE AS FIGHTING ENDS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 12 One hundred and fiftyfive Americans were evacuated from Jordan today after King Hus sein brought calm to his bat tered capital by yielding to Arab commandos' demands.

title: 2 Off Broadway Plays Close And One Suspends Its Run
description: The closings of two Off Broadway shows and the sus pension of a third were an nounced yesterday. Dark of the Moon, the Howard Rich ardsonWilliam Berney play, will end its run tomorrow at the MercerShaw Arena The ater after B6 performances.

title: Palestine Was the Area Under British Mandate
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 (AP)The words Palestine and Palestinian are often in the news from the Middle East these days. Here, briefly, is their meaning:

title: Dayan Says New Raid Proves Intent to Defend Line at Canal
description: JERUSALEM, June 12De fense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that last night's heavy raid across the Suez Canal was proof that Israel would steadfastly defend the canal line despite what he called red strings entangled with the Egyptian forces.

title: Valiant Beats Intrepid as America's Cup Preliminary Trials End
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 12 The preliminary phase of the America's Cup defense trials ended today with Valiant charging to victory over In trepid in a rain squall that bristled with lightning and wind.

title: Federal Court Grants a Hearing On Visa Denied Marxist Scholar
description: A group of American profes sors challenging the denial of a United States visa to Dr. Ernest E. Mandel, a Belgian economist who is a Marxist scholar, won a motion in Fed eral Court here yesterday to establish a threejudge panel to hear the case.

title: 2Price Copper Held on Way Out
description: Hendrik S. Houthakker, a member of the President's Council of Economic Advis ers, said here yesterday that the controversial twoprice system for copperone level for American supplies and another for foreign produc tionprobably would disap pear within the next few years, and perhaps much sooner.

title: ROYER 132 LEADS WESTERN OPEN
description: CHICAGO, June 12 (AP) Hugh Royer, an obscure tour regular from Columbus, Ga., carded a sixunderpar 65 today and moved into a fourstroke lead in the second round of the $130,000 Western open golf tournament.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, JUNE 13, 1970

title: West German Vote Is Local in Name Only
description: REMSCHEID, West Germany, june 11The names of the four contestants for Remscheid's seat in the state Parliament of North RhineWestphalia in the election Sunday are Janssen, Van Norden, Lemmer and Gier sienen. But a visitor, after talk ing with a score of voters, would think they were voting for or against Chancellor Willy Brandt and his pol icy of seeking bet icyrelations with Eastern Europe.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended June 2.

title: Brooklyn Marks 324th Year
description: Brooklyn marked its 324th anniversary yesterday with festivities on the steps of Borough Hall, including a birth daycake celebration.
