One pur pose of the celebration, accord ing to the Brooklyn Birthday Committee, was to appeal for the return of pre  Broadway show runs to the borough. To that end, Sandy Duncan, now appearing in The Boy Friend, presented a cake from the show's cast to Borough Presi dent Abe Stark.

title: BONNSOVIET TEXT LEAKED TO PAPER
description: BONN, June 12The West German Government was an gered today by a newspaper leak of a secret agreement be tween Bonn and Moscow that is to serve as a basis for nego tiating a nonaggresssion treaty this summer.

title: Prices for Film Series
description: The admission prices men tioned in a review in yester day's New York Times for the Take One film programs being presented at the New York Cultural Center were in correct. The prices are $2 for adults, $1.50 for students and $1 for members of the center. The information in the review was provided by the center.

title: Mayo Called Possibility For Position in Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)The White House said today that President Nixon wanted to consider Robert P. Mayo, outgoing Budget Director, for a Cabinet post should a vacancy arise in the months ahead. The President's press secretary, Ron ald L. Ziegler, said Mr. Nixon indicated to Mr. Mayo that if a Cabinet opening should develop, he would like him to be available for consideration.

title: Japan to Give U.S. A Textile Proposal
description: TOKYO, June 12 (AP)The Japanese Government hopes to submit a final proposal to Wash ington by next Thursday in effots to settle the dispute over Japanese textile exports to the United States, a Foreign Min istry spokesman said today.

title: Kennedy Memorial Slated
description: DALLAS, June 12 (AP)  Dedication ceremonies for the John Fitzgerald Kennedy Me morial will be held June 24 within sight of the spot where the President was assassinated Nov. 22. 1963.

title: Matson Sets Meet Mark
description: WICHITA, Kan., June 12 (AP) Randy Matson bettered the meet shotput record by more than seven feet and beat back the challenge of Karl Salb to day at the United States Track and Field Federation champion ships.

title: Bicentennial Decision May Be Revised
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12  The executive committee of President Nixon's Bicentennial Advisory Commission will prob ably revise the first draft of its recommendations for celebrat ing the country's 200th birthday in 1976, Dr. J. E. Wallace Ster ling the commission chairman, said in a telephone interview today.

title: Note by Envoy's Kidnappers Reported Found in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 12 (Reuters)  A West German Embassy spokesman said here tonight that a message report edly written by the kidnappers of Ambassador Ehrenfried von Holleben had been found in city church.

title: Firemen and Oilers Get Rails Wage Pact
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  The International Brotherhood of Firemen and Oilers announced today a wage settlement with the railroad industry that the union said averted the threat of a nationwide rail strike.

title: Roundup: Ellis of Pirates Stops Padres on NoHitter
description: Lady Luck turned sharply in favor of Philip J. Dock El lis Jr. last night. The Pitts burgh Pirates' 25yearold righthander, shut out four times last season and in volved in nine onerun games, pitched the major league's first nohitter of the season in beating the Padres, 20, in the first game of a double header in San Diego.

title: Mrs. Rene Massequoi, 26, Of Children't Aid Society
description: Mrs. Rene Shostack Masse quoi, the youngest director ever apointed by the Chil dren's Aid Society, died of complications following minor surgery on Tuesday at Doctors Hospital. She was 26 years old and lived at 444 East 82d Street with her husband, Fran cois.

title: Bicentennial Decision May Be Revised
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12  The executive committee of President Nixon's Bicentennial Advisory Commission will prob ably revise the first draft of its recommendations for celebrat ing the country's 200th birthday in 1976, Dr. J. E. Wallace Ster ling the commission chairman, said in a telephone interview today.

title: Unmanned Spacecraft Planned To Study HighEnergy Particles
description: Plans are being developed for a new spacecraft equipped to tackle some of the most chal lenging puzzles of physics and astronomy  the pulsars and quasars, quarks and cosmic rays, mumesons and pi mesons.

title: Act I Wins Two Classes to Take Open Jumper Lead at Ox Ridge
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 12 What started as a walkaway for the open jumper champion ship suddenly developed into an extremely close contest to day at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club Horse Show.

title: JERSEY CITY TENSE AFTER DISORDERS
description: JERSEY CITY, June 12A relative calm, marred by a few isolated bottletossing inci dents, prevailed tonight in downtown Jersey City after two nights of sporadic disor ders by Puerto Rican youths.

title: Washington: For the Record
Lee A. Nunez Wed in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 12 The marriage of Miss Lee Ann Nuez to James Schet tino, an architect with W. C. Frank Associates in New Canaan, took place here to night. The Rev. Kenneth P. Ruehl, pastor of the Talmadge Hill Community Church, per formed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. John Bristol Nuez parents of the bride. The bridegroom is the son of Leo J. Schettino of New Canaan and Mrs. Mau rice Bennett of Stamford.

title: 0.E.C.D. REVISES PRICE FORECAST
description: PARIS, June 12 (AP)Con tinued inflationary pressures in major industrialized nations have prompted experts of the Organization for Economic Co operation and Development to revise upward earlier predic tions of price trends for 1970, it was learned today.

title: Sinden to Coach East Stars
description: BOSTON, June 12 (AP) Harry Sinden will coach the East Stars against the West in the annual National Hockey League AllStar game next Jan uary, the Boston Bruins an nounced today. Sinden, who coached the Bruins to the Stan ley Cup this year, resigned last month to enter private business.

title: TELPAK ORDERED EXTENDED TO ALL
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  The Federal Communi cations Commission ordered the American Telephone and Telegraph Company and Western Union today to pro vide equal access to their Tel pak rates for all privateline customers without regard to the nature of their business.

title: Congress Backs Space Bill Authorizing $3.4Billion
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  Senate  House conferees agreed today on a $3.4billion space authorization bill for the fiscal year starting July 1, but actual funds available for the program are likely to be con siderably less.

title: McCarthy Tours Bronx Wards, Says Veterans' Care Is Poor
description: Members of a Congressional committee, including Repre sentative Richard Max Mc Carthy, toured the Bronx Vet erans Administration Hospital in Kingsbridge Road yesterday and were shocked by a statement by a paralyzed veteran of the war in Vietnam that a doctor had refused to give him braces so he could attempt to walk again.

title: Eagles, Giants Play Sept. 5 In Benefit Test at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. 3., June 12 (UPI)  The Philadelphia Eagles and New York Giants will play their ninth annu al New Jersey Jaycee exhibition football benefit game on Sept. 5 at Princeton's University's Palmer Stadium.

title: Lombardozzi Is Given 2 Years In Case Involving Stolen Check
description: Carmine Lombardozzi, an al leged Mafia lieutenant, was sen tenced yesterday to two years in prison by a Federal Court judge in Brooklyn on a charge of conspiring to cash $50,000 in stolen brokerage checks.

title: Art: 2 Interesting Talents Make Debut
description: As the art season draws to a close this month, two in teresting new talentsboth womenare making their de but in New York with solo exhibitions: Kay Kurt at the Kornblee Gallery, 58 East 79th Street, and Pat Lipsky at the Emmerich Gallery, 41 East 57th Street. Both are painters with strongly de fined styles. Both bring im pressive technical gifts to their work and both leave an impression of large ambitions and clearly thoughtout posi tions on questions of style and pictorial method.

title: Cambodians Now Expecting Long Years of Strife
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 11  A quiet fear is growing in the Government and among civil servants that Cambodia faces years of cruel crises because of the foreign forces contending on her soil.

title: Hart, Seeking Third Term, Opposes Asia Involvement
description: DETROIT, June 12 (UPI) Senator Philip A. Hart, Demo crat of Chicago, announced today that he was running for a third term and repeated his appeal the nation get out of Indochina and turn its efforts to solving the problems at home.

title: U.S. Doubts Study on Extent of Harlem Addiction
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Federal health sources ex pressed skepticism today about a widely publicized report de tailing an alarming extent of drug addiction and homelessness in Harlem.

title: Peace Is the New Design at Parsons
description: As commercial students; they've been studying propa ganda to sell corn flakes, said David C. Levy, dean of the Parsons School of Design. Now they've decided to use their skills to sell peace.

title: U.S. COURT REVERSES INDIAN CLAIMS UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) A United States Court of Claims issued a decision today that could trim millions of dol lars off proposed Federal pay ments to Indians for tribal land taken by the Government in the last century.

title: Brownsville Erupts in Violence Over Huge Accumulations of Garbage
description: Small bands of youths burned garbage in the streets and set lire to vacant build ings early this morning in the second night of disturb an??s in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn. One man wac ?? killed.

title: Rats Eating Yogurt Develop Cataracts, 2 at Hopkins Find
description: Two researchers at Johns! Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore have reported that rats whose! diets consisted exclusively of commercially prepared yogurt] developed cataracts  cloudi ness of the lenses of the eyes.

title: YANKEE PITCHER YIELDS FIVE HITS
description: KANSAS CITY, June 12  Fritz Peterson of the Yankees, in complete control from the start to finish, rationed the Kansas City Royals a modest five hits tonight and chalked up his ninth victory of the sea son, 50, before a gathering of 9,274 at the Municipal Stadium.

title: A New Command Guides Palestinians
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 A new 27man Central Commit tee of the Palestinian com mando organizations is leading the guerrillas in their present skirmishes with the Jordanian Army.

title: BRENNEV SAYS U.S. SPURS AGGRESSION AS IT TALKS PEACE
description: MOSCOW, June 12Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party leader, accused the Nixon Administration today of talking about peace while carrying out aggressive actions that aggra vate international tensions.

title: Screen: 'Events' of Young Adventure:Tale About Filmmaker Improvises Dialogue Fred Baker's Work at 72d St. Playhouse
description: From time to time each season a new Worst Movie of the Year appears, and this time it is Fred Baker's "Events," which the widely displayed ad tells us "is about a young filmmaker, Ryan, who wants to make his own film, but who, in order to raise money, must first make some stag films . . . ." I'm not sure what those four dots mean, though I suspect they are some kind of dirty-movie braille for "Oh, Wow!" But the actual movie looks as if it had been developed from an idea that, while traveling between the minds of Brian De Palma and Chuck Hirsch (co-authors of "Greetings" and "Hi, Mom!"), had been kidnapped by Grove Press, and, because nobody wanted to pay the ransom, they killed it.The movie also looks like several other movies, and, fatally, reminds us of two or three real movie makers. In its locales and its images (young adventure in New York from the East 50's to Coney Island) it follows the footsteps of Warren Sonbert ("The Bad and the Beautiful," "Truth Serum," etc.).In some of its moods and in its choice of leading lady (Joy Bang, here identified as Joy Wener) it imitates Andrew Meyer ("Sky Pirate," "An Early Cue to the New Direction," etc.). And in its final freeze frame, the puzzled face of its hero spurned by its heroine (the sensible Joy Bang), it acts as if it were the very first film to copy the device out of Truffaut's "400 Blows."At no point is "Events" worth watching, but it reaches a positive frenzy of dullness during its climactic orgy sequence, when the heroine, the modest Joy Bang, has left the scene ("I dunno  maybe I'm just not hip enough for the new generation hipness.") and the heroes, Frank and Ryan, settle down for some profitable movie making.Baker has an unenviable talent for undressing girls who are at once flat-chested and flabby-breasted (except the firm and voluptuous Joy Bang) and then subjecting them not only to various sexual specialities, but also to a really obscene hand-held camera, and to such a variety of screens and tinted panels and arty superimpositions as to qualify for every photographer's prize contest between the years of, say, 1933 and 1937.The director selected the events, and the actors improvised their own dialogue, and the results are uniformly unhappy. Nothing interesting happens, though a lot that is supposed to be interesting happens, and the lines fall like lead weights cast into the void. "If my mind can't go around you, how can my arms go around you?" wails Ryan when Joy puts down pornographyas if he had pulled an F in his sensitivity classes.The cast is large, untalented (except for Joy Bang), and terrifically indigenous. "Events" may (or may not) be the first dirty movie to show and give special credit to the Rev. William Glenesk of the Spencer Memorial Church.

title: ...and F.T.C. Reforms
description: The agency in Washington that hits closest to home for the American consumerthe Federal Trade Com missionup to now has been unable to keep pace with the growth of industry and the marketplace. Since 1915 it has attempted patchwork in the broad areas of product labeling, fair packaging, trade marks, pricefixing in restraint of trade, and other unfair methods of competition. The result has been that the F.T.C. served mainly as an information instead of an enforcement agency.

title: Only $25 and WashableNo Wonder All Those Men Lined Up
description: A teenaged blonde and her frizzyhaired boy friend pushed their way through the crowd on Alexander's second floor the other evening.

title: Buses for New Canaan Link
description: The Penn Central announced yesterday that it would provide buses instead of trains for pas sengers on its New Canaan branch, Monday through Fri day, between the hours of 9 A.M. and 3 P.M., next week and the week after. The railroad said it would be doing track maintenance work on the line between New Canaan and Stam ford, Conn.

title: No. 190 in the Draft Lottery Made Ceiling for July Call
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) A sequence number ceiling of 190 has been set on the draft call for July, Curtis Tarr, director of the Selective Serv ice System, said today.

title: Title Scores by Two Lengths and Returns $4 in Sprint at Belmont
description: The Claiborne Farm's Title registered an expected victory In the feature race at Belmont Park yesterday. A crowd of 22,811 bet the 3yearold daugh ter of Bold Ruler into even money favoritism in the seven furlong sprint for fillies and mares and she won by two lengths from C. V. Whitney's yes Sir.

title: Books of The Times
description: There are good reasons why Dietrich Bonhoeffer, the German theologian, ex ecuted by the Nazis just before the end of the war, is not a hero to the young. To them World War II is ancient history; fascism is not the menace it was to an older generation. The terms of his revolu tionary activity are not acceptable to them.

title: Wider Detection of Prenatal Flaws Expected to Spur Abortions
description: Prenatal identification of birth defects has reached the stage where an increasing num ber of mothers are expected to take advantage of liberalized abortion laws to avoid the birth of children with severe disabilities.

title: STOCKS SHOW DIP IN AMEX TRADING
description: Most issues on the American Stock Exchange finished lower yesterday in slow trading al though a rally in the last 90 minutes erased almost half of the earlier losses.

title: Harvey Services Monday
description: Memorial service for Chester D. Harvey, former head of the United States Information Agency news bureau at the United Nations, will be held Monday at 2 P.M. at the Church Center for the United Nations, 777 United Nations Plaza. Mr. Harvey, who retired last No vember after 16 years at the United Nations, died Wednes day night of lung cancer at his home, 19 Stuyvesant Oval.

title: Agriculture Department Recalls C.C.C. Certificates
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Agriculture Department announced today it is calling in $167million in Commodity Credit Corporation certificates of interest a month ahead of time as an economy measure.

title: $3 Tickets Go On Sale For $1 Million Drawing
description: ALBANY, June 12 (UPI) Sales began throughout the state today for the state lot tery's new $1million grand prize, the biggest in the world.

title: Music: Doc Severinsen
description: Johnny Carson might as well start looking for a new leader for the band on the Tonight show. Doc Sever insen, the trumpet player who has been conducting that band for the last two and a half years, has blended an 11piece orchestra and a sing ing and dancing group of nine girls and eight boys, the Brothers and the Sisters, in such a fastmoving, colorful bit of razzle dazzle that he can no longer be held down to second (or third) banana on anybody's show.

title: EASTMAN, DILLON EXPLORES MERGER
description: Preliminary contacts that ??ay lead to a merger have been made between Eastman Dillon, Union Securities & Co. and Homblower & WeeksHemphill, Noyes, two of Wall Street's leading brokerage houses.

title: New York Bank Elects
description: Arthur J. Quinn, president of the New York Bank for Sav ings, has been elected chairman of the executive committee of the board of directors of the Grand Union Company. He suc ceeds Lawrence C. Marshall, retired vice chairman, board of directors, the Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., who remains a director and a member of the executive committee at Grand ??

title: Race Issue Overriding as Vote in Newark Nears
description: NEWARK, June 12Inside the dimly lighted quarters of a social club at 100 Bloom field Avenue, Raymond Neste, 67 years old, sat deep in an easy chair, sweating in his shortsleeve shirt, a cigarette drooping out of one corner of his mouth.

title: Wife Pleads Not Guilty In the Killing of Steel Heir
description: FRESNO, Calif., June 12 (UPI)Mrs. Louise Thoresen, wife of William E. Thoresen 3d, the steel heir who turned their homes into arsenals, pleaded not guilty today to killing him with one of his own guns.

title: Chilly Breeze From Moscow
description: Moscow's three top leaders have underscored this week the chasm that separates the two superpowers, the United States and the Soviet Union. Thus Com munist party chief Brezhnev has emphasized that SovietAmerican differences are really deep; Presi dent Podgorny characterized relations as in a kind of frozen state, and Premier Kosygin attacked this country as the main source of international tension. To these unfriendly words, Moscow has now added an announcement that it is sending additional aid to North Vietnam.

title: Buffalo Strike Continues
description: BUFFALO, June 12 (AP)A strike by delivery truck helpers against The Buffalo Evening News entered its third day to day, and a spokesman for the newspaper said the possibilty of resuming publication today was ??.

title: Ottinger Seeks City Use Of Packaged Hospitals
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger charged yesterday that the Federal Government was keeping under wraps more than 2,500 selfcontained hos pital units that could be put to use immediately to ease the health crisis in the nation's cities.

title: Richardson, in New job, Faces Discontent in Ranks
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  Employes of the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare want Elliot L. Richardson, when he becomes Secretary of the department, to convene with them the meet ing that the outgoing Secretary, Robert H. Finch, missed be cause of illness.

title: TEXAS NINE ROUTS DELAWARE BY 124
description: OMAHA, June 12 (AP)Sec ondranked Texas scored five runs in the fourth inning on Lou Bagwell's basesloaded double and David Hall's two run homer to crush eighth ranked Delaware, 124, tonight in the opening game of the College World Series.

title: C.B.S. and N.B.C. Want PrimeTime Rule Dropped
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System and the National Broad casting Company petitioned the Federal Communications Com mission yesterday to reconsider its recent ruling that would force individual stations to broadcast more local shows and less network material dur ing prime evening hours.

title: Card of Thanks
description: ERNSTHenry. We wish to thank all our relatives and friends for their sympathy during our mourning for the late Henry Ernst. THE ERNST FAMILY

title: Amey's Designs: Not for Wallflowers
description: I've never had a crowd like this, said Ronald Amey, surveying his packed show room the other afternoon. I think it's curiosity. He was probably right. Store buyers who've been un nerved by the plunge of hemlines are searching everyhere for someone to lead them out of the wilder ness. Amey. who's been in business for 10 years (his company was known as BurkeAmey until he bought out his partner, James Burke, last year), is more appreciated outside New York than he is here. But buyers from Saks Fifth Ave nue, Bonwit Teller, Martha's and Sara Fredericks joined those from Texas and Wis consin to see what he was up to.

title: Mrs. Jones Paces British to 21 Lead Over U. S. in Wightman Cup Tennis
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 12The Wimbledon champion, Mrs. Ann Jones, made a senti mental return to Wightman Cup tennis play today and drove the British women into a 21 lead over the United States.

title: FREDERIC HAHN
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., June 12 Frederic DeG. Hahn, who retired in 1947 as president and treas urer of the C. W. Crane truck ing Company of New York City, died yeesterday at a nursing home in Morgan. He was 84 years old.

title: Table Tennis and Bowling on Wheels: Handicapped Athletes Open 14th Annual Games
Executive Changes
description: Sanford C. Bernstein has been named chairman and chief executive officer and Shepard D. Osherow, president and chief operating officer, Sanford D. Bernstein & Co., Inc., members of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Son to Mrs. D. M. Satlof
description: A son was born in Mount Sinai Hospital in Hartford to Dr. and Mrs. David M. Satlof of Bloomfield, Conn., on May 28. Mrs. Satlof is the former Miss Judith Ugelow, daugh ter of Mrs. Phillip R. Ugelow of New York and the late Mr. Ugelow. The child, whose fa ther is a physician in Hart ford, is named Phillip Ralph.

title: 2 SUSPECTS SEIZED IN VILLAGE SLAYING
description: Two men described by the police as escapees from a Rhode Island correctional institution were arrested separately yes terday as suspects in the mug ging murder of a retired teach er on University Place early Thursday morning.

title: Women's Federation Holds Congress to Be Apathetic
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., June 12 (AP)  The world's largest women's organization accused Congress today of apathy in the face of forces bent on destruction of our free way of life.

title: Sorensen Wins Endorsement in Utica
description: UTICA, N. Y., June 12Theo dore C. Sorensen wore a suit with a small hole in the seat of the trousers to this upstate city today, where he was prom ised support by the Oneida County Democratic organiza tion and Mayor Dominick Assaro.

title: 6 Die Amid Celebration Of Mexico Team Victory
description: MEXICO CITY, June 12 Mob jubilation, during which at least six persons were killed, greeted Mexico's qual ification for the quarterfinal round as the World Cup soc cer championship moved to day into the knockout phase.

title: Mayor's Political Puzzle
description: This happily was not a diffi cult decision, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday as he endorsed Charles E. Goodell for the Unit led States Senate.

title: Wade Wins Net Title
description: RYE, N. Y., June 12Joseph Wade of Berkshire, seeded No. 5, won the singles champion ship of the 39th annual Eastern Interscholastic tennis tourna ment at Manursing Island Club today, defeating Kenneth Dan iels of Landon School of Be thesda, Md., 86, 6.4, 36, 63. Daniels and John McNair won the doubles final and wrapped up the team championship for Landon.

title: RESERVE IS PLANNING MIAMI BRANCH BANK
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Federal Reserve Board said today it plans to set up branch bank in Miami to handle the rising flood of financial paper work in southern Florida.

title: In Memoriam
description: ABRAMOWITZDr. E. William. Cherished and everlasting memory of a loving and devoted husband and father who left us June 13, 1949. Rest In Peace.

title: Wounded Pilot Says He Welcomed Hijacker's Bullet
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) When is getting shot in the stomach the finest feeling in the world? Dale Hupe says when it means you have thwarted a hijacker's hanker ing to blow up the airliner you are piloting and the 57 persons aboard.

title: Gurney, Hulme and Oliver Snap Qualifying Record for CanAm
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ont., June 13The McLaren auto racing team, reconstituted 11 days after the death of Bruce Mc Laren, swept the first two starting positions today for to morrow's opening race of the 1970 CanadianAmerican Chal lenge Cup series.

title: U.N. Aide Warns of Need To Combat Urban Poverty
description: UNITED NATION, N.Y., June 13 (AP)A high United Nations official today predicted new confrontations soon un less the problems of over populated cities, poverty and disease were combatted vigor ously.

title: Connecticut Man Wounded After 6Hour Siege at House
description: BURLINGTON, Conn., June 13 (AP)A former Army cap tain who had held the state police at bay for six hours with a fusillade of bullets was wounded and captured around noon today when he finally emerged from his house.

title: Bridge
description: RUBBER bridge players, competing n for a stake and dependent to large extent on the luck of the deal, are notoriously superstitious. They worry about dealing with the deck which seems to be lucky, and ma neuver to occupy the lucky seats, thus implicitly rejecting the state ments of mere scientists who suggest that inanimate objects have no memory.

title: Stallworth Is Named Black Athlete of Year
description: Dave Stallworth of the New York Knicks has been voted Professional black ath lete of the year by the Asso ciation of Black Athletes.

title: France Will Lose Many of Her Trees As Traffic Hazards
description: PARIS, June 13 The tree lined roads and the shady squares that long have been a French hallmark have suc cumbed steadily to the require ments of the automobile.

title: JERSEY CITY MAYOR ASKS YOUTHS' HELP
description: JERSEY CITY, June 13 Mayor Thomas J. Whelan toured the ten le downtown section of the city today after asking a delegation of 14 Puerto Rican youths to help restore calm following three nights of sporadic disorders.

title: Fleet Wing Chicago Victor; Fast Hilarious Runs Third
description: CHICAGO, June 13 (AP) Fleet Wing, ridden by Jeff Anderson, closed strongly in the stretch today to defeat pacesetting American Victory in the Olympia Handicap at Arlington Park.

title: FARMHOUSE SAVED FOR SECOND TIME
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., June 13 For the second time in a month an 18thcentury Quaker farm house here has been saved from demolition while residents of the area try to decide whether it can be moved to new site and restored as museum.

title: Nixon Picks Panel to Find Causes of Campus Unrest
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 13President Nixon named ninemember commission today to explore the causes and con sequences of campus unrest and to recommend ways of as suring peaceful dissent.

title: 7CAR RACING PILEUP HOSPITALIZES PAIR
description: SYRACUSE, June 13 (AP) The 100mile latemodel stock car race was halted in the 68th lap today following a seven car pileup that hospitalized two drivers.

title: Twine Arounds For Cities
description: VINES have many vir tues for city gardens because they use the minimum amount of growing space and provide tremendous amounts of foli iage in a relatively short time.

title: Music: Sampler at Tully
description: Programs of unusual vocal music, a jazz concert, ballet films and chamber music make up an unlikely series, yet that is what is being presented at Alice Tully Hall in 11 days under the title Tully Hall Sampler.

title: Gadfly on the Left Needles His Peers
description: AREAL ESTATE man attacking profit grubbing and greed among his peers? One who says that some New York commercial buildings are put up just for the buck? Who is organizing a businessman's seminar to hear William Kunstler, Allen Ginsberg and a spokesman for homosexuals? Who has sunk $10,000 Into en OffBroadway play that offered nudity and a preachment against the Vietnam war? And who says, Yes, I'm on the Left.

title: A Brief Turn Backward in Motorized Time
description: JOHNSTOWN, N.Y.Last year's highway map in the glove compartment, as well as most of the clean, unfolded new maps from the service station, show about 15 miles of State Route 10 high up in the Adirondack Mountains as either unpaved or planned for improvement.

title: THE OPENING
description: THE CAGEThursday, The Playhouse, 357 West 48th Street, 7:30. The Barbwire Theater production of play by Rick Cluchey. Star ring Mr. Cluchey.

title: COLLEGES WARNED OF A TAX PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Colleges and universities that 4 plan to close temporarily this, fall to give their students and faculties free time to work in political campaigns will have to be careful just how they do it if they are not to run the risk of losing their tax  exempt status.

title: Education
description: Samuel Eliot Morison, the his torian, in appraising the tradi tional presentation of slavery and the Civil War to genera tions of young Americans, has described many of his colleagues as our evasive historians, our mufflers of great passionate is sues.

title: LOCAL ARMY ROLE WIDENED IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, June 13Re cent changes in the ruling pro vincial Revolutionary Commit tees of Communist China show continued gains by military men at the expense of those who were the earliest and most ardent supporters of the Maoist Cultural Revolution.

title: Crash Kills 5 in Texas
description: LAREDO, Tex. June 13 (AP) A car struck a culvert today six miles north of here, killing five persons and injuring five others. The dead were Julia Rijos, Elvira Torres, Concepei on Gonzalez, Sara Garcia and Concepelon Gonzalez.

title: Good Lord, It's Frodo Baggins
description: FRODO Baggins is alive and well and living it up on the campuses of the world. In case you haven't heard, Frodo, a mis chievous 3foot hobbit, is the hero of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings, an adult fairy tale that has been bigger than big with the col legiate set ever since the book's first appearance in 1956. And now United Artists, mindful of the booming youth market, has announced that Frodo will become a film figure.

title: Green's 3Run Clout Sparks 5Horner Attack as Athletics Beat Orioles, 107
description: BALTIMORE, June 13 (AP) Dick Green slammed a three run homer off Dave McNally and four Oakland teammates also connected tonight as the Athletics defeated the Baltimore Orioles. 107.

title: CREW OF SOYUZ 9 IN ORBIT 12TH DAY
description: MOSCOW, June 13 (UPI) Col. Andrian G. Nikolayev and Vitaly I. Sevanstyanov com pleted today the 12th day of their flight aboard the Soviet spacecraft Soyuz 9 in earth orbit.

title: Observer: Some Way to Run a Railroad
description: WASHINGTON, June 13Like most other people, I suppose, who live on the Penn Cen tral Railroad, I was terribly upset to hear that the Govern ment was going to use public moneyperhaps to the tune of $750 million  to guarantee loans that would save that great rail empire from collapse. Everybody knows what can happen to a great private en terprise once the Government inserts the entering wedge of the dollar.

title: OneParty Rule Growing In PostColonial Africa
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, June 13  Ten years after colo nial flags began coming down in Africa, threefourths of the continent's 345 million people live under oneparty political systems or military rule.

title: Sarah C. Nimitz Bay State Bride. Of F. C. Smith
description: WELLFLEET,. Mass., June 13In St. James the Fisher man Episcopal Chapel here this afternoon, Miss Sarah Catherine Nimitz, grand daughter of the late Fleet Adm. Chester W. Nimitz, commander in chief of the Pacific Fleet during World War II, was married to F. Curtis Smith, who was grad uated with her on May 30 from St. Lawrence Univer sity.

title: Santana to Skip Wimbledon
description: PARIS, June 13 (Reuters) Manuel Santana of Spain said today he would not play in the Wimbledon championships this year, joining Pancho Gonzales, who made a similar announce ment yesterday. Santana said he wanted to rest before the European Zone Section A Davis Cup final against Rumania or Yugoslavia July 17 to 19.

title: Dance
description: NEW YORK CITY BAL LET, through its dif ficulties with the Mu sicians' Union, be came the late, late show this season. It opened on May 19 and it closes tonight. It is unnecessary to stress the union difficulties the com pany found itself in. They are all part of an economic pat tern likely to erode the per forming arts in this country. The performing artsat least when performing at their besthave always proved deficit operations. So far we have expected the performing artists themselves to meet at least part of that deficit by accepting salaries far lower than they are worth.

title: Catherine H. Haight Wed to Stephan Petty
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., June 13 The Espiscopal Cathedral Church of the Nativity was the setting here today for the marriage of Miss Catherine Harper Haight to Stephan Miller Petty. The Very Rev. H. L. Whittemore Jr., dean of the Cathedral, performed the ceremony.

title: CHI CHENG BREAKS 2 WORLD RECORDS
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 13 (AP)Chi Cheng of Taiwan shattered two world records to day, clocking 10.1 seconds in the women's 100yard dash and 22.7 in the 220 in the Portland Rose Festival meet.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: The sustained high volume of retail sales suggests that the recession has not caught up with the consumer. There are complaints about a lag in business, but often this only means that gains are moder ate.

title: Quake Brings Gains To Peru With Loss
description: LIMA, Peru, June 13  While the human toll taken by the May 31 earthquake in Northern Peru may never be tabulated, the economic lossesand gainshave just about been itemized by econ omists.

title: Democratic Vote Recount Set in Carolina House Race
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 13 (AP)The State Democratic Ex ecutive Committee granted a re count request today after de claring official the vote in last Tuesday's Sixth Congressional District primary. A June 23 run off will follow the recount.

title: For Young Readers
description: The Beggar In the Blanket

title: A FEEBLE FIGARO PRESENTED BY MET
description: The Metropolitan Opera's Marriage of Figaro on Friday night was not an especially happy affair. Whatever quali ties the cast may have pos sessed were pretty well negated by the absence of a consistent musical and dramatic point of view and by a complete lack of strong direction.

title: Kathy Whitworth 2 Shots Ahead With a 73 for 213 in Title Golf
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 13 (AP)  Favored Kathy Whitworth withstood pressure applied by Shirley Englehorn and took twostroke lead today after 54 holes in the $30,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association championship.

title: With a Bow to Miners, It's High C Time In Central City
description: CENTRAL CITY, Colo.On that chilly April evening back in 1877, the barrooms in this mountain mining town were jammed. Oc casionally, an energetic rinkydink piano could be heard twanging above The din when there was a momentary lull in the goodnatured brawling. It was a typical early spring night of revelry for the rowdy town's gettingricherbythe shovelful citizens.

title: Leslie Hailand, T. G. Walker Jr. Are Married
description: LAKE FOREST, III., June 13The marriage of Miss Letlie Meacham Hailand, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Garfield Hailand Jr., to Thomas Glynn Walker Jr. took place in the First Pres byterian Church of Lake Forest this afternoon.

title: Mary O. Webb Is Bride Of David Gee Phillips
description: SHELBURNE, Vt., June 13 Miss Mary Olmsted Webb, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Derick Vanderbilt Webb of Shelburne Farms and a de scendant of Commodore Cor nelius Vanderbilt, was mar ried here this afternoon to David Gee Phillips, son of Mrs. William C. Phillips of Upper Montclair, N. J., and the late Mr. Phillips.

title: Geller of Midwood Takes P.S.A.L.'s Tennis Crowr
description: Steve Geller of Midwood de feated Dave Kiel of Van Buren, 61, 62, yesterday for the ten nis singles championship of the Public Schools Athletic League.

title: Penn Head Won't Live In President's House
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 13 Martin Meyerson, who will become president of the Uni versity of Perinsylvania Sept. 1, said today that rather than live in Penn's president's house, on the city's out skirts, he and his family would reside in the center of the city.

title: AGEE GETS HOMER
description: Before yesterday's game, Mike McQueen's primary prob lem was that he was the fifth man in a fourman starting ro tation.

title: Q:
description: Delight

title: Oberts Reach Quarterfinals In A.A.U. Handball Tourney
description: The topseeded team of Carl and Ruby Obert of the New York Athletic Club gained the quarterfinals of the National Amateur Athletic Union one wall handball championship yesterday. They beat Joe La Malfa and Joe Rispoli of the Samuel Field Young Men's He brew Association, 2112, 217, at the Municipal Courts in Coney Island.

title: World Cup Soccer
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, June 13Condemned to play an ebullient West Germany on the heights and in the heat of Leon in tomorrow's quarterfinals of the World Cup soccer, England had best seek hope in history. Over a period of 69 years, West Ger many has beaten England only oncetwo years ago in a dull and unimportant friendly game in Hanover. One need hardly remind you that in the 1966 World Cup, England beat West Germany, 42, after extra time in the final.

title: Samuels Offers HealthCare Program
description: YONKERS, June 13Howard J. Samuels today proposed an eightpoint health care program as an antidote to the state's crazy quilt approach to pro viding medical assistance that he said unduly taxed middle class wageearners and elderly Inersons living on fixed incomes.

title: MRS. KING EXCELS
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 13It was a day to remember for Mrs. Billie Jean King.

title: Man Shoots at Detective With the Policeman's Gun
description: A Bronx man assaulted a New York police detective making a routine inquiry in an apartment building last night, threw the detective down a flight of stairs, robbed him of his gun and wristwatch and then fired two shots at the policeman using the stolen gun, the police said. Both shots missed.

title: Brewers Sin Top Draftee
description: MILWAUKEE, June 13 (AP) The Milwaukee Brewers to day signed Darrell Porter of Oklahoma City, a catcher, their No. 1 choice in the recent free agent draft for what General Manager Marvin Milkes de scribed as an undisclosed but substantial bonus.

title: ELIZABETH REVIEWS HOUSEHOLD TROOPS
description: LONDON, June 13 (UPI) Riding sidesaddle on a prancing black horse, Queen Elizabeth today reviewed her household troops in Britain's most color ful military spectacle.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Our National Forests: Will the Conflicts Ever Be Settled?
description: SOME of the largest, most beautiful and perhaps least understood of this country's recreational re sources are its national forests. Spread across the nation In 154 areas comprising 187 million acres, the for ests, mountain ranges, groves of maple, oak, fire and pine, vales of ash, poplar and birch and huge stands of giant redwoods endow the visitor with a feel ing of awesome serenity, a feeling rare ly experienced in a recreational area.

title: MAYER, ROSS REACH STATE TENNIS FINAL
description: Sandy Mayer, the 18yearold power hitter from Woodmere, I.. I., defeated topseeded Jon Buchman of Great Neck, I.. I., 5.7, 86, 6.4, in the semifinals of the New York State clay court tennis championship yes terday at the North Shore Ten nis and Racquets Club in Bay side, Queens.

title: LAOTIANS REPORT SARAVANE RETAKEN
description: VIENTIANE LAOS, June 13 (Agence FrancePresse)  Two patrols of proGovernment guer rillas yesterday entered de serted Saravane, the southern Laotian town that North Viet namese and Pathet Lao troops took on Tuesday, an informed course said here today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Baseball's 41st AllStar Game will be played one month from today in Cincin nati, and something new has been added this year: the game has been given back to the fans.

title: Thieu Asserts U.S. Will Not Pull Out For Several Year
description: PARIS, June 13  President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam predicted today that his forces would be engaged in a long war in Cambodia and that American troops would re main in his own country for several years more.

title: A PACKED GARDEN HEARS TOM JONES
description: There was, as anyone could see, a good representation of males among the 22,000 people who packed Madison Square Garden on Friday night. But when Tom Jones appeared, it was evident from the eruption of shrill, young female squeals who had taken them there.

title: CAPITAL WILL GET IVY LEAGUE POLICE
description: As a result of a oneman re cruiting drive by a New York police sergeant, the police in Washington expect that by September about 50 graduates of Ivy League colleges such as Harvard and Yale will be pounding a beat in the capital.

title: Fort Marcy Sets Mark at Belmont
description: Fort Marcy, the indestructi ble, contributed a record smashing performance in win ning the $57,400 Bowling Green Handicap at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Polluted California Air Turns Stone Swan Into a Dirty Bird
description: SANDS POINT, L. I.Ecolo gists could find a polluted swan here an interesting sub ject for a whodunit. The swan never swam in polluted waters, nor did an oil slick mar its snowy plumage. It was never near a garbage dump, an aban doned car lot, or a sewage dis posal plant. Nor could one say it ever really breathed polluted air.

title: Our Flag Is Still There
description: Thirty years ago today the conquering armies of the most powerful military dictatorship the world had ever known were sweeping through Western Europe under the hacked cross and bloodred banner of Nazi Ger many. The flags of Norway, Denmark and the low countries had already been struck. On this very day in 1940 the swastika was for the first time unfurled atop the Eiffel Tower. The Battle of Britain was about to begin.

title: Gov. Kirk's Daughter, Katharine, Wed to Alexander M. Crenshaw
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., June 13  Miss Katharine Gilmer Kirk, daughter of Gov. Claude Roy Kirk Jr., of Florida, and Mrs. Edmund Richardson Mc David of New York, was mar ried here this evening to Alexander Mann Crenshaw, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mc Carthy Crenshaw. Mr. Cren shaw is a partner in the Jacksonville law firm of Glickstein, Crenshaw, Glick stein, Fav & Allen.

title: 2 Track Officials Are Hurt in Crash At Le Mans Race
description: LE MANS, France, Sunday, June 14The 24hour Le Mans race started yesterday without the Le Mans start. It was ap parent today that it would fin ish differently, too.

title: It began in an obscure
description: For obvious reasons, archeology has far less to contribute to an understanding of the New Testament than of the Old. The Old Testament contains the history of a nation, and the events it describes happened on a comparatively large stage. But the gospels of the New Testament deal only with a small group of working class people who spent most of their lives in an obscure corner of a re mote Roman province.

title: Miss Thatcher Becomes Bride Of Navy Ensign
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 13  Miss Patricia Louise Thatcher and Ens. John Stephen Garvan 3d, U.S.N.R., were married here this after noon in St. Barnabas Episco pal Church by the Rev. Har old Bassage.

title: CONSPIRACY CASE TO BE TRIED AGAIN
description: Ernest Gallishaw, who was acquitted in the 1966 fatal shooting of a 10yearold boy during racial violence in Brook lyn and was found guilty two years later of supplying a ma chine gun to bank robbers, had his conviction reversed last week.

title: Prince Charles and Sister To Visit Capital July 16
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) Plans for next month's three day visit of Prince Charles of Britain and his sister, Princess Anne, were announced today by the White House.

title: Red Sox Triumph Over Twins, 6 to 4, With 4 Runs in 6th
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 13  Billy Conigliaro's tworun single with two out in the sixth inning capped a fourrun out burst today and the Boston Red Sox rallied for a 64 victory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Toyota Recalls New Cars
description: TOKYO, June 13 (Reuters) The Toyota Motor Company has asked its dealers around the world to recall its Corona Mark II models because of defective fuel line. A Toyota spokesman said today that 60, 260 of the cars manufactured and sold since the beginning of this year were defective. He said that gas leaks between the tank and carburator apparently had originated from vibrations.

title: KEOGH TRIUMPHS IN SCHOOL 2MILE
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N. J. June 13Mike Keogh of Essex Catholic, Ed Jones of Lincoln and Gary Proto of Scotch Plains, Eastern champions, won New Jersey scholastic track and field titles today in an all group championship meet at the Highland Park High School field.

title: Grant Took a Vacation And a Resort Was Born
description: ALEXANDRIA BAY, N. Y.When a weary executive or working man decides to take a quiet fishing trip so as to get away from it all, he hardly expects or wants to become a Pied Piper. But that is bound to be the effect if the person happens to be President of the United States. In 1872, Ulysses S. Grant visited the then little known Thousand Islands area in the St. Lawrence River, and there has hardly been an unbusy moment here since.

title: U.S. Nullifies Mississippi Law Imperiling Head Start Program
description: WASHINGTON, June 13In a littlenoticed technical step, the Nixon Administration pre vented Mississippi this week from destroying the whole Head Start program in the state.

title: Brewster Tells Friendly but Questioning Yale Alumni He Cannot Be Personally Neutral on Public Issues
description: NEW HAVEN, June 13King man Brewster Jr., the president of Yale University, told alumni at an unusual reunion session today that he could not remain personally neutral on public issues of great importance to students.

title: Governor Reiterates Plan For Ideas Clearinghouse
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., June 13Governor Rockefeller has reiterated his proposal of a permanent clearinghouse of ideas to provide communica tion between students and gov ernment. He outlined it at commencement exercises at the State University Agricultural and Technical College here yes terday.

title: MANILA TO STRESS FAMILY PLANNING
description: MANILA, June 13  With a population that threatens to double in 20 years, the Phil ippines has decided to use her schools to teach family plan ning.

title: Alice Ann Kany To Wed July 18
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 13Mr. and Mrs. Howard L. Kany have made known the engagement and approaching marriage of their daughter, Miss Alice Ann Kany, to Edward Macksoud Jr. of Woodstock, Vt. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Macksoud of Ridgewood, N. J., and Woodstock.

title: Powell Says Britain Is Under Attack From Within by Forces Aiming at Destruction of the Nation
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, June 13Enoch Powell, the right wing Conservative, charged to night that Britain was under attack from within by forces which aim at the actual destruc tion of our nation

title: Barbara Jo Oppenheim Is a Bride
description: Miss Barbara Jo Oppenheim and Geoffrey Case Berresford, teachers at the Collegiate School, were married here yesterday at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Jay Oppenheim 3d. The ceremony was per formed by the Rev. Dr. Hugh McCandless of the Epiphany Episcopal church.

title: Federal Housing Projects Stir Strong Opposition Across U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 13  When officials in Indianapolis proudly announced a few days ago that the city, unlike others across the country, had ex perienced no local opposition to the Operation Breakthrough housing program, one of the newspapers immediately stirred some up.

title: Chess
description: THE veteran master Arnold Denker captured first place during the recent finals of the Manhattan Chess Club by, scoring 81 in the 11man round robin.

title: Nuptials Held For Miss Cox
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., June 13Miss Ella Cox was married here this afternoon to Michael Blakesly Bracy in Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church. The bride's uncle, the Rev. Lewis Morris Cox, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Expos Sign First Baseman
description: MONTREAL, June 13 (AP) Jim Fanning, general manager of Montreal Expos, announced today the signing of Randolph Viefhaus, an 18yearold first baseman. He was the Expos' third choice in last week's free agent draft.

title: Politics: McCarthy, O'Dwyer and Sorensen Attack Ottinger for Spending on TV
description: BUFFALO, June 13In their first campaign debate televised to an upstate audience, the foul men seeking the Democratic nomination for Senator strucli their familiar campaign themes and then three of them turned on the fourth  Representativc Richard L. Ottinger.

title: Nancy Rogers Bride in Darien Of Elias Baker
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 13 Miss Nancy Howell Rogers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Harwood Rogers, was married here this after noon to Lieut. Elias Bloxom Baker, U. S. A., son of Mrs. Marjorie Credo Baker of Princeton, N. J., and Elias Bloxom Baker Jr. of New York and Little Silver, N. J. The Rev. Robert Nelson Back performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Episcopal Church.

title: 1 KILLED, 5 WOUNDED IN VILLAGE SHOOTING
description: Six men were shot, one fatal ly, when they went to the aid of a woman who reportedly was the victim of an attempted rape in the hallway of an East Vil lage tenement early yesterday morning.

title: Says Campaign Chairman Steve Smith: Goldilocks may not be the most exciting fellow in town but he's the only one who can win this year
description: If we didn't have a Steve Smith, the party would have to invent one. A NEW YORK DEMOCRAT.

title: TAIWAN CURBING A RELIGIOUS FEAST
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 13  One of Taipei's oldest sections, the upper west side along the Tanshul River, has long been proud of its reputation for holding the city's biggest and noisiest pai pai, or annual festival.

title: Foreign Affairs: The RevolutionEaters
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R.Ever since seventeenth century astrono mers confirmed that the earth revolved around the sun, po litical scientists have been in creasingly aware that each revolution leads eventually to counterrevolution. This dis quieting truth seems to be ig nored by contemporary student revolutionists, above all in the United States, who are more concerned with the act of re volting than with seeking pre cise coals.

title: Seattle Mass Transit Proposal Pleases Everybody but Voters
description: SEATTLEVoters of Se attle and its suburbs, forming the Municipality of Metropoli tan Seattle, have rejected, for the second time in about two years, and ambitious mass transit proposal that had everything going for it except the people.

title: 2 Short Parades Here Mark Flag Day Early
description: Groups in Queens and Man hattan celebrated Flag Day one day early yesterday by staging short parades on Queens Boulevard and on Third Avenue.

title: Creole capers
description: Although creole cookery is histori cally a blend of French, Spanish and African cuisine, the most typi cal creole dishes, which use to matoes and green peppers, tend more toward the last two. Until a decade or so ago, green peppers were all but unknown in France. The shrimp creole on this page has been given an extra Spanish flavor with the addition of capers, not a common ingredient in Louisiana, where creole dishes originated.

title: CAROLINA PARENTS SPLIT ON SCHOOLS
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 13 Sure, there's going to be some adjustment, but this is what we have in every area of life.

title: Numata Outpoints Korean
description: TOMAKOMAI, Japan, June 13 (AP)  Yoshiaki Numata of Japan, weighing 132 pounds, outpointed PokChong Lee, 134, from South Korea, in a 10 round boot tonight. Numata floored his opponent for an 8count in the eighth round.

title: The Summation
description: MidJune arrives with a richness and an abundance that makes the restless doings of people seem trivial by comparison. The world is lush with the fullblown green leaf, chlorophyll performing the basic chemistry of food production without clamor or fume and fuss. The air is full of the fragrances of roses and newcut grass, growth and blossoming come to perfection. Young robins and young thrashers are on the wing, the egg come to its fruition, another generation of life, another song for those who listen.

title: A DoortoDoor Search Seeks Lead Poisoning in Hunts Point
description: Papo Rodriguez, who is 5 years old and weighs 39 pounds, watched with eyes as big as quarters as the doctor inserted the needle in his arm.

title: Ontario Lists Forest Fires
description: TORONTO, June 13 (AP) The Ontario Ministry of Lands and Forests reported today that 45 forest fires were burning in the province, 19 of them in the Sioux Lookout district. It said no communities were in im mediate danger.

title: Associated Harvard Alumni Elect Six New Directors
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 13 (AP)Henry E. Russell, presi dent, of the Associated Harvard Alumni, has announced the election of six directors.

title: Captain Nash, $14, Wins Feature at Suffolk Downs
description: BOSTON, June 13 (AP) Crown Stable's Captain Nash came front next to last place in a field of eight and won the $20,000 Stars and Stripes Han dicap today at Suffolk Downs.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 125 book stores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the right hand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The American Thread Company has taken an $3 million, longterm lease on a fourstory building being erected for use as its head quarters in High Ridge Park, an office development off Exit 35 of the Merritt Park way in Stamford. Conn.

title: 14TH DAY OF RAIDING BY ISRAEL REPORTED
description: TEL AVIV, June 13 (Reuters)  Israeli jets today completed, two weeks of nearly roundthe clock bombings of Egyptian military positions on the Suez Canal with intermittent attacks throughout the day, a military spokesman said. All planes were reported to have returned safely from today's missions.

title: A Contempt Order Fought by Student In New Hampshire
description: DURHAM, N. H., June 13 Mark Wefers, the student presi dent at the University of New Hampshire, will file an appeal in the United States Circuit Court of Appeals next week in an attempt to overturn a fine of $500 or 20 days in jail for contempt of court.

title: Music
description: SO the Beatles have broken up. Judging by their latest album, Let It Be, it's about time. This is not to denigrate their total achievement: it's a truism that the Beatles have been the most imaginative and most influential of all rock groups. But it seems there comes a time in the progress of any artistic groupwhether it be a theater company, a movie co operative or a rock bandwhen it reaches some sort of creative impasse and has to decide whether to rethink its purpose and work out a new direc tion for itself, or split up.

title: If All Else Fails, Firms Merge
description: The tidal wave of red ink that has engulfed large portions of the securities industry for the last year is producing one of the largest retrenchment pro grams in its history.

title: Point of View
description: DECEMBER will be the 10th anniversary of the adoption of a new zoning resolution in New York. This provides a good vantage point from which to examine and reevaluate it. What in the new zoning is good, what is bad? What has worked and what has not? Above all, what needs to be modified or changed?

title: THE BIG TEN ON BROADWAY
News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, JUNE 14, 1970

title: Economic Indicators
description: WEEKLY COMPARISONS

title: Thomas Golf Purse Raised
description: Memphis, June 13 (AP)The Danny Thomas Memphis open golf tournament will sweeten its payoff purse to $175,000 next year, a $25,000 increase. Vernon Bell, the general chair man said today.

title: Marion C. Eells Becomes Bride Of Peter Schade
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J., June 13Miss Marion Coffin Eells was married here this aftek noon to Peter Arthur Schade, a graduate student in elec tronic engineering at the University of Maryland.

title: The World
description: AMMAN, Jordan  After five days of fighting in which scores of persons were reported to have been killed and wounded. King Hussein of Jordan yielded once again last week to the Arab guerrillas he harbors in his country.

title: SPAIN ADVANCES IN ZONAL TENNIS
description: PARIS, June 13 (Reuters) Spain qualified today for the Davis Cup European Zone sec tion A final with a doubles vic tory that gave it a 30 lead over France in the fivematch series.

title: Prefab Wishing Well
description: Standing four feet high, and constructed of red wood, the decorative wishing well shown at right is designed so that water flows continuously from the bucket. The same water is recirculat ed, so no plumbing hook ups are required. Colored lighting provides a pleas ant accent at night, and the well can be installed indoors or outdoors. Wishing Well, $79.95. (Little Giant Pump Com pany, 38101 Tulsa Street, Oklahoma City, Okla. 73112)

title: AIRLINE CANCELS CREDIT WITH CITY
description: American Airlines has can celed credit cards issued to 15 city agencies because of unpaid bills by city personnel totaling almost $30.000.

title: Music in Czechoslovakia
description: PRAGUE. SMILING through her tears, Prague has been celebrating her 25th Music Festival, an event initiated in a period of peace and liberty . . . one of two brief ones I have known in my life, a 40yearold paint er remarked.

title: Astros Obtain Cards' Culver
description: ST. LOUIS, June 13 (AP) The St. Louis Cardinals today traded George Culver, a right handed pitcher, to the Houston Astros for Leon McFadden, an infielder, and Jim Beauchamp, an outfielder.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayFiveclub auto meet, sponsored by PackardNew York, at Flushing Meadow Park, Queens. Also participating are Greater New York Region of A.A.C.A., Studebaker Driver's Club, Hudson  Essex  Terraplane Club and CadillacLaSalle Club. Judging starts at 11:30 A.M.

title: Humphrey in Senate Race; Leaves Door Ajar for '72
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 13 Hubert H. Humphrey announced his candidacy for the United States Senate today.

title: In 1651 It Was Jove & Calisto & Diana &...
description: GLYNDEBOURNE, Eng. LIKE any opera house worth its salt, Glynde bourne occasionally feels the need to ex pand its repertory. The ques tion is how. The rich seams of Monteverdi and Handel have already been tapped, and new works calculated to appeal to the rather se date, wellupholstered audi ences which assemble in George Christie's Arcadia in the Sussex Downs are dis tinctly few (though later this season a speciallycommis sloned opera, The Rising of the Moon, by Nicholas Maw, will have its first per formance).

title: Miss Bettye F. Carter Married To Robert Turner Freeman 3d
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., June 13  Miss Bettye Frances Carter, daughter of Mayor and Mrs. Matthew G. Carter, was married here today to Robert Turner Freeman 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Freeman Jr. of Washington. The Rev. William H. Gray 3d per formed the ceremony in the Union Baptist Church.

title: Once Upon a Time A Fable Of Student Power
description: ONCE upon a time in the City of New York civilized life very nearly came to an end. The streets were covered with dirt, and there was no one to tidy them. The air and rivers were polluted, and no one could cleanse them. The schools were rundown, and no one believed in them. Each day brought a new strike, and each strike brought new hardships. Crime and strife and dis order and rudeness were to be found everywhere. The young fought the old. The workers fought the students. The whites fought the blacks. The city was bankrupt.

title: DEMOCRATS UNITE IN WISCONSIN RACE
description: MILWAUKEE, June 13  With the stakes higher than usual. Wisconsin Democrats al ready are showing an unusual display of unity in their cam paign to win back the gov ernorship in November.

title: At Pennsy: No Calm After Storm
description: The upheaval at the Penn Central Company last week posed some questions of major importance for Wall Street and Washington, as well as for the railroad, its shippers and more than 100,000 commuters. Some of them got answers in a hurry; the answers to others may be years in forthcoming.

title: GIRL, 13, CAPTURES WHEELCHAIR TRIAL
description: A 13yearold Phoenix, Ariz., schoolgirl, paralyzed for the last six years from the chest clown by a case of measles, posted the fastest time in the 60yard clash qualifying heats yesterday at the 14th National Wheelchair Athletic Champion ships.

title: FOR THIS WEEK
description: Where grass is growing under shade trees, prune branches to thin them and let more light through. . . . Continue regular fruit tree spray program and follow package directions carefully. . . . Malathion will control the inch worms and canker worms on trees. . . . Try dicamba to con trol wood sorrel where a problem. . . . Remove faded flowers from peren nials that have bloomed; cut stalks of spent delphinium spikes to the ground.

title: Ford Clan Honors Sheila at Her Debut
description: DETROIT, June 13In the tradition of all granddaugh ters and greatgranddaugh ters of the late Henry Ford, Miss Sheila Ford made her formal bow to society last night in a pretty but modest, as Ford parties go, pinkand purple party for family and friends on the rolling lawn of her home in Grosse Pointe Shores.

title: Boston Paper Raises Price
description: BOSTON, June 13 (AP)The Herald Traveler announced to day that it was raising its price by 5 cents to 15 cents a copy, effective Monday. Increased labor costs as a result of recent contract negotiations and set tlements, plus higher charges for newsprint and other vital production supplies make this price adjustment necessary, the newspaper said.

title: Mantle Helps Miami Beach Make Pitch For Young
description: MIAMI BEACHIt could happen only in the summertime. A young man, a guest at an oceanfront hotel, scratched his leg while in the pool area and asked the desk clerk to recommend a physi cian. There was one who leased of fices on the hotel's mezzanine, and the youth was directed there.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Biblical assurance that ye shall have the poor always with you has never ruffled Americans, who took it for granted that the Bible didn't mean right in your own neigh borhood. But recently the asser tion has been raised that the Constitution protects the rights of poor people to acquire living space in every community, and when the Supreme Court agreed last week to hear a case that could bolster this claim, the ac tion caused an uneasy stir.

title: BOMBERS WIN, 94, ON FIVERUN BURST
description: KANSAS CITY, June 13The New York Yankees, believing more and more in their chances of catching the Baltmore Orioles for the leadership of the American Leagues Eastern Division, kept rolling tonight.

title: Miss Karen Schnitzler Is Married
description: Miss Karen Elizabeth Schnitzler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. August R. Schnitz ler or Orange, N. J., was mar ried here yesterday to Rupert Hitzig, son of Dr. William M. Hitzig and Mrs. Candis Hall Hitzig, both of New York and Bearsville, N. Y. The cere mony was performed at St. Clement's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Eugene Monick.

description: The Stunt Man
