description: Good Luck, Miss Wyckoff

title: Druggists Meet In Monticello
description: About 1,000 New York State pharmacists are ex pected to attend the 92d annual convention of the Pharmaceutical Society of the State of New York which is starting today at the Laurels Hotel and Country Club in Monticello, N. Y. The conven tion will continue to Friday.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THE American Place Theater which, in the span of six seasons at St. Clement's Church, has become a significant force in the encouragement and development of native playwrights, is opening its 197071 campaign with one of its old friends.

title: Ore Carrier Is in Erie, Pa., for Stretching
description: ERIE, Pa., June 13An odd looking 185foot craft all head and tail and no body at allthat has stirred atten tion as she moved up the St. Lawrence River, arrived here this morning for a stretch job.

title: Newport Sail Is Lengthened
description: The NewportBermuda yacht race that will begin Saturday will be longer than before be cause of a change in the course, possibly keener than ever for firsttofinish honors because of larger and faster boats and probably including more wind ward work than usual. The scheduled starters number 153, but, as in all distance events, there will be some withdrawals.

title: Anniversaries
description: JOBLINGizelle and Manny celebrating our 50th wedding annivensary. Acknowledge with warm appreciation many congratulatory messages and contributions to Hadassah.

title: Black Insurgent Who Won Berkeley Race Is an Outspoken Radical
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 13 In the wee hours of primary night, when Ronald V. Dellums went before his supporters to claim victory, he greeted them with a clenchedfist salute.

title: Quiz No. 99
description: During the recent Zagreb, Yugoslavia, International, the position below oc curred in a Ruy Lopez. Bobby Fischer, eighttime United States champion was paired with Svetozar Gligoric, 11time Yugoslav titleholder. Fischer was to play. With one good move, Fischer forces his opponent to resign. What is it?

title: 12.000 in Antitreaty Rallies
description: TOKYO, June 13 (Reuters) About 12,000 Japanese partici pated in protests here today against the United StatesJapa nese security treaty, which is scheduled to be extended auto matically when its initial 10 year term ends on June 22. The demonstrations were generally orderly.

title: Alabama County Ordered to Integrate
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 13Three Federal judges, act ing under the mandates of re cent desegregation decisions, reluctantly ordered a rural Ala bama county yesterday to inte grate its schools completely and predicted that the order would result in complete reseg regation.

title: Television
description: THE prospect of television transmitted over cables directly to the home, rather than over the air, continues to keep the communications world agog. Technically, however, a socalled wired country is not going to be achieved overnight, and meantime the economic, legal and cultural potentials of cable TV are so vastas has been noted for something like 10 yearsthat it takes something on the order of an elec tronic scorecard to keep up with the changing situation.

title: Income Gains Reported in Virginia
description: RICHMOND, June 13Aft er a decade of nearly un interrupted growth, Vir ginia's per capita income is higher than that of any other state in the Southeast with the exception of Florida.

title: Engagements
description: BLACKSBERGBERLIN. Mr. and Mrs. Max Berlin of 1040 Park Ave, NYC are pleased to announce the engagement of their daughter Gail Joyce to Ronald Blacksberg.

title: Is Patton a Lie?
description: PATTON opens with a shot of an American flag that fills the en tire screen. George C. Scott, be ginning his remarkable incarna tion of the late general, strides into the picture, snaps to attention and delivers firm salute. The camera moves in for lingering closeups of his insignia, his rows of medals, his ivoryhandled revolv ers. The movie ends with a view of Scott from behind, lumbering off across a bar ren landscape in northern Europe on a walk with his cowardly pet mastiff. He is walking past a windmill. In between these two imagesPatton as American god of war, Patton as Don Quixote fall three hours and some minutes of epic, harrowing and ultimately infuri ating film.

title: Campbell Luke Graham Weds Christie Krementz in Jersey
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J., June 13Miss Christie Krementz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Martin Krementz Jr., was married in St. Peter's Episcopal Church here this afternoon to Campbell Luke Graham, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Calvin Graham of Bed ford, N.Y.

title: Coins
description: NUMISMATISTS inter ested in history and art will have plenty of opportunity to pur sue their studies at the American Numismatic Asso ciation's annual convention in St. Louis, Aug. 18 through 22. Committees in charge of the 79th anniver sary show have arranged numerous tours and lectures on the culture of that city, known as The Gateway to the West

title: Harvard Oarsmen Sweep Yale for Fourth Year in a Row on Thames River
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., June 13It was the same old story on the Thames today as Har vard dominated Yale in the continuation of their ancient crew rivalry, which was begun in 1852 on New Hampshire's Lake Winnepesaukee as a sum mer resort attraction.

title: Susan Overton Smith Married To Ens. Eric Vogt, Harvard '70
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., June 13  In Trinity Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Susan Overton Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Burr Smith of Fair field, was married to Ens. Eric Edwards Vogt, U.S.N., by the Rev. Francis X. Cheney.

title: Biological Pest Control to Be Used at 7 Airports
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI) Seven civilian and military airports in the East will be treated with a biological insect control agent this month as part of a Government shift away from the use of pesticides at airports, the Agriculture Depart ment has announced.

title: Washington Crew Takes I.R.A. Title
description: SYRACUSE, June 13The University of Washington's var sity crew burst the Pennsyl vania balloon today to win the Varsity Challenge Cup at the Intercollegiate Rowing Associa tion regatta on Onondaga Lake.

title: Plebiscite on Ostpolitik
description: Three state elections in West Germany today have been turned into a referendum on Chancellor Brandt's Eastern European policy. The results could determine the fate of his Government.

title: Reutemann's Time Is Best In Rhine Trophy Auto Trials
description: HOCKENHEIM, Germany, June 13 (UPI)  Caring Reute mann of Argentina, driving a whiteandyellow Brabham Ford, attained the fastest time today in qualifications for tomorrow's 125mile Rhine Trophy Formula Two auto race.

title: Miss Berguido To Be a Bride
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., June 13 The engagement of Miss Jill Berguido to John Kay Clement 3d, son of Mrs. Al fred Reeves Hunter Jr. and the late Henry Laussat Geye lin Clement, has been an nounced by the prospective bride's mother, Mrs. Carlos Berguido Jr. A wedding in the autumn is planned.

title: Leonora Prowell Wed To Bernard Meusnier
description: Miss Leonora Pickering Prowell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Pickering Pro well of New York and Had lyme, Conn., was married in St. James' Episcopal Church here yesterday afternoon to Bernard Jacques Raymond Meusnier, a film producer in Paris, where the bride is a fashion model. Canon Wil liam J. Chase performed the ceremony.

title: SENATORS DOWN WHITE SOX, 12 TO 7
description: CHICAGO, June 13 (AP) The Washington Senators slammed five home runs, in Frank Howard and Mike Ep stein in the fourth inning on the way to a 127 uphill victory over the Chicago White Sox today.

title: Plate Umpire Calls a Balk So Pitcher Knocks Him Out
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 13 (UPI)Greg Arnold, a pitcher for the DallasFort Worth Spur of the Texas League rushed to the plate and knocked Nick Emeterio, the umpire, uncon scious tonight after the arbiter called a balk.

title: Son to Mrs. Canestrino
description: OAKLAND, N. J., June 13 A son was born on Thurs day to Mr. and Mrs. Peter J. Canestrino in Presbyterian Hospital in New York. Mrs. Canestrino is the former Miss Patricia Milkon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey J. E. Milkon of Franklin Lakes. Mr. Milkon is president and chairman of the City National Bank of Hackensack and Lit tle Ferry, where Mr. Canes trino is an assistant cashier. The child has been named Richard Anthony.

title: TEST IS DISCOVERED FORTHYROID CANCER
description: ST. LOUIS, June 13 (AP)  Scientists from research centers in Boston and Houston have developed a technique to identify at an early stage an unusual form of cancer of the thyroid gland, it was announced yesterday.

title: Mt. Vernon Officials Cleared Of Black Panther Charge
description: A Federal judge dismissed an action yesterday against Mount Vernon city officials charging them with interfering with the Black Panther party's distribu tion of its newspaper.

title: Kathryn I. Wanderer Bride of Teacher
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 13Miss Kathryn Joan Wan derer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth H. Wanderer, was married here this after noon to Roger Nye Chapman, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. Nye Chapman of Englewood, Fla.

title: Card of Thanks
description: EDLESDr Allen I. We are deeply apprecia tive of the kind expressions of sympathy and comfort on the loss of our beloved husband and father, Dr. Allen I. Edles.

title: Soviet Trawler Off Limits
description: TOKYO, June 13 (AP)A 2,000ton Soviet trawler was sighted last Monday fishing in an area of the Sea of Japan that was put off limits June for three months to conserve fish resources, the Shimane pre fectural government said to day. It said Tokyo has been asked to protest to the Soviet Government.

title: Letters
description: INQUEST AND THE ROSENBERGS

title: Miss Niebling Jersey Bride
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., June 13Miss Sarah Lee Niebling. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter W. Niebling, was mar ried here this afternoon to Robert Cornish Krebs, son of Mr. and Mrs. William D. Krebs of Potsdam, N. Y. The Rev. Dr. Herbert H. Cooper performed the ceremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: REV. A. A. ALLEN, EVANGELIST, DIES
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 13 (UPI)The Rev. A. A. Allen, the evangelist and selfproclaimed faith healer, was found dead in a hotel room here Thursday. He was 59 years old.

title: You Are Looking at a Stage Face
description: I ALMOST forgot. All season long I've been meaning to pick a bone with William Goldman, author of The Season, a book I liked ex cept for one little patch of slander. Mr. Goldman claims that there are such things as critics' darlings, creatures who are always overpraised, overpowering ly, regardless of the caliber of their work. He lists a few of them: Sandy Dennis, Carol Channing, Mary Martin, Beatrice Lillie. And then he adds:

title: CANDIDATES LIST CAMPAIGN COSTS
description: With the June 23 primary little more than a week away, the campaign for the Demo cratic nomination for Gover nor has cost the backers of Arthur J. Goldberg an esti mated total of $333,000 and the Howard J. Samuels organi zation, at least $340,000, ac cording to interim figures made public yesterday.

title: Miss Leahy Married
description: FORT MEADE, Md., June 13Miss Margaret Pennell Leahy was married at the Main Post Chapel this morn ing to Dr. James Watts Vis tola, an attending urologist at Roosevelt Hospital in New York, where the bride makes her home.

title: Pop
description: STEPPENWOLF LIVE: Steppenwolf (Dunhill DSD 50075). IRON BUT TERFLY LIVE: Iron Butterfly (Atco SD 33318). Steppenwolf and Iron Butter fly are highpowered groups who produce the kind of acoustical energy that is best experienced live. For the heavy rock freaks, then, these disks, recorded live at concerts in 1969 and 1970, will be particularly valuable. Atlantic and Dunhill have managed the difficult task of preserving the electric ambi ance of living rock concerts, although, obviously, stereo playback systems will have to be run at full power to produce an effective simula tion of the real thing.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: THE stock market found a bottom toward the end May, and now the recessionary economy may be on the verge of reaching its trough.

title: Science
description: Sitting in a secluded part of the campus, the young couple had been holding hands for some time, talking quietly. Suddenly one of them said: Let's match cards!

title: Nixon Flies to Bahamas
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 13 After spending the morning working at his Key Biscayne compound, mostly on a forth coming message concerning the economy, Mr. Nixon left by heli copter for Grand Cay Island in the Bahamas. He was expected to return to Florida tomorrow.

title: 20 GET DOCTORATES AT ROCKEFELLER U.
description: Rockefeller University grant ed Doctor of Philosophy degrees to 20 graduates and honorary degrees to two Nobel Prize win ners last week at its 12th an nual commencement held at the university's Caspary Auditori um, 66th Street and York Avenue.

title: PIRATES TOP PADRES AS ROBERTSON STARS
description: SAN DIEGO, June 13 (AP) Bob Robertson's grandslam homer in the seventh inning broke open a close game and sparked the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 72 victory over the San Diego Padres tonight.

title: Gerken in Tennis Final
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 13 (AP)Paul Gerken of Nor walk, Conn., gained the final of the annual BlueGray tennis tournament today by downing Lenny Schloss of New York, 62, 64. Peter Van Lingen of South Africa defeated Charlie Owens of Tuscaloosa in the other semifinal, 16, 64, 97.

title: Advertising:
description: There are the writers in their little cubicles, young men and women for the most part who have decorated the partitions to their particular tastes. In the next room are the art directors who have done the same.

title: BLACKS ORGANIZE TO DEFEAT NIXON
description: MACON, Ga., June 13  A black Southern strategy de signed to frustrate Republican hopes of sweeping the South in the next national election took shape here today.

title: Business Index Off in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity Cell to 343.4 from 364.8 a week earlier. A year ago it was 342.4.

title: Going, Going, Gone With The Wind
description: HOLLYWOOD. SO the MGM auction is over. Gone with the wind in a random har vest. Buried dragon seed deep in the good earth of Raintree County along with Camille and Mrs. Mini ver and Marie Antoinette and all those other dead ladies, with foreign accents. The un sinkable Molly Brown is sunk and someone paid $3,000 to cart off the brass bed she slept in.

title: Staten Island Show Slated for Sunday; Army Fort Is Site
description: The Staten Island Kennel Club event, one of four all breed dog shows within New York City limits and the only one held outdoors, will be on the parade grounds at Fort Wadsworth on Staten Island next Sunday. The location is beneath the VerrazanoNar rows Bridge. Because it is on Federal property, the show has an advantage to the public that works against the club: No admission can he charged. The entry is 1,540 dogs, the limit, raised from last year's 1,200dog limit. The event's weekend com panion is the MidHudson Kennel Club show on Satur day in Rhinebeck, N. Y. Mid Hudson has an entry of 1,265, up 110 dogs.

title: New Musicals: The Accent Is on Full Living
description: AKEY premise of some of the musicals that arrived both on and off Broadway during the latter part of the last season has been living  taking part, being fully, vitally involved. This was a theme that cropped up in a variety of fashions in several of the musicals that were sufficiently successful to war rant an original cast record ing. rant an original cast record ing.

title: Soviet Expels a Time Reporter; Brezhnev Cover Believed Cause
description: MOSCOW, June 13Stanley W. Cloud, a Moscow correspon dent, for the magazine Time, left today after Soviet authori ties had refused to renew his visa and journalistic accredi tation.

title: Bridgehampton Race May Give TransAm AlsoRans a Break
description: It doesn't seem credible, but firstclass teams like Donohue  Revson, Gurney Savage, HallLeslie and indi viduals like Sam Posey and Jerry Titus have been shut out, 4 for 4, in this season's Trans  American champion ship for small sedans. Par nelli Jones and George Foil mer have domi nated the manu facturers' compe tition without even breathing hardtheir gold en Mustangs have been hold ing up strong while the oppo sition cars have recalled the terminal outing of the one boss shay.

title: Tarrytown, at 100, Has Gala Celebration, Including Beards and Long Dresses
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., June 13This Hudson River village has been celebrating its 100th anniversary this week, with one concession to climate and another to commuters.

title: . . . Hailing a Forest Primeval
description: SCHAFER'S MEADOW, Flathead National Forest, Mont.Catching five bull trout and more than 75 cutthroat wasn't exactly the most memorable part of our trip into this part of Montana's wilderness, though it was the most pleasurable. Nor was it that unforgettable afternoon when a bull moose and cow determined that we were camped smack in the middle of one of their favorite trails.

title: ARREST REFORMS SOUGHT IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, June 13Bills call ing for reforms in arrests, pre trial detentions and bail pro cedures were introduced this week in the House of Commons.

title: Laurie Van Brunt, Oboist, Married
description: POCANTICO HILLS, N. Y., June 13  Miss Laurie Van Brunt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Van Brunt of Mount Kisco, was married in the nondenominational Union Church here today to John Frederick Appleby, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Appleby of Bethesda, Md. The Rev. Marshall L. Smith performed the ceremony.

title: Czech Schools to Add Military Training Course
description: PRAGUE, June 13 (AP) Military training will be intro duced into Czechoslovakia's elementary schools next fall to combat what the Com munist party newspapers de scribed today as the poi soning of young people by pacifist propaganda.

title: Budget Pact Preserves 5c Ferry Fare
description: The fare on the Staten Island Ferry will remain five cents as the result of an agreement late Friday among the Lindsay ad ministration, City Council lead ers and a majority of the Board of Estimate on the Mayor's pro posed expense budget for 197071.

title: Nixon Seeking a Softer Image for VISTA
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 The Nixon Administration has begun changing the image, com position and role of VISTA, the socalled domestic peace corps.

title: Chaos Wins as Massachusetts Democrats Stage a Donnybrook
description: AMHERST, Mass., June 13 Anyone who thinks national political conventions are chaot i?? should try a meeting of the Massachusetts Democrats.

title: From in back of his garden came the rumble of approaching death
description: The Sound of The Mountain

title: POLICE BRUTALITY CHARGED ON COAST
description: ISLA VISTA, Calif., June 13 Students and faculty mem bers accused the police of bru tality and harassment today as a tense peace returned to this small town adjoining the Uni versity of California's Santa Barbara campus.

title: Flag and Allegiance
description: A FULLCOLOR flag from a painting by Leonard E. Buckley, a designer at the Bureau of Engraving and Printing, and the Oath of Al legiance, both printed on an 11by14inch glossy paper base, is available from the Bureau for 75 cents.

title: Bill Douglas Has Never Stopped Fighting the Bullies Of Yakima
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Gary Wood Will Play Football in Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, June 13 (AP) Gary Wood, a sixyear Na tional Football League quar terback released by the New York Giants, signed a one year contract today with the Ottawa Rough Riders of the Canadian Football League.

title: Fire Boxes Off for Hours
description: Fire alarm boxes were out of order for two hours and 15 minutes yesterday morning over a threemile strip of Manhattan containing housing projects and hospitals. No fires were re ported during the time the boxes were out of service, and firemen patrolled the area, which extended along the East Side from Pike to 38th Street between the East River and First Avenue.

title: U.S. BIDS COURT SHUN ACTION IN BERK CASE
description: WASHINGTON, June 13  The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court yesterday not to block the United States Army from sending to Vietnam a soldier who contends Newt York State law forbids the gov ernment to send New York, servicemen overseas to fight an unconstitutional war.

title: Western Governors Attempt to Reach Across the Generation Gap at Conference
description: PARK CITY, Utah, June 10 The Governor of Idaho, a big man with closecut hair and a slow way of speaking, leaned forward to ask the young man a question.

title: Miami Getting Its Tallest Skyscraper
description: MIAMIEnrique N. Gutierrez, a Cuban who was the Castro Government's leading architect for a brief peri od in 1959, announced plans last week to construct what will be Miami's tallest building, a 37story office tower with 1:1 million square feet of rentable space.

title: Police Ask Help of Public On Queens Blvd. Robbery
description: The police appealed to the public yesterday for assistance in capturing four gunmen who critically wounded a patrolman during a robbery in Queens Thursday.

title: Mailmen Getting New Ties
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI) Your mailman is going to change ties. The Post Office Department said this week that effective July 1, uniforms of postal employes will be changed slightly, the first revisions in the attire since 1955. One change will be a switch from maroon to blue ties, to match the rest of the blue uniform.

title: An Unabashedly Joyful Eroticism
description: REUBEN NAKIAN'S cur rent show of small terracotta and bronze sculptures and reliefs and ink drawings at the Egan Gallery is his first in New York since the splendid retro spective of his work mount ed by the Museum of Modern Art in 1966. There are no major new pieces or sugges tions of recent stylistic de velopment in the show, but it's good to have Nakian back, even in a season'send exhibition not likely to get the attention it merits. For Nakian, now 73 years old, remains one of the most in dividual and uniquely talent ed of firstrank American sculptors  this despite the relative neglect that has late ly befallen his reputation, an effect of inclement art world fashion and his own apparent reluctance to remain for long in the public eye.

title: Miss Waller Wed to L. F. Timberlake Jr.
description: NEW HAVEN, June 13 The marriage of Miss Vic toria Lynn Waller, daugh ter of Col. Albert Russell Waller, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Waller of Darby, Pa., to Lloyd Flintom Tim berlake Jr. took place in the Dwight Chapel at Yale University this afternoon. The bridegroom, who was graduated with the class of 67 from Yale, is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Timberlake of Atlanta. The Rev. William Soane Coffin Jr., Yale chap lain, performed the Presby terian

title: John Francis Goldener, Student, Marries Lisa Martin Leydon
description: NEW HOPE, Pa., June 13 Miss Lisa Martin Leydon, daughter of Rear Adm. John Koebig Leydon, U.S.N., re tired, and Mrs. Leydon of Lahaska, was married here this afternoon to John Fran cis Goldener, son of Mr. and Mrs. Franklyn Goldener of Warwick, R. I. The Rev. Francis Joseph Sherry per formed the ceremony in St. Martin's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Urban Officials Hail YearOld U.S. RatControl Drive
description: WARRENTON, Va., June 11 The northern Virginia country side formed the backdrop this week for a meeting by a group of city officials who took a look at the Federal program to wipe out rats one year after it got under way.

title: DATA KEPT ON ALL AT FRESH AIR FUND
description: Ten college students are hard at work at the Fresh Air Fund's headquarters processing data that will enable the 93yearold charity to locate any one of more than 15,000 city children who are to be recipients of free Friendly Town summer vaca tions in private country or sub urban homes from Maine to Virginia.

title: Brownsville Peers Through Haze of Rioting With Little Hope
description: Sitting amid the old dressers chairs and used clothing it a churchrun rummage shot spared by Brownsville fire bombers, the Rev. Willie Gil more spoke yesterday about the problems of his community.

title: Safe Pesticide Disposal
description: WITH the passage of legislation fur ther restricting the use of pesti cides, it is only natural that in terested and concerned people desire to collect pesticides such as DDT for safe disposal to avoid further contamina tion of the environment and to prevent harm to pets or children.

title: Article 2  No Title
City's Rubella Drive on TV Sells Children on Need for Shots
description: Dr. Vincent Guine has sold New Yorkers on the new vac cine for rubella (German meas les) in the same way that American advertising sells breakfast cereals and toysto the parents through their chil dren.

title: Letters: There'll Always Be an England
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Conservationists Decry Norwalk Harbor Dredging
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 13 Conservationists are alarmed here over plans for a private dredging project in Long Island Sound that they say will prob ably undermine two popular and unspoiled Norwalk islands as well as threaten a lucrative oyster industry.

title: FATAH AIDE DENIES HUSSEIN IS TARGET
description: LOS ANGELES, June 13A representative of Al Fatah, the major Palestinian guerrilla or ganization, declared here that despite the fighting this week in Jordan his group had no de sire to depose King Hussein.

title: Gardens
description: COUNTRY gardeners, often find themselves sharing their harvests with the local fauna. Although this wildlife contributes to the de lights of country living, many small animals make nuisances of themselves by damaging vegetable and ornamental gardens.

title: From Skagway to Whitehorse by Narrow Gauge
description: LAKE BENNETT, British Columbia About midway in the 110mile trip between the little coastal town of Skagway, Alaska, and Whitehorse, Yukon Territory's capital, the White Pass & Yukon Route train, makes a 45minute stop in Lake Bennett. The traveler, who has been lulled by several hours of gentle jolting and spec tacular scenery, is faced with a difficult decision: eat lunch in the station here or scramble about for a close look at an old log church, a rusting 1947 Bald win steam locomotive and an 1899 rotary snowplow.

title: Time Runs Short for Troubled Gretel
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 13 Gretel II, Australia's poten tial challenger for the Amer ica's Cup, left Sydney this week as deck cargo on a freighter bound for Boston, with one big problem and several small ones still to be overcome.

title: Negro Church Painted Free By a Mostly White Union
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 13 Fiftyfour members of a pre dominantly white union painted a Negro church this morning as their contribution to racial harmony.

title: The public and private aspects of the problem
description: Abortion, like the Middle East, has been the long time terrain of con flicting ideologies, which for all their sakes must learn to live together. Daniel Callahan, a Roman Catholic scholar and director of the Institute of Society, Ethics and the Life Sci ences, has written a comprehensive and scholarly book that examines the issues involved and the recent developments in the abortion area with considerable objectivity.

title: Honoring the Museum's Traditional Obligation
description: THE Museum of Modern Art has just mounted, as one of its attractions for the summer months, a small but superb exhibition of Recent Acquisitions. With one exceptionthat of the Italian sculptor Fausto Melotti  the names repre resented are all established classics in the modern canon: Braque, Kokoschka, Klee, Ernst, Miro, Matisse and Sophie TaeuberArp. Lest the museum stand accused of ignoring the accomplish ments of American artists, particularly younger Amer icans currently at work in new idiomsa very touchy subtect at the momentthe announcement accompanying the show hastens to point out that During the past year, the Museum of Modern Art has shown over 100 re cently acquired paintings and sculptures by artists of the postWorld War II gen erations. These additions to the collection were largely by Americans, and ranged from works by Abstract Ex pressionists such as Barnett Newman, Mark Rothko, and Robert Motherwell to others by younger arists such as Ron Davis, Carl Andre, Dan Flavin and Bell.

title: GEM AND LADY DEL YACHTING VICTORS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 13  William Ziegler 3d's 44 foot sloop Gem, out of Noroton (Conn.) Yacht Club, the second to finish the 12.6mile race on Long Island Sound today, was winner, on corrected time, of the second race of the Indian Harbor Yacht Club's fourrace cruising yacht summer series for the Whitmore Trophy.

title: Panel Finds Shaw Trial Judge Unfit and Asks He Be Removed
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 13 Judge Edward A. Haggerty of the Criminal District Court here, who presided at the 1969 trial in which District Attorney Jim Garrison attempted to prove a conspiracy in the as sassination of President Ken nedy, was described by an ethics panel this week as unfit to remain on the bench.

title: Famine on 7th Avenue Reaches Severe Levels
description: Those who have long op erated businesses along Sev enth Avenue, the nation's fashion center, like to think that their battlescars over the years prove that they can surmount the industry's tra ditional feastandfamine cy cles.

title: Bureau of Standards Study Suggests Best Tires Belong on the Rear Axle
description: WASHINGTON, June 13  Should you put your best tires on the front or rear of your car?

title: Article 7  No Title
TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Atlanta at New York (2:05 P.M.) Jarvis (6.4) vs. Seaver (85).

title: Article 3  No Title
Marlu Pride Takes Fastest Dexter Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 13 Herve Filion, driving the colt for the first time, steered Marlu Pride to a 6length triumph over Nevele Rascal in 2:01 25 in the $111,514.24 Dexter Cup trot at Roosevelt Raceway to night. This was the fastest of the 11 Dexter Cup mile tests and the margin was also great est in the history of the classic.

title: Connecticut Militia Honors Dempsey at Military Camp
description: NIANTIC, Conn., June 13 Gov. John N. Dempsey, who will step down in January after having served as Connec ticut's chief executive since 1961, was honored by 1,500 people today at the state mili tary came that bears his name.

title: Harvard Honors Maine Judge
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 13 (AP)Chief Justice Robert B. Williamson of the Maine Su preme Court has been elected to honorary membership in the Harvard University Chapter of Phi Beta Kappa. Justice Wil liamson was one of six elected Tuesday to honorary member ship at the chapter's annual business meeting.

title: Demonstration Leaders at Ohio State Say Students Have Been Radicalized and Will Never Turn Back
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 13 A 12foothigh papiermach statue representing an Ohio State football player poised to break through a line of de fenders stands on top of a bul letin board along one of the streets near the huge state campus here.

title: Art:
description: DETROIT. IT is easy to become blasand in deed it is difficult not to become worseabout many aspects of the American art scene, filled as it is with hoopla and promotionalism, with artificially induced excitements, with synthesized reputations comparable to wildcat stocks and with manipulations of the art market that would not be tolerated if it were subject to super vision by an equivalent of Wall Street's S.E.C. But there is one aspect that is eternally gratifying, which comes again and again as a heartening surprise the enrichment of American museums as one great private collection after another becomes public property. And when a collector has gone about his avocation as quietly as did the late Robert Hudson Tannahill of Detroit, the surprise and the gratification are greater than ever with the revelation of a superb group of works of art that had been kept  relatively under wraps.

title: HILL EQUALS MARK FOR HIGH HURDLES
description: WICHITA, June 13, Kan. (AP) Thomas Hill of Arkansas State University tied the world record in the 120yard high hurdles tonight in the United States Track and Field Federa tion meet at Cessna Stadium.

title: MEHL POINT LEADER IN 420 CLASS SERIES
description: RYE, N. Y., June 13Steve Mehl of Hingham, Mass., placed first, third and second in three races on Long Island Sound today to take a 4 Yacht Club's twoday invita tion 420 Class regatta. He totaled 5 points.

description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 13 Benjamin H. Bryon Jr. won his fifth straight Soling Class race with Impulse today when the Belle Haven Club conducted the season's 10th championship regatta for Connecticut area Yacht Racing Association fleets based east of Rye.

title: HIGHWAY TO AVOID FRANCONIA NOTCH
description: CONCORD, N.H., June 13 Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe reaffirmed to day that the Federal Govern ment would not build Interstate 93 through Franconia Notch at the foot of the famous Old Man of the Mountain, a natu ral rock formation resembling a human face.

title: RIOTNEWS CURBS ASSAILED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, June 13 (Reu ters)  Indian journalists are challenging Governmentbacked selfcensorship codes designed to play down HinduMoslem clashes.

title: GIANTS TURN BACK CARDINALS BY 65
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 13 (AP)Don McMahon pitched the San Francisco Giants out of a tight jam in the eighth inning today as the Giants downed the St. Louis Cardinals, 65.

title: D'ARTAGNAN VICTOR OF CINEMA HANDICAP
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 13 (AP)D'Artagnan, winner of two of his three races but never in stakes company, took the $56,350 Cinema Handicap at Hollywood Park today as the favorite.

title: DAME FRANCESCA WINS MIAMI RACE
description: MIAMI, June 13 (AP)Dame Francesca closed with a rush along the inside to win the fea ture at Tropical Park today be fore a crowd of 5.102.

title: Laird Said to Tighten Rein On the Joint Chiefs of Stall
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 After 16 months of giving mili tary leaders their head at the Pentagon, Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird has reportedly decided to rein them in.

title: BIG JULY 4 RALLY SLATED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 13A small piece of scrap paper was taped on the lobby wall of a Washington office building this week to notify the public of a new tenant. On the paper, in red crayon, were the words Honor America Day Commit teeSuite 506.

title: Housing Case in Jersey Alleges Communitywide Pattern and Practice of Bias
description: NEWARK, June 13The New Jersey Division on Civil Rights is pursuing a case that could lead to a new broadscale method of attack upon housing discrimination.

title: DYCE 880 VICTOR IN A.A.U. TRACK
description: Byron Dyce is ready to de fend his national halfmile title, but Marcel Philippe's welllaid plans in the mile went astray yesterday afternoon at Dow ning Stadium.

title: Peking Is Reviving Interest in Sports; Team Sent to Nepal
description: HONG KONG, June 13 Peking has laid new stress on physical culture in a campaign apparently aimed at reviving public interest in sports, which suffered a decline during the Cultural Revolution.

title: That Laughter You Hear Is the Silent Majority
description: RODNEY Dangerfield is the favorite comic of the Silent Majority. He sags into their living rooms, like a tired salesman just off the road. (This week he will appear with Johnny Carson on Thursday night and with David Frost on Fri day.) He gives them his sad menopausal look, compound ed of disappointment, anger and resignation. Then he fractures them with a lugu brious litany of woes.

description: LONDON.

title: Confirmations
description: BECKERMr. and Mrs. Gerald H., of Hewlett Bay Park and Palm Beach, Fla., are happy to announce the confirmation of their daughter, Robin Dee at Central Synagogue, Rockville Centre, N. Y., on Tuesday, June 9th.

title: NIXON AIDE DENIES HICKEL IS LEAVING
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 13The White House denied today that President Nixon had any intention of seeking the resignation of Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel.

title: Students Work for Rooney Rival
description: The polyglot 14th Congres sional District, which contains everything from expensive townhouses to deserted ware houses as it zigzags along Brooklyn's waterfront, has be come the latest battleground for college students trying to elect an antiwar political can didate.

title: Elizabeth Alsop Bride Of Walter Mahony 3d
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Miss Elizabeth Winthrop Alsop and Walter Butler Mahony 3d were married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church in George town. The Rev. William P. Baxter performed the cere mony.

title: A Correction
description: In a worldwide survey of off track betting printed April 26, incorrect figures were printed about distribution of the bet ting money at Japan Racing Association tracks. The correct figures: Of total sales, 75 per cent goes hack to the public as winnings, 15 per cent goes to cover the total expenses of the association and 10 per cent goes to the state. The associa tion budgets 6 per cent of the total estimated annual sales to be awarded to horseowners as prizes and for stable mainte nonce fees and other expenses.

title: Miss Nancy Celich Married to Soldier
description: DENVER, June 13Miss Nancy Joanne Celich, daugh ter of Lieut. Col. Nicholas J. Celich, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Celich of Lafayette, was married here this afternoon to Pfc. Alexander Calder 3d, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Calder Jr. of Upper Mont clair, N. J. The Rev. Gerhard Mundinger of the University Lutheran Chapel in Boulder performed the ceremony in the Grace Lutheran Church.

title: KELLY AND DOWRY SCORE IN SAILING
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 13William E. Kelly, at the helm of Dowry in the Etchells 22 Class, and Joseph F. O'Hora and Dr. George K. Brazill Jr., with their Shields Class sloop, Double Dare, were among the winners of the 7.2mile races on Long Island Sound today. It was the eighth championship regatta of the Yacht Racing As sociation season.

title: SOUTH STARS WIN IN LACROSSE, 1110

title: METHADONE CURB FOUGHT IN TEXAS
description: FORT WORTH, June 13A Texas physician has gone to court here to block a state board from censuring him and possibly canceling his medical license because he treats more than 400 heroin addicts with the synthetic narcotic, metha done.

title: Lauren Brown Wed To Stuart R. Sadler
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., June 13Miss Lauren Jane Brown and Stuart Ragland Sadler were married here this after noon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Floyd Payne Brown. The ceremony was per formed by the Rev. Wesley A. Kemp, minister of the Ridgewood Methodist Church.

description: Quarup

title: Mailers Hold Union Meetings At News, Delaying Distribution
description: About 300 mailers held union meetings last night at the Man hattan and Brooklyn plants of The Daily News, delaying dis tribution of the paper for the second consecutive evening.

title: Boston Shopping Link Set
description: BOSTON, June 13 A $300million link between Boston's downtown shopping district and the Back Bay re tail area came into the modeldevelopment stage last week. The 35acre newcon struction and rebuilding proj ect in the city's Park Square area will take seven to 10 years. Its start is scheduled for next spring.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayBurlington County K.C. allbreed show, Doughboy Field, Fort Dix, N. J.; 1,579 entries; 8 A.M.

title: L.0.S. MAKES PUBLIC ITS 1969 REPORT
description: GENEVA, June 13  A story of unusual corporate generosity to insiders and friends was told today in the annual report of Investors Overseas Services, the troubled mutual fund com pany that is now facing a squeeze on its cash resources.

title: UZBEK'S OLD WAY YIELDING SLOWLY
description: BUKHARA, U.S.S.R.  Sit ting on a gray donkey in the 100degree desert heat 30 miles from this ancient Central As ian city, a sunblackened Uz bek shepherd left his flock of karakul sheep in the distance and answered a question.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayOx Ridge. Ox Ridge Hunt Club, Route 124, Darien, Conn. Championships in all di visions. 9 A.M.

title: Garden Screen to Show Cup Soccer Tests Today
description: Two quarterfinal round matchcs of the World Cup soccer championship from Mexico City will he telecast in color today at Madison Square Garden. The opening game at 2 P.M. will pair Italy and Mexico followed by Brazil and Peru.

title: Soviet Dissent Is Not Unified, But It Proves to Be Persistent
description: MOSCOW, June 11Dissent in the Soviet Union is hardly part of a brewing revolution, nor is it unified. But the small group of Russian men and women who do dissent are proving both hardy and per sistent.

title: Arabs Protest in Denmark
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 13 (AP)About 45 young Jordanian Arabs occupied Jor dan's Embassy here today in support of the Palestinian com mandos in their struggle with King Hussein. The police said they had been notified by an embassy secretary that the demonstrators were peaceful and that no police intervention was desired.

title: Vehicle Registration in U.S. Exceeds 105 Million
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPI)The Government re ported this week that motor vehicle registration in the United States passed the 105, million mark in 1969 for an alltime high and increased more than 4 million during the year, another record.

title: In The Camera World
description: SEVERAL new books that have recently been pub lished should prove of interest to many ama teur and professional photog raphers:

title: 3 on Peace Corps Council
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 13 (UPI)President Nixon an nounced today three appoint ments to the National Advisory Council on the Peace Corps, rounding out the 25member panel. Appointed where Mark Evans of Washington, Gesital A. Nordin of Pasadena, Calif., and Erich Segal of New Haven, Conn.

title: House Plants From Seed
description: HOUSE plants started from seed now will be ready for display in doors in early fall. Seedgrown plants are pro lific bloomers, and for the price of a single plant, there will be enough African vio lets, geraniums, fibrous be gonias, and gloxinias to give away.

title: Fairly Sad Story Of a Wall Street Broker
description: TECHNICALLY, Francis Bartow Farr is just another stock sales man, a broker, a customer's man, a regtitered representative. There are 57,000 like him who work for the 545 member firms of the New York Stock Exchange that deal with the public. But such a statistical lumping is misleading as well as slighting: in his own way, Farr is rarity. When he left his last firm recently he was the object of spirited bidding.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Novelization of historical crimesusually unsolvedhave long been a small, but intrigu ing subgenre of mystery fic tion. The now forgotten Joseph Shearing committed a number of these to paper, and there has been a modest sprinkling of others through the last four decades, but I remember with most pleasure John Dickson Carr's description and resolu tion of a 17thcentury cause clbre in The Murder of Sir Edmund Godfrey (1936).

title: Valiant Regarded Boat to Beat for Role of Cup Defender
description: Olin Stephens appears to have come up with another capable 12Meter in Valiant, his latest America's Cup con tender.

title: Priest in Race for Congress
description: DEPERE, Wisc., June 13 (AP) The Rev. Robert Cornell, 50 years old, will run for Congress from the Eighth District. The Roman Catholic priest said yes terday he would be a Demo cratic candidate for the seat held by John W. Byrnes, a Republican, since 1944.

title: Taylor's Folksongs Stir Recollections With Rich Fullness
description: James Taylor, a young folk singer with sad smoke in his voice, who writes most of the songs he sings, played two con certs Friday evening at Carne gie Hall.

title: MAPLE POSTS DOUBLE IN LIBERTY BELL MILES
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 13 (AP)Eddie Maple swept both ends of the Keystone Handicap at Liberty Bell Race Track to day, winning the first division abroad Futura Bold, then com ing back to take the second with Addy Hoy.

title: Machine Unit Head
description: The Machinery Dealers National Association has elected Robert C. Atherton president. Mr. Atherton is president of the Raco Indus trial Corporation, Elk Grove, Ill. The association repre sents dealers in used ma chinery throughout the United States and Canada. Louis M. Stern, chairman of the World Wide Equipment Company, Dearborn, Mich., was named first vice presi dent and James J. Walsh, president of the Colonial Machinery Company, Bridge port, Pa., was named treas urer.

title: The World
description: LONDONA large audi ence of the Conservative faithful jammed into the City Hall of NewcastleUponTyne one night last week to hear Edward Heath, the Tory leader. For an hour Mr. Heath spoke, in great detail and with evident sincerity, about the Labor Govern ment's economic failures and the Conservative alternative.

title: Robin J. Rutter Plans Nuptials
description: CHARLOTTE, Vt., June 13 Mr. and Mrs. A. William Rutter Jr. of Midland, Tex., and Charlotte have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Robin Jessica Rutter, to Jeffrey Prescott Price. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin F. Price of Pleasantville, N. Y., and Charlotte.

title: Air Controllers Disciplined In Kansas for Slowdown
description: KANSAS CITY, June 13 (AP) Disciplinary measures have been taken against air traffic controllers at Municipal Air Terminal and at the Olathe, Kan., air control center for their part in a sickout, this year, the Federal Aviation Ad ministration said yesterday.

title: Soviet Envoy Sees Wilson
description: LONDON June 13 (UPI) Ambassador Mikhail N. Smir novky of the Soviet Union to day called on Prime Minister Wilson and, without waiting to see whether he is reelected Thursday, discussed with him a possible official visit by him to Moscow in July. Mr. Smir novsky saw Mr. Wilson at his office, No. 10 Downing St.

title: Home Improvement
description: INEXPENSIVE disposable paint brushes that apply the paint with a polyure thane pad or blade rather than the traditional bristles are becoming increas ingly popular with doityour self painters who find it easi er to throw their brushes away after each job instead of bothering to clean them. First introduced about three or four years ago, foam brushes are inexpensive enough to be truly labeled as throwaways, but this is not the only feature that has made them popular. First introduced about three or four years ago, foam brushes are inexpensive enough to be truly labeled as throwaways, but this is not the only feature that has made them popular.

title: New York
description: The brazen bombing at tack on New York City's Po lice Headquarters last week made clear what police offi cials long have admitted to themselves but not to the public: Nothing and no one can be made safe from a man determined to explode an infernal machine in a public building.

title: Farmers Harbor Doubt Despite Good Crops
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 13In the midst of what promises to be a year of good crops, good prices for Iivestock and better prices than were expected for grain, Iowa farmers are facing the annual problem of having no idea at all of what lies ahead.

title: Newark Mayoral Contest Reaches a Bitter Climax
description: NEWARK, June 13The bit terly contested mayoral cam paign reached a climax here this weekend in the heavily black wards and the white eth nic neighborhoods where the election will be decided Tues day.

title: Plant for Bavaria
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., has announced that the German subsidiary of its Lummus division has received a $25million contract from Gelsenberg A.G. for a petro chemical plant in Upper Ba varia.

title: Kent State Graduation Ceremony Calm
description: KENT, Ohio, June 13Kent State University, where four students were shot to death in a volley of National Guard rifle fire, graduated the class of 1970 today.

title: Child to Mrs. Armstrong
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., June 13A daughter was born on May 29 to Mr. and Mrs. Forrest Harrell Armstrong in the Bellin Memorial Hos pital here. Mrs. Armstrong is the former Miss Dorothy Ciner of Scarsdale, N. Y. Her husband is chairman of the Urban Analysis Concentra tion at the University of Wisconsin here. The child has been named Allison Elisabeth.

title: La Dolce Vita E Musicale
description: AMERICANS, not to men tion Germans, Eng lish and Scandinavi ans, invade Italy every summer. Most of them are there as tourists, some as students, some as performers. Spoleto, where Gian Carlo Menotti's Festival of Two Worlds holds forth, will have more than its customary share of American artists, what with 150 Juilliard School performers taking part. And down on the Amal fi coast, 50 young American instrumentalists will be tak ing part in the threeyearold Festival Musicale di Salerno.

title: Nuptials for Rhonda L. Fishbein
description: CRESSKILL, N. J., June 13 Miss Rhonda Laurie Fish bein and Lloyd Gary Steger were married here tonight at the Tamcrest Country Club. Rabbi Judah Cahn performed the ceremony.

title: FOE IN CAMBODIA ENTERS KEY TOWN ON ROUTE TO PORT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, June 14Enemy troops mounted fresh attacks on the key town of Kompong Speu, about 30 miles southwest of Pnompenh, the Cambodian cap ital, and lead elements fought their way into the center of the town, a Cambodian military communiqu said today.

title: Rising Costs and Labor Strikes Delay Construction of Stadiums
description: To achieve a modern new stadium is becoming quite an accomplishment in the face of soaring construction and labor costs. The new Phila delphia Veterans Stadium will not be available to the Eagles this season as prom ised because of a labor strike. Pete Retzlaff, the Eagle genmanager, announced last week that the team once more would play its home games at the University of Pennsyl vania's Franklin Field. The site has been more than ade quate and now has artificial turf. But the Eagles have been there as polite guests and Franklin Field is almost 50 years old, with next to no parking. The new stadium will seat 65,000 for football, 5,000 more than the Penn plant.

title: Verdu to Put Up Big Front On Garden Wrestling Show
description: Bruno Sammartino will op pose 29yearold Crusher Verdu of Spain In the feature of tomorrow night's wrestling pro gram at Madison Square Garden. Verdu claims the largest chest in sports, 62 inches.

title: Caution in Boom Pays Off in Bust
description: Believe it or not, Wall Street is not quite the total disaster area that many investors have been led to believe it is. In fact, after 18 calamitous months of plunging prices and ebbing volume, some brokerage houses are still earning a handsome profit.

title: Phils Lose Doyle for Week
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 13 (AP) Denny Doyle, the Philadelphia Phillies second baseman, has been ordered to rest for a week as a result of a bruised right shoulder, club officials an nounced last night. Doyle hurt his shoulder sliding into third base in the first inning of Thursday night's game with Atlanta.

title: Act I Captures Class Laurels And Nears Open Jumper Title
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 13 Complete disaster would have to descend on Act I if the 9 yearold bay gelding is to lose the open jumper championship at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show.

title: Envoy to Greece Flies Home
description: ATHENS June 13 (UPI)Am bassador Henry J. Tasca of the United States flew home for consultations today to press recommendation that Washing ton resume full military aid to Greece, diplomatic sources said. The United States has been re viewing its policy toward the Athen's military regime. One item under study is the ban on heavy arms.

title: THANT REBUFFED BY HANOI ON TALKS
description: PARIS, June 13The North Vietnamese spokesman at the Paris talks has denounced as sheer hypocrisy the proposal of U Thant, Secretary General of the United Nations, for an expanded international confer enc on the war in Iindochina.

title: And outward there is always the great presence of the sea
description: The peculiar magic of Cape Cod and of the islands satellite to it since the railroad's coming first made it accessible 100 years ago yearly draws hordes of visitors to this low, sandy, scrubpiny, pondy hook of glacial moraine sticking out into the Atlantic. Every summer without fail, as surely as the warbler flight immediately preceding it, the annual migration to the Cape occurs. By the tens of thousands cars tlow across the two bridges over the Canal and on down Routes 6, 6A and 28, to fan out at turnoff and junction, and some to head for the Woods Hole or Hyannis ferries connecting Nan tucket and Martha's Vineyard with the mainland.

title: SANITATION STUDY SET IN RIOT AREA
description: The city's Environmental Pro tection Administrator promised a hard look yesterday at the operations of the Sanitation De partment and said more men and equipment were being sought to clean upand keep cleanthe garbagelittered Brownsville section of Brook lvn.

title: Personality:
description: Women shoppers create the tempo in retailing, but men sit behind the desks in most top executive offices. In Austin, Tex., there is one notably attractive exception.

title: All's Right With The World of Harold Wilson
description: LONDON. IN October, 1968, Harold Wilson flew down to Gibraltar to parley with Ian Smith, the Prime Min ister of rebel Rhodesia, aboard the British warship Fearless. It was an unpromising journey.

title: Menasha Skulnik 18981970
description: THEY saw 1776 about a month ago and they came backstage. Anna complimented me. Menasha said, Why shouldn't he be good, he's got some of the best lines in the play and besides, it's not just a great, situation, it's a great situation!

description: To the Editor:

title: Australia Shelves Proposal For Alternative to Army Duty
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 13 The Government has shelved a plan to offer civilian work as an alternative to jail for those who refuse to be con scripted. Strong opposition within the coalition Govern ment and from the Labor party, on different grounds, killed the proposal.

title: TRUMAN INSTITUTE GOES ITS OWN WAY
description: JERUSALEM, June 11The Truman Institute, newly opened on Mount Scopus in Jerusa lem, has opted for research rather than for the quick pur suit of peace, with the name but apparently without the very strong blessing of Harry S. Truman, the former President of the United States.

title: CAPITAL FAVORED AS '76 SHOWPLACE
description: WASHINGTON, June 13  A prominent group of scholars has recommended that the na tional celebration of the 200th anniversary of the United States in 1976 include a broad effort of urban innovation and devel opment in the city of Wash ington.

title: A 435CARAT GEM IS BEING SAWED
description: A copper disk coated with mixture of castor oil and dia mond powder is slowly sawing along a fine black line drawn in India ink on the surface of the 435carat rough diamond whose discovery was an nounced in January by the Zale Corporation, one of the world's largest jewelry concerns.

title: Paula Chartier Wed to Ens. A. Q. Gabriele
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., June 13 In the chapel at Manhattan ville College here this morn ing, Miss Paula F. Chartier, who was graduated from Manhattanville on May 30, became the bride of Ens. Al fred Q. Gabriele, who is at tending Naval Flight School at Pensacola. Fla.

title: Bill Urged on Mailing Lists
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (UPT)  Representative Frank Horton, Republican of upstate New York, has introduced legislation to halt the sale of Federal mailing lists for com mercial purposes. Mr. Horton said Tuesday that the bill would provide Congress with guidelines on the use of such Hats and would close what he referred to as a gap in the Freedom of Information Act.

title: Rent Plan Is No Cure For Blight: Analysis
description: IT is an old axiom that relaxing rent control in New York City is political suicide for any elected official. Yet Mayor Lindsay has pro posed, and the Democraticcontrolled City Council is seriously considering, the most sweeping revision of rent control in the 27year history of the law.

title: National Geographic Led By Another Grosvenor
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Gilbert M. Grosvenor. 39 years old, has been elected editor of The National Geo graphic Magazine by the Na tional Geographic Society's hoard of trustees, the presi dent, Melvin M. Payne, an nounced yesterday. Mr. Grosvenor, now vice presi dent and associate editor, will succeed Frederick G. Vosburgh, who is retiring.

title: Pittsburgh Hails the 100th Year. Of Its Incline Cable Car System
description: PITTSBURGH, June 13  This city's Monongahela In cline has just marked its 100th anniversary. Appro priate ceremonies were held and a plaque, designating the incline as a historic struc ture, was affixed to an in cline station by the Pitts burgh History and Land marks Foundation.

title: 3 Paraplegics Typify Sportsmanship
description: Lou Rosini, 40 years old, is from Philadelphia. He was wounded by a bullet nearly 20 years ago in the Korean War. And he is no relation to the basketball coach at New York University who spells his last name with a doubles.

title: Phils Down Reds, 63, as Johnson Belts Two Homers and Bats in Five Runs
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 13 (UPI)Deron Johnson drove in five runs with a pair of home runs off Gary Nolan tonight to lead the Philadelphia Phillies to a 63 victory over the Cin cinnati Reds.

title: ARGENTINE JUNTA NAMES PRESIDENT
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 13 Brig. Gen. Roberto Marcelo Levingston, a specialist in mili tary intelligence, was named to night as the President of Ar gentina.

title: Tube Sales Climbing For Color Television
description: As new color TV sets go unsold, the manufacturers of replacement picture tubes are ringing up the happy tune of rising sales.

title: Nixon Urges U.S. Citizens To Aid Peru Quake Victims
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 13 (Reuters)President Nixon today appealed for individual contributions from the public to help relieve the suffering in Peru in the aftermath of the devastating earthquake there two weeks ago, in which 30, 000 to 50,000 people were killed. two weeks ago, in which 30, 000 to 50,000 people were killed.

title: Counter and Amex Advance Stalls
description: The recent advance on the American Stock Exchange and the over  the  counter market ended last week as prices of most issues de clined in very light trading.

title: Cup Scores on WQXR
description: Please do not telephone The New York Times or WQXR for scores of World Cup soccer matches. The cans tie up lines and inter fere with the work of the newspaper and the radio sta tion. World Cup results will he given on WQXR late evening hourly news reports.

title: Stonitsch Sets 3Mile Meet Mark as C.W. Post Places 2d in N. C. A. A.Track
description: ST. PAUL, June 13Ron Stonitsch felt exhausted last night, sluggish this morning and really dead this afternoon during the running of the three miles at the National Collegiate Athletic Association college di vision track and field champion ships.

title: Student Weds Miss Christie
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., June 13  Miss Marietta Clark Christie and Dennis Parker Metcalfe of New York and Nantucket were married here this afternoon by the Rev. James O. Edds of the Con gregational Church. The cere mony was performed out doors in the Nantucket Is land Bird Sanctuary. A recep tion was given at the Jared Coffin House here.

title: Laura Vanderbilt Wed to David Ernst
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 13  Miss Laura Elizabeth Vanderbilt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Bedford Van derbilt of Greenwich and Devil Lake, Ontario, was married here at noon today to David Cuenod Ernst, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eliot D. Ernst of Lake Bluff, Ill., formerly of Greenwich.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONSeveral things seemed immediately apparent when Richard M. Nixon, in a swift Cabinet shuffle that caught most of the capital by surprise, moved Robert H. Finch and George P. Shultz into the White House and closer to his inner circle of advisers.

title: Miss Louise Dempsey Engaged To Ens. Edgar D. McKean 3d
description: CLEVELAND, June 13 Mr. and Mrs. John B. Demp sey 2d of Cleveland and Mur ray Bay, Quebec, have an nounced the engagement ofk their daughter, Miss Louise Gertrude Marie Dempsey, to Ens. Edgar D. McKean 3d, U.S.N.R., son of Mr. and Mrs. Edgar D. McKean Jr. of Fox Chapel, Pa. The wedding is planned for late fall.

title: U.S. WITHDRAWAL BY 71 IS BACKED
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 13 With United States forces scheduled to be out of Cam bodia before the end of the month, the debate over the war will almost certainly center on the rate of withdrawal of troops from Vietnam.

title: Ashe Turns Back Hewitt, Wins Tennis RoundRobin
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 13 (AP)Arthur Ashe of Rich mond fought back for a 46, 63, 61 victory over Bob Hew itt of South Africa today and won the $2,400 top prize in a roundrobin tennis competition that has been running for sev eral weeks.

title: Lake Champlain Fishermen Warned of Mercury Danger
description: ALBANY, June 13 (UPI) The State Conservation Depart ment said yesterday that fisher men on Lake Champlain risked mercury poisoning by eating their catches.

title: Acting Chief Appointed For Lick Observatory
description: Dr. George E. Herbig, an authority on the formation of new stars, has been named acting director of the Lick Observatory of the University of California, Santa Cruz.

title: Ah, Youth! Ah, Sex! Ah, Revolution!
description: THE suspicion has been in the attic of my mind for some time, but it didn't start clomping around in such a way that I had to acknowl edge its presence until the other day, when I came out of the Cinema I after seeing Getting Straight. Well, I found myself saying with a good deal of sincerity, at least the riot is a lot better than the one in The Strawberry Statement.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: This is the second of two articles on North Carolina's trash fish industry.

title: English Girls Snap Mark For 3,200Meter Relay

title: Harvey Restaurant to Close
description: ST. LOUIS, June 13 (AP) The Fred Harvey Restaurant in Union Station, a pall of the railroad terminal since it was opened in 1895, will close June 30, Leo T. Hamilton, the man ager, said that only 14 passen ger trains operated daily in and out of the big terminal, not enough to support the facility. It includes a restaurant, bar, snack bar, gift shop and news stand.

title: POWER NETWORKS PASS INITIAL TEST

And, please, what was my connection with the picture that had just won the Golden Palm?

title: Recordings
description: MUSICTANS are ordi narily the least so phisticated of politi cal animals, perhaps because for so many of their formative years they are shut up in practice rooms com municating with the dead. Even composers, the cream of the musical intelligentsia, usually find ways to drift along apolitically with what ever ideology is in power and in control of commis sions, so that one is rather startled to find an occasional Verdi going so far as to hold a public office.

title: Gooseneck Design Is Adopted By Connecticut for Mailboxes

At that stage, they often feel they have a problem.

M.For al most 90 years, from 1881 until last year, tiny pot bellied engines straining up the steepest railroad grades in the United States, slowly pulled long strings of freight cars over towering peaks in the Southern Rocky Moun tains and in Southern Col orado and Northern New Mexico.

title: Photography
description: NEARLY halfway through Photo Eye of the 20s, the Mu seum of Modern Art's beautiful, scholarly and lop sided summer photography show, is a print of Edward Weston's famous and oftre produced study of a single green pepper. In Weston's oeuvre, as in the exhibition, the picture is pivotal. For the photographer it marked the end of a long search for artis tic identity. For the exhibi tion it illustrates the aims and limits set by the principal organizer and selector, Beau mont Newhall, Director of the George Eastman House in Rochester. photographer it marked the end of a long search for artis tic identity. Marlowe, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sanford S. Marlowe of Hong Kong, where Mr. Marlowe is the public affairs officer of the United States Informa tion Service. The child's fa ther is the Shaftsbury repre sentative in the Vermont State Legislature and is Democratic candidate for Lieutenant Governor.

title: Douglas Heads Foundation
description: Lewis w. Douglas, former United States Ambassador to Britain, has been elected presi dent of the United States Churchill Foundation. Mr. Douglas has served on the board of trustees since the foundation was organized in 1959 as a nonprofit institution to perpetuate the memory of Sir Winston Churchill and to provide scholarships and fel lowships to Americans for advanced study at Churchill College of Cambridge Uni versity.

title: Her own look
description: City apartments are somewhat like chameleons. They change as tenants move in and out, imposing their own tastes and personalities on their environment. When Mrs. Rene Bouche, the widow of the portraitist, bought this apartment, was a lavishly draperied and mirrored doctor's office. She enlisted architect John Bedenkapp to create a single, flowing living space out of the old reception room and the doctor's office. He stripped off moldings and deemphasized ugly, jutting columns by enlarging and aligning them. Conversation areas were created to accommodate large and small groups. The furnishings were under played to focus attention on Mrs. Bouche's extensive collection of paintings.

title: Connecticut Yankees Are Hitting 300
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn.  Mini skirts were never really in vogue in this central Connecti cut town, for the lifestyle here is conservative, a heritage of a colonial past. And so, when Mayor Joseph Carini issued a proclamation ordering all the men to grow beards for the town's 300th anniversary, the reaction was not wholly enthusiastic.

title: WILDCAT STRIKES AT MINES FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 Rising labor unrest in the Ap palachian coal fields is being watched anxiously by Federal officials and leaders of the min ing and electric power indus tries.

Voight, won the $30,425 Long Branch Stakes at the track that likes to call itself the resort of racing.

description: HUNTINGTON BAY, L. I., June 13The tower of Fergu son's Castle overlooks the har bor and the wrecker's ball.

title: U.S. Loan to Turkey Dismays Narcotics Officials

Y., and the late Mrs. Barbara Pogue Preston. The ceremony, in St. Leo's Roman Catholic Church, was performed by the Rev. David Riley.

title: A Native Son's Nostalgic Return to Jefferson Country

title: MEMOIRS OF POLE RECALL 1939 WAR

description: LOS ANGELES  Just a matter of weeks ago, Califor nia savings and loan associa tions were so strapped for funds that many of them de clined to make mortgage loans.

title: PARK SERVICE HALTS AUTO ENTRANCE FEE
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP) The National Park Service announced today the suspen sion of entrance fees to its park areas normally entered by automobile.

title: Books of The Times
description: At first, it comes as a shock to discover that Jay Martin's new book is the first biography of Nathanael West ever written. Nearly 30 years have passed since the Sunday afternoon in December of 1940, when West died with his wife (the former Eileen McKenney and the model for My Sister Eileen) in an automobile accident near Los Angeles. And though West was 37 at the time, he had lived a full life and ac complished much for his age. An accomplished fan tasist from the start, he had bluffed his way through Brown University in two andahalf years, and had continued to make up stories for the rest of his life. His anecdotes had beguiled an unusual circle of friends and ac quaintances, ranging from S. J. Perelman, who married West's sister, Laura, to F. Scott Fitzgerald, who looked upon West as something of a spiritual heir. His four novelsThe Dream Life of Balso Snell, Miss Lonelyhearts, A Cool Million, and The Day of the Locusthad secured him a reputation as a writer's writer, even if his books had not sold well. And his screenplays had finally established him as one of Hollywood's better craftsmen, and were beginning to earn him a living.

title: NEGRO IS ELECTED TRUSTEE OF YALE
description: NEW HAVEN, June 14Fed eral Judge A. Leon Higgin botham Jr. has been elected a trustee of Yale University, the first black person to be chosen for the institution's governing board since Yale was founded in 1701.

title: DIABETES DRUGUSE BACKED BY COUNCIL
description: ST. LOUIS, June 14  The American Diabetes Association Said today it saw no need to abandon accepted methods of treating diabetes despite a re port from a massive study that has cast doubt on the value of oral drugs in controlling effects of the disease.

title: Nixon's Bugaboo
description: WASHINGTON, June 14In a couple of weeks the Federal Government will close the books on fiscal 1970 with a deficit of $1.5billion. But further deficits are in prospect for the following two years, and they may be much higher. The Administration says that the deficit in fiscal 1971 will be only $1.3billion. Its estimate assumes that Congress will vote stiff taxes on leaded gasoline and empower the Treasury to speed up the collection of estate and gift taxes. It also assumes that corporate profits this year will total $89billiona figure that private analysts regard as high ly improbable.

title: Sweet Mimosa, at 23 1, Takes $262,000 French Oaks
description: PARIS, June 14The luck of the Irish followed Seamus McGrath as he confounded the racing experts again today when his filly, Sweet Mimosa, a 231 shot, won the $262,000 Prix de Dianethe French Oaksat 1 516 miles.

title: U.S. 1,600Meter Relay Four Breaks Military Meet Mark
description: VIAREGGIO, Italy, June 14 (UPI)America's 1,600meter relay team set a meet record today in winning the final at the 24th Conseil International du Sport Militarie track and field championships.

title: SCHWARTZ TAKES SAILING LAURELS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 14 Taking the lead on the sec ond leg of the fourlegged course that circled the island in a clockwise direction, Her bert F. Schwartz won the Ensign Class event with Wen den on Long Island Sound today in the annual Captains Island regatta of the Greenwich Cove Racing Association. Wenden triumphed by 3 minutes 55 seconds and close to 500 yards after 6.5 miles in 58knot southeasterly breeze.

title: SORENSEN SCORED FOR PEACE VIEWS
description: The stockholdings of Repre sentative Richard L. Ottinger came under political attack yes terday as the four candidates for the Democratic nomination for Senator held their second televised debate in two days.

title: DODGERS TOP CUBS ON A PINCH HOMER
description: LOS ANGELES, June 14 (AP) Bill Sudakis smacked a two run pinch homer with two out in the ninth inning today, giv ing the Los Angeles Dodgers a 54 victory over the Chicago Cubs.

title: ARTHUR HARRISON
description: Arthur Harrison, a former lawyer with the Veterans Ad ministration here, died Sunday of a stroke at Kew Gardens General Hospital in Queens. He was 71 years old, and lived at 7636 113th Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Lull of Summer Welcomed After All Princeton's Noise
description: PRINCETON, June 14  Some Princetonians feel that the summer vacation will prove a particular blessing this year in restoring tidiness to that segment of Nassau Street that separates town and gown  sometimes re ferred to as the D.M.Z. Fre quently during the 196970 academic year the campus was the scene of protest oratory, petition, exhorta tion, vocalized anguish and occa sional absurdity. Now, before Nassau Hall and behind the great iron gates there is a stillness like that of a carnival ground the morning after the show has packed and moved on.

title: U.A.W. to Train Its Leaders At a Millionaire's Playground
description: BLACK LAKE, Mich., June 13 Deep in Michigan's northern woods, where the bullfrogs croaks are so loud they make the city folk jump, the United Automobile Workers has turned a millionaire's play ground into a union resort.

title: Lithuanians Hold Protest On Russian Persecution
description: Several hundred Americans of Lithuanian origin staged a com memoration and protest yester day of Russian persecution of citizens of Baltic states over the last 30 years.

title: Polarization in Newark
description: At a time when this nation needs leaders who will heal the wounds and lessen the tensions between the races, Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark has been waging an ugly and racist campaign. In his desperate effort to defeat his opponent, Negro engineer Kenneth A. Gibson, Mayor Addonizio has not hesitated to rouse the most primitive fears among Newark's white voters and population. He and his supporters have sought to polarize whites against blacks, a course whose explo sive potentials threaten the very existence of Newark as a viable multiracial community in the future. If only because of these irresponsible tactics, Mayor Addonizio deserves to be defeated tomorrow by a huge coalition of concerned white and black voters alike.

title: A Policeman's Tale Hangs by Hair
description: A 24yearold patrolman charged yesterday that the Police Department was har rassing him because of his long hair.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Assails Violence
description: NEW DELHI, June 14 (AP) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, in an emotional speech to the ruling Congress party, called today for an allout fight against left and rightwing extremists, who, she said, ad vocate violence and threaten India's democracy.

title: Nixon Visits Bahamas
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 14 (UPI)  President Nixon worked and relaxed today in the Bahamas. With him on an overnight stay at G??and ??ay were Robert H. Finch, who, is to become a White House counselor, and the Presidents friend, C. G. Rebozo.

title: Laborites and Tories Offer Differing Views of British Economy
description: LONDON, June 14The state of the British economy has be come the most debated issue in the election campaign.

title: Citizen Group Votes Opposition to Nixon Planto Jail Dangerous Defendants Before Trial
description: Opposition to the Nixon Ad ministration's proposal to au thorize detention before trial of persons ruled dangerous has been voted by the National Council on Crime and Delin quency.

title: BAUMERT SCORES IN SHIELDS CLASS
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 14 Edward C. Baumert 3d sailed kriette to a 20second Shields class victory after 10 miles on Long Island Sound today when a fleet of 132, largest of the Yacht Racing Association cham pionship season, raced off Larchmont Yacht Club.

title: . . . Especially Electronic
description: While the proposals of the Twentieth Century Fund are given small probability of Congressional approval in an election year, especially since they do not favor incumbents, headway on the television front is dis tinctly possible.

title: HUMPHREY HOLDS ECONOMY IS ISSUE
description: WAVERLY, Minn., June 14 The nation's economy, not the war in Vietnam, will be the central issue in this fall's elec tion, former Vice President Hu bert H. Humphrey said today.

title: GOVERNMENT SUES A MARITIME UNION
description: The Federal Government has started legal action against ship radio officers' union in an effort to set aside an election of officers.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Monday, June 15, 1970

title: Bridge:
description: STOCKHOLM, June 14 The bridge teams represent ing five countries were gath ering in the Hotel Foresta here today in preparation for the 17th contest for the Bermuda Bowl beginning to morrow.

title: Esalen Encounter Group Finds British in Touch
description: LONDON, June 14  The Esalen encounter group from the United States, which came here three weeks ago worried that it would get an uptight reception, has discovered that it's really merrie Olde Eng land after all.

title: Muncey's Hydroplane Wins Kentucky Governor's Cup
description: OWENSBORO, Ky., June 14 (AP)Bill Muncey piloted his Myr's Sheet Metal to first place in the second annual Kentucky Governor's Cup Regatta today on the Ohio River.

title: Adventists: Old Faith And New Pressures
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 14, When Christ came the first time, God called on John the Baptist to prepare the way, said Sam Young. This time he's raised up our denomination.

title: Israelis Concerned
description: JERUSALEM, June 14 There was some concern in Israel today that recent turmoil in Jordan could spread to Leb anon and lead to a weakening of the already limited control that Arab governments exer cise over Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Whaleboats Race In Summer Festival Off Shelter Island
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I., June 14 Whaleboats surged through Shelter Island Sound and bands marched along Main Street here this weekend as the summer season opened with the eighth annual Old Whalers Festival.

title: CHASE DISCUSSING JAPANESE VENTURES
description: TOKYO, June 14 (Reuthers) A spokesman for the Mitsu bishi Bank said over the week end it was negotiating with the Chase Manhattan Bank to set up two joint ventures herea business consultant concern and a leasing company.

title: Gibbs & Cox Appoints 3
description: The appointment of three senior vice presidents who will supervise all phases of opera tions has been announced by the naval architectural con cern of Gibbs & Cox. They are Thomas M. Buermann, in charge of the technical group; Richard J. Nesbitt, administra tion, and James J. Convy, fi nance.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Role in Southeast Asia

title: Walinsky Criticizes State On Consumer Fraud Cases
description: Adam Walinsky, who is seek ing the Democratic nomination for Attorney General, charged yesterday that present state procedures for handling con sumer fraud cases encouraged these practices rather than act ing as a deterrent.

title: Seoul Reports 2 Clashes
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 14 (UPI)South Korean troops clashed with North Korean intruders in two incidents along the truce line late last night and early today, the Gov ernment's Central Counteres pionage Command said. Two of the intruders were killed.

title: 3 HOUSING PROJECTS DUE TO GO UP HERE
description: Construction is scheduled to begin soon on three new city MitchellLama rental develop ments involving more than 1,000 middleincome apart ments and a total investment of $28million, the Housing and Development Administration announced today.

title: Heath Responds to Powell, Assailing His Divisiveness
description: LONDON, June 14Edward Heath, the leader of the Con servative party responded today to Enoch Powell's charge that an enemy within was attacking Britain.

title: Swede Holds Sailing Lead
