Lane, the New York Insurance Department said yesterday. The department found the company to be in solvent, and its superintend ent was named as rehabilita tor.

description: COLLEGE WORLD SERIES

title: Italy Beats W. Germany and Brazil Ousts Uruguay to Gain World Cup Final
description: MEXICO CITY, June 17 (AP) Italy defeated West Germany, 43, in overtime and Brazil downed Uruguay, 31, in the World Cup soccer semifinals to day and advanced into Sun day's final.

title: Market Place:
description: Is it possible that if the conglomerates had been more straightforward  revealing profits and losses division by division and quarter by quar terthey might not have taken such a tumble in the bear market?

title: MINE DUMP CHOSEN FOR ATOMIC WASTES
description: TOPEKA, Kan. June 17 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commis sion announced today the tenta tive selection of an abandoned salt mine near Lyons, Kan., as the nation's first under ground radioactive waste repository.

title: Rene Merow Plans Nuptials
description: Mr. and Mrs. Morris Merow of Brooklyn have made known the engagement' of their daughter, Miss Rene Merow, to Lester J. Margareten. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joel Margareten of Kew Gar dens Hills, Queens, and Lake Mohegan, N. Y. The couple plan to be married in Novem ber.

title: POLL FINDS WORRY IN CAMPUS UNREST
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 17 Campus unrest is regarded by Americans as the country's leading problem, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Leaders of 2 Congos End Enmity
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, June 17 (UPI)The Presi dents of the two Congo re publics embraced in the mid dle of the Congo River yes terday to demonstrate the reconciliation of their coun tries.

title: Election in Newark
description: The voters of Newark have given an encouraging demonstration of the health of the American political system. In recent years no city has reflected more alarmingly the acuteness of urban decay, corruption and racial animosity. Yet, in Newark's mayoral elec tion, significant numbers of white voters, ignoring strident appeals to their fears and their prejudices, joined blacks in naming as head of their municipal government the bestqualified candidate, Kenneth A. Gibson.

title: Piccolo Funeral Tomorrow
description: CHICAGO, June 17 (AP)A funeral service for Brian Pic colo, the Chicago Bears' run ning back who died of cancer Tuesday, will he held Friday morning. Mr. Piccolo was 26 years old. A requiem mass will be said in Christ the King Roman Catholic Church, with burial in St. Mary's Cemetery.

title: Cambodians Beset for Centuries by Their Neighbors
description: Ever since the decline of the. Khmer empire, the forerunner; of modern Cambodia, in the; 13th century, the Cambodians have found themselves caught in a predicament like their pres ent one, squeezed between stronger neighbors.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Key Figure in Newark
description: There was a time when John Pershing Canfield was one of the most popular men in Newark.

title: World Bank Sets Loans Of $114Million to Nations
description: LONDON, June 17 (Reuters) The International Bank for Reconstruction and Develop ment group said today that it had approved loans totaling $114.3million to Iran, Pakistan, Niger, Senegal, the Malagasy Republic, Mexico and Honduras.

title: Draft Parley Set in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 (UPI) More than 100 members of the Selective Service System's youth advisory committees around the country will hold a fiveday conference here start ing June 28, the draft director, Curtis W. Tarr, announced to day. Mr. Tarr said the youths would discuss such problems as determining conscientious ob jector status under the Su preme Court's new broadening of that category, abolition of student deferments, dealing with antidraft activities and the proposed national quota system to replace state quotas. day. Mr. Tarr said the youths would discuss such problems as determining conscientious ob jector status under the Su preme Court's new broadening of that category, abolition of student deferments, dealing with antidraft activities and the proposed national quota system to replace state quotas.

title: 6 More Shot as Race Unrest Resumes in Miami Despite Curfew
description: MIAMI, Thursday, June 18 Renewed violence last night and early this morning in Miami's large black community shattered a dusktodawn cur few the police had imposed in the hope of ending two nights of racial unrest.

title: MEDVEDEV FREED AFTER PROTESTS
description: MOSCOW, June 17Zhores A. Medvedev, the biologist whose forced detention in mental hospital touched off pro tests from scientists and writ ers, was provisionally released today and permitted to go home.

title: Rockefeller Announces New Campaign Group
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday the for mation of what was described as a committee to spearhead a statewide, grassroots elec tion campaign under the title of Committee of Inde pendents for the Rockefeller Team.

title: CRANGLE SCORED ON CAMPAIGN AID
description: BUFFALO, June 17Howard J. Samuels, invading the terri tory of one of his toughest op ponents within the Democratic party, promised today a com plete reform of the party to take it out of the hands of selfseeking individuals.

title: SUKARNO'S KIN SAY HE IS GRAVELY ILL
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Thurs day, June 18 (AP)The children of the former President Sukarno gathered today around their ail ing father, and a member of the family said:

title: PRESIDENT IS CHOSEN BY S. S. KRESGE CO
description: Robert E. Dewar has been named president and chief ad ministrative officer of the S. S. Kresge Company, it was an nounced yesterday in Detroit following the annual meeting. Mr. Dewar has been executive vice president for administra tion and finance.

title: Quarry Stops Foster in 6th for Upset at Garden
description: As patient as a tiger in a tree waiting for his prey to appear, Jerry Quarry pounced on Mac Foster with a two clawed attack that produced a sixthround knockout in their heavyweight bout last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: PAUL KERINS
description: Paul Kerins, a senior counsel in the law department of the Kraftco Corporation, formerly the National Dairy Products Corporation, died at his desk yesterday at the concern's headquarters here. He was 52 years old and lived at 23 Leslie Drive, Syosset, L. I.

title: Screen
description: New Yorkers turning blas with the spate of sex films, both factual and fictional, flooding local screens, are advised that The Zodiac Couples, the work of a cou ple of young California moviemakers, which had its world premiere yesterday at the Orleans and Avco Em bassy, is a variant on the marriagemanual type of fea ture exposed here in the re cent past.

title: World Agency Is Sought On Jobs and Population
description: THE HAGUE, June 17The European Economic Com munity's leading farm expert today recommended the estab lishment of a worldwide or ganization with powers to deal with employment and popula tion.

title: Dog's Life in Austria. Is Not Only for Show
description: VIENNA, June 17  To many people, Vienna is the waltzing city of Johann Strauss. To the philotherian, however, it is the capital of the Central European gun dog world. For hundreds of years, we Austrians have hunted in the Alps, said Walter Hiedl, president of the ?? scher Kynologen verband, this country's equiva lent of the Amer ican Kennel Club. Almost every hunter has his dog to help him find game. We breed dogs to work, not just sit on the sofa. For ex ample, I have dachshunds. Every one is a good working dog and has hunted badger and fox.

title: Reporter in Vietnam Loses His Credentials for 30 Days
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 17 (AP)The United States military command an nounced today that it had sus pended for 30 days the cre dentials of George Esper, a cor respondent for The Associated Press, for violating the com mand's rules governing the publication of military informa tion.

title: SWITZERLAND GETS ANTIINFLATION LAW
description: GENEVA, June 17The Swiss parliament gave final approval today to a diluted version of a Government bill for fighting inflation by freezing 5 per cent of export receipts.

title: 8 Killed in Buenos Aires As a Building Collapses
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 17 (Reuters)At least eight persons were killed and 15 injured last night when condemned 14story apartment building collapsed and dragged down an adjacent ninestory building that was under con struction.

title: Criminal Law Code That Would Widen Federal Jurisdiction Proposed by Presidential Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 17A Presidential study commission unveiled today tentative sug gestions for an overhaul of the Federal Government's criminal laws that could broaden Federal jurisdiction over local crimes.

title: Louis Lufrano, ExOfficer Of Teamsters Joint Council
description: Louis Lufrano, former secre tarytreasurer of Joint Council 16, International Brotherhood of Teamsters, died yesterday at Astoria General Hospital in Queens. He was 82 years old and lived at 2411 33d Street, Astoria.

title: Consortium Strikes Oil Off the Coast of Ghana
description: ACCRA, Ghana, June 17 (Reuters)  An American con sortium has struck oil on the Atlantic continental shelf about eight miles off the coast of Ghana, it was announced today.

title: Saskatchewan Farms Get Bigger but Many Hamlets Are Dying
description: FIELDING, Saskatchewan In the nineteentwenties, when Chester Ferris was a boy, Fielding had a bank, a threestory hotel and two ga rages and a beauty parlor, butcher shop, Chinese laun dry, blacksmith shop, doc tor's office, pool hall and hat shop.

title: Mrs. Noble, Mrs. Ruvaine Gain Jersey Medal on 73
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 17 Mrs. James Noble of Morris County and Mrs. Joseph Ruvaine of Canoe Brook, the defending chardpions, won the qualifying medal today for the Garden State Women's Golf Association's betterball match play championship.

title: Cancer Cells, in an Experiment, Appear to Lose Malignancy
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 Cancer cells appear to have been transformed into noncan cerous cells in laboratory ex periments reported here.

title: CLASHES DISRUPT GERMAN HOLIDAY
description: BONN, June 17Amid signs of deep political division, West Germany today marked its an nual Day of National Unity, marking the 1953 uprising of East German workers against the Communist regime.

title: China Tightens Curbs on Student Rebels
description: HONG KONG, June 17Com munist China, which has en thusiastically endorsed the antiEstablishment activities of young people around the world, is adopting increasingly repres sive measures against its own student rebels.

title: VOLOSHEN ADMITS PLOT TO DEFRAUD FEDERAL AGENCIES
description: Nathan M. Voloshen, lawyer and lobbyist, pleaded guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to conspiring with an aide of House Speaker John W. McCor mack to use the prestige of Mr. McCormack's Washington of fice to defraud agencies of the Federal Government.

title: LONNIE JOHNSON, 81, JAZZ GUITARIST, DIES
description: TORONTO, June 17 (AP) Lonnie Johnson, considered one of the top jazz guitar play ers, was found dead in his Toronto apartment yesterday. He had spent a long period in the hospital last year after a street accident. He was 81 years old.

title: GASOLINE PRICES TO DROP IN NORTH
description: A number of oil companies that operate refineries in the MidContinent region have re duced prices on gasoline for shipment to the north, it was announced yesterday.

title: Owners and Union Are Seeking Ways To Raise Cab Fares
description: Representatives of taxi fleet owners and unionized drivers have been meeting to seek ways to end their contract before its expiration date and to increase fares, it was disclosed yester day.

title: I.T.T. IS CONTINUING HARTFORD FIRE BID
description: A new series of legal ma neuvers by Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, against the merger of the International Telephone and Telegraph Cor poration and the Hartford Fire Insurance Company failed to deter I.T.T. from going ahead with merger plans yesterday.

title: LANDLORDS AGREE TO A 3YEAR PACT
description: Representatives of landlords agreed yesterday to a three year contract providing 25,000 doormen, elevator operators, handymen and porters with wage increases averaging 40 per cent.

title: L.I. Company Told to Give Up 16,179 of Its Starter Guns
description: A Long Island mail order company has been ordered to forfeit 16,179 convertible starter guns on the ground that they were imported from Italy in vio lation of the Gun Control Act of 1968.

title: Businessmen Applaud and Criticize Nixon Speech
description: The business and financial community greeted President Nixon's economic speech yes terday with a mixture of ap plause, indifference and some disappointment.

title: A.B.A. Seeks to Head Off N.C.A.A. Boycott Over Simpson Signing
description: Jack Dolph, commissioner of the American Basketball Association, headed off a confrontation with the Na tional Collegiate Athletic As sociation yesterday over the signing of Ralph Simpson of Michigan State, one of the nation's outstanding sopho more players last season, by the Denver Rockets to a re ported fiveyear contract at $750,000.

title: NIXON ENDORSES STOCK INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 17  President Nixon formally en dorsed today legislation creat ing a system of insurance for investors against brokerage house failures.

title: NARCOTICS GUARD SHOT IN BROOKLYN
description: A correction officer at a state narcotics center in Brook lyn was shot in the abdomen yesterday, allegedly by a pa tient.

title: Washington For the Record
United Aircraft Planning To Drop 700 More Jobs
description: HARTFORD, June 17 (AP) The United Aircraft Corpora tion said today it would lay off 700 more employes at three of its divisions in Connecticut, bringing the total reduction in the concern's jobs in the state this year to 3,000.

title: Casual Water to Hamper U.S. Open Field Today
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 17 The United States Open golf championship begins here to morrow under conditions baf fling to the contestants and officials.

title: Personal Income in May Fell to $793Billion Rate
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 (UPI) The total personal come of Americans declined in May for the first time in almost five years to a seasonally ad justed annual rate of $793.51 billion, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: Bridge:
description: STOCKHOLM, June 17 The Dallas Aces, strongly favored to win for the United States its first world cham pionship title since 1954, held a commanding lead at the end of the first cycle of qualifying play here.

title: Ships That Pass in Night (and Day) Get Mail Service
description: DETROIT, June 17 (AP) The mailinapail postal service began its 75th year of deliveries today to ships passing the city on the De troit River.

title: Books of The Times
description: Return with us now to the thrilling sub ject of sociology. In our last episode, Alvin W. Gouldner rode into Function Junction on a quasiMarxist horse and slew the sheriff, Talcott Parsons, with a musket full of moral values. Distraught Functionalists complained about the loss of Equilibrium. Dr. Gouldner, before galloping off into the sunset in search of a Reflexive Sociology, advised them to look into their own hearts, the Welfare State, the slums of Function Junction and the idea that some power arrangements and institutional relation ships are more ethical than others. Angst! The Functionalists retired in methodologi cal confusion to the Rand and Hudson saloons, where they drank bile and mut tered about nodes of transition, canonical variations, propaedeutic scenarios.

title: Synod Tells Church School To Admit Negro Children
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., June 17 (AP)  Timothy Christian School in Cicero, Ill., has been ordered by the Christian Re formed Church Synod to admit black children without further delay.

title: Mrs. Elizabeth C. Gray Wed to Richard Hunter
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., June 17Mrs. Elizabeth Christian Gray, widow of Bowman Gray Jr., who was president and board chairman of the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company, was married at noon today to Richard Ed ward Thomas Hunter of Wal lingford, Conn., a master at the Choate School there.

title: Addonizio Jury Is Told of Plan To Control Jobs by Kickbacks
description: TRENTON, June 17A plan for a contractors' joint ven ture to control a $10million to $12million Newark sewer construction project for $1mil lion in kickbacks took form in 1964, a witness testified here today in the extortion trial of Hugh J. Addonizio, outgoing Mayor of Newark, and six oth er defendants.

title: NIXON ASKS FOR RESTRAINT ON WAGEPRICE DEMANDS;
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 President Nixon announced to the nation today that he was standing by his basic strategy against inflation and recession.

title: Transcript of the President's Address to Nation on Inflation and Economic Policy
description: Good afternoon, my fellow Americans. Today I would like to share with you my thoughts on three subjects that reach into the homes and the pocket books of every familyyour job, your income and your cost of living.

title: Appeals Judge Orders Secrecy in Hearings on Baltimore Indictment Blocked by Mitchell
description: BALTIMORE, June 17The case of an indictment voted by a Federal grand jury here but blocked by Attorney General John N. Mitchell has been plunged deeper into mystery and controversy.

title: Examiner Bids P.S.C. Limit Con Ed to $80Million Rise
description: A hearing examiner recom mended yesterday that the State Public Service Commis sion approve an $80.4million increase in electricity rates for the Consolidated Edison Com pany.

title: Laird Sees Need for Mideast Balance
description: ABOARD U.S.S. FRANKLIN D. ROOSEVELT, in the Mediter ranean, June 17Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that it was most im portant that we maintain mil itary, strategic balance in the Middle East.

title: 3D SITE APPROVED FOR ABM SYSTEM BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 17  The Senate Armed Services committee approved today an expansion of the antiSoviet phase of the Nixon Administra tion's missile defense system. But it rejected a proposed start on the antiChinese phase, which the Administration had described as essential.

title: Selection of Jury to Hear Trial of a Black Panther in New Haven Bogs Down
description: NEW HAVEN, June 17 Efforts to select a jury to hear the case of a Black Panther charged in the kidnapping and murder of a fellow party mem ber were at a standstill today.

title: Miss Shawna Donovan Betrothed
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 17The engagement of Miss Shawna Mary Donovan to Robert Arthur Lavigne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Omer D. La vigne of Leominster, Mass., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Donovan Jr. A wedding in November is planned.

title: Jersey Crime Problem Made Clear to Cahill
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 17 (UPI)Someone stole Gov. William T. Cahill's unlocked car.

title: AntiBlack Bias Is Charged to WPIX and Denied
description: WPIXTV, Channel 11, was accused yesterday of a policy of antiblack bias in the selec tion of talent for one of its for mer rock music programs, The Clay Cole Show. The station quickly denied the allegation.

title: Italian Modern's Problem Popularity
description: Will success spoil modern Italian furniture?

title: Observer: With Robert at the End
description: WASHINGTON, June 17  Just for a few minutes, Robert's wife whispered. He is very weak.

title: PRICES ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
World Cup Soccer
description: GROUP I

title: Roundup: Hegan Helping Yanks in Role as Brewer
description: Mike Hegan never did much for the Yankees when he was a Yankee, but he's making up for it as a Brewer.

title: DEFICIT IS SHOWN BY DINERS CLUB
description: Diners Club, Inc., controlled by the Continental Corporation, had a loss after taxes of about $13million in the fiscal year ended March 31 or a total of $23million with an additional nonrecurring writeoff of about $10million, the preliminary un audited company report dis closed yesterday. Audited fig ures are expected before the end of July.

title: Hussein Acts to Reassert Leadership After Turmoil
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 17 King Hussein sought to reas sert his leadership at a news conference today during which he pointedly praised the Jor danian Armythe mainstay of his shrunken powerand criti cized extremist Palestinian com mandos.

title: Ottinger Proposes an Increase In Pollution Violation Penalty
description: A sharp increase In the pen alties for air and water pollu tion, including fines of $1,000 a day for violators, were pro posed yesterday by Represen tative Richard L. Ottinger.

title: Cairo Hints It Will Study U. S. Peace Bid
description: CAIRO, June 17The United Arab Republic indicated today that it was in a receptive mood to study United States initia tives aimed at a settlement of the ArabIsraeli conflict.

title: New Technique Permits DeepSea Drilling
description: BOSTON, June 17In an achievement that opens a vast realm of the ocean floor to exploration and exploitation, a drill string has been hauled out of a hole in the deep ocean floor and then guided back in to that hole from a ship float ing almost two miles above it.

title: GORDON ANTHONY, 51, LED HARRODS LTD.
description: Gordon Anthony, the manag ing director of Harrods Ltd., the London department store, died in London Tuesday after a short illness. He was 51 years old.

title: For Stavropoulos, The Time Is Right
description: Despite the usual opening day flutters, George Stavrop oulos was a man of content ment yesterday. And why not? Next month he returns to Athens a conquering hero, at the request of the Hellenic Fashion Institute. Along with James Galanos, Dimitri Krit sas and Nico Terzi of Maxi milian Furs  other Greeks who have made it in this countryhe'll show his de signs and hopefully draw at tention to the designers working in Athens. countryhe'll show his de signs and hopefully draw at tention to the designers working in Athens.

title: 3 Firebombs Explode Near N.Y.U. in Village
description: Three Molotov cocktails ex ploded and burned at separate locations in the New York Uni versity area in Greenwich Vil lage last night, but little or no damage resulted, according to the police. A fourth firebomb, found earlier in the East Village, failed to explode.

title: Advertising: Thinkers Map a Better Earth
description: Once you got past the iron door at the top of the steep stairs at 1034 Lexington Ave nue, it was easy, enough to tell the thinkers from the visitors.

title: Dr. Salk and Francoise Gilot, Picasso's ExMistress, to Wed
description: Dr. Jonas E. Salk, the physi cian who developed the vac cine against polio that bears his name, and Francoise Gilot, the mistress of Pablo Picasso for 11 years and mother of two of the artist's children, plan to be married July 9.

title: THE YOUNG LORDS SEIZE XRAY UNIT
description: Members of the Young Lords Party walked up to a mobile chest Xray unit yesterday at 116th Street and Lexington Avenue, seized it and moved it to another site in East Harlem.

title: Market Drop Echoed
description: LONDON, June 17The long bear market on Wall Street has been reflected in a decline in the assets of some 200 inter national offshore funds, an un usual compilation by Inter vestment Management, Ltd., showed today.

title: House Tally On Vote Bill
A.T. &T. REPORTS DROP IN EARNINGS
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company and its sub sidiaries showed lower earnings for the three months ended May 31 despite a new high in operating revenues for the period.

title: O'DWYER STEPS UP OTTINGER ATTACK
description: Paul O'Dwyer yesterday re newed his attacks on one of his opponents in the Demo cratic Senatorial race, Repre sentative. Richard L. Ottinger, asserting that he had clearly violated the state law that sets a limit on spending in pri mary campaigns.

title: BookFilm Workers Rally for Peace
description: In an unusual work stop page for peace, several thou sand members of the book publishing and film industries observed a day of positive action yesterday to mobilize support for political candi dates opposed to the Indo china war.

title: Soviet Astronauts Test Their Eyesight
description: MOSCOW, June 17 (UPI) The Sovuz 9 astronauts, now in the 16th day of their record breaking space endurance flight, are conducting eye ex periments to determine the ef fect of prolonged space flight on vision, Soviet specialists said today.

title: GENERAL DYNAMICS IN ACCOUNTING MOVE
description: The General Dynamics Cor poration issued yesterday com ments about changes in its 1969 income statement, while pointing out that its reported profits of $2.5million, or 24 cents a share, were unchanged.

title: Washington:
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 When the House of Representa tives voted 272 to 132 to lower the voting age from 21 to 18 in all Federal, state and local elections, it raised some funda mental questions for the Presi dent, the Supreme Court and the young people of this country.

title: HARRY G. TANE
description: Harry G. Tane, president of the Gotham Building Mainten ance Corporation, died Wednes day at Presbyterian Hospital after a long illness. He was 57 years old and lived on Beech wood Road, Ossining, N. Y.

title: MRS. BERT C. GOSS
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 18 Mrs. Ruth McCarthy Goss, wife of Bert C. Goss, chairman and chief executive officer of Hill & Knowlton, Inc., public relations firm, died yesterday after a long illness at the Neuro logical Institute, Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center, New York. She was 62 years old and lived at 12 Sunset Avenue.

title: ZIOBRO, ALPERT GOLF FINALISTS
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 18 Billy Ziobro of Ash Brook, a 21yearold senior at Mary land, and Jeff Alpert of Flor ham Park, a 25yearold truck ing executive, will meet for the New Jersey State Golf As sociation's 69th amateur cham pionship tomorrow.

title: Mining Acquisition Is Set; Brooklyn Banks to Merge
description: The board of directors of the Houston Natural Gas Corpora tion and the Banner Mining Company have approved a letter of intent to merge Ban ner into Houston Natural Gasi through an exchange of stock valued at about $148million on a fully converted basis.

title: Rhodesian Group Seeks Role for Black Students
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 18 (Agence FrancePresse)A student group in this white dominated Country is demanding that blacks be represented in the government of the Univer sity College of Rhodesia when it attains university status.

title: Head of Los Alamos To Get Fermi Award
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP)Dr. Norris E. Bradbury, 61 years old, who has di rected a key nuclear weapons development facility for a quarter of a century, was named today to receive the Atomic Energy Commission's $25,000 Enrico Fermi Award for 1970.

title: U.S. REPORT FEARS SUMMER DISORDERS
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI)  A confidential Justice De partment report on prospects for civil disorders this summer forecasts potential trouble in the Negro areas of densely pop ulated big cities, particularly in the Middle West and on the East and West Coasts.

title: Coty Awardsthe Winners
description: For Chester Weinberg, it was his soft, clingy clothes in muted colorings with a sub dued quality.

title: Annual Fair Set At St. Johnland
description: KINGS PARK, L. I., June 18The St. Johnland an nual Summer Day Fair will be held on Thursday at the St. Johnland Home for the Aged, on Sunken Meadow Road, from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. rain or shine. The residents at the home have been helping the committee pre pare.

title: Soyuz 9 Craft Completes 17 Days in Earth's Orbit
description: MOSCOW, June 18 (AP)  The Soviet Union's Soyuz 9 spaceship completed 17 days in the earth's orbit today.

title: Liguori Is Third in Mile Heat
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 18 Last year, Marty Liguori was the challenger who wanted a piece of the action, a place alongside Jim Ryun of the international track and field honor roll.

title: POSTAL PAY RISE AND REFORM PLAN PASSED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, June 18As blueshirted mailmen watched from the galleries above, the House voted tonight to revamp the nation's 181yearold postal system and give postal workers an 8 per cent pay rise.

title: LEASCO OFFERING TO BUY ITS STOCK
description: The Leasco Data Processing Equipment Corporation an nounced yesterday that it had offered to purchase 400,000 shares of its Series B preferred stock and 500,000 of its war rants from a group of private investors for $31.9million in cash. The current market value lof the securities is about $11.7 million.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
description: AREA ASchool tuna and striped bass have been ap pearing in fair amounts in Barnegat Light waters. One charter boat. The Flyer, re turned to port yesterday with 21 tuna ranging to 40 pounds. They were taken on The Ridge while trolling with feathers and spoons. Another boat, the Rascal, came home with 16 stripers up to 20 pounds. They were captured with live shrimp and plugs in the Inlet at anchor. From the surf, the pickings for kingfish have been slim. Fluke are beginning to appear and seem most interested in squid and spearing.

title: Man and Wife Get 15 Years For. Importation of Heroin
description: A man and wife were sen tenced to 15 years in jail and a $15,000 fine each yesterday after a Federal grand jury con victed them of importing more than five pounds of pure heroin, which they obtained from two members of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

title: Patman Will Press For Aid to Transit Using a Trust Fund
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 Representative Wright Patman, chairman of the House Commit tee on Banking and Currency, indicated today that he would seek major amendments in the Nixon Administration's pending mass transit legislation.

title: AUTOMOBILE OUTPUT DECLINED FOR WEEK
description: DETROIT, June 18 (AP) United States automakers lost more ground this week with production of 181,551 cars, down from 189,963 for the com parable week a year ago.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Armada from Athens, by Peter Green (Doubleday, $7.95). Of the sea expedition of 415 B.C. against Syracuse.

title: Marine in Vietnam Says 4 in Patrol I Killed 16 on Orders
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Friday, June 19 (UPI)A young corporal in the United States Marine Corps told a court martial today that he had watched four other marines, on the orders of their patrol leader, shoot to death 16 Vietnamese women and children at a hamlet in the Oueson valley.

title: Cairo Says Israel Uses New U.S. Bombs
description: CAIRO, June 18 (AP)  The authoritative newspaper Al Ah ram reported today that Israeli jets had dropped latemodel American bombs on the United Arab Republic.

title: Belmont Jockeys
Cathleen O'Donnell Is Betrothed
description: KATONAH, N. Y., June 18 John F. O'Donnell, general counsel to the Transport Workers Union of America, and Mrs. O'Donnell have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cathleen O'Donnell, to Cas J. Paprocki, son of Mrs. Stanley Paprocki of Steubenville, Ohio, and the late Mr. Paprocki. The wedding will take place here Aug. 29.

title: MRS. LEE LAURIE
description: EASTON, Md., June 18Mrs. Mildred Allen Laurie, widow of Lee Laurie, a sculptor, died to day in the HouseinthePines near Easton after a long illness.

title: French Reserves Inch Up
description: PARIS, June 18 (UPI)The Bank of France announced to day that France's official gold and foreignexchange reserves rose by $4,175,325 last week, one of her smallest increases this year. Overall reserves stood at $3,925,970,560 on June 11, compared with $3,921,732, 235 a week before.

title: MEDIA CONFERENCE COVERS WIDE RANGE
description: PLAINFIELD, Vt., June 18  Yippies, black radicals and cor poration executives are min gling on the wooded Goddard College campus this week for a conference on alternative media in a changing world.

title: SENATE TO MEET NIGHTS IN LOGJAM
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 With considerable interparty jockeying, the Senate moved today to break the legislative logjam created by its protract ed Cambodian debate by agree ing to hold evening sessions to consider Administration bills.

title: STACKS IN LONDON SHOW SLIGHT GAIN
50Year Relationship Is Ending
description: There was a party yesterday at Fuller & Smith & Ross for John F. Wagener, vice president and group head on the Hercules, Inc., account. He deserved it, too.

title: BIG LINE WINNER IN OPEN JUMPING
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 18 Big Line, who won the Na tional Horse Show champion ship two years ago, captured the first open jumper class to day as the Fairfield County Horse Show got under way. The event runs through Sun day at the Fairfield County Hunt Club.

title: Presbyterian Synod Elects
description: SENECA FALLS, N. Y., June 18 (AP)The Rev. Dr. George H. DeHority Jr. of Berwyn, Ill., today became synod executive, or fulltime administrator, of the United Presbyterian Synod of New York. He was elected at the synod's annual meeting, held at Eisenhower College. Dr. DeHority succeeds the Rev. Dr. Hermann N. Morse.

title: Card of Thanks
description: WEIDR. PEIHSIU. Mrs. PeiHsiu Wei and family sincerely wish to thank their friends and relatives for their kind expressions of sympathy, attendance, and help during their recent bereavement.

title: Patman Summons Principals To Defend Penn Central Loan
description: Representative Wright Patman, chairman of the House Banking and Currency Committee, said yesterday he had insisted that the Defense Department not guarantee a $200million bank borrowing of the Penn Central Company until his committee has com pleted an investigation of the Penn Central deal.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In this era of the supersell and the mil liondollar bonus, we give you Tug McGraw of the New York Mets, a lefthanded relief pitcher who arrived in baseball six years ago without a lawyer, literary agent, busi ness manager or ghost writer. He did arrive with a $7,000 bonus, but he spent most of that on a convertible, which he no longer has.

title: CAROLINA BUSING FOCUS OF APPEAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 Lawyers for black children in Charlotte, N. C., appealed to the Supreme Court today in an effort to overturn a decision of the United States Court of Ap peals for the Fourth Circuit, which ruled out reasonable busing to achieve desegregation.

title: Floridians Trade Freeman To Utah, Get Rockets' Jones
description: MIAMI, June 18 (AP)Don nie Freeman was traded today by the Miami Floridians as the American Basketball Associa tion's weakest team, in a sec ond deal, acquired an allleague guard, Larry Jones, from the Denver Rockets.

title: L.I. Bishop Warns Of Catholic Canon Against Abortions
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., June 18  Roman Catholic physicians, nurses and other medical personnel on Long Is land were forbidden today, un der penalty of excommunica tion, to perform or otherwise take part in abortions.

title: Road to Saigon Severed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 18  Vietnamese Communist troops today cut the last major surface route open in Cambodia, the highway linking Pnompenh with Saigon.

title: Laird Arrives in Spain
description: MADRID, June 18 (Reuters) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird arrived here from Rome today for a fiveday visit that will include talks on United States military bases in Spain.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Effects of Rent Law

title: FULL RIGHTS DRIVE IN SCHOOLS VOWED
description: WASHINGTON, June 18  Jerris Leonard, Justice Depart ment civil rights chief, pledged today prompt Federal action next fall against supposedly de segregated Southern schools that, in fact, discriminate in ternally against black students.

title: ISRAELIS CONTINUE BOMBINGS AT CANAL
description: TEL AVIV, June 18 (Reuters) Israeli jets today continued their continual bombing of Egyptian military targets on the western bank of the Suez Canal it was announced here. A military spokesman here said that all planes had returned stfely.

title: Unveilings
description: ALTMANPaullne. Unveiling will take place on Sunday, June 21, at 11 A.M., at Mount Judah Cemetery, Brooklyn, Section 2, Block 12.

title: U.S. Deaths in War Increase for Week; Injured Toll Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 18 (UPI)Fighting in In dochina last week killed 130 Americans and wounded 364, the United States command reported today. The number killed, an increase over the pre vious week, included 93 men slain in South Vietnam and 37 in Cambodia.

title: Books of The Times
description: BALL FOUR. My Life and Hard Times Throw ing the Knuckleball in the Big Leagues. By Jim Bouton. Edited by Leonard Shecter. Illustrated. 400 pages: World. $6.95.

title: A Woman Director Turns King John Into Modern Farce
description: STRATFORDONAVON, Eng land, June 18King John, at the Royal Shakespeare Theater, launches the Royal Shakespeare Company's 23yearold first woman director. Even without the help of a name like Buzz Goodbody, there would be no danger of ignoring her con tribution.

title: Amex Prices End Session Mixed On a 2,335,900Share Turnover
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mixed yester day in light trading.

title: H.B.P.A. Proposes New, Salaried State Racing Commission
description: The Horsemen's Benevolent and Protective Association called yesterday for the aboli tion of the threemember New York State Racing Commis sion, charging its members were dilettantes and unresponsive to the small horse owners and trainers.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Soybeans future prices rose as much as 3 cents a bushel in early trading on the Chi cago Board of Trade but a late run of selling trimmed prices near the close.

title: NEGOTIATING SNAG CHARGED TO N.F.L.
description: The National Football League Players Association has filed with the National Labor Rela tions Board a charge of unfair labor practices by the league owners and out the window has gone both sides' promise of a peaceful contract settlement this year.

title: N.B.C. Offers Democrats Time for Reply to Nixon
description: The National Broadcasting Company said yesterday that it will give time next week on its television and radio networks for Congressional spokesmen to answer Presi dent Nixon's economic report.

title: Woodstock Up Tight As Hippies Drift In
description: WOODSTOCK, N. Y., June 18  Woodstock (the movie) opened last night in Wood stock (the village) amid some fear here that this community might soon face the kind of youth invasion depicted in the film.

title: Yanks Traveling at 696 Pace for Last 46 Games After Beating Red Sox, 32
description: BOSTON, June 18The Yan kees, who have become New York's favorite underdogs since the Mets, defeated the Boston Red Sox, 32, tonight and crept to within 1 games of the firstplace Baltimore Orioles.

title: School Board Weighs 6 for Chancellor
description: After trying unsuccessfully for nearly a year to find a man to head the city school system, the Board of Education now hopes to name a chancel lor before the end of this month.

title: STUDENTS SCORE FACULTY STRIKERS
description: LOS ANGELES, June 18 Conservatives who now domi nate the Board of Regents of the University of California in sisted today on hearing a stu dent investigative group's accu sation that members of the faculty supported an antiwar strike at the Berkeley campus this spring.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: FINER FUTURES BEGIN WITH FRESH AIR FUND.

title: Sukarno, Seriously Ill, Seems To Respond to Treatment
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, June 18 Former President Sukarno was reported to be responding to treatment today in an army hospital here. His condition was described as critical last night. No official medical report has been released, but one of his daughters, Rachma Wati, said this morning that her father was much more talkative.

title: 5 IN PLAYGROUND HURT BY GUNFIRE
description: Four children and a woman were wounded in a spray of shotgun pellets when they were caught in a dispute between two groups of young men on a playground in the South Ozone Park section of Queens yester day.

title: City Seeks to Take Over Shakespeare Theater
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Au relio said yesterday that the city would attempt to take over the New York Shakespeare Fes tival's Public Theater at 425 Lafayette Street, but would not provide additional funds for the free Shakespearean perform ances in Central Park nor for the mobile unit that tours the city.

title: SLAYING IN IOWA SPURS DISORDERS
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 18 (UPI)Rock throwing and loot ing in a predominantly Negro section followed the death to night of a black escaped con vict in a gun battle with po licemen.

title: Council Expected to Take Rent ProfitSetting Power
description: Mayor Lindsay's plan to give a city agency the authority to set profit levels in rentcon trolled apartment houses will almost certainly be substituted with a program placing that Dower with the City Council.

title: Mary E. Deane Married on L.I.
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., June 18The out door chapel of St. John's Episcopal Church was the setting this evening for the marriage of Miss Mary Evelyn Deane, one of the first 80 coeds at Dartmouth College this year, to Thorne Gordon Butler. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Robert Huneke of St. Dominic's Roman Catholic Church, assisted by the Rev. Lyman Bleecker.

title: PACE MODERATES IN MONEY GROWTH
Fire Truck Is FireBombed During Blaze in Tenement
description: An overnight spate of fire bombings which started in Greenwich Village was cli maxed early yesterday when soineone pitched a molotov cocktail into the hose bed of a fire truck while firemen were battling a twoalarm tenement blaze at 8 and 10 Avenue B in the East Village.

title: Foreign Affairs:
description: ERIVAN, U.S.S.R.It is pre mature to speak of a Brezhnev policy for the Soviet Union be cause, although the Communist party chief has moved steadily to the fore since Khrushchev was ousted six years ago, he doesn't yet run a oneman show.

title: CONSUMER PRICES CONTINUE TO RISE AT 0.5% A MONTH
New American Review Loses Sponsor
description: New American Review, the last of the massmarket paper back literary journals, is being abandoned by its publisher, the New American Library, a subsidiary of The Times Mirror Company of Los Angeles.

title: BIRRELL CONVICTED IN STOCK FRAUD HERE
description: Lowell M. Birrell, the finan cier, was convicted last night by a Federal Court jury of par ticipating in a fraudulent scheme to use blank stock certificates as security for a $5,000 bank loan in 1966.

title: Store Sales Reported
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The Commerce Department to day estimated last week's de partment store sales at $740 million, up 2 per cent from the yearearlier $727million. Last week's total store sales were about $7,098,000,000, down 1 per cent from $7,153,000,000.

title: The Misses Petersen and Watson Bow
description: The Misses Suzanne Elise Petersen and Susan C. Wat son, who have been best friends since they were 4 years old, were presented at a dinnerdance last evening to 325 guests of their parents at the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: Arrests Reported in Abduction in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANIERO, June 18  The police and secret serv ices have begun an unobtrusive search for the kidnappers who held the West German Ambas sador to Brazil for five days, forcing the Government to re lease 40 political prisoners.

title: Advertising:
description: Are you wondering what kind of billings and profit projections agencies are making for the second half of the year? Everyone's en titled to wonder, you know.

title: Qualifying Races at Westbury Keep Owners, Trainers Sighing
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 18 During this morning's eight qualifying events at Roosevelt Raceway George Wampetich, Lee Benson and Mrs. Barbara Katz held their breaths, crossed their fingers and did what many owners andor trainers do at times when they are not sure about their horses.

title: MRS. DEANE M'GOWEN
description: TEANECK, N. J., June 18 Irene Mary Byrnes McGowen, wife of Deane McGowen, sports writer for The New York Times, died today, apparently of a heart attack, in her home at 84 Blauvelt Street. She was 49 years old.

title: CANDIDATES OFFER POSTAL PAY PLAN
description: Two candidates for the Dem ocratic nomination for United States Senator called yesterday for legislation that would give postal workers in New York, and other cities where the cost of living is high, better pay than those in areas where the cost is lower.

title: Senatorial Primary
description: In this difficult period of an unwanted war, urgent domestic problems and a divided people, there is special need for men of courage, judgment and liber alism in the United States Congress. Thirtyfive seats in the Senate will be filled by voters across the country this year, one of them from New York State.

title: Tory Party Embraces a Wide Spectrum
description: LONDON, Friday, June 19 Within the whirl of British pol itics, the Conservative party has emerged as a powerful force that blends a wide spec trum of personalities and styles and aims.

title: In Memorian
description: GORDONEdna. So many people need you now, more than ever. Your many years of love and labor are now the benefits of others. Your sons will always remember.

title: Union Calls Bill Great
description: A spokesman for the 26,000 member Manhattan and Bronx Postal Union said last night that his union would not strike if the Senate passed a bill similar to the one passed by the House, United Press Interna tional reported.

title: Aid Asked by Red Cross For Peru Quake Victims
description: The American Red Cross announced yesterday that new or clean serviceable win ter clothing and blankets as well as cash contributions were needed for victims of the Peruvian earthquake.

title: Miles Davis's New Group Cuts Deeper Into Rock at he Fillmore
description: Miles Davis is cutting deep er into the rock underground this weekend at Fillmore East. The jazz trumpeter is appearing there with his sep tet through tomorrow, shar ing the bill with Laura Nyro, the singer and composer.

title: Heller Pleased With Catch22 Film
description: Catch22, Joseph Heller's huge practical joke on the Department of Defense, is about to be told a few million more times.

title: MUTINY CONVICTIONS OF 3 MORE REVERSED
description: WASHINGTON. June 18 (UPI)  The United States Army Court of Military Re view reversed today the mutiny convictions of three more men who were courtmartialed after a sitdown demonstration at the Presidio stockade in San Fran cisco in October. 1968.

title: U.S. Court Panel Voids Part of State Voting Law
description: A panel of three Federal judges yesterday voided some sections of the State Election Law that the jurists said had discriminated unconstitutional ly against socalled independent parties.

title: Henry Hintermeister, 73, Painted Historic Subjects
description: PINELLAS, Fla., June 18 Henry Hintermeister, an artist who painted historical subjects of the Washington era, died at his home here last Thursday after a short illness. He was 73 years old and until recently lived and had a studio in Tuck ahoe, N. Y.

title: Penn Central Refurbishing Is Disputed
description: Some commuters say they haven't noticed it, but the Penn Central is making a vigorous effort to refurbish many of its antiquated cars.

title: MURPHY QUITS POST WITH TECHNICOLOR
description: LOS ANGELES, June 18 (UPI) Senator George Mur phy, Republican of California, whose $20,000 post as consul tant and a director of Techni color, Inc. was an issue in the California Republican primary election, left the post today.

title: Executive Changes
description: S. Peter Kamins has been appointed vice president of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc. and assistant merchan dising manager of the cotton division, it was an nounced yesterday. He has been an assistant general sales manager for the division since 1964.

title: Tobacco Company's Structure Revised
description: A realignment of its corpo rate structure, a change in name of two subsidiaries, the appointment of new execu tives and the formal adop tion of a new logo were an nounced yesterday by the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Com pany.

title: Argentine President Sworn In With 5 Cabinet Aides
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 18 (Reuters)Brig Gen. Roberto Marcelo Levingston took the oath of office as President of Argentina today and then swore in five of the six Cabinet ministers who were appointed last night.

title: Firemen's Union Here Endorses Rockefeller
description: The 12,000member Uni formed Firefighters Associa tion endorsed Governor Rockefeller yesterday in his campaign for reelection.

title: Bonn Lowers Voting Age In Federal Elections to 18
description: BONN, June 18 (AP)West Germany today lowered the minimum age for voters in fed eral elections to 18. Some states already have this voting age.

title: Lee Remick Cited in Divorce
description: LONDON, June 18 (AP)A British actress was awarded a divorce today after the court was told her husband had com mitted adultery with Lee Rem ick, the actress. A decree on grounds of adultery was grant ed 30yearold Valerie Gearon, who played Anne Boleyn's sis ter in the film Anne of the Thousand Days. Miss Gearon was married to William Rory Gowans, a movie director, in 1962. Miss Remick, 33, had her marriage to Bill Colleran dissolved last year.

title: Student Filmmakers Will Get Cash Prizes
description: Cash prizes totaling $22,500 aod two fellowships for ad vanced film study will be awarded to competitors in the Fifth National Student Film Festival, to be held Oct. 13 at Philharmonic Hall. A fivejudge panel will name five firstprize winners, who will receive $2,500 each, with additional grant prizes of $500 each going to 20 other filmmakers.

title: Freedom Game Foes Picked
description: LOS ANGELES, June 18 (UPI)Alcorn A. and M. will meet Tennessee State in the Urban League's second annual Freedom Football Classic Sept. 11. In last year's Freedom Classic before more than 62,000 fans at the Coliseum, Alcorn beat Grambling, 387.

title: TAX RULING AIDS SUPPORT OF AGED
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The Internal Revenue Service, reversing a 13yearold ruling, has decided that a single per son who pays the entire cost of maintaining an elderly parent in a rest home or home for the aged may pay his income tax at the advantageous headof household rates.

title: Meehan Urges Greater Effort on Crime
description: District Attorney Robert R Meehan of Rockland County, who is running a lowbudget campaign for the Democratic nomination for State Attorney General, says that if nominated and elected he would be the leader in the war on crime.

title: Theater: From Prisonto Off Broadway
description: We have seen theater of the streets, or for that matter theater of the ghetto. Now in The Cage, which opened last night at the Play house Theater, we can see theater of the prison.

title: Williams and Gross Meet in First Campaign Debate
description: NEWARK, June 18Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., the Democratic candidate for re election, assailed the Nixon Ad ministration tonight in a de bate with Nelson G. Gross, the Republican candidate. It was their first confrontation of the campaign.

title: NIXON'S MESSAGE LAUDED BY AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, June 18  Officials in the Nixon Adminis tration who differ on the issue of whether the President should resort to jawboning to influ ence private price and wage decisions expressed satisfaction today with the President's message on the economy.

title: UNESCO Appeal Asks Protection for Angkor
description: PARIS, June 18The ex ecutive board of the United Nations Educational, Scien tific and Cultural Organila don addressed an urgent ap peal today to all parties in the Indochina war to protect the temples of Angkor and other Cambodian monuments.

title: SALK LEAVES CITY WITH HIS FIANCEE
description: Dr. Jonas E. Salk and his bridetobe, Francoise Gilot, left New York yesterday for an un disclosed destination, according to Claude RuizPicasso, the son of Miss Gilot.

title: MRS. HAROLD C. MORRIS
description: Mrs. Cosby Dansby Morris, piano teacher and widow of Dr. Harold C. Morris, composer, concert pianist and music edu cator, died Tuesday at the Lynwood Nursing Home. She was 88 years old.

title: Some Major Deficiencies Found in Safe Streets Act
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The Advisory Commission on Intergovernmental Relations reported today that it had found major deficiencies in the 1968 Safe Streets Act of 1968 but recommended only one major change.

title: H. B. EHRMANN, 77, IN FAMOUS TRIAL
description: Herbert B. Ehrmann, asso ciate counsel for Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti dur ing their murder trial in 1925, died Wednesday after a long illness at his home in Brookline, Mass. He was 77 years old.

title: A Troublesome Opposition Confronts Spanish Regime
description: MADRID, June 18Eight months after Generalissimo Francisco Franco drastically re shuffled his Cabinet, the Span ish Government is confronted with the widest and most troublesome opposition in the 30 years since the Civil War.

title: Lincoln Center Resumes Mostly Mozart Festival
description: Lincoln Center will present a Mostly Mozart Festival of 23 concerts in August, resum ing the annual series at Phil harmonic Hall that was inter rupted by last summer's acous tical remodeling there. Each program will include works of Mozart. Haydn and Schubert.

title: Draft Office Raided
description: WILMINGTON, Del., June 18 (AP)  Vandals damaged rec ords as they raided the state Selective Service headquarters in a Wilmington suburb and local offices in Dover and Georgetown last night. Officials said that 89,000 records in the state headquarters office had been damaged. Unidentified war protestors claimed respon sibility for the raids.

title: Witness in Addonizio Trial Tells of a Helicopter Picking Up $35,000 in Extortion Money
description: TRENTON, June 18An al leged extortionmoney collec tor arrived by helicopter at a job site for a Newark water main extension in March, 1966, picked up $35,000 in cash and left the same way, a witness testified today in the trial of Hugh J. Addonizio, outgoing mayor of Newark, and six other defendants charged with extor tion conspiracy.

title: Rahim and Cramer Upset in Singles
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 18 (AP)  Haroon Rahim of the University of California, Los Angeles, and Pat Cramer of Miami, the two topseeded players in the National Col legiate tennis tournament, were upset today, but U.C.L.A., man aged to hold a 2point lead in the team standing.

title: COMMERCE AIDE ASKS IMPORT CUT
description: In an unusually blunt speech, a high Administration official urged President Nixon yester day to back legislation that would limit imports on textiles, apparel and footwear.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS 0.7% RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 18  Freight traffic on United States railroads in the week ended June 13 was above the corresponding week last year. Intercity truck tonnage in the same week, still affected by va rious work stoppages through out the country, was 21.7 per cent below the comparable 1969 period.

title: Enoch Powell Victor By a Large Majority
description: WOLVERHAMPTON, Eng land, Friday, June 19 (AP) Enoch Powell, the Conserva tive who injected the race issue into British politics, won an overwhelming vic tory in yesterday's Parlia mentary elections.

title: N.B.A. and A.B.A. Agree to Merge, Subject to Approval of Congress
description: The 24yearold National Bas ketball Association and the threeyearold American Basket ball Association agreed yester day to merge, subject to the approval of Congress.

title: POLICEMAN TELLS TRIAL OF PAYOFFS
description: A decorated New York po liceman testified in court yes terday that gamblers paid bribes of $700 to $800 a month to individual patrolmen as signed to suppress gambling in part of the Bronx.

title: A Summary of Senate Proposals on President's Powers in Southeast Asian War
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 Following is a summary of the legislative proposals that have been placed befbre the Senate or that may be offered on the subject of Presidential powers to direct the war in Southeast Asia:

title: HARRY J. NEAL JR.
description: MIAMI, June 18Harry J. Neal Jr., a partner in Reynolds & Co., New York brokers, died of cancer here yesterday. He was 54 years old and lived in Coral Gables.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Britain's Conservative party, the underdog in the general elections yesterday, seemed headed for victory early today as returns were counted. Though the polls had pre dicted an easy victory for the Labor party of Prime Minister Wilson, indications were that the Tories would have a margin of 25 to 30 seats in the new House of Commons and that Edward Heath would be the new Prime Minister. [Page 1, Columns 48.]

title: Officer Is Promoted By Morgan Guaranty
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company has elected James O. Bolsi an executive vice president, it was an nounced yesterday.

title: LESSER CHARGE SET FOR MRS. CRIMMINS
description: Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell dropped murder charges against Mrs. Alice Crimmins yesterday and planned to substitute a charge of firstdegree manslaughter.

title: Libel Suit in U.S. to Test Charges on B'nai B'rith
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 An obscure libel suit scheduled for trial in Federal Court here this fall is developing into a test of charges that Israeli representatives have tried to use B'nai B'rith, the Jewish service and charitable organization, as a cover for some of their own foreignpolicy activities.

title: Dining:
description: A selective list of restau rants in New York and vi cinity is given on this page on Friday. The restaurants are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored in the restaurants where it is indicated.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: ExManagement Man Slated for Labor Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI)President Nixon will nominate Laurence H. Silber man, solicitor of the Labor Department, to be Under Secretary of Labor, informed sources said today.

title: Article 3  No Title
City Asks Bid Policy on CATV Franchises
description: The Board of Estimate was asked by the city yesterday to approve development of a pol icy governing competitive bid ding for cable television fran chises in all boroughs but Manhattan.

title: Surgeon General Defends Herbicide
description: WASHINGTON, June 18The Surgeon General of the United States Public Health Service emphatically denied today be fore a Senate Commerce sub committee that 2,4D, the most widely used herbicide in the nation, presented a hazard to public health.

title: Dempsey Clouds Picture By Getting Out of Race
description: HARTFORD, June 18You want to be on the train when it pulls out, said an organiza tion Democrat over lunch the other day at Frank's, a Hart ford ford politicians' hangout. The trouble is that this year there are too many trains.

title: Market Place:
description: Where are the new deals of yesteryear? The new issues market, which was thriving in May of 1969, has virtually dried up. That was a month when $250million worth of securities were offered to the public by companies that had enjoyed no public market for their securities before that date.

title: Youth Fined for Insult
description: BUFFALO, June 18 (AP)A 19yearold youth was fined $50 today for calling a state trooper a pig. You look more like a pig than he, the way you're dressed, Judge Ann T. Mikoll of City Court told Jo seph P. Thomas of Buffalo in imposing the sentence.

title: School Board Is Accused of Job Bias
description: Sixty black and Puerto Rican teachers and assistant princi pals charged yesterday that the Board of Education has failed to live up to its commitment to place them as principals and supervisors after they had qual ified for the posts by a year of intensive training.

title: Astronaut Married in Texas
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., June 18 (UPI)An Air Force chaplain disclosed today that he had married Lieut. Comdr. Thomas H. Mattingly 2d, the astronaut, and Elizabeth Dailey. The chaplain, the Rev, Patrick Mori son of Laughlin Air Force Base, Del Rio, Tex., said the service was performed yesterday at the Brooks Air Force Base chapel, Commander Mattingly, of the Navy, had been assigned to the Apollo 13 moon fight but missed It because he was ex posed to measles.

title: PATROLMAN FOUND DEAD WITH WOMAN
description: A 27yearold Bronx partol man and a woman described by the police as his girlfriend were found dead last night of bullet wounds in the head in the woman's apartment in the Kingsbridge Heights section of the Bronx.

title: Ailey Troupe Saved By State Department
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, which dis banded after its spring sea son at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, has reorganized, thanks to money from the State Department, the Na tional Council on the Arts and the New York State Arts Council.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Fading of Dollar's Global Role Envisioned by O.E.C.D. Aide
description: PARIS, June 18The gradual phasing out of the dollar as a reserve currency, a development that implies a change in the role of the United States as a world power, is foreseen in an important pa per now being read in inter national monetary circles.

title: Marinello's OneUnderPar 71 Leads L.I. Amateur Qualifying
description: EAST WILLISTON, L. I., June 18  Thirtyone com petitors, including a golf salesman who hit a rival company's ball by mistake, and a recent graduate who was barred from his col lege's golf course because his hair was too long, qualified today for the Long Island Golf Association amateur championship.

title: Fads Pass On, But Tom Paxton Is Still With Us
description: Whenever there's a glittery new trend in music, one tends to forget about people like Tom Paxton. But when all the fads and trends are in the 99cent bin at the corner record store, Tom Paxton re emerges to show you how it should be done.

title: HARLEM HOUSING VOTED BY BOARD
description: The largest urbanrenewal project in the city's historya plan for 10,500 new and rehabi litated housing units in Central Harlemcleared its final local hurdle yesterday.

title: BIG BANKS REJECT A DEAL WITH I.O.S.
description: PARIS, June 18  The large banks that sent representatives to Paris a week ago to nego tiate a partnership arrangement with Investors Overseas Serv ices have concluded that no deal can be made now, banking spokesmen said today.

title: JUDGES ADVISED ON BUSINESS TIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP) Federal judges were advised today to cut down on junkets and to shun ties with business.

title: Vote on Postal Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, June, 18 [AP]Following is the 306 to77 rollcall vote by which the House defeated tonight an attempt to strip the postal reform bill of everything but an 8 per cent pay increase. The pay rise and reform plan was subsequently gassed, 359 to 24.

title: Mrs. Faith Burwell Kaye Rewed
description: Mrs. Faith Burwell Kaye of New York, widow of Sidney Kaye, was married here at noon yesterday to James StewartGordon, a roving edi tor of Reader's Digest, by Justice Stanley H. Fuld of the New York Court of Ap peals.

title: Firestone Accord Reached
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 18 (AP) The United Rubber Workers and the Firestone Tire & Rub ber Co. reached a tentative agreement tonight on a new contract covering 19,000 Fire stone production workers across the country. A Firestone spokesman said that details of the tentative agreement could not he released until after it is drawn up and signed by union and company representatives tomorrow.

title: New State Crime Fighter
description: Robert Eugene Fischer's nose has been broken at least six times.

title: Indian Airlines Gets Loan
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI) An agreement was signed to day, for a loan of $12,526,650 by the ExportImport Bank to the Indian Airlines Corporation to help finance the purchase of seven jet transport planes.

title: Blood, Sweat &
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, June 18 (UPI)The American rock jazz group Blood, Sweat and Tears made its first appearance here last night, bringing more than 5,000 Yugoslav music fans at a downtown stadium to their feet in roaring approval.

title: Richey and Riessen Advance
description: LONDON, June 18  Two Americans made the semifinals of the London grasscourts ten nis tournament today, but their immediate future looked omi nous. Cliff Richey played beau tifully to defeat Georges Goven of France, 64, 63, and Marty Riessen coasted to a 61, 60 victory over an offform Frew McMillan of South Africa.

title: Jacklin's 71 Sets Pace in WindBlown U.S. Open as Favorites' Scores Soar
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 18In one of the most incredible days of a United States Open Golf championship, Tony Jacklin of England scored a oneunder par first round of 71 as Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer and Gary Player struggled to try to stay out of the 80's.

title: Treasury Official Calls Tax Increase Possible Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (UPI)  Treasury Secretary David M. Kennedy said today that the Administration was likely to ask Congress in Janu ary either to raise taxes or to postpone some of the tax cuts that were approved last year.

title: Walinsky Seeks Inquiry On a Campus Infiltrator
description: Adam Walmsky demanded yesterday that Attorney Gen eral Louis J. Lefkofitz inves tigate allegations that an up state undercover agent for the Ontario County Sheriff's office known as Tommy the Traveler had incited campus violence by offering students bombs, guns and lessons in guerrilla tactics.

title: And, Besides, She Can Type
description: At 19, just before she left Montreal for Paris, Joanna Shimkus was allowed to stay out until 11 P.M. on Saturday nights (my mother waited outside the door to make sure I didn't kiss the boy good night).

title: Jacqueline Childs to Be Bride Of Thomas Dozier on Sept. 26
description: OLD BROOKVILLE, L. I., June 18Miss Jacqueline M. Childs and Thomas M. Dozier or Vero Beach, Fla., plan to be married here Sept. 26.

title: Nixon and Pilot Reminisce
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP) President Nixon reminisced today about World War II with Capt. Dale C. Hupe, the Trans World Airlines pilot who was wounded when his airliner was hijacked June 4. Captain Hupe, his wife and children, and the stewardesses and other crew members on the hijacked air liner visited the President at the White House after the pilot was released from Fairfax Hos pital where he recuperated from a wound in the stomach. Mr. Nixon and Captain Hupe served together on Guadal canal.

title: Primaries May Decide Control of Legislature
description: ALBANY, June 18Over shadowed by other campaigns, men and women who will help shape New York's future are fighting out key contests for party control in legislative dis tricts across the state.

title: VICTORY FOR TORIES IS INDICATED IN SURPRISING BRITISH ELECTION; MARGIN MAY REACH 25 TO 30 SEATS
description: LONDON, Friday, June 19 The underdog Conservative party appeared headed for vic tory early today in the British general election.

title: Aluminum Concern Elects President
description: PITTSBURGH, June 18 Directors of the Aluminum Company of America elected a new president here today. He is W. H. Krome George, 52 years old, a chemical en gineer who has been the top financial officer of the na tion's largest aluminum pro ducer since 1965.

title: Seasonal Joblessness Rate For May Rises in Canada
description: OTTAWA, (Canadian Press) June 18  Unemployment in Canada declined last month to 513,000 from 544,000 at mid April, but the improvement in the employment picture was less than usual for this time of year, the Dominion Bureau of Statistics reported today.

title: Powder Blast Kills Worker
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, June 18 (UPI) One worker was killed today and six others injured when an explosion destroyed a powder sifting building at the Miller Fireworks Company in nearby Springfield. The victim was Phyllis Sue Stewart, 27 years old, of Toledo. She was loading powder onto trays when the explosion occurred.

title: Canadian Bill Rates Rise
description: OTTAWA, June 18 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $150million of new 91day Treasury bills at an av erage price of 98.553 and aver age yield of 5.89 per cent, com pared with last week's 98.565 and 5.84 per cent. Today's $40 million of 182day bills brought 97.095 and 6.00 per cent, against last week's 97.101 and 5.99 per cent.

title: HEAVY RAIN AND WIND HIT STATE AND 2 DIE
description: Heavy thunderstorms whipped by what the Weather Bureau described as hurricaneforce winds, sliced across central New York last night, smashing windows, overturning cars and felling power lines in the Utica and Rome areas. At least two persons were known dead. One was struck by lightning and the other was killed by a falling tree. The storm here was far less severe.

title: Indiana G.O.P. Selects Rep. Roudebush for Senate
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 18 The politicians here in Indiana call it superdeal.

title: COSSA IS MARCELLO IN MET'S 130HEME
description: In the Metropolitan Opera's ninth and final performance We season of La Boheme, Dominic Cossa sang the role of Marcello Wednesday night for the first time with the com pany, and a mighty sprightly and finevoiced bohemian he was.

title: Roundup: Jenkins Shows Durocher a 5th Straight
description: Late last August, when the Chicago Cubs were gaining momentum in their drive away from the National League's. Eastern Division title, Leo Durocher wanted Ferguson Jenkins to pitch with one day's rest after he had been knocked out in the fourth inning of a game.

title: Jersey Man, 51, Is Stabbed In Crowded Times Square
description: An Asbury Park, N. J., man was stabbed in the stomach in a doorway on crowded Times Square last night by a youth who reportedly tried to rob him. Two policemen who wit nessed the attack seized the alleged assailant.

title: Washington For the Record
USE OF GRADUATES BY ARMY LIMITED
description: A Defense Department study that was disclosed here yes day details the limited use the Army made of the civilian skills of the thousands of col lege graduates who were drafted or who enlisted last year.

title: $1BILLION URGED TO TREAT WASTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The House Appropriations Com mittee recommended today an appropriation of $1billion for the construction of municipal waste treatment works for the fiscal year beginning July 1 the last year of the program authorized in the Clean Waters Restoration Act of 1966.

title: Steve's Lark Sets Track Record in Taking Hurdles Event at Belmont Park
description: Philip Wise's Steve's Lark won the $17,450 Annapolis Hurdle Handicap by one length, at Belmont Park yesterday, sur viving a foul claim brought by the riders of Maimed, who was second, and Dream Spirit, who finished third.

title: Bundesbank Warns Of Wage Explosion
description: BONN, June 18  West Germany's central bank ad dressed an urgent appeal to the Government today to take longdelayed, unpopular meas ures in the interest of price stability and overall economic equilibrium.

title: Plant in Argentina Burns
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 18 (AP)  Explosions and fire destroyed a United States phar maceutical plant near Buenos Aires today. At least four em ployes are missing and feared dead and 12 were seriously in jured, firemen said.

title: Sills, ExAttorney General Of Jersey, Has Heart Attack
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., June 18 (AP)Former State Attorney General Arthur J. Sills of Me tuchen was admitted to Perth Amboy General Hospital to night after suffering an appar ent heart attack.

title: For Weekend Chef, Menu With OreganoSeasoned Veal
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: ARGENTINA'S PESO DEVALUED 12%
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 18 Argentina's central bank an nounced today that the peso hitherto one of the most stable currencies in Latin America has been devalued. The new value of the peso will be 4.0 to the dollar, an increase from 3.5 to the dollar.

title: Swedish Derailment Kills 2
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, June 18 (UPI)Two persons were killed and 71 injured when an express train with 300 pas sengers derailed and crashed today east of this port city in western Sweden, the police said.

title: H. J. HEINZ CITES 19.7% PROFIT RISE
description: The H. J. Heinz Company, a major food processor and dis tributor here and abroad; real ized a 19.7 per cent increase in fiscal fourth quarter earn ings on an 11.5 per cent sales gain, both setting records for the period, R. Burt Goodkin, president, reported yesterday.

title: Callas to Visit Kremlin
description: PARIS, June 18 (UPI) Maria Callas, the American so prano, has accepted an invita tion from the Soviet Cultural Ministry to make an official visit to Moscow next week, a spokesman for the singer said yesterday. Miss Callas will be received at the Kremlin in her first visit to the Soviet Union during the annual Tchaikovsky piano competition, the spokes man said.

title: LIVING COSTS HERE RISE BY ONLY 0.4%
description: The cost of living in the New York metropolitan area rose by 0.4 per cent last month, the smallest increase in six months.

title: POST OFFICE SEEKS PARCEL RATES RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP)  The Post Office announced today that It had asked for in creased postage rates for par cels and catalogues and was seeking to establish a 35cent surcharge for oddly shaped and oversize packages.

title: Bridge
description: STOCKHOLM, June 18The United States, represented by the Dallas Aces, increased its lead in the qualifying stage of the world championship today, winning two matches by substantial Margins.

title: Mrs. Kaiser Remarried
description: Mrs. Barbara Preninger Kaiser, widow of Henry J. Kaiser Jr., was married at the Plaza last evening to Kanial Amin, an Egyptian born architect, who is with the Frank Lloyd Wright or ganization. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Arthur Caliandro of the Mar ble Collegiate Church. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. M. C. Preninger of Santa Ana, Calif.

title: U.S. Concern Is Growing
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The Nixon Administration was described by senior officials to day as gravely concerned over the situation in Cambodia, particularly over the fate of Pnompenh, which is under in creasing military pressure.

title: Riot Police in Miami Are Withdrawn
description: MIAMI, Friday, June 19A truce worked out by the police and Miami Negro leaders pro duced a night of relative calm in Miami after three days of racial violence.

title: Gibson and Addonizio Meet on ChangeOver
description: NEWARK, June 18 (AP)  Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio and Mayorelect Kenneth A. Gibson met briefly tonight in the Mayor's office to prepare for Mr. Gibson's takeover of the city government on July 1.

title: Teamsters Strike at Airport
description: Members of Local 553, Inter national Brotherhood of Team sters, struck the La Guardia Airport facility of Butler Avia tion International, Inc. at 12:01 A.M. yesterday when their threeyear labor contract ex pired.

title: Ballet Theater Revives a de Mille Work
description: Agnes de Mille's Fall River Legend was revived last night at the State Theater by American Ballet Theater. It has been four years since Miss de Mille's 1948 dance dramatization of the 1892 Lizzie Borden case has been seen here. Although murder is a theme that preoccupies few contemporary ballet choreog raphers today outside Brit ain's Scottish Theater Ballet, Fall River Legend has worn well.

title: AFRICOBRA Will Make Local Debut on Sunday
description: AFRICOBRA, a group of 10 black artists from Chicago, will make its debut here at the Studio Museum in Har lem, Fifth Avenue nad 125th Street on Sunday. AFRI COBRA 1, a show of 45 works, includes paintings, mixed media constructions, tapestries, silkscreen prints and painted garments.

title: Colombia Bus Plunge Kills 8
description: MEDELLIN, Colombia, June 18 (UPI)Eight persons were killed and 20 others injured to day when an urban bus left the road and went over a cliff. The police attributed the acci dent to a mechanical failure.

title: P.S.C. BACKS CON ED ON TURBINE LEASES
description: ALBANY, June 18The Con solidated Edison Company may proceed with its plan to lease 10 gas turbinegenerator units from a trust, the Public Service Commission said today.

title: Lieutenant Governor.
description: It should not be difficult for the Democrats of this state to choose State Senator Basil A. Paterson of Man hattan over Jerome A. Ambro, town supervisor of Huntington, Long Island, in the primary contest for Lieutenant Governor.

title: U.S.C. NINE TAKES N.C.A.A. FINAL, 21
description: OMAHA, June 18 (AP)  Frank Alfano's infield single with the bases loaded in the last of the 15th inning gave top ranked Southern California a 21 victory over Florida State tonight and the College World Series championship.

title: Gubernatorial Primary
description: As New York State's gubernatorial primary grinds wearily to a close, Democrats confront a difficult and important choice between Arthur J. Goldberg and Howard J. Samuels.

title: STIFF RULES URGED IN AIR TAXI WORK
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP)  The National Transportation Safety Board said today that it had asked for stricter qualifi cation rules for pilots in the fastgrowing air taxi industry.

title: Tass Assails Conference In Jakarta on Cambodia
description: MOSCOW, June 18 (AP)  Tass today assailed the Jakarta conference on Cambodia after its representatives met with Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gro myko yesterday.

title: Article 2  No Title
Finch Says Dispute Will Help Campus Study Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 The Secretary of Health, Edu cation and Welfare, Robert H. Finch, said today that Vice President Agnew's recent at tack on a young member of the President's Commission on Cam pus Unrest had given the com mission greater legitimacy and visibility than it had be fore.

title: Chase Manhattan Appoints
description: Robert H. Aldrich, 35year old chemical engineer, has been appointed to the newly created post of coordinatorenviron mental systems for the Chase Manhattan Bank. Believed to be the first post of its kind in any commercial bank, he will assist the bank's lending of ficers as they deal with com panies in the pollution control field, John B. M. Place, vice chairman of the bank, an nounced yesterday.

title: PRESIDENT WIDENS WELFARE REQUEST
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP) President Nixon asked Con gress today to overhaul and consolidate Federal welfare services and add new aid for child foster care and adoption.

title: Measure Lowering Voting Age Presents Political and Constitutional Issues
description: WASHINGTON, June 18  The Congressional decision to give the vote to 11 million Americans between 18 and 21 years old may have raised as many questions as it settled.

title: Credit Markets:
Glenda Morris Wed
description: To Gerald Rothberg

title: BEAME'S PROPOSAL ON TRANSIT OPPOSED
