description: The Citizens Budget Com mission will urge the Board of Estimate today not to commit the grave error of resuming responsibility for the city's mass transit system.

title: U.S., at Hijacking Parley, Asks Strong Move Short of Sanctions
description: MONTREAL, June 18  The United States delegation to an emergency aviation conference here is pressing for a strongly worded resolution against hi jacking and sabotage that will call for action by governments but stop short of sanctions.

title: MORTGAGE AGENCY STARTED BY STATE
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., June 18The newly formed State of New York Mortgage Agency, designed to pump money into the tightly squeezed housing market, has made a number of key decisions regard ing its initial operations, sources attending a state banking con vention disclosed here today.

title: RETHINKING URGED ON RETIREMENTS
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the la bor mediator, said yesterday that the city and labor unions should rethink decisions of the past allowing city transit workers, sanitationmen, police men and firemen to retire at half pay after 20 years of city employment.

title: A High School Ball Parents Can Enjoy
description: WALDWICK, N. J., June 18 For months, parents in this quiet suburban town have been hammering and paint ing, wiring and cutting, sewing and scrounging in a good cause. Their efforts, which came to fruition tonight with the Waldwick Junior  Senior High School surprise ball, were directed at making the evening so enjoyable for their teen agers that they would be willing to spend the evening here rather than to hit the highways for New York and more spirited fare.

title: Amex Short Interest Up From Revised May Level
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest positions as of last Monday were 5,480,022 shares, an increase of 486,397 shares from the revised figure of 4, 993,625 shares for May. The comparable figure a year ago was 7,810,233 shares.

title: Anniuersaries
description: MENDELSOHNEva & Sidney G. Mendelsohn celebrate their Golden Annlversary with friends and relatives at the Friars Club, Saturday evening, June 20, 1970.

title: Coliseum Will Show Cup Soccer Telecast
description: With Sunday's televised performance of the World Cup soccer final between Bra zil and Italy sold out at Madison Square Garden, ar rangements have been made to show the event live from Mexico City at the Coliseum at 2 P.M.

title: Gentile and Mayer Gain Final Round In Westchester Golf
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 18 John Gentile Jr. of The Pat terson Club, Fairfield, Conn, and James D. Mayer Jr., Winged Foot, who were first and sec ond with 70 and 72, respec tively, in the medal round Tues day, scored easy victories to day to reach the final of the 51st annual Westchester Coun ty Golf Association champion ship.

title: Egyptian Motive Assailed
description: JERUSALEM, June 18An Israeli military commentator suggested tonight that the United Arab Republic was at tempting to forestall the de livery of United States jets to Israel and to encourage greater Soviet intervention in the Mid dle East conflict by charging that American bombs were used yesterday in air raids near the Suez Canal.

title: Florida Canal Approved
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP)  The House Appropriations Committee approved $6million today for the crossFlorida barge canal and said construction should continue without any halt for further studies on its ecological impact.

title: Reports of Village Massacre Called Calumny by Vietcong
description: PARIS, June 18The Viet cong today denied as a vile calumny reports of a massacre by Communist forces in the village of Thanhmy, south of Danang, on June 10.

title: Mafia Leader Indicted
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 18 (Reuters)Carlos Marcello, the reputed Mafia chieftain of Louisiana, was arrested here after a Federal grand jury in dicted him today on a charge of being in the country illegally. Federal officials have attempted for years to deport Marcello on the basis of a narcotics convic tion, but no country will accept him.

title: Dutch Dwarfs Inject A Pixy Tone in Politics
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands June 18In this month's municipal, elections here, there seemed no end of political parties, though there were only 20, and no limit to campaign promises, though voters were hardly listening. Forty per cent stayed home, which may explain why the Free Sex party drew only 1,058 votes.

title: BROKERS AND S.E.C. ARGUE INSURANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 Thre are four major areas of difference between the securi ties industry and the Govern ment on legislation to insure investors against losses when brokerage firms fail, Ralph D. DeNunzio told Congress today.

title: Dr. Mary Clabaugh Wright, 52, Yale History Professor, Is Dead
description: GUILFORD, Conn., June 18 Dr. Mary Clabaugh Wright, a leading scholar of Chinese his tory and the first woman to be named a full professor at Yale University, died at her home here today. She was 52 years old.

title: Panther on Trial in New Haven Accused of a Jailbreak Attempt
description: NEW HAVEN, June 18 Lonnie McLucas, a Black Pan ther on trial here in the kid napping and murder of a fellow party member, was accused to day of having attempted to break out bf a state jail on the eve of the opening of his trial.

title: Thousands Escape Trial Here As Arrest Warrants Pile Up
description: Hundreds of defendants es cape prosecution each week, their cases relegated to a per manent pending status, be cause the Police Department's warrant squads fall to execute many courtordered arrest war rants.

title: A COLOR LINE SEEN IN DUAL POSTERS
description: A group of black politicians supporting Howard J. Samuels in the Democratic gubernatorial primary asserted yesterday the campaign of Arthur Gold berg was the worst kind of racial tactic  using separate posters for white and black neighborhoods.

title: 44 Peace Demonstrators Arrested at the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP)The police arrested 44 demonstrated at the Pentagon today for trying to attend mass for peace in the huge building's crowded concourse.

title: Officer Gets Pension as Department Trial Is Adjourned
description: A Police Department trial of a detective charged with selling confidential information was adjourned about midnight last night after a series of highly technical legal developments.

title: Quarry Victory Stimulates the Heavyweight Division
description: Suddenly, with Jerry Quarry a winner again, the heavy weight division regained some order out of its chaos.

title: Major League Baseball
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Monmouth Jockeys
In Portland, Ore., Urban Decay Is Masked by Natural Splendor
description: PORTLAND, Ore.Doctors bury their mistakes, archi tects plant vines, and Port land covers them with roses. June is rose festival time in this city of 375,000 people, where green residential hills drop down to the commercial core with a 10minute transi tion from panoramic views to compact urban center. Small scale, comfort ably pedestrian streets with a cosmopolitan ar chitectural mix are bounded by the hills on the west and the Willamette River on the east, with spreading residen tial and industrial areas be yond that double the metro politan population.

title: Iowa Electric Plan Approved
description: The Iowa Electric Light and Power Company announced yesterday the receipt of ap proval from the Atomic Energy Commission of its application for a construction permit for its Duane Arnold energy center near Cedar Rapids. The $168 million facility will have a 550,000kilowatt capacity and is expected to be completed by the end of 1973.

title: S. J. RADZWILLER, 49, AD AGENCY OFFICER,
description: Seymour J. Radzwiller, a senior vice president and a director of Ted Bates & Co., the advertising agency died Wednesday night at Morris town (N.J.) Memorial Hospital, after a long illness. He was 49 years old and lived in Old Woods Road, Morris Plains, N.J.

title: LEVI SMITH SR., 84, BANKER IN VERMONT
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., June 19 Levi Smith Sr., patriarch of one of Vermont's most prominent families and retired president and chairman of the Burlington Savings Bank, died at his home here yesterday at the age of 84.

title: WHITE'S HOME RUN CAPS 4RUN NINTH
description: BOSTON, June 19The New York Yankees, who are begin ning to behave like the old Mets, went eight innings to night without getting a hit of Sonny Siebert of the Boston Re?? Sox. Then, on five pitches in the ninth, their first four bat ters got four hits and four runs.

title: Screen:'ElCondor' Bows:Mexican Treasure Tale Comes to the Forum
description: "El Condor," which opened yesterday at the Forum Theater, is a movie that almost nobody involved seems to have taken seriously  neither the writers, nor the director, nor the actorswith the possible exception of the explosives expert. For unlike everything else in the film, the explosions, which are fairly numerous, are surprising, precise and occasionally spectacular.Once, during an artillery barrage leveled at the momentarily defenseless leads (Jim Brown and Lee Van Cleef), the detonating shells literally take over the screen and seem to provide their own dumb reason for being.Brown and Van Cleef play a pair of adventurers who, with a band of renegade Apaches, besiege a fabled fortress called El Condor, in which the treasury of Maximilian's Mexico is supposed to hoard its vast reserves of gold.In time, they learn that all that glitters is not, etc.; but on the way they suffer a few indignities, outwit a few fools, fall in and out of troublesalmost enough to make a movie. Eventually Van Cleef ends up dead and Brown ends up with Mariana Hill, simmering ex-mistress of Patrick O'Neal, iron-willed commandant of El Condor, who also ends up dead.From time to time in "El Condor" there is introduced a certain amount of female nudity, which probably indicates a trend and certainly makes the film different from the general run of Westerns you may have enjoyed as a child.The nudity is more than sufficiently integrated into the plotas at the sexual-military climax, when Miss Hill, who has gone crazy for Jim Brown, though she has scarcely spoken to him, strips for her love.To distract the guards of the fortress, she throws open her balcony door before undressing for the nightand while part of the cast of hundreds gapes in admiration, the other part of the cast (the Brown-Van Cleef-Apache part) come from behind and strangle them and slit their throats and otherwise silently slaughter them. The pointed juxtaposition of sex and slaughter that particularizes this otherwise mostly mindless movie, introduces a measure of perverse brutality that is more vicious in fact than may appear from a simple description. I think it is the mindlessness more than the violence that makes for my discomfort, for "El Condor" lacks either the prurience or prudery to support its more sensational gestures.When you create a vacuum, in art as in nature, something ambles in to fill the empty spaces, and in the void that is "El Condor" that something is a death that chills desire.

title: Dr. Sydney Chapman, 82, Dies; Geophysicist Led '5758 I.G.Y.
description: Dr. Sydney Chapman, to many the grand old man of geophysics, died Tuesday in Boulder (Colo.) Memorial Hos pital after a heart attack and stroke. He was 82 years old.

title: Freeport Sulphur Granted Approval for Copper Project
description: The Freeport Sulphur Com pany has announced that it has obtained final agreements and necessary appproval from vari ous governments for its $120 million copper project in West Irian, Indonesia.

title: School ChancellorNow
description: In its search for a chancellor, the Board of Educa tion has commendably tried to find a man of the highest qualifications. Indeed, the change in the title of the office can be justified only by putting a pre mium on exceptional qualities of leadership which inspire the confidence and respect both of the educa tional bureaucracy and the community at large.

title: OFFICE QUEEN 52 IN 1MILE OAKS
description: Cathy Honey will be the strong favorite to take the 54th running of the Coaching Club American Oaks today at Bel mont Park. Hastings Harcourt regards his Floridabred filly so highly that he has paid a sup plementary fee of $10,000 to put her into the important 1 mile test.

title: Miss Kimball Leads on 66
description: HORSHAM, Pa., June 19 (AP)  Judy Kimball, who hasn't won on the women's pro golf tour since 1962, shot a seven underpar 66 today to gain the firstround lead by two strokes in the $25,000 George Wash ington golf classic.

title: Roundup: Orioles Survive Shelling by Epstein's Bat
description: Everyone, it seems, is try ing to help the Yankees present Yankees, past Yan kees, even players who have been rumored to be future Yankees.

title: POLIO VICTIM WINS TEACHER'S LICENSE
description: Officials of the Board of Edu cation said yesterday that the board had agreed in principle to grant a teacher's license to Judy Heumann, a 22yearold polio victim who is confined to a wheel chair.

title: 2 G.I.'s Ordered to Trial In Slayings at Songmy
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Two Vietnam veterans impli cated in the killing of civilians in Songmy, Vietnam, were ord ered today to stand trial before a military court on charges of murder and other offenses.

title: How 2 Policemen Decided to Fight Graft
description: Even in the school for plain clothes policemen, many of the students were said to have complained about being off the street for the 30 days needed for the course and missing what they called the nut payoffs to the police by gam blers and narcotics pushers.

title: Satellite Rocketed Toward Asia To Warn U.S. of Missile Attack
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., June 19 (AP)A secret spy satellite equipped with a television cam era and Xray sensors sped tonight toward a lonely outpost high over Southeast Asia to keep watch on the Soviet Un ion, Red China and North Viet nam.

title: 2 Berkeley Banks Hit by Bombs; Damage Is Slight, No One Hurt
description: 2 Berkeley Banks Hit by Bombs; Damage Is Slight, No One Hurt

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Loan to Turkey

title: Train Kills Transit Worker
description: A 32yearold Transit Au thority workman, a member of a crew repairing a BMT subway signal at the Union Street sta tion in Brooklyn, was struck by a work train early yesterday morning. The man, James Walsh, of 2106 East 13th Street, Brooklyn, was pronounced dead at the Lutheran Medical Center.

title: POSTAL WORKERS AUTHORIZE STRIKE
description: Members of the Manhattan Bronx Postal Union voted yes terday to authorize a strike if a satisfatory postal reform bill is not passed by Congress.

title: Estimate Board Delays Action On Plan for CityRun Subways
description: Business and industry repre sentatives opposed yesterday the return of subway operations to the city, while politicians, straphangers and an 11year old student were highly critical of the operation of the system by the Metropolitan Transpor tation Authority.

title: Bridge:
description: STOCKHOLM, June 19 The United States team rest ed this afternoon while their rivals battled for second po sition in the world team championship here.

title: Badillo Expected to Be in Close House Race
description: When politicians forecast the outcome of the primary elec tion contest in the 21st Con gressional District a few months ago, the result seemed clear: an easy victory for Her man Badillo if he chose to run.

title: Bookmakers in Britain Taken by Surprise, Too
description: LONDON, June 19  The result of the British general election took bookmakers, like everyone else, by sur prise. Experienced as they are at calculating the odds they too were fooled by the publicopinion polls.

title: Princeton Trustees Agree To End R.O.T.C. in '72
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 19 (AP)Princeton University an nounced today that it would terminate its Reserve Officer Training Corps program in June, 1972.

title: U.S. Takes Wide Point Lead In Onion Patch Trophy Sailing
Washington: For the Record
Bertelsen Lowers Record In N.C.A.A. SixMile Run
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 19 A series of surprise perform ances, including a collegiate record in the sixmile run by Bob Bertelsen of Ohio Univer sity, set the stage today for a dramatic windup to the 49th annual National Collegiate out door track and field champion ships.

title: Longest Arms Talk Held
description: VIENNA, June 19 (AP)  United States and Soviet nego tiators at the strategic  arms limitation talks held their long est session today since the meetings began April 17  two hours and 20 Minutes, one how of it informally. Conference sources said no special signifi cance should be read into the length of the session.

title: No Threat From U.S
description: CAPE KENNEDY, June 19 (UPI)The Sovtie Union's new 18day endurance record in space is not in danger from the United States for at least two andahalf years. The United States does not plan to keep men in space for longer than 16 days until its Skylab space station is launched in late 1972.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Albert M. Thorne, vice presi dent of the Oceanic Investing Company, died yesterday after a long illness at New Rochelle (N. Y.) Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 38 Frank lin Road, Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Curfew in Miami Is Lifted As Calm Returns to the City
description: MIAMI, June 19 (AP)  A dusktodawn curfew in Negro neighborhoods was lifted today after 300 volunteer black peace makers restored temporary calm to Miami, which has been wracked by four days of racial violence.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Leader of B'nai B'rith Denies Group Acted as Israeli Cover
description: WASHINGTON, June 19Dr. William A. Wexler, president of B'nai B'rith, expressed confi dence today that the Jewish service and charitable organiza tion would be fully vindicated of charges that it had been used as a cover for some Israeli for eignpolicy activities.

title: California Regents Drop Communist From Faculty
description: LOS ANGELES, June 19 The University of California's Board of Regents dismissed Negro assistant professor of philosophy from the Los An geles faculty today. The board said it moved because of state ments she had made in four off campus speeches.

title: Market Place
description: Anybody who bought a lot of those hot new issues dur ing their heyday in 1969 knows why they are so un popular today. They fell out of bed along with the rest of the common stocksonly more so.

title: Europeans' Assessment: A Craving for Stability
description: PARIS, June 19  European conservatives were cheered and Socialists dismayed today at the victory of the British Tories. It was widely taken to confirm a craving by the si lent majority for stability in a world beset by inflation, war and other frightening changes.

title: Prosecutor Called to the Stand In Policeman's Trial in Bronx
description: The defense lawyer for a plainclothes patrolman charged with lying when he denied il legal contacts with gamblers called as a witness yesterday the man who is prosecuting his clientBronx District Attor ney Burton B. Roberts.

title: Socialist Leader Assails Idea of New Leftist Party
description: Members of the Socialist par ty, one of the oldest political institutions in the country, gath ered here yesterday for their national convention and imme diately heard warnings that at tempts on the left to form new third party would guar antee the reelection of Rich ard M. Nixon in 1972.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Saturday, June 20, 1970

title: Mrs. Noble and Mrs. Ruvaine Retain Jersey Golf Title
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 19 Mrs. James Noble of Morris County and Mrs. Joseph Ru vaine of Canoe Brook defeated Mrs. Robert Shields and Mrs. Philip Baris of Alpine, 3 and 1, today to retain their Garden State Women's Golf Associa tion betterball, matchplay championship.

title: British Upset Recalls Defeat Of Churchill by Labor in 1945
description: Twentyfive years ago there was another profound British political upset. The Conserva tive party led by Winston Churchill went down to de feat before the Labor party in what was described at the time as one of the most stun ning election surprises in the history of democracy.

title: Texan Given 1,500 Years
description: DALLAS, June 19 (Reuters) A jury today gave a 1,500 year prison sentence to Antonio Rodriguez, convicted of posses sion and sale of heroin. It was the longest sentence in Texas history. Sentences of 1,000 years and more have been given recently in cases of rape, rob bery and assault.

title: HOLLYWOOD WRITERS AUTHORIZE A STRIKE
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 19 (AP) Television and movie writers have given their union's gov erning council the authority to call a strike against major Haywood producers.

title: Lower MiddleClass Working Women: What Help Is Needed, a Group Wonders
description: Twentyfive were expected but 76 appeared last Thurs day at the Institute of Hu man Relations, 165 East 56th Street, for a consultation about the distaff side of the American intelligentsia's lat est discoverythe lower mid dle class.

title: L.I.R. Gives Volpe a Ride And Collects $20Million
description: Transportation Secretary Jo seph A. Volpe, during a visit here yesterday, rode an experi mental train car, announced a $20million grant for the Long Island railroad and said he hoped to initiate a Government test of downtowntodowntown air service in the Northeast Corri dor.

title: EDITOR AT HARPER LEAVING IN A RIFT
description: A top editor at Harper & Row lost his job yesterday in the midst of a dispute growing out of the publishing compa ny's decision to halt the ex pansion of its fiction list.

title: Water Main Ruptures, Flooding Streets in Midtown
description: A 100yearold water main ruptured under Third Avenue and 42d Street last night, flood ing the surrounding streets and basements of office towers and snarling heavy traffic over a wide area of the East Side.

title: A Freeway Lane for Car Pools And Buses Studied in Cleveland
description: C.EVELAND, June 19  A federally financed study to de termine the feasibility of re serving freeway lanes for buses and carpool vehicles during rush hours has started here.

title: Mrs. Tollefson Wed To H. L. Wattenberg
description: The marriage of Mrs. Vic toria Tollefson to Howard Loeb Wattenberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip B. Watten berg of New York, took place yesterday afternoon at tt home here of Dr. and Mrs. Victor Carabba, stepfather and mother of the bride. Su preme Court Justice Theo dore R. Kupferman per formed the ceremony.

title: HOWARD COOK
description: Howard Cook, a public rela tions consultant and an asso ciate professor at Herbert H. Lehman College, died of pul monary tuberculosis at St. Vin cent's hospital Monday. He was 40 years old and lived at 15 Charles Street.

title: Marine's Motion Is Denied In Murder Trial at Danang
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, June 19 (AP)  A military judge today denied a motion for the acquittal of one of four United States marines charged with murdering 16 Vietnamese women and children in Son thang village on Feb. 16.

title: R. S. Pieters Jr. Fiance Of Pamela K. Lawrence
description: CHESTERTOWN, Md., June 19  Mrs. William R. Mc Alpin of Land's End Farm here and Norfolk, Conn., has made known the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Pamela Kathleen Lawrence, to Richard Sawyer Pieters Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Pieters of Andover, Mass., and East Andover. N. H.

title: Catherine Gleboff Plans Bridal in the Fall
description: Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas Gle boff have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Catherine Gleboff, to William Henry McDavid Jr., son of the late Mr. and Mrs. McDavid of Garden City, L. L The wedding is planned for fall.

title: Circulation Manager Promoted by Times
description: The appointment of Frank Adams as circulation man ager for sales of The New York Times was announced yesterday by Nathan W. Goldstein, circulation direc tor. Mr. Adams, metropolitan circulation manager for the last 10 years, will assume his new duties July 1.

title: PROMENADE OFFERS SPANISH SELECTIONS
description: It was raining and thunder ing outdoors during the New York Philharmonic Promenade concert Thursday night at Phil harmonic Hall.

title: A NATO DOCUMENT BRANDED A FORGERY
description: ROME, June 19A docu ment purporting to describe recommendations by the. Atlan tic alliance for the transfer of American troops from West Germany to northern Italy be cause of Communist strength there was shown to members of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Chamber of Deputies yesterday. Today the Italian Foreign Ministry branded it a forgery.

title: May Orders Rose In Durable Goods; Trailed 1969 Pace
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  New orders for durable goods, which have been moving erratically in recent months, rose $800million in May, the Commerce Department esti mated today.

title: Communists Believed to Be Turning Southern Laos Into Big Supply Base
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 19 Communist forces are said to have stepped up troop move ments in southern Laos amid indications that they are stock ing the region as an expanded supply base for the war in Vietnam.

title: Sweig Trial Jury Chosen
description: A Federal Court jury of four women and eight men was sworn here yesterday for the trial of Dr. Martin Sweig, the suspended administrative as sistant to House Speaker John W. McCormack. The trial is to begin on Monday. Dr. Sweig was indicted on charges of using the prestige of the Repre sentative's office to obtain fa vors for clients from Gov ernment agencies, and for allegedly lying to a grand jury. A lawyerlobbyist, Nathan Vo loshen, was indicted with Dr. Sweig. He pleaded guilty on Wednesday to the charges.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Operas

title: Men, Don't Give Up the ShipGenerals Won't Retreat on Minis
description: WASHINGTONIf I had ever learned to type, Eliza beth P. Hoisington mused, I never would have made brigadier general.

title: L.I.R. Reaches Agreement With 3 Who Withheld Tickets
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 19 (UPI) The Long Island Railroad agreed to drop charges against three commuters who refused to show their commutation tick ets to a conductor in Valley Stream last January.

title: 18YearOld Texas Lad Gets Golf Pros' Plaudits
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 19 (AP)One can detect a lit tle bit of Ben Hogan in Ben Crenshaw, the mop  haired 18yearold Texas schoolboy who emerged today as an amateur threat in the 70th United States Open golf championship.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, JUNE 20, 1970

title: Deer Swims to Kentucky
description: ASHLAND, Ky. (AP)The deer that darted into the path of two automobiles in the downtown section here appar ently had come from Ohio swimming the Ohio River, a conservations officer said.

title: Connecticut Contender Quits
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 19 Another contender for the Democratic nomination from the Fourth Congressional Dis trict has withdrawn. Robert M. Owens, city alderman, an nounced that he was throwing his support to F. Gilroy Daly of Fairfield.

title: Arab States Are Warned On Disunity
description: CAIRO, June 19An authori tative Cairo voice cautioned the Arabs today that they must not expect the Soviet Union to support them indefinitely with costly military aid if they per sisted in bickering among them selves and refused to under take decisive, coordinated ac tion to bring an end to the drawnout conflict with Israel.

title: Long Island Playoff Goes To Mrs. Dempsey by a Shot
description: JERICHO, L. I., June 19  Mrs. Thorne Dempsey, Piping Rock, scored 39, 3978 over the 5,919yard par72 Meadow Brook Club layout today to win the Women's Long Island Golf Association's 54hole med al play championship playoff by one stroke.

title: MITCHELL SPURS JACKSON INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 19A special Federal grand jury will be convened in Jackson, Miss., on June 29 to investigate the fatal shooting of two students last month at Jackson State Col lege, Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today.

title: Excerpts From Report to Canadian Government on Drug Use
description: OTTAWA, June 19Fol lowing are excerpts from the final chapter, The Issues Some Interim Recommenda tions, of a report to the Government published today by the LeDain Commission on Canada's drug laws:

title: Record Looms as a Sure Thing In the Commodore Pace Tonight
Illustrated Lessons Sent by an FM System
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The inventors of a system by which still pictures as well as the teacher's voice can be broadcast from frequency modulation radio stations believe it will prove a boon to educa tion over the air. Educasting Sys tems, Inc., New York, will receive Patent 3,518,376 shortly. The inventors are Ira Kamen, the company's research vice presi ident, and Harold R. Walker, technical director. PictuRadio, as it is called, creates in about eight seconds an Image that will last as long as half an hour. The student listens to a lecture, answers ques tions by pressing one of four buttons and is told whether he is correct.

title: Brooklyn's Leaders Urged To Push Hard for Paterson
description: Meade H. Esposito, Demo cratic party leader of Brooklyn, urged all district leaders in the borough yesterday to make an extra effort for the election of Basil A. Paterson as the party's candidate for Lieutenant Governor in Tuesday's primary.

title: SUIT BIDS U.S. SIGN GRAFT INDICTMENT
description: BALTIMORE, June 19Two private citizens filed suit today in an attempt to force the Jus tice Department to sign a draft indictment proposed by a spe cial grand jury investigating the alleged corruption of gov ernment officials.

title: Peru Expels A.P. Reporter For Report on Prostitution
description: LIMA, Peru, June 19The Peruvian military Government tonight expelled Joseph Mc Gowan Jr., The Associated Press bureau chief here, charg ing that he had insulted the Peruvian national dignity and Peruvian womanhood.

title: Prosecutor Scores City Police On Delays in Detective's Trial
description: Alfred J. Scotti, chief assist ant district attorney of Man hattan, scored the Police De partment yesterday for having failed to finish its departmental trial of a detective accused of dishonesty before that detec tive's retirement, and right to a police pension, became final.

title: Trade Policy Critic Leaves U.S. Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stans denounced today state ments made yesterday by one of his principal assistants on trade policy and he disclosed the re signation of the assistant, Ken neth N. Davis Jr.

title: Judge in Philippines Orders Jailing of Chief of U.S. Base
description: MANILA, June 19 (AP)A Philippine court found the com mander of the United States' Clark Air Force Base and a for mer member of his staff guilty of contempt today and ordered them jailed for failing to pro duce an American airman ac cused of abducting a Filipino girl.

title: Enemy Forces Attack Provincial Capital on Road to Angkor Area
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 19 (AP)Communist pressure increased floral of this capital today as fresh fighting was re ported to have erupted on the road to the historic temples of Angkor.

title: Deception Charges Denied By Auto Repair Concern
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 19 (AP)The vice president and general manager of AAMCO Automatic Transmissions, Inc., of Bridgeport, Pa., denied today charges by the Federal Trade Commission that the company uses deceptive means to get repair jobs.

title: Cup Scores on WOXR
description: Please do not telephone the New York Times or WQXR for scores. The calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station. World Cup re suits will he given on WQXR lateevening hourly news re ports.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
Front Page 1  No Title
Sports of The Times
description: Jesse Moss has a fireplace, a chandelier and old racing prints in his Fifth Avenue law office. His personal style is similarly adorned. At a news conference the other day, he described the State Racing Commissioner as a lackey of the Jockey Club, charged that the building of Aqueduct and Belmont was conceived in sin and called for a res toration of confidence in thoroughbred racing.

title: Abortion Service Starting July 1 To Offer Advice
description: Planned Parenthood of New York City announced yesterday that a citywide abortion infor mation and referral service would be in operation on July 1, when the state's new abor tion law takes effect. The serv ice will advise women on abor tions and refer them to doc tors and hospitals willing and able to perform the operations.

title: Books of The Times
description: If V. S. Naipaul moves effortlessly from his novelist's chair to the historian's desk in this chronicle of his native Trinidad, is because that history is so fictional, family story with living characters. The events are played out on the fringes of European national ambitions; the perform ers include mountebanks and incompe tents, visionaries and predators. Some of this Carib bean history is ludicrous, a Res toration comedy of intrigue, shift ing alliances, in tricate plotting and papiermache ar rogance. But it will induce little laughter. Masters were brutalized, slaves mutilated, the Indians de stroyed, life de graded. There was something about this island (and perhaps all the others in that sea) that subdued each man to what he dealt sin, and since what he dealt in demanded the exploitation of other men, the result was that each man suffered or flourished only by other people's suffering. Few books, I think, will make so evident the rot that sets in when men leave their native hearth, free of the binding force of convention, morality and accepted norms, and act out their animal instincts. To be sure, we see enough of such behavior today. But at least we go through the motions of protesting these acts and sometimes putting a stop to them. But the Europeans who came to the islands in the form of administrators, magistrates and traders had the military power, the sanction of their laws, the certainty of their natural superiority. The word gook may not have been invented, but the psychology that coined it was long in existence.

title: FEW NEW ISSUES BOW IN THE WEEK
description: The newissue market con tinued in the doldrums this week as only three companies made first public offerings of their common stock.

title: Topics: International Law in the Middle East
description: A recurrent theme of the Middle East debate is no weight to conquest. President Johnson sounded that theme in 1968 and, more recently, Secre tary of State Rogers maintained that any changes in the 1949 armistice lines between the Arab States and Israel should not reflect the weight of con quest and should be confined to insubstantial alterations re quired for mutual security.

title: Massachusetts Drug Raids
description: BEVERLY, Mass., June 19 (AP)  Eightythree persons were arrested late last night and early today in drug raids in Beverly, Lynn and Manches ter by Federal and local offi cials. All those arrested were under 25 years of age, the offi cials said. The arrests, the au thorities said, were primarily for heroin violations.

title: ALBERT M. THORNE
description: ALBERT M. THORNE

title: HEATH BECOMES PRIME MINISTER; MAKES A PLEDGE TO UNITE BRITAIN; CONTROLS COMMONS BY 30 SEATS
description: LONDON, June 19Edward Heath moved into 10 Downing Street tonight as the new Con servative party Prime Minister of Britain.

title: Orchestra League Presents Award to Mrs. Thompson
description: The American Symphony Or chestra League presented the Gold Baton Award, its highest honor, to Helen M. Thompson, manager of the New York Phil harmonic, last night in Denver during its 25th national confer ence.

title: HUMM ADVANCES IN L.I. TITLE GOLF
description: EAST WILLISTON, L. I., June 19John Humm of Rockville Links had a builtin rooting section today as he gained the quarterfinal round of the Long Island Golf Association ama teur championship at the Wheatley Hills Golf Club. The rooting section cost the 51 yearold Humm $14 in caddie fees that remained in the fam ily.

title: 96 INDIANS STAGE A BELGRADE SITIN
description: BELGRADE, Yougoslavia, June 19A group of 96 damp but determined Indians from Uganda entered the second day of a sitin strike in the drive way of the British Embassy here today.

title: Four $100,000 Stakes Events Highlight Horse Racing Today
Political Notions Crumble Under Tory Triumph
description: LONDON, June 19  Many pieces of conventional wisdom about British politics have gone down with Harold Wilson. And in those crumbled notions must lie part of the explanation for the greatest election upset here in a generation.

title: Piccolo Rites Held
description: CHICAGO, June 19 (AP) Six teammates served as pall yearers today at the funeral of Brian Piccolo, a Chicago Bear running back who died Tues day of cancer. The pallbearers were Gale Savers, Dick Butkus, Randy Jackson, Ralph Kurek, Mike Pyle and Ed O'Bradovich. A requiem mass was offered in Christ the King Roman Catholic Church here.

title: FREEHAN LEADS ALLSTAR BALLOT
description: Bill Freehan, Detroit Tigers' catcher, emerged as the biggest votegetter yesterday in the first weekly release of fan bal loting for the 1970 American League AllStar team.

title: EDGARDO IN LUCIA SUNG BY ION BUZEA
description: Ion Buzea, the Rumanian ten or who made his debut with the Metropolitan Opera earlier this season, added the role of Ed gardo in Lucia di Lammer moor to his repertory there in Thursday night's performance of the Donizetti work.

title: Miss Crispell Is Bride in Virginia
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., June 19Surrounded by 200 friends and relatives who led lighted candles in a circle near the Jefferson Rotunda, Miss Barbara Jean Crispell and Richard Doane Johnson were married tonight on the Lawn of the University of Virginia.

title: GOODRICH RAISING TIRE PRICES JULY 1
description: Following on the heels of a wage settlement that it is esti mated will cost $70million over the next three years, the B. F. Goodrich Tire Company an nounced yesterday it would charge more for its tires be ginning July 1.

title: Spain Fines Opposition Leaders For Sending Message to Rogers
description: MADRID, June 19The Span ish Government has begun to levy fines against opposition figures who signed a statement to Secretary of State William P. Rogers last month expressing concern over the current nego tiations on United States mili tary bases in Spain.

title: New York G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) The Pentagon today identified eight servicemen as having been killed In the war in Southeast Asia, including Specialist 4 Den nis N. Hogenboom of the Army,

title: Goldberg Presents New Plan for Election Reform
description: A program for party and electoral reform was outlined yesterday by Arthur J. Gold berg. At the same time, he assailed proposals for such re forms advanced three weeks ago by his opponent for the Democratic gubernatorial nomi nation, Howard J. Samuels.

title: F.T.C. Proposes Rule to Outlaw Unordered Interstate Shipments
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The Federal Trade Commission moved today to outlaw the interstate shipment of un ordered merchandise.

title: DEVON SLATE WINS AT 5TH AVE. COACH
description: A slate of 10 directors sub mitted by the Devon Committee and pledged to continue Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., as an operating entity emerged vic torious yesterday. Earlier in the day, the Appellate Division cut more than $3million from the price the city will have to pay for intangible assets of the com pany taken over in 1962.

title: Psychiatrist Finds Seale Witness Is Stable Enough to Testify About Murder
description: NEW HAVEN, June 19  A psychiatric report on George Sams Jr., a key prosecution wit ness against Bobby G. Seale in connection with the slaying of a fellow Black Panther, has found him to be stable and in telligent enough to give reli able testimony.

title: Working Against SALT
description: The Senate Armed Services Committee has prudently trimmed from President Nixon's Safeguard antiballis tic missile (ABM) program a small but significant proposal to begin work on a thin area defense against China. But the committee went on to endorse the bulk of a $1.5billion Administration request to continue development of two Safeguard sites approved narrowly last year and to begin work on a third site to defend Minuteman missile bases against Soviet attack.

title: Bombing Damages Home Of Financier in Montreal
description: MONTREAL, June 19 (AP) The home of Jean Louis Le vesque, a financier who lives in the wealthy suburb of Outre mont, was the target of a ter rorist bombing today. The bombing was the 12th in the Montreal area in less than two months and the third this week.

title: BRITISH MARKETS BUOYED BY TORIES
O'Dwyer and Walinsky Win Breslin's Blessing
description: Jimmy Breslin, newspaper columnist turned City Council President candidate turned novelist, has volunteered from Irelandwhere he is work ing on a new book  some thoughts on the Democratic primary in New York.

title: The Tories Win
description: The Cinderellaman of British politics turns out be not Harold Wilson, winning his third straight elec tion, but Edward Heath, one of the longestshot victors since Harry S. Truman upset Thomas E. Dewey and the pollsters in 1948.

title: Politics: Ottinger's Rivals Again Attack Him on Spending in Campaign for Senate
description: ALBANY, June 19The four candidates for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator started to debate issues in a television program here today that quickly became a threeonone atack of Repre sentative Richard L. Ottinger's campaign spending.

title: Melville Sentenced To 13 to 18 Years In Bombings Here
description: Samuel J. Melville, who a month ago admitted a plot to bomb eight Manhattan office buildings last fall, began a 13 to18year prison term yester day after being sentenced in heavily guarded Federal and state courtrooms.

title: Bailey Resigns as Counsel Of Air Traffic Controllers
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization an nounced today that it had accepted the resignation of F. Lee Bailey, the Boston criminal lawyer as its general counsel.

title: AMEX STOCKS RISE AS VOLUME GAINS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange ended mostly higher yesterday in slightly heavier trading.

title: Cadet Drowns in Horseplay
description: MINERALS WELLS, Tex., June 19 (UPI)A 22yearold South Vietnamese Air Force cadet drowned today when fel low classmates tossed him in a motel swimming pool to cele brate his first solo flight. Seven cadets had gathered at the motel for a party after taking up their military helicopters for the first time at the train ing school at Fort Wolters. The victim's name was withheld.

title: School Finance Unit Meets
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) The President's Commission on School Finance held its first meeting today to begin its study of future revenue needs and resources of the nation's public and nonpublic elementary and secondary schools.

title: PLATINUM SHOWS RISE FOR FUTURES
description: Platinum futures rose yester day on the New York Mercan tile Exchange with no particu lar news to trigger the advance. The January contract, with 36 sales, went to $156.50 an ounce from $154.60 an ounce the day before. The October contract rose to $154.50 an ounce from $152.50 the previous day.

title: DAVID IRWIN, 60, ARCTIC EXPLORER
description: David Irwin, who survived 2,000mile trip alone across the Arctic in 1935, died Thurs day after a brief illness at his home in Scotrun, Pa. He was 60 years old.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Danny Davis Plays For Intrepid Fans At Holmdel Center
description: HOLMDEL, N. J., June 19  Only a few hundred dauntless fans of country and Western music made their way through the heavy rain that pelted this area last night to attend the first program in a threenight country music festival at the Garden State Arts Center. The festival is being presented through tomorrow night by WJRZ, a Hackensack radio sta tion that specializes in country music.

title: Thriving South Koreans Worry About U. S. Plans
description: MUNSAN, South Korea, June 16The people of Mun san are worried.

title: India Said to Refuse To Back Asian Plan On Cambodia Peace
description: NEW DELHI, June 19  A threenation task force seeking peace in Cambodia was report ed today to have failed in its efforts to persuade New Delhi to endorse its approach for solving the Indochina problem.

title: Ziobro, Trailing 6 Down, Beats Alpert in Jersey Final, 3 and 1
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 19 Billy Ziobro of Ash Brook, trailing at one stage by six holes, rallied on the second round today to defeat Jeff Alpert of Florham Park, 3 and 1, and take the 69th New Jer sey amateur golf champion ship.

title: New Play by Storey Stars Two Knights At the Royal Court
description: LONDON, June 19Never haunt of theatrical knights, the Royal Court Theater has coaxed two of themJohn Gielgud and Ralph Richardsoninto its pro duction of David Storey's new play, Home.

title: Interim Chief at Boston U.
description: BOSTON, June 18 (AP) Boston University announced today that Calvin B. T. Lee, dean of the College of Liberal Arts, had been named acting president of the university. Mr. Lee will replace Arland F. ChristJaner, who leaves July 1 to become president of the Col lege Entrance Examination Board.

title: CHAMBER ENDORSES PRESIDENT'S POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The board of directors of the United States Chamber of Com merce endorsed today the eco nomic policy of President Nixon as described in the President's speech turn days ago.

title: Witness in Addonizio Trial Cites Apparently Fictitious Bills
description: TRENTON, June 19A book keeper testified today that his employers, contractors on the South Side sewer in Newark, had apparently issued checks to pay what the Government has called fictitious bills even before the bills were received.

title: Thai Premier Visits Vietnam; Troop Shift Believed Discussed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 19 (Reuters)  Thailand's Premier, Thanom Kittikachorn, conferred with the principal American and South Vietnam ese military commanders when he made an unexpected seven hour visit to South Vietnam to day.

title: SUGAR QUOTA IN U.S. INCREASED FOR 1970
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP)  The Agriculture Department announced today a rise of 100, 000 tons in this year's United States sugar quota, lifting the 1970 requirement to 11.2 mil lion tons. It was the second quota expansion in the last two weeks. The department an nounced an additional deficit of 150,000 tons in the amount Puerto Rico had planned to sup ply this year. The increase in the basic quota and the Puerto Rican deficit was prorated among domestic and foreign suppliers.

title: Use of Nation's Land Is Being Reassessed
description: LOS ANGELES, June 16 We don't have too many people, Secretary of the In terior Walter J. Hickel remarked recently. The trouble is that they're concentrated in the wronff nlaces.

title: PAKISTANIS URGED TO DEVALUE RUPEE
description: CHITTAGONG, Pakistan, June 19 (AP)  In a confidential report, a highlevel economic committee has recommended that Pakistan devalue her ru pee. It also has suggested the country defy pressure from the International Monetary Fund and continue to give bonus rates of exchanges to encour age exporters.

title: President Consoles Wilson And Congratulates Heath
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  President Nixon conveyed his congratulations to Edward Heath today and his personal sympathy to Harold Wilson, the defeated Prime Minister.

title: Congressmen See a Slice of Life in Slums
description: We live here, we don't want you here! the gan gling Puerto Rican youth shouted. Get the hell out of here, we don't need you!

title: COMMISSION ASKS CANADA TO REDUCE DRUG PENALTIES
description: OTTAWA, June 19An offi cial commission recommended today that Canada radically relax her laws banning or re stricting the use of narcotics.

title: JUMPER LAURELS TO DOUBLE DUTCH
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 19  Heike de Leyer has been riding horses most of his 13 years, but never had entered a jumper competition until this year.

title: Road to Better Mail Service
description: The overwhelming passage by the House of a bill to modernize the postal service brings halfway to realization a major governmental reform. The wrangle over the bill's labor provisions obscured the funda mental nature of the contribution the measure can make to increasing the speed and efficiency of the mails.

title: BLUE CHIPS PACE MARKET ADVANCE
State Promises $250,000 To Aid Papp Theater Plan
description: Governor Rockefeller has of fered $250,000 in state match ing funds if the city acquires the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theater at 425 Lafayette Street, it was learned yesterday.

title: Chicago Policeman Is Slain; Five Charged With Murder
description: CHICAGO, June 19, (UPI) A Chicago Policeman was shot to death today while sitting alone in his squad car while making out a report on the city's South Side.

title: 5 European Plane Makers Ready Plans to Cooperate
description: BRUSSELS, June 19 (AP) Five of Europe's largest air craft manufacturers have agreed to cooperate to fight American competition.

title: Mitchell Deplores Delay in the House On DrugAbuse Bill
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., June 19 (AP)  Attorney General John N. Mitchell criticized the House today for not acting on the Nixon Administration's pro posed legislation aimed at curb ing drug abuse and the nar cotics traffic. He called it an appalling delay.

title: Podell for Voting at 18
description: WASHINGTON, June 19The name of Representative Ber tram L. Podell, Democrat of Brooklyn, was inadvertently omitted from the Wednesday rollcall vote of the House of Representatives on the bill to lower the voting age to 18 and to extend the Voting Rights Act. Mr. Podell voted for the bill.

title: Britain's Leader: Shy and Complex
description: LONDON, June 19On the night of his triumph, Edward Heath stood at the bar of the Crook Log Hotel in Bexley, the district south of London that sent the shy, intense Conservative to Parliament in 1950. Mr. Heath listened un easily to the first returns of the evening surrounded by workmen and wives and local businessmen.

title: Oregon Brokerage Office Is Punished by the S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission said today the Portland, Ore., office of May & Co., a brokerage firm, would be suspended from overthecoun ter transactions for 10 business days beginning July 1. The company will be allowed to do business for certain current customers but may not take any profits.

title: NIXON IS WEIGHING VOTING BILL VETO
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  President Nixon left for Camp David today to resolve what his senior associates describe as one of the most difficult de cisions he has faced: Whether to approve or veto legislation lowering the voting age from 21 to 18.

title: Heyerdahl's Oar Smashed
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., June 19 (UPI)A radio message from Thor Heyerdahl's papyrus boat today said a huge wave had smashed a steering oar on the vessel as it sailed through, the midAtlantic toward Mexico. The boat, called Ra2, left the Moroccan port of Safi in May on a voyage to prove that Egyptians could have used papyrus boats to sail to the Americas centuries before Co lumbus.

title: Not Just Election Loss, A Housing Problem Too
description: LONDON, June 19 (UPI) Harold Wilson said today that he and his wife would have a housing problem when they move out of the Prime Minister's official residence at 10 Downing Street.

title: Secundas Have Son
description: A son was born May 20 to Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Sec unda of New York and Fair Harbor, Fire Island, N. Y., at Beth Israel Hospital. The child, who is named Andrew Morgan, is a grandson of Sholom Secunda, the com poser and conductor.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 19 (AP)  Bombs exploded today at two branches of the Bank of America, shattering dozens of windows. The bombings were the latest in a series of violent acts against the na tion's lamest bank.

title: German Youths Fight Police In Protest Over McNamara
description: HEIDELBERG, West Ger many, June 19 (Reuters)  Stu dents and policemen fought to day during leftist demonstra tions against a meeting of in ternational development aid ex perts attended by Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank.

title: U.S. Withdraws Backing Of Loan to Penn Central
description: The Nixon Administration, in a reversal of plans, decided yesterday not to guarantee up to $200million of bank loans for the financially troubled Penn Central Company and its huge railroad subsidiary, the Penn. Central Transportation Company.

title: Virginia G.O.P. Leaders Spurn Overtures From Byrd
description: RICHMOND, June 19This state's Republican hierarchy, including Gov. Linwood Holton, has spurned overtures from United States Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., a former Democrat, for their endorsement of his in dependent candidacy for re election.

title: ARGENTINES BEAT MILAN IN SOCCER
description: Two of the top soccer clubs in the world, Racing Football Club of Argentina and A.C. Milan of Italy, attracted only 4,103 spectators to Yankee Sta dium last night as the South Americans scored a 1to0 tri umph.

title: Warsaw Pact Meeting Set
description: WARSAW, June 19 (Reuters) The Warsaw Pact foreign min asters will meet in Budapest June 21 and 22 to discuss prep arations for a European Secu rity conference, the official Polish press agency reported tonight.

title: If You Always Thought Fashion Was Frivolous...
description: When a woman lengthens her skirts and grows her fin gernails, it's a sign of crisis and economic depression. Subconsciously, she feels de fensive.

title: Air Force Deploys Multiple Warheads on Missiles
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The United States reached an important milestone today in the postwar development of arms technology by announc ing that it had deployed multiple warheads on some American intercontinental mis siles.

title: DR. LEON P. LEWITHIN
description: Dr. Leon Paul Lewithin, senior clinical assistant at St. Clare's Hospital, died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 73 years old and lived at 325 East 57th Street.

title: Lisa Rosenblum Wins
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., June 19 Lisa Rosenblum of Long Is land City, defeated Donna Stockton of Garden City, L. I., 62, 63, for the New Jersey State girls' 16yearsandunder singles championship today at the Englewood Field Club.

title: Marriage Planned By Padraig Hahn
description: WINNETKA, Ill., June 19 Mr. and Mrs. Charles Halm have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Padraig deNormandie Hahn, to Theodore A. Brenneri, son of Theodore W. Brennen of Toledo, Ohio, and Mrs. Ar thur E. Backus of Chicago. The wedding is planned for late October.

title: Royal Guests Visit Windsor
description: WINDSOR, England, June 19 (Reuters)More than 20 mem bers of various royal families attended a dinner tonight at Windsor aCstle given by Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip. The dinner celebrated the 70th birthday this year of Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and Earl Mountbatten.

title: In West Cambodia, Weak Army Waits
description: SISOPHON, Cambodia, June 19The flies that swarm through the tilting barracks seem to be in control of the decaying army garrison in this town in Cambodia's northwest.

title: Africans Found Eager on Trade With U.S., but Want Major Role
description: The welcome mat is out for American business in three Afri can countries now recovering from severe setbacks  Ni geria, the Congo (Kinshasa) and Ghana  but Africans are de termined to do their own thing in any new ventures.

title: Ulster Backlash Vote Sends Paisley to Commons
description: LONDON, June 19  The Rev. Ian Paisley, the fiery Prot estant extremist and potential embarrassment to the Conser vative party leadership, won a House of Commons seat from Northern Ireland today on a backlash of Protestant resent ment against the Roman Catho lic minority.

title: RoundTrip Waste
description: The flying beer can and the shattered softdrink bottle are heard in the landsounds as American roadside and beachfront litter piling up in summer.

title: STATE BANK CHIEF OUTLINES HIS POLICY
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., June 19New York State's new Superintendent of Banks William T. Dentzer Jr., made his first public appearance be fore bankers here today and hinted broadly that he had no inclination to change dramatic ally the course of policy fol lowed in the recent past.

title: MRS. JAMES PERKINS, EDUCATOR'S WIFE, 55
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 19 (AP)  Mrs. Jean Bredin Per kins, the wife of James A. Perkins, former president of Cornell University, died last night at Princeton Hospital after a long illness. She was 55 years old and lived at 18 Camp belton Circle.

title: TAX ACTION DELAYED BY WEST GERMANS
description: BONN, June 19Heeding a central bank warning, the West German Parliament shelved to day a bill for higher tax allow ances on workers income and gradual abolition of a surtax on selfemployed and corporate income.

title: Girl With MidiDress Refused Her Diploma
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., June 19 (AP)A girl was re fused her diploma from Nichols Junior High School here today because she was wearing a midilength dress.

title: DAVID PASMANTIER, LED IMPORTING FIRM
description: David Pasmantier died at the Bronx Lebanon Hospital yester day. He was 71 years old and lived at 10 Park Avenue.

title: Gentile Wins Westchester
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 19 John Gentile Jr. of the Pat terson Club at Fairfield, Conn added the Westchester amateur golf championship today to the Connecticut amateur title he won last year.

title: Samuels Pictures Goldberg as Passe
description: Howard J. Samuels said yes terday that his opponent for the Democratic nomination for Governor, Arthur J. Goldberg, represented the passe liberal ism of. the thirties, forties and fifties, which hasn't worked. Mr. Samuels said he, on the other hand, exemplified the new liberalism of the seventies, which is how to make govern ment function.

title: 20% RISE IN RENTS CALLED POSSIBLE
description: Rents for most of the 1.3 million families in rentcon trolled apartments will be raised up to 20 per cent to cover landlords' taxes, operat ing expenses and maintenance costs if Mayor Lindsay's com puterized rent formula is ap proved by the City Council.

title: MRS. COURT GAINS FINAL WITH EASE
description: LONDON, June 19  For the London grasscourt tennis championship at the Queens Club tomorrow, Rod Laver will meet John Newcombe, just as the seedings have them doing in the Wimbledon tournament, which opens next week.

title: Common Market Officials See Hard Economic Road for Britain
description: PARIS, June 19European Common Market officials see another difficult period ap proaching for the British econ omy and warn that hard eco nomic realities will determine whether Britain finally wins admission in the market.

title: 7RUN FIRST HELPS SEAVER WIN NO. 10
description: Only an act of God could have stopped the Mets and Tom Seaver last night  and one nearly did. With the New York ers trouncing the Philadelphia Phils by 90 in the second in ning, a heavy downpour halted the game.

title: Leslie Martin Wed to William Duncan 3d
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 19 The marriage of Miss Leslie Ann Martin and William Rowland Duncan 3d, who were graduated June 1 from Pembroke College and Brown University, respectively, took place here this afternoon. The Rev. H. Arthur Lane per formed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church.

title: 2 ON TIMES CALLED IN PANTHERS' CASE
description: The lawyer for three Black Panthers charged with a ma chinegun attack on a Jersey City police station 18 months ago obtained subpoenas yester day requiring a court appear ance by two New York Times reporters who wrote stories about the attack.

title: DAVE HILL SECOND AS WINDS DIMINISH
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 19 Tony Jacklin continued to bat ter par today as the high winds that buffeted the competitors yesterday in the United States Open golf championship van ished. As zephyrs replaced 41 mileanhour winds at the Hazeltine National Golf Club course, the 25yearold English man widened his margin to three strokes with a 36hole aggregate of 141.

title: PANTHERS SEEKING NEW CONSTITUTION
description: WASHINGTON, June 19The Black Panther party announced today plans for a Revolutionary People's Constitutional Conven tion in Philadelphia on Labor Day, Sept. 7.

title: SOYUZ 9 RETURNS AFTER 17DAY TRIP SETS SPACE MARK
description: MOSCOW, June 19Two So viet astronauts, Col. Andrian G. Nikolayev and Vitaly I. Se vastyanov, landed safely on the earth today after the long est manned flight in history aboard the Soyuz 9 spacecraft.

title: Thank Technology
description: Out of technology can come more interesting forms of art. This was proved hand somely yesterday at a metal smith show that opened in the Museum of Contemporary Crafts.

title: Detection of Fraud in Ceramics Is Aided by Emissions of Light
description: BOSTON, June 19  Collec tors who are buying vast quan tities of ancient Chinese ceram ics of the T'ang Dynasty  as well as plenty of modern fakes of themmay now have a scientific technique to de tect the frauds.

title: Property Stewart Bought Is Issue in Brooklyn Race
description: The purchase by State Sen ator Waldaba Stewart of three dilapidated buildings in an area he proposed four months later for an urban renewal proj ect has become the central issue in the bitter Democratic primary fights in the Bedford ?? section of Brooklyn.

title: An Oil Fire Sweeps Franklin, Pa.
description: FRANKLIN, Pa., Saturday, June 20 (AP)Thousands of gallons of oil continued to feed a fire raging at a multi million dollar oil refinery early today, but firefighters said they were making head way.

title: Briton Ends Ocean Crossing
description: NEW SHOREHAM, R. I., June 19 (AP)James Bailey, 40 years old, of Wymeswold, Eng., landed at Block Island today, ending a lonely and perilous journey in a 27foot boat that started May 2 in Penzance, Eng.

title: Savings and Loan Units Show a Gain in Deposits
description: The flow of funds into the nation's savings and loan asso ciations improved substantially during May compared to the depressed levels of last fall and winter, the United States Sav ings and Loan League reported yesterday.

title: FRAN WELCH DEAD; KANSAS TRACK COACH
description: EMPORIA, Kan., June 19 (AP) F. G. (Fran) Welch, an inter nationally known track and field coach who trained a number of Olympia athletes, died today at the University of Kansas Medi cal Center in Kansas City after a brief illness with leukemia. He was 74 years old.

title: Menu Offers Musicals At 48th St. Restaurant
description: Miniaturization, which has done so much for electronics, is now being applied to the Broadway musical theater at the Pig 'n' Whistle, a two story restaurant in what was once President Taft's town house at 36 West 48th Street.

title: Jeremiah T. Mahoney, 91, Dies; A Lawyer and Former Justice
description: Jeremiah Titus Mahoney, a prominent lawyer and former judge who was once an all round athlete, died Thursday night at the New York Athletic Club, where he had an apart ment for the last four years. He would have been 92 years old next Tuesday.

title: Wife Says Husband Misused Her Funds In $6.2Million Suit
description: Mrs. Charles C. Bassine yes terday accused her husband, chairman of Spartans Indus tries, Inc., of fraud and misrep resentation in handling her fi nances and sued him for $6.2 million.

title: British Poll Takers, Under Fire, Blame Low Vote
description: LONDON, June 19  British poll takers, widely assailed for their mistaken election fore casts, excused themselves to day by arguing that an unex pectedly low turnout had up set the general prediction of a strong Labor party victory.

title: C. J. Dodd to Marry Susan Mooney
description: CORONA DEL MAR, Calif., June 19  Miss Susan B. Mooney, a former speech writer and legislative aide on the staff of Senator Thomas J. Dodd of Connecticut, and the Senator's son, Christopher John Dodd, plan to be wed in August.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: UNISHOPS PLANS TO BUY MASTERS
description: Discount stores, restaurants and a leading juice producer were the major targets for the mergerminded yesterday. At the same time, two companies backed away from previously announced resort developments.

title: 23D DANCE FESTIVAL SET IN CONNECTICUT
description: Connecticut College's 23d American Dance Festival in New London has announced the schedule for its sixweek season, which is to include seven premieres. The new works listed so far are by Mar tha Graham, Meredith Monk James Cunningham and Lucas Hoving.

title: FUND SALES EDGED MAY REDEMPTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 19The mutual fund industry appears to have incurred heavy liquida tions of its shares in the early part of May, but then a turn around to net sales in the second half of the month, according to figures collected by the Invest ment Company Institute.

title: 7 Die in Iowa Fall As Roof Collapses In Grain Elevator
description: ALBERT CITY, Iowa, June 19 (UPI)  Seven construction workers plunged 130 feet to their death today when the scaffolding and steel girders of a grain elevator roof collapsed 15 minutes before the men were to have quit for the day.

title: Connecticut G.O.P. Convention Opens
description: HARTFORD, June 19  As the Republican State Conven tion opened here today, the big question was not who would he nominated for the top offices hut whether challengers would he able to force the holding of the first primary election in Connecticut's history.

title: May the Richest Man Win
description: LONDON, June 19  When Harold Wilson was to speak outside London in the election campaign just ended, he went down to the station and took a train like anyone else. Well, almost like anyone else.

title: L.I. Boy Dies in Florida
description: BROOKSVILLE, Fla., June 19 (AP)A taxicab, caught be tween two semitrailer trucks in a collision, exploded Into flames today. A 9yearold boy was burned to death. Philip Lopez of Nesconset, L. I., was killed. His mother, the cab driver, and two other children were saved. The Lopez family was on vacation.

title: OneIssue Senate Race
description: The campaign for the Dem ocratic nomination for United States Senator has been char acterized by some politicians as four men in search of an issue.

title: Soldier Wins Right to Challenge War in Vietnam
description: A Queens soldier was granted the right yesterday to try to prove in Federal Court his claim that the war in Vietnam is unconstitutional.

title: City Trees: Some Problems Crop Up
description: Year in and year out an average of 8,000 people liv ing on 5,000 miles of Streets in Queens complain to the Overlook office of the Parks Department about trees, and the pattern of complaints is always the same.

title: MRS. ABRAHAM GOLDBERG
description: Mrs. Abraham Goldberg, mother of Bernard Goldberg, president of Schenley Indus tries, Inc., died at the Albert Einstein Hospital here yester day. She was 77 years old.

title: Short Interest Showed Sharp Advance in Month
L. I. Sound Pollution Challenged
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 19The Connecticut Conser vation Association, a private organization, has filed a $150million suit against four towns and cities and six companies on the state's coastline, charging them with polluting Long Island Sound and destroying ecologically important marshlands.

title: MEXICO HOLDING 24 ON 2 U.S. TUNA BOATS
description: SAN DIEGO, June 19 (AP)  Mexico has held 24 men aboard two United States tuna boats prisoner for two weeks in a dis pute over fishing rights, the manager of the American Tuna boat Association said today.

title: Dance: A Reconstructed Petrouchka
description: American Ballet Theater dug into its history last night and came up with a gem. In 1942, toward the very end of his career, the great Russian choreographer Michel Fokine produced for the then very young and adventurous Bal let Theater a final version of one of his most famous bal lets, Petrouchka. During those early performances, Petrouchka was danced by Yurek Lazovsky, the Moor by Dimitri Romanoff and the Dancer by Lucia Chase.

title: Shultz Says Unemployment Will Probably Rise Above 5 Per Cent
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP)  Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz says unemployment will probably climb above the 5 per cent rate recorded in May, the highest monthly figure since 1965.

title: BERTRAM SCHWARTZ
description: Bertram Schwartz, a lawyer, and professor of military law at the New York University Law School, died of a heart at tack at his home yesterday. He was 57 years old and lived at 16403 89th Avenue, Jamaica, Queens.

title: Antiques: For the Maritime Collector
description: Objects and pictures that document New York's im portance as a port offer chal lenging possibilities for the collector.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Philadelphia at New York (8:05 P.M.)Short (37) vs. Koosman (23).

title: Rockefeller Is Endorsed By Leather Goods Union
description: Governor Rockefeller was endorsed yesterday by the In ternational Leather Goods, Plastics and Novelty Workers Union, which has 25,000 members in upstate New York and which has never be fore endorsed a Republican for Governor.

title: U.S. Printers Get a Raise
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) A wage increase of 53 cents an hour was announced today for journeymen compositors at the Government Printing Of fice. Also affected are other craftsmen whose wages are tied to the compositors' wage scale. Under a proposal ap proved by the Joint Congres sional Committee on Printing, the compositors will now re ceive $5.64 an hour.

title: The Outlook for Britain Under Heath
description: LONDON, June 19More than most traditional govern ing parties returning to power after an interlude, the Con servative party takes office in Britain with a specific mandate for change.

title: Hester, K. Dall, Princeton Man, Wed in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 19 Miss Hester Kingsland Dall and Harry Mark St. John 3d, on of Mr. and Mrs. St. John Jr. of Avon and Masons Is land, Mystic, were married here this morning.

title: Thomas Happel Jr. Dead; Headed Pet Milk Division
description: Thomas K. Happel Jr., presi dent of the Dairy division of Pet Incorporated in Johnson City, Tenn., died Monday at Memorial Hospital there, after a long illness. He was 56 years old.

title: 6 on Capitol Hill Figure in Secret Inquiry On Builder's Action in $ 5Million Claim
description: WASHINGTON, June 20A report that a Baltimore grand jury has been prohibited from making public gives the names of four Representatives, one Senator and one former Senator as figuring in a case in which a contractor was accused of trying to defraud the Federal Government, reliable Sources reported today.

title: Bridge
description: SOME actions at the bridge table have a mysterious aspect. Bids and plays that do not seem to make sense may be the result of incompe tence, but sometimes there are hidden meanings which partner is expected to figure out.

title: French Jet Stowaway Dies
description: LYONS, France, June 20 (AP) A 13yearold French boy died of cold and oxygen star vation today when he hid in the undercarriage of an air liner flying from Lyons, in southern France, to Abidjan, copital of the Republic of the Ivory Coast, in West African, airport sources said. The body of Jean Pierre Viers dropped from the French U.T.A. DC8 aircraft shortly after the pilot lowered the landing gear over Abidjan's airport, the sources seld.

title: Pop
description: THE mysterious aloof ness and quirky genius of Bob Dylan so fasci nate the public imag ination that the rare release of a new album by this sly, incredibly gifted artist invar iably rocks the excitable psyche of pop culture with the force of a historic event.

title: Both Sides in Newark Seek Orderly Shift as Bitterness Fades
description: NEWARK, June 20With the corridor outside his City Hell offices lined with cartons overflowing with pictures, awards and other personal memorabilia, Hugh J. Addoni zip, Newark's outgoing Mayor pledged the full cooperation of his administration this week to the orderly transfer of author ity to Mayorelect Kenneth A. Gibson.

title: Great Dane Club B. Match Listed Today at Westbury
description: The second annual American Kennel Club  sanctioned B. Match sponsored by the Great Dane Club of America will be held today, at the Salisbury Park East Meadow in West bury. L.I.

title: ATHLETICS DOWN WHITE SOX, 8 TO 5
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 20 (AP)Bert Campaneris drove in four runs with a double and homer today to pace the Oak land A's to an 85 victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: THE OPENINGS
description: BOESMAN AND LENA  Tomorrow, Circle in the Square, 159 Bleecker Street, 7. A play by Athol Fugard. Starring James Earl Jones and Ruby Dee.

title: Go Ahead, Interview Me
description: FUNNY thing happened to the Russian Carpa thian Church on 13th Street between Second and Third Avenues on its way to becoming an Off Broadway theater: it became a movie set. Beside the entrance, on a black signboard set with white plastic letters, were the words:

title: The Irrelevant Campus
description: Amid persistent student complaints that higher education is irrelevant has come the disclosure that American scholarship on much of Southeast Asia and particularly North Vietnam, ranges from inadequate to nonexistent. Insufficient Federal support of all international studies is a factor contributing to the neglect. But it is only part of the story. The fact that a combination of the difficulty of the languages and much academic opposition to warrelated studies has allowed these crucial areas to be shunted aside.

title: 7 Seek House Seat Occupied by Ottinger
description: YONKERS, June 20When Richard Ottinger turned his sights this spring from the House to the Senate, he left in his wake one of the most hotly, contested political races in re cent memory here.

title: Socialists Refuse To Give Support To New 3d Party
description: After a fivehour debate, de legates to the Socialist party convention here yesterday re jected a move to support can didates of a new third party this year and in the 1972 Presidential elections.

title: Bahai Movement Banned By New Law in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, June 20 (Reuters)The Iraqi Govern ment has harmed the Bahai movement and has announced the closing of all the move ment's centers and confiscation of its property.

title: Is Boulez Imperialistic?
description: IT will be another year be fore fore Pierre Boulez be comes music director of the New York Philhar monic, but he Is currently in charge of other American or ganizations. One of them is the small but prestigious Ojai Festival In California, whose five concerts, four of them involving the Los Angeles Philharmonic, were given two weeks ago.

title: Have Some Flat Beer
description: ONE of the image problems of commer cial televsion is the elusive quality of re spectability. The medium's in fluence in many fields is nev er questioned, the profit mar gin on capital investment is fairly heady, and the audi ence response in general is constantly reassuring. But among the effete snobs to be found in Washington, and in academic and intellectual cir cles, the TV world has long been regarded with a sneer, even by those who would never admit to peeking at the periodic pinnacles of TV rubbish.

title: The Shattered Dream
description: When both John Adams and Thomas Jefferson were near their end, Adams wrote to his more fortu nate successor concerning that im mense unpopularity which fell like the tower of Siloam upon me . . Sic transit gioria mundi. So Herbert Hoover (had he and Roosevelt ever resumed their early friendship) might have written to Franklin D. Roose velt.

title: Mansfield to Reply to Nixon On the State of the Economy
description: The National Broadcasting Company said yesterday that the Senate majority leader, Mike Mansfield, had accepted the network's offer of free television and radio time to reply to President Nixon's address on the economy last Wednesday.

title: WINNER IN FINAL WILL RETIRE CUP
description: After 5 P.M. (New York time) today, the Federale In ternationale de Football Assd ciation, the world governing soccer body, will start search ing for a new World Cup.

title: MERGER IS SOUGHT BY PRESBYTERIANS
description: MEMPHIS, June 20  The Presbyterian Church in the United States a historically Southern and traditionally con servative communion, sprinkled its annual meeting here this week with generous dashes of liberalism as it inched hesitant ly toward a reconciliation with its sister denomination in the North.

title: ISRAELI JETS ATTACK U.A.R. FOR 21ST DAY
description: TEL AVIV, June 20 (Reuters) Israeli jets pounded Egyptian military targets in the Suez Canal region for the 21st con secutive day, hitting fortified positions and artillery sites, military spokesman said here today. All planes returned safely to hase, he added.

title: New Historical Dictionary Of Italian Is Due in 2021
description: ROME, June 20 (UPI)An ancient literary organization known as the Accademia della Crusca (Academy of Bran) be cause of its sifting of words is preparing a new historical dic tionary of the Italian lan guage.

title: House Inquiry Committee Is Off to Southeast Asia
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) A 12man House committee left today to investigate United States involvement in South east Asia.

title: James W. Fordyce Weds Miss Anne C. Boardman
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., June 20Miss Anne Calef Board man and James Woodard Fordyce were married here this afternoon in the Episco pal Church of the Redeemer by the Rev. Donald E. Bitsberger.

title: PAVAN BARS AID FOR PENN CENTRAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) Top officials of the Penn Cen tral railroad tried but failed to day to win the crucial backing of Representative Wright Pat man, Democrat of Texas, for a Government guarantee of a $200million loan to the finan cially troubled line.

title: FULBRIGHT'S RECALL SOUGHT IN ARKANSAS
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., June 20 James D. Johnson, who op posed Senator J. W. Fulbright for reelection in 1968, is trying to amend the Arkansas Consti tution so that he can lead an effort to recall the Senator.

title: The 19th century: alive and well
description: NEOCLASSICISMDuring the first half of the 19th century, neoclassicism reigned supreme and Duncan Phyfe was its chief exponent in this country. The 1830's parlor in the Metropolitan (right) shows the style as it was. The modem blackwalled room below features Italian Directoire chairs with neoclassic lines ar ranged around a Noguchi table. Art by Robert Indiana, James Seawright and Babe Shapiro adds a 20thcentury signature.

title: Louise B. King Is Bride Of Lieut. Warren Cook
