description: DOVER, Mass., June 20 Miss Louise Bramhall King, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Franklin King Jr. of Sher horn, Mass., was married here this afternoon in St. Dunstan's Episcopal Church to First Lieut. Warren Cum mings Cook, U.S.M.C., son of Mrs. William H. Vanderbilt of Williamstown, Mass. and John R. Cook of New York.

title: THREAT OF ARSON ALERTS HUNT CLUB
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 20 Extraordinary security mea sures have been taken at the Fairfield County Hunt Club following a telephoned threat to burn the barns at the Fair field County horse show.

title: The Student Moves
description: THE air was heavy with the sense of responsibility. No one smoked or used bad language or glued a transistor radio to his head. These were the campus voices of reason, the delegates to the metro politan area conference of the Move ment for a New Congress. They had gathered on a rainy Saturday, May 23, at the auditorium of the Columbia University Law School to pick candi dates to support in Tuesday's pri maries who would try to end the Indochina War.

title: Architect Designs Tower Home for His Family
description: To the neighborhood kids, the van Summerns' new home in Wilton, Conn., is Fort Apache.

title: Woman Seized After Heath is Splashed With Red Paint
description: LONDON, June 20 (Reuters) A 26yearold woman was ar rested today after red paint was thrown over Britain's new Prime Minister, Edward Heath.

title: James E. Meighan Jr., 66, Actor on Stage and Radio
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., June 20James E. Meighan Jr., a retired stage and radio actor, died today at his home, 29 Greenlawn Road. His age was 66.

title: Dance: Perennial Joy of Fancy Free
description: Twentysix years ago, on an April night at the old Metropolitan Opera House, Fancy Free burst upon New York. And it has been burst ing ever since; this Jerome RobbinsLeonard Bernstein ballet has become one of the best loved in the American repertory. Its joys are peren nial, and never seem dimmed by cast changes or even overfamiliarity.

title: Skyjackings: What's Being Done And How Passengers React
description: POLICE cars surround an El Al jet as it lands at Fiumicino Airport in Rome.... An American couple are unceremoniously searched as they start to board an AVENSA plane in Caracas for a short trip to Isla de Margarita.... Two airline guards dressed in business suits and carrying revolvers concealed in shoulder holsters find seats among the paying passengers on a Pan American flight between New York and San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: A Holdup Suspect Killed And 2d Hurt by Detective
description: An offduty narcotics detec tive shot and killed a man and seriously wounded another early yesterday after, he said, they attempted to hold him up outside a hotel in the Jamaica section of Queens.

title: Tina Croll Is Married Here To Albert Constantine Bellas
description: Christ Church, United Meth odist, was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Selina (Tina) Schroeder Croll, who made her debut here in 1961, to Albert Constantine Bellas, an associate with the investment banking house of Dillon, Read & Co.

title: Fox, Ogilvy and Dorsey Win 2d Time in Y R. A. Season
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., June 20  A. Shawhan Fox, with his Shields Class sloop, Strider, C. Stanley Ogilvy, with Flame in the Etchells22 Class, and Joseph F. Dorsey, at the tiller of the International sloop, Sheila, won their second Yacht Racing Association champion ship races of the season on Long Island Sound today.

title: A Quiet Voyage Home
description: By Richard Jessup. 275 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $5.95.

title: Why Hasn't Public TV Made a Deeper Impact?
description: NOW that some of the dust has settled in the approximately momentous debate between Jack Gould and Fred W. Friendly in the columns of the Sunday Times, it is possible to appraise the is suesand to attempt to set the record straight in the hope that this may help to rescue Public Television from its present bind.

title: All's Well That Ends We Even Begins Well
description: STRATFORD, CONN.

title: FOR THIS WEEK
description: Stake tomato plants, if they were not staked when set out... . Abundance of caterpillars has defoliated many trees; the larvae will soon pupate and healthy trees will grow new leaves. . . .Thin fruits where heavy set has occurred on peaches and apples. . . Last call to take softwood cuttings of shrubs. . . . Yellowing and dropping of inner yew needles is a natural discard.

title: Carolyn Stires Bride in Maine Of T. P. Aldrich
description: HEAD TIDE, Me., June 20 Old Head Tide Church was the scene this afternoon of the marriage of Miss Carolyn Brooks Stires, granddaughter of the late Rev. Ernest Mil more Stires, former Episcopal Bishop of the Diocese of Long Island, to Thomas Porter Aldrich. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Samuel G. Henderson, rector of St. Andrew's Episcopal Church in Newcastle.

title: NEW STUDY ASKED IN PANTHER CASE
description: CHICAGO, June 20Civic groups here have called for appointment of a special pros ecutor and county grand jury to reopen an investigation into the slaying of two Black Pan thers in a predawn police raid.

title: Maryland Five Faces Slate Of 25 Games. 15 at Home
description: A 25game basketball sched ule, with 15 games at Cnle Field Iluuse and clashes with three of rlast season's tournament teams, will be played by the University of Maryland this season.

title: SCHOOLS GET RULE FOR FALL POLITICS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  Colleges and universities that close this fall to give students and faculty time to work in political campaigns will have to add an equal amount of time to the school year or run the risk of losing their taxexempt status.

title: In The Nation: Lowering the Age of Maturity
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  No doubt it would have been more orderly to approve the eighteenyearold vote through a constitutional amendment, but it would have taken longer, too. And if the recent example of Oregon is a guide, it might perhaps never have been done along that route. That is one of many good reasons why President Nixon, despite his misgivings, should sign the un usual legislation that would lower the voting age.

title: Sketches of Key Men in Heath Cabinet
description: Reginald Maudling

title: Monaco Croupiers End Strike
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, June 20 (AP)The croupiers of the Monte Carl() Casino ended a strike today, just in ?? for weekend business The croupiers union said it was satisfied with a 6 percent pay increase offered by manage ment, the ?? des ?? de Mer, controlled by ?? Pai??.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodaySports Car Club of America TransAmerican sedan race at Bridgehampton, L. I. Warmups: 1:051:30 P.M.; race at 2 P.M.

title: Critical Look at Military PriSon System
description: In the spring of 1969, the Army courtmartialed 27 young soldiers on mutiny charges for conducting a sitdown demon onstration in protest against stockade conditions at Presidio, Calif. Public reaction to dis closures of stockade conditions and to the unusually severe sen tences (the first three tried re eked sentences of 15, 14 and 16 years, later cut to two years led to the appointment in April, 1969, of a civilian committee to study the Army confinement system.

title: Connecticut G.O.P. Convention Backs Meskill for Governor and Weicker for Senate
description: HARTFORD, June 20  United States Representatives Thomas J. Meskill and Lowell P. Weicker, who had been en dorsed by state party leaders, were nominated by the Repub lican state Convention today to run for Governor and United States Senator, respectively, in Connecticut.

title: Miss Keith C. Manley Is Married
description: GLADWYNE, Pa., June 20  The marriage of Miss Keith Carter Manley to La mont J. Bassett, a graduate of the University of Denver, took place here today at the home of Mr. and Mrs. John T. Dorrance Jr., stepfather and mother of the bride. Mr. Dorrance is chairman of the board of the Campbell Soup Company.

title: Kahn's Kubla Overall Victor In Woodmere Overnight Sail
description: WOODMERE, L. I., June 20  Sigmund Kahn's Kubla, a Tar tan27 from the Miramar Yacht Club, was the overall winner today in Woodmere Bay Yacht Club's fourth annual 76mile overnight distance race on the Atlantic Ocean.

title: A New Criticism Is Needed
description: IF I understand the essen tials of Hilton Kramer's criticism of the exhibi tion, AfroAmerican Art ists: New York and Boston, they are (A) that there is a conflict between works con ceived as an esthetic end and works conceived as a medium of social and political action; (B) that works ?? latter order have no esthetic purpose since quality judg ments are reserved to the mainstream (esthetic pieces), and (C) that black art, as de fined in my introductory es say to the exhibition, is styl istically staid, or to put it anotner way, a return to the social realism of the pre World War II period.

title: In Kipling's Simla Where All Things Begin
description: SIMLA, IndiaYes, yes, Kipling's house is here in Simla, said the Indian prccessor from New Delhi, his dam eyes alight with enthusiasm.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: I have been vastly amused by the Broadway brouhaha created by my interview with Ron Leibman and Linda Lavin in The Record. However, I am less than amused by the mis leading impressions of my interview techniques detailed in Patricia Bosworth's article, Ron Lunt and Linda Fon tanne? in The Times.

title: AQUEDUCT EXACTA STARTS IN A WEEK
description: The exacta will be put into effect at Aqueduct a week from tomorrow, the New York Rac ing Association announced yes terday. Exacta tickets of $2, $10 and $20 will be sold for two racesthe fifth and eighth.

title: A Roseate Tern Reaches Pacific From L I., the First So Recorded
description: A roseate tern, a beautiful local sea bird, has turned up for the first documented time in the Pacific Ocean after mi grating from a breeding area on the Atlantic coast of the United States.

title: PASS IS BY M'GRAW
OAKS RACE TAKEN BY MISSILE BELLE
description: Missile Belle rounded out a fine stakes week for the John A. Morris family by winning the $133,875 Coaching Club American Oaks at Belmont Park yesterday. The filly also furthered the current riding ca reer of Petey Anderson, who guided her to a onelength suc cess in the mileandaquarter race, ahead of Mrs. Hastings Harcourt's Cathy Honey.

title: Ann F. Struthers Bride Of Michael C. Coburn
description: RYE, N. Y., June 20 Miss Ann Ferrell Struthers and Michael Cutler Coburn were married here this after noon in Christ Episcopal Church. The ceremony was performed by the bride groom's father, the Rev. Dr. John Bowen Coburn, rector of St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. He was assisted by the Rev. Thomas B. Kennedy of Boston.

title: Medicine
description: In New Jersey early this month legislative action snuffed out Rutgers Univer sity's hope that it might soon have a full fouryear medical school. In California a few days earlier, voters defeated a proposed multimillion dol lar bond issue designed to increase substantially the state's medical education vet cilities. Meanwhile, all over the United States existing medical schools are caught in a deepening financial crisis which has brought some to the edge of bankruptcy.

title: Pope Declined an Invitation To Visit Poland Last Month
description: ROME, June 20 (AP)The Vatican disclosed today that Pope Paul VI declined an invita tion to visit Poland last month but said there had been no po litical motivation in his decision.

title: 4 YOUTHS HONORED FOR INSPIRING DEEDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)  Three teenagers Who per formed outstanding acts of heroism or helpfulness and a boy who drowned rescuing friend from a rushing stream have been named as recipients of Young America medals.

title: G. S. M'ALLISTER, EXECUTIVE, DIES
description: G. Stanley McAllister, an ex ecutive of the Associated Dry Goods Corporation, a chain of department stores that includes Lord & Taylor, died of a heart attack while walking on Fifth Avenue near his home yester day. He was 70 years old and lived at 1115 Fifth Avenue.

title: Cheers for Those Subscribers Some Catcalls, Too
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Headliners
description: When President Nixon named a new commission on campus unrest, Joseph Rhodes Jr. was the youngest and perhaps least known of the nine members. But last week, the 22yearold Negro, a junior fellow scholar at Harvard, received almost all the attention. He achieved this dis tinction by being the target of Vice President Agnew's rhetoric. In an interview after his selection, Mr. Rhodes, a moderate who is committed to working within the system, commented on campus problems and, in refer ence to six student deaths this spring, said: If the President's and Vice President's statements are killing people, I want to know that. Mr. Agnew demanded that Mr. Rhodes resign, contending that he did not possess the maturity, the objectivity and the judgment for the commission. Mr. Rhodes, the son of a steel worker, re buffed the Vice President's demand, as did the White House. Summing up his position, Mr. Rhodes declared, My responsibility is not to the President, but to the people.

title: Inner Mongolia Loses Territory To Adjacent Chinese Provinces
description: HONG KONG, June 20There is strong evidence from Commu nist China that Peking has gone far toward dismembering the vast, northern, crescentshaped territory called the Inner Mon golian Autonomous Region.

title: Block Island Won't Gamble With Its Reputation
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I.The specter of legalized gambling, which has been hovering over this unso phisticated island for a dozen years, seems to have been chased away at last. The news brought cheers from those of us who love this place and want it to be left alone to go its own Yankeeindependent way.

title: VORSTER SAYS TOUR WILL BENEFIT NATION
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Afri ca, June 20Prime Minister John Vorster returned from threeweek European tour today and said that he ihad found South Africa was not as iso lated as some of our enemies tried to make out.

title: LEADED GAS BAN TO BE PROPOSED
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the head of the city's Environmental Protection Administration, said yesterday that his agency would shortly propose regula tions prohibiting the sale of leaded gasoline in the city.

title: South Carolina: A Yankee View
description: VERY spooky. We are driving in the late twilight down the narrow highway toward Hilton Head Island, under the long, ashengray strands of Spanish moss that hang like hag's hair from the gnarly, twisted, clutching arms and fingers of the ancient live oaks. Even my televisionjaded sons, Tay lor and Adam, are soon reduced to pensive silence by the weird and shadowy landscape. I ponder. Can the Low Country of South Carolina, which inspired Edgar Allan Poe's Gold Bug and frightened the pantaloons off some of the Spanish Main's meanest buccaneers and brigands, still send even a shiver up the steel spines 9 and 6yearolds with roughly 973 hours of Spider Man and The Horrible Hulk cartoons behind them? It can, and does. I give South Carolina credit.

title: Seoul Indicts 4 for Poem
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 20 (UPI)The South Korean Gov ernment today indicted threes journalists and a politician ac cused of publishing a poem titled Five Thieves, accusing Government leaders generals, politicians and businessmen of corruption. They were charged with violating the antiCommu nist law.

title: ASTROS TRIUMPH OVER BRAVES, 96
description: ATLANTA, June 20 (AP) A fiverun rally in the fifth in ning and John Edwards's two run homer in the sixth enabled the Houston Astros to end a fivegame losing streak with a 96 victory over the Atlanta Braves tonight.

title: CRAWFORD GAINS JUMPER HONORS
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 20 Iain Crawford piloted Five O'Clock Flight to victory in, the preliminary jumper stake today at the Fairfield County horse show.

title: Miss Janet Ann Nash Planning Bridal to Randall Corbin Perry
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., June 20 Mr. and Mrs. John F. Nash of Bethlhem, formerly of Bronxville, N. Y., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Janet Ann Nash, to Randall Corbin Perry, son of Mrs. Eleanor McClure Perry of George town, Washington, and Wil bert R. Perry, also of Wash ington. The wedding will take place here in October.

title: Murphy and Gilison Advance to Final in Long Island Amateur Golf Tourney
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., June 20Bob Murphy, an intense 21yearold who left school to find out where I'm at, today advanced to the championship round of the Long Island ama teur golf tournament along with Alan Gilison, who entered the competition because busi ness was slow.

title: L.I. SENIORS HOED OWN GRADUATION
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., June 20 More than 175 graduating seniors of Oceanside High School, whose selection of Rep resentative Allard K. Lowen stein as their commencement speaker was rebuffed by the school board, filed into a movie theater here today for what was termed a supplementary graduation program.

title: Student Weds Miss Brown
description: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y. June 20Miss Barbara Ann Brown, a junior at Jackson College of Tufts University, was married in the South Presby terian Church here this after noon to James David McNitt 3d, a senior at Tufts.

title: Miss Carey Wins Handily
description: LONDON, June 20 (Reuters)  Shelia Carey of Britain won the 80meter run in 2:03.8, fast est women's time in the world this year at the British women's ?? championships today.

title: NEW CLINIC HERE TREATS ANEMIA
description: The city's first clinic for the treatment of sickle cell anemia has been opened in the pediat ric outpatient department sponsored in Brooklyn jointly by the Downstate Medical Cen ter and Kings County Hospital.

title: Urban Coalition Post Filled
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 David M. Thompson, 39 years old, has been appointed vice president for financial develop ment of the Urban Coalition here, a private, nonprofit cor poration involved in the solu tion of urban problems.

title: HANOI ACCUSES U.S. OF NEW SHELLINGS
description: HONG KONG, June 20 (Reu ters)The Hanoi radio said to day that United States aircraft and ground forces had fired on a number of North Vietnamese villages during the nest week.

title: NEW GROUP ASKS STUDY OF HUDSON
description: A new organization of en vironmental scientists and other concerned individuals has urged the study and control of the life balance of the Hudson River basin and nearby coastal areas.

title: Marine Denies Murdering Vietnamese
description: DANANG, South Vietnam June 20 (AP)  A 21yearold United States marine testified today that he did not intention ally shoot any of the five Viet namese women and 11 children alleged to have been slain by a patrol of marines on Feb. 19.

title: Deborah Kiendl Wed to Student
description: MOUNT HERMON, Mass., June 20  The Memorial Chapel at the Mount Hermon School was the setting here this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Deborah Jean Kiendl, daughter of Arthur H. Kiendl Jr., headmaster of the boys' preparatory school, to James Joseph McLaughlin, a law student at Boston University.

title: Probing Ocean Secrets With Deep Drills
description: New techniques for explo ration of the ocean floor are beginning to paint a global picture of how oceans grow and, apparently, how depos its of oil, copper, manganese and iron form beneath them.

title: SIEGEL GAINS FINAL AT NEW JERSEY NET
description: KEARNEY, N. J., June 20 Steve Siegel of Teaneck moved into the final of the New Jersey State men's tennis champion ship by beating Claude Schoen lank of New York today, 75, 62, at the Arlington Players Club. He meets Steve Ross of Brooklyn in tomorrow's final.

title: Chicago Gets 6 in First
description: CHICAGO, June 20Staked to a sixrun lead in the first inning, Bill Hands hurled the Chicago Cubs to an 83 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals today.

title: Poland to Free 2 Britons
description: WARSIW, June 20 (AP)  Two Britons held for three weeks were told today by Po lish authorities they were free to return home, the British Em bassy announced. The men, Jeffrry Putchrr and Ian Turn hull, both railway enthusiasts were accused of photographing trainsclassified as espionage in Poland.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: IT is very clear from Guy Flatley's article, Godard Says Bye Bye to Bardot and All That, that he neither likes JeanLuc God ard nor the movies Godard has made recently. Such opinions can, of course, be defended. What is entirely indefensible about Mr. Flat ley's article is its tone. From the very opening sen tence (Remember Breath less? Well forget it) to the last paragraph (but Jean Pierre, quick on the didactic draw) we are faced with a series of juvenile and una musing jokes at Godard's ex pense.

title: Theater in Spain
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain THE First International Theater Festival of San Sebastian, which rapidly came to be known among the partici pants  rather cynically  as Festival Zero, was sched uled to last from May 4 to May 10. On the afternoon of May 9 the festivl broke up during a performance of the Roy Hart Theater of London as about half the audience surged onto the stage shout ing, Liberty, yes; censor ship no!

title: 3 Clouts Sink Los Angeles
description: CINCINNATI, June 20Tony Perez's 24th homer, a three run, tapemeasure shot in the third inning, and homers by Johnny Bench and Lee May car ried the Cincinnati Reds to a 54 victory over the Los An geles Dodgers today.

title: Enemy Is Pressing Attacks To the North of Pnompenh
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, June 21Enemy forces struck north of Pnompenh yes terday in an apparent effort to seize the upper reaches of the Mekong River and speed the flow of troops and supplies in to Cambodia.

title: White House Holiday Hours
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) President Nixon has directed that the hour for While douse visits by the public he extended during the July 4 weekend The White House will he open July 3, 4 and 5 from 10 ?? to A PM.

title: Nancy Whitney Gerry Married
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 20Miss Nancy Whit ney Gerry, a greatgrand daughter of the late Edward H. Harriman, the railroad magnate, was married here this afternoon to Geoffrey Lewis Groat, headmaster of the Joseph Kershaw Academy in Camden, S. C.

title: Sleeping Bear Dunes
SUKARNO, 69, DIES; LED INDONESIANS
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Sun day, June 21  Former Presi dent Sukarno of Indonesia died early today at Jakarta's Central Army Hospital, an official med ical bulletin said. He was 69 years old.

title: Author's Query
description: For a study of Whitney War ren (18641943), the American architect who studied at the Ecole des BeauxArts in Paris, I would appreciate hearing from anyone having personal recollections, correspondence or other material relevant to this subject.

title: Asian Mission Visits Paris To Discuss Indochina Peace
description: PARIS, June 20 (Reuters) A threeman Asian delegation working to bring peace to Indo china arrived here today for talks with Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann.

title: Republicans in Minnesota Endorse Two Candidates
description: ST. PAUL, June 20 (AP) The Minnesota Republican Convention today endorsed At torney General Douglas M. Head for Governor and Repre sentative Calrk MacGregor for the Senate.

title: Biology and the Future of Man
description: During the last few years, the Com mittee on Science and Public Policy of the National Academy of Sci ences has produced a series of sur veys of several scientific disciplines. They had in mind an audience of all those reasonably informed people in terested in the directions in which science is advancing at present, and the ways in which it may, or might be guided to, influence mankind's gen eral social concerns. The surveys were therefore written in a manner suitable for a readership of mem bers of Congress, educated laymen, and scientists working in other dis ciplines.

title: Hee Haw People Appear at Jersey
description: HOLMDEL, N. J., June 20 Not a single elephant could be found last night In the neigh borhood of the Garden State Arts Center. So it was not pos sible to determine if the corn was as high as an elephant's eye. But it was obviously flour ishing.

title: Blueprint for Leisure In the Adirondacks
description: OLD FORGE, N.Y.  When you run out of nature's own lakes and the last acre of open shore front holds a bright new summer home, what is more natural than to build some new lakes? Nothing the size of Lake Mead, because that would be out of place, and slightly grotesque in the Adirondack Forest Preserve, but, say, eight small lakes, the largest a mile long and maybe onehalf to three quar ters of a mile across?

title: New From Uruguay
description: URUGUAY has added a number of colorful stamps to its 1970 program, including de finitives, and commemora tives for a number of events and personages. Among the latter is one for the Italian hero, Giuseppe Garibaldi, (Jos) on the current com memorative.

title: Women's Track Mark Falls
description: WARSAW, June 20 (Reuters)  Teresa Sukniewicz of Poland won a women's 100meter hur dle race in 12.8 seconds today, trimming onetenth of a second off the world record held by Karin Balzer of East Germany.

title: RESOLUTE HONORS GO TO MOORE'S YACHT
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 20  Elliot Oldak, sailing James B. Moore Jr.'s Lure, won Resolute Class honors by a wide margin today as 50 boats sailed with the Port Washing ton Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area competition of the Yacht Racing Association of Long Is land Sound.

title: Marcello Males A Big Scandalo
description: PADUA, Italy ARCELLO MASTROI ANNI'S mother80 years old, almost totally deaf and mad as hell about itsat under a flowering cherry tree waiting for her son. She was paying a rare visit to the set of The Priest's Wife, a new movie filming in English that is giv ing the Roman Catholic Church an itch that has noth ing to do with the starch in its clerical robes. In the film, the Italian Clark Gable plays a dedicated priest who falls in love with Sophia Loren, a rocksinging bobbysoxer, and leaves the motherly sanc tity of St. Peter's dome to take up the swinging good life. It's the kind of movie a Catholic mother likes to look in on.

title: Gains Seen for Liquefied Gas
description: If the liquefied natural gas (LNG) industry has its way, millions of consumers will not only be heating and cook ing with LNG, they'll also be fueling their cars and freez ing food with it.

title: Field Of Travel
description: THE Customs Bureau has prepared a flyer en titled An Explanation to Youthe Traveler, which warns of delays that visitors to this country can expect at international ports of entry during the present tourist season.

title: Amex and Unlisted Stocks Rise in Light Trading
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthe counter market advanced last, week in comparatively light trading.

title: Lee E. Cotter Becomes Bride
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., June 20Miss Lee Ellen Cot ter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Davison Cotter, was married here this afternoon in the Memorial Presbyterian Church to Robert Lewis Dur ham, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Durham of Park Avenue, New York. Richard Mitchel, a minister on the church staff, officiated.

title: BOROWIAK TAKES N.C.A.A. NET TITLE
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 20 (AP)Jeff Borowiak of the University of California, Los Angeles, defeated Roscow Tan ner of Stanford, 108, 97, 75, for the singles title of the Na tional Collegiate tennis cham pionships.

title: Countess Manuela Serra Is Wed
description: Countess Manuela Serra, a protocol officer with the United Nations, and Baron Jean d'Arcy of New York, director of radio, television and visual information of the Office of Public Information of the United Nations, were married here yesterday morn ing in the Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Family. Msgr. Timothy Flynn, pastor of the parish, performed the ceremony.

title: Soviet Lifter Raises Record
description: SZOMBATHELZ, Hungary, June 20 (Reuters)  Vladislav Krischisin of the Soviet Union improved his world flyweight record by 5 pounds with a total lift of 749 pounds in the European weightlifting champi onships today.

title: Democratic Clubs Show Voter Apathy
description: In the last hours of the prim ary campaign for the Democra tic gubernatorial nomination, I the activities of the party's county organizations, with some exceptions, reflect the apathetic mood of voters from Massena Ito Montauk.

title: T.V.A. Planning Power Project
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 20Construction of an un usual $155million hydro electric power project on Raccoon Mountain near Chattanooga will start in July, according to the Ten nessee Valley Authority. A $6,353,073 contract has been let to the AllisChal mers Manufacturing Com pany, York, Pa., for four hydraulic pumpturbine units.

title: Pisanis Take FatherSon Event in New York A. C. Open Rowing
FIDDLE ISLE WINS RICH COAST RACE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 20 Howard B. Kecks Fiddle Isle, given Bill Shoemaker's 5,959th winning ride, beat Fort Marcy by a slim neck today in the $100,000 Hollywood Park In vitation Turf Handicap.

title: Marcie Lifshitz Bride Of Hugh S. Sharison
description: Miss Marcie Sue Lifshitz was married in the Terrace Room of the Plaza last night to Hugh Stanley Sharison, son of City Councilman Saul S. Sharison and Mrs. Shari son.

title: Tugboat Pilots Rise to Elevated Positions as Pull Comes to Shove
description: The lowly tugboat has to be a little less lowly these days if the pilot is to see where he is going.

title: LAW STUDENTS HERE TO WORK WITH POOR
description: Forty law students from schools across the country be gan a summer program here last week with the Legal Aid Society to help the poor with their legal problems.

title: Cup Scores on WQXR
description: Please do not telephone the New York Times or WQXR for scores. The calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station. World Cup re sults will he liven on WQXR liteevening hourly news re ports.

title: Letters: Octagon House Plan Scored
description: NONA B. BROWN'S informative article, Forgotten White House Is Back in Business (Travel Section, June 7), re ferred to the office building that the American Institute of Architects pro poses to construct in back of Octagon House in Washington. She failed, how ever, to point out that, if erected, this proposed building will destroy the stable, the smokehouse and the garden, important elements that have always been closely associated with Octagon House; it would also destroy the aspect of the house itself.

title: Thomas Hardy
description: At the end of this absorbing textual anatomy of Thomas Hardy, J. Hillis Miller likens his author to an anthro pologist structurehunting among the Dorset tribes and presents him self as the critic in his turn structure hunting  a watcher watching the watcher watch his characters. And now the wheel comes full circle: an other Dorset novelist joins the chain of spies.

title: Oil: A World of Deepening Strife
description: The witches in Macbeth could well have been describing the present world oil situation in terms of United States Government and American oil company interests.

title: Bayonne to Lose 250 Jobs
description: BAYONNE, N. J., June 20 (AP)The Humble Oil and Re fining Company said today that it would halve its work force in this waterfront city over the next two and half years. The company, which is the city's largest taxpayer, said 250 em ployes would be phased out be cause of the national manu facturing situation in wax and asphalt manufacturing. An of ficial said the work realignment would he a gradual change, not a layoff.

title: Reuther's Successor Says U.A.W. Will Work With A.F.L.C.I.O. but Won't Rejoin Federation
description: DETROIT, June 20The United Automobile Workers are will ing to maintain close ties with individual A.F.L.C.I.O. unions, but not to mend the historic break with the parent labor federation, according to Leonard Woodcock, the new U.A.W. president.

title: Conservative and Liberal Mormons Advise Church on Negro Exclusion Policy
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 20 The Mormon Church has been getting advice recently from members on the right and left about criticism of its practice of excluding Negroes from priesthood orders.

title: Robin Fuller Neuschel Bride of Ross Reeves
description: ROSLYN, L.I., June 20 Miss Robin Fuller Neuschel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard F. Neuschel of Brookville, was married here this afternoon to Ross Camp hell Reeves, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph B. Reeves Jr. of Raleigh, N. C. The Rev. Har old C. Whitmarsh performed the ceremony in Trinity Epis copal Church. He was as sisted by the Rev. Gilbert S. Larsen.

title: Miss Gonnerman Wins Final In Eastern Tennis, 86, 108
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 20Louise Gonnerman of River Edge, N. J., regained the wo men's Eastern claycourt tennis championship today.

title: Britain: Heath Fooled Polls and Wilson
description: LONDONThe political corre spondents in Britain, the experts and the pollsters know now how their American equivalents felt on Nov. 3, 1948. Not since Harry Truman's surprise victory over Thomas E. Dewey have so many people been so wrong about an election.

title: Brown Given Lacrosse Title
description: Brown University's lacrosse team was declared the New England champion for the fourth time since 1964 by the United States Intercollegiate Lacrosse Association. The Bruins were undefeated in six contests against New England teams, were second in the Ivy League, and 11 and 3 over all.

title: Belmont Bugler Dons Lederhosen for Luchow Stint
BRAZIL AND ITALY PLAY FINAL TODAY
description: Brazil and Italy, two of thej most colorful and exciting teams in the tournament, will meet for the World Cup soccer championship today in a game to be shown on closedcircuit television at Madison Square Garden and the New York Coli seum. The telecast will begin at 2 P.M., live and in color via satellite with English com mentary.

title: Author's Query
description: I am writing a biography of American author Upton Sinclair (18781968) and would be grateful to receive any useful letters, information, or anec dotes.

title: Final Session Held Here
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 20 (UPI)  An interna tional symposium sponsored jointly by the United Nations and the United Automobile Workers called today for im mediate global action to pro tect the human environment.

title: Boxing Writers Honor Frazier
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., June 20  Three years ago, at the Boxing Writers Dinner, Cassius Clay, alias Muhammad Ali, warned that when his career was inter rupted, as it was by his draftrefusal conviction, they can take the game to the gravevard.

title: In The Camera World
description: PROBABLY the first cam era to come with a tri pod as standard equip ment (albeit a small, tabletop model), the Yashica Eiectro 35 GT is an automatic 35mm camera that is designed to provide perfect exposure in almost any light. It does this by electronically computing the amount of light required and then setting the shutter speed accordingly. Unlike most automatic cameras which set the shutter speed to one of six or seven stan dard speeds, the 35 GT has an infinite range of settings from 1/500 to as long as 30 seconds. and then setting the shutter speed accordingly. Unlike most automatic cameras which set the shutter speed to one of six or seven stan dard speeds, the 35 GT has an infinite range of settings from 1/500 to as long as 30 seconds.

title: Knicks Send Bowman, Backup Center, to New Buffalo Five
description: The New York Knicks yes terday sent Nate Bowman, their backup center, and Mike Silliman, a former West Point star, to the Buffalo Braves, one of the three new National Bas ketball Association franchises, for future consideration of draft choices.

title: Sub Tender Christened
description: QUINCY, Mass., June 20 (AP) The Navy submarine tender Dixon, which will carry a crew of 1,300 when she joins the fleet next year, was christened today at the General Dynamic?? ??.

title: Florence Keiser Wed To Nickolai Romanov
description: WILTON, Conn., June 20 Miss Florence Hammond Keiser was married to Nicko lai Vassielivich Romanov at home here this afternoon at tired in a wedding gown first worn by an ancestor around 1810.

title: British Regiment Told It Will Be Preserved
description: LONDON, June 20 (AP) Colin Mitchell, who com manded the Argyll and Su therland Highlanders, prom ised his old outfit today that the ousted Labor Govern ment's plans to scrap the reg iment in November would be canceled.

title: Why Did Orioles Fall in Slump? Just Fatigue, Says Rettenmund
description: Since Mery Rettenmund usually is only a reserve outfielder and pinchhitter for the Baltimore Orioles, he doesn't get much of a chance to get tired. But that's what he blamed the Orioles' slump onfatigue.

title: Salavarria Retains Crowr
description: Salavarria Retains Crowr

title: WHITTELSEY FIRST IN LUDERS16 CLASS
description: GREENWICH. Conn., June 20 Souther (Chick) Whittelsey won his second straight Luders 16 Class race with Interludel today on Long Island Sound in the season's 12th championship regatta for Connecticut area Yacht Racing Association fleets based East of Rye, conducted by the Belle Haven Yacht Club.

title: CORN OFF THE COB VICTOR OF CLASSIC
description: CHICAGO, June 20 (AP) Corn Off The Cob, owned by Tom Gary of Miami and ridden by the nation's leading money winning jockey, Eddie Belmonte, won the $109,500 Arlington Classic today in a drizzle by six lengths.

title: TTTTTshirt
description: The Tshirt has a brandnew look this summer. The classic cotton knit topcm old hotweather standbyhas stretched to reach any where from midcalf to midankle. It is the perfect beach coverup. These easy cottonknit dresses in every conceivable kind of stripe will be making the scene at most beaches and pools this summer.

title: Frivolous Or Serious?
description: WALKING into the Rhino Horn exhibition at the new Sonraed Galleries, 542 La Guardia Place, what is the first thought that comes to mind? That one has seen it all before, many times, many places? I'm afraid so. Seven artistsKen Bow man, Peter Dean, Michael Fauerbach, Joseph Kurhajec, Jay Milder, Peter Pas suntino and Nicholas Sperakis  have banded together under the Rhino Horn banner. Their styles differas do, in deed, their individual gifts and lack of giftsbut the note they sound is instant ly recognizable. We are, alas, in the presence of that screaming Expression ism that is familiar to anyone who has ever juried a regional art exhibition. All the main characteristics of this provincial style are here in force: the aggressive display of feeling, the incompetent tech nique, the iconographic cliches proudly Offered as original inventions, the whole funkyuglyviolentbuckeye vision of the apocalypse that is the special trademark of painting of this persuasion.

title: Pirates Rally to Score Three Runs off Morton in Fifth and Beat Expos, 42
description: PITTSBURGH, June 20 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates rallied for three runs in the fifth in ning today and went on to beat the Montreal Expos, 42, be hind the sixhit pitching of Steve Blass, with help from Dave Giusti in the ninth.

title: Antiwar Drive Begins to Recruit 40,000 Priests
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 20 (AP)A concentrated mail cam paign to recruit 40,000 Roman Catholic clergymen for the antiwar movement has been an nounced.

title: M. F. De Anzeris Jr. Weds Miss Marr
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., June 20Miss Barbara Ann Marr was married in the Chapel of Marymount College here to day to Michael F. De Anzeris Jr. The bride was graduated on May 30. The Roman Catholic ceremony was per formed by the Rev. Salvatore Motarozza, O. P., a friend of the bridegroom's family.

title: Arab Leaders, in Libya, Hail Departure of U.S
description: CAIRO, June 20In a gesture underscoring the growing influ ence of revolutionary Libya in Arabworld affairs, President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic, King Hussein of Jordan, and other Arab leaders flew to Tripoli to day to take part in celebrations connected with the withdrawal of the United States Air Force from the huge Wheelus air base.

title: War Stirs More Dissent Among G.I.'s
description: COLUMBIA, S. C.As the war in Vietnam drags on, the Army is finding itself in creasingly plagued by a growing struggle of another sortagainst dissidents in its ranks.

title: COLLEGE TO FUSE WORK AND STUDY
description: The City University is pro ceeding with plans for a new twoyear college patterned after Antioch College in Ohio, where students will alternate class room instruction with onthe job experience for pay.

title: Miss Shelley Busskind Is Bride
description: Miss Shelley Davidson Suss kind and Michael Dwayne Andreas, students at North western University, were mar ried here yesterday afternoon at the high alter of the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine. The Rev. Richard R. Kirk performed the cere mony.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
How to Preserve Past and Present
description: IS the photograph here to stay? This apparently dumb question has been debated quite seriously by experts at two recent con ferences on Conservation of Photographs at the Smith sonian Institution in Wash ington.

title: Guyana Announces Venezuela Defers Her Border Claims
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, June 20  Prime Minister Forbes Burnham has announced that Venezuela and Guyana, with Britain's approval, have signed an agreement to shelve their border dispute for at least 12 years.

title: Slump in Productivity Appears Near the End of Its Cycle
description: The credibility gap that was invented by the last Ad ministration has been vastly expanded by this one. On the domestic front, it is seriously questioned whether or not we have the willingness and the ability to defeat the continu ing threat of inflation. This, combined with a plethora of other domestic crises, has left confidence at an alltime low. Away from home, the war seems interminable.

title: Legislature in Saigon Is Scene of Fistfight;
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 20 (UPI)  A fistfight, accompanied by shouting and screaming, today marked the National Assembly debate on controversial legislation to give President Nguyen Van Thieu full emergency powers for five months to cope with the nation's eco nomic problems. The police fired tear gas to break up the clash.

title: Miss Orthwein Is Wed To James Snowden Jr.
description: WATCH HILL, R. I., June 20The Watch Hill Chapel was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Katherine Gatch Orthwein to James McClel land Snowden Jr., who is an assistant vice president of Glore Forgan Staats, Inc., in vestment bankers in New York.

title: Dune Plants By the Shore
description: SEASHORE gardens are sometimes invaded by that thorny stemmed vine known as catbriar, one of the Smilax. Any one who has tried to struggle through a catbriar thicket knows how cruel its barbs can be, tearing flesh and clothing, so naturally it is a most unwelcome intruder.

title: A CROSS IN OREGON IS ORDERED DOWN
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 20  Once again, a court has ordered the removal of the Skinner Butte Cross, a 51foot concrete cross that overlooks this university city from a hill top park.

title: Space
description: WASHINGTONAround and around the earth the two Soviet cosmonauts sped for almost 300 orbits in the Soyuz 9 space craft which finally landed last Friday after a recordbreaking 17 days 16 hours in space. Dur ing this longest journey man has ever made Col. Andrian G. Niko layev and Vitaly I. Sevastyanov played chess with ground con trollers, gawked at the stars, radioed an election day getout thevote speech to their country men, and photographed the weather beneath them.

title: Article 2  No Title
ANDREW M'CARTHY, BRONX PROSECUTOR
description: Andrew C. McCarthy, who retired in 1967 after having served for 34 years on the staff of the Bronx District Attorney's office, died yesterday in Union Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 2606 Grand Ave nue, the Bronx.

title: Hanoi Opens New Campaign To Increase Rice Output
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, June 20 (Agence FrancePresse)A new campaign to increase rice production was announced here yesterday.

title: Pamela O'Neill Wed To Army Lieutenant
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., June 20Miss Pamela Latta O' Neill and Lieut. Russell Burton Jones 3d, U.S.A., were married here this noon in the Reformed Church by the Rev. Charles Robert Harrah.

title: FOREIGNERS VISIT CHINESE COMMUNE
description: PEKING, June 20An un usual group visit to a com mune north of here for a look at Chinese farming was ar ranged this week by the For eign Ministry for 80 foreign diplomats, correspondents and wives.

title: Tercentennial Events
description: June 25 to July 8

title: Fiat Weighs Role in Plan To Aid Soviet Truck Proiect
description: ROME, June 20  Italian newspapers today quoted Gio vanni Agnelli, chairman of Fiat, as having told correspondents in Moscow that his concern was considering participation in an international consortium to assist the Soviet Union in building a big truck plant.

title: Qualifying Requirements Eased By Westminster Kennel Club
description: The qualifying requirements for dogs whose owners want to enter them in next year's Westminster Kennel Club show has been made easier through a reduction in the necessary championship points. Last year and the year before a dog needed to have won a major, or at least 3 points in a sin gle show. Under the revision, a single point will be enough. Al though we want to preserve the quality of our entry, we do not want our entry requirements to fore close the possibility of as many dogs as we can accom modate to be entered at West minster, said Dr. Lyman Fisher, the new chairman of the bench show committee. We believe from our last show that we can convenient ly handle up to 1,500 dogs per day and that is what we hope to achieve by changing the entry requirements.

title: Robert Steen Weds Anne Bretnall
description: PLAINSBORO, N. J., June 20Miss Ann Mather Bret nall, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William B. Bretnall of Princeton, was married in the Plainsboro Presbyterian Church this afternoon to Robert Steen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Chester A. Steen. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Richard L. McAfee, com bined the services of the Presbyterian Church, to which the bridegroom be longs, and the Religious So ciety of Friends, of which the bride is member.

title: Ribofilio and War Censor Capture Divisions of Longfellow at Monmouth Park
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June 20  the Cragwood Stable's favored Ribofilio, champion 2 yearold of England in 1968, finally gained his first triumph on American soil today by win ning the $29,687 first section of the Longfellow Handicap at Monmouth Park.

title: ARKANSAS BLACKS SHIFTING TO G.O.P.
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., June 20 A record number of blacks have switched to the Republi can party in Arkansas this year to run for political office, sug gesting that the state's Negroes may have virtually abandoned their traditional allegiance to the state Democratic party, at least for now.

title: Buddhist Political Activity Keeps Pressure on Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 14Since 1963 when the An Quang Buddhists whose leader is Thich Tri Quang helped bring about the down fall of President Ngo Dinh Diem, their disapproval of all other governments here has provided continual jolts throughout the nation.

title: Coast Fountain Melds Art and Environment
description: PORTLAND, Ore.On Tues day, Portland will start the wa ter flowing in the fountains of what may be one of the most important urban spaces since the Renaissance. The word fountains requires a little clarification. Waterfalls would be a more accurate description. Thirteen thousand gallons of water a minute will cascade down 18foothigh, rock like concrete cliffs, 80 feet wide, in a new blocksquare park. (The falls were turned on for a preview for this observer.)

title: Earle Brown: They Love Him in BadenBaden
description: IF Earle Brown reads the entrails correctly, the most sacred temples of contemporary music are being pulled down, and he is going to go down in history as one of a small, heretical band of American composers who started the pillars shak ing. Brown, a lean, longjawed man whose personality is bal anced intriguingly between the poet and the pilot ;(he flies his own plane) sprawled across a bed at the Salisbury Hotel the other day and re called how he began to sub vert the internationally ac cepted dogmas of postWe bern serialism back in the early fifties, after meeting John Cage and coining under the influence of that giddily, free spirit.

title: Gretchen B. Bachrach Is Bride Of Ernest Watson Hutton Jr.
description: BOSTON, June 20His toric King's Chapel, Unita rian, here was the scene of the wedding this afternoon of Miss Gretchen Burdic Bach rach and Ernest Watson Hut ton Jr.

title: Kites in the Sky Over Grim Amman Are Evidence That Children Can Again Venture Outdoors
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 19 Strange white specks floated over this grim, hilly city, dancing higher than the min arets. Seen from the barren countryside, they somehow seem magical and without substance, as though they were a trick of the desert sun.

title: Italy Urged to Spend $20Billion Against Pollution Over 15 Years
description: ROME, June 20  A group of experts has recommended that Italy spend $20billion over the next 15 years to fight air and water pollution and thus save much of the nation's cultural heritage that would otherwise be destroyed.

title: Quotes
description: PRESIDENT NIXON: We cannot protect the value the dollar by passing the buck.

title: Mexican Rebels Of Old Live On In Chihuahua
description: CHIHUAHUA, MexicoTwo border linking roads that are in various stages of improvement, notably paving, are already bringing an increased number of American tourists to this capital of Mexico's largest state (of the same name). And Chihuahua, with its cathedral, many modem hotels, native products and historic shrines to revolutionary heroes, is ready for them.

title: ARREST ATTEMPT BY INDIANS FAILS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 20 A small group of Indians at tempted yesterday to make citizen's arrest here of the pres ident of the Pacific Gas and Electric Company.

title: Numbers Of Jobless Rise in Pa.
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., June 20  The bankers are Pennsylvania climbed sharply during the past two months, business analysts at the Pennsylvania State Univer sity report.

title: An Old ManofWar Dozes in the Delaware
description: PHILADELPHIA Berthed in an area that boasts the highest den sity of Revolutionary War land marks in America, the cruiser Olympia seems almost an impertinence. And here she is, impertinent enough to be hardly diminished by the Early Americana behind her or the modern highway bridge looming high over head.

title: Stronger Competition Is Sought For TransAm's U2 Division
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., June 20Say TransAmeri can and it connotes a race for Mustangs, Javelins, Ca maros, Challengers, Barracu das and Firebirds. But there is a band of aficionados who could not care less about these American sedans, which they derogate as De troit Iron. For them the appeal of the TransAm is the U2 divi sion, U2 being the sport's ab breviation for engines with a displacement of under 2 liters (2,000 cubic centimeters). The current competition is be tween the Alfa Romeo GTA and the BMW 2002TI. Going into this afternoon's race, Alfa had won three to BMW's one.

title: Evans Scott Ward, ExOfficer, Marries Patricia A. Eldredge
description: Miss Patricia Annette Eldredge and Evans Scott Ward were married here yesterday at the Episcopal Church of the Transfigura tion.

title: Stalled Tobless Aid
description: As the slowdown in the economy squeezes thou sands out of their jobs each week, a bill that would provide extended insurance protection to the unem ployed is stalled on Capitol Hill.

title: Snorts of She Times
description: Hours of boredom, seconds of terror was how an airlines pilot once described his vocation. Similarly, the reporter cover ing the leisurely game of baseball finds time weighing heavily between moments of high excitement. In years gone by, a popular game was played in the press boxes in which the players selected the name of a sports figure, listened to its ring, then applied an appropriate vocation to the echo. Toots Shor? A chorus girl, of course.

title: Atlanta Mayor Advises Hippies of Local Scene
description: ATLANTA, June 20 (AP) Unless you have bread and a pad, please find your thing somewhere else  or face bad scene, Mayor Sam Massell has advised.

title: Observer: Red Gardening
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  If there is anything that should convince liberals that Commu nism is not joking about taking over the world, it is weeds.

title: Web of Steel Holds Fate Of the Stage
description: The fate of Broadway as the center of New York's legitimate theater may hinge on a complicated and costly bit of steel construction now being undertaken at the 1 Astor Plaza construction site at 44th Street and Broadway.

title: Truckers Set Up Group to Help Curb Pollution
description: The American Trucking Association has appointed some of the leading execu tives in the industry to a new Committee on Ecology. Its task, according to Frank L. Grimm, who is president of the association and chair man of O'Boyle Tank Lines of Washington, will be to define areas in which the in dustry offends the environ ment, to pinpoint causes and to find answers in coopera tion with manufacturers and government.

title: Indians Topple Tiers, 21, on Foster's Homers for Seventh Straight Victory
description: CLEVELAND, June 20 (AP), Roy Foster's second home run of the game with one out in the eighth inning broke a tie and gave the Cleveland Indians a 21 victory over the Detroit Tigers today. The triumph was the seventh straight for the Indians.

title: Todd Shipyards Abandons Diversification Plan
description: Todd Shipyards Corporation, encouraged by the prospects for domestic shipbuilding and ship repair activities in the nineteen seventies, has decided to re verse course on diversification.

title: Grades Delayed in Italy By a Teachers' Boycott
description: ROME, June 20 (AP)  Un ions representing a majority of teachers in Italy's junior high schools and high schools refused today to issue final grades and examinations to more than five million pupils.

title: Gailingersoll and L. B. Ransom WedProving Computer Right
description: WINNETKA, Ill., June 20 Back in 1966 when she was at Smith and he was at Am herst, Miss Gail Ann Inger soll and Lawrence Bristol Ransom fed their personality profiles into a computer. It said they were meant for each other.

title: PEKING TELLS U.S. NOW IS NOT TIME TO RENEW PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 Communist China informed the United States today that it would not be suitable at this time to set a date for the re sumption of their ambassa dorial talks in Warsaw.

title: OIL BLAZE KILLS THREE: A fire at a refinery outside Franklin, Pa., injured eight and required 15 local volunteer companies to fight it. Ignited by an explosion among 150 large metal tanks on Friday, it burned out of control for 24 hours. Article on Page 40.
description: FRANKLIN, Pa., June 20A fire in an oil and gasoline re finery that resulted in the ap parent death of three persons and injuries to eight others was extinguished this afternoon after burning for more than 24 hours, according to a refinery official.

title: Met Prints Soar Note, Angering Opera Goers
description: A printing error caused more than 100 ticket holders to miss part of the first act of the Metropolitan Opera Company's first production of Pietro Mascagni's Caval leria Rusticana last night.

title: RCA Aids Reform of Camden Schools
description: CAMDEN, N. J., June 20 The Camden Board of Educa tion has hired the RCA Corpo ration as prime contractor in a joint effort to reform the entire public school system in this city of 115,000 people.

title: HILL IN 2D PLACE
Among The Stars Is Auctioned For $5,000 as Part of Estate
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 20 Among The Stars, the na tional highpoint green con formation hunter champion in 1967, has been sold for $5,000 as part of the estate of the late Eleonora Sears of Pride's Crossing. Mass.

title: JAPAN TO PROPOSE CURB ON TEXTILES
description: TOKYO, June 20Two senior Cabinet ministers are due in Washington Monday with Japan's final proposal on the long angry dispute between the two countries over Japanese textile exnorts.

title: Borings in Ocean Disclose Minerals Of Economic Use
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., June 20The likelihood that under water extraction of minerals will have major economic im portance in the future has been increased by the findings of the latest oceanographic expedition aboard the Glomar Challcnger, the chief scientist of that ship said here this week.

title: WORLD MARK SET FOR 440 HURDLES BY MANN IN 0:48.8
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 20 Ralph Mann, who was mar ried two weeks ago and turned 21 years old four days ago, achieved another personal mile stone today by setting a world 11 record in the 440yard inter mediate hurdles.

title: TURKEY'S PREMIER PRESSED TO QUIT
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 20 Eight months after obtaining a comfortable majority in the gen eral elections, Premier Suley man Demirel of Turkey is facing increasing criticism and demands that he resign.

title: PAGELS LEADS SAIL ON GREAT SOUTH BAY
description: MORICHES, L.I., June 20 Bill Pagels, the Blue Jay Class national champion, took the lead today in the men's cham pionship series of the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Asso ciation.

title: Middle States Seniors Beat Eastern Team in Cup Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 20 The Middle States team regain ed the Bruneau Cup today by defeating the Eastern players from the New York area, 63, in the annual senior grasscourt tennis matches at the German town Cricket Club. Middle States won four of the six singles and two of the three doubles.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: Msgr. Leo Farley, Served As a Chaplain for Firemen
description: Msgr. Leo G. Farley, a former Fire Department chaplain, died at St. Vincent's Hospital yester day. He was 62 years old and lived in Montrose, N.Y., where he had been pastor of St. Christopher's Roman Catholic Church since 1962.

title: Radishes, Lettuce All In a Row
description: WHEN you are only nine years old and not yet fully won over to the disciplines of gar dening, keeping your vege tables all in a row can seem an uneven struggle. Weeds spring up where string beans should. Beetles and squash borers threaten. And the hot, summer sun beats down relentlessly.

title: Times Gets Court Order On Grand Jury's Data
description: A document delivered to the Washington bureau of The New York Times yester day evening by a man who said he represented the law firm of Williams & Connolly, ordered the newspaper to show cause in Federal Court in Maryland on or before next Thursday why it should not be restrained from dis closing or publishing the con tents of the documents de livered to the court by the special grand jury.

title: HOFSTRA MAY GET U.S. TITLE FINAL
description: Hofstra University in Hemp stead, L.I., may be the site of the first national collegiate la crosse championship game in 1971.

title: Berkley Corner and Tatoi Triumph at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 20 (AP)  Berkley Corner and Tatoi captured divisions of the Pa triot Stakes at Liberty Bell race track today before 14,385.

title: World Cup Finale
description: MEXICO CITY, June 20 If Italy is to win the World Cup tomorrow for the first time in 32 years, its chance must rest on Felix and on desperation. Felix, the Brazil ian goalkeeper, muse he one of the worst goalkeepers ever to play in a World Cup soccer final. He is as unsafe, as indecisive and as worrisome to the Brazilian defense as his predecessor, Gylmar, was sound and sure.

title: Palafox Tops Lenz, 61, 62, At Start of Eastern Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 20 (AP)Tony Palafox, the former Mexican Davis Cup player, defeated Alfred Lenz of Flushing, Quens, 61, 62, today to lead the field past the first round in the Eastern men's clay court tennis championships.

title: Hill Is Fined $150 For Links Criticism
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 20 Before beginning the third round of the United States Open Golf championship, Dave Hill, who had moved into second place yesterday three strokes back of Tony Jacklin of England, was fined $150.

title: Food for Peace Aid Drops
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) A sharp drop in aid exports of wheat last year brought shipments down to the lowest level in the Fond for Peace program's 15year history, the Agriculture Department has re ported. Department experts said Wednesday that projec tions for 1970 indicated ship ments might hold close to the $1.018billion total of 1969 or might decline slightly.

title: Foreign Affairs: Only One Kind of Bridge
description: ERIVAN, U.S.S.R.The most sensitive segment of the Soviet Union's ring of allies is Czecho slovakia, a country which al ways wanted to become a kind of EastWest bridge and never could. It is therefore note worthy that the Communist propaganda machine should have chosen Prague's ideologi cal monthly to make a sharp attack on the bridgebuilding efforts of U.S. policy.

title: 14th Street A Crosstown Study in Contrasts
description: Property owners on 14th Street, the longest and one of the shabbier cross town thoroughfares in Manhattan, are struggling to upgrade commerce along the avenue, to make it more in keep ing with the halfdozen luxury apart ment buildings scattered across its middle stretches.

title: 40 LEAD POISONINGS FOUND IN BRONX AREA
description: Health and antipoverty of ficials in the Hunts Point sec tion of the Bronx have urged emergency measures to halt, lead poisoning discovered among children tested in that area.

title: Scofflaws Still Have 9 Days of Leniency
description: Scofflaws were urged yes terday to take advantage of a leniency period that ends June 30 or face stiff penal ties for outstanding viola tions.

title: School Integration Entering Critical Stage
description: WASHINGTONSixteen years after the Supreme Court declared school desegregation by official policy to be unconstitutional, it is now clear that there will be massive integration in the towns and rural areas of the Deep South next fall. Desegregation will be total and complete for several hundred school districts that have been in the process of integrating or will do so all in one swoop.

title: Enlarging the Electorate
description: The vote in the House approvins extension of the amended Voting Rights Act of 1565 stands as a land mark victory for democracy. Following earlier ap proval by the Senate, it connotes a laudable legisla tive determination to enlarge the electorate and guar antee to all qualified Americans the fundamental right to vote. As amended, the act grants the franchise in all elections to those 18 years of age or older continues to protect Negroes, especially in the South, against infringement of their franchise.

title: ALGERIANS EXPEL U.S. MEDICAL AIDES
description: ALGIERS, June 20The Al gerian Government is ending a multimilliondollar program of United States aid by expelling members of the private Ameri can CAREMedico mission, it was learned this week.

title: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
description: Through the halfopen door in one room of the huts I saw Pastor Bon hoeffer kneeling on the floor praying fervently to his God. I was most deeply moved by the way this lovable man prayed, so devout and so certain that God heard his prayer. At the place of execution he again said a short prayer and then climbed the steps to the gallows, brave and com posed. His death ensued after a few seconds. So wrote the camp doctor who witnessed the death at the hands of the Nazis of 39yearold German theologian, Dietrich Bonhoeffer, on April 9, 1945.

title: Columbia Yearbook Drops Usual Themes to Discuss Sex, Drugs and Protests
description: Columbia College's 1970 student yearbook has scrapped traditional concepts of class annuals and candidly discusses sex and drug use on campus, race relations at the univer sity, and the political protests that have racked the school for the last two years.

title: Biscayne Monument Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel has announced the formal establishment of Biscayne National Monument off the southeastern coast of Florida. The new national monu ment encompasses 33 islands and keys in an area of some 95.000 acres of land and ocean.

title: UNESCO Head Is Praised and Blamed
description: PARIS, June 20Ren Maheu, the embattled director general of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organiza tion, received a unanimous vote of confidence from his bosses this week and a mixed reception from his staff.

title: Frank Silvers 19141970
description: BACK around 1950 I innocently went to see Paul Peters's play, Nat Turner. When I left the the ater, I had decided it was a sacred place where I would like to spend the rest of my life. As the black rebel leader, Frank Silvera was so compelling I was convinced that, if I could not start a revolution myself, I ought at least to work in an area where some one else might be inspired to do it.

title: New York State
description: MANHATTAN

title: Gayle Allison Cuming Is Wed To Richard Ward in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 20The First Presbyterian Church was the setting here this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Gayle Allison Cuming, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John G. Cuming, to Richard Reynolds Ward, son of Ralph E. Ward, president of ChesebroughPond's, Inc., and Mrs. Ward. The ceremony was performed by Rev. George A. Pera.

title: Criminals At Large
description: There is something to be said for the series novel, which builds and expands upon the structures and images of the previous members of the ser ies. There is a bit more to be said, however, for the non series novel, a more exacting task, demanding the develop ment, each time, of a new structure, new images, new milieu, fresh basic character ization. That brings us to Eng land's Michael Gilbert, a most creative author who has fol lowed this latter course with unusual consistency of quality.

title: The Nixon Watch
description: Richard Nixon dyes his hair. That revelation, flatly asserted and defend ed by John Osborne, is one of the dressier trinkets in this collection of essays on the first year of the Nixon Presidency. Osborne covers the White House for The New Republic with dry, wry understatement that turns out to be devastating. As his hair dressing item indicates, he can spe cialize in those glimpses of trivia that newsweekly magazines have abandoned in search for profundity. Osborne is devastating because he takes the President and his cohorts seriously, treating their efforts as though they were not solely aimed at the 1972 election. The 32 reports necessarily focus on the men around Nixon because, the author contends, the man himself is unknowable. The study of Richard Nixon, he writes, requires a steadfast clinging to the fact that he is human. That is not easy. Most of the people who work for him at the White House do their witless best to conceal the fact.

title: West Germany Conquers Uruguay, 10, for Third Place in World Cup Soccer
description: MEXICO CITY, June 20 (AP) A goal by Wolfgang Overath at the 27minute mark gave West Germany a 10 victory to day over Uruguay and third place in the 1970 World Cup soccer championship.

title: Jolts Defeat Chicago for Boxing League Championship
description: DENVER, June 20 (AP)The New York Jolt's heavyweight, Jasper Evans, whipped Billy Thompson of Chicago on a 100 decision last night in lead ing the Jolts to the champion ship of the International Box ing League.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Nader Plans Expanded Summer Investigations of Government and Business
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 Ralph Nader has announced plans for a greatly expanded program of investigations this summer by students known as Nader's Raiders.

title: 50 JERSEY TROOPERS CALLED TO A PRISON
description: BORDENTOWN, N. J., June 21Some 300 prisoners at Bor dentown Reformatory refused to leave the auditorium after a movie last night. About 50 state troopers in full riot gear were dispatched to the institu tion, which has been affected by a statewide strike of prison guards for the last six days.

title: Right of a Father Upheld
description: CHICAGO, June 20 (UPI)A Federal judge has ruled it un constitutional to deny a father the right to be in the delivery room during the birth of his children. The decision by Judge Alexander Napoli prompted the Chicago Board of Health to change its 33yearold rule against permitting fathers to participate. The decision came in the case of Barry Gross, a lawyer, and his wife Merle.

title: DramaPageants: The Heartland's Answer to B'way
description: ALONG with stock com panies performing in barns and symphony orchestras playing in the open air, the historical dramapageant is becoming entrenched as a summertime phenomenon across the Unit ed States.

title: Regina Resnik Hailed For 25 Years at Met
description: Regina Resnik's 25 years as a leading singer with the Metropolitan Opera were celebrated during the third intermission of last night's performance of Carmen, in which she sang the title role.

title: Windward Passage Leads Newport  Bermuda Race
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 20 The race to Bermuda, glamour event of ocean sailing, began today with 149 starters reach ing into a fresh southwesterly breeze and a lump of sea capped with white in clear, crisp weather. Ahead were 679 miles of whatever the fortunes of the biennial fixture had to offer and for one yacht an immor tality of sorts as the main cor rectedtime winner.

title: Prospect Looms for U.S. Budgetary Deficits
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 The 10 per cent surtax on personal and corporate in come, which was cut to 5 per cent on Jan. 1, expires com pletely at the end of this month. President Nixon hailed its expiration in his economic message to the nation Wednesday as a boon to tax payers; it would have cost them more than 12billion if it had stayed in force at the 10 per cent level.

title: LEFKOWITZ HAILS NEW WITNESS LAW
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has declared that a law enacted by the 1970 Legislature removing the ne cessity for corroboration of testimony in antimonopoly cases gives district attorneys another weapon in the fight against organized crime.

title: Astros Call Up Two
description: ATLANTA, June 20 (AP) The Houson Astros called up Cesar Cedeno from Oklahoma City and Cesar Geronimo from Columbus today to replace two players on military duty for the weekend. Replaced temporarily were Norm Miller and Keith Lampard.

title: Verdict On the Apollo 13
description: In the two months since the Apollo 13 spacecraft was dam aged by an explosion that aborted its moon mission and jeopardized the lives of its three man crew, the accideut has been the subject of an exirtustiv, in vestigation by a board of scien tists. Last week the board is sued its report: The accident was caused by human and me chanical failure, management errors by industry contractors, and gross negligence on the part of ground crews.

title: Sarah Willard, Boston Alumna, Becomes Bride
description: SEWICKLEY, Pa., June 20  Miss Sarah McKnight Willard, daughter of Mr. arid Mrs. Louis Willard Jr., and Charles Devens Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Devens of Milton, Mass., were mar ried here this afternoon by the Rev. Benedict Williams, assisted by the Rev. Robert Hetherington in St. Stephen's Episcopal Church here.

title: Job Changes:
description: William W. Morison has been named president of ForemostMcKesson, Inc., suc ceeding Rudolph J. Drews, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer of the company.

title: An Aviation Emergency
description: Ninety air travelers have been killed and 23 injured in the last 18 months in 114 incidents of hijacking, sabotage and ground attacks on aircraft.

title: New York Mood: Impatience In the Slums
description: The smell of charred wood and smoke was strong one re cent morning in the Browns ville section of Brooklyn. On a garbagefilled sidewalk a young Puerto Rican girl was berating a group of newsmen covering an outbreak of violence of the previous night.

title: Johnson Says Tension Cost Him 18Foot Vault
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 20If I would have relaxed on the way down, I would have had it, an excited Jan Johnson said today, after he came within inches of clear ing 18 feet in the pole vault in the best attempt ever made at the height.

title: Point of View
description: A wall is a wall, is a wall, but the construction industry is not an in dustry, not an industry, not an indus try. Then what is it? Probably this country's and this century's greatest anachronism. The innovative and the inventive have been sadly lacking and hence we have to pay through the nose for a large slice of our living expenses.

title: In Hedda Irene Proves Her Worth
description: STRATFORD, Ont. WHAT shall we talk about, the big things Irene Worth does in Hedda Gabler or the little ones? The big ones are staggering in their ar rogance, and in the authority with which that arrogance is supported. When, at the Ca nadian Festival in Stratford, Ontario, we return from an airy intermission on a twilit lawn to attend the second act, the house lights go down and in the complete darkness a pistol is fired, apparently directly in our faces.

title: Japanese Railways Plans To Revolutionize Transit
description: TOKYO, June 20  Buoyed by the success of the 120mile anhour Tokaido express line linking Tokyo with Osaka, the Japanese National Railways is engaged in a series of projects that will revolutionize trans portation in this cramped coun try.

title: Religion
description: For two decades the Na tional Council of Churches has been taking liberal stands on issues like the war in Vietnam while millions of churchgoers fretted, fumed and angrily accused the ecu menical agency of being out of touch with grassroots Protestant opinion. The 250 member general board of the council, which represents most major Protestant and Orthodox churches in this country, is now drafting a major overhaul of the council at its quarterly meeting in Washington which could bring some of the changes long sought by conservatives.

title: Fireman a Fire Hazard
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 20 (UPI)A fireman was threat ened with dismissal today on the ground that his long hair, moustache and sideburns rep resented a fire hazard. Fire Chief Winston O. Wilson has suspended Reed L. Gibson, 22 years old, for 30 days, and said he would lose his job if he did not clip his hair and moustache, an unsafe condition which could be injurious to you and to others around you during fire fighting operations.

title: Pesonen, ExGiant Back. Joins Staff of L.I. Bulls
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. (UPI) A former New York Giant half back, Dick Pesonen, has joined the Long Island Bulls of the Atlantic Coast Football League as coordinator of offense.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE combination dead bolt, chain lock and alarm system pictured at right is designed to be installed on almost any kind of entrance door (other than glass) to provide an extra measure of security for the occupants. Particularly suitable for apartment house doors, the lock has a builtin battery powered alarm sys tem that emits, a shrill, pul sating signal as soon as any one attempts to pick the lock, jimmy, the door, saw through the deadbolt, try to force it open with a plastic strip, cut through or pry off, the chain lockor in any way gain un authorized entry. suitable for apartment house doors, the lock has a builtin battery powered alarm sys tem that emits, a shrill, pul sating signal as soon as any one attempts to pick the lock, jimmy, the door, saw through the deadbolt, try to force it open with a plastic strip, cut through or pry off, the chain lockor in any way gain un authorized entry.

title: Congress Acts on Youth And Rights Votes
description: WASHINGTONThe galleries were packed, young people over flowing the seats and standing clustered around doorways. When Speaker John McCormack an nounced the vote, 224 to 183 in favor of the resolution, they broke into applause that the Speaker was unwilling to check with his gavel.

title: G. M. Inquiry Planned
description: DETROIT, June 20  Mr. Nader said today that 10 grad uate students would spend this summer studying the Gen eral Motors Corporation to determine whether its policies were serving consumers.

title: Army Stunt Chutist Killed
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., June 20 (UPI)A member of the Army's Golden Knights pre cision parachute team fell to his death today at a perform ance at the Corpus Christi Na val Air Station. The jumper's main chute failed to open, then, became tangled in the reserve chute.

title: Soviet Trade With NonCommunists Increases
description: The Soviet Union increased its trade last year with non Communist countriesespe cially developing nations  much more rapidly than with other Communist countries. In line with this spurt, So vietAmerican trade in 1969 had one of its sharpest rises in years.

title: Miss Fugazy Bride Of Vito A. Luciani
description: Miss Denise Fugazy, whose greatgrandfather, Louis Fu gazy, founded the Fugazy Travel Bureau in 1870, was married at the main altar of St. Patrick's Cathedral yes terday morning to Vito A. Luciani. Terence Cardinal Cooke performed the cere mony and celebrated tne nup tial mass.

title: U. of Rhode Island Cancels A Course on Revolution
description: KINGSTON, R. I., June 20 (UPI) The dean of the Uni versity of Rhode Island summer school says he is canceling a course on revolution, as directed by the university president, Werner A. Baum.

title: Miss Ann Dixon Schickhaus Bride of David Carpenter Titus
description: ORANGE, N. J., June 20 Miss Ann Dixon Schickhaus and David Carpenter Titus were married here this after noon in Grace Episcopal Church by the Right Rev. Leland Stark, Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Newark. The rector, the Rev. Richard H. Schoolmaster, assisted.

title: U.S. Business:
description: FORT WORTH, June 20 American Airlines, Inc., which has trained flight and maintenance crews here for 12 domestic and foreign air lines as well as for itself, has announced plans to broaden its flighttraining ac tivity to include the instruc tion of general aviation crews.

title: Can They Clean Up With Dirty Little Billy?
description: BILLY THE KID, that lovable varmint of the Old West, will gallop across the screen once again. The latest moviemakers to be hooked on the glamorous renegade and his glamorous box office potential are the boys at the adver tising firm of Wells, Rich and Greene. Stan Dragoti and Charles Moss, who have fashioned many a zippy TV commercial for the prestigious Madison Avenue house, have penned a screenplay which they are calling Dirty Little Billy.
