In dealing with the exploits of the fabled outlaw, they have decided to put the emphasis on comedy. The fun should begin in Texas or Mexico this October.

title: Dance
description: AS the New York dance season moves into its final phase with the month's engagement at the New York State Theater of the American Bal let Theatercelebrating its 30th birthdaythere are still one or two things that for reasons of space I have not mentioned earlier in this column.

title: Rosewall Trounces Hewitt In South of England Final
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 20 (Reuters)Ken Rosewall of Australia won the $1,200 men's singles finst prize with a 62, 61 victory over South Africa's No. 1 player Bob Hewitt, in the South of England tennis cham pionships today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Miss Lucy Elisabeth Schnei der and John Fergus McDiar mid, 1968 graduates of Swarthmore College, were married in the Community Church of New York yester day afternoon. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Wayne Knoll, a Jesuit priest, who is studying for a doctor ate in English at Harvard, as is the bride. Mr. McDiarmid is a candidate for a doctorate in English at Yale.

title: SPANISH LAWYERS URGE AN AMNESTY
description: MADRID, June 20  Spain's lawyers called today for a gen eral amnesty of political prison ers and the abolition of special Dolitical courts.

title: MAJORITY FOUND TO LIKE AGNEW
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 20 A survey by the Gallup Poll indicated today that favorable opinions of Vice President Ag new outweighed the unfavor able by a 5to3 ratio but that only one person in five thinks of him as Presidential timber.

title: New Rules Not All Of Them Clear On C.O.'s;
description: WASHINGTON  The occa sional governmental tendency to say it like it isn't was never more apparent than last week, when the Supreme Court and the Selective Service System took turns obfuscating the sub ject of conscientious objectors.

title: Airport Officials Predict Easier Going at Kennedy
description: Officials are forecasting that most air travelers will find it easier going at Kennedy Inter national Airport this summer than during the summers of 1969 and 1968.

title: ISRAELIS COMING HERE FOR TENNIS
description: Despite her troubles with the Arab countries, Israel is still seeking to build up her sports program.

title: Ch. Legend of Gael, a Gordon Setter, Judged Best at MidHudson K. C. Show
description: RHINEBECK, N. Y., June 20 A Gordon setter, known on the circuit as Valor, showed his mettle in the ring at the Dutchess County Fairgrounds today when he was named the best of 1,263 dogs at the Mid Hudson Kennel Club show.

title: PRECIPICE WOOD SCORES AT ASCOT
description: ASCOT, England, June 20 (Reuters)Precipice Wood won the Ascot Gold Cup today in a surprising eclipse of the French challenge for Royal Ascot's richest prize.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayFairfield County, Fair field County Hunt Club, Long Lots Road, estport, Conn. Cham pianships in all divisions. 11 A.M.

title: MEDIATOR HELPS IN LOCAL FIGHTS
description: For Ronald W. Haughton, the president of the Board of Mediation for Community Dis putes, there is a special virtue in being humble.

title: B. G. Garrett Jr. Weds Elizabeth Kirkman
description: NOROTON, Conn., June 20 Miss Elizabeth Ann Kirk man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Lloyd Kirkman of Darien, was married here to day to Broox Gray Garrett Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Gar rett of Brewton, Ala.

title: Business Index Rises in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose to 349.9 from 343.4 a week earlier. A year ago it was 353.2

title: Patriots' snack
description: Although the usual expression is as American as apple pie, the characteristic American eating pattern has changed so that as a hot dog, or hamburger, or baked beans with molasses, or even as American as fried ravioli (big in the Middle West), or as a Reuben sandwich grilled delight of corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese and Russian dressing on rye), or a lobster roll is equally apt. At right, a recipe for a lobster roll par excellence.

title: Chess
description: THE chess play of Bobby Fischer, eighttime United States cham pion, is motivated by the dictum of Dr. Emanuel Lasker: Chess is a struggle. Right there, the analogy ends.

title: Mrs. Barrett H. Clark Dies; Concert Pianist, Teacher
description: HAGERSTOWN, Md., June 20 Mrs. Cecile Smith Clark, concert pianist and the widow of Barrett H. Clarke, author and editor of many books on the drama, died here yesterday. Her age was 79.

title: Pulitzer Panel Fills Vacancy
description: John Cowles Jr., president and editorial chairman of the Minneapolis Star and Tribune Company, has been elected to fill a vacancy on the Pulitzer Prizes advisory board. He suc ceeds Norman Isaacs, who re cently resigned to become a member of the faculty of the Columbia Graduate School of Journalism here.

title: Have You Tried The Danish Blue?
description: BLUE moviesthe short est, purest form of the cinemaofachievement  are now openly available to Manhattan adults as elements of featurelength documentaries on the effects of Denmark's abolition (in June, 1969) of all restraints against the manufacture and sale of pornography to adults. The latest product of the new boom in Danish Blue is called Censorship in Denmark: A New Approach, and it opened this week at the 55th Street Playhouse, the Lido East and the Evergreen 11th Street Theater.

title: Editor's Mailbox
description: Another Kick Coming

title: Letters
description: William H. Honan (Can Teddy Kennedy Survive His Reputation?, May 24) illus trates his point that public men may live down almost any failing by citing the case of Grover Cleveland who was elected President despite the campaign revelation that he may have fathered an illegiti mate son.

title: Deaths Attributed to Narcotics, Mainly Heroin, Increase Here
description: Deaths from the epidemic of narcotics abuse are still rising from the highest levels in the city's historywith no abate ment in sight.

title: Kirkpatrick Sparks Royals
description: KANSAS CITY, June 20 (AP) Ed Kirkpatrick drove in four runs wih a homer and double and the Kansas City Royals sur vived an eighthinning Minne sota rally tonight for a 53 vic tory over the Twins.

title: Stamps
description: UNITED STATES stamp collectors will be well represented in dis plays at Philympia, London's international stamp exhibition, Sept. 1828, at the Empire Hall, Olympia, in the Kensington section of that city.

title: Economy: Nixon and Critics Disagree on Remedies
description: WASHINGTON  Twenty four hours before President Nix on went on the air last week to discuss the national economy, the Senate Democratic Policy Committee adopted a resolution whose clauses provided a broad ly accurate  if partisan  picture of where the economy stands:

title: Summer Beginning
description: Summer begins here at 3:43 P.M. today

title: HENRY HOFHEIMER, SCARSDALE LAWYER
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 20 Henry Hofheimer Jr., a cor porate and real estate lawyer, was killed yesterday when bicycle he was riding plunged down an embankment near his home at 19 Ross Road. His age was 53.

title: 3 Senate Rivals by Land and One by Sea
description: Theodore C. Sorensen yester day suggested a detailed pro gram to combat narcotics. Rep resentative Richard L. Ottinger accused the Nixon Administra tion of malign neglect of education. Paul O'Dwyer spoke at a peace rally in Brooklyn. Representative Richard Max McCarthy put on his scuba equipment and jumped into three upstate lakes to drama tize the pollution problem.

title: The Derby Ram
description: A tall old tale is The Derby Ram, and what a wonderful whopper of ballad it has been for hundreds of years now! The narrator's description of the extraordinary creature met upon an ordinary market day gets broader and broader as the verses proceed: The wool upon his back, sir,/Reached up unto the sky,/The eagles built their nests there,/For I heard the young ones cry. And on and prodigiously on: This ram had four legs to walk upon,/This ram had four legs to stand,/And every leg he had, sir,/Stood on an acre of land. Eventually the animal winds up as the most enormous mut ton pie as the narrator assures the listener: Indeed, sir, it's the truth, sir,/For I never was taught to lie,/ And if you go to Derby, sir,/You may eat a bit of the pie.

title: Compact Appliances Spurring Sales Gains
description: The appliance industry, as the auto mobile industry did a few years ago, going compact in a big way. And, as with the big Detroit car makers, the appliance producers of the Midwest and South have apparently been spurred into making compact models by the inroads of a rising flow of imports.

title: Soviet Yields On Dissenter But Not On Dissent
description: MOSCOW  At 10 o'clock Wednesday morning, Zhores A. Medvedev, the outspoken bio logist whose forced detention had created a cause celebre in scientific and literary circles here, was released from the men tal hospital in Kaluga and al lowed to return to his home in nearby Obninsk, about 60 miles southwest of Moscow.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: FLORIA

title: Summer
description: We call it the summer solstice, and it took place yesterday. Today, in the terms of the almanac, it is summer. Now the earth begins to swing hack on its trunnions, past the year's longest span of daylight and toward the equinox of autumn. The long summer days will slowly shrink, for though summer is April and May grown into June and July, it is also June and Ally ripening into September and October.

title: GAUCHERO OUTSAILS FLEET OF 12 STARS
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., June 20 Alan Burtis's Gauchero returned to her winning ways in Star Class competition today in Hempstead Harbor sailing con ducted by the Sea Cliff Yacht Club.

title: News of the Rialto
description: ALT HOUGH the Long Wharf Theater of New Haven occasionally may be short on cash, under the leadership of Alvin Brown it hasn't been short on artistic standards. Or, for that matter, as its new schedule testifies, on enter prise either.

title: CHILDABUSE INQUIRY URGES MORE JUDGES
description: A Manhattan grand jury looking into child abuse has called for the hiring of more judges and other court person nel.

title: Linda J. Palmer And M. F. Miller Marry in Jersey
description: OAKLYN, N.J., June 20 Miss Linda Joyce Palmer, who was graduated last week from Susquehanna Univer sity, where she was on the dean's list, was married this morning to Mark Fulton Miller, an alumnus of the Wharton School of Finance and Commerce of the Univer sity of Pennsylvania.

title: War Is Heaven!
description: As D. Keith Mano tells it in his new novel, shortly after the end of the Vietnam war American liberalism has swept into the jungles of the Central American banana republic of Camaguay to quell a national liberation movement. The ste rility of soul that leads serious men to think they are making love when they are in a gang bang persists. I cherish two things only in life, says Sgt. Clarence Hook, the hero. My religion and my liberty. Com munism, he adds, is inimical to both.

title: Goshen in Summer: Trot Town, U.S.A.
description: Goshen is an anachronism in 1970. It is a 19thcentury village 85 miles from Man hattan. The frenetic society so close by hasn't disturbed it vet.

title: Mayors Wonder: How Hot A Summer Will It Be?
description: DENVERWhen Mayor Carl B. Stokes of Cleveland was asked last week if he thought there would be violence in the cities this summer, he replied: The prospects are the same as they were last winter. They are terri ble, to say the least. We have been having violence of all kinds. On the campuses, everywhere. Now you are going to have idle people out on the streets and that only exacerbates the bad situa tion we already have.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NEW YORK STATE

title: Hebert Seeks Way Out
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 20 (UPI)  Representative F. Ed ward Hebert, chairman of the House Armed Services Commit tee on Reserves, said today that a way must be found to re turn American servicemen from Vietnam. It's got to he done with our flag flying on high and not dragging in the dirt, the Louisiana Democrat told the 24th national convention of the Reserve Officers Association. There can he no compromise.

title: Recordings
description: SOME years ago, Glenn Gould's accountant brought him the good word. The young Ca nadian pianist could give up riding the concert circuit. He was delighted. Bigtime pub lic performance had brought him fame and fortune in a relatively short time, but he did not enjoy it and was de lighted at the prospect of putting it behind him.

title: PRO GOLFING TOUR IS NOT FOR CLARK
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 20 (AP)  Bob Clark, concerned with defending his National Collegiate Athletic Association golf title, wants no part of the pro tour.

title: In Paris, Orly Is the New Eyeful
description: PARISIn planning a trip to the French Alps recently, I faced the prospect of a fourhour layover at Orly Airport. The thought struck a dismal chord, one reminiscent of other times and other airports at which un avoidably long waits were exercises in tedium and boredom.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: In the dusky recesses of a Manhattan bar, Clare Con ley, Jack Samson and I talked of the world of field and stream and of this month's 75th anniversary edition of the magazine they work for: Field and Stream.

title: Indians Distrust in Peru Complicates Quake Relief
description: LIMA, Peru, June 20In the bleak, cold Andean highlands of northern Peru, many Indians are still hiding their injured and orphaned, according to mis sionaries, three weeks after the devastating earthquake there.

title: France and Rumania Plan To Double Annual Trade
description: PARIS, June 20 (Reuters) France and Rumania have agreed to double their trade to 1.3billion francs ($250 million) a year over the next five years.

title: Bankers and Students Rapping at Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 20  Unemployment in meeting the students of Rut gers University over nightly half kegs of beer in rap sessions. The program called Rutgers Summer Mobilization is being held at the graduate student lounge where 50 to 250 persons argue events ranging from Cambodia to the slums of Newark.

title: YOUTHS SON U.N. ON ENVIRONMENT
description: BLACK LAKE, Mich., June 18The youthful evangelists of the environment have met the United Nations, and they are not rileased with it.

title: Barbara Wood Married in St. Paul
description: ST. PAUL, June 20Miss Barbara Washburn Wood, a coed at Dartmouth College last year, and Winthrop Adams Rockwell, a graduate of Dartmouth this month, were married here this after noon in an outdoor ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thurs ton Wood. A reception was held at the Somerset Country Club.

title: Players From Communist Nations Infiltrating Tennis's Top Ranks
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 20Tennis was once the game of the kings of France and still is widely regarded as a fancy pants sport for the moneyed bourgeois, not for common peo ple. All of which makes more curious the fact that some of the newest stars of the court represent Communist  ruled peoples democracies of East ern Europe.

title: Death Penalty Illegal, Goldberg Article Says
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, a for mer Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, says he be lieves that capital punishment is unconstitutional.

title: They Hold French Decorations and Some Even Know Their Meaning
description: Sam Aaron, wine merchant; Mildred Custin, former president of Bonwit Teller, and Diana Vreeland, editor in chief of Vogue, recently joined some 100 civilians in this country who have ?? a medal they know is an honor but, in most cases, don't know quite what honor.

title: MAFIA RACKETEER MAY BE DEPORTED
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 20 The legal fight to deport the racketeer Carlos Marcello, which started in 1952, appears to be coming to an end.

title: AssignedRisk Insurance: To Many It's a Stigma
description: A story making the rounds not too long ago had to do with the businessman who applied to an agent for auto insurance.

title: It's Been A Long, Long Primary Campaign
description: The Page Airways field out side of Rochester, N.Y., showed only a few lights late last Sunday night. It was a lonely place, a sad place to be on a Sunday night. Two small planes waited beyond the circle of light around the small terminal buildingone to take Arthur J. Goldberg to Syracuse, the other to take Howard J. Samuels to New York City.

title: Miss Lucy Schneider Is Bride Here
description: Miss Lucy Schneider Is Bride Here

title: ROGERS HAS A TALK WITH SOVIET ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 Secretary of State William P. Rogers met today with Ambas sador Anatoly F. Dobrynin of the Soviet Union on possible peace moves in the Middle East.

title: Decatur and Reyer Upset Obert Brothers in Handball
description: Marty Decatur and Artie Reyer of the 92d Street Y.M. H.A., the fourthseeded team, upset Carl and Ruby Obert of the New York Athletic Club, the topranked team, 1221, 2114, 2115, to gain the semi final round of the National Amateur Athletic Union one wall handball championship at Municipal Courts in Coney Island yesterday.

title: Kemp, ExPlayer for Bills, Making a Run at Congress
description: BUFFALO, June 20  Whether they are sports fans or not, said Jack Kemp, I don't think there are many people around Buffalo who haven't heard of the Bills. For eight years through last season Kemp was the quar terback of the Bills, the local pro football team. Now he has retired and is running for Congress in the 39th District here as a Republican.

title: Laird Backs Spain's Entry Into NATO
description: MADRID, June 20Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird strongly endorsed today the eventual entry of Spain into the North Atlantic Treaty Organiza tion.

title: Buffalo Is Split by Nominee to Head University
description: Dr. Robert L. Ketter, a former vice president of the State Uni versity of New York at Buffalo, has been nominated for the institution's presidency in a move that has deeply split the campus and worried top uni versity officials in Albany.

title: Personality:
description: PITTSBURGH  A young man who had recently earned his master's degree in busi ness administration and then gone to work for the Alumi num Company of America, told the chief financial officer of Alcoa the other day that the concern's cost accounting was really out of the Dark Ages.

title: HAROLD SEROFF
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 20 Harold Seroff of 3836 West field Avenue, president of the Intercontinental Funding Cor poration, a division of the In tercontinental Life Insurance Company in Newark, died yes terday at the Shackamaxon Country Club in Scotch Plains, apparently of a heart attack. His age was 45.

title: Coins
description: THE numismatist is quite interested in the sym bols, portraits and legends on coins and paper monies of the United States and other countries because of the history they partray. On the basis of the many Queries received here, a steadily increasing number of people are becoming inter ested in the hobby of col lecting coins and currency and learning the meaning be hind some of the legends and symbols.

title: Rough Riders Head For the Rodeo Circuit
description: WITH approximately 500 rodeos scheduled in the United States and Canada this season, vaca tioners will have more than one opportunity to relive the bold spirit of the Old West. This 87yearold dramatic sport still excites thousands of spectators and earns cash prizes for those rugged entrants to whom bronco busting or roping a frisky steer is just part of a day's work.

title: Back to south Pacific Minus Bloody Mary
description: UGANVILLE, Espiritu Santo, New HebridesMany of the same Americans who passed through these jungled islands in World War II uniforms of green and khaki are coming back today in multicolored Hawaiian shirts, shorts and sandals, the accepted travel gear in these sunny South Pacific latitudes.

title: I.R.A. Sitin at Irish Airline
description: LONDON, June 20 (Reuters) Two groups of men who said they were members of the Irish Republican Army staged sitins today at offices of Aer Lingus, the Irish airline in Birmingham and Glasgow. They said they were protesting collaboration between Irish and British police. Both groups were moved out of the buildings by the police.

title: Where They Eat and Ate in Paris
description: If you can't get to Paris for a meal this summer, it's possible to sit at home and read about others who did, because a considerable number of writers, outlanders as well as native Frenchmen, have chronicled their wandering through the dining rooms and cafe terraces of this city.

title: ARAMBURU CASE REMAINS PUZZLE
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 20 The kidnapping and presumed murder of Lieut. Gen. Pedro Eu genio Aramburu, former pro visional President of Argen tina, have added a perplexing new dossier to the files of un solved political crimes in this country.

title: Angelike De Kornfeld Is Married
description: Miss Angelike De Kornfeld was married in Philadelphia yesterday to Dave Heath, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Howard Heath of Philadel phia. Justice of the Peace Robert Baker performed the civil ceremony at City Hall.

title: ALGERIA STRESSES DOMESTIC ISSUES
description: ALGIERS, June 20A four day state visit by King Faisal of Saudi Arabia has served to underscore the determination of President Houari Boumediene of Algeria to concentrate on his country's internal problems and to avoid meddling in those of other Arab lands.

title: When The Panther Came to Yale
description: WHEN all the tumult began at Yale over the New Haven trial of the Black Panther's, was deep in rehearsals for a production of Don Juan at the Yale Repertory Theater. The conjunction of events seemed to me significant at the time, and nothing that followed was to alter my sense of tortured symbolic contrasts. Social and political issues were helping to mobilize the campus toward a commitment that declared all other ac tivity irrelevant, and here we were proceeding with the provocative business of trying to formu late works of theatrical artfrom another century and civilization, no less.

title: Miss Mancri to Be Bride
description: CLIFTON, N. J., June 20 Mr. and Mrs. D. Richard Ma ned have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Marilyn Maneri, to Charles M. Carroll, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Carroll of Hillside. Miss Maneri was graduated this month from Douglass College. Mr. Carroll wah graduated the, month from Rutgers University.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: A new regulation of the New Jersey Real Estate Com mission requiring all brokers and salesmen in the state to be fingerprinted has led to protests from some members of the profession.

title: RED SOX BOW, 83, TO STOTTLEMYRE
description: BOSTON, June 20The New York Yankees put together a lot of little things again tonight plus one big thinga seven hitter by Mel Stottlemyreto defeat the Boston Red Sox, 83.

title: AT 50, GRASSLANDS HONORS EMPLOYES
description: VALHALLA, N.Y., June 20 Grasslands, the Westchester County hospital, celebrated its 50th anniversary here this week with a ceremony honoring those who had worked at the hospi tal for 10 years or more.

title: U.S. No To Penn Central.
description: Early this month the giant transportation complex, the Penn Central Company, discovered that despite its $7billion in as sets and the inducement of an 11 per cent coupon on the secu rities, it was unable to sell a $100 million debenture issue. Wall Street's confidence in the com pany was seriously undermined as a result, and the Pennsy was unable to refinance some short term debt as it matured.

title: Europeans Skeptical of Nixon Plan
description: PARIS, June 20In setting up his machinery for volun tary wage and price restraint, President Nixon is trying to do what other democratic countries have attempted with only very mixed results.

title: Kathryn Little Married
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 20Miss Linda Kathryn Little and Robert Martin Konetchy were married here this morn ing. The Rev. Dr. W. Donald Harris performed the cere mony In the Hitchcock Pres byterian Church. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Paul Little of Scarsdale, and Mr. and Mrs. John M. Konetchy of Hartsdale. The bride's father is general tax counsel with Mobil Oil Cor poration. The bridegroom's father is a dealer in antiques.

title: Canadians File Pollution Suit
description: DETROIT, June 20 (Canadian Press)Thirteen Canadian fam ilies are suing three United States companies for $3,795,000 in damages allegedly caused by American pollution drifting over the Detroit River into the Windsor, Ont., area. The suit was filed in Federal District Court here yesterday against Great Lakes Steel, Allied Chem icals and Detroit Edison.

title: Education
description: Millions of children every morning begin their school day by reciting the pledge to the flag, sitting through routine chores, such as attendance tak ing and listening to the princi pal's disembodied voice giving inspiration and instructions over the public address system. To many, this symbolizes order and security; others see it as a pro cess of dehumanization.

title: $1Million Libel Suit Filed Over Film by Oregon Honor Students
description: BEND, Ore., June 20Two high school girls elected to make a movie with an eight millimeter camera instead of writing term papers for an honors English class this spring. Now, the local school district and five teachers are defend ants in a $1million libel suit and the girls may vet be sued.

title: Pleasant Valley Signs L.P.G.A. for 3 Years
description: SUTTON, Mass. June 20 (UPI)An agreement to stage the Ladies Professional Golf Association championship at Pleasant Valley Country Club for the next three years has been reached.

title: Roosevelt Entries
Goodell Bill Would Eliminate Selective Service Director
description: WASHINGTON, JUNE 20 (UPI)  Introducing legislation to abolish the post of Selective Service Director, Senator Charles E. Goodell, Republican of New York, charged today to let new standards for con scientious objectors set by the director, Curtis Tarr, Discrim inate against young men who have not head a college educa tion.

title: Football Giants Are Sold Out for Ninth Straight Season
description: The New York Giants an nounced yesterday that Yan kee Stadium had been sold out for the 1970 National Football League season. The Giants' string of homegame sellouts dates to the 1962 season and will have reached 65 straight games at the end of 1970.

title: THE BIG TEN ON BROADWAY
ExCabinet Member Named Editor of New Statesman
description: LONDON, June 20Richard Crossman, Secretary of State for Social Services in the de feated Labor Government, is to become editor of the New Statesman, a leftwing weekly magazine.

title: Tough Job Ahead for Newark's First Black Mayor
description: NEWARKRight after the Tuesday night election returns showed that Kenneth A. Gibson had become the first in what promises to be a long list of black mayors here, two black youths, both of them grinning from ear to ear, pranced past a cordon of white city patrol men drawn around City Hall in the event that a Gibson defeat might ignite another violent black rampage in the city. As the two boys went by, they held up their fists mockingly at the white faces peering from be hind white crash helmets, That's black power, baby, the blackest power you ever saw, and then moved on to join thou sands of other deliriously happy blacks who spilled out onto the streets in peaceful victory cele brations.

title: How to Talk Back to Your Television Set
description: WHAT TO DO ... 3. Express your views. Write the stations, the networks, adver tisers, the FCC ...  How to Talk Back to Your Television Set, page 220.

title: HEATH STRESSES PARTY CONTINUITY IN NAMING CABINET
description: LONDON, June 20Edward Heath named his Cabinet to night, emphasizing continuity rather than novelty.

title: Attic
description: Seven miles away and twelve stories up Sister Blen dina turns up a black ace and the eyes begin to move and grow. At that point I try to slip out of Dogsbody the back way but it's a close fit and they're too fast for me. The uniform takes one long fast step that puts him behind me. That gives the eyes time to become metal rings opened wide and moving in quickly each one closing with a hard click around one of my thighs an inch below the crotch. My stomach drops and would fall but it catches on my crotch and is saved.

title: Nixons Served Tacos To Mark Anniversary
description: THURMONT, Md., June 20 (UPI)  President and Mrs. Nixon were observing their 30th wedding anniversary this weekend at Camp David with a serving of Mexican tacos.

title: Christine Stoehr Is Bride of J. F. Wells
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., June 20Miss Christine Val erie Stoehr and Jonathan F. Wells were married here to day at a nuptial mass in St. Thomas the Apostle Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. William Cullen.

title: House Acts On Postal Reform
description: The program to reform the na tion's postal system, which had been moving at Pony Express pace for months, spurted last week when the House, in a 359 to24 vote, passed a sweeping reform and pay  rise bill. The measure would turn the Post Of fice Department into an inde pendent Government agency operated by an 11member com mission. The commission would be authorized to negotiate sala ries with postal unions, set postal postal rates subject only to Con gressional veto, and sell bonds to finance modernization of the na tion's antiquated post offices. Under the present system, Con gress sets postal rates and sala ries and subsidizes all deficits.

title: SURVEY FINDS WAR ANGERS STUDENTS
description: In a sixmonth survey of more than 5,000 students at 39 randomiy selected colleges and universities, two Swarth more College psychologists have concluded that the Viet 312km war has greatly changed students' attitudes toward ca reers, parents, religion, politics and the United States in gen eral.

title: Blackfin Reported in Lead In Los AngelesTahiti Race
description: LOS ANGELES, June 20 (AP) The ketch, Blackfin, held the lead today after about the first quarter of the Los Angelesto Tahiti race was completed.

title: Columbia George Takes $30,850 Westbury Commodore Pace by HalfLength
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 20 Columbia George, bowed ten dons and all, ruled the track tonight just as much as Roland Beaulieu, his New England driver, wanted him to at Roose velt Raceway.

title: SOVIET SCIENTISTS HAIL SOYUZ FEAT
description: MOSCOW, June 20 (UPI) Soviet scientists expressed sat isfaction today with the Soyuz 9 space mission. They said had demonstrated that man, with his inherent creative en deavor, preserves his charac teristic qualities under weight less conditions.

title: OFFENSES BY G.I.'S STIR OKINAWANS
description: NAHA, Okinawa, June 20 Demands have increased here that the United States transfer to the local police, and to the courts, judicial jurisdiction over crimes committed against Oki nawans by American service men and civilian employes of the United States Government.

title: YEMEN ASKS FOR AID IN SEVERE DROUGHT
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, June 20The adjoining Yemen Arab Republic has appealed to United Nations agencies and several countries for help because of an extreme drought that has lasted for several years.

title: MIRV Changes the Arms Race
description: While the United States and the Soviet Union negotiate in Vienna on slowing down the arms race, that race, in the opin ion of many experts, is in danger of escalating to a new level. This arises from the fact that both the United States and the Soviet Union have been developing MIRV'sMultiple Independently Targeted Reentry Vehicles. Each MIRV carries a number of war heads which can be fired against as many targets while in mid flight. Once MIRV's are de ployed in substantial numbers it will be difficult if not impossible for either side to estimate how many warheads the other side has, since spy satellites can count missiles but not the num ber of warheads on each missile. The prospects of an armslimita tion agreement will, therefore, be that much more remote. Both sides fear onsite inspection as an opportunity for espionage.

title: Syria Raises Interest Rate
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 20 (Reuters)Syria raised its bank interest rate today by at least onehalf of 1 per cent in a hid to encourage savings and the return of Syrian capital from abroad. Abdel Halim Khaddam, the Minister of Economy and Foreign Trade, issued a decree raising the rate from 4 per cent by at least onehalf of 1 per cent.

title: Alice Franklin, J. E. Goyert Jr. Are Married
description: NOROTON, Conn., June 20 The marriage of Miss Alice Louise Franklin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward V. Franklin to John Emmett Goyert Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Goyert of Cincinnati, took place here this after noon. The Rev. Dr. Lawrence McColl Horton performed the ceremony in the Noroton Presbyterian Church.

title: F.B.I. Arrests 16, Seeks Eight Others In Car Theft Ring
TV, Radio Listings
description: The following information about today's television and radio programs was not avail able in time to appear in Sec tion 2.

title: RETARDED TAUGHT TO LIVE NORMALLY
description: From its small office on the fourth floor of a Manhattan office building, a special agency carefully nurtures and directs the dreams of a group of young people determined to lead normal life.

title: Susan Hand Bride of Stephen Robinson
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 20Miss Susan Elizabeth Hand, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Darwin C. Hand of Old Greenwich, was married here this afternoon to Stephen Manning Robinson, son of Mrs. Claude E. Robinson of New York and the late Mr. Robinson, founder and presi dent of the Opinion Research Corporation.

title: Black Police Assail Station Brutality
description: The top officials of an as sedation of 2,000 black New York City policemen yesterday challenged city and police of ficials to halt alleged station house brutality against prison ers before it led to armed confrontations between white and black policemen.

title: Garden Tours and Shows
description: THE Middle Atlantic Re gional Lily Group will have its seventh annual Lily Slow on Saturday and next Sunday at the Penn sylvania Horticultural Soci ety, 325 Walnut Street, Phil adelphia. Hours Saturday will be from 2 to 5 P.M. and Sun day from noon to 5 P.M. There is no admission charge. The shove will hive 52 com petitive classes including many species from Asiatic, Martagon, Candidum, Amer ican and Trumpet groups. Three classes will he devoted to lily arrangements.

title: Badillo Joins Protesters Over Garbage Collection
description: Herman Badillo, former Borough President of the Bronx, appeared in front of Gracie Mansion with several civic groups yesterday to protest what they termed inadequate garbage collection in Central and East Harlem.

title: World Soccer Is a Mad, Mad World
description: MEXICO CITYThe eyes of 300 million television viewers from the Soviet Union to Chile, from South Africa to northern Europe will be on Aztec Sta dium here today for what most of the nonAsiatic world consid ers the supreme sports event of the year: the final game of the world soccer championship be tween Brazil and Italy.

title: The Guardsmen's View Of the Tragedy At Kent State
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio.

title: Aerospace: Tale of A Sick Industry
description: Henry Beers, a 43yearold Princeton graduate with two de grees in aeronautical engineer ing, is looking for a job. He was laid off May 15 by The Grum man Corporation, the Long Island company that produced the Apollo moon craft. He has a daughter headed for college in the fall, and two other children, and he is not particular whether his next job is in or out of the aerospace field.

title: Generations Clash at Parley on Food
description: THE HAGUE, the Nether lands, June 20Older delegates to the second World Food Congress reacted strongly yes terday against a coordinated attempt by 250 participating students and youth leaders to concentrate the debate on po litical issues.

title: FAST HILARIOUS TIES TRACK MARK
description: LIVONIA, Mich., June 20 (AP)  Fast Hilarious took the lead at the start and fought off a charging Figonero to win the $126,000 Michigan Mile at a mile and oneeighth today in the recordequaling time of 1:47 4/5 for the Detroit Race Course.

title: Princeton Names Robinson Varsity Lacrosse Coach
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 20 Arthur E. Robinson, freshman lacrosse coach at Princeton University since 1967, has been named head coach of varsity lacrosse.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Q:

title: Aide Declines to Comment
description: PARIS, June 20 (Reuters) Neil Huff, the head of the CAREMedico mission expelled from Algeria, said today his group would leave Paris fort New York on Monday. He re fused to comment on the cir cumstances of the expulsion.

title: Scholars Now Work on H in Welsh Dictionary After 50 Years
description: ABERYSTWYTH, Wales, June 20Nearly 50 years after work started on the definitive Welsh dictionary, the Celtic counterpart of the Oxford Eng lish Dictionary, a team of com pilers is working through the letter H. They cautiously hope that the job will be finished in 15 years.

title: Hockey Players Swing to Golf Naturally
description: Swinging a golf club just might be the most unnatural movement an athlete has to master, but hockey players, accustomed to flailing a puck with a stick, apparently have less difficulty with the game than other professionals.

title: Spotlight:
description: One of the Wall Street curiosities about American Telephone is the gap between the published comments is sued by brokerage concerns and the private views of some securities salesmen.

title: Positions of Goldberg and Samuels on Major State Issues Listed
description: While Arthur J. Goldberg and Howard J. Samuels have traveled the state for the past three months in their race for the Democratic nominations for the Democratic nomination for Governor in Tuesday's pri mary election, their respective headquarters in Manhattan have issued a series of position papers or programs de signed to show what kind of Governor each man would be.

title: Hussein Depending On Army To Hold Control
description: AMMAN, Jordan  There was the whisper of soft shoes on the polished floor, a shout of His Majesty  and the little man with the worried eyes slipped into the red velvet chair. It was King Hussein Ibn Talal, mon arch of Jordan, scion of an an cient Arab line, holding a palace press conference.

title: Author's Query
description: I am preparing a critical edi tion of Alfred Lord Tennyson's (180992) Gareth and Lynette and would like to know the whereabouts of the Butler proof sheets for this idyll.

title: CHANGE PROPOSED IN ELECTION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  A significant change in the plan for direct popular election of the President, designed to pro mote broader support, has been advanced by two members of the Senate Judiciary Com mittee.

title: Beame Criticizes Rise in Free Trips By City Employes
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame yesterday urged diligence and restraint in authorizing outof town travel expenses for city employes, which have in creased about 370 per cent since the 1966 budget.

title: Nancy Urquhart Knowlton Wed In Ardmore to G. K. Stevens
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 20 Miss Nancy Urquhart Knowl ton, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Peter Knowlton of Wynnewood, Pa., and Marion, Mass., was married here this afternoon to Gerard King Stevens, son of Mr. and Mrs. Almon G. Stevens of New London, N. H., and West brook, Conn. The Rev. Wil liam Faulds performed the ceremony.

title: M.I.T. Elects Woman To Board for 1st Time
description: The Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology has an nounced the election of the first woman to the corpora tion, or hoard of trustees, of the school. She is Mrs. Philip F. Wagley of Baltimore, a 1947 alumna of the Cam bridge, Mass., institution.

title: Such Good Friends
description: In the intensivecare unit of a New York City hospital, Richard Messinger, magazine artist, illustrator of children's books, husband of Julie and father of two young sons, lies in a deep coma. His trouble began with the removal of a mole, when an anesthetic sup posedly in general use appears to have caused what a spe cialist defines as a massive insult to his liver. He has now become a sort of medical playing field, or Exhibit A, or automatonwith all his God given orifices and a couple of manmade ones pierced, tapped or taped. He is also wired for sound. In this hospital, no one dies in peace and quiet: at the ultimate failure of the vital or gans, a siren blares throughout the buildingnot that fire has started, but fire has been put outand all the doctors come rushing to make sure it's real ly true.

title: Lora Elkinton, J. H. Miller 3d Wed in Jersey
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J. June 20Miss Lora McNeill Elkinton and John Hamilton Miller 3d were married here this afternoon in St. John's on the Mountain Episcopal Church. The Rev. James L. Johnson performed the cere mony.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Withdrawing From South Korea

title: SINGAPORE MOVES ON AIR POLLUTION
description: SINGAPORE, June 20 (UPI) This island republic off the coast of Malaysia is going to clean up its air even before it gets dirty.

title: Article 8  No Title
35 SHIELDS BOATS TO VIE FOR TITLE
description: The Shields OneDesign Class district championships of West ern Long Island will be held next Saturday and Sunday by Seawanhaka Yacht Club, with the courses set a mile west of Buoy 32A.

title: The Privileged Sanctuary of Conscience
description: WASHINGTON, June 20The Congress, the Supreme Court, and the Director of Selective Service have now all spoken on what beliefs or convictions should relieve a man from serv ing in the armed forces of the United States, but the result is such a tangle of conflicting views that even a draft board of judges, saints and philoso phers would scarcely know what to make of it.

title: To Water or Not That's the Question
description: ARE you planning to water the lawn this summer? Will it be worth the effort and cost? Some lawns in arid areas offer no choice, for without water the grass will not survive summer heat and drought. In other areas, while grass does not al ways die during a dry hot period, it may brown extensively.

title: Cynthia Brown Wed in Jersey
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 20 In the Westfield Presby terian Church tonight, Miss Cynthia Brown, who was graduated last month from Case Western Reserve Uni versity, became the bride of Theodore J. Bunt, a 1969 graduate of Case and a medi cal student at the University of Michigan.

title: Advertising:
description: A politician looks out across the country and sees, voters bunched together in Congressional or election Dis tricts. A marketing man has a much different view. To him those are all consumers out there and they live in households, each with its own buying power and life style.

title: Marlene Ann Becker To Be August Bride
description: ST. LOUIS, June 20Miss Marlene Ann Becker and George Kalman plan to be married here in August.

title: Parents Unhappy With Public Schools Find Alternative in Informal Classes
description: In an upstairs room of a West 88th Street brownstone that houses the Children's Corn munity Workshop School, or ganized by dissatisfied parents as an alternative to public school, an 11yearold boy in dulges his fascination with elec tronics by building a radio from cannibalized parts.

title: 20 Get SmokeOut Grants
description: RANDOLPH, Mass., June 20 (UPI)Twenty members of the graduating class at Randolph High School were presented Rotary Club scholarships on Wednesday out of the $3,000 raised last February during a classsponsored smokeout day. Smokers were asked to give up cigarettes for a day and donate the money saved to a scholarship fund.

title: 4,117 SmallBusiness Men Form Units to Hire Jobless
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)More than 4,000 small business men have formed joint organizations to hire and train disadvantaged jobless people under a program that has been used mostly by large corpora tions, Secretary of Labor George P. Shultz said Thursday.

title: PREDICTS VICTORY IN VOTING TUESDAY
description: Arthur J. Goldberg said yes terday that he thought he would win the Democratic nomination for Governor in Tuesday's primary but that he would face a very, very for midable campaign to defeat Governor Rockefeller in No vember.

title: ALASKA GOVERNOR ACTS ON OIL ROAD
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, June 20 Gov. Keith H. Miller of Alaska, frustrated thus far in his at tempts to promote construction of a road to the North Slope this year, has called a special session of the Legislature to consider what he believes to be an emergency situation.

title: A New Walk in Old Wales
description: ST. DAVID'S, WalesIt is uphill where I started. Up the steep lane out of Goodwick, by Fishguard. Up the path where rain drips from the hedges and the breath comes short and blackthorn is in bloom. Up on the headland where the meadows are near emerald green and black and white cows graze in sodden fields and a farm ers wife whose complexion is all peaches and cream confirms the direc tion.

title: REVOLUTION CITED IN MENTAL HEALTH
description: A social worker was shocked when she heard that her aide had stood up in court and stormed at a judge, You can't do this to our client!in reac tion to a sentence of a year in prison and $500 fine for shop lifting.

title: U.S., Despite First Loss, Leads World Bridge Play
description: STOCKHOLM, June 20The United States team suffered its first defeat in the 1970 world championship of bridge here to night, losing to Norway 5 to 15.

title: Dilibero Entry Places 1, 2 In $15,000 Suffolk Feature
description: BOSTON, June 20 (AP)The Celestine Dilibero entry of L'Aiglon and Lion Sleeps fin ished one, two today in the $15,000 Bread Winners purse as the 21 favorites at Suffolk Downs.

title: Jail for Bomber
description: After a rash of bombings and bombthreats last fall that threatened to make pe riodic evacuation of buildings a new life style for the New York office worker, the F.B.I. cracked what it called a bombing conspiracy headed by a 34yearold engineering technician named Samuel J. Melville. Arrested with sever al alleged accomplices, Mel ville pleaded guilty to charges of conspiring to bomb sev eral Manhattan skyscrapers.

title: Petition Planned for U.N. Accuses U.S. of Genocide
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. June 20Ossie Davis and Dic Gregory have joined with American Indian representa tives in a drive for a million signatures to a petition asking the United Nations to act against the United States under the convention against geno cide.

title: Nureyev  My Whole Body Bursts In Flames
description: WITH an insistence bordering on the obsessive, his eyes keep darting to the mirror. He scans the fluid line of his body, seek ing always a greater perfection of shape, contour and movement. He moves be fore the mirror like one possessed. The mirror, every dancer's aid and guide, becomes an incantatory object to Ru dolf Nureyev. Here in this rehearsal room beneath the mammoth stage of the Metropolitan Opera, Nureyev appraises himself, and there is that in bis eyes to suggest Narcissus lost in his own exquisite dream.

title: Humphrey: Yes on Senate; Maybe More
description: WASHINGTONThe principal question raised last week by Hubert Humphrey's return to the campaign trail was how the effervescent Minnesotan had been restrained for 18 whole months from announcing that he was back in business.

title: CHI CHENG TAKES 3 RACES ON COAST
description: ORANGE, Calif., June 20 (AP) Chi Cheng of Taiwan con tinued her assault on women's track records today as she won three events at the Orange County invitation meet. She smashed one American mark and equalled another.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: MANILA, June 20 (AP)  Er bito Salavarria of The Philip pines retained the Orient fly weight boxing championship to night by outpointing Witaya Plernjit of Thailand in 12 rounds.

title: MISS HAYNIE GAINS GOLF LEAD BY SHOT
description: HORSHAM, Pa., June 30 (AP) Sandra Haynie, a steady playing pro from Texas, took onestroke lead after two rounds today in the $25,000 George Washington Classic. She fin ished a fourunderpar round of 69 with a 40foot birdie putt on the 18th green.

title: Congo Hopes to Prevent Extinction of Rhinoceros
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, June 20 (AP)The Congo is now hopeful that she can save her native white rhinoceros.

title: Kim Richardson Wed to Navy Officer
description: RYE, N. Y., June 20Miss Kim Margaret Richardson, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Ralph William Richardson Jr., was married at the Presby terian Church here this eve ning to Lieut. (j.g.) Ronald Monroe Gates who is serving with the Coast Guard at Newport, R. I., where he is attending the Naval Justice School. The Rev. Joseph Bishop performed the cere mony.

title: REPORT ON DRUGS STIRS CANADIANS
description: OTTAWA, June 20  Many Canadians, especially the young, applauded today the LeDain Commission report recommend ing more liberal laws on drug use. Others termed it too permissive.

title: There's a Turbine in Boating Industry's Future
description: A look into the boating world of tomorrow indicates that though tomorrow will be great time for some things, the coating industry is going to have to wait for the day after tomorrow to make it all work efficiently.

title: Samuels for Arbitration Of Public Jobs Disputes
description: Howard J. Samuels said yes terday that he favored man datory binding arbitration in public employe disputes after collective bargaining fails.

title: Bust Placed on Stalin Grave Behind Lenin Mausoleum
description: MOSCOW, June 20 (AP)A bust of Stalin has been placed over his grave behind the Lenin Mausoleum in Red Square, an official said today.

title: ALMONER IS FIRST IN QUEEN'S PLATE
description: TORONTO, June 20 (AP) Almoner came from sixth place on the far turn and outbattled Franfreluche in the stretch for a threequarter length victory in the $88,300 Queen's Plate Stakes today.

title: FRIDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: WOODLAND HILLS, Calif. Hedgemon Lewis, 147 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Seve rio (Kid) Balboa, 145, Corpus Christi, Tex., 3 rounds.

title: Something Is Missing In the Primary System
description: In 1967, after 50 years of of intermittent debate, New York State scrapped its noisy conven tion system of selecting state wide candidates and adopted the primary election system, sup ported for so long by good gov ernment groups and newspaper editorials. The first full test of the primary law will be held on Tuesday when enrolled Demo crats choose their candidates for Governor, United States Senator and lesser offices.

title: FREEMAN IS AHEAD IN FINN CLASS SAIL
Lindsay Strengthens Position With Mayors at Denver Parley
description: DENVER  Mayor Lindsay Left the fiveday meeting of the United States Conference of Mayors here last Wednesday with a strengthened reputation in city halls around the coun try and his future in national politics, in the view of many Mayors, full of promise, but still several years off.

title: Mary Carney Bride of Leonard Panaggio
description: MIDDLETOWN, R. I., June 20Miss Mary Eleanore Car ney and Leonard Christian Panaggio were married here this afternoon in St. Lucy's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James P. Casey who also celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: RAILROAD IS USING DISPUTED SPRAY
description: The Penn Central said last week that it was clearing away weeds and shrubs along itsi New Haven Division rightof way with a spray that contains a chemical herbicide almost en tirely banned by the Pentagon in Vietnam.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: What  in these days of faltering retail businessis on the mind of the man whose hand is on the throttle of a $1billion chain?

title: Marshall in China
description: In December, 1945, President Harry S. Truman sent Gen. George C. Marshall on the most frustrating diplomatic mission in American his toryan attempt to bring the Chi nese Nationalists and Communists into peaceful agreement. The Com mists accused Marshall of aiding the Nationalists. The Nationalists re jected Marshall's suggestions for reform and negotiation and instead welcomed civil war to the finish. They lost.

title: Old Tales in New Picture Books
description: Penpoints scratch, typewriter keys clack, wheels turn, presses roll, and out tumbles another bunch of old reliables  Grimm, Andersen, Kip ling, Lear, et al.done up as picture books in 1970 for the entertainment and edification of the youth of 1984. Anything for them to remember when they get to placardbearing age?

title: FOREIGN STUDENTS AID FUND CAMPERS
description: Seven foreign students will be among the 200 young men and women Who will serve as staff members at the Fresh Air Fund's camping center near Fishkill, N. Y., this summer. The foreign students are from Ethiopia, Greece, Germany, Austria, the Netherlands, Eng Bridgeman of Barbados.

title: NECESSARY RISE IN IDLE PREDICTED
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 A member of the Federal Re serve Board predicted today that unemployment would rise further in the second half of this year but said that this should be accepted as neces sary if progress was to be made against inflation.

title: So You Thought Jazz Was Dead
description: IMAGINE first the ultimate jazz bar: a soulful, Sa royanesque House of Los ers, buried in some im possible location like the dockside warehouse district of Manhattan. Then imagine night in the city, with the fumes of rape, murder and mayhem rising from the pavement and the blocks lengthening into miles in the eerie urban silence. Then imagine yourself inside the Half Note, a famous jazz shrine down near the Hol land Tunnel, where the audi ence on a bad winter night consists of two birddog reg ulars, a neighborhood drunk slumped across the bar and maybe a pair of bronzed Texas loudmouths yelling at the sophisticated musicians, Lees dance!

title: Coast Guard Escorts Won't Accompany Fleet
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 20 There will be no Coast Guard vessel or patrol plane accompanying the Newport Bermuda race yachts this year. The Cruising Club of America sponsors did not re quest such assistance for two reasons, said Bill Robinson, secretary of the race com mittee.

title: Massachusetts Forfeits Titles Over Violations
description: AMHERST, Mass., June 20 (UPI)The University of Massachusetts has decided to forfeit its 1969.70 Yan kee Conference champion ships because it used inel igible players.

title: Bech: A Book
description: The hero of Beck: A Book is writer in trouble. In the midfifties Henry Bech's first novel brought him considerable reputation, especially among the young, but after that the books got worse and worse, until a severe artistic block formed. He remains a secondstring literary ce lebrity, in demand for campus lec tures and State Department tours, eminent enough to be elected to something like the American Acad emy of Arts and Letters; but he's well aware how small a career it's been, and his professional frustra tions have disturbingly merged with the philosophical and sexual anxieties of creeping middle age. This very funny and oddly moving book is in a way John Updike's revenge upon the circumstances of his calling, the silken mechanism whereby America reduces her writers to imbecility and cozenage, as Henry Bech is made to put it.

title: Canada Is Charged With Downgrading Seaway Operations
description: TORONTO, June 20 (AP) The St. Lawrence Seaway has been downgraded by the Cana dian Government and now faces extinction in competition with overland transportation and giant jet aircraft, the Inter national Association of Great Lakes Ports was told this week.

description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., June 20Plymouth's Barra cuda, holding last place in the point standing of the Trans American championship for small sedans, made a strong bid today to challenge the su premacy of Mustang and Jave lin.

description: DETROIT, June 20The top bargainers for the auto indus try warn that foreign competi tion threatens the jobs of American workers and must be considered in this year's labor contract talks.

Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Brown of Roslyn Estates and Fire Island Pines, are the bride's parents. Her father k an executive vice president of Cinderelle Knitting Mills. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Palin Archer of Greenville, N. Y. His father is an artist and owner of the Greenville Gallery.

title: On Understanding Black Art
description: THE shuttle plane from New York made Its last run around the greater Boston area, then locked itself into a straight line and, for what seemed like hours, flew lower and lower toward Logan Field. The scrunch of the tires brought me back to the real ity of my sitting on that plane at this time, and in this place.

description: CLEVELAND, June 20Vice President Agnew accused eight of President Nixon's most out spoken antiwar critics tonight of prescribing surrender to achieve peace in Indochina.

title: Fire Delays 7th Ave. IRT
description: Traffic on the IRTSeventh Avenue line was delayed for nearly an hour just after noon yesterday, after a train caught fire near the 103 StreetBroad way stop. The fire, apparently caused by a brake shoe's com ing in contact with the third rail, was quickly extinguished and the passengers were evac uated. Two of them were treated for smoke inhalation. During the disruption, north bound traffic on the line was terminated at Times Square.

Javits, Republican of New York, and nine other Senators. The fee would be redeemable upon delivery of the car by its last owner to an authorized processor of scrap metal.

title: Cambodia: Communist Pressure Steadily Growing

The Cambodians are fast begin ning to realize this.

description: WASHINGTON, June 20One day this yearit may already have gone by unnoticedthe United States passes a major social and political turning point.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: IN his senior year at college, Nor man found himself with an un finished thesis and a deadline only two days away. NoDoz pried his eyes open, but his brain seemed to turn to rubber after hours of typing. So his slightly overweight girl friend came up with some little yellow diet pills, 10 milligrams apiece. With the first pill, Norman's mind clicked into gear and his fin gers pattered over the keyboard as intricate insights streamed out of his head. After 10 hours he took break and cleaned out all the draw ers of his desk, arranged the pens and pencils in precise parallels, and stacked all his books so that the bottom corners were exactly even. Then he slid the pile so it coincided perfectly with the right angle at the corner of his desk. He stared at the pile for 20 minutes. Then he popped another pill, whistled through 10 more hours of typing and polished up the conclusion of his thesis with some more rather arcane insights. Norman drank half a quart of or ange juice, emptied the icebox, and cleaned out all the shelves. Then he retyped some earlier pages which dirty eraser had smudged, called up his girl and chattered gaily for 40 minutes. Then Norman passed out for 10 hours with dreams of an A in his head. He got a Bplus.

title: The Davis Case: Issue of Academic Freedom?
description: LOS ANGELES  There was little doubt about what action the California Board of Regents would take in the Angela Davis case as its members assembled here last week for a two  day meeting. Miss Davis, a young, black Communist party member, would lose her job as acting as sistant professor of philosophy at the University of California at Los Angeles.

title: Jews in 25 Nations Were Aided in '69 By Joint Committee

description: City work crews rushed re pairs yesterday on a 25foot gap in the middle of the inter section of 42d Street and Third Avenue. The gap resulted from a break in a 100yearold water main Friday night.

description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)For about a year now, the red, white and blue mail drops on the street corners of America have been turning blue.

description: I was encouraged by President Nixon's economic message and feel his threestep plan to deal with inflation was a move in the right direction, but I think he didn't go far enough.

Paterson for Lieutenant Governor. The news paper said Mr. Paterson has proved himself a diligent Sena tor and that he has a grasp of ctate iscileg.

description: ATHENS, June 21 Arche ologists from the American School of Classical Studies, led by Prof. Leslie Shear of Prince ton University, have unearthed in the ancient marketplace of Athens the place where the trial of Socrates was held.

title: Article 6  No Title

description: BREMERTON, Wash., June 21 (UPI)The U.S.S. Hornet, the aircraft carrier that re covered the Apollo 11 and Apollo 12 astronauts on their return from the moon, will he decommissioned Friday at the Puget Sound Naval Shipyard. The Hornet was commissioned at Newport News, Va., in 1943 and saw action in the Pacific in 1944.

title: Rabbis Teach, Catholics Learn at Seton Hall Institute
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., June 21Rabbi Jules Har low stood over the lunch table, holding a plastic cup of wine and reciting the kid dush, the prayer that Jews have said before the sabbath meal since ancient times. He then broke a loaf of chala and passed out pieces to Ro man Catholic sisters in flow ing habits who closely fol lowed the bearded rabbi's every motion.

title: U.S. JETS BOMBING CAMBODIAN TRAILS ON DEEPER RAID
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21  Reliable military sources disclosed today that United States fighterbombers and gun ships, which have been restrict ed to flying a maximum of 21.7 miles into Cambodia in support of ground operations, have been ranging much deeper into northeast Cambodia for nearly two months in raids on new enemy infiltration routes.

title: Dr. Austin Weisberger, 56, Cleveland Medical Leader
description: CLEVELAND, June 21Dr. Austin S. Weisberger, chairman of the department of medicine at the Case Western Reserve School of Medicine and Uni versity Hospitals of Cleveland since 1965, died of a heart at tack while driving in San Mateo, Calif., Saturday.

title: Fulbright Seeks a Ceiling On Pentagon Propaganda
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) Senator J. W. Fulbright called today for a 75 per cent reduc tion in Pentagon spending for public relations and charged the Defense Department has understated the growth of its propaganda apparatus.

title: Modern Tory Cabinet
description: Edward Heath has selected his Cabinet largely from his own kind of British Conservative. This means that, although the Cabinet represents a large measure of continuity from previous Conservative Governments, most of the key Ministers symbolize modern Toryism. Iain Macleod, Reginald Maudling, Robert Carr, like Mr. Heath, are pragmatic, practical, flexible men, indif ferent to ideology and dogma.

description: Heated facetoface argu ments among the four candi dates for the Democratic nom ination for Senator broke out yesterday during and after their nexttolast television de bate of the campaign.

Licht, was married here this afternoon to Alfred Lawrence Schreiber, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Schreiber of Hollis, Queens. Rabbi Albert G. Silverman performed the ceremony at the Licht home.

But it leaves virtually unchanged the threat of service shutdown before the end of this month many of the 1.3 million apartments under the 1943 rent control law.

description: The City Council's housing chairman said yesterday that he wanted to put teeth into the pending rent control revi sion to make sure that a ma jor proportion of any rent raises would go into mainte nance, decoration and repair.

description: CHICAGO, June 21The an nual convention of the Ameri can Medical Association opened in confusion today as protest groups of blacks, consumers and the poor forced the dele gates into a closed meeting guarded by private policemen.

title: Soviet Honors Poet Who Quit as Editor
description: MOSCOW, June 21The Sov iet Government and the official literary establishment have marked the 60th birthday today of Aleksandr T. Tvardovsky with warm praise for his poetry but not a word about his res ignation of the editorship of the liberal journal Novy Mir.

title: Expos Top Pirates, 32
description: PITTSBURGH, June 21 (AP) John Bateman's tiebreaking single in the fifth inning and the strong pitching of Rich Nye gave the Montreal Expos a 32 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates today. The game was delayed 52 minutes by rain in the sixth inning.

description: KANSAS CITY, June 21 (AP) Harmon Killebrew hit his 17th home run as the Minne sota Twins scored an 112 tri umph over the Kansas City Royals today.

description: BOSTON, June 21In a 4 hour thriller that bore a striking resemblance to the Boston Marathon, the New York Yan kees scored six runs in the 11th inning today to defeat the Red Sox, 1410.

title: Small Step on Oil Spills

And it may serve as a precedent elsewhere.

title: World's Political Prisoners Believed to Exceed 250,000
description: LONDON, June 21 (Reuters) There may he more than a quarter of a million prisoners of conscience in jails through out the world, according to a report released today by the British section of Amnesty In ternational, an organization founded in 1961 to assist such prisoners.

description: CAIRO, June 21Can Doris Day and Walter Winchell, Lu cille Ball and Dr. Ben Casey triumph over sternfaced and daring Bulgarian intelligence agents, Soviet guerrillas, Hun garian criminal investigators and the Bolshoi Ballet?

The session represents the first class activity at. Kent State since four students were killed May 4 by National Guardsmen. description: HARTFORD, June 21Twen ty years from now people will still be talking about the 1970 Republican convention, a tired politician said as he walked out of Bushnell Memorial Auditori um at 4 o'clock this morning.

description: The board of directors of Na tional Educational Television will submit its views on a con solidation of N.E.T. and WNDT with the board of Channel 13 at a meeting on Wednesday. The N.E.T. board met on Satur day.

title: Article 1  No Title

title: Personal Finance

title: Fewer Soviet Sorties in U.A.R. Reported

June 21To judge by the array of Nashville based performers who were heard at the threeday Country Music Festival that concluded last night at the Garden State Arts Center, the most popular song in Nashville nowadays is would you believe it?Dan ny Boy. It was performed three times during the festival sung by a trumpet player, wailed out by a steel guitarist and harmonized by a male trio.

title: Dougal, an English Sealyham, Judged Best on Staten Island

title: Miss Devlin's Supporters Clash With Ulster Police
description: STRAHANE, Northern Ire land, June 21 (Reuters)Police men wielding clubs charged a crowd today after a celebra tion of Miss Bernadette Devlin's reelection to Parliament turned to stonethrowing.

title: Servan  Schreiber Leads in French Vote

title: D. J. Bird Weds Miss Chandler
description: GUYENCOURT, Del., June 21  The marriage of Miss Alpine Douglas Chandler to Donald James Bird took place here today at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred DuPont Chandler, grandpar ents of the bride. The Very Rev. John N. Peabody, Dean of the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Balti more, performed the cere mony.

description: BALTIMORE, June 21 (AP) Dave McNally registered his 100th career victory today as the Baltimore Orioles complet ed a fourgame sweep of the Washington Senators, 42.

title: Three Women Lawyers in Major League of the Legal Profession
description: Dozens of major Wall Street law firms have a lot in commonoffices in the financial district, corporate giants as clients, scores of lawyers with degrees from the best schools, and not a few partners whose annual income is in six figures.

title: SCHOOL GETS GRANT FOR HEALTH COURSE
description: A grant to assist the na tion's first collegedegree pro gram to train a new category of health professionals, the physician's assistant, will be announced today by the Com monwealth Fund, a locally based philanthropic foundation.

title: DYNAMITE IS SEIZED BY MONTREAL POLICE
description: MONTREAL, June 21 (AP) The police seized more than. 650 pounds of dynamite and arrested six persons in the Montreal suburb of Laval and the Laurentian city of Prevost, 30 miles north of Montreal, to day.

title: Federal Report on Liability Covers 80 Million Cars
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 About 20 per cent ot the country's 80 million private passenger automobiles are not covered by liability insurance, according to a Department of Transportation study.

title: GIANTS TRIUMPH OVER PADRES, 72
description: SAN DIEGO, June 21 (AP) Hal Lanier singled home the lead run in the sixth inning and started a threerun eighth with a double as the San Fran cisco Giants whipped the, San Diego Padres today, 72.

title: J. F. Wise Marries Lesly Spitzer
description: Miss Lesly Ellen Spitzer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Emanuel J. Spitzer of New Rochelle, N.Y., was married here yesterday to Jonathan Franklin Wise, son of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Wise, also of New Rochelle.

title: GUTHREZ GETS 7 STRAIGHT HITS
description: CLEVELAND, June 21 (AP) Cesar Gutierrez, Detroit's short stop, became today the first Player in modern major league history to get seven consecu tive hits in one game as the Tigers beat Cleveland, 98, in the second game of a double header on Mickey Stanley's 12thinning homer. Gutierrez had six singles and a double.

title: The Primary's Stakes
description: Richard Max McCarthy, one of the four candidates for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator, was shaving in his hotel room last Friday before a night of speeches. Someone asked whether there were any issues that were not being discussed in this campaign.

title: Chiefs Sign 3 Draft Picks
description: KANSAS CITY, June 21 (AP) The signing of three draft choices was announced today by the Kansas City Chiefs. They are Billy Bob Barnett, Texas A. and M. defensive end; Fred Barry, Boston University cor nerback, and Glenn Dumont, American International running back.

title: Study Shows Increased Deaths Among Youths Sniffing Solvents
description: The practice of sniffing chemical solvents for kicks has stopped the hearts of and killed at least 110 American youths in the last decade, and deaths as a result of the prac tice are rising sharply, a medi cal study shows.

title: Soviet Said to Arrest 20 In Plot to Hijack a Plane
description: MOSCOW, June 21Twenty persons were reported today to have been arrested in Lenin grad in what the Soviet au thorities have called an attempt to seize a Soviet airliner.

title: RUSSIAN SAYS SOYUZ LEFT SOME DOUBTS
description: MOSCOW, June 21 (UPI)A Russian space commentator said today that the record breaking flight of Soyuz 9 may not have answered all the questions puzzling scientists about man's ability to endure prolonged periods in space.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Pills for the Diabetic: Dilemma for Doctors
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  Doctors who treat more than a million adults with mild dia betes face a problem this sum mer that most cannot solve independently.

title: 135 Seized in Drug Raids Here and in 9 Other Cities
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  Federal agents staged what they described as the largest nationwide narcotics raids in history last night and today, arresting 135 persons and seiz ing heroin and cocaine valued at about $2.5million on the retail market.

title: Agnew, in Between His Fiery Banquet Speeches, Maintains a LowKey Style
description: CLEVELAND, June 21  The man who came to dinner here last night to arouse the pas sions of 1,400 listeners and nearly as many demonstrators left in the rain today without a peep and with scarcely spectator.

title: Pope Proclaims a Martyr the First Croat Saint
description: ROME, June 21  Pope Paul VI today proclaimed the first Croat saint, a 14thcentury martyr in the Holy Land, and deplored in a eulogy what he called the modern world's pref erence for fashion over faith.

title: Rindt Wins Dutch Grand Prix
description: ZANDVOORT, The Nether lands, June 21 (AP)  Jochen Rindt of Austria drove a Lotus to victory today in the Dutch Grand Prix, which was marred by the fatal crash of Piers Courage of Britain.

title: REDS AND DODGERS DIVIDE 93 GAMES
description: CINCINNATI, June 21 (AP) Johnny Bench drove in four runs today with a double and his 24th homer and Wayne Simpson breezed to Ms 10th victory as the Cincinnati Reds beat Los Angeles, 93, for a split of their doubleheader.

title: Jacklin Captures U. S. Open Golf Title by 7 Strokes With Final 70 for 281
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 21 Tony Jacklin won the United States Open golf championship today and became the first Eng lishman to do so in 50 years. I'm proud to be an English man,said the smiling 25year old British Open titleholder after sinking a 35foot putt for a birdie that gave him a seven stroke margin.

title: PRESIDIO ALTERS STOCKADE IMAGI
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 21 The stockade here at the Pre sidio of San Francisco is old and small and hidden on a fog shrouded hill in the shadow of the Golden Gate Bridge.

title: Inflation Tops the Tory Agenda in Britain
description: LONDON, June 21Inflation is the No. 1 problem facing Britain's new Conservative gov ernment, and a voluntary in comes policy is expected to be instituted in an effort to cur tail the wageprice spiral.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for the week follows:

title: Braves Win, Aaron Hits 2
LAYER TO DEFEND WIMBLEDON TITLE
description: LONDON, June 21It would be absurd not to pick Rod Laver and highly disputable to favor Mrs. Billie Jean King over Mrs. Margaret Court as play opens tomorrow in one of the world's great sport spectacles on the lawns of the AllEngland Lawn Tennis club at Wimbledon.

title: Relief Supplies for Peru Stranded in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, June 21 (AP)  More than 220,000 pounds of relief supplies donated for Peruvian earthquake victims sat in an airport hangar here today as volunteer workers sought for transportation to deliver it.

title: Donohue Drives Javelin to TransAm Victory by 2 Laps
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. L, June 21Roaring over rainslicked surfaces at an average speed of 90.55 miles an hour, Mark Donohue of Media, Pa., drove his red, white and blue Javelin to its first triumph in the Sports Car Club of America's trans American series.

title: Stephen Muskie Weds Miss Alexis Droggitis
description: KENNEBUNK, Me., June 21  Miss Alexis Droggitis and Stephen O. Muskie, son of Senator and Mrs. Edmund S. Muskie, were married this afternoon on the lawn of the Muskies' summer home here, near the Webhannet Golf Club, where the reception was held afterward.

title: State Spending Said to Top Revenues by $600Million
description: ALBANY, June 21State Controller Arthur Levitt re ported today that state spend ing had exceeded revenues by nearly $600million a year for the last five years, with the budget balanced only by bor rowing for construction.

title: Goodrich Accord Reached
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 21 (UPI) A threeyear contract with the B. F. Goodrich Company was ratified today by 4,500 members of Local 5 of the United Rubber Workers Union. The contract calls for a raise of 82 cents an hour over three years. Members of Local 5 went on strike May 6 after having worked on a daytoday basis since their contract ex pired at midnight, April 19. They returned to work last week, when a tentative agree ment was reached.

title: FURTHER DIP SEEN FOR BOND YIELDS
description: Interest rates hit a peak early last week and then declined in the face of an unusually large volume of new bond issues for sale. As a result, investment bankers expect yields to move down further this week.

title: District Attorneys Elect
description: Robert R. Meehan, the Dis trict Attorney of Rockland County and a candidate for the Democratic nomination for State Attorney General, was elected president of the New York State District Attorneys Association at the group's sum mer convimnon. Mr. Meehan succeeds Joseph Toracca, Dis trict Altorney of Ulster County.,

title: New York A.C. Oarsmen Take Triad Event in Rain
description: PITTSBURGH, June 21 (AP) The New York Athletic Club senior eightoar shell won the third annual Triad rowing re gatta over rough water on the Allegheny River today.

title: 4TH WEEK OF RAIDS BY ISRAELIS BEGINS
description: TEL AVIV, June 21 (Reuters) Israeli aircraft today began their fourth week of intensive raids in the Suez Canal area with intermittent strikes against Egyptian targets there through out the day, an army spokes man said here.

title: Revue on Israel Is Set For Opening in the Fall
description: To Be or Not to Be What Kind of a Question is That?, a revue reflecting presentday Israel, will have its premiere Oct. 13 at the BarbizonPlaza Theater. Pre sented by Henry Goldgran and Arthur V. Briskin, it will run for five weeks before going on a national tour.

title: DR. CECIL ROTH, 71, HISTORIAN, IS DEAD
description: JERUSALEM, June 21 (AP) Dr. Cecil Roth, noted authority on Jewish history, died of can cer today in Hadassah Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived here and at the Oliver Crom well Hotel in New York.

title: Town Washington Knew Resists Pollution
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa.This wayside hamlet on the west ern fringe of Philadelphia is little larger than it was two centuries ago when the Hes sians crossed the Brandywine here and helped Gen. William Howe crush George Washing ton's Continentals. The swift stream still courses through a countryside that is rolling, wooded and sparsely pop ulated U. S. 1 now provides a free crossing where the ferryman, John Chad, charged four pence for every horse and rider in Rev olutionary days.

title: Chess
description: Sharp on all four boards, Bayside High School scored 204 to win the Spring, 1970, Interscholastic Chess League Senior High School Team Tour nament. The results: Board One, Nicholas Ocipoff, 4 1; Board Two, Alex Oci poff, 51; Board Three, Rich ard Wentzler, 51, and Board Four, Steve Sherbel, 5.

title: Golf His Cup of Tea
description: The first Englishman to hold the British and United States Open golf champion ships concurrently is a 25 yearold perfectionist whose main problem on the tourna ment tour is boredom.

title: U. S. Plans to Redirect Aid to Poor in Appalachia
description: CHARLESTON, Va., June 20 Five years and several bil lion dollars later, the Govern ment officials who manage the Appalachian economic recov ery effort initiated by Presi dent Kennedy have decided that the time has come to reach the people.

title: Police Here Are Silent on Guardians' Charges
