description: Federal and county law en forcement officials here said yesterday that they would will ingly investigate charges of brutality committed against arrested persons in station houses if they were asked by the Guardians' Association to do so.

title: CHURCHMEN PLAN ALLFAITH PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  The National Council of Churches, a federation of Prot estant and Eastern Orthodox denominations, agreed here today to call a National Ecu menical Consultation that would include Roman Catholics, Southern Baptists and other evangelical churches.

title: NONTARIFF BAR TO TRADE LOOMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21By what appears to be a classic process, the United States may be slipping into erecting a major new nontariff barrier to trade.

title: FEEDER SHIP LINES FACE DIM FUTURE
description: A limited future for container feeder ships in United States waters is being predicted by an official Government study.

title: CANADA's BROKERS BACK NATIONALISM
description: TORONTO, June 21A com mittee of securities industry leaders has embraced the es sential arguments of Canada's leftish economic nationalists with respect to the undesirabil ity of foreign ownership.

title: CARDS TURN BACK CUBS BY 30, 32
description: CHICAGO, June 21 (AP)  Steve Carlton hurled a sixhit shutout in the opener and Joe Torre slugged a tiebreaking homer in the eighth inning of the second game today as the St. Louis Cardinals captured a doubleheader from the Chicago Cubs, 30, 32.

title: Wild Marijuana Is Target
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI)  The Federal Govern ment announced a pilot project today aimed at the voluntary eradication of wild marijuana in 20 counties of 10 Midwest states before illicit traffickers can harvest it.

title: PALAFOX IS VICTOR IN EASTERN TENNIS
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 21Tony Palafox, seeded second, and Jon Buchman, fourth, won two matches apiece to reach the fourth round of the Eastern men's claycourt tennis championship at the Port Washington Tennis Academy today. The matches were moved indoors because of rain.

title: L. I. GOLF TITLE GOES TO MURPHY
description: EAST WILLISTON, L.I., June 21As Bob Murphy, his orange shirt and blue slacks rain drenched, walked onto the pa tio of the Wheatley Hills Golf Club today, he was handed a telegram.

title: Minor Leagues
description: INTERNATIONAL LEAGUE

title: STEEL USE KEEPS PACE WITH OUTPUT
description: PITTSBURGH, June 21 Steel users have been consum ing metal as fast as it has been coming in.

title: International Pact On Patents Ready
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A patent cooperation treaty, de signed to save paperwork and expenses in patenting the same invention in a number of coun tries, has been concluded here, subject to ratification by the participating governments.

title: Miss Minetto, Happy Daze Gain Honors at Horse Show
description: RIVER VALE, N.J., June 21 Happy Daze, with Mindy Mi netto riding, piled up 13 points with a victory, two seconds and a third today to win the junior working hunter cham pionship at the Holiday Farm Horse Show.

title: Four of Hussein's Children Sent to Safety in London
description: LONDON, June 21 (AP)  King Hussein of Jordan has sent his four youngest children to safety in London, but diplo matic sources today discounted any political significance in the move.

title: Article 3  No Title
Penn Central's Announcement
description: The Board of Directors of Penn Central Transportation Company issued the following statement yesterday:

title: MARINE CONVICTED IN CIVILIAN DEATHS
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, June 21A 21yearold marine was convicted of premeditated murder today in the fatal shoot ing of 12 Vietnamese civilians during a patrol on Feb. 19. He was sentenced to life imprison ment at hard labor.

title: First Day of Summer Is Wet, Gray and Long
description: Summer came to the north ern hemisphere at 3:43 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time yes terday, butin the New York metropolitan area, at least the weather didn't match the calendar.

title: A Florentine Who Designs Own Fabrics
description: It's almost inevitable that Paola Davitti be compared with Emilio Pucci and she manages to smile brightly while the analogies are made. They are both from Florence, Italy; they are both fashion designers and the specialty In each case is printed silk jersey fabric.

title: ROBERT NAGY SINGS THOUGHTFUL CANIO
description: Robert Nagy, for many years a comprimario with the Met, emerged from the relatively obscurity of Messengers, Her alds, and Faithful Companions Saturday night to sing the lead ing role of Canio in Pagliacci. The promotion was on the whole a well deserved one for Mr. Nagy gave a thoughtful, in telligent performance.

title: SPINDLETOP TAKES FAIRFIELD CROWN
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 21 Spindletop Showdown, the defending national high point champion, won his fourth con secutive title this seasonbut in a close squeaktoday as the Fairfield County Horse Show closed its fourday run at the Fairfield County Hunt Club.

title: Ens. Charles Roberts Lamson Weds Alberta Ann Wangeman
description: At the Marble Collegiate Church yesterday afternoon, Miss Alberta Ann Wange man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank George Wange man of New York and Quaker Hill, N.Y., was mar ried to Ens. Charles Roberts Lamson, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Otis Floyd Lamson Jr. of Mercer Island, Wash.

title: Jacklin Wins Open; Brazil Soccervicim
description: Tony Jacklin, a 25yearold pro, won the United States Open championship yesterday with a 72hole total of 281 at the Hazeltine National Golf Course in Chaska, Minn. Jack lin, who won the British Open last year, is the first English man to win the United States Open since Ted Ray in 1920.

title: Mets' Records
Lefkowitz Warns P.S.C .of Suit Over Increase in Phone Rates
description: The state's Attorney General declared yesterday that he would sue the state's Public Service Commission if it ap proved a telephone rate in crease without some restora tion of service to which the people are entitled.

title: M'GOVERN DECRIES ACTIONS OF AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The conduct of Vice Presi dent Agnew has been disgrace ful, divisive and damaging, Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: WHITTELSEY'S SLOOP WINS 3D RACE IN ROW
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 21 Souther (Chick) Whittelsey, at the helm of his Luders16 Class sloop, Interlude, won his third straight Yatch Racing As sociation race today when the Indian Harbor Y. C. conducted the season's 13th regatta for Connecticut area Y.R.A. fleets based east of Rye. Interlude triumphed by 34 seconds over a 7.5mile triangle in an 8to 10knot eastnortheast breeze.

title: Paris: The Label of Expressionism
description: PARISIf ever an exhibi tion demonstrated the dan gerous vanity of labels, it is the one currently at the Muscle d'Art Moderne, under the titillating title European Expressionism. The core of the show is provided by two generations of Germanand, accessorily, Beneluxartist whom history ians, patriots and art dealers have for exalt above to exalt above localinter est status. That they have not quite succeeded is ob vious from the fact that the show is ameliorated with an assortment of such major figures as Matisse, Dufy, Chagall, Kandinsky, Mir Drain, Mondrian, etc., de signed to make the visit worthwhile and also, one suspects, in the hope that some of their mastery may rub off on their less brilliant neighbors.

title: Aide to Eisenhower To Teach at Rutgers
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 21  Emmet John Hughes, a journalist, au thor and former Presiden tial adviser, will join the fac ulty of Rutgers University in September as a professor of political science in the Eagle ton Institute of Politics.

title: Walker First at Monza
description: MONZA, Italy, June 21 (Reu ters)Mike Walker of Britain, driving a 5,000 cc McLaren, won the twoheat, 205mile Grand Prix aP Monza today with an aggregate time of 1 hour 1 minute 6.1 seconds.

title: Dann Quits C.B.S. for Public TV
description: Michael H. Dann, one of the most prominent, highly paid executives in commercial tele vision, has resigned as senior vice president of programing for the Columbia Broadcasting System to ally himself with noncommercial public broad casting.

title: Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Article 5  No Title
Protestant Leaders Here Drop Unified Social Action
description: The Protestant leadership of New York City has quietly con ceded defeat on a highly pub licized effort to bring religious, agencies and community, groups together for a coor dinated drive on poverty and other social problems.

title: Roosevelt Entries
Saigon Paper Says Situation In Cambodia Seems Sour
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, June 22 (Reuters) The Vietnam Guardian, an Englishlanguage newspaper, warned in an editorial today that following initial military successes things seem to have turned sour in Cambodia.

title: BALTIMORE DATA IN INQUIRY MOUNT
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  Reliable sources have supplied more information about the re port made by a Baltimore grand jury that investigated alleged attempts by a contractor to de fraud the Government.

title: Conditions in Fort Dix Stockade Found Improved Year After Critical Report on Mess Hall's Sanitation
description: FORT DIX, N. J.Mice were observed in the dish washing area.

title: MICHAEL TOTH, 14, IN RECITAL DEBUT
description: Saturday afternoon, when some ninthgraders hereabout were out celebrating the end of school with picnics and little league games, Michael Toth was at Carnegie Recital Hall, making his New York debut. The 14yearold pianist from Glenside, Pa., wisely avoided the most common prodigy trap by choosing comparatively un complicated music that over reached neither his technical equipment nor his emotional understanding.

title: Student Weds Elena Alpher
description: REVERE, Mass., June 21 Miss Elena Frances Alpher, daughter of Mrs. Theodore Ruhinovitz of Marblehead, was married in St. Anthony's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon to Peter Leh man Wise. He is the son of Mrs. Hilda Lehman Wise of New York and grandson of Mrs. Herbert H. Lehman of New York and the late Gov ernor Lehman of New York. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Guido Pillato.

title: Barbecue Accident Fatal
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., June 21A 47yearold art repre sentative died last night of burns suffered six days ago when a can of alcohol he was using to light a backyard barbecue exploded in his hands. Willard Neeley of 137 Carpenter Avenue, Sea Cliff, had been under care at the Nassau County Medical Center here since the accident June 14.

title: Chiovari and Stack Capture Masters Doubles Handball
description: Chiovari and Stack Capture Masters Doubles Handball

title: UNREST MOUNTING IN COAL INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Serious grievances are mount ing in the coal industry, in creasing the likelihood of a dis ruption of the nation's critically short supply of coala factor in the power brownouts fore cast for this summer.

title: Hirsch's Dynamite Finishes First in Bayside Y.C. Race
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., June 21 Jack Hirsch's Dynamite, a new 45foot Whitby built sloop, was the apparent winner of Bayside, Yacht Club's 17th annual point nopoint cruising race today.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Robert C. Bitting Jr., has been promoted to staff vice president, Selectavision busi ness development, RCA Cor poration.

title: Crews Faces Challenge in Brooklyn
description: John R. Crews, who has led the Brooklyn Republican organ ization for 36 years, faces a strong challenge to his leader ship in tomorrow's primary, but is generally expected to win an other term if he decides to seek it.

title: Seldom Seen Aides Protect Nixon's Political Flank
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 Until the abrupt resignation of one of their number several weeks ago, they were known to outsiders as Haldeman's Four Horsemen  a versatile, sea soned, and aggressive quartet of White House advisers tech nically attached to H. R. Halde man, President Nixon's chief of staff.

title: Saudis Send Yemen Food To Tide Her Over Famine
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, June 21Saudi Arabia has sent a consignment of food to the neighboring republic of Yemen to tide her over a severe famine, according to the Sana radio.

title: When Belief Is Hollow
description: LONDON  A young man writes from America. In his last year at a college in the Middle West he did some part time teaching. He had an ex perience that he still cannot altogether understand, that he cannot forget.

title: SEOUL FEARS U.S. WILL CURB TRADE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 19We owe much to America and we acknowledge that debt, a Korean Government official said. But we cannot go along with you on your plans to re strict our textile exports. For us, textile exports are almost a matter of life or death.

title: ABRAHAM UMANSKY, ORTHOPEDIST, DIES
description: Dr. Abraham L. Umansky, an orthopedic surgeon at the Hos pital for Joint Diseases, died yesterday at Beth Israel Hos pital of a heart attack. He was 53 years old and lived at 92 Verdun Avenue, New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: PENN CENTRAL IS GRANTED AUTHORITY TO REORGANIZE UNDER BANKRUPTCY LAWS
description: The Penn Central Transporta tion Company, which operates the country's largest railroad system, told a Federal judge yesterday that it could not pay its bills and was granted its pe tition for reorganization under the bankruptcy laws.

title: IRANIANS HIJACK JET TO IRAQ FOR ASYLUM
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 21 Three Iranians seeking politi cal asylum in Iraq today hi jacked an Iranian airliner with 91 passengers aboard on a flight from Teheran to Abadan and forced the pilot to fly to Baghdad.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Monday, June 22, 1970

title: Pomp and Pageantry Mark Queen's Stakes
description: TORONTO, June 21That's right lovey, stand tall, cried one of the 32,000 spectators at the Woodbine race course here yesterday as the slim, erect figure in striped trou sers, morning coat and gray top hat walked across the red carpet laid over the dirt track.

title: CITY AIDE REGRETS POLACKS COMMENT
description: The chairman of the New York City Human Rights Com mission apologized yesterday for having innocently and in advertently used the word Polacks to refer to Polish Americans during a television discussion.

title: Senatorial Candidates Get Wifely Aid
description: Behind each of the four Dem ocratic aspirants to the Senate stands a womanon a subway platform, on a soapbox, at a switchboard, or simply in a liv ing room with a cup of coffee in her handtalking and talk ing and talking.

title: Pagels, With 3 Firsts, Wins Great South Bay Laurels
description: MORICHES, L.I., June 21 William Pagels of the Wet Pants Association had two firsts and a secondplace fin ish today to easily capture the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's men's champion ship. The new champion's over all score showed three firsts, three seconds and a third for the sevenrace roundrobin se ries sailed in Mobjacks.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A small boy once asked Alvin Dark for his auto graph at the Polo Grounds and the Giant shortstop said, Take a hike, son, take a hike. The Alvin Darks are always telling this to small boys, who often sob it out to their fathers, who sometimes write letters to the editor. But this small boy grew and grew, learned to throw a knuckleball from instructions on the back of a cereal box, discovered a hopping fastball, became a Yankee, lost the fastball and remembered the knuckleball just as he was going down for the third time. He came back as a relief pitcher and he talked out a book called Ball Four (World, $6.95) which says, come here, come here to all the small boys, but ultimately concludes, I guess to really like base ball as a fan you've got to have some Richard Nixon in you.

title: Medical School Will Train Maintenance Men
description: The Mount Sinai School of Medicine has won a state grant to train prospective building superintendents in housing maintenance on the ground that good housing is basic to good hearth.

title: Tank Car Explosions Ravage Third of Illinois Town
description: CRESCENT CITY, Ill., June 21 (AP)A freight train pulling tank cars of compressed butane gas derailed today, setting off explosions and fires that raged across a third of this town and destroyed half its business dis trict.

title: M'CRACKEN PREDICTS A NEW JOBLESS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Paul W. McCracken, Presi dent Nixon's chief economic ad viser, predicted today that un employment would get worse before it got better.

title: Sukarno's Body Viewed by Thousands
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, June 21Indonesians by the tens of thousands streamed into a mansion on the outskirts of this capital today for a last look at the oncefiery politician who led them to independence.

title: Grace to Quit Seat At Marine Midland
description: J. Peter Grace, president and chief executive of W. R. Grace & Co., a major chemical pro ducer, has informed the Fed eral Reserve thatunder pro test  he plans to resign promptly as a director of Marine Midland Banks, Inc.

title: From New York to Sao Paulo: Delighted Brazilians Samba in the Streets
description: New York's tiny Brazilian colony, vibrating sympatheti cally to the ecstasy of its countrymen far to the south, enlivened the midtown streets yesterday in a spontaneous sambadancing, trafficstop ping celebration of its na tion's triumph in the World Cup soccer series.

title: HURON TRIUMPHS IN $137,520 RACE
description: PARIS, June 21The horses in the Grand Steeplechase de Paris were applauded four times today by 35,000 cheerful fans at Auteuil race course.

title: WARSAW PACT HOLDS TALKS IN BUDAPEST
description: VIENNA, June 21 (AP)The foreign ministers of the Soviet Union and its six Warsaw Pact allies met in Budapest today for two days of talks on the projected European security conference.

title: Dim Outlook for Reconciliation in Port Harcourt
description: PORT HARCOURT, Nigeria Here in the capital of the Riv ers State is where the most difficult tests for Nigerian re unification and for reintegra tion of the Ibos who served Biafra will come. The signs so far are not encouraging.

title: Paper Disposal Problems Cited by Newspaper Guild
description: SEATTLE, June 21 (AP)A resolution urging the newspaper industry to consider the prob lems created by disposal of newspapers was approved yes terday by the Executive Board of the American Newspaper Guild, a union representing newspaper employes.

title: From Peace Pendants to Cattle Brand Cufflinks
description: Maria Vogt's vague ambi tion to become a middle class German housewife end ed at 17 when she was kicked out of high school for refus ing to say Heil Hitler. For the next three years she went to a private arts and crafts school and learned to work in precious metals. Then Ger many became too unpleasant lo bear and she left first for England and later fur the United States.

title: The Hippie Coach at Berkeley Instills Commune Spirit in Track
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 21 Colleagues have called Dave Maggard, the hippie coach, because he practices in that famous college commune, Ber keley, and because he tells his track and field athletes that beards, beads and mustaches are fine as long as the finish line comes first.

title: Dunkirk Commemorated
description: RAMSGATE, England, June 21 (Reuters)A flotilla of small boats gathered today off this southetstern coastal resort to commemorate the 30th anniver sary of the evacuation of Brit ish and allied troops from Dun kirk, France.

title: A Missing Playwright
description: Plays can cross oceans and continents but not all playwrights can. When Athol Fugard's drama Boes man and Lena opens at the Circle in the Square today he will not be at the back of the theater, wondering how New Yorkers receive it. Fie will be home in Port Elizabeth, South Africa, because Government officials took away his passport. They do not like plays about outcast coloreds that might indicate that apartheid, the policy of racial separation, is not beautiful.

title: Prodigal Father
description: Sukarno, the deposed lifetime President of Indo nesia, was a man of exceptional gifts who led the world's fifth most populous nation out of colonialism and inspired its widely scattered and divergent peo ple with a sense of national unity. He deserves re membrance as the Father of his country.

title: Printers' Union Ratifies Pact With Four Major Papers
description: Members of New York Typo graphical Union No. 6 yester day ratified a new threeyear contract with the city's four major newspapers. The vote for acceptance was 293 to 8 and was taken at the union meeting in Stuyvesant High School.

title: Opera: A Rare Mozart Warms Chilly Caramoor
description: KATONAH, N. Y., June 21 This is the first time that Mozart has left me cold. The remark was going the rounds at the opening of the 25th annual Caramoor Festival here last night. It had nothing to do with the composer's opera Idomeneo, which was being presented in the out door Venetian Theater, but with the weather.

title: Politics: Goldberg and Samuels Are Polite in Final TV Debate
description: Arthur J. Goldberg and How ard J. Samuels, the candidates for the Democratic nomination for Governor, met in their sec ond and last television debate last night and quietly and po litely restated the positions they have tried to develop in the last three months.

title: Munich: A Crowded and Sometimes Chaotic Mixture
description: MUNICH, West Germany Munich is growing as it never did before. There are 1.3 mil lion people here, and last year the new arrivals outnumbered those departing by nearly 50,000.

title: KAPILOW SCORES IN ETCHELLS22
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 21Marvin Kapilow sailed Lor raine to his third Etchells22 Class Yacht Racing Association victory of the season today In the Sheldrake Yacht Club's an nual regatta on Long Island Sound.

title: Article 2  No Title
Enigma of James Parris
description: In death, James Parris has succeeded in getting what he was unable to get in almost 43 years of lifeattention. But whether it will give him an identity remains in doubt.

title: WILLARD L. NEELEY SR.
description: Willard L. Neeley Sr., an art representative, died Saturday night at Mcadowbrook Hos pital, East Meadow, L. I. He was badly burned last Sunday by charcoal lighting fluid at a barbecue in Sea Cliff, L. I. Mr. Neeley, who was 47 years old, lived in Sea Cliff and formerly in Pound Ridge., N.Y.

title: A Shopping Mall in Suffolk Offering More Than Goods
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., June 21The Smith Haven Mall, a new city within the Vil lage of Lake Grove straddling the line between the Towns of Smithtown and Brook haven, has a low silhouette but casts a large shadow over central Suffolk County.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: West German Plane Down
description: BERLIN, June 21 (UPI)East Germany forced down a West German plane and its twoman crew near the city of Eisenach today, the East German press agency, A.D.N., reported. It said the plane had violated East Ger man airspace near Eisenach, about 38 miles east of the border.

title: 12Man House Committee Arrives in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21 (Reuters)A 12man ??elect committee from the United States House of Rep resentatives and Secretary of the Navy John H. Chafee ar rived in Saigon today on sepa rate aircraft for visits to South Vietnam.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Narcotics Agent, Dragged by Auto, Gets His Man
description: At 10 o'clock Saturday morn Mg the final phase of Opera tion Eagle in New York began.

title: Japanese Demonstrate Against Security Treaty
description: TOKYO, June 21 (AP) About 150,000 demonstrators, far short of the organizers' goal of a million, turned out today across the nation for the ninth day of protest against the automatic extensoin of the. JapanUnited States secu rity treaty.

title: Peggy Wood to Receive Theater LaSalle Award
description: Peggy Wood has been named the winner of the first annual Theater LaSalle Award, it was announced by Brother Daniel Burke, president of LaSalle Col lege in Philadelphia.

title: A's Hand White Sox Sixth Double Defeat In Row, 63 and 54
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 21 (AP)Sal Bando hit two home runs as the Oakland Athletics beat the Chicago White Sox, 64, to complete a doublehead er sweep today.

title: JUDGE RELEASES SECRET JURY DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 22A Federal judge said in a report here today that a grand jury had charged a Baltimore con tractor with seeking to obtain the assistance of members of Congress in connection with an underground garage project here.

title: Reporters' Call Deferred
description: JERSEY CITY, June 22Ac tion on subpoenas directing two reporters for The New York Times to appear here at a trial of three Black Panthers was deferred today because of the illness of Superior Court Judge Edward F. Hamill. The subpoenas for Walter H. Wag goner and Francis X. Clines were obtained last Friday by Raymond A. Brown, the attor ney for the Panthers, who are charged with a machinegun attack on a Jersey City police station 18 months ago. Mr. Brown has said that he wanted the reporters to confirm state ments in articles that they had written.

title: European Device Set to Aid U.S. Concerns In Raising Funds
2 Seized in Soviet Hijacking Case Signed Emigration Petition in '69
description: Two of the 20 Soviet citizens who were reported implicated in an air hijacking attempt in Leningrad last week were among 27 Riga Jews who had signed a petition to Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin last year re questing permission to emigrate to Israel.

title: Books of The Times
description: ARROW IN THE BLUE. By Arthur Koestler. 416 pages. The Danube Edition: Macmillan. $7.95. THE INVISIBLE WRITING. By Arthur Koestler. 526 pages. The Danube Edition. Macmillan. $8.95.

title: PRICES SHOW DIP IN AMEX TRADING
description: On a broad front, prices of American Stock Exchange is sues moved lower yesterday in moderately active trading. At the close stocks declining to taled 542, well outnumbering the 195 that advanced. Some 233 issues remained unchanged from last Friday's quotations.

title: Virginia Bridal For Mrs. Bellin
description: ARLINGTON, Va., June 22 Mrs. Barbara Bellin, daugh ter of Mrs. Maurice Bellin of East Orange, N. J., and the late Mr. Bellin, was married here this morning to Martin Stuart Kahn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Michael Kahn of Englewood Cliffs, N. J. Mu nicipal Magistrate Francis E. Thomas Jr. performed the ceremony in his office.

title: Text of Judge's Summary of Secret Grand Jury Presentment in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, June 22Fol lowing is the text of Judge Roszel C. Thomsen's sum mary of the secret grand jury presentment of which he is custodian:

title: 7 Student Protest Heads Unite on Lobbying Effort
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Leaders of seven college stu dent groups protesting Ameri can involvement in Southeast Asia today announced coordi nation of their lobbying effort and plans to assist peace and new priorities candidates for Congress.

title: NEW UPDIKE NOVEL HEADS FOR STAGE
description: The Theater Guild will pre sent Bech, a play by Eric Ambler and Leonard Spigel gass based on John Updike's recently published Bech: A Book, on Broadway in September.

title: Doctors Say Drug Eases Pain of Acute Epididymitis
description: CHICAGO, June 22  Two urologists from the University of Michigan Medical Center said today that a short course of oxyphenbutazone, an antiin flamatory drug, helped to re duce pain and tenderness from a condition called acute epididy mitis.

title: $500,000 AWARDED IN MALPRACTICE SUIT
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 22 The 34yearold mother of three children won a $500,000 settle ment today from a hospital and three doctors fro brain damage she suffered during a sixhour open heart operation.

title: GRUNDOON OUSTED IN SAILING MISHAP
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 22Nepenthe, Grundoon, Con gere and Warrior, participants in the NewporttoBermuda yacht race, were dismasted last night and were proceeding to United States ports this morn ing, according to a report re ceived here today from the United States Coast Guard in Boston.

title: Chubby Checker Arrested At Border on Drug Charge
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., June 22 (AP)  The police said the rock n roll band leader Chub by Checker and three other men were arrested at the Unit ed States border early today on drug charges.

title: Bill Rates Decline at Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: JAPAN EXTENDING U.S. SECURITY PACT
description: TOKYO, June 22The Japa nese Government today declared its intention of continuing its security treaty with the United States, which expires tonight The expected cries of protest were relatively muted.

title: Business Records
description: EASTERN DISTRICT

title: U.S. Asks City's Aid in Hiring To Complete Census in Slums
description: The Federal Bureau of the Census asked the city yester day to help recruit 750 to 1,000 census canvassers to work in slum areas here, where the re sponse to mailed census forms has been slow.

title: Down Came Fresco, to Nobody's Regret
description: The ceiling fresco, full of floating cherubs, had to come down, but luckily the rest of the ballroom was salvage able when the Joseph Hocksteins moved into their house seven years ago.

title: Secretary Asserts He Gave Orders to Speaker's Staff
description: A secretary to House Speaker John W. McCormack testified yesterday that she had been told by Dr. Martin Sweig, Mr. McCormack's chief aide, to take orders from Nathan M. Voloshen because it would be the same as doing it for the Speaker.

title: URTAIN OUTPOINTS BLIN, KEEPS TITLE
description: BARCELONA, Spain, July 22 (AP)Jose Manuel Ibar, known as Urtain, retained his European heavyweight championship by outpointing the German chal lenger, Jurgen BIM in a sensa tional fight tonight.

title: Unionist Heads Hospital Unit
description: ALBANY, June 22  Arcy Degni, secretarytreasurer of the New York State Building and Construction Trades Coun cil, A.F.L.C.I.O., has been named chairman of the State Hospital Review and Planning Council effective July 1. Mr. Degni, a Utica resident, is also president of the New York State Conference of Painters. The 31 member unsalaried council, ap pointed by the Governor, ad vises the State Health Commis sioner.

title: Mets' Records
description: BATTING

title: URBAN ARTS CORPS TO GIVE NEVER JAM
description: The Urban Arts Corps, an integrated group of profession al performers between the ages of 16 and 25, will present But Never Jam Today at the Mount Morris Amphi Theater, 122d Street near Lenox Avenue, on Friday at 8:30 P.M. Admission is free.

title: 1940 Killer of 5 Is Paroled
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 22 (UPI)  The California state parole board granted parole to day to Verlin J. Spencer, 68 years old, who in 1940 was sentenced to life in prison for killing five school officials and teachers. Spencer, now at the California medical facility at Vacaville, will he paroled Nov. 9 to work with a social service agency for exconviets in Hawaii.

title: Dealers in Commercial Paper Find Display of Confidence
description: The financial markets weath ered the shock of the Penn Cen tral's filing under the bank ruptcy laws with little difficulty yesterday.

title: MARGARET DIXON, POLITICAL WRITER
description: BATON ROUGE, La., June 22  Margaret Dixon, managing editor of The Baton Rouge Morning Advocate and reporter of the Louisiana political scene from the days of Huey P. Long through the current legislative session, died of cancer last night. She was 62 years old.

title: Lowell Employes Strike
description: LOWELL, Mass., June 22 (AP) More than 300 Lowell city employes went on strike today in defiance of a restraining or der issued by Superior Court Judge Edward A. Pecce. The citywide walkout affected near ly all city agencies except the police and fire departments.

title: EACH FORESEES PRIMARY VICTORY
description: The four candidates in day's primary contest for the Democratic nomination for United States Senator, all bone tired but each exuding confi dence, wound up their cam paigns yesterday.

title: Jack Lightcap, Announcer For Mets Games at Shea
description: John P. Lightcap, the public address announcer at Shea Stadium, died at Memorial Hos pital yesterday of lung cancer. He was 53 years old, and lived at 22750 112th Avenue, in Queens Village, Queens. Mr. Lightcap had announced the first three Mets games this year before entering the hospi tal.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Nixon Warns of Attempts To Restrict U.S. Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)  President Nixon said today that the United States would vigorously oppose any attempts by foreign nations to restrict the operations of Unit ed States airlines.

title: 1,000 In Financial District At Antinarcotics Rally
description: Nearly 1,000 persons attend ed a rally against narcotics abuse yesterday in front of the Federal Hall Memorial, in the heart of the financial district.

title: Syria Raises Bank Rate
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, June 22 (Reuters)  The Ministry of Economy and Foreign Trade issued a decree today raising the rate of interest in Syrian banks from four per cent by at least 0.5 per cent. The rate for deposits blocked for at least one year goes up from 4.75 to 5.75 per cent. The decree also exempted deposits and savings from all charges and from a tax on capital in circulation.

title: ALEXANDER's DROPS OUT
description: And so it goes in fashion: Alexander's announced yester day that it is dropping out of the haute couture copies com petition.

title: SINGER CO. SEEKS LAND DEVELOPER
description: The Singer Company an nounced yesterday that it had reached an agreement to ac quire for stock the Besco Or ganization, a California inde pendent real estate developer.

title: HEARING ORDERED ON CAMPUS CODES
description: A Federal appeals court or dered a hearing yesterday to determine whether a New York State law enacted after campus violence last year had coerced colleges to adopt disciplinary codes embodying a hardline attitude toward student pro testers.

title: Her Family Laughed When She Sat Down at the Typewriter
description: The book, A World in Flames, was written on the kitchen table while the chil dren were in school.

title: COMPANY REPORT RAISES QUESTIONS
description: A number of questions have been raised by some insiders at the General Dynamics Cor poration and Wall Street ob servers regarding the com pany's 1969 financial report and Its recent comments about the income statement.

title: Mayor White Will Enter Primary for Governorship
description: BOSTON, June 22 (AP)  Mayor Kevin H. White an nounced today that despite his defeat at the state Democratic convention, he would enter the primary election with three ether candidates for the guber natorial nomination.

title: Cambodians Bitterly Complain Of Looting by Saigon's Troops
description: KOMPONG SPED, Cambodia, June 22  A Cambodian Army officer declared here today that the population now has more fear of the South Vietnamese than of the Vietcong.

title: Union Carbide in Oak Ridge Reopens After Long Strike
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., June 22 (UPI)The longest strike in the history of Union Carbide's Atomic energy facilities here ended last night when members of the Atomic Trades and Labor Council ratified a new contract by a vote of 2,007 to 787.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: Refused to grant permis sion to Cassius Clay to go to Canada for a title fight with Joe Frazier. The former heavyweight boxing cham pion is appealing a convic tion for refusing to submit to induction into the armed forces (unnumbered, Clay v. United States).

title: Harness Horse Dies at 23
description: LAWRENCE, Kan. June 22 (AP)The Lemon Drop Kid, former world champion open stakes harness horse, died of a heart attack yesterday. He was 23 years old and was owned by Patricia Battin of Woodside, Calif.

title: Washington: For the Record
High Court Denies Plea For Clay Bout in Canada
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The United States Supreme Court denied permission to day for the former world heavyweight champion, Cas sius Clay, to go to Canada to fight Joe Frazier, his suc cessor. The vote was 80.

title: PREMIER OF LIBYA URGES ARAB UNITY
description: CAIRO, June 22The Pre mier of Libya, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, called tonight for total Arab unity to support the cause of the Palestinians against Israel, declaring that if Arab rulers failed to join the struggle, the masses must press for this even by revolu tion.

title: 15 STATES TO ACT ON YOUTH BALLOT
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  President Nixon's approval to day of the 18yearold vote came at a time when there was strong interest in many states in lowering the voting age. In several states campaigns to extend the franchise are nearing a referendum.

title: G.I. Tax Relief Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)  Senator Strom Thurmond, Republican of South Carolina, asked President Nixon in a letter today to exempt Ameri can forces in Cambodia and air crews flying missions over Laos from payment of United States income taxes. Servicemen in Vietnam already enjoy the ex emption under a 1965 Execu tive order.

title: Allis Sets New Tractor
description: The AllisChalmers Manufac turing Company expects the first production model of its HD41 crawler tractor to move off the assembly line at Spring field, Ill., in July. The new model, said to be the largest crawler tractor in the world weighs 127,130 pounds when equipped with a dozer blade. It is designed specifically for and reclamation, heaving rip ping and bulldozing operations as well as for strip mining and large construction jobs.

title: A Son, Their 3d Child, Born to Peter Duchins
description: A son was born last Friday to Peter Duchin, the pianist and orchestra leader, and Mrs. Duchin, the former Cheray Zauderer, in the LyingIn Hospital. The child, the couple's third, has been named Colin Z. He has a four yearold brother, Jason, and a sister, Courtney, who is two and a half.

title: Wildcat Strikes Cripple Coal Industry in 3 States
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Much of the soft coal industry was crippled today by wildcat strikes as roving pickets pro tested the policies of their union and a closeddoor meet ing here on mine safety by Gov ernment and coal industry of ficials.

title: Burton Gets Raid on Rommel Film Role
description: Richard Burton, whose por trayal of Henry VIII in Anne of the 1000 Days proved un successful in the competition for best actor honors in the recent Academy Award sweep stakes, will return to the screen in Raid on Rommel, a World War II adventure that goes before the cameras in Mexico on Monday.

title: Steinkraus Pilots Snowbound To Victory at Aachen Show
description: AACHEN, Germany, June 22 (AP)William Steinkraus of the United States Equestrian Team guided Snowbound to first place today in a difficult jumping test over 12 obstacles and 14 jumps at the Aachen Interna tional Horse Show.

title: U.S.Italy Pact Gives Airlines New Routes and Added Flights
description: ROME, June 22The United States and Italy signed today a new air transport agreement that awarded new routes to carriers of the two countries.

title: TAYLOR IS VICTOR WITH RELIEF STINT
description: CHICAGO, June 22 The New York Mets and Chi cago Cubs resumed hostilities today before 24,867 persons in Wrigley Field and the Mets took Round One with a 95 victory.

title: A. & S. and Ohrbach's Plan Queens Shopping Center
description: Abraham & Straus and Ohr bach's, two of New York's largest retailers, will operate a major new shopping center in the Rego Park section of Queens, containing large stores of each company. The open ing is set for late 1972.

title: Student Deferments Seen Certain Next Fall
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)College freshmen are virtually assured of student draft deferments next fall but the Selective Service System says that the deferments could be short lived.

title: Hospital Arbitration Needed
description: The contract covering 22,000 workers in New York City voluntary hospitals expires next Tuesday, with every present sign pointing to a strike. That is an un conscionable prospect, both because it would en danger the lives of the sick and because the pre ponderance of Negroes and Puerto Ricans among the workers would aggravate racial tensions.

title: Cost of F.B.I.'s Unbuilt Center Rises by $5Million
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The price of the most expen sive Government building ever a new headquarters for the Federal Bureau of Investigation has gone up by $5million. Meanwhile, all that is visible at the site is a massive hole.

title: Wisconsin Abortion Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) Wisconsin appealed today to the Supreme Court from a judgment that its abortion law is unconstitutional. The law forbids abortions except thera peutic ones performed by a physician when necessary to save a mother's life. Last March a threejudge Federal Court in Wisconsin, ruling on a suit brought by Dr. Sidney G. Bab bitz, held a mother has the right to determine whether to carry or reject an embryo that has not quickened.

title: Ecuador's President Assumes Dictatorial Power to Avoid Chaos
description: QUITO, Ecuador, June 22 President Jos Maria Velasco Ibarra of Ecuador assumed dic tatorial powers today, ending a night of Government confu sion and student riots.

title: Political Insanity
description: Political insanity seems to be peculiarly endemic in Russia. Nearly 150 years ago Czar Nicholas I detected the disease in Russia's first modern political philosopher, Pyotr Y. Chaadayev; the evidence of his insanity was his enunciation of the rule that the chief thing we owe to our country is truth. Czar Nicholas forbade Chaadayev to write or speak publicly and sent a physician to examine him each week.

title: Miss Devlin's Appeal Denied; New Plea on Jail Term Set
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 22Bernadette Devlin, the 23yearold Ulster Member of Parliament and Roman Catholic civil rights leader, lost her ap peal today against a sixmonth prison sentence for her part in the riots between Catholics and Protestants in Londonderry last August.

title: Seminary Names Dean
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 22 The Rev. Dr. James Hastings Nichols, a church historian, has been named academic dean of the Princeton Theological Sem inary. The former professor at the University of Chicago, who came to Princeton in 1962, will continue to serve as a profes sor of church history.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: UPSTATE RETURNS TO BE SLOW TODAY
description: Paper ballots are being used today in a score of upstate counties, adding a confusing el ement to a primary in which Democrats pick their candi dates for Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General and United States Senator.

title: Advertising: Professional PulseFeelers
description: When a candidate wants to feel the pulse of his elector ate; a manufacturer of a new product, the pulse of a housewife, or an ad agency, the pulse of a consumer, they usually end up in the hands of a woman like Mrs. Chezna Copeland and the women who work for her. Profes sional pulsefeelers all.

title: Rejection of Pennsy Loan Is Laid to Political Risks
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Administration sources con ceded today that a plan to rescue the Penn Central with $200million in Federally guaranteed loans had been abruptly abandoned when the White House decided that its po litical risks were too large.

title: Shakespeare Marathon Is Now Set for Saturday
description: The financially threatened New York Shakespeare Festi val has decided to present its dusktodawn production of the Henry VI trilogy and Richard HI on Saturday at the Delacorte Theater in Cen tral Park.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 23, 1970

title: Article 2  No Title
Aid Asked for U.S. Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The American Bar Associa tion urged approval today of a bill to provide continuing legal education of the 10,000 Govern ment lawyers. The bill, spon sored by Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massa shusetts, would establish a Federal Administrative Justice Center.

title: Judge and Times Disagree
description: The Associated Press re ported from Baltimore last night that Judge Thomsen said he had been told by The New York Times that it had received information from a Baltimore juror. The judge was also re ported to have said that James Reston, vice president and col umnist of The Times, would confirm the statement.

title: Israel Reports Raid On Military Center 45 Miles Into Egypt
description: JERUSALEM, Tuesday, June 23  Israeli troops penetrated into Egypt last night, mortared an Egyptian Army center and destroyed two armored troop carriers, a military spokesman said today.

title: ABORTION REFORM DEBATED BY A.M.A.
description: CHICAGO, June 22Roman Caholic doctors fought today to have the American Medical Association sidetrack a recom mendation of its board of trust ees that would favor the repeal of all laws limiting abortions.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Reacting sharply to a state ment by the Massachusetts Division of Fish and Game that it and other utilities with dams on the Connecticut River are being uncoopera tive in providing facilities for upstream passage of shad and Atlantic salmon, the Hol yoke (Mass.) Water Power Company says that the accu sation is unjustified and inac curate.

title: LONDON MARKET TRIMS ITS GAINS
description: In a sharp reversal yesterday, the London stock market lost a good part of the large gains it had made on Friday in reaction to the Conservatives' election victory. Trading was quiet.

title: City Plans to Raise Fees for Activities To Help on Budget
description: If a person wants to operate a serpent farm to make snake bite remedies, the city intends to charge him $35 instead of $25 for a permit.

title: Prosecutors as Ballplayers: Not Guilty
description: At Yankee Stadium last night, there were bats and balls and homemade signs, pop corn, peanuts and hot dogs, youthful fans, moms and dads and an assortment of digni taries.

title: Corning Glass Profit Declines; Sales Set Record for the Half
description: The Corning Glass Works, the first major company to is sue halfyear results, reported yesterday lower earnings for the 24 weeks ended June 14 despite record sales for the period.

title: Italy Opens Drive to Get Even More U.S. Tourists
description: ROME, June 22The Min ister of Tourism and Enter tainment, Giuseppe Lupis, flew to New York today to start a drive for more Amer ican visitors to a country that already seems overrun by them.

title: When Tassel] Designs the Midi, He's Serious About
description: Gustave Tassell never did make baby dresses, which is perhaps why he latched on to the midi length so avidly. Back in December, when most designers were still equivocating, he came out strongly for belowtheknee hemlines for spring. Knees were banished by the time he showed his summer clothes two months later.

title: Insolvent Penn Central
description: The reorganization of the Penn Central under the bankruptcy laws is an astonishing denouement to the high hopes for improved service and financial strength stirred by the merger of two giant railroad systems just a little over two years ago. That this corporation with nearly $7 billion in assets should have to confess in Federal court its inability to pay its bills projects on a mammoth screen the dimensions of the liquidity crisis caused for many businesses by the current com bination of inflation and recession.

title: $150Million Fund To Aid Integration Blocked by Stennis
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI) A Southern Senator's objec tion tonight struck down $150million appropriation in tended to soothe the strains of integration for 994 South ern school districts.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS OUSTER OF GAMBINO
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Supreme Court let stand today a 1967 deportation order against Carlo Gambino, 67year old reputed boss of all bosses of the six Mafia families in the New YorkNew Jersey area.

title: Mrs. Meir Spurns CeaseFire
description: JERUSALEM, June 22Pre mier Golda Meir rejected today the recent Egyptian suggestion for a temporary ceasefire in the Middle East and warned that if Russian pilots flew com bat missions near the Suez Canal, Israel would have no alternative but to fight them.

title: DRAWING TO NAME JUDGE FOR PENNSY
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 22  The 13 justices of the Federal District Court here will draw lots tomorrow to decide which one of them will act as the judge in charge of the reorgani zation proceedings of the Penn Central Transportation Com pany.

title: Marketing Service Post
description: Charles W. Detjen has been appointed president of RAM Services, Inc., a new market ing service for the apparel in dustry in New York and Chicago. Mr. Detjen was for merly vice president of the Carnac division of the Iselin Jefferson Company.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: Soybeans futures continued to occupy the main stage on the floor of the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday with the new crop options again setting highs for the season.

title: Election and Good News At Milwaukee Meeting
description: In Milwaukee yesterday, the American Advertising Federation got its annual meeting off to a good start by electing Victor C. Elting Jr., vice president for adver tising of the Quaker Oats Company, its chairman; Fred erick E. Baker, chairman of Ayer/Baker, Seattle, was named senior vice chairman, and as regional vice chair man for the East, none other than Roland (Steve) Camp bell, creative marketing di rector of General Foods.

title: Roundup: Frank Robinson a GoatHero
description: Frank Robinson, the batter, did better against Cal Koonce, the last Boston pitcher, than Frank Robinson, the fielder, did against Ken Brett, the first Boston pitch er, and that's why the Balti more Orioles beat the Red Sox, 98, last night.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON PENNSY NEWS
USE OF DEFOLIANTS IN WAR SUSPENDED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22The nineyearold program of spraying chemical defoliants and herbicides to strip the cover from enemycontrolled base areas in South Vietnam and to kill rice crops in such regions has been suspended, American military sources dis closed today. They said the program was stopped without announcement nearly two months ago.

title: U.S. Is Challenged in a Contempt Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  The chief defense counsel for two former poverty workers charged in Federal Court today that the Government had made gross misstatements of fact before the grand jury that in dicted the two for contempt of Congress.

title: LTV Men May Go On Board of J. & L.
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., the troubled conglomerate concern whose control of the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation has been challenged by the Justice Department, is expected to get three seats on the steel com pany's board later this week.

title: Mets' Game Rescheduled
description: ATLANTA, June 22 (AP) The Atlanta Braves announced; today that a June 3 rainedout game with the New York Mets would he made up as the second game of a twilightnight double header Aug. 14.

title: Executive Changes
description: David D. Allen has been named CBS vice presi dent, management information systems. He formerly was with Computer Technology, Inc., a subsidiary of LTV Aerospace Corporation, where he was vice president and eastern regional manager.

title: Palisades Tract Is Leased To Columbia for Ecology
description: A 23acre tract of wood land on the Palisades has been leased by Columbia Uni versity for ecology field trips.

title: Play Adds Nuance to the Real McCoys (and Hatfields)
description: BECKLEY, W. Va., June 22 Far from Broadway, in the mountains of Appalachia, a new chapter in outdoor thea ter and an image of the mountain man far different from the comic stereotype of cartoons was created here Saturday night with the pre miere of Hatfields & Mc Coys.

title: HOSPITAL BUDGET IN CITY CRITICIZED
description: The city's Health and Hos pital Corporation, which takes over operation of the 18 mu nicipal hospitals on July 1, can not provide a budget for a decent and professionally sat isfactory standard of health care, according to a study made for the New School for Social Research.

title: At Least 35 Countries Now Allow Vote at 18
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 A spokesman at the Library of Congress said today that at least 35 countries in ad dition to the United States, 13 of them Communist, now allowed voting at age 18.

title: Model Cities Cash Shakes UP Town
description: TRINIDAD, Colo., June 18 Through the peculiar pro cesses of American politics, the Model Cities Program, de signed to attack urban blight in large metropolitan areas, has found its way into this remote coal mining town of fewer than 10,000 people.

title: DAVID SCHWARTZ
description: David Schwartz, president of Schwartz Brothers Memorial Chapels, Inc., died of a heart attack Sunday at Montefiore Hospital in the Bronx. He was 64 years old and lived at 81 La Salle Drive, Yonkers.

title: GRAEBNER, LUTZ, PASARELL VICTORS
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 22Arthur Ashe led most of the Americans into the second round of the Wimbledon open tennis championship today by destroying Graham Stilwell of Britain on the center court in a match that had enormous possibilities but turned out to be a dud. A year ago Stilwell had car ried Ashe to five sets and was serving for victory in a furious finish. He was the architect of the British string of Davis Cup victories last summer that ended with a loss to Rumania, even though he won both his singles. He had turned pro since and dropped out of contention.

title: Cavalli Opera Is Revived in England
description: LONDON, June 22 The Glyndebourne Festival, in its 37th year in the Sussex Downs, has achieved a musical triumph this season with an opera not seen for more than 300 years.

title: Enemy Pullback Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 22 (AP)A military spokesman said today that enemy forces were quitting Kompong Thom, a provincial capital 80 miles north of Pnompenh. But it was thought that the North Viet namese there might be taking a breather before making an other attack.

title: G.M. TO USE PARTS FROM EUROPE IN CAR
description: DETROIT, July 22A major component of General Motors Corporation's new mini car will be made in Europe. The car, the Vega 2300, which may be in production by the end of the month, will carry a manual transmission made in West Germany and imported into the United States.

title: F.P.C. Allows Expansion Of Pennsylvania Facilities
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)  Three natural gas pipeline companies have been author ized by the Federal Power Commission to spend an esti mated $29million, or about $9.5million each, on separate programs to expand the Ellis burg, Pa., gas storage facilities.

title: Miss Jacquet Plans Nuptials
description: Mrs. Barbara Jacquet of New York has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Pamela Jacquet, to Hay wood H. Davis Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. H. Howard Davis of Norfolk, Va. The future bride is the daughter also of Illinois Jacquet, the jazz saxophonist, of St. Albans, Queens.

title: Hospital Arbitration Needed
description: The contract covering 22,000 workers in New York City voluntary hospitals expires next Tuesday, with every present sign pointing to a strike. That is an un conscionable prospect, both because it would en danger the lives of the sick and because the pre ponderance of Negroes and Puerto Ricans among the workers would aggravate racial tensions.

title: Firestone to Raise Prices
description: The Firestone Tire & Rubber Company yesterday followed other major producers by an nouncing increases in the price of passenger car tires by 5 per cent, and most other tire by 6 per cent, effective July 1.

title: RICHARD A. KING
description: UNION CITY, N.J., June 22 Richard A. King, who had coached football, baseball, bas ketball and track and taught Latin, business law and mathe matics at All Hallows Institute, a Roman Catholic high school in the Bronx; since 1943, died yesterday of a heart attack at North Hudson Hospital here. He was 59 years old.

title: Contraceptive Ban Loses
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The House voted today to repeal an 87yearold ban on importation of contraceptive devices or materials. The meas ure was sent to the Senate by voice vote.

title: In The Nation: The Wrong Kind of Jawboning
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  President Nixon's national tele vision address on the economy was a good example of why there is a widespread impres sion that the nation is failing to come to grips with its major problems, that its leaders in stead fall back on highlevel public relations and gimmickry.

title: California Assembly Bars Busing Without Consent
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 22 (UPI)The California As sembly passed a bill today that prohibits schools from busing children for racial integration or any other purpose without their parents' consent.

title: Party at Boat Basin To Assist Children
description: Arlene Francis, the actress, and William R. Hudgins, pres ident of the Freedom Nation al Bank, will be guests of honor at the 10th annual Evening of Elegance at the Boat Basin Rotunda, 79th Street at the Hudson River, on Friday night.

title: U.S. Airliner Hijacked to Cairo and Then Released
description: CAIRO, June 22A man with an Albanian passport, said to be a resident of the United States, hijacked an air liner over the eastern Mediter ranean today and forced the pilot at pistol point to fly to Cairo.

title: A KOREAN RED AGENT DIES IN SEOUL BLAST
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 22 A North Korean agent was killed early today when a group of two or three Communist in filtrators accidentally detonated a bomb that they attempted to mount on a gate at the National Cemetery here, the Government announced.

title: Maj. Gen. W. H. Harrison Jr. Of Massachusetts Guard, 73
description: BOSTON, June 22Maj. Gen. William Henry Harrison Jr., former Adjutant General of Massachusetts, died here on Saturday. He was 73 years old and lived in the city's Rox bury section.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Candidate Clarifies Stand On Peace in Southeast Asia
description: YONKERS, June 22  Keith Drake, candidate for the Demo cratic nomination in the 25th Congessional District, today clarified his position on Nixon Administration policies in Southeast Asia.

title: Eventually Why Not Now?
description: To prevent the law's delay from deepening the silence of successive springs, killing off millions fish and possibly raising the toll of cancer in humans, President Nixon has only to order his Secretary of Agriculture to suspend immediately the use of DDT. Appeals from the Department's ruling of last November to that effect could then take their long and tortuous course without harm to man or beast.

title: STOCKTON SCORES 75, 61 TRIUMPH
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 22Dick Stockton of Gar den City and Sandy Mayer of Woodmere scored victories in the Eastern men's claycourt tennis championships at the Port Washington Tennis Acad emy today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Jack Dempsey will celebrate his 75th birthday tomorrow but a warmup anni versary party was tossed for him in Madi son Square Garden last week just before the QuarryFoster fight. The Garden gala was significant in two respects because it provided a twoway glimpse of the old heavyweight champion of the world. Both were impressive and one was awesome to the point of being frightening.

title: Janet R. Hurly Is Future Bride Of Brian White
description: BILLINGS, Mont., June 22 The engagement of Miss Janet Ruth Hurly to Brian O'Donoghue White, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ross O'Donoghue White of New Canaan, Conn., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. John T. Hurly.

title: European Reserve currency Is Urged by Yale Professor
description: TURIN, Italy, June 22 (Reu ters)Prof. Robert Triff in of Yale University said here today that the creation of a European reserve currency would allow European central banks to sub stitute their own currencies for the United States dollar in for eign exchange dealings.

title: U.S. Newsman Freed in Cambodia Tells of 40Day Ordeal
description: The rice paddies stretched emptily on both sides of us. The countryside was deserted. We were frighteningly alone.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
Vorster, Returning From a Private European Tour, Declares That South Africa Is Not a Social Outcast
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, June 22Prime Minister John Vorster has come home from his European tour with re assuring words contending that this country is not so much social outcast after all.

title: '65 ACT EXTENDED
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 President Nixon resolved a po litical dilemma today by sign ing into law a historic measure lowering the voting age from 21 to 18and then immediately calling for a court challenge to decide if it is constitutional.

title: Post Offices Open July 3
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount announced today that basic services such as de liveries, window service and mail pickup would he provided cirl July 3, which will he a holi day for most other Federal workers since July 4 falls on a Saturday. But Mr. Blount said that postmasters were being authorized to adjust hours and services In permit as many em ployes as possible to take the day off.

title: Swanberg Turns Down an Honorary Degree From Northwestern
description: W. A. Swanberg, the biogra pher of Hearst, Pulitzer and Dreiser, has rejected an hon orary doctorate from North western University because of his strong opposition to Amer ican militarism, which he charged was subsidizing the university.

title: Museum to Show Mekas Film
description: Diaries, Notes and Sketches, a threehour film shot from 1950 to the present by Jonas Mekas, a leader of the under ground film movement, will be shown at 5:30 P.M. today at the Museum of Modern Art. Mr. Mekas will discuss his film, which he describes as a diary dealing with situations, friends, New York, seasons of the year.

title: Recovery in the Credit Markets Continues as Yields Move Down
State Honors Granted To Sukarno at Burial
description: BLITAR, Indonesia, June 22 (Reuters)  More than 50,000 mourners joined weeping relatives as former President Sukarno, the founder of modern Indonesia, was lowered into his grave with full state honors today.

title: CHURCHES INTEGRATE IN VIRGINIA'S HILLS
description: BIG STONE GAP, Va., June 22A small Negro congrega tion has merged with a larger white congregation in this Trail of the Lonesome Pine country.

title: MAN, 47, CONVICTED IN BANK LOAN FRAUD
description: A Federal court jury con victed a real estate operator yesterday in a scheme involv ing the fraudulent pledging of life insurance policies as col lateral for bank loans in six states.

title: BROADCASTERS AID CRUSADE ON DRUGS
description: The broadcast industry, urged by President Nixon two months ago to get the message across to young people that drug use is weakening the character of the United States, has attempted to keep the dan gers of narcotics abuse in front of its listeners in diverse ways.

title: Two States to Divide Land
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Supreme Court decreed today that disputed land along the Mississippi River he divided between the states of Illinois and Missouri. The Court made official a report tendered last March by Special Master Har vey M. Johnsen, who had ref ereed the dispute over Kaskas kia Island, and St. Genevieve, Mo.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Albany Teamsters Strike Halts Deliveries for Ford
description: ALBANY, June 22 (AP)A strike by Teamsters Union truck drivers has halted delivery of Ford Motor Company vehicles in parts of several Northeastern states, a spokesman for Auto mobile Transport, Inc., in near by Selkirk, said today.

title: MRS. RANKIN'S 212 WINS BY A STROKE
description: HORSHAM, Pa., June 22 (AP)Mrs. Judy Rankin of Mid land, Tex., who trailed by seven strokes, carded a fiveunder par 68 today and won the $25,000 George Washington golf tournament by one stroke.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: COERCION CHARGED TO 2 L.I. CARTERS
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., June 22 The president of the Suffolk County Cartmen's Association and his partner in two carting concerns were indicted today on charges of having used threats of violence and death against a competitor to retrieve business the latter had won away from them.

title: Stalarow Cards 79 and 77 To Win Public Links Title
description: GARRISON  ON  HUDSON, N. Y., June 22James Stalarow of Salisbury won the 33d an nual public links championship of the Metropolitan Golf Asso ciation today by two strokes with a 79, 77156 over the 6,512yard par 35, 36171 North Redoubt Club course.

title: Toronto Rightists Assault Kunstler
description: TORONTO, Tuesday, June 23William M. Kunstler, the trial lawyer for the Chicago Seven, was beaten and knocked down by a group of rightists last night when he tried to deliver a speech. He apparently was not seriously hurt.

title: DEMOCRATIC VOTE BELOW A MILLION IS EXPECTED TODAY
description: Fewer than a million of the state's 3.6 million enrolled Dem ocrats are expected to vote to day to elect their party's can didates for Governor and Unit ed States Senator in the first full test of the 1967 New York primary election law.

title: AMERICANS CALLED INEFFECTIVE CRITICS
description: ST. LOUIS, June 22 (AP) Americans are uninformed, in effective critics of their politi cal institutions and complain ers about government who take no steps to make it better, a former Cabinet member said today.

title: U.S. Troop Total in Vietnam Termed Lowest in 40 Months
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22 (UPI)United States troop strength in South Viet nam is at its lowest point in nearly 40 months, American military spokesmen said today.

title: ERIE SETS BILL ON SOCIAL ISSUES
description: Senator Edmund S. Muskie announced here yesterday that he would introduce a bill in the Senate today that would give company shareholders a greater say on social issues.

title: Net Working Capital Is Up For Corporations In U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  Net working capital of United States corporations rose by $200million in the first quarter of this year after declining in the two previous quarters, the Securities and Exchange Com mission reported today.

title: Social Security Rise Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI) Senator Vance Hartke, Demo crat of Indiana, today proposed legislation to increase Social Security benefits by 20 per cent.

title: Jacklin Caddie Gets $3,000
description: CHASKA, Minn., June 22 (AP)Tom Murphy, 19year old Mankato State College stu dent, who shines shoes and works as a hotel night clerk, walked away from the United States Open golf championship yesterday with $3,000. He was the caddie for Tony Jacklin, the new champion. The sum represented 10 per cent of Jacklin's first prize of $30,000.

title: Bridge: Interest in World Play Shifts To 2d Place as U.S. Team Wins
description: STOCKHOLM, June 22 The United States players crushed their nearest rivals, Nationalist China, or Taiwan, in the 12th round of the world championship qualify ing stage here this afternoon, thus removing the faint mathematical chance that they would not reach the fi nal and also throwing wide open the race for the crucial second position.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: PRESIDENT MEETS 19 TOP EDUCATORS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)  President Nixon dis cussed student unrest for an hour and a half today with the presidents of 19 colleges and universities.

title: Benjamin Parran Sr., 72, Maryland Cattle Breeder
description: PRINCE FREDERICK, Md., June 22 (AP)Benjamin Par ran Sr., agriculturist and cattle breeder, died yesterday after a long illness at Calvert County Hospital. His age was 72.

title: ANNULMENT CHANGES BACKED BY VATICAN
description: The American bishop of the Roman Catholic Church have received permission from the Vatican to make a series of changes designed to speed the granting of annulments of mar riages involving Catholics.

title: Col. Cooper Reported Resigning as Astronaut
description: HOUSTON, June 22 (Reu ters)The astronaut corps is about to lose another of its charter members, sources close to the space program said today.

title: Merit System Experiment Challenges Traditional Army Methods for Training Recruits
description: CHICAGO, June 22By sub stituting an experimental merit system founded upon princi ples of education and learning for the traditional initiation rites of basic combat training, two Army doctors are challeng ing the theory that it is neces sary to break a recruit to make him into a welldisci plined soldier.

title: Accountant Named Officer Of I.O.S. in Switzerland
description: GENEVA, June 22Marvin H. Hoffman, formerly a member of Arthur Andersen & Co., auditors for Investors Overseas Services, has been appointed financial vice president of I.O.S., it was announced today.

title: Wells Fargo & Co. Revises Its Offering to Investors
description: Wells Fargo & Co., parent company of the Wells Fargo Bank, has announced that it has revised the terms of a pro posed Wells Fargo mortgage investors' offering through an amendment filed with the Securities and Exchange Com mission.

title: Miss Ann O'Hear Prospective Bride
description: WILMINGTON, Del., June 22The Rev. Dr. John Le gere O'Hear, rector of Christ Church Christiana Hundred (Episcopal), and Mrs. O'Hear have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Ann Berwick O'Hear, to Rob ert Silliman. He Is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Harper Silliman of Hagley, Montcha nin.

title: Jane Dorrance To Be Married
description: PENN VALLEY, Pa., June 22Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. John B. Dorrance Jr. of the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Ellen Dorrance, to Frank Alfred Craven, son of Mrs. Frank Tempest Craven of Yardley and the late Mr. Craven.

title: STAR IN DECATHLON CHALLENGES KANSAS
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 22 Is an athletic department ac countable to the rest of the University? How far does this jurisdiction go in its relation ship to the student athlete?

title: TROUBLES PILE UP IN CRIMINAL COURT
description: To most of the staff of the city's Criminal Court yester day, it looked like one more mammoth problem to add to all the rest.

title: High Court to Rule on Aid To ChurchTied Colleges
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  The Supreme Court agreed to day to rule on the constitution ality of Federal construction grants to churchrelated col leges and universities.

title: Senator With an Eye for Detail
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 As the rollcall moved inexo rably forward to overwhelm ing passage today, Robert Carlyle Byrd rested comfort ably in his backrow Senate seat, one hand to his mouth, and savored the dimensions of his victory.

title: HIGHT COURT RULES CITY MUST WIDEN JURYTRIAL RIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Supreme Court today de clared unconstitutional New York City's system of denying jury trials to persons accused of crimes that carry sentences of up to one year in prison.

title: Senate, 79 to 5, Reaffirms War Powers of President
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  The Senate, modifying its pending CooperChurch amendment, overwhelmingly ac knowledged today that the President, as Commander in Chief, had the power to take certain military actions in Cambodia.

title: 8 Seized in Quebec In Bombings Linked To Separatist Cause
description: MONTREAL, June 22Eight persons were arrested over the weekend in connection with a number of recent bombings in Montreal.

title: Controller Warns on Deals With J. P. Morgan & Co., Ltd.
description: The Controller of the Cur rency, William B. Camp, has warned banks against engaging in transactions with J. P. Mor gan & Co., Ltd., a concern not affiliated with the New York bank with a similar name.

title: Tax Conviction Appealed
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) A former West Virginia offi cial asked the Supreme Court today to review his conviction on income tax evasion charges. Clarence C. Elmore, former Commissioner of the West Vir ginia State Liquor Control Board, is seeking a review of his 1968 conviction and a de cision of the United States Ap peals in Richmond upholding the conviction and sentence of 18 months' imprisonment and $5,000 fine.

title: JANET LYNN EVANS
description: NASHVILLE, June 22 (UPI) Janet Lynn Evans, daughter of Amon Carter Evans, pub lisher of The Nashville Tennes sean, died yesterday of compli cations arising from Hodgkin's disease. She was 16 years old.

title: Anniversaries
description: WOODHappy anniversary to dearest baby blue eyes for making this year beautiful beyond belief. Perpetual love. Wife D.

title: SORENSEN'S MOTHER DIES AT 81 IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Mrs. Annis Chaikin Sorensen, the mother of Theodore C. Sorensen, a Democratic candi date for the Senate nomination from New York, died in a hos pital here today of cancer. She was 81 years old, and lived in Lincoln, Neb. Her husband, C. A. Sorensen, a former Attorney General of Nebraska, died in 1959.

title: CONSUMER AIDES LIST DEBT DECEIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  Senator William Proxmire, Ralph Nader, and a host of other advocates of consumer interests chronicled today de ceptive and threatening meth ods used by some creditors to collect debts that may or may not have been owed to them.

title: New U.S. Pullout Leaves 9,700 G.I.'s in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 22  Units of two Ameri can battalions reportedly pulled out of Cambodia today from border regions where they had been searching for enemy faci lities.

title: KLM Investigating Complaint Of Marijuana Use on a Flight
description: The Dutch airline KLM is in vestigating a complaint that some of the crew and most of the passengers on a recent stu dent charter flight to Europe were smoking marijuana and hashish.

title: Observer: New Directions
description: WASHINGTON, June 22If Congress ever enacts a Truth in Directions bill, one of the first outfits that should be brought into line is the brass polish trust. At present the di rections on the typical can of brass polish read somewhat as follows:

title: Concern Is Voiced By Treasury Chief On Trade Balance
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 22 Secretary of the Treasury David M. Kennedy expressed concern about the United States balance of trade here today and called for a corporate response to the Administration's proposal to de fer taxes on export profits.

title: Harry Lang, Long an Editor Of Jewish Daily Forward
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., June 22 (UPI)Harry Lang, who wrote of the rise of the Ameri can labor movement and of life on New York's Lower East Side, died today of pneumonia at the age of 81.

title: CANNONBALLS ARE BICENTENARY SIGN
description: A design of six cannonballs stacked as a triangle was se lected yesterday as New York State's symbol to mark the 200th anniversary of the Rev olutionary War, beginning in 1975.

title: POLICE CARS BURNED AFTER GIRL'S ARREST
description: Two police cars were set afire and a third was reported dam aged last night when a large crowd gathered outside an up per Manhattan police station after a young girl was taken into custody following a dispute among teenagers.

title: All Candidates Will Win They Say
description: The day before the primary election was a time for en couraging words at the head quarters of the Democratic gu bernatorial and senatorial can didates.

title: Pennsy Bond Symbol Changes Are Listed by Stock Exchange
5 Beaten Children Found in Bronx; Father Is Charged
description: A building superintendent in the Bronx was arrested last night after the police found two of his five children living alone in one of two apartments he apparently maintained, and found all five children with marks indicating they had been beaten.

title: Police Call In LongHaired Patrolman
description: A policeman who called a news conference a week ago to protest what he called de partmental harassment because of his long hair, said he had been treated like a criminal yesterday at a departmental hearing.

title: Young U. S. Tourists Flooding Britain, And There Isn't Enough Hotel Space
description: LONDON, June 22British tourist officials, who have been attracting young American travelers with the theme Lon don is a nonstop party, are hoping that the party may soon be over.

title: Steamship Company Named In Federal Antitrust Suit
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)  The Justice Department sought divestiture by the Amer ican Steamship Company of one of two competing Great Lakes steamship companies purchased by American last year.

title: Nixon Statement on Signing Voting Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Following is the text of the statement made by President Nixon today as he signed leg islation extending the Voting Rights Act of 1965 and low ering the minimum voting age to 18:

title: Today's Primaries
description: In the first test of New York State's new challenge primary law for the selection of gubernatorial candi dates, Democrats will go to the polls today to choose between Arthur J. Goldberg and Howard J. Samuels. Members of that party will also choose nominees for Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General and United States Senator. Democrats, as well as Republicans and members of the Conservative party, will make selec tions in nomination races for Congress and other offices.

title: ITALY ACTS TO END TEACHER BOYCOTT
description: ROME, June 22The Gov ernment decreed emergency measures tonight to assure endofterm and graduation ex aminations for more than three million students despite a boy cott by high school teachers unions.

title: N.B.A. Names Nucatola Supervisor of Officials
description: John Nucatola, supervisor of basketball officials for the Eastern College Athletic Con ference for the last 12 years, was named yesterday to a similar post with the Nation al Basketball Association. Nucatola replaces Dolph Schayes, who left the posi tion in March to become coach of the Buffalo Braves, the new N.B.A. franchise.

title: Article 1  No Title
Swon, Amateur, Wins Medal In Jersey Open Qualifying
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N. J., June 22Jerry Swon of Fair mont, an amateur, carded a twounderpar 36, 3369 to day at the Green Brook Coun try Club and led 62 qualifiers into the 50th New Jersey open championship.

title: Coach at Parsons Resigns
description: FAIRFIELD, Iowa, June 22 (AP)K. Wayne Williamson, athletic director and head foot ball coach at Parsons College since 1968, announced his res ignation today. He has ac cepted a position, effective Aug. 1, as athletic supervisor for the Hillsborough County Board of Instruction in Tampa, Fla.

title: Ideas for Those Not Counting Calories
