description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., June 26The engagement of Miss Louisa Ogden Dixon to Samuel E. Walker has been announced here by her par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Paul R. B. Dixon. The wedding will take place on Aug. 22 in Omaha.

title: Washington State Bans ClayFrazier Title Boat
description: TACOMA, Wash., June 26 (AP)  The Washington State Athletic Commission refused today to grant Cassius Clay a boxing license to fight the heavyweight champion, Joe Frazier, in the state.

title: COUNTY IN CAROLINA SUED ON SCHOOL BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)  The Government filed suit against Calhoun County School District 1 in South Caro lina today for operating a seg regated school system.

title: Ecology Bill of Rights is Proposed by Nickel
description: CHICAGO, June 26 (AP) Walter J. Nickel, Secretary of the Interior, proposed today an environmental bill of rights because we have pol luted the American dream.

title: The Kronhausens' Film, 'Feedom to Love,' Starts Run Here
description: Despite certain aspirations to high seriousness (and certain achievements in low camp), "Freedom to Love," at the Cine Lido, is for the most part another of those movies in which specialists offer Kinsey statistics and Playboy pieties on the soundtrack while assorted young couples have at it with great vigor and in some detail on the screen.But as written, directed and jointly narrated by Drs. Phyllis and Eberhard Kronhausen (authors, editors, teachers, psychologists, art collectors, Ph.D.'s and, according to the press release, "two of the world's foremost advocates of sexual freedom"), the film views its garden of delights with all the appetitive stimulation of a dietitian imagining marshmallow salad.But the nonfictional episodes are a different, more pleasurable, more ridiculous matter. These range from excerpts out of real dirty plays (for example, Michael McClure's excellent "The Beard") to an interview with Hugh Hefner (trying to be urbane, and very funny), to an exhibition of erotic art in which the obsessions of the ages are displayed and guilt-free children wander around pulling at a plastic penis.To open the exhibition, held in Lund, Sweden, the statuesque and fortyish Dr. Phyllis Kronhausen emerged, fully clothed, from a piece of plush sculpture called the "Womb Tomb." The event is chronicled in "Freedom to Love," and for sheer inappropriateness it is the film's best moment.Miserably written, poorly acted and dreadfully dubbed, the frictional episodes "illustrate" (surely the wrong word) the dilemmas faced by impetuous youth ("Yes, Chuck, I'm only 15."), jaded adults, consenting Lesbians, naughty little girls, and others in this as yet insufficiently Kronhausened world of ours. A depressing aura, as of ancient Danish modern, hangs over these episodes; and although the girls are sometimes ripe, the boys are usually muscular and the practices occasionally quirky, they never make up in physical energy what they lack in cinematic flair.The second best moment also involves a bit of erotic art, I guess. It is an early animated cartoon, of the 1920's, according to the Kronhausens, featuring a magnificently equipped Barney Google character, who, on his three legs, roams the landscape having happy adventures  one of which turns up an enterprising temptress with bedroom eyes and lascivious lips.

title: CANADA HIGH COURT BACKS BREATH TEST
description: OTTAWA, June 26The Su preme Court of Canada upheld today the new Federal law re quiring a motorist to give a sample of his breath to the po lice if asked.

title: U.S. Awaits Arab Reaction
description: WASHINGTON, June 26The United States refused today to consider the speech by Presi dent Gamal Abdel Nasser in Libya yesterday as the final word on the American peace plan.

title: ECONOMIC INDEX DECLINED IN MAY
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy declined by eighttenths of 1 per cent in May, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: JUDGE ASKS TIMES TO REVEAL SOURCE
description: BALTIMORE, June 26  Fed eral Judge Roszel C. Thomsen asked The New York Times to day to divulge voluntarily the source of its article concerning a secret grand jury report charging a Baltimore contractor with trying to defraud the Unit ed States Government.

title: Leningrad Jew Says 8 Held Are Innocent
description: MOSCOW, June 27  A Leningrad Jew, in a letter to the Soviet Prosecutor General, has protested the detention of eight Jews in connection with an alleged hijacking plot in which 12 other persons are be ing held.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Among the bestremembered banners unfurled for the Mets at the Polo Grounds was this: Is Kranepool Over The Hill? Ed Kranepool was 18 years old 14 the time. A few years later, as he came to bat at Shea Stadium, the fan who offers flashcard comments held up a Sign with one word: Superstiff. Last season, en route to the pennant, Kranepool recalled his youth as a chamber of horrors. He said that if he could have looked ahead he never would have signed with the Mets. Kranepool is not quite a Met any more. Earlier in the week, the Mets requested waivers from every other National League team and either no one wanted to claim Kranepool or there was a routine gentlemen's agree ment to let him go. He was assigned on option to the Mets' minor league team in Tidewater, Va., presumably to get his hit ting together. But more likely, after nine seasons as a Met, Ed Kranepool is finally over the hill. He is now 25 years old.

title: E.E.C. GETS PLAN TO EASE MERGED.
description: BRUSSELS, June 26  The Executive Commission of the. European Economic Commu nity, in an effort to spur estab lishment of Europeanbased multinational companies, has submitted a plan to the six member states that would fa cilitate mergers across frontiers.

title: Israeli Architects Honored
description: BOSTON, June 26 (AP)The American Institute of Archi tects has given its R. S. Reyn olds Memorial Award for com munity architecture to the architects of Beersheba, a re constructed city in the Israeli desert. Prof Hanan Pave11, dep uty director of the Israel Min istry of Housing, accepted the award yesterday at the insti tute's convention.

title: Provocative Child Agency Head
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 My politics are children, Dr. Edward Frank Zigler said today upon being sworn in as the first director of the Office of Child Development.

title: Nixon Asks Senate To Act on Reform Of Welfare Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) The Nixon Administration prodded the Senate today to act on welfare reform and signed a $2.3million contract with Vermont for a partial test of the proposed family assist ance measure.

title: Black Firm Applies to Exchange
description: The New York Stock Ex change has received its first application for membership from a securities concern owned and controlled by blacks.

title: Illegal Booking by Charter Flight Agents Stalls Many at Kennedy
description: Dreams of European vaca tions have turned into night mares this summer for count less travelers because of illegal practices by some travel agents and airlines.

title: SOYBEAN TRADING SETS PRICE MARK
description: Futures prices of agricultural products continued to occupy the commodities markets lime light yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Identity, Values, Loneliness, Direction: Themes of ParentStudent Debate
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J. It was students versus mothers here the other eveningand the students won.

title: Both Goldberg and Rockefeller Cite State Issues in Campaign
description: Arthur J. Goldberg called yesterday for television debates with Governor Rockefeller and said that Rockefeller's going to get the surprise of his life if he concentrates on state is sues.

title: Fund to Aid Rumanians
description: VIENNA, June 26 (UPI)The United States Embassy in Bucharest said today it had canceled its traditional Fourth of July party and would give the money usually spent on it to Rumanian relief to aid those who suffered losses in the re cent floods.

title: Cat Bird Wins Open Jumper Title
Bonn to Lower Voting Age
description: BONN, June 26 (Renters) The West German Bundesrat today papsed a bill lowering the voting age, from 21 to 18. The measure will entitle about two million young people to vote in the next federal elec tions scheduled for 1973.

title: Kinshasa: Streets Safer, but Oh, the Graft
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, June 25Newcomers to this dusty capital, recalling the violence that marked the early years of the Congo's independence, still sometimes ask with concern whether it is safe to walk about town.

title: Jane Bastanchury And Cathy Gaughan Gain Final in Golf
description: EL CAJON, Calif., June 27 (AP)The, defending champion, Jane Bastanchury, and her Arizona State teammate, Cathy Gaughan, will meet for the Na tional Women's Intercollegiate golf title in tomorrow's 36hole final after winning their matches today.

title: INNOVATIONS PART OF MORTGAGE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 An emergency housing bill with potentially major implica tions for home building and for the financial markets headed to a SenateHouse conference to day after passage last night by the House of Representatives.

title: Jay C. Wegrzyn Weds Cathie Kerns on Coast
description: PACIFIC BEACH, Calif., June 26Capt. Cathie Lydia To Kerns, U.S.A., was mar ried at Christ Lutheran Church here this evening to Jay Charles Wegrzyn, a for mer Air Force captain, who is a real estate broker in Monterey. The Rev. Lawrence Yoder performed the cere mony.

title: GUILTY PLEA FILED IN TRENTON TRIAL
description: TRENTON, June 26One of the codefendants of Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark pleaded guilty in Federal court today to a charge of income tax evasion.

title: Jewish Leaders Seek a New Coalition
description: CLEVELAND, June 26Spe cialists in Jewish intergroup relations called today for im mediate formation of a coati Ition of black, labor, academic, religious and white ethnic mi nority groups to cope with the divisiveness and social ills that confront the nation.

title: Marc Sinclaire, On His Own
description: Marc Sinclaire, the hair dresser, has moved up in the world. Physically, that is. He has left his underground stand at the Charles of the Ritz salon and moved into sunny, airy quarters of his own on the second floor of the town house at 115 East 55th Street. Although Mr. Sinclaire, 35, is the blueeyed dar ling of many long  maned so cialites and has been a hairdress er for 15 years, he has never had a shop of his own in New York. (Before his sojourn at Charles of the Ritz, he fol lowed Kenneth as the star of the now defunct Lilly Dach shop.)

title: Politics of Disunity
description: The National Education Association, in recent Senate testimony, has cut through the statistical fog that long obscured the truth about school desegregation in many Southern districts.

title: Tutwiler Gets 2Shot Edge In Northeast Amateur Golf
description: RUMFORD, R. I., June 26 Ed Tutwiler of Indianapolis carded an even par 69 today and held a twostroke lead in the ninth annual Northeast am ateur invitation golf tour nament at the Wannamoisett Country Club.

title: SOVIET SAID TO ACT ON MIDEAST PEACE
description: MOSCOW, June 26  The Soviet Union was reported to day to have shown renewed interest in recent weeks in reaching a negotiated settle ment of the Middle East crisis. Reliable diplomatic sources said that, in conversations in Western capitals, the Russians had underlined the seriousness of the situation and the need for a settlement.

title: Attacks on Firemen Hamper Recruiting In Many Big Cities
description: CLEVELAND, June 23Fire House No. 9, in Cleveland's East Side ghetto, has all the ear marks of a police station. Squad cars are parked in the drive way. Armed policemen stand guard. They have been on duty since firemen were shot at a few weeks ago.

title: Frenn and Tom Hill Take National A.A.U. Crowns
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., June 26Returning to the scene of one of his most embarrassing experiences in track and field, George Frenn won his first na tional Amateur Athletic Union outdoor championship in the hammer throw tonight.

title: City Planning Post Is Filled
description: The appointment of Alex ander Garbin, 29 years old, as chief of the City Planning Com mission's housing and commu nity development section was announced yesterday by Donald H. Elliott, chairman of the com mission.

title: 119 Nations in a Conference at San Francisco Commemorate 25th Anniversary of Signing of U.N. Charter
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 26 (AP)  Speakers commemo rating the signing of the United Nations Charter here 25 years ago pleaded today for peace in Indochina, a set tlement in the Middle East and general acceptance of postwar European borders.

title: GOODELL WILL AID ROCKEFELLER DRIVE
description: Senator Charles E. Goodell declared yesterday that he would campaign for the re election of Governor Rockefel ler but that he Would not cam paign directly against Arthur J. Goldberg, the Governor's Dem ocraticLiberal opponent.

title: $480,000 IS GIVEN 19 L.I. BUS LINES
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday a $480,000 grant to clean and maintain equipment on 19 private bus lines in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: Shipping/Mails
Jaycees Elect Ohioan in 24 Ballots
description: ST. LOUIS, June 26 (AP) Gordon B. Thomas of Toledo, Ohio, was elected president of the United States Jaycees today after 24 ballots.

title: Lombardi Faces Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) Coach Vince Lombardi will undergo exploratory abdominal surgery tomorrow morning at Georgetown University Hospi tal, the Washington Redskins announced today. Lombardi en tered the hospital last Tuesday suffering from a stomach vi rus.

title: U.S. May Store Gas on Isle
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reu ters) A special Defense De partment team is studying Johnston Island in the South Pacific as a possible storage site for 13,000 tons of poison gas that the United States Is moving from Okinawa, the Pentagon said today. It said the group, which went to John ston Island nine days ago, would report hack to Washing ton over the weekend.

title: Violence Erupts as Miss Devlin Enters Ulster Prison
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, June 26Miss Berna dette Devlin, 23yearold Member of Parliament and volatile civilrights leader, went to prison tonight for riotous behavior during vio lence between Roman Cath olics and Protestants last summer. Her request for per mission to appeal to the House of Lords against a sentence of six months' im prisonment was denied by the Appeals Court. Her jail ing was the signal for an outbreak of violence in Bog side in Londonderry as youths clashed with the Brit ish garrison. There was trou ble also in Belfast, but disturbances there were sparked by a march by the Protestant Orange Order. As the marchers passed the Catholic area of Ardoyne, crowds of youths be gan throwing bottles and stones. They ignored orders to disperse and troops fired 24 canisters of riot gas.

title: CONTROL OF HEROIN LAID TO 15 IN MAFIA
description: William M. Tendy, assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District, told members of the House Select Committee on Crime yesterday that about 15 Mafia figures were respop sible for almost 85. per cent of the heroin being brought il legally into the East Coast.

title: STORM SUSPENDS N.C.A.A. GOLF PLAY
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 26 (AP)Lanny Wadkins of Wake Forest held a twostroke lead after 45 holes when rain sus pended play in the 73d National Collegiate Athletic Association universitydivision golf tourna ment at the Ohio State course.

title: Auction of Dealer's '70 Automobiles Brings $344,000
description: Nearly 200 new and used 1970 Chevrolets, about half the automobile inventory of Prince Chevrolet, Inc., of Brooklyn, were offered at an auction yesterday at its showroom at 5323 18th Ave nue, in the Bensonhurst sec tion. The retail value of the 200 ears was estimated at $500,000. A total of 103 was auctioned for $344.000.

title: PRICES ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange closed steady in quiet trading yesterday.

title: SAW NO BRIBE GIVEN, POLICEMAN SWEARS
description: A suspended New York pa trolman said yesterday that he had not seen a Bronx gambler give one of his fellow policemen a bribe when the police raided the gambler's apartment in 1968.

title: Antiques: Made of Heir
description: Despite all the talk about hair these days, there as not yet been a run, on the hair work objects and Jewelry that were fashionable for a good part of the 19th cen tury.

title: JUDGE REJECTS PLAN ON RICHMOND PUPILS
description: RICHMOND, June 26 (AP) A Federal judge rejected a Gov ernment proposal today for de segregating Richmond schools on the neighborhood school principle and took under ad visement a plan, put forth by Negro leaders, relying heavily on school busing.

title: Harold H. Corbin, 80, a Lawyer For Prominent Figures, Is Dead
description: Harold Harlow Corbin, a de fense lawyer who represented many figures of the underworld and public life for more than half century, died at his apart ment yesterday after a long ill ness. He was 80 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue.

title: Administration Appears to Shift On Tax Break for White Schools
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The Nixon Administration, which last month argued in favor of Federal taxexempt status for segregated Southern private schools, appeared to day to have backed away from that position.

title: RULE ON BUSING PLAN ASKED OF HIGH COURT
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP)  The National Educa tion Association has asked the Supreme Court to overturn ruling by the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit in a school desegrega tion case involving the Char lotteMecklenburg County, N. C., Board of Education.

title: MRS. S. MAX ABELSON
description: Mrs. Esther Abelson, an early leader of the suffragette movement In Rhode Island, died Thursday night of a heart attack at her home, 25 Tudor City Place. She was 79 years old.

title: A Correction
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  Because of dropped lines, an article in yesterday's New York Times on President Nixon's or der to increase timber cutting in the national forests had the following passage: Mr. Nixon said the increased cutting should be consistent with sustained yieldthere must be money for manpower to plant new trees. The passage should have read: Mr. Nixon said the increased cutting should he consistent with sustained yield, environ mental quality and multiple use objectives. But to insure sus tained yield, there must he money for manpower to plant new trees.

title: COUNCIL IS CLOSE TO VOTING CHANGE IN RENT CONTROL
description: The City Council headed early today toward approving a ma jor revision of the city's 27 yearold rent control law that Would raise rents Aug. 1 by 8 to 15 per cent for most fam ilies living in controlled apart ments.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE TO FALL
description: After a shortlived effort to irise yesterday, prices on the American Stock Exchange re suited their downward bourse, taping the index down 0.15 to 20.22, its lowest level since May 27. On that date the index stood at 19.96.

title: BRITANNICA SUES ON MAILING LISTS
description: CHICAGO, June 26Encyclo pedia Britannica, Inc., charged here today that three former computer operators for the com pany obtained and sold without authorization its confidential customer list of about 2 mil lion names and addresses. The suit, filed in Cook. Coun ty Circuit Court asked exem plary damages of $1million from the three men and one company, and actual damages to be determined by the court. The suit estimated that actual loss exceeded $3million.

title: Crucial CityState Issue
description: As Governor Rockefeller and Arthur J. Goldberg square off for their gubernatorial contest, the central problem facing the state is epitomized in the budget New York City has just adopted to pay for street cleaning, public safety, schools, welfare and other municipal services in the next twelve months.

title: MADDOX LIFTS BAN ON TWO NEWSPAPERS
description: ATLANTA, June 26 (AP) Gov. Lester G. Maddox re moved his ban on sales of two Atlanta newspapers at the state Capitol today.

title: House Painter Is Charged With Drowning His Son, 3
description: A house painter was held without bail yesterday on charge that he had killed his threeyearold son by forcing water down, the child's throat, causing him to drown.

title: Banks to Sell Food Stamps
description: BOSTON, June 26 (AP)Gov. Francis. W. Sargent signed a bill yesterday to allow statechar tered savings banks, trust com panies and cooperative banks to sell food stamps. Merchants will be able to redeem stamps at the institutions for cash.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: MISSILE HITS JET IN MIDEAST FLIGHT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 26 A missile damaged an Italian jetliner flying near Damascus, Syria, today.

title: Senate Redefines Proposal to Curb War in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 The Senate today redefined once again the proposed amendment to limit Presiden tial authority to conduct mili tary operations in Cambodia.

title: West German Equestrians Win Aachen Jumping Prize
description: AACHEN, West Germany, June 26 (AP)  West Ger many won the Prize of the Na tions jumping competition of the Aachen international horse show today, with Britain sec ond and the United States third.

title: Cheri Rosenbluth Bride in Florida
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 26 Miss Cheri Rosenbluth who sings in nightclubs and on television as Cheri Royce, and Ezra Millstein, owner and president of Advertising, Re search, Marketing, Inc., in Miami, were married this afternoon in the Plaza Hotel.

title: Special Jury to Investigate 2 Chicago Panther Deaths
description: CHICAGO, June 26A special Cook County prosecutor was appointed today to impanel a special grand jury and reopen an investigation into the slaying of two Black Panther party members in a predawn police raid here last December.

title: AIRLINES WARNED ON MAIL THEFTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 Post Office Department of ficials warned today that, un less airlines take adequate pre cautions against mail theft at airports, they will face stiff fines ranging up to $1,000 for for each piece of mail that is stolen.

title: RAIN SPOILS PLAY IN 36HOLE FINAL
description: ESSEX FELLS, N. J., June 26 Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of the Essex County Country Club won the 67th annual Women's Metropolitan Golf Association championship today.

title: Foster's Educated Right Rated Too Much for Texas Teacher
description: BALTIMORE, June 26Bob Foster will defend his world lightheavyweight title tomor row night against an unusual challenger. Mark Tessman, a 23yearold Texan.

title: U. of Maryland Regents Name First Chancellor
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., June 26 (AP)The appointment of Dr. Charles Edwin Bishop, 49 years old, of Chapel Hill, N.C., to be the first chancel lor of the University of Mary land at College Park was approved today by the Board of Regents.

title: A Sure Winner for Presidency Is Campaigning Hard in Mexico
description: TANTOYUCA, Mexico, June 18To the twang of country guitars, a quartet of singers wearing straw hats and red ker chiefs improvised verses of po litical tribute.

title: $272,000 German Holdup
description: OFFENBACH, West Germapy, June 26 (Reuters)Four men, one with a submachine gun, held up an unarmored bank truck here today and escaped with one million marks ($272, 000) in this country's biggest postwar robbery, the police re ported. The truck was halted while transferring money from the municipal savings bank's central office to a branch.

title: S.E.C. HEAD TELLS OF SWEIG MEETING
description: Dr. Martin Sweig, then an aide to House Speaker John W. McCormack, accompanied a client of Nathan M. Voloshen to a meeting with the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission at which the client sought to have trading of his company's stock resumed, it was testified yesterday.

title: Agnew and McCormack Sign 1970 Code on Fair Campaign Practices
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI)Vice President Agnew signed a clean politics pledge in behalf of the Republican party today. The pledge is incorporated in the 1970 Fair Campaign Practices Code.

title: Gun Position in North Vietnam Attached by U.S. Navy Plane
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam June 26 (AP)  The United States Command announced to day that a United States Navy escort plane attacked gun posi tions deep inside North Viet nam yesterday after the guns had fired on a reconnaissance aircraft the Navy plane was es corting.

title: Soviet Bloc Indicates It Is Ready To Study Pullback With NATO
description: LONDON, June 26The So viet bloc gave a new indication today that it was willing to dis cuss with the North Atlantic alliance a reduction of forces in Europe.

title: Nixon Aide Denies Letters on Official Stationery Helped Brother
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  Harry S. Dent, a special counsel to President Nixon, denied to day that he was attempting to solicit business for his brother's housing company in South Caro lina when he wrote letters on White House stationery to Ne groes in the state.

title: Brooklyn Principal Beaten by 5 Posing as Newsmen to Get
description: A 64yearold Brooklyn prin cipal was beaten in his office yesterday by five men who gained admission by posing as newsmen.

title: World Organizations Make Up a Growing World of Their Own
description: BRUSSELS, June 19  The universe of international or ganizations includes behe moths like the United Na tions but admits some very junior partners as well.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Boston at New York (2:15 P.M.) Peters (4.7) vs. Wasiewski (12).

title: Catholic Superiors Take Activist Role
description: DAYTON, Ohio, June 26  The prestigious Conference of Major Superiors of Men made its debut this week in the arena of social action after 13 years of strictly fraternal, private an nual gatherings.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
Woman Employe Wounded In Manhattan Bank Holdup
description: Two gunmen wounded a sec retary during a holdup in bank in lower Manhattan yes terday and then escaped with more than $4,000.

title: Ticket Office Moved
description: Tickets for threeday rock festival at the Power. Ridge Ski Area near Middlefield, Conn., which will run from July 31 through Aug. 2, will be on sale at 144 East 57th Street in stead of 200 West 57th Street as previously announced. Tick ets are $20 for the weekend.

title: TREASURY SETS SALE FOR U.S. BILL ISSUE
description: The Treasury announced yes terday plans to sell $2.5billion of tax anticipation bills matur ing next March.

title: Pentagon Says List of War Prisoners Is Incomplete
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  The Defense Department today rejected as incomplete and un acceptable a list of prisoners of war compiled by a peace group in New York and de scribed by Hanoi as a com plete list of the Americans it holds.

title: JERSEY INSURERS FACE A 90DAY BAN ON CANCELLATIONS
description: SPRING LAKE, N. J., June 26 Confronted by a flood of in surance policy cancellations, the State of New Jersey today declared a 90day emergency moratorium on the termination of all homeowner and automo bile insurance policies and other lines of personal cover age.

title: U.S. Confirms Its Decision To Expel a Pravda Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) The State Department con firmed today that a Soviet correspondent for Pravda in New York, Boris M. Orekhov, was being expelled because of nonjournalistic activity hos tile to the interests of the United States.

title: Miss Roberta Schwartz to Be a Bride
description: LONGMEADOW, Mass., June 26Mr. and Mrs. Albert Schwartz have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Roberta Ann Schwartz, to Robert Kanof Tendler. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Max Tendler of Washington.

title: Hermann B. Deutsch Dies at 81; New Orleans ColumnistAuthor
description: Hermann B. Deutsch, a columnist for The New Orleani StatesItem, died Thursday in New York on his way to Poly clinic Hospital after suffering a heart attack at a board meet ing of the Channing Fund, an investment group at 285 Park Avenue. He was 81 years old and lived in New Orleans.

title: COUPLE CONVICTED IN CONTEMPT CASE
description: WASHINGTON, June 26A United States District Court I jury today found Alan and Mar garet McSurely, former civil rights and antipoverty activists, guilty on two counts each of contempt of Congress.

title: FOUR AUSTRALIANS IN QUARTERFINALS
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 26  One Australian expatri ate beat another today as Bob (Nails) Carmichael finally set Wimbledon alight by crushing Bob Hewitt in straight sets to reach the quarterfinals of the AllEngland tennis champion ships, along with John New combe, Tony Roche and Ken Rosewall, Australians who live in their homeland some of the time.

title: Stars of Faith Fill Garden of Museum With Joyful Energy
description: The Jazz in the Garden series at the Museum of Mod ern Art took a turn for the gos pel Thursday night, with the first local appearance in sev eral years of the Stars of Faith. While the fivevoice, Philadel phiabased ensemble (a sixth member was ill) may not gen erate as much raw excitement as some other gospel groups, there is an exhilarating free dom to its work, a joyful spirit fired by more than average musicality.

title: WOLLMAN OPENER GETS FULL HOUSE
description: The summerlong pop music series at Wollman Rink in Cen tral Park, the Schaefer Music Festival, began on Thursday night with what was, on the surface, a surefire program Ray Charles and his orchestra and the Raelets, his quartet of girl singers.

title: Astros Obtain Geiger
description: HOUSTON, June 26 (UPI) Gary Geiger, an outfielder who played with Cleveland, Boston and Atlanta, was purchased to night by the Houston Astros from their Oklahoma City team. Geiger, who was hitting 335 at Oklahoma City, will replace Norm Miller, who left for two weeks of Army Reserve train ing.

title: Bridge
description: STOCKHOLM, June 26 Six young Dallas experts, Jim Jacoby, Bob Wolff, Bill Eisen berg, Bob Goldman, Mike Lawrence and Bob Hammin, received their world cham pionship trophies here this afternoon from Princess Christina of Sweden.Receiving the Bermuda Bowlthe first Americans to do so since 1954were the team captain, Oswald Jacoby, and the deputy captain, Ira Corn Jr., and all of them wondered what would have happened if the Italian Blue Team had been here to de fend the trophy it won on 10 successive occasions from 1957 through 1969.

title: Charges Fly On Pollution In Stamford
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 26 A company charged with pollution here has leveled the same charge against City Hall in what is growing into a fullblown ecological war.

title: Frederic J. Torphy, a Lawyer, Marries Elizabeth Anne Ryan
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., June 26 Miss Elizabeth Anne Ryan and Frederic 3. Torphy were married at noon today in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James K. Bogert, who also celebrated the nuptial mass. There was a reception at the Southward Ho Country Club.

title: Syria Claims 11 Planes
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 26 Syria reported shooting down 11 Israeli planes today.

title: Charleston, Home Of Catfish Row, Stages First Porgy
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., June 26 The goat cart that pulled Porgy to international fame brought him home to Charles ton this week for the first time since the musical had its premiere 35 years ago.

title: Pele to Stay With Santos
description: SANTOS, Brazil, June 26 (AP) Pls, the world's most famous soccer player, said today, it is certain he would remain with his home club, Santos, for two more seasons. Then, he says, he will retire. Pele re vealed that during the World Cup, tournament he had re ceived offers from Mexico and Germany.

title: Widgeon Gains Slight Lead In Yacht Race to Tahiti
description: LOS ANGELES, June 26 (UPI)  Another change in the winds provided the Los Angelesto Tahiti yacht race with its third leader in three days today as Widgeon took a slight lead on the 12th day.

title: MUSIC FESTIVAL TO OPEN UPSTATE
description: MOUNTAINDALE, N, Y., June 26A summerlong series of Bach to Rock concerts that its promoters say will at tract 50,000 patrons a day will open in this tiny Sullivan County community on Tuesday, July 7.

title: $43.3Million Renovation Is Due At Morgan Postal Station Here
description: WASHINGTON, June 26  The Post Office Department an nounced today plans to spend $43.3million to renovate the Morgan Postal Station in Man hattan, which was damaged by fire in December, 1967.

title: NASKRA AND TATO?? CHIEF CONTENDERS; Belmont, Spring Meet Ends TodayMeritus Captures and Pays $9.60
description: The spring meeting at Bel mont Park will end today with the Saranac Handicap serving as the feature on the ninerace program. To the great vocal majority of local fans, the de nouement is a happy occasion, for froth Monday on through Aug. 1 the thoroughbred ac tivity will swtich to the more popular Aqueduct.

title: STANFORD PROVOST NAMED ACTING HEAD
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., June 26 Richard W. Lyman, provost at Stanford University, was named acting president of the school tonight, effective Sept 1, when Dr. Kenneth S. Pitzer will formally step down.

title: Thomas C. Robbins, 77, A Senior Golf Champion
description: PINEHURST, N. C., June 26 (AP)Thomas C. Robbins, win ner of several major senior golf championships in the 1950's died of cancer at a Pinehurst hospital today at the age of 77.

title: TAX ACCOUNTANT IS CONVICTED HERE
description: An accountant who prepared tax returns for foreign musi cians and opera singers was convicted late Thursday by al Federal Court jury of having) made false statements in their tax forms and of having given illegal gratuities to Internal) Revenue Service employes.

title: LANDLORD AGREES TO ACCEPT A WHITE
description: NEWARK, June 26  A set tlement was reached today on charges brought against a white landlord who had been accused of excluding a tenant because she was not black.

title: Better Dead Cambodians Than Red
description: LONDON, June 26Ameri can forces have warned Cam bodian rice field workers that they are in danger of being hit if they run for cover or look suspicious when U.S. helicop ters fly over them, qualified sources said....

title: Massachusetts Housing
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP) The Department of Housing and Urban Development has ap proved a $1.26million grant for Pittsfield. Mass., for construc tion of 50 units of low income housing. Representative Silvio O. Conte, Republican of Massa chusetts, also announced yes terday department approval of a $538,000 grant for Spring field, Mass., for construction of a 32unit housing project for the elderly.

title: STOCK PRICES SAG IN SLOW TRADING
description: The stock market sagged again yesterday following an abortive attempt at a rally during the early trading. Vol ume on the New York Stock Exchange was not heavy, con cluding a week of generally spiritless activity.

title: Federal Contracts Awarded to Find a Safer Car
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (UPI) The Transportation Depart ment awarded today two sets of contracts, one to produce safer car and the other to eliminate drunken drivers from the highway.

title: Save the Side Streets
description: No one really seems to know how the area from 86th to 96th Street between Fifth and Park Avenues got to be zoned solidly R10, but that is how turned out in the revised zoning law of 1961. To translate numbers into buildings, this means that the verylarge apartment houses permitted on the avenues are also permitted on the side streets in these ten blocks. Below 86th, the side streets are zoned R8, which preserves valleys of smaller structures and lower densities between the avenue blockbusters.

title: U.S. Vows Suits in South For Fall Pupil Integration
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., June 26 The Nixon Administration will begin filing desegregation suits against recalcitrant Southern school districts next week un less local and state officials can work out acceptable plans to end discrimination in the public schools next fall, a top Justice Department official said today.

title: Topics: America Is Part of the Body Count
description: I've seen elaborate wreaths by the plaque which commemo rates the six million Jewish dead. I've seen dramatic flower arrangements, and streamers with gilt letters proclaiming sorrow. Since my afternoon walks take me past there, on Riverside Promenade at 83d Street, I've gotten used to it. But a couple of weeks ago came on something different. A simple cardboard leaned against the fence which pro tects the plaque. And on it somebody had written:

title: William Heisig And Mrs. Jones Married on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L.I., June 26 Mrs. MaryRose Jones, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Mackay of Locust Valley and grandaughter of the late Clarence H. Mackay, who was board chairman of the Postal Telegraph and Cable Company, was married this morning to William T. Heisig of Locust Valley.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: A major war effort weighs heavily on our institutions and on our economy. But the ap proach of the critics of the Ad ministration is a wholly nega tive one. The President has only one policy often statedto hold the line in Vietnam until the South Vietnamese Army is in a position to take over, this to coincide with a substantial withdrawal of our troops.

title: Dubcek Is Expelled From Czech Party
description: VIENNA, June 26Alexan der Dubcek was expelled from the Czechoslovak Communist party today, the Czechoslovak press agency C.T.K. reported. The expulsion was decided by a majority vote of the party's Central Committee, which met in Hradcany Castle in Prague.

title: Mount Elbrus in Soviet Is Scaled by U.S. Team
description: MOSCOW, June 26 (UPI) A threeman team from the United States has scaled Mount Elbrus, highest peak in the. Caucasus, and planted the American flag atop it, an expedition members said to day.

title: Radcliffe to Get $10Million
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 26 (AP)Radcliffe College has raised $7.5million from alum nae, parents, friends and indus try and thus qualified for a $2.5million Ford Foundation grant offered three years ago on a 3for1 basis. The funds will help pay for a new dormi tory and for housing for tutors and associates.

title: Rubber Footwear Industry Asks For Examination of Quota Needs
description: WASHINGTON, June 26The first harpy flew out Pandora's box today following the Nixon Administration's endorsement of import quotas on textiles. The rubber foot wear industry, asserting that it was far more damaged by imports than textiles, de manded that the Administra tion and the Congress ex amine the need for quotas. Previously, the industry had been interested only in pre serving a relatively high tariff.

title: Books of The Times
description: The titles are pointers, to the subject matter and to the emotional climate of the two books. Both deal with the Hoover Administration and with the agonizing, the violence, the hopelessness and the dis illusion that were so notably parts of it. Mr. Ellis, a longtime newspaperman and author of The Epic of New York City, goes furtherinto the New Deal meas ures that fought the Depression. He de scribes the circumstances, the infighting and some of the results surrounding the creation of the labormanagement indus trial codes (N.R.A.), the agricultural acts (A.A.A.), and the public work projects that paid money directly to the men employed on them (W.P.A.).

title: STOP WATCH PACES GRAHAM CRUSADES
description: Cliff Barrows, sitting in the center of a platform in the in field of Shea Stadium one night last week, turned a small knob and watched a white warning light appear on the lecturn where the Rev. Billy Graham was preaching.

title: Blare of Hartford Politics Mutes Critical Problem
description: HARTFORD, June 26In this capital city these days most of the talk is of politics.

title: Brenda Johnson, '66 Debutante, Engaged to John Howard Dick
description: MARION, Mass., June 26 Mr. and Mrs. William Shaw have announced the engagement of Mrs. Shaw's daughter, Miss Brenda Marsh Johnson, to John Howard Dick. He is the son of Al bert Blake Dick 3d of Lake Forest, Ill., and the late Mrs. John S. Wyper, the former Elisabeth York, of West Hartford, Conn. Miss John son is the daughter also of Orlan A. Johnson of Gates Mills. Ohio.

title: Rightists Scrutinize Schools
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 26 The school year in West chester County, marked as in many other places by pro test on the left, has closed on a note of concern along school administrators about activity on the right.

title: GUNS FOUND IN RAID ON PANTHER'S HOME
description: NEW HAVEN, June 26Fed eral authorities charged the Wife of a Black Panther leader in Bridgeport today with il legal possession of firearms.

title: News Executives Briefed By President on the War
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 26  President Nixon told a closeddoor meeting of editors and executives from major news organizations today that he had chosen the course of orderly withdrawal from South Vietnam to reinforce America's role in world affairs and thus secure a lasting peace.

title: Theater: Oriental Rock
description: Of course, you expect the unexpected at the Cafe La Mama, but I must confess I never expected anything quite so unexpected as the Japanese rock musical Gold en Bat, which I saw there last weekend.

title: BANK GROUP MAKES BIG LOAN TO PERU
description: Completion of a $94.1million refinancing agreement between Peru and a consortium of 11 American banks was announced yesterday by Manufacturers Hanover Trust, the leading bank in the group.

title: DEMOCRATS MEET IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, June 26  The Democratic state convention opened tonight with United States Representative Emilio Q. (Mim) Daddario as the sole can didate for Governor and four men battling for the seat of Senator Thomas J. Dodd.

title: Falling in Love AgainWith Gainsborough?
description: LONDON. ONE of the most fascinat ing and worthwhile changes in artistic ap preciation that has oc curred recently has been the revival of interest in 18th century British painting. It is now seen with fresh eyes and a deeper appreciation of its European status.

title: Article 5  No Title
Job Changes:
description: Major executive changes have been announced by the Collins & Aikman Corpora tion a textile manufacturer.

title: G.O.P. in Virginia, in Rebuff to Byrd, Names Own Candidate for Senate Race
description: RICHMOND, June 27Vir ginia Republicans turned their backs today on the independ ent candidacy of Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr. and chose, instead, to select a nominee of their own.

title: Article 2  No Title
Irish Catholic Church Lifts Trinity College Ban
description: DUBLIN, June 27The Ro man Catholic hierarchy in Ire land has lifted a 100year old ban forbidding Catholics to attend Trinity College, Dublin.

title: LORENZEN TO DRIVE IN FIRECRACKER 400
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., June 27 (UPI)The return of Fred Lorenzen and record speeds are expected to high light the opening day of quali fying Wednesday for the Sat urday's Firecracker 400 at Daytona International Speed way.

title: GENTRY IS WINNER
Card of Thanks
description: GAINSBURGDr. Joseph C. My son and I are deeply moved by your gracious ex pressions in recognition of our beloved's valuable contributions to education and of his outstanding character.

title: Bragan Refuses to Lift Ban On Pitcher Who Hit Umpire
description: BALTIMORE, June 27 (AP) Bobby Bragan, president of the Texas' League, said today he would stand by his decision to suspend Greg Arnold, a 21 yearold pitcher, for the remainder of the season, for striking, an uthpire, Nick Emer terio, in a game June 14.

title: 2 Police Vehicles Collide, Injuring Nine Patrolmen
description: Nine policemen were injured yesterday, none seriously, when a Tactical Patrol Force bus and a patrol car collided at Sutter and Saratoga Avenues in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn.

title: Alabama School Plan Barred by U.S. Court
description: MOBILE, Ala., June 27 (AP) A threejudge Federal Court dismissed this week a peti tion by the State of Alabama that it declare a freedomof choice school law constitu tional.

title: OurayA Dividend Perched
description: OURAY, Colo.Even though U.S. 550, the Million Dollar Highway, has been widened and improved so that it is no longer a terror to flatlanders, it is still a breathtaking way to go from Durango, near the New Mexico border, north into Colorado's alpine country around Silverton and on up to mountainous Ouray and Uncompahgre National Forest.

title: OAS. IS SEEKING TO ADAPT TO '70'S
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Organization of American States is striving to adapt itself to they political and social stresses of the 1970's.

title: Israeli Planes Attack Targets Along Suez Canal and in Jordan
description: TEL AVIV, June 27 (Reuters) Israeli jets were in action today against the United Arab Republic and Jordan, striking intermittently at military tar gets along the Suez Canal and twice attacking Arab guerrilla bases, a military spokesman said here.

title: Why the construction workers holler, U. S. A., all the way!
description: WHEN you were still up on Broadway you could hear the ruckus, the hol lering. The peace demonstrators trying to outshout the construction workers. The construction workers hollering, U.S.A., all the way and We're Num ber One. And the peace demonstra tors screaming up there that the war was unjust and everything else, right by the Treasury Building on Broad Street there.

title: Black Box To Clean Windows
description: Black boxes that climb down the sides of tall buildings are about to introduce a Look, Ma, no hands element to the endless chore of wash ing acres of windows in Manhattan's skyscrapers.

title: CARDS WIN, 9 TO 8, ON DISPUTED RUN
description: ST. LOUIS, June 27 (AP) A disputed leadoff homer by Jim Beauchamp in the eighth inning gave the St. Louis Cardi nals a 98 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies today.

title: Quotas: Textile Impasse May Bring Them Back
description: WASHNGTON  The 35 yearold United States policy of seeking a steady reduction of our own and other nations' tar iffs and other trade barriers may have reached a Major turn ing point last week. A very large number of citizens and organi zations believe this is all to the goodthat a time for change has come.

title: Miss Susan Taylor White Bride on Coast
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., June 27The Spreckels Organ Pa vilion in Balboa Park here was the scene for the morn lag wedding of Miss Susan Taylor White and LeGrand Snowden Redfield. The Rev. Joseph Sandren of the Mis sinn Hills Congregational Church performed the cere mony. A reception was given at the Del Coronada Hotel here.

title: Gong Hair and Tennis Mix Well Together at the AllEngland Tournament at Wimbledon
Juilliard Orchestra Is in the Pit As Spoleto Starts 13th Season
description: SPOLETO, Italy, June 27 (AP) An ItalianAmerican produc tion of an Italian opera, which opened the 13th Festival of Two Worlds, received mixed reac tions today in the Italian press.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Bridge
Nijinsky Takes Derby
description: THE CURRAGH, Ireland, June 27Nijinsky, the wonder horse of European racing own ed by Charles W. Engelhard of the United States, stretched his winning streak to nine today by winning the Irish Sweeps Derby.

title: Author's Query
At Long Last One for MacArthur
description: DOUGLAS MacARTHUR has made it; his por trait is to appear on a United States postage stamp. Although the design, date and site of issue are yet to be announced, it is certain that a portrait of the late Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers in the war against Japan during the nine teen forties will dominate a commemorative stamp that will be issued in his honor, according to Postmaster Gen eral Winton M. Blount.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: News Summary and Index
description: Authoritative military sources in Pnom penh said yesterday that American planes will conduct bombing, strafing and rocket attack missions in support of Cambodian troops anywhere in Cambodia, even after American forces leave the country next week. The sources said the planes would be used whenever Cambodian troops in major battles needed help. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: KEY CABINET POSTS SHUFFLED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, June 28 (AP) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, with an eye toward elections scheduled in 1972, moved to day to strengthen her hand with a Cabinet shakeup that in volved all the major portfolios.

title: Retiring Policemen and Firemen Offered Nurses Training by City
description: In a move to ease the critical shortage of nurses here, City University will start an experi mental program this fall to pre pare policemen and firemen who are approaching retirement to become professional nurses.

title: Kolotov Sets Lift Mark
description: SZOMBATHELY, Hungary, June 27 (Reuters)Vasily Kolo tov of the Soviet Union broke his lightheavyweight world rec ord in the jerk section of the Europ An weightlifting cham pionships yesterday with a 443 pound effort.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: A widespread searching process is under way, involv ing minds, talents and costs, in the apparel, textile and re tail industries, over the most effective means of employing capital in a time of tight money and lagging sales in various sectors of the con sumer economy.

title: Mystery Witness Tells Crime Inquiry How He Worked Up to $6,000 a Week Selling Heroin
description: A mystery witness told mem bers of the House Select Com mittee on Crime yesterday that he rose from a smalltime mari juana dealer as a teenager to heroin salesman netting $6,000 a week before he turned 30.

title: III Greek Girt Sent to U.S.
description: ATHENS, June 27An eight yearold Greek girl left for the United States today for treat ment of a serious heart condi tion. Her trip is financed by United States airmen, a Greek American women's organiza tion and Aristotle Onassis. The girl, Niki Pantziatis is to be treated at then. National Insti tute of eHalth at Bethesda, Md.

title: Peter van Roijen Weds Beatrice Frelinihuvsen
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., June 27Miss Beatrice Sterling Frelinghuysen, daughter of Representative and Mrs. Peter H. B. Frelinghuysen, was married here this afternoon to Peter Portner van Roijen, a graduate student in eco nomics at George Washing ton University. The bride groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. van Roijen of Warrenton, Va., and Wash ington, and grandson of the late Jan Herman van Roijen, former Netherlands Ambas sador to the United States.

title: Entry 1, 2 in Breeders Derby
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., June 27 (AP)The Mario Riharich trained entry of Lord Tibetot and Nashojet finished one, two today in the second annual run ning of the $6,285 New York State Breeders Derby at Finger Lakes Race Track. The entry returned $48.20, $20.20 and $25.60. Elena's Alert paid $5.60 for third.

title: Startling Prospect Of a New Form of Water
description: From time to time, observations are made that appear so im probable or contrary to nature's laws that only highly unortho dox theories seem able to ex plain them. Such was the discovery, a few years ago, of microscopic fossils inside me teorites.

title: What Do You Do When The Till Is Empty?
description: For months, a small but high ly vocal body of economists has been preaching of an impending liquidity crisis in the American economy. Looking back over the years, they have compared the present situation to the last genuine liquidity crisis, the Panic of 1907 which led to the formation of the Federal Re serve System.

title: Sydney Smith Honored
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., June 27 Miss Sydney Carothers Smith was honored tonight at a dance given by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd Hilton Smith of Houston, at Linden, their summer home here. Earlier in the evening the debutante attended a din ner party given at home by Mr. and Mrs. John Astegren for their daughter, Miss Theo dora Astegren. Miss Smith, a graduate of the Foxhollow School, will enter Pine Manor Junior College in the fall and will be a member of the New York Junior Assemblies. Her father is an independent oil operator.

title: Pamela C. Derbyshire Is Married
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 27 Miss Pamela Catherine Derby shire and William Ford Carl son were married here this afternoon in St. John's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. Stephen Fronckewicz of the Convent of St. Birgitta here performed the ceremony.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: Madrid, SpainJose Legra, 125 pounds, Spain, outpointed Tommaso Gallia, 124, Italy, 15 rounds. Legra won European featherweight title. Miguel Ve lazquez, 131, Spain knocked out Carmelo Coscia, 128, Italy, 11. Velazquez retained Euro pean lightweight title. Pedro Carrasco, 134, Spain, knocked out Jean Pierre le Jaque, 132, France, 6.

title: PLANT CATALOGUE FOR NATION BEGUN
description: A pilot project has been started by the Smithsonian In stitution in cooperation with the New York Botanical Garden and the Missouri Botanical Gar den with the goal of ultimately making a computerized cata logue of all plants in the United States.

title: Mary Carpenter Becomes Bride Of John P. Doyle
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 27  St. John's of Lat tingtown Episcopal Church was the setting this after noon for the marriage of Miss Mary Wootten Carpenter, daughter of Mrs. Charles H. Thieriot of Locust Valley and Edmund Nelson Carpenter 2d of Greenville, Del., to John Porter Doyle. He is the son of Doble M. Doyle of Berke ley, Calif., and the late Mrs. Doyle. The ceremony, per formed by the Rev. Dr. Ho ward Lowell, was followed by a reception at the Piping Rock Club.

title: AID TO CAMBODIA PLEDGED BY THIEU
description: Saigon, South Vietnam, June 27President Nguyen Van Thieu pledged today to help the Cambodian Government de fend itself from the Commu nists, but he did not make clear the extent of the help.

title: Hanalei Bay Victor by a Neck In $123,200 Hollywood Derby
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 27A Californiabred light weight, Hanalei Bay, ridden by Merlin Volske, outdueled the favored Corn Off the Cob in the stretch today to win the $123,200 Hollywood Derby by a neck at Hollywood Park.

title: GIANTS TRIUMPH OVER BRAVES, 30
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 27 (UPI)Dick Dietz belted a threerun homer and Frank, Reberger and Don McMahon turned in four innings of score less relief pitching today to give the San Francisco Giants a 30 victory over the Atlanta Braves.

title: PETERS, RED SOX, DOWNS YANKS, 40
description: For the second time in four days, Steve Hamilton turned routine New York Yankee de feat into a diverting entertain ment at Yankee Stadium yes terday, but as much with his fast ball as with his folly floater.

title: Miss Reynolds, John Vogel Jr. Are Married
description: Miss Virginia Faith. Reyn olds was married yesterday afternoon to John Henry Vogel Jr., son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Vogel of Westport, Conn. The Rev. Franklin Goldthwaite Sherrill 2d per formed the ceremony in Grace Episcopal Church in Brook lyn Heights.

title: After July 1, an abortion should be as simple to have as a tonsillectomy, but
description: IT all looked so simple on April 10, the day the New York State Legislature finally amended the state's penal law to give New York the most liberal abortion statute in the United States.

title: Mary Marra Is Wed Here
description: Miss Mary Elizabeth Marra, daughter of Criminal Court Judge Anthony F. Marra and Mrs. Marra of Brooklyn, was married here yesterday after noon to John Eugene Freitas. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Richard Weiss at St. Agatha's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Education
description: More than 100 years ago, America conceived the land grant colleges to open higher education to the children of the middle class. Then came the two year junior, or community, col leges as enrollments increased and spread into the lower class es. Now the community colleges are being asked to handle most of the burden created by exten sion of higher education to even the poor and deprived.

title: Observer: Amazing, B. B.! Simply Fantastic!
description: WASHINGTON, June 27  B. B. Holmes, the private clich investigator, was idling in the Senate press gallery disguised as an inexperienced Capitol ob server. With this disguise, he hoped to learn whether all Cap itol observers were veterans.

title: Religion
description: Twentyone years ago William Randolph Hearst shot off a terse cable to his Los Angeles bureau reading Puff Graham and thereby baptized the national career of a 30yearold barn storming youth evangelist named William Franklin Graham.

title: Article 3  No Title
NEGRO LEADERS ASK U.S. JETS FOR ISRAEL
description: A call to the United States to send jets to Israel has been made by a coalition of more than 60 Negro leaders in many fields. The request is contained in advertisements in today's editions of. The New York Times and The Washington Post.

title: ATHENS WARNED ON AIR POLLUTION
description: ATHENS, June 27 (Reuters) The Greek Chamber of Tech nology has been warned that Athens will have to be abandon ed by its residents in 10 years unless radical measures are taken immediately to combat air pollution.

title: U.S. Steel Readies Its Texas Works
description: BAYTOWN, Tex., June 27 The new Texas Works of the United States Steel Cor poration, from which first shipments of finished steel plates are now being made to Southwestern customers, stands both tall and long on the coastal prairie near here.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: TODAY

title: Talks Go On in Bid to Avert Hospital Strike Wednesday
description: Negotiations continued yes terday between the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes and Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Union in an ef fort to reach a contract agree ment and avert a strike by 25,000 nonmedical employes.

title: Miss O'Neil Fiancee of M. M. Loperena
description: EVANSTON, Ill., June 27  Dr. and Mrs. John Tet temer O'Neil have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Katherine En nis O'Neil, to Martin Miguel Loperena, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gabriel Loperena of Vigo and Madrid, Spain, and Caracas, Venezuela.

title: Mir Takes a 10Mile Lead In Los AngelesTahiti Race
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27 (AP) Mir, skippered by George A. O'Brien of Vancouver, British Columbia, recaptured the lead this morning in the Los AngelestoTahiti yacht race.

title: Who's on First? Would You Believe ...?
description: The Miracle of the Mets, vin tage 1969, is being transformed into the commonplace success of 1970 by the earlier seizure of first place by the Mets. But the Resurrection of the Yankees, suddenly running a strong sec ond in the American League after five years in eclipse, is exciting New York's baseball fans almost as much.

title: Colleges Broaden Base for Giving Honorary Degree
description: A study of honorary degrees done a decade ago showed that you were not very likely to get one if you were a woman, a Democrat, a union leader or young.

title: Dr. Wilbert Chapman, Aide Of Ralston Purina Company
description: SAN DIEGO, June 27 (UPI) Dr. Wilbert McLeod Chap man, director of marine re sources for the Ralston Purina Company for the last 10 years, died Thursday after a long ill ness. He was 60 years old.

title: D'AMBNOSIO TAKES CLASS IN JUMPING
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 27Tony D'Ambrosio Jr., a 16yearold senior at Iona Prep in New Rochell, N. Y., had the best strategy and the best mount tonight and won the Gambler's choice class in the open jumper division at the Middlesex County horse show.Earlier, D'Ambrosio and Samuri, his horse, barely miss ed winning the New Jersey pro fessional Horsemen's Associa tion trophy class. Conrad Horn field, another teenager, piloted the HighHopes Farm's Act I to victory by winning the jump off with a clean round in 32.3 seconds. Samuri also was fault less, but was clocked in 34.1 for second place.

title: In The Nation: A Paper Tier Down South
description: WASHINGTON, June 27  George D. Fischer, the presi dent of the National Education Association, charged in recent Senate testimony that the Nixon Administration's hesita tions on schooldesegregation policy had encouraged a seg regationist revival in the South and elsewhere.

title: PANEL ON DOUGLAS GIVEN MORE TIME
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) Despite repeated requests, the Justice Department has still not supplied information con cerning Justice William 0. Douglas to the House commit tee investigating impeachment charges against him.

title: Personal stamp
description: The apartments in the new build ings that have shot up all over the city are depressingly similar, and since interior structural changes are usually prohibited either by the landlord or by finances, ten ants must depend on the magic of color and pattern for selfex pression. In this onebedroom Manhattan apartment, English decorator David Hicks used a simple brown and white color scheme and gave it drama by juxtaposing strong patterns. Spot lights in chrome balls on the floor wash the chocolatebrown walls with light. Mirrors broaden the liv ing room, making it seem less long and lanky, and an elaborate win dow treatment compensates for the absence of a view.

title: Suez Is the Front To Watch
description: A RECURRENT nightmare for many Americans is that our national preoccupation with Indochina and the resultant turmoil on our home front may induce us to sit paralyzed while the power balance shifts drastically against us.

title: LINDSAY PROPOSES WATERFRONT PLAN
description: Development of 100 acres of Brooklyn waterfront was pro posed yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: The Week in Finance:
When 12 or 18 responsible, normal and temporarily smelly people get together
description: We landed in a cold wind at Monterey, and I felt it. A nice lady with a Mustang met me and a gar rulous blonde at the airport. The nice lady was secretary, cook and general handywoman to the Western Institute for Group and Family Ther apy. We zoomed up to Mount Madon na, tailed by a wild driver in an old sedan. Mount Madonna is a re tirement home for nuns newly con verted into quarters for the insti tute's activities. The wild driver was Robert M. Goulding, M.C., the freed up, flowing haired, besandaled di rector of the institute. Thus began a weekend, transactionalanalysis group encounter. And 14 wary strangers brought together for all kinds of painful reasons became 14 intimate strangers who told their secrets, and wept and kissed when they said goodbye three days later.

title: FRANKLIN IS VICTOR IN LIGHTING SAILING
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 271 A northwest squall, with gusts of close to 50 knots, struck a fleet of 40 Lightning Class sloops on Long Island Sound off the Black Rock Yacht Club between races today and the committee had to postpone until tomorrow the second race of the third regatta of the new northern circuit summer series of the class.

title: TEMPLE FESTIVAL OF MUSIC OPENS
description: AMBLER, Pa., June 27When the opening measures of Bee thoven's Leonore Overture No. 3 were played by the Pitts burgh Symphony Orchestra here last night, the Temple Univer sity Music Festival and Institute came into its own. This was the beginning of its third year, and the first two summers had been ambitious enough musically.

title: Shortage of Summer Jobs Found Severest in Years
description: WASHINGTON, June 27  The slowdown in the econo my and rising unemployment among adults has resulted in the most severe shortage in summer jobs for youth that the nation has experienced in several years.

title: MOUNTIE CHIDED ON U.S. DESERTERS
description: OTTAWA, June 27  The Royal Canadian Mounted Police unlawfully returned three mili tary deserters to the United States, an official inquiry con cluded this week.

title: Pennsy: Bad Management or Ailing Industry Debated
description: WASHINGTON  Was it bad management that forced the Penn Central Transporta tion Company to file last Sunday for reorganization under the Federal Bankruptcy Act?

title: Federal Computers Amass Files on Suspect Citizens
description: WASHINGTON, June 27  The police, security and mili tary intelligence agencies of the Federal Government are quietly compiling a mass of computer ized and microfilmed files here on hundreds of thousands of law abiding yet suspect Ameri cans.

title: Danger to the Universities
description: The resignation of Dr. Kenneth Pitzer from the presidency of Stanford University, after serving in that office only nineteen months, is symbolic of the campus crisis across the nation. Mr. Pitzer pinned his decision to step down on the widening of the gulf between the campus community and society at large and on pressures which distract or disrupt the educational process. Radical students at Stan ford as elsewhere have made a shambles not only of campus property but of the academic community's confidence in its ability to govern itself.

title: Margaret Danenhower Wed to Dr. H. S. Baker
description: The marriage of Miss Mar garet Noel Crosby Danen hower to Dr. Howard Scott Baker took, place yesterday afternoon it St. George's Episcopal Church at Stuy vesant Square: The ceremony was performed by the Rev. John Harms. A reception was given at the Gramercy park Hotel.

title: MICHAEL CLOCKS 4:01.8 AND TAKES A.A.U MILE FINAL
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., June 27Capping a meet of upsets, Howell Michael beat Marty Liquori in the mile and John Smith surprised Lee Evans in the 440yard dash tonight at the National Amateur Athletic Union track and field cham pionships.

title: Coast City Indictments Spawned By Inquiry on Fake Certificates
description: STOCKTON, Calif., June 23 This agricultural trading cen ter of 175,000 has been shaken by a string of indictments voted by a county grand jury.

title: Spotlight:
description: We really had a rally go ing in the stock market, a Wall Street broker declared last week, until it got clob bered by that Pennsy thing.

title: Brotherhood at Fillmore
description: Jerry Hahn, the jazz guitar ist who, was a vital factor in John Handy's quartet in the midsixties and later played an equally important role in the Gary Burton quartet, brought a quartet of his own to New York this weekend to make its debut at the Fillmore East.

title: WINNER IS LIKELY TO OPPOSE QUARRY
description: JERSEY CITY, June 27 (AP)  Sonny Liston, the former world heavyweight champion trying to make a comeback, and Chuck Wepner, trying to break into the big money, bring boxing back to New Jersey Monday in a 10rounder in the Jersey City Armory.

title: Domino Theory Affects Diamond and Fur Centers
description: One of the city's most concentrated business districtsthe diamond cen ter on West 47th Streetis being buffeted by the pressure of the ever changing Manhattan skyline.

title: Bridal in Mamaroneck For Valerie Campbell
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 27Miss Valerie Claire Campbell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. H. Richmond Camp bell, was married at the Methodist Church here this afternoon to H. Keith Jud kins of St. Charles, Mo., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Jud kins of Muskogee, Okla. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Richard E. Stout of White Plains, who was assisted by the pastor, the Rev. George R. Bailey.

title: SURTAX WILL EXPIRE AFTER THIS TUESDAY
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI) After 27 months, the income surtax will expire at midnight Tuesday, adding about a dollar to the weekly takehome pay of the average worker.

title: Powell Defeat Confirmed by Recount
description: The Board of Elections de clared yesterday that State Assemblyman Charles B. Rangel was the official winner over Representative Adam Clayton Powell in last Tuesday's Demo cratic primary contest in the 18th Congressional District.

title: PEKING ENHANCES ITS STATUS IN ASIA
description: HONG KONG, June 27 Communist China has success fully used the 20th anniversary of the outbreak of the Korean war to further enhance the ap peal and solidarity of the Asian Communist front that has tak en shape under Peking auspices in recent months.

title: MERUNKA, PALAFOX REACH TENNIS FINAL
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 27Two former Davis Cup players now teaching ten nis at the host club reached the final of the Eastern men's clay court championship today by downing rising young teen agers.

title: Church of Brethren Endorses Resistance to Draft
description: LINCOLN, Neb., June 27  The Church of the Brethren overwhelmingly approved to day an official church position endorsing nonviolent draft re sistance as an acceptable op tion for draftage young men.

title: SKILL IS STRESSED IN ANNUAL DRIVE
description: Twenty national organizations and hundreds of local and re gional recreational boating or ganizations will publicize Amer ica's annual drive for better boating skills in the wake of the Presidential proclamation of National Safe Boating Week today through next Saturday National Safe Boating Week is sponsored annually by the National Safe Boating Commit tee. The chairman is Capt. R. T. Norris, deputy chief of the United States Coast Guard's Office of Boating. Safety. The committee has produced and distributed 7,500 promotional kits for use by local organiza tions in their community cam paigns for boating safety.

title: President Attends Coast Wedding of Niece
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., June 27On a perfect Cali fornia morning, Lawrene Mae Nixon was married here to day to Thomas Elmer Anfin son with her uncle, President Nixon and 799 other guests in attendance.

title: Jennifer Marks Wed in Suburbs To John D. Peck
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 27Miss Jennifer Peabody Marks was married here this evening to John Douglas Peck. The Rev. Kenneth E. Mackenzie performed the ceremony in St. John's Epis copal Church.

title: Missouri Ready for Appliance Plants
description: KANSAS CITY, June 27 Missouri's central location, transportation facilities and labor force are favorable for the location of appliance manufacturing plants for na tional distribution.

title: At Midyear Recession Nears Bottom
description: The campaign to restore price stability in this coun try, Andrew F. Brimmer said last weekend, has now moved onto the crucial test ing ground.

title: 6 More Flee Red China
description: HONG KONG, June 27 (UPI)  Six men fled from Communist China today and requested asy lum in this British colony, the polide said, raising to 17 the number of Chinese who have sought refuge in Hong Kong in the last three days.

title: Geraniums Can Be Trained to Grow as Trees
description: GERANIUMS are versa tile. They thrive as border or bedding plants, in window box es, and in planters. Trailing ivy geraniums flower abun dantly in hanging baskets and pots of assorted varieties make cheery house plants.

title: Sow Some Wild Flowers
description: EVERY gardener who has a little un used space to spare can help con serve our vanishing wildflowers by propagating them from seed. The difficulties vary with the species, but the dedicated dirt gardener will surely see them as challenges rather than obstacles.

title: New and Recommended
description: BECH: A BOOK, by John Updike. Meet Bech; meet John Updike, too, in a comic mood, satirizing the literary life In the person of Henry Bech, writer, who had it in him but is now blocked.

title: Milwaukee and Memphis Receive Antipoverty Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP) The Office of Economic Op portunity has announced the awarding of grants to new non profit organizations in Mil waukee and Memphis for the creation of prepaid group practices to provide health care for the poor.

title: State Site to Bury Atom Wastes Tested
description: WEST VALLEY, N.Y., June 27  The Atomic Energy Com mission has begun the final phase of a series of tests to determine whether shale de posits in western New York State can be used as a major burial area for radioactive wastes.

title: Anniversaries
description: DORMANCarolyn and Moe. Happy 40th, June 29th, from your children and grand children.

title: Marita March Bride in Majorca
description: PALMA DE MAJORCA, June 27The two largest selfmade fortunes of Spain those of the Marches and the Fierrosmerged tonight in what one guest called the last great wedding on the Iberian Peninsula.

title: ITALIAN BOXERS BEAT U.S IN 6 OF 11 BOUTS
description: ROME, June 27 (AP)The Italian amateur boxing team beat the United States, 6 matches to 5, tonight to win the Rocky Marciano Trophy. The Italians had won the first leg of the competition by the same score.

title: Jack Donne, poetabout I town, and Dr. Donne, dean of St. Paul's
description: The two portraits of Donne that accompany this review epitomize the popular conception of his career. In one we see Jack Donne, a foppish young poetabouttown. He bears the conventional dress and attitude of melancholy (i.e., rejected) lover, but the eyes are laughing and the sensual lips sneer rather than droop; to com plete the jest, the Latin inscription ribaldly parodies a prayer to the Virgin Mary: Lighten our darkness, O mistress!

title: A Kentucky Boy, 11, Faces Murder Trial
description: CADIZ, Ky., June 27An 11yearold boy faces trial on a murder charge in Trigg Cir cuit Court in Cadiz.

title: Article 6  No Title
Israeli Planes Attack Targets Along Suez Canal and in Jordan
description: TEL AVIV, June 27 (Reuters) Israeli jets were in action today against the United Arab Republic and Jordan, striking intermittently at military tar gets along the Suez Canal and twice attacking Arab guerrilla bases, a military spokesman said here.

title: TWINS TURN BACK WHITE SOX BY 91
description: CHICAGO, June 27 (UPI) pert Blylgven, a 19yearold rookie who has been in the ma jors less than a month, pitched a twohitter and Tony Oliva and Cesar Tovar hit homers today in pacing the Minnesota Twins Ito a 91 triumph over the Chi cago White Sox.

title: Son to Mrs. Johannsen
description: SOUTH NATICK, Mass., June 27A son was born on June 10 to Mr. and Mrs. Peter G. Johannsen of South Natick, formerly of New York, in the Newton Wellesley Hospital in Newton Lower Falls. The child has been named Peter Van Aiken. His father is a lawyer. His mother is the former Miss Marion Steven son Myers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Rem V. Myers of Lloyd Neck, Huntington, L. I.

title: 60 Nations, in Vienna, Seeking Controls on AtomArms Spread
description: VIENNA, June 27Represen tatives of some 60 nations be longing to the International Atomic Energy Agency have been meeting here in an effort to lay the foundation for a sys tem of controls against the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: RESEARCH BEGINS ON MINER RESCUE
description: A ninemonth study of new lifesupport, communications and rescue equipment for trapped coal miners will begin this week under a $3.4million contract from the Bureau of Mines to the Westinghouse Electric Corporation.

title: Machines to Use Voice Recognition
description: The voices of postal em ployes may soon be helping them in sorting and deliver ing the mail.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: JOSEPH SULLIVAN'S let ter about Child's Play leads me to do some thing I've wanted to do ever since I saw the play namely, salute it in print as one of the most stimulating and exciting of many seasons.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Article 8  No Title
Bridal Held for Miss Rebecca Grimmett
description: ROCHESTER, June 27Miss Rebecca Grimmett, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence A. Grimmett Jr., was married here this afternoon to Thomas Daniel Steiner, the son of Dr. S. Daniel Steiner, medical director of the General Motors Corp., and Mrs. Steiner of Bloomfield Hills, Mich.

title: DETENTION CASES STIR SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, June 27Two of three black Africans who have been missing since their arrest under the Terrorism Act several months ago turned up this week after newsmen and rela tives inquired of their where abouts.

title: Mideast 3: Israel Cautious On How To Respond
description: JERUSALEM  Israel main tained a cautious silence last week about the new and still unpublished United States peace initiatives for the Middle East. Premier Golda Meir promised a political statement In Parlia ment tomorrow, but she may not disclose Israel's true reac tion to the plan. Many observers believe that Israel has kept quiet in the hope that the Arab na tions would shoot down Secre tary of State William P. Rogers's proposals and save Israel the trouble.

title: Colonial, Hudson, Adams And Greek
description: CAZENOVIA, N. Y.The situation is superb and the lands are beautiful, John Linckleen wrote in his 1792 jour nal as he and his band of woodsmen broke through the Genesee wilderness and onto the shores of Lake Owahgena.

title: Capercaillie Shore Victor
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June 27 Extending the dominance of the Charles W. Engelhard's Cragwood Stable to two con tinents today, Capercaillie pounded to victory in a divi sion of the PostDeb Stakes at Monmouth Park.

title: Miss Tallman Wed To David E. Toroler
description: WILMINGTON, Del., June 27Miss Nancy Prickett Tall man and David Ernest Torg ler were married here this afternoon in Grace United Methodist Church by the Rev. Gerald W. Knotts.

title: Apartment Bias Charged
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) The Justice Department has filed suit against the owner of apartments in Gretna and Belle Chasse, La., charging that he refused to rent to Negroes. The suit, filed Thursday in United. States District Court in New Orleans, names Courtland John Kay.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: An amended offering to convert the Excelsior apart ment house on Second Ave nue to cooperative status has been approved by more than the required number of the apartment's tenants. A total of 133 apartments, out of 344 voting, said yes to a coop erative plan that has now gone into effect.

title: Suzanne Hillard Laporte Married
description: Miss Suzanne Hillard La porte, a systems engineer with the International Busi ness Machines Corporation in Boston, and John McMahon Westcott Jr., a lawyer with the firm of Hale and Dorr there, were married here yes terday afternoon at St. James's Episcopal Church. The Rev. Dr. John B. Coburn performed the ceremony.

title: J. R. Kimberly Weds Miss Christy
description: GLADSTONE, N. J., June 27  Miss Barbara Lenox Christy and John Robert Kim berly of Champaign, Ill., were married here this afternoon in St. Luke's Episcopal Church by the Rev. John T. Morrow.

title: Counselors at FreshAir Camp Told How to Aid Handicapped
Miss Wendy Schiff Is Married in Queens
description: Miss Wendy Sandra Schiff was married here last eve ning to Irving Howard Brom berg. The ceremony, at the Fresh Meadows (Queens) Jew ish Center, was performed by the Rabbis Herbert Richtman and David W. Gordon.

title: Soccer Body Abolishes Toss of Coin for Ties
