description: INVERNESS, Scotland, June 27 (Reuters)  The Interna tional Football (Soccer) As sociation board decided to day to scrap the tossofa coin rule to settle matches that are tied after overtime.

title: Personality:
description: The credentials of John G. McLean are impeccably es tablishment.

title: MEND BRONX FENCES, PENN CENTRAL TOLD
description: ALBANY, June 27Citing 22 deaths in the last five years, the Public Service Commission has directed the Penn Central to make immediate repairs on its fencing along lines in the Bronx.

title: Is the Studio Your Whole Life? She Asked
description: WHEN Bracken's World ap peared last September as part of the annual land grab the networks call the new sea son, it seemed quite doomed. No vio lence, no disaffected juveniles, no mad cap virginwidow with three adorable children; only soapoperetta twaddle about life on the back lot of a Holly wood studio, plots that seldom even de ferred to probability, and dialogue so mildewed that the room seemed to grow damp when the actors spoke it. Is the studio your whole life? a starlet asked the dedicated young producerdirector during the show's very first hour on the air; right then, would you have given a nickel for Bracken's chances?

title: Miss Davidson, Briarcliff '70, Is Wed to William B. Wigton
description: Madison, Conn., June 27 Miss Delozier Davidson who received a B.A. degree from Briarcliff College this month, was married here this after noon to William Benson Wig ton, a 1970 graduate of Lynchburg College in Vir ginia.

title: A Treasure Hunt That's Spreading Across the Nation
description: FRANKLIN, N. C.The woman obvi ously brought joy to her neighborhood beauty salon every week. But at this moment, her carefully manicured finger nails had mud around the edges, there was a smudge across one wellpreserved jawline, and a halfdozen strands of hair had escaped from their regimented contours.

title: Modifying of Rules On Charter Flights Asked by Lefkowitz
description: State Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz said yesterday that he had asked the Civil Aeronautics Board to modify rules covering airline charter flights to avoid cancellation of an entire flight because of only one or two illegal par ticipants.

title: Vasquez Stops Hill in First
description: SAN DIEGO, June 27 (UPI) Amado Vasquez scored a tech nical knockout over Jesse Hill at 1 minute 27 seconds of the first round at the Coliseum last night. Vasquez weighed 176 pounds to Hill's 170.

title: Negro Scholarship Aid
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 27 (UPI)The Ohio State Univer sity administration has begun a drive to raise $200,000 for scholarships for Negro students.

title: U.S. Sees Both Competition and Gains
description: For the United States, the prospect of a larger European Economic Community, or Common Market, is a cause for both enthusiasm and apprehension.

title: Point of View
description: New. York City is halfway through the third consecutive year of an un paralleled c?llapse of privately fi nanced, fully taxpaying new apart men construction. This year's output is headed well below the 3,000 mark. Only once in this century has the city approached this experiencein two depression years, 1933 and 1934 (aside from the nationwide World War II shutdown of residential construction).

title: BREWERS DOWN A'S ON A FIVEHITTER, 31
description: MILWAUKEE, June 27 (AP) Gene Brabender scattered five hits today and the Mil waukee Brewers defeated the Oakland Athletics, 31, for their third straight victory.

title: CITY POLICE STUDY A BUG FOR DRUGS
description: Microorganisms from the sea that give off light when affected by certain substances are being studied by crimefighters here to determine if they can help detect narcotics and explosives.

title: Operation Reveals Tumor in Lombardi
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 A twofoot section of colon was removed from the Wash ington Redskins' coach, Vince Lombardi, today after a small tumor was discovered during an exploratory operation.

title: Miss Diane. Gall du Pont Wed To Ernest Ellsworth Beck Jr.
description: CECILTON, Md., June 27 Miss Diane Gall du Pont, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Francis du Pont of Hexton Farms here and Wil mington, Del., was married this afternoon to Ernest Ells worth Beck Jr. at Hexton. The Rev. James O. Reynolds, an Episcopal minister, and the Rev. Charles R. Green 3d, a Methodist minister, officiated at the Episcopal ceremony.

title: Shostakovte The Volca
description: ALDEBURGH, ENG. THE sixties have been a period of almost un relieved disappoint ment for admirers of Shostakovich. But then, he has always been an uneven composer, whose best works lie alongside those that border on banality.

title: McHaney Named Captain Of Heavyweight Rowing
description: James McHaney, 20 years old, a junior from Little Rock, Ark., has been elected captain of the 1971 Columbia heavy weight crew. He succeeds John Probolus of Worcester, Mass.

title: COUNCIL PASSES MAJOR REVISIONS IN RENT CONTROL
description: Major revisions in the city's rentcontrol lawwhich will provide increases up to 15 per cent for about a million fam ilies on Aug. 1were voted at 3:30 A.M. yesterday by a weary, angry City Council.

title: Dr. Leona Baumgartner Is Wed In Cambridge to Dr. Langmuir
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 27Dr. Leona Baumgartner, visiting professor of social medicine at the Harvard Med ical School and former Health Commissioner of the City of New York, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Alex ander D. Langmuir. The bridegroom, for many years chief epidemiologist of the Communicable Disease Serv ice of the Public Health Service in Atlanta, will join the Harvard Medical School faculty in August as a visit ing professor of epidemiology.

title: YACHT RACE WON BY DOUBLE DARE
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., June 27 Dr. George Brazill and Joseph F. O'Hora's Double Dare from the MidSound fleet beat Thom as Hume's Pantomine from the Greenwich fleet by a length to day in the only official race of the Long Island Sound Shields Class District championship late today.

title: Myr Sheet Metal Detroit Choice Today
description: DETROIT, June 27If the field of unlimited hydroplanes reaches 13 for the Horace E. Dodge Memorial Regatta to morrow, George McKernan won't be at all surprised. The winner of more than 30 cham pionships in the last 18 years, he has yet to win a trophy on the Detroit River.

title: Lower 3d Ave. Group Fights Rezoning That They Say Favors Luxury Housing
description: About 100 businessmen, art ists and tenants in the lower Third Avenue area have band ed together to fight a contro versial rezoning plan that they contend would oust them for the benefit of developers who want to build luxury housing.

title: Business Index Rises for Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose to 366.4 from 349.9 a week earlier. A year ago it was 346.9.

title: Elia Fernandes to Wed
description: ROSELLE, N. J., June 27  Announcement has been made of the engagement of Miss Elia Fernandez, daugh ter of Mrs. Justino Fernan dez and the late Mr. Fernan dez, to Rollin J. Berger Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Berger of Buck Hill Falls, Pa. Miss Fernandez attended Drew University and was gradua ted from Montclair State Col lege. Mr. Berger is an alum nus of Rollins College.

title: U.S. Business:
description: LOS ANGELES  In 1958, with intercontinental ballis tic missiles threatening to make manned bombers ob solete, N. D. Showalter Jr., 33 years old, a bomber man since he built balsa wood models, set behind the con trols of a B52 over Washing ton State. He pushed the stick forward, bringing the plane, designed to fly at high altitude, down to relative rooftop level and opened up the throttle. The huge jet lurched in the heavy turbu lence, shaking so that its wings flapped like a bird's, jolting the pilot in and out of his seat.

title: U.S. Rail Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI) Reginald N. Whitman re signed Friday as head of the Federal Railroad Administration to accept the presidency of the MissouriKansasTexas Railroad, effective July 10. Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe announced the resignation at a news conference.

title: Miss Mary A. Moran Becomes a Bride
description: Miss Mary Anne Moran and Raymond Hoagland God frey Jr. were married yester day afternoon in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathe dral. The Rev. Charles Mc Donough performed the cere mony.

title: P.G.A. Lists Trials In Nine Districts For 1970 School
description: Nine district tryouts for the 1970 qualifying school to de termine approved tournament players have been scheduled by Joseph C. Dey Jr., commis sioner of the Professional Golf er's Association tournament prayers division.

title: Miss Olivia Saunders Baker Bride of William Cecil Blumer
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., June 27 Miss Olivia Saunders Baker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Keith Lanneau Baker, was married here this after noon to William Cecil Blu mer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Cecil C. Blumer of Wood haven, Queens, in the Epis copal Cathedral of the Incar nation. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. George Gruman, chaplain of the Cathedral School of St. Mary here, of which the bride is alumna.

title: Thriving Stanleyville Now Depressed Kisangani
description: KISANGANI, the Congo, June 24This Jungle river port, still haunted by brutal memories, has so far been fairly bypassed in the economic boom that is racing across other parts of this former Belgian colony.

title: Mrs. Azani Has Child
description: A daughter was born last Monday to Mr. and Mrs. Shalom Azani of New York in Polyclinic Hospital. Mrs. Azani is the former Miss Bar bara Fein of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: Klamath Indians' Land to Be Auctioned
description: KLAMATH FALLS, Ore., June 27It's a tragedy, and that's the only way to describe it, says Raymond H. Lung, the man who is reluctantly prepar ing to break up the last land holdings of the Klamath In dians and sell the parcels piece meal to the highest bidder.

title: NAIAD AND AUSLESE TRIUMPH ON SOUND
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 27 Dr. Aubrey L. Whittemore Jr.'s Luders16 Class sloop, Naiad, won for the second time thisseason and Robert E. Scherr's Soling, Auslese, for the first on Long Island Sound off the Riverside Yacht Club today in the season's 14th champion ship regatta for Connecticut area yacht racing association flets based eastofRye.

title: Paula Helene Sullivan Is Wed To Thomas Crowley Escher
description: RUTHERFORD, Calif., June 27After the small family wedding this afternoon in Holy Family Roman Catholic Church of Miss Paula Helene Sullivan and Thomas Crow ley Escher, a large reception took place at Beaulieu, the estate of the bride's family in the heart of California's wine country. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Mark Hurley.

title: Captivated Capital Rallies Round the Nathan Cummings Art Collection
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 Selections from the Nathan Cummings Collection opened at the National Gallery of Art, here with all the trap pings of a potentate's state visitlacking only flags on the street.

title: Benedict to Captain U.S. World Golfers
description: Clarence W. Benedict of White Plains, N.Y., president of the United States Golf As sociation in 1964 and 1965, was named yesterday as non playing captain of the Unit d States team for the world amateur team championship.

title: Timbuktu A Byword For Faraway Places
description: TIMBUKTU, Mali  Although the name Timbuktu is an evocative and mysterious as lost Atlantis, this West African crossroads city has done a much better job of keeping its head above water. The disappearance of the legen dary Atlantis into the sea preserved its glamour; Timbuktu's was dispelled by rediscovery. But the city, once a symbol of wealth and traditionally a byword for faraway places, is still a going con cern today.

title: HIT IN 8TH, COMES WITH BASES FULL
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)Wayne Corner, a pinchhitter, drove in two runs with a double tonight and a third run scored on an error in the eighth inning as the Washington Senators de feated the Baltimore Orioles, 53. Comer's hit came with the bases full.

title: UPSET BY BRITON
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 27The great Rod Laver was beaten at Wimbledon today, his streak of 31 victories over 10 years broken.

title: Daddy Was A Number Runner
description: Most novels about Harlem seldom go beyond what might be called its sociology the devastating impact of poverty and prejudice upon our black lives. At best, these novels are telling indictments of American society for its continuing op pression of black people. At their least effective, they seem almost exploitative.

title: Moxham Resolute Victor
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 27Arthur Moxham's Waif won the Resolute Class today in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound regatta conducted by the Manhasset Bay Y. C.

title: CAIRO CRITICIZES U.S. MIDEAST PLAN
description: CAIRO, Rule 27Although the Cairo leadership is warily studying the details and possi bilities of the latest United States peace initiative, officially authorized editorials in the press forecast today that the plan would be rejected by all Arabs.

title: Death of A City
description: What seems to be a race riot in a mediumsized Southern city turns out to be a compli cated caper masterminded by a white crime syndicate. The trouble at Oakdale, a town of 200,000 souls and three banks, is expanded by Mr. White into a high scoring massacre in the old hardboiled tradition,  la Dashiell Hammett's Red Har vest. But this plain and fancy mortality, Including a dash of cannibalism, takes place in a limbo lacking intriguing charac ters. When day is done in Oak dale, many are dead and none has lived.

title: Will Europe's 6 Become 10?
description: BRUSSELSFor the third time in less than a decade Britain is knocking at the gates of the European Eco nomic Community, and this time, it looks as if they may swing open.

title: Shadow Over the Caribbean
description: GEORGETOWN, Grand Cayman, B.W.I. The summer sun shines bright and exceedingly hot on the Caribbean Islands, the water is appropriately sap phire blue and emerald green as the coral sea : bottom dictates; and recently honeymooners from the United States and Canada have been filling the hotel dining rooms.

title: Escalation in the Skies?
description: Americans are likely to forget that neither repeal of the Tonkin Gulf Resolution last week nor the sched uled withdrawal of all American ground forces from Cambodia within the next few days is likely to mean that American military personnel will no longer be employed in combat operations beyond the borders of South Vietnam. The air war continues. Indeed, the President in his interim report on Cambodia earlier this month admitted that after July 1 there will remain air missions to interdict the movement of enemy troops and material where I find this is necessary protect the lives and security of our forces in South Vietnam.

title: FIVE FLY TO HAVANA IN A RENTED PLANE
description: MIAMI, June 27 (AP)A light plane rented in Miami by a Spanishspeaking aerial pho tographer flew to Havana to day with five persons aboard, including two children.

title: Power, Politics and Television
description: American television is on the spot these days. It has devel oped such power over politics and government in the United States that, like big business in the twenties and big unions in the thirties and forties, it is being charged with unbalancing and corrupting the political sys tem of the nation.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Effects of Guideposts

title: Miss Wilson Bride Of Morris Brooke
description: SUMMIT, N. J., June 27 Miss Margaret B. Wilson was married here this afternoon to Morris R. Brooke in the Central Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Robert H. Ste phens.

title: Status of Chinese in South Africa Becomes Issue in College Sports
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, June 27  The question How white Is a Chinese? is being raised once again, this time at the university level.

title: Waller Gains 2Stroke Lead In Northeast Amateur Golf
description: RUMFORD, R. J., June 27 Man Miller of Pensacola, Fla., held a twostroke lead today at the end of three rounds of the Northeast amateur invitations golf tournament at the Wanna moisett Country Club. He had a 72 this morning and a 68 in the afternoon for a 211 total.

title: Most in a Poll Term Vietnam a Mistake
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 27  The number of Americans who think the United States was wrong to have become involved in Vietnam is again increasing, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: Mrs. S. P. Borner Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Steven P. Borner of New York on June 13 at Doc tors Hospital. Mrs. Bonier is the former Miss Nancy Howe Benkhart, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald R. Benkhart of Lawrence, L. I. The child has been named Andrew Howe. His father is with the Investment Trust Department of the Chemical Bank of New York.

title: Psychiatrist Will Take Over City's New Corporation in Charge of 18 Municipal Hospitals Wednesday
description: Next Tuesday, a 37yearold psychiatrist will leave his po sition as administrator of the Federal Health Services and Mental Health Administration and come to New York to take charge of a new hospital cor poration that will provide care for nearly half the city's pop lation.

title: Seals and Red Wings Pairs Share Lead in Hockey Golf
description: TORONTO, June 27While most of the 6,000 spectators tried to keep up with Bobby Orr today, Harry Howell and Billy Hicke of the Oakland Seals carded a net score of 61 to tie for the lead in the Amer ican Airlines golf tournament for National Hockey League players.

title: Lucille Beachy Wed To T. R. Mathews Jr.
description: Miss Lucille Beachy, as sistant director of editorial research for Newsweek mag azine, and Thomas Richard Mathews Jr., its New York correspondent, were mar ried here yesterday at the home of the bride's twin sis ter and brotherinlaw, Mr. and Mrs. Jacob B. Underhill 3d. Family Court Judge Har old Felix performed the ceremony.

title: Alice Doesn't Poach Oysters
description: MARSHMALLOWED meatballs ...poached oysters! burbles the brandnew bride, snug gling down under the bed covers and leafing through a gourmet's Guignol of a cookbook. Hubby, who's queasily making his way back to the nuptial couch after gulping down a di gestif to deaden the effect of their First Dinner, pivots on his heel and reels back to the bathroom.

title: Mayor Visits Moscow
description: MOSCOW, June 27 (UPI)  Walter E. Washington, the Mayor of Washington, D. C., and his wife arrived in Moscow today for a weeklong visit as guest of Mayor Vladimir F. Promyslov.

title: Gardens
description: THE Massachusetts Bay Colony had hardly been settled in 1639 when the newcomers began planting shade trees along the Boston Common. They chose particularly hand some local trees that would reach 100 feet tall or more and arch out in beauti ful vaseshaped crowns. The American elm tradition started.

title: LOUISVILLE TRIAL OF 6 BLACKS IS ON
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., June 27 After two years of delay and two changes of venue, the trial of six Negroes charged with conspiracy to destroy private property during racial disord ers got under way here this week.

title: Nixon's Upbeat Speech in St. Louis Regarded as Preview of Approach in Pall Campaign
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 27As he was leaving St. Louis last Thursday, President Nixon, in one of several impromptu news conferences he held on airport runways that day, solemnly forecast that he would do little or no campaigning for candidates next fall.

title: State Warns Parents On Miniscooter Use
description: Parents in New York State can lose their cardriving li cense and registration, Motor Vehicle Commissioner Vincent L. Tofany has warned, if they let their children operate minibikesultralight motor scooters intended mainly for offstreet useon the public streets illegally.

title: Gambling Suit Is Dismissed
description: RENO, June 27 (UPI)  A district judge has reaffirmed that gambling debts in Nevada cannot be collected through the courts. The rule applies regardless of who has won or lost, because of the nature of the gambling transactions it self, Judge John Barrett held yesterday in a ruling that dis missed a suit by Kenneth W. Corbin of San Leandro, Calif., who contended that Reno bookies owed him $20,000.

title: SOVIET BLOC PUSHES EASTWEST MEETING
description: BUDAPEST, June 27 (AP) The Warsaw Pact governments, in a memorandum handed to Western governments by Hun garian diplomats and published today, have proposed the early preparation of a European East West security conference, with the United States and Canada also attending.

title: Beyond Fiji: The Unspolied Remnants Of Empire
description: BIKENIBEU, Gilbert IslandsSome of the world's most unspoiled tropical is lands lie only a few hours from the highly developed resort complexes of Fiji, the crossroads and playground of the South Pacific.

title: 5 Students and a Black Panther To Be U.S. Group at Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 27The American way of life will be interpreted at the World Youth Assembly by five students fresh from classrooms and one Black Panther, free on bail.

title: Mental Health Study Concludes TwoThirds of Westchester's 3to18YemOlds Suffer Impairment
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 27 A threeyear study paid for by the Federal Government has concluded that nearly two thirds of Westchester County's children between the ages of 3 and 18 suffer from some degree of emotional impair ment and that most children who need psychiatric help are not receiving it.

title: New York's Democrats Now Face A Real Test
description: It was Primary Day in New York last Tuesday, but until the polls closed at 10 P.M. the ma jor impact of the election seemed to be on those unhappy souls who walked up to their neigh borhood tavern and found the lights out and a Closed sign on the door. The campaign had dragged on for months, with candidates finding little to dis agree about and voters finding little reason to remember to vote; in the Democratic party, with contests for everything from Governor and United States Sen ator to district leaders, only about one million of the 3.6 mil lion eligible voters came out.

title: Criminals At Large
description: What was once known as the novel of chase or pursuit now usually comes to us as espio nage or international intrigue. I am tempted to say that the state of the art has progressed markedly, but a rereading of John Buchan's The ThirtyNine Steps (1915), admittedly far superior to average chase fic tion, reminds me that the older form still has vitality and charm something the present vin tage is usually lacking.

title: Major League TeamAgainstTeam Records
description: Includes games of Fri., June 76

title: Study of Ohio State Unrest Cites Student Foes of Police
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 27 (UPI)A Police Department re port on the violence that closed Ohio State University last month said that the most dis turbing element in the riots was the number of students who were willing to battle the Police.

title: Francesca Farr Is Bride Of Prescott S. Bush 3d
description: CARMEL, Calif., June 27 Miss Francesca Emerson Farr, daughter of Fredrich Sharon Farr and the late Mrs. Janet Haskins Farr, was married here this afternoon to Pres cott Sheldon Bush 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bush Jr. of Greenwich, Conn.

title: Miss Holthusen Becomes Bride Of an Architect
description: MARGARETVILLE, N. Y., June 27  Miss Cynthia Meeker Holthusen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. A. John Holthusen of Sea Girt, N.J. was married here today to Roswell Randall Sanford Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Sanford of Margaretville.

title: Photography
description: BY 1851, a mere 12 years after the invention of photography, the inde fatigable French travel ler Maxime Du Camp was 1,000 miles up the Nile photo graphing the colossal statue of Rameses the Great at Abu Simbel. Since then both North and South Poles and every thing in between (including the whole Earth as seen from the moon) has been photo graphed nearly to death. So you had better be good if you expect anyone besides friends and family to look at your travel pictures.

title: Robert Granitz Dies Here at 61; LanvinCharles of the Ritz Aide
description: Robert Granitz, a vice presi dent and director of creative services for LanvinCharles of the Ritz, Inc., died Friday of a heart attack. He was stricken while waiting for a train at the Long Island Railroad Hunter's Point station in Long Island City, Queens. He was 51 years old and lived at 155 East 76th Street. He also had a summer home in East Hampton, L. I.

title: Cambodia 1: Agony of A Nation Caught in The Middle
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia They're cutting the low branch es off all the trees in Pnompenh these days in order to give the Government defenders a clearer line of fire if the Communists at tack. This is as good an indication as any of how bad things have become in Cambodia as the deadline for American troop withdrawal approaches.

title: The Gold In the Glass
description: The gold is in the glass in the hand of Mrs. Gladys O'Brien Jugson, an octogenarian wino living in a French village. Primed with refreshment from an excellent cellar, golden memories flood Mrs. Jugson's tiny house: memories of her dead husband, with whom she shares an occasional brandy at the graveside; memories of old lovers and distant escapades. Miss Chaquet builds a solid inner life for her heroine, who has hung a Do Not Disturb sign on her door and become what she herself diagnoses as a splitsophrenic complicated by tipsomania. Notwithstand ing her occasional conversa tions with Woodrow Wilson and Mahatma Gandhi, there are more of life's juices in Mrs. Jugson than one expects to find in eccentric. Villemont, her home for a generation, is an art colony, and it attracts a few young people who put the old lady in touch with the current scene. Past and present are homogenized into a novel of considerable charm.

title: Integration: South Finds New Ways to Say Never
description: WASHINGTON  The South, it turns out, still says never. It often says it, though, in a newer, subtler way.

title: Mexico Frees 24 Crewmen From 2 U.S. Tuna Vessels
description: SAN DIEGO, June 27 (AP) Twentyfour crewmen of two United States tuna boats have been released after three weeks detention in the western Mex ico port of Mazatlan in a dis pute over territorial waters.

title: 10Year Limit Placed On P.G.A. Exemptions
description: Winners of the United States Open and Professional Golfers' Association cham pionships will now be eligible for 10 years, instead of for an unlimited time, for exemp tion from qualifying In open invitation events of the P. G. A. tour

title: Pierce Home Granted Permission to Relocate
description: CONCORD, N. H., June 27 (UPI)The Pierce Brigade, an organization dedicated to saving the home of Franklin Pierce, 14th President of the United States, has been grant ed permission by the Historic District Commission to relo cate the home.

title: Professor Studies Factors in White Votes on Black Candidates
description: One of the nation's foremost experts on race and racism in American politics is now analy zing why some whites will vote for Negroes seeking some offi ces and not for black men seek ine other positions.

title: Hallie Rogers Becomes Bride
description: Miss Hallie Pennington Rogers was married here yes terday morning to Ens. Daniel Maltby Rugg 3d, of the Navy. The Rev, Dr. Almus Thorp performed the ceremony in St. James Episcopal Church.

title: Maya Ruins: Story of a People
description: CHICHEN ITZA, MexicoThe Maya ruins here are the jewel in Yucatan's tourist tiara and in season (November to mid March) 600 people visit them daily. Spec tacular as they are, the average visitor is likely to find the surrounding area more absorbing.

title: Reader's Report
description: If you've been out of town for the last five or ten years, this highly educational novel will fill you in on everything that's been happening. High culture, pop culture, politics, educationthe author zeros in on major targets with satiric bullseyes every time. These are not easy days for humorous so cial commentaries, but Mr. Ed wards succeeds brilliantly. His modus operandi is to stage a series of slapstick interludes that embrace the daytime world of civic confusion and the nighttime world of culture chic.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONPresident Nixon cast the Supreme Court in an unaccustomed role last Monday when he signed a bill to lower the voting age to 18, a law that he insists is unconstitutional.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: *The remaining four members of the Catonsville Nine complied with the court and turned themselves in. They are Thomas and Marjorie Melville, Tom Lewis and John Hogan. (Brother David Dant died in a car crash several months before.)

title: Battle of the Bottleneck Rumbling On
description: On a 10th Avenue parking lot about 5 P.M. the other day, a natty young man from Nyack stood beside his auto with all the jauntiness of an Errol Flynn about to launch himself against Baron von Richthofen.

title: Lucia M. Burnett Bride of G. D. Williams
description: EAST SYRACUSE, N. Y., June 27Miss Lucia M. Bur nett was married here this afternoon to Gregory D. Wil liams, son of John A. Wil liams of New York, author and editor. The Rev. James K. Bennett performed the ceremony in St. Matthew's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Hearing Called on Brooklyn Renewal
description: The downtown Brooklyn re newal plan calling for new of fice towers, department stores, scores of small shops and a pedestrian galleria above Ful ton Street, will be the subject of a City Hall public hearing on July 15.

title: Elba's Approach to Tourism: Go Backward to Go Forward
description: PORTOFERRAIO, Elba, ItalyPutting aside the carrots she was scraping, the young woman in a black dress left her kitchen and led me into Napoleon's study. I was making a quick tour of the Emperor's country house, San Mar tino, as most visitors to this island do, but little did I realize that, in the woman herself, I was discovering the very essence of Elba.

title: Sharp Battle On. Issue Of Aid to Hospitals
description: WASHINGTON  Patients lie in bed in the corridors of a small community hospital in the south. There aren't enough rooms to go around. Other patients sit in terminably in the waiting room of a large metropolitan hospital clinic in the north. That institu tion, too, is, often overcrowded.

title: General Surprised at Problems as Safety Director in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, June 23The job of a military general is uncomplicated routine com pared with the task of con trolling crime and racial ten sions in a major American city, according to a man who has tried both.

title: Headliners
description: Not Hung Up

title: Kidneys Frozen And Reimplanted Into Three Dogs
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 27A team of five physicians and an electrical engineer have frozen, stored, thawed and reimplanted kidneys in three dogs.

title: SenatorWatcher Finds Species Is Human
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 United States Senator Hays Stowe has discovered that fellow Senators are usually gentlemen, always human, rarely remote; that they fre quently yawn, blow their noses, scratch themselves and turn off on the Sen ate floor, where they are seldom seen, and that they constantly and affectionately manhandle each other on stage and in the wings.

title: Jones Leads by Shot In Cleveland Open
description: CLEVELAND, June 27 Steve Eichstaedt, a Vietnam veteran, who hasn't won a penny this year on the $6.5 million pro golf tour, surprised the regular campaigners today. The 23yearold professional from Miami scored a five underpar 65 in the second round of the $150,000 Cleve land open and moved into a secondplace tie with an ag gregate of 135, one stroke off the pace.

title: Negro P.T.A. Merges With White Group, Ending 5 Years of Negotiations
description: ATLANTA, June 27  After five years of negotiations, the National Congress of Colored Parents and Teachers, an all Negro organization, has of ficially merged with the National Congress of Parents and Teachers, a predominantly white group.

title: Garay, Roca Named Captains Of Hofstra Football Team
description: Tony Garay and Bill Roca have been named cocaptains of the Hofstra football team.

title: Clerks Vote for a Walkout At Lincoln Downs Track
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., June 27 (UPI)Clerks at Lincoln Downs race track have voted to strike unless a new contract settle ment is reached before opening day next Friday.

title: STANLEY DANCER AWAITS HONORS
description: This will be a memorable week for Stanley Dancer. On Wednesday, the 42yearold driver and trainer from New Egypt, N.J., will be inducted into the Hall of Fame of the Trotter with Wayne (Curly) Smart at Goshen, N. Y. On Sat urday at Pocono Downs in WilkesBarre, Pa., ceremonies will mark the 25th anniversary of Dancer's first harness race.

title: POLITICAL PRISONS HOLD MANY TYPES
description: LONDON, June 27The pris oners range from peasant trade unionists in Peru to Jews in the United Arab Republic, from teachers in Mexico to newspa per editors in Nigeria.

title: Miss Gaughan Takes Crown In N.C.A.A. Golf by 2 Up
description: EL CAJON, Calif, June 27 (UPI)Cathy Gaughan, a 20 yearold Arizona State sopho more, putted with consistency today and beat Jane Basthan chury, the defending champion, also from Arizona State, by up for the National Collegiate women's golf title.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: PICTURE CREDITS

title: Rep. Aspinall, 74, to Marry
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI)  Representative Wayne N. Aspinall, 74 years old, Demo crat of Colorado, will marry next month the childhood sweethart with whom he had his first date, his office said Friday. Mr. Aspinall, a widower, and Mrs. Essie Jeffers Best, a widow of Grand Junction, Colo., will be married July 12 in Grand Junction, an Aspinall spokesman said.

title: Taxes to Increase Air Passenger Fares on Wednesday
description: Airline passengers will pay more for domestic and foreign air travel beginning Wednes day, and transAtlantic passen gers face the prospect of still another increase late this sum mer.

title: Evelyn Irving Is Wed on L.I. To a Lawyer
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., June 27Miss Evelyn duPont Irv ing, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Duer Irving 2d of Unionville, Pa., and Southampton, was married here in St. Andrew's Dune Episcopal Church this after noon to Craigh Leonard Jr., a lawyer with the firm of Breed Abbott & Morgan in New York. The Rev. Malcolm L. Foster performed the ceremony.

title: European Notebook
description: Arrigo Benedetti, born in 1910, author of several novels and editorinchief of the Flor entine weekly Il Mondo, be longs to a generation greatly impressed by Proust and the psychological element in fic tion. His new book, Gli Ochi (Mondadori) describes one day in the life of Adelmo Sestini, a Christian  Democrat states man, who is compelled to re sign from his ministerial post because of a financial scandal involving his son Vittorio. Ses tini is old; his downfall puts an end to a long political career, and he decides to retire to his native town, apparently Lucca.

title: Contemporary Prints: The Medium Is Not the Message
description: EVERYTHING looks en couraging for the field of printmaking these days. For a variety of reasons  technical and es thetic as well as economic it has achieved a new viabil ity. One no longer looks at printmaking as merely a side line activity for artists more importantly engaged in pro ducing painting or sculpture. In fact, many artists whom one had clearly associated with those two disciplines have recently turned to the graphic arts. Not exclusively, to be sure, but with a new and marked interest in the of the medium.

title: Britain's U.N. Delegate Is Removed by Tories
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 27The Conservative party's victory in the British elections has cost the United Nations one of its most re spected delegates, Lord Cara don.

title: Thirty Years Later, Johnny Gets His Gun Again
description: HOLLYWOOD. IN the midthirties, the Prance of Wales visited a military hospital in Canada. At the end of a hall way, there was a door marked No Admittance What's in there? he asked. We'd rather you not go in there, they told him. But the Prince of Wales in sisted, and when he came out of the room, he was weeping. The only way I could salute, the only way I could communicate with that man, he said, was to kiss his cheek.

title: Young, Black and in Japan: A Search For a New Kind of Brotherhood
description: BANG a black American affords one a particular eyesight, an eyesight de veloped by the country of his origin. And more often than not, when one travels with this eyesight, he spends much of his time comparing his coun try with the one he visits. What he sometimes finds is a new vision.

title: 7 BIRDIES BALANCE A TRIPLEBOGEY 7
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 27 (UPI)  Mrs. Althea Gibson Darben, a nonwinner in seven years on the women's pro tour, took the lead in the $20,000 Immke Buick women's open golf tournament today with secondround 68 for an aggre gate of 139.

title: Pravda Reports on Dubcek
description: MOSCOW, June 27 (UPI) The Soviet Communist party newspaper, Pravda, reported the ouster of Alexander Dubeek from the Czechoslovak Com munist party today as part of a routine purge of opportun ists from the party.

title: A Lament for the Passing Of the Highway Poets
description: STOPLOOKLISTEN! They're not writing signs like that any more. And judging from the way things are going, with symbols replacing words on high ways throughout the world, this little gem may go down in history as one of the last of the great American road signs.

title: Mideast 1: U.S. Again Tries to Find Path To Peace
description: WASHINGTON  The Nixon Administration's greatest foreign policy nightmareeven exceed ing the Indochina warall along has been the fear of a new major explosion in the Middle East that could lead to a confrontation be tween the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: West German Musical Treats Kaiser as Hilarious Figure
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, June 16The 47yearold mon arch struck a martial pose and declaimed: There is only one recipe against tuberculosis soap, that's the main thing, just soap!

title: Yorktown Decommissioned
description: BOSTON, June 27 (AP)The U.S.S. Yorktown was de commissioned here today after more than 27 years of service, bridging three wars. The air craft carrier, christened in 1943, served in World War II, the Korean War and the war in Vietnam.

title: U.S. Announces Pact Is Reached On Cable Concerns' Stock Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) The Justice Department an nounced today it had reached an agreement in principle under which British Insulated Callen der's Cables, Ltd., and the Gen eral Cable Corporation would acquire minority stock interests in each other.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Rico Carty of the Atlanta Braves was batting .436 on the last day of May, even the skeptics began wondering if he was for real, and if he could continue at so giddy a pace for the rest of the season to become the first .400 hitter since Ted Williams last did it in 1941. It made for teasing conjecture.

title: Al Unser Gets Pole Position For Rocky Mountain Race
description: CASTLE ROCK, Colo., June 27 (AP)Al Unser, the Indian apolis 500 winner, raced the 2.66mile, 10turn Continental Divide Raceway road course at 91.46 miles an hour today to win the pole position for the $60,000 Rocky Mountain 150 race tomorrow.

title: Dubcek Is Symbol Of Broad Czech Purge
description: VIENNAThe name of Alex ander Dubcek, the tragic hero in the contemporary Czechoslovak drama, was invoked again last week on the stage that has the medieval castle of Prague as backdrop. He was reviled and condemned by the chorus of lead ers, but remained unseen, inac tive offstage  hidden away at a heavily guarded clinic where he is being treated for a nervous breakdown.

title: South Fallsburg Firemen Are Called Lax
description: SOUTH FALLSBURG, N. Y., June 27  Volunteer firemen were accused this week of al lowing the home of a 70year old Negro to burn, but the fire men responded that onlookers had harassed them when they tried to fight the fire.

title: Dance
description: IT may have happily es caped some people's no tice, but at age 30 you are not, by any reasonable estimate, young. You are not precisely old, but you already have received intimations of mortality. That is, of course, if you are a person. If you are an institution you are in far better shape. Ballet Theater  or, as it nowadays calls itself, American Ballet Thea ter  has become an institu tion after 30 years of true, good and useful service.

title: Giants Sign U.S.C. Slugger
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 27 (AP)Dave Kingman, an out fielder on Southern California's National Collegiate champion ship baseball team, signed with the San Francisco Giants to day. He was the Giants' first choice in the second phase of the recent free scent draft.

title: Dangerous Drugs Taken
description: The police last night sought two youths who were seen re moving cartons of dangerous, possibly poisonous drugs, from a vacant lot at West 216th Street and the Harlem River in upper Manhattan. The drugs, including arsenic, mercury and amphetamines, were said to have been abandoned by a Bronx pharmacist who was go ing out of business.

title: Stram Spreads Simple Football Tenet
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., June 27This was the week when Coach Hank Stram and a contingent of his Kansas City Chiefs captured the Catskills.

title: Nuptials Held For Ellen Lea In Chestnut Hill
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 27 In St. Paul's Episcopal Church, Chestnut Hill, at o'clock this afternoon, Miss Ellen Elizabeth Lea, daugh ter of Mrs. Bertram Lippin cott O'Neill of Chestnut Hill and the late Sydney Long streth Wright Lea, was mar ried to Henry Disston Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Disston, also of Chestnut Hill. The Rev. Tom Turney Edwards per formed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Ernest A. Harding.

title: Bayh Hits Military Courts
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI) Senator Birch Bayh, Demo crat of Indiana, called today for major reform of the nation's military court structure, includ ing a provision to allow enlisted men to sit on courtmartial tri bunals.

title: Some Consumer Goods Sell Well, Despite Trend
description: All is not down in the down economy.

title: ALOU DOUBLE ENDS BID FOR NOHITTER
description: HOUSTON, June 27 (UPI) Tony Perez drove in two runs with a pair of singles and Jim Merritt pitched a perfect game for six innings tonight, leading the Cincinnati Reds to a 52 triumph over the Houston As tros.

title: Point of View
description: BRUSSELS  In two days time, the important multilat eral negotiations begin in Luxembourg between the Eu ropean Economic Community and four European countries  Great Britain, Denmark, Ireland and Norway  ne gotiations that are intended to bring about the enlarge ment of the Community and membership for these four countries, who will thus join the six original members.

title: Knickers. Knickers?
description: From left to right

title: FREDERICK LIBBY, PEACE CRUSADER
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (Ap) Frederick J. Libby, a life long crusader for, peace, died at a local nursing hpme yesterday after a brief illness. He was 95 years old.

title: U.S. Predicts 80% of Jobs Won't Require Degree
description: A new Federal study of job prospects for the next decade has found that while training requirements are rising eight out of 10 jobs to be filled will be open to young workers with less than a college degree.

title: From Myra to Byron
description: WHAT can a man do after he's done Myra Breckinridge? That's the question Michael Sarre, the young Briton who wrote and directed the movie version of Gore Vidal's novel, asked himself. And his answer? Back to the classics! Or at least back to the creators of clas sics. Like Byron and Shelley and that crowd.

title: Article 14  No Title
description: Questions of literary interest should be addressed: Queries Editor, The New York Times Book Review, Times Square, New York, N. Y. 10036, and accompanied by a stamped, selfaddressed envelope. The editor will publish those of greatest interest. Others are answered by letter.

title: 284 BY MAHAFFEY WINS N.C.A.A. GOLF
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 27 (AP)  John Mahaffey's final round 68 gave him the indi vidual title and helped Houston win the team crown today in the National Collegiate golf tournament.

title: Sports Foundation Seeks to Move Youngsters Living in Harlem Out of Shadows
description: In Harlem, the youngsters would recognize Dean Mem inger without the Rice High School equipment bag he carries or the Marquette Uni versity sweat suit he puts on or his National Invitation Tournament championship watch, and even though its nice to be recagnized, it's nicer still just to be there.

title: Freeman Has Never Stopped Growing
description: THE formation of the group called The World's Greatest Jazz Band of Yank Lawson and Bob Haggart and its use of the Roosevelt Grill as a home base during the past winter has done considerably more than merely satisfy the enthusiasm of Dick Gibson, the wealthy Denver jazz fan who organized the band and who has backed it with his promotional energies and with his money. (Gibson says he has poured $125,000 into the support of the band dur ing the first year and a half of its existence.)

title: TRAVEL BY AIR TO COST MORE
description: Beginning Wednesday, it's go ing to cost more for air travel, domestic and international.

title: Ridge in the Rocky Mountains Is Becoming Showplace for Geology of Region
description: The line of Interstate 70 in the Rocky Mountains west of Denver cuts through a ridge called the Hogback. On the initiative of Colorado conservation and civic groups, it is being turned into an at tractive showplace of the geology of the region.

title: Nancy Lodge Married to Richard Webbe
description: BEVERLY, Mass., June 27  Miss Nancy Kunhardt Lodge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Cabot Lodge, was married this afternoon to Richard White Webbe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Scotson Webbe of Northfield, Ill., at St. Peter's Episcopal Church. The Rev. Homer McCue, the rector, Performed the ceremony.

title: Democrats in Connecticut Name Donahue, Daddario
description: HARTFORD, June 27Al phonsus J. Donahue, a 53year old Stamford businessman making his first bid for public office, tonight won the endorse ment of the Democratic party in Connecticut for the United States Senate seat now held by Thomas J. Dodd.

title: Conigliaro Got Red Sox In on a Pass
description: There's nothing like a two week tour of military reserve dutyone a month? every other week?to foul up a manager's plans, but some tours are different from others.

title: 4 Provinces in Northeast Abandoned by Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 27  Cambodian troops have withdrawn from their last gar risons in Ratanakiri Province, leaving that northeastern prov ince and three others to the enemy, the Government military spokesman announced today.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: CAREER ADVANCEMENT

title: Judge Says Change in Drug Law Allows the State to Refuse Treatment to Some
description: A littlenoticed change made recently in the state's Mental Hygiene Law gives the Nar cotic Addiction Control Commis sion an opportunity to turn away hardcore addicts at will and allow them to be sent to prison, according to Criminal Court Judge Amos S. Basel.

title: Remembering the Goncourt Brothers
description: THE death of Jules de Goncourt 100 years ago this month marks a date that will be little observed in this country. So far as I know, only one publication  Paris Under Siege, 18701871: From the Goncourt Journal (Cornell University Press, $8.50), edited and translated by Prof. George J. Becker of Swarthmore College  has been issued as a tribute to the remarkable accomplish ments of Jules de Goncourt and his brother Edmund. In the June number of the Brit ish art journal Apollo, however, there is a fine appreciation of the Goncourt brothers for their work as critics, connoisseurs, collectors, historians and even  surpris inglyminor practitioners of the visual arts. The Apollo articleunsigned, but pre sumably written by the editor, Denys Suttonis entitled Two Heretics and reminds us of what we should never have forgotten: that the career of the Goncourts belongs to the history of art as much as to the history of literature. inglyminor practitioners of the visual arts. The Apollo articleunsigned, but pre sumably written by the editor, Denys Suttonis entitled Two Heretics and reminds us of what we should never have forgotten: that the career of the Goncourts belongs to the history of art as much as to the history of literature.

title: SARANAC IS TAKEN BY SILENT SCREEN
description: Silent Screen made his way to the winner's circle yesterday, for the first time since last Feb ruary. The Elberon Farm's New York bred took the onemile Saranac Handicap for 3year olds at Belmont Park by 3 lengths over Aggressively of the El Peco Ranch, with the HerJac Stable's Naskra next in the field of six.

title: Music
description: COLLATION of data from several of the most recently retrieved TimeSpace Capsules has made possibie great strides in our knowledge of how people lived on Earth I before our mother planet cre mated itself in the latter part of the 20th century. The information placed in these orbiting capsules, which were ejected into space by the thousands sometime around 1990, has proved an inexhaust ible fund of knowledge for anthropolog ists and others specializing in Earth culture. We can only regret that our knowledge of Earth I's final days was rendered incomplete by the communica tions disruption that resulted from the thermonuclear explosions in space shortly after our hardy ancestors left Earth It colonize this planet.

title: CAMBODIA TO GET U.S. PLANE SUPPORT IN GROUND COMBAT
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 27Authoritative military sources here disclosed today that United States planes would provide close air support bombing, strafing and rocket at tacksfor Cambodian troops engaged in combat anywhere in Cambodia.

title: New Rioting Flares In Northern Ireland; 4 Dead and 100 Hurt
description: BELFAST, Northern. Ireland, June 27Three men were killed by gunfire here today as severe rioting between Protes tants and Roman Catholics broke out in Belfast and Lon donderry.

title: NEW AMMAN CABINET NAMED BY HUSSEIN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 27 King Hussein of Jordan formed a new Cabinet today headed by Abdel Monem Rifai and includ ing many friends of the Pale stinian commandos. It was de scribed as a Cabinet of reconciliation after the recent confrontation between the Jor danian Army and the Pale stinians.

title: BERMUDA TROPHY RECEIVED BY NYE
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 27With all 149 yachts that started the NewporttoBermuda race last Saturday present or accounted for, one of the weird est biennial ocean competitions was wrapped up today with a large prizepresentation cock tail nartv at Government House.

title: Summer special
description: Homemade potato sausage and a jellied veal and lamb loaf provide a pleasant change from the usual cold fried chicken for a summer supper on the porch. Since both should be prepared a day ahead, they aren't too demand ing in time and effort. For an allcold collation, add a salad, pumpernickel rolls and a pitcher of homemade lemonade. If Aunt Martha brings a jar of her best pickles, so much the better. Warming the sausages on a hibachi or grill might keep the youngsters busy, but it isn't necessary.

title: Czechoslovak Dogs to Fore
description: PRAGUECzechoslovakia Is a land of contrasts. Al though it has slipped down the scale economically, it has not only regained a high position in the dog show world but has gone far ahead of most of its neighboring countries. In Prague, the city of palaces and churches, the fashionable poodle and aris tocratic Afghan Ire accompanied through the drab streets by their unfashionably dressed, plebian owners.

title: The Need To Share Political Power Of TV
description: WASHINGTON  President Eisenhower was the first man in the White House to try to pro ject his view of nation and world through the television camera to the electorate. Al though he refused to permit his news conferences to be tele vised live, he gave fatherly, abovethebattle lectures 49 times in his eight years in office about once every two months.

title: Prices Off On Counter And Amex
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange and the over thecounter market declined sharply last week.

title: And They All Married Ginger Rogers
description: As America's Silent Ma jorny begins to make itself neard, through the rallies of the hard hats and the larynx of the Vice President, Hollywood is beginning to sit up and take notice. Although film moguls aren't saying it out loud, many of them have begun to feel that they have been ig noring this segment, of the public for too long.

title: SHEPHERD IS BEST 2D YEAR IN A ROW
description: NORTON, Mass., June 27 Drizzly weather couldn't quell the spirit of Mariana Knob lauch's German shepherd, Ch. Idol von Celler Schloss, C. D., and the dog was named best in a field of 813 today by Dr. James Nakada at the Hocka mock Kennel Club show on the grounds of the Norton School.

title: Lindsay Dedicates Morris Park Recreation Center and Amphitheater
description: Mayor Lindsay and Richard Rodgers, the composer, dedi cated the new Mount Morris Park Recreation Center and Amphitheater in Harlem yes terday.

title: Anne Stuart Straffin Married To David Hall 3d, Psychologist
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 27A choir of the Radcliffe Choral Society and the Har vard Glee Club members per formed tonight at the wed ding in the Scarsdale Com munity Baptist Church of Miss Anne Stuart Straffin to David Connolly Hall 3d, a greatgrandson of President William Howard Taft. The bride made an Asian tour with the group in the sum mer of 1967 after her gradu ation from Radcliffe College.

title: Moderate Republican Is Backed To Oppose Kennedy for Senate
description: BOSTON, June 27 (AP)Jo siah A. Spaulding, a 47year old political moderate, was en dorsed by the Republican state convention today to oppose Senator Edward M. Kennedy for the Senate.

title: Victory Tack
description: The America's Cup races begin Tuesday, Sept. 15, and will con tinue until four out of seven races are won by either the American defender or the foreign challenger.

title: Chess
description: IT is all a matter of technique is the sage commentary on many a game where the plan and treat ment is as clear as a triple check a ludicrous impossibility. Here, how ever, are three examples from the recent 18man Zagreb, Yugoslavia, Interna tional, in which all the top prizewin ners triumphed by Ibreaching the enemy kingside and center.

title: Wedding Held for Miss Elizabeth Paige
description: MERION, Pa., June 27 Mise Elizabeth Emily Paige was married here yesterday afternoon to William Fran cis Tiernan 3d. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. James Armstrong Trimble in Christ Chapel of Episcopal Academy.

title: The Composer Is the Orchestra
description: WHAT opera has 28 characters, four singers and the composer as or chestra? It is Malcolm Wil liamson's The Growing Cas tle, which will be given its American premiere next Fri day at the Caramoor Festival in Katonah, N.Y.

title: TV Sponsors Sought
description: The revived Junior World Series, matching the American Association and the Interna tional League champions, may be put on national television for the first time this year if enough interested sponsors can be found.

title: World Cup Gleanings
description: There is an awfully strong case, after the Brazilians' Vic tory a week ago in the World Cup, their third in four years, to say that their football has proved itself definitely the best. With the exception of one sad parenthesis in 1966, when the team was too old and Pele was actually and literally kicked out of the tournament, Brazil has domi nated the World Cup since 1958.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Building on 5th St. Ruined by Vandals On Overnight Spree
description: Between sundown and sunup one night on a recent weekend, an East Fifth Street building was pillaged, reducing it from a wellkept artist loft and apart ments into a rubbleheaped hulk.

title: News of the Camera World
description: POLAROID camera own ers can save between 30 and 40 per cent when ordering copies and enlargements of color prints by using a newly in troduced, prepaid mailer that can be purchased from cam era and film dealers. Offering the purchaser a choice of two different assortments (copies and enlargements of the same print), the mailer is priced at $4.99 and offers choice of either an 8x10 enlargement and eight 2x 2 walletsize prints; or four 5x7 enlargements and eight walletsize prints. The buyer merely checks the of fer he wants, then mails it with his original print  in the preaddressed envelope supplied. The prints and en largements will then be mailed directly back to the purchaser from Polaroid.

title: West German Teams 1, 2 In Horse Show at Aachen
description: AACHEN, West Germany, June 27 (Reuters)West Ger man teams took first and sec ond places in today's jumping relay at the Aachen interna tional horse show.

title: Gary Mayor Hails His Record, But Rivals Cite Some Setbacks
description: GARY, Ind., June 26Very frankly, at this point, I have the feeling that Gary has turned the corner, Mayor Richard G. Hatcher said today.

title: Margaret Baird Becomes Bride Of David Towle
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, LI., June 27  Miss Mar garet Moran Baird and Da vid Richard Towle were mar ried here at noon today in the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Concep tion by the Rev. Theodore J. Leture.

title: Westchester Tennis Put Off
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 27Rain today delayed for 24 hours the start of the annual Paul Martin Memorial tourna ment of the Westchester County Tennis League. Two rounds of doubles were rescheduled for tomorrow at Beach Point Club, with the semifinals and finals put off until next weekend.

title: Foreign Affairs: The Great Game of Patience
description: MOSCOWThe best guess is that this coming decade will mark a strategic period during which Russia and China both prepare for a possible show down but that there will be no outbreak of either war or peace between them. Each side wants to buy time.

title: The tragedy of four dedicated men
description: This is a maddening novel, gimmicky and full of stylistic tics, but so piercingly imme diate, so terrifyingly right that it burns in your guilty hands. Structurally a chronicle of four white revolutionaries and their individual drives towards pure justice and human dignity, News screams like a siren as it plunges these dedicated men to their American ends: death for two, madness for one and a desperate embracing of fidelity for the fourth.

title: Britain's Nationalized Railways Run Well
description: LONDONWhen an Amer ican visiting London wants to go 50 or 100 miles out into the country, he auto matically thinks of renting a car. If it is a longer trip, he usually asks about planes.

title: Pridewood Victor In $94,335 Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 27 Dayan, at the prohibitive odds of 15, never had a chance to win the $94,335.42 Realization Trot at Roosevelt Raceway to night.

title: Cambodia 3: Confusion Reigns on Challenge To Nixon
description: WASHINGTON  The pro longed Senate debate on Cam bodia will come to a probably confusing end this week. Inevit ably the underlying constitution al issues were being obscured in the politicking between the White House and the Democrat iccontrolled Senate.

title: Zelia A. Moore Wed To Charles W. Paul Jr.
description: STUART, Fla., June 27 Miss Zelia Ava Moore, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eu gene Minton Moore, was married at St. Mary's Epis copal Church here today to Charles William Paul Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul, also of Stuart. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Arthur A. Smith.

title: Cubs' Aguirre on Waivers
description: PITTSBURGH, June 27 (AP) The Chicago Cubs have asked waivers on Hank Aguirre, 38 yearold southpaw relief pitch er.

title: Petty Wins Kingsport 300
description: KINGSPORT, Tenn., June 27 (AP)Richard Petty captured the Kingsport NASCAR 300 last night, driving a 1970 Plymouth to an average speed of 68.583 miles an hour.

title: Japan Extends U.S. Treaty But in New Guise
description: TOKYOIt was just 10 years ago that howling Tokyo mobs, protesting the signing of the JapanUnited States Security Treaty, forced the cancellation of a visit to this country by President Dwight D. Eisenhower.

title: ISDALE ALSO WINS ON 9MILE COURSE
description: RYE. N. Y., June 27Stuart B. Rowe Jr., with his Interna tional sloop, Ann, and George M. (Dooie) Isdale Jr., at the helm of the Etchells22, Ram pant, triumphed today in an American Yacht Club regatta.

title: Alice M. Wang Becomes Bride
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 27  Miss Alice Mailien Wang was married here this afternoon to George Tzu Yung Chen in the Massachusetts Institute of Technology Chapel. The Rev. Donald Lee, a Lutheran minister, per formed the ceremony.

title: EAST DOWNS WEST IN FOOTBALL 3427
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., June 27 (UPI)Davidson's quarterback, Gordon Slade, threw two touch down passes and ran for a third tonight to lead the East to 3427 triumph over the West in the 10th annual Coaches' All America football game.

title: BUCKLEY PREDICTS ELECTION VICTORY
description: James L. Buckley, the Con servative party candidate for United States Senator, has pre dicted that he will win the Nov, 3 election because Sena tor Charles E. Goodell and Representative Richard L. Ot tinger will split the liberal and New Left vote.

title: Organization Gives Training to Develop Individual Skills and Group Power
description: Although many people find comfort in rhetoric, the black social activist said, we must learn to live with realities and to deal effec tively with realities.

title: RISE IN V.D. SPURS REFORM ON COAST
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 27A worsening incidence of gonorrhea among California teenagers has caused Gov. Ronald Reagan to reverse his stand against selling prophylac tics to minors.

title: Bust for Stalin
description: When Josef Stalin died in 1953, his remains were em balmed and placed in an honored spot alongside those of Lenin in the mausoleum in Moscow's Red Square. There were also count less statues of the Russian dic tator in Soviet cities and his name was embodied in the heroic city on the Volga where the German advance in World War II was stopped.

title: L.I.R. AND UNIONS SET PENSION AGREEMENT
description: An agreement on a new pen sion plan was anounced yes terday between the Long Island Railroad and all 14 unions working for the line, apparently averting a threatened work stoppage.

title: Television
description: LAST week's resignation of Michael H. Dann as senior vice  president for programs of the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem to join the Children's Television Workshop, the most successful and virtually autonomous arm of public noncommercial broadcasting, has a significance beyond the individuals and organizations involved.

title: Fishing Curbed in Quebec
description: MONTREAL, June 27 (AP) Commercial fishing on water ways in southeastern Quebec has been banned because of mercury contamination origin ating in New York State, a Quebec government spokesman said today,

title: Cambodia 2: Nixon Adds Up the Gains and Losses
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif.On the eve of what promises to be Richard Nixon's most detailed and elaborate report on the United States military adventure into Cambodia, his senior asso ciates are still claiming success. But they are not saying what they will do if drastic steps are required to rescue the belea guered Government of Cambo dian Premier Lon Nol and they are not sure  given the opposition of Congress  whether they will be able to do anything.

title: GURNEY FASTEST, GAINS POLE BERTH
description: MONT TREMBLANT, Quebec, June 27The bright orange sports racing cars of the Mc Laren team qualified today for the first two starting positions in tomorrow's running of the second CanAm race of the sea son.

title: Earthquake Rocks Teheran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 27 (AP)  A strong earthquake rocked Teheran and the surrounding area today, causing widespread panic. But no casualties or dam age were reported. The epicen ter was reported to he about 40 miles southwest of Teheran, near an area devastated by 1963 quake that killed more than 13.000 people.

title: Avoiding a Trade War
description: The collapse of negotiations between the United States and Japan over textile exports jeopardizes polit ical and economic relations between the two countries and raises acute danger of a worldwide wave of protec tionism.

title: Agatha G. Kimmel Is Wed on L.I. to John Gates 3d
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., June 27Miss Agatha Gay Kimmel and John Wil liam Gates 3d were married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Lyman C. Bleecker, rector emeritus, assisted by the Rev. Carleton T. Lee, the rector. The bride was given in marriage by her grandfa ther, Dr. Oscar Swineford Jr., professor emeritus of medi cine at the University of Vir ginia.

title: IBA TO SUPERVISE 3WEEK PROGRAM
description: Fortyfour outstanding bas ketball players have been in vited by the United States Olympic Committee to partici pate in a threeweek intensive training program, starting next Sunday at the United States Air Force Academy in Colorado. Following the training period, closing July 26, 12 players will be chosen for an exhibition tour tb meet the leading teams in Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union.

title: ITALIANS TO HOLD RALLY TOMORROW
description: The telephones in the crowd ed suite on the 22d floor of the Park Sheraton Hotel rarely stop ringing. Pretty girls in miniskirts and men in pastel colored turtle neck shirts scram ble to answer the calls.

title: Hundreds Reported Seized As Foes of Syrian Regime
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 27  Hundreds of people, mostly, leftist opponents of the ruling Baath party, have been arrested in Damascus in the list three weeks, according to informants who have arrived here from Syrian Capital. Some of those arrested were said to have been In the army.

title: Led Relief Effort
description: I determined that the rest of my life would be spent ex clusively in the task of pre venting another war, and that all other interests would be subordinated to this supreme task, said Frederick J. Libby in early 1921, after supervising a Quaker relief effort for starv ing children in Poland, Ger many. Austria and Yugoslavia.

title: The Value Of Nothing
description: So you want to become a famous designer of ladies duds  eh, young fellow? John Weitz, no tyro he, tells you how to go about it. First get picked up in the Stork Club by a wealthy sportsman who will keep you as his plaything for two years and then indenture you to a wizard American cou turier. Leave this old creep when you've learned all you can and throw in with a Sev enth Avenue house, which will open a chain of boutiques by lined with your stuff. Then, find a firstclass sales manager and a great production man, and launch your own shop on a new wave of expensive public rela tions. Simple as this formula may seem, it requires absolute masses of intrigue and chican ery. One has to be in the good graces of yellow fashion jour nalism and go to unusual lengths, sometimes, to obtain backing and retail outlets. All of this authentic occupational lore grows a mite tedious. More than a mite, really, since our hero is almost void of per sonality. Mr. Weitz himself seems at a loss to know what to do with his protagonist, and kills him off fortuitously, if not as promptly as might be wished.

title: LUTHERAN CHURCH ELECTS PRESIDENT
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 27The Rev. Dr. Robert J. Marshall was elected today to a full four year term as president of the 3.2  million  member Lutheran Church in America.

title: Hunter M. Marvel Marries Miss Camilla S. McKisson
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, June 27 Miss Camilla Sutherland Mc Kisson was married here this afternoon to Hunter Marston Marvel at Rosary Roman Catholic Cathedral. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. John W. Laska, S. J.

title: Miss Barbara W. Campbell Is Wed
description: WATERTOWN, Conn., June 27Christ Episcopal Church was the scene this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Barbara Webster Campbell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Cook Campbell of Watertown, to William Kemp Bigelow Jr. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bigelow of New Vernon, N. J., and Dorset, Vt. The Rev. Jackson W Foley performed the ceremony.

title: Accused Miner Rebuffed
description: PITTSBURGH, June 27 (UPI) A Federal District Court judge refused Friday to halt the extradition of Silous Huddle ston from Ohio to Pennsylvania, where he and four more per sons face murder charges in the slayings of Joseph A. Yablonski of the United Mine Workers Union and his wife and daugh ter. Judge Wallace S. Gourley said he would continue a tem porary restraining order against extradition of the accused mine official for another 48 hours to allow him time to prepare an appeal.

title: Clothes for Oh! Calcutta!?
description: NUDE streamlining actually enhances text and perform ance, was the sizzling verdict of Howard Thompson in The New York Times.

title: Mideast 2: Arabs Say No, But It May Not Be Last Word
description: CAIROIf there is ever to be a settlement of the conflict over Israel's presence in the Mid dle East, it is becoming increas ingly clear that first there must be unity among the Arabs, not necessarily for war but at least to agree among themselves upon the terms for peace.

title: A Correction
description: Queens College has an nounced the appointment of Prof. Nathaniel H. Siegel as dean of faculty and Prof. E. Richard Covert as dean of stu dents. An article in Thursday's editions of The New York Times said that the appoint ments had been made at Brook lyn College.

title: Draft Board Quits in Protest
description: WARSAW, Ind., June 27 (UPI)The Kosciusko County draft board has resigned be cause It believes that the re cent Supreme Court decision on conscientious objectors makes the Selective Service Act unworkable and unen forceable. In a letter Wednes day to Col. Wayne Rhodes, state director of Selective Serv ice, the board members said that the decision by the high court defining conscientious ob jectors makes our position un tenable and unacceptable.

title: Baldur's Gate
description: At first glance, and for several glances thereafter, Baldur's Gate appears to be simply a New England village novel  Elizabeth Gaskell's Cranford brought up to date and transplanted to Jordan, Conn. The narrator is an amiable, incurably cir cumstantial lady, nee Eva Bucking ham, currently married to Lucas, whose last name (we learn, after considerable delay) is Hines. Our nar rator, then, is Mrs. Hines, in her midthirties, with a 5yearold son and a handsome husband determined to avoid all forms of responsibility and social success. The time is rough ly the 1950's.

title: For Louis, childhood was very difficult
description: By E. B. White. Illustrated by Edward Frascino. 210 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $4.50.

title: Argentine Leader Seeks a Broad Base
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 24 Since his inauguration on June 18, Argentina's new Military President, Brig. Gen. Roberto Marcelo Levingston, has been seeking the widest possible popular support in addition to the military backing that in stalled him in power.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: July 34Sports Car Club of America, Northern New Jersey Region, races at Lime Rock, Conn. Friday: Registration: 8 A.M.1;30 P.M.; practice: 10 A.M. 5 P.M. Saturday: racing: 9 A.M. noon and 1 P.M. Each race 30 minutes.

title: FOX TERRIER WINS IN UPSTATE SHOW
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., June 27Ch. Ellastone Fireflash, owned by Mr. and Mrs. James A. Farrell Jr. of of Darien, Conn., was named best of 802 dogs in the SusqueNango Ken nel Club show today.

title: SANITATION UNION TO SEEK 40% RISE
description: The president of the Uni formed Sanitationmen's Union has made it clear that he will be seeking a giant pay increase for his men in the coming ne gotiations with the city.

title: FOSTER FLATTENS TESSMAN IN TENTH
description: BALTIMORE, June 27Al though bleeding from a cut over the left eye and frustrated by Mark Tessman's clever circling. Bob Foster proved to night that the degree of power in his right hand was superior to his foe's degree from the University of Houston.

title: Letters: Camping A broad With Children
description: To THE EDITOR: I would like to add some comment on recent articles about camping in Europe and traveling with children.

title: Ball Is Chosen Director Of Golf at John's Islam
description: Errie Ball has been named director of golf at John's Is land in Vero Beach, Fla. Prior to joining John's Island, Ball was golf professional at the Oak Park (III.) Country Club for 25 years.

title: Robbins Laments Dearth of Housing
description: Ira S. Robbins, who helped write the legislation that started the nation's public housing pro gram in the Depression, said last week that housing condi tions now were as bad or worse than during that des perate era.

title: N.A.I.A. Unit Names Eight As Top Baseball Coaches
description: KANSAS CITY, June 27 (AP) Eight men have been voted area baseball coaches of the year in balloting conducted by the Coaches Association of the National Association of Inter collegiate Athletics.

title: Columbia George Scores In Saratoga Pace Finale
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., June 27 (AP)Columbia George paced to a 7length victory in the $15,300 Springwood, closing Grand Circuit feature at Sara toga Raceway tonight.

title: A Triumphant Catch
description: MIKE NICHOLS'S Catch22, which opened this week at the new Paramount and old Sutton Theaters, is the most moving, the most intelligent, the most humane oh, to hell with it!it's the best Amer ican film I've seen this year.

title: Dartmouth Names Golden Assistant Swimming Coach
description: Dennis M. Golden, an all America diver at Los Angeles State College in 1968, has been named assistant swimming coach and diving coach at Dart mouth College.

title: Norwegian Farmers a Problem For Common Market Meeting
description: OSLO, Norway, June 24  The Norwegian farmer is pre senting political and economic complications as Norway pre pares to open negotiations next Tuesday for joining the Europ ean Economic Community, or Common Market.

title: Britain Sees Gains in E.E.C.
description: LONDON  Membership in the European Economic Community, as seen from the windows of Whitehall, holds for Britain farreaching op portunities for economic prosperity and political in fluence.

title: DIETZ OF N.Y.A.C. ROWS TO VICTORY
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 27 Jim Dietz, of the New York A.C., scored his first singles victory of the 1970 season to day in the Schuylkill Navy re gatta on the Schuylkill River.

title: Frances de Fritsch Is Wed to a Teacher
description: WASHINGTON, Conn., June 27Miss Frances de Fritsch and Stuart Hope Van Dyke Jr. were married here this afternoon in the First Con gregational Church by the Rev. Francis Hawes.

title: Rimbaud and Stavrogin in the Harvard Yard
description: In the last four years hundreds of thousands of American students have adopted the epithets, the cos tumes, the extremism by which in the 19th century a mere handful of prophetic writers expressed their to tal rejection of society. At every turn in the Harvard Yard or on Campus Walk one comes across Arthur Rim baud or the Stavrogin of Dostoevsky's The Possessed.

title: An Inquiry Into Fire on 747 Started by Federal Agencies
description: A Federal investigation into the fire in one of the four jet engines of a Boeing 747 landing at Kennedy International Air port on Friday was announced yesterday.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WARWICK, R. I.Wild fingers of spray flew from the windchurned waters of Narragansett Bay when the hungry bluefish hit our pop ping plugs, and art Lavallee was content.

title: The Bomb as an object of worship
description: Preoccupied as we are these days with little bombs, we tend to forget that there are big ones around. And that those big ones have a much more fundamental hold on us, have indeed become a central object of worship in our time. We bring to The Bomb, an entity both abstract and all too concrete, attitudes char acteristic of those held toward deity. Awed by its destructive pow er, we feel insignificant in relation ship to it and view it as capable of unlimited creation as well. We then disqualify ourselves from raising questions about its continuous pro liferation and absolute authority, and in fact come to depend upon it both for periodic miracles and everyday sustenance.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: Today  Middlesex County, Johnson Park, Route 18, New Brunswick, N. J. Champion ships in all divisions. 9 A.M.

title: Architecture
description: VANCOUVER, B. C.

title: Virginia Ranlet Shelden Wed To John Woodson Willingham
description: GROSSE POINTE FARMS, Mich., June 27Miss Virginia Ranlet Shelden was married here this afternoon to John Woodson Willingham. The rector, the Rev. Arnold A. Fenton, performed the cere mony in Christ (Episcopal) Church.

title: Time: Today Place: A Street
description: AYOUNG man of mili tary age, limping, and with bandages around his head, staggers down the outdoor steps of the New York Public Library at Fifth Avenue and 42d Street. He turns to another young man: Mr. President, we're getting killed in Cambodia and you haven't even de clared war. The President replies, The reason you boys are dying in Southeast Asia is to save you boys from dy ing in Southeast Asia.

title: Penn State Names Morris Sports Publicity Assistant
description: John M. Morris, sports In formation director at the Uni versity of Delaware since 1964 has been named assistant sports publicity director at Penn State.

title: Bengals Sign Weeks
description: CINCINNATI, June 27 (AP) Marvin Weeks, a 15thround draft selection, was signed to day by the Cincinnati Bengals of the National Football League. Ile played quarterback for Al corn A & M., but will ha given, a trial as a cornerback.

title: A cop from Queens
description: I can think of no writer who has nubbed the horrifying in terior life of urban America better than Irvin Faust. Mr. Faust's collection of stories, Roar Lion Roar, and his first novel, The Steagle, laid bare the guts, bones and geography of New York with invention, style and a heartbreaking clar ity. In The File on Stanley Patton Buchta, we again have a keenlyfelt perception of New York, as Stan Buchta, Hofstra graduate, Vietnam hero and city cop, spreads himself across the landscape with the power and mobility of an octo pus.

title: Manitoba Detective Killed
description: WINNIPEG, Man., June 27 (AP)One detective was killed and another wounded here to day while trying to capture a man suspected of being a peep ing tom.
