title: 3D STAKE TAKEN BY TAYLOR FILLY
description: STANTON. Del., June 27 ZAP)Unbeaten Deceit posted her third straight stakes tri umph and sixth victory over all today in winning the $24,400 Polly Drummond Stakes for 2yearold fillies at Delaware Park.

title: Bartold Chosen to Help Coach Track Squad on European Tour
description: Steve Bartold, St. John's Uni versity track and field coach, has been named as one of the coaches who will direct an all star American team scheduled to tour Europe this summer with a threeday meet against a Soviet team in Leningrad, the feature of the trip.

title: Volpe Deplores Violence Against War Protesters
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI) As one hardhat to another, Transportation Secretary John A. Volpe has applauded con struction workers patriotism but deplored violence against antiwar demoristrators as risk ing an increasing, alienation of our young neonle.

title: Hail Insurance Growing Slowly
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP)Volume in hail insur ance on crops has more than tripled since World War II but lately has shown signs of leveling off because of tighter acreage restrictions and lower prices for major crops, the Agriculture Department has reported.

title: The Castaways
description: The castaways in this haunt ing odyssey are marooned by dry land and by povertythe oldfashioned kind where the income level is zero. And the land is as bone dry as it can get at the bottom of the dust bowl in the pit of the Great Depression. Against this for gotten landscape, Miss Cooper evokes a family of three, hurry ing nowhere in a yellow 1923 touring car, with stops at vari ous General Deliveries for the good news that never comes. Riff, the 14yearold son, was born in an Oklahoma oilfield, but the three Conmaras have aspirations above those of the migrant Okies of the era. Mike, the father, is an exsea captain turned artist. His richest com mission in a long time has been painting bacon and eggs on the window of a rural beanery; but he hangs on to his paintbox and to a hatful of fantasies that are a stopgap to hopelessness.

title: Watkins Glen's improvements Benefit Racers and Spectators
description: What's new at Watkins Glen? Aside from increasing its guaranteed prizes to $375, 000 for this season's events, the Glen is completing $150 000 worth of construction, much of which is for the ben efit ofoh, happy day!that stepchild of auto racing, the paying customer. To begin with there will be a 40foothigh scoreboard, long needed at Wat kins Glen and most other road courses. A new spectator area has been opened at the outside loop on the southern end of the circuit. The chi cane bleachers will be moved across the circuit to provide spectators with a long view of the front straight.

title: Heath's Cries of Doom Come Home to Roost
description: LONDON  The most press ing problem for Britain's new Conservative Government is what to do about wageprice in flation. Some Conservatives would like to do nothing until they see whether the preelec tion wageprice explosion con tinues. But such a course is po litically impossible since Prime Minister Edward Heath turned scaremonger in his winning cam paign, warning of imminent eco nomic dangers. The Tories were prepared to act, he said, while Labor dozed in illusory sunshine and waited for storm clouds to gather.

title: Letters
description: MORE VOICES FROM HARVARD

title: Chilean Police Kill 2 Students; Regime Urges End of Violence
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 27 Two secondary school students were killed by police gunfire in riots yesterday and last night, and the Chilean Govern ment has appealed to all groups to halt violence in the final months of the presidential elec tion campaign.

title: Cup, Ho! Cheers Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. I.As the brisk off shore wind swept through the harbor, I stepped into a boatbuilder's shed. Hi, Mike, I greeted one of the ship's car penters at work there. His response sur prised me: C'est un tres joii jourisn't it?

title: Recordings
description: WORKS from three periods in Italy's operatic history have made their ap pearance on recordings re cently, and each of them is to be valued for one reason or another. The earliest is scarcely known and comes as part of the, revival of inter est in the socalled bel canto operas. It is Donizetti's Roberto Devereux which had its premiere in 1837 (three disks. Westminster WST 323). The second is with us all the time, Verdi's Il Trovatore which first saw the footlights in 1853 (three disks, RCA LSC 6194). Finally, there is Giordano's Fedora, which has been popular in Italy since its premiere in 1898 but has turned up only fitfully else where (two disks, London OSA 1283).

title: $90 and Guts Will Get You From India To England
description: LONDONDuring six of the weirdest weeks in my life, I traveled by bus from New Delhi to London for a mere $90 fare, covering about 5,500 miles and saving the difference between a one way plane ticket, which would have set me back $383.70if I'd had that much to spend.UNCERTAIN BEGINNINGAs Europebound passengers prepared to board vintage bus in New Delhi, their apprehension mounted when they spied tents and sleeping bags tied to the luggage racki. During sixweek odyssey they found time to bargain a bit and sightsee (weather permitting).

title: Minnewaska Tract Is Bought by State To Develop as Park
description: KERHONKSON, N. Y., June 27New York State has agreed to buy a Minnewaska Wilder ness tract near here rather than permit it to go on the auction block for public sale.

title: An honest, literate and loving memoir of the Movement
description: Compared to its numbers, its ener gies and its impact, the New Left has been remarkably under represented by readable literature. Until recently, young radicals have just not produced many books that successfully yoked intelligence to craft and imagination. Most of the booklength efforts by New Left types have been poorly written, sim plistic, exaggerated, dumb, commer cialized, or personalego trips.

title: EBERSOLE, PORTER SIGN JETS PACTS
description: The New York Jets have signed their fourth and eighth draft choices and also have come to terms with two free agent kickers, Weeb Ewbank, head coach and general man ager, announced yesterday.

title: Donna L. Merrill, Samuel Stout Wed
description: HARWICH, Mass., June 27 Miss Donna Louise Merrill, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Loomis Merrill of Brewster, was married at the First Congregational Church here this afternoon to Sam uel Deming Stout, who is serving with the Navy in California. The Rev. J. Ed ward Elliott performed the ceremony.

title: Mr. Gunn, Joyously In Love With Shakespeare
description: STRATFORD, Conn. I HAVE rarely had so strong a sense of the physical presence of words. as I did while watching Moses Gunn over master Othello. Words are intellectual constructs, they come dry from the mind and we try to keep them dry, like powder. Tools to be bandied about swiftly, used for our bland busy projects, little efficiency experts to be sent trotting down hallways on trimly shod feet. Words are coin, hard to the teeth, not custard or ever cream. We expect them to hold firm, make sense, and go back into our heads where they came from.

title: Advertising:
description: There are advertising seers who are predicting a frag mented future for the busi ness.

title: The Priest Who Stayed Out in the Cold
description: DAN BERRIGAN  Jesuit priest, prizewinning poet and na palmer of draft filesis on the dam. He was convicted with eight other Christian resisters, including his priestbrother Philip Berrigan, for destroying Selective Service records snatched two years ago from Local Board 33 at Catonsville, Md. But after the Supreme Court refused to review the case, he failed to surrender him self for imprisonment on April 9.

title: The Actor the French Dim the Most
description: PARIS. THE clapstick said Day 15, Take 1, Domicile Conjugale. It's the third in the trilogy of autobiographical films by Franois Truffaut called Les Aventures d'Antoine Doinel, which began with his first feature, The 400 Blows, 1959, and continued with his seventh, Stolen Kisses, 1968. In all three, the char acter of TruffautDoinel is played by JeanPierre Laud, now 26.

title: Governor Takes Strong Peace Stand
description: Governor Rockefeller, de scribing himself yesterday as a strong peace candidate in his bid for a fourth term, accused Arthur J. Goldberg of having acted as world spokesman for President [Lyndon B.] John son's war policy during Mr. Goldberg's three years as chief United States delegate at the United Nations.

title: DEVALUED PIASTER IS URGED ON SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, June 27A Congressional watchdog com mittee recommended today that South Vietnam promptly deval ue its currency to dampen in flation, curb corruption and protect the morale and morals of Americans fighting and working in that country.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE problem of convert ing a concrete slab floor to a finished wood floor conies up rather frequently these days because many homeowners find it necessary to solve their need for additional liv ing space by remodeling an attached garage, or by en closing a conveniently lo cated breezeway, patio or sun porch.

title: Louise Gengler Wins Title In Jersey Junior Tennis
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 27  Louise Gengler of Locust Valley, L. I. won the New Jersey State 18yearsandunder tennis cham pionship with a 64, 63 victory over Lisa Rosenblum of Long Island City, Queens, at the West field Tennis Club today.

title: JEWISH PARLEY SEES CITYSUBURB DANGER
description: CLEVELAND, June 27A na tional conference of Jewish community relations leaders sharply criticized government housing and highway policies today, contending that they re inforce apartheid between city and suburb.

title: Social Ideas Accented In Reports
description: Social responsibility and concern for the environment seem to be the in thing in many of the annual re Dorts that have reachtd shareholders this year.

title: Article 9  No Title
Nancy Booth Is Married To Peer P. Wedvick Jr.
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., June 27 Miss Nancy Ellen Booth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John McLaughlin Booth of Birmingham, Mich., was married here this afternoon to Peer Eiler Wedvick Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Wed vick of Haworth, N. J., and New York.

title: Coins
description: THE Society of Medalists of New York, an or ganization of art medal collectors, is seeking new talent among American sculptors to prepare its an nual issues and to obtain a special commemorative for its 40th anniversary being celebrated this year.

title: Maltaverne
description: Maltaverne is a translation of Un Adolescent d'Autrefois which Mauriac, the most important writer of the modern French Catholic re vival and one of the halfdozen great est European novelists of this cen tury, published last year at the age of 84. Mauriac is the moral historian and chronicler of a region: the pine barrens of southwestern France called Les Landes with its regional capital at Bordeaux; of a social class, the upper bourgeoisie who live in big gloomy houses in Bordeaux but often have their wealthor once had itfrom the relentless harvest ing of pit props and pine resin on large forest estates like Maltaverne, which they constantly plot to make larger; of the spiritual condition of this class, whose representatives are at once cruelly materialistic and deep ly religious according to the rigors of the Jansenist conscience, people both clannish and selfish and yet poignantly human in the intensity of their loves and hates. They are without what is called Gallic charm, and some of them are monsters whom only God (and Mauriac) could love, and this is surely as Mauriac intends.

title: Barbara A. Rudolph Married in Jersey
description: MERCHANTVILLE, N. J., June 27Miss Barbara Anne Rudolph, who received a B.A. degree this month from Moravian College in Bethle hem, Pa., was married here this morning to Edmund Law MerleSmith, a senior at the college.

title: Marxist Guerrilla Chief Seeks End of U. S. Mideast Interests
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 26 The leader of the most militant group of Palestinian comman dos, or fedayeen, has called for elimination of all American interests in the Middle East.

title: Article 7  No Title
Effect of Army Training Wins Discharge for Soldier
description: A 23year Lold former soldier who went A.W.O.L. from Fort Dix to escape being shang haied to Vietnam has won his release from service on the ground that his basic training had turned him into a conscien tious objector.

title: Giants Sign U.S.C. Slugger
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 27 (AP)Dave Kingman, an out fielder on Southern California's National Collegiate champion ship baseball team, signed with the San Francisco Giants to day. He was the Giants' first choice in the second phase of the recent free scent draft.

title: 30 Millionth Visitor to Expo Awarded a Trip to Europe
description: OSAKA, Japan, June 27 (AP) A 29yearold Japanese bank clerk Tuseday became the 30 millionth visitor to Expo '70, and was presented two airline tickets for a 10day trip to Europe.

title: Grant Awarded Brandeis
description: A grant of $500,000 has been made to Brandeis University by the Samuel Goldwyn Founda tion in Los Angeles to provide five full scholarships of $7,500 each per year in the life scien ces..The university, in Waltham, Mass., said the first five would be awarded for the next fall semester, with preference being given to foreignborn applicants needing financial aid.

title: Both heroine and book are funny haha and funny weird
description: I am Melissa Johnson: I am the deciduous quaking aspen. There is something magical in this line from Rosalyn Dreader's new novel One or Another. It sits in the core of the book like a seed, an embryo which contains all the essential properties of the mature book: feminine vulner ability, a sense of wry desperation, ephemeral sensuality and an odd kind of zany humor. Like the ulti mate Reader's Digest condensation, this one line captures the novel in miniature. Those who have never seen a deciduous quaking aspen will either have to take a trip to the Rock ies or read the book; the latter alter native is recommended; it's quicker and cheaper, as well as being a lot of fun.

title: Dissenters Win Points From A.M.A.
description: CHICAGO  The American Medical Association, which for the past halfdecade has often been regarded as one of the na tion's most conservative organi zations, is showing increasing evidence that it is moving from its far right political position.

title: U.S. Hopes Allied Troops Can Save Lon Nol Regime
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 The Nixon Administration be lieves that the use of South Vietnamese and Thai combat troops and air forces in Cam bodia, combined with a limited supply of United States weap ons and continued bombing of Communist supply lines, will save the regime of Premier Lon Nol in Pnompenh.

title: Nancy Neilson Engaged to Abijah Fox
description: MALVERNE, L. I., June 27 The engagement of Miss Nancy Elizabeth Neilson to Abijah Shawhan Fox has been announced by the fu ture bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Neilson.

title: The Dance: Swan Lake
description: Ballet Theater was the first American company to accept responsibility for ballet's past as well as for its present and future. David Blair's authori tative, intelligent and elo quent staging of the Petipa and Ivanov classic, Swan Lake, should be seen in this context.

title: RHODESIAN SCHOOL IS TORN BY DISSENT
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 27University College in Sal isbury, Rhodesia's only multi racial seat of learning, is torn by dissension.

title: AllPurpose Device_Will Aid Boatmen
Wisconsin Aide Dismissed In Sports Economy Move
description: MADISON, Wis., June 27 In his first economy move at the University of Wisconsin, the athletic director, Elroy Hirsch, has dismissed George Lanphear, a former coach now sports publicity director.

title: COURT GETS PLEAS IN MENTAL CASES
description: Do you know where you are?

title: New Bathrooms Mix Family Den And Taj Mahal
description: In an age of increasing opulence, there has been a return to the luxuriousness of the royal bath once en joyed by kings and their consorts.

title: 32 STATES FIGHT CAMPUS UNREST
description: Following the recent demon strations on the nation's cam puses, 32 states have passed laws designed to prevent fur ther disorders.

title: DRUMTOP SECOND, 2 LENGTHS BACK
description: BOSTON, June 27 (AP)  Semillant, the Frenchbred who ran out of gas in his American debut in New York two weeks ago, proved his staying power today by taking an early lead and holding off all challenges in winning the $84,200 Massa chusetts Handicap at Suffolk Downs.

title: Muir Wins British Race
description: SILVERSTONE, England, June 27 (AP)Brian Muir, 38year old Australian, driving a Chev rolet Camaro, won the Royal Automobile Club Tourist Tro phy race today. He covered 399.76 miles at an average speed of 99.94 miles an hour.

title: EXPERTS DISCOUNT 18YEAROLD VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 27  Politicians and political scien tists across the country expect the enfranchisement of 18, 19 and 20yearolds to have rela tively little immediate impact.

title: NETS OPENING CAMP FOR ROOKIES TODAY
description: Lou Carnesecca, vice presi dent, general manager and head coach of the New York Nets of the American Basketball As sociation, will open a sixday rookie camp today at Cathedral College, Douglaston, Queens.

title: Miss Ann M. Lessing Is Married on L.
description: ISLIP, L. I., June 27Miss Ann M. Leasing, daughter of Mrs. Lawrence A. Leasing Jr. and the late Mr. Leasing, was married at home here today to William P. Benedict, on of Mr. and Mrs. William G. Benedict of Patchogue. The Roman Catholic cere mony was performed in the garden by the fey, Kieron Corrigan, assisted by Msgr. Joseph Tappia and the Rev. Vincent Nagen.

title: Pirates' Run in 9th Defeats Cubs by 21
description: PITTSBURGH, June 27Con secutive ninthinning singles by Richie Hebner, Roberto Cle mente and Al Oliver produced the winning run today as the Pittsburgh Pirates sent the Chi cago Cubs to their eighth straight defeat, 21. The tri umph was the Pirates' fifth in a row.

title: Aqueduct, With New 5Acre Park Behind It, Makes Preparation for Reopening Tomorrow
description: The New York Racing As sociation will unveil a spar kling new fiveacre park behind the grandstand of Aqueduct with tomorrow's opening. Complete with trees, grass, tubs of flowers, 60 um brellacovered tables, 400 lounge lawn chairs, drinking fountains and a large refresh ment stand, it will be a bu colic retreat for racegoers seeking a bit of country at mosphere.

title: SWEETNESS VICTOR IN STAR CLASS RACE
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., June 27 Rolf Carlsen's Sweetness beat Alan Burtis's Guachero for Star Class honors in the Hempstead Harbor sailing conducted by the Sea Cliff Yacht Club today.

title: Italians Fight for Their City
description: PESCAA, Italy, June 27 (UPI)Hundreds of Pescara citizens, angered by reports that the rival city of L'Aquila would be named capital of the new region of Abruzzi, fought the police today for five hours. It was the second outbreak of violence in 48 hours. The po lice hurled tear gas and re peatedly charged into demon strators. Twentyeight persons were Injured Thursday during demonstrations.

title: Brazil Players Can't Kick About Gifts
description: The 32 members of the Bra zillian national soccer team, which last Sunday attained permanent possession of the World Cup, will share prizes worth more than $750,000, in a country where the per capita income is $215 a year.

title: Joe Netro, Fight Manager, Guided Carmine Basilio
description: SAYRE, Pa., June 27 (AP) Joe Netro, who helped manage Carmine Basin to the welter weight and middleweight box ing championships in the fifties, died today in a hospital here after a short illness. He was 72 years old and lived in Ithaca, N.Y.

title: Rickel Pays High Tribute to Rachel Carson as Maine Wildlife Refuge Is Dedicated to Her
description: WELLS, Me., June 27 Under a lowering sky and in chill, mid50degree tempera tures, more than 200 persons paid tribute today to the late Rachel Carson. She was de scribed by Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel as the mother of the age of ecology.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Boston at New York (2, 1 P.M.) Culp (67) and Siebert (64) vs. Bahnsen (55) and Stottlemyre (85).

title: Connecticut Voters Look for Politically Hot Summer
description: HARTFORD, June 28With two tumultuous conventions behind them, Connecticut poli ticians today were looking ahead to perhaps the most in tense summer of campaigning the state has ever seen.

title: GRAHAM LIKENS METS' GAIN TO HIS
description: Billy Graham ended his five day New York Crusade '70 yes terday at Shea Stadium and summed up his accomplish ments one of which the jocu larly listed as:

title: Beth J. Zimmerman Wed in White Plains
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., June 28Miss Beth Jane Zimmerman and Peter Pier pont Post, 1969 graduates of the University of Pennsylva nia, were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Sidney P. Zimmerman. Judge Evans V. Brewster of the Westchester Family Court performed the ceremony.

title: Grand Jury Will Be Seated Today in Killings in Jackson
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 28 (AP)A special Federal grand jury will he empaneled here to morrow to investigate the dis orders in which two young Ne groes were killed last month at Jackson State College.

title: 3,500 AT THE PARK HEAR BUDDY RICH
description: The 3,500 people who at tended the Central Park Music Festival in the Wollman rink on Saturday night had come to hear some drumming. Buddy Rich and his orchestra, supple mented by Gene Krupa and Lionel Hampton, had been an nounced. But both Mr. Krupa and Mr. Hampton canceled out, so Mr. Rich had to carry on alone.

title: Intrepid in Test Sail
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 28 (UPI)Intrepid, the 12meter yacht hopeful of representing the United States in the Amer ica's Cup races this fall, took test run today after arriving here yesterday from New York. She is equipped with a new lightweight mast.

title: Bahnsen Is Victor, 82, After Boston Triumphs by 53
description: The New York Yankees continued to reconstruct pieces of their glorious past while splitting a double header with the Boston Red Sox at Yankee Stadium yes terday.

title: Bailey Loses a Rein
description: HARTFORD, June 28  Twentyfour years ago, John M. Bailey seized control of the Connecticut Democratic party by winning the gubernatorial nomination for a whitehaired poet named Wilbert Snow at turbulent convention at the Bushnell Memorial Hall in Hart ford. Asked later why he had staked his future on, of all things, a poet, Mr. Bailey replied evenly, I needed a horse. Yesterday the two men were back at the Bushnell  Mr. Bailey still the state chairman, Mr. Snow an elder statesman. The 65  year  old chairman was at his accus tomed spot in an anteroom at stage left, puffing on a long cigar, hands in motion, glasses propped on his bald head.

title: Casals Leads a Brilliant Jupiter at Waterloo
description: You may say that you heard a rather good performance, said Pablo Casals Saturday night, his chuckle underlining the extent of his understate ment. In fact, Don Pablo had just conducted an unforgetta ble one.

title: BYRON C. FOY, 77, OF CHRYSLER DIES
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., June 28Byron C. Foy, former vice president and director of the Chrysler Corporation, died to day at Southampton Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived here and at 650 Park Avenue in New York.

title: Theater: Dirtiest Show in Town Isn't
Board Says 57 on Airliner Got No Warning in Ditching
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (UPI) The 57 passengers aboard a Dutch airliner had no warning prior to water impact and many were out of their seats when the plane slammed into the Caribbean May 2, a pre liminary report shows. Twenty three persons died, one after rescue.

title: Books of The Times
description: First, a strange confession. I happen to know and care less about food and cook ing than the average man. Throw me a beefsteak at dinnertime, and I'll go back to my corner. But several months ago, I en countered a peculiar occupational hazard of fulltime book reviewing. Having to imagine things all day, and having become rather practiced at it (and, not inci dentally, having recently given ur smoking), I began to find that the merest mention of food would ignite in my mind the most vivid hal lucinations, while skillful descrip tions would send me running to the kitchen. There was a threeday jag of fried eggs back there somewhere, all because of a passage in a Wright Morris's novel. Per Olaf Sundman's description of hot chocolate in the Arctic (in The Flight of the Eagle) started a habit that lasted for several weeks. So a while ago, I de cided that while I was at it, I might as well get the best, and I began to look out for a literate cookbook to read.

title: Article 2  No Title
Apartment Walkout Postponed by Union
description: A strike threatened for yesterday by 25,000 apart ment house workers was postponed until at least next Monday by Local 32B of the Service Employes Interna tional Union.

title: A 117Foot Barkentine Carries 32 Sails and 2 Men's Dreams
description: The 117foot barkentine Re gina Maris, which left Sydney, Australia, Saturday on a round theworld voyage, is a sailing vessel with an international flavor.

title: PALAFOX CAPTURES EASTERN NET TITLE
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 28Tony Palafox, the former Mexican Davis Cup star, gave local tennis fans a treat today as he flashed some of his worldclass form and won the Eastern men's claycourt championship at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Hatfield Says There May Be No Nixon Slate in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Sen ator Mark O. Hatfield, Republi can of Oregon, said today that unles the war was ended and the economy improved then just may not be a NixonAgnew ticket in 1972.

title: Bethpage Beats Fairfield And Gains Final in Polo, 106
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., June 28 Bethpage defeated the Fairfield, (Conn.) polo team, 106, today at Bethpage State Park in a Northeastern intracircuit 12 goal tournament game.

title: Environment's Day in Court
description: If three members of Congress are successful, the Federal courts will be drawn into saving the environ ment much as they have been involved in desegregat ing schools and reapportioning state legislatures. Sena tor Hart of Michigan. Senator McGovern of South Dakota and Representative Udall of Arizona are push ing a bill to affirm the legal standing of any citizen to appear before administrative agencies and courts to defend a right to a pollutionfree environment.

title: July 4 Committee Grows
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (UPI)Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, announced today that he would serve as a member of the Honor America Day committee, sponsor of a giant Fourth of July celebration in Washington.

title: BRONX RALLY SCORES HOSPITAL AND POLICE
description: A coalition of youth gangs and political activists calling it self the Think Lincoln Commit tee held a rally in the South. Bronx yesterday afternoon to protest conditions in Lincoln Hospital and to charge the po lice with brutally beating up people at a similar rally on Saturday.

title: Miller's 69 for 280 Wins Northeast Golf by 7 Shots
description: RUMFORD, R. I., June 28 Alan Miller of Pensacola, Fla., shattered the tournament record by seven strokes as he ran away from the field in the ninth annual Northeast amateur Invitation golf event with total of 280 today.

title: WHITE SOX, TWINS SPLIT TWO GAMES
description: CHICAGO, June 28 (UPI) Bill Melton's 14th homer of the season provided the Chicago White Sox with an 1110 tri umph today after the Minnesota Twins had given Manager Bill Rigney the 1,000 victory of his career by winning the opener, 91, with the help of two hom ers by Harmon Killebrew, his 19th and 20th.

title: Mrs. Nixon Reaches Peru To Help Victims of Quake
description: LIMA, Peru, June 28Mrs, Richard M. Nixon arrived here this evening with two plane loads of relief supplies for vic tims of the earthquake that devastated northern Peru on Mar 31. About 50,000 people are believed to have died in the quake, which injured 100,000 and left 800,000 homeless.

title: Barbara Zion Is Bride
description: Miss Barbara Joy Zion was married here yesterday to Samuel Gary Weiss in the sanctuary at Temple Israel of the City of New York. The bride's father, Rabbi Martin J. Zion, spiritual leader of the temple, performed the ceremony. She is also the daughter of Mrs. Zion of New York. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray A. Weiss of Brooklyn. His father is a partner in the New York accounting firm of Feldman & Weiss. Mrs. Weiss is a student at New York University, as is her husband.

title: Cambodia Incursion by U.S. Appears to Unite Foe
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 27As American sol diers near the end of their twomonth incursion into suspected North Vietnamese and Vietcong sanctuaries in Cambodia and return to South Vietnam, the course of the war in Southeast Asia appears vastly more compli cated and uncertain than be fore the incursion began.

title: New Black Journalists Group Backs Reporter
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., June 28A national organization of black journalists was founded today at Lincoln University here and adopted a program to support a colleague who has been cited for contempt of court.

title: David Humphreys, a Painter Of Landscapes, Dies at 69
description: David Humphreys, a land scape painter, died in Paris on Thursday after a short illness. He was 69 years old, and lived here and in Dorset. Vt.

title: N.A .A .C.P. Lauds Its Role in Haynsworth Defeat
description: CINCINNATI, June 28The N.A.A.C.P. said today that its part in the fight to defeat the nomination of Judge Clement F. Haynesworth Jr. to the Su preme Court was one of its most noteworthy achievements of 1969.

title: Six Soldiers Are Arrested; Refused to Go to Vietnam
description: FORT LEWIS, Wash., June 28 (UPI)Six soldiers who were denied conscientious objector status have been arrested for refusing shipment to Vietnam, and their attorney, Charles H. W. Talbot, said today that he would go before United States District Judge George H. Boldt in Tacoma tomorrow to seek a restraining order.

title: Dance: Moor's Pavane
description: With a new production, a new Giseile and Carla Fracci, American Ballet Theater had a quite eventful Saturday at the New York State Theater this weekend.

title: The D.C. Rider
description: Ordinarily there is little to be said for legislating by rider, that procedure whereby Congress may tack on to a bill under consideration a proposal that has little or nothing to do with the subject. Yet we favor Sen ator Edward Kennedy's intention to do just that in desperate effort to achieve Congressional representa tion for the District of Columbia. We favor it because this simple act of justice has over and over again been thwarted by an even less excusable parliamentary deviceburial in the pigeonholes of the House Rules Committee and the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: Antiwar Letter Is Read To Oklahoma Catholics
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 2R (UPI)Roman Catholics throughout Oklahoma today were read a letter condemn ing United States involve ment in Indochina from the Most Rev. Victor J. Reed, Bishop of Oklahoma.

title: Ford Fund Names Aide
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced yesterday that Roger G. Kennedy, the University of Minnesota's vice president for investments, would take charge of the foundation's fi nancial affairs on July 1. He will be the foundation's senior financial officer, United Press International reported.

title: ECUADOR ALTERS BUSINESS STANCE
description: QUITO, Ecuador, June 27 We don't have a dictatorship we have a revolutionary Gov ernment that is going to re structure Ecuador's social and economic life, Finance Minis ter Luis Gmez Izquierdo said the other day.

title: I U.S. African Aide in Kinshasa
description: KINSHASA, The Congo, June 28 (AP)The United States As sistant Secretary of State for African Affairs, David D. New som, arrived here today on fourday visit to represent President Nixon at ceremonies marking the 10th anniversary of Congolese independence on Tuesday.

title: Elise Burns Bradley Betrothed To William Mairs Duryea Jr.
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., June 28Mr. and Mrs. Thomas A. Bradley Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Elise Burns Bradley, to William Mairs Duryea Jr., a member of the New York Stock Exchange and a partner of the New York securities firm of H. Hentz & Co. in New York. A September wedding is planned.

title: Greek Orthodox Open First Congress Here in 39 Years With Call to Seek Spiritual Heights
description: We have not gathered in New York to hear the throb of the subway trains, but to de tect it in the hearts of men.

title: Sports of The Times
description: I wake up in the morning and I can't understand what's happening to me, says Buddy Jacobson. I'm the most honest trainer in the world. I never asked a jockey to give a horse a race, I always told him to get all you can. I know there are fairminded people in this business. I can't understand how they're letting this happen.

title: PLAN IS ARRANGED FOR GAS DELIVERY
description: TORONTO, June 28  An ambitious but somewhat vague plan for delivering natural gas from Alaska to Canada and the United States was an nounced over the weekend by the Alberta Gas Trunk Line Co., Ltd.

title: Consumer Panel Creates FederalState Relations Unit
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) A Federalstate relations of fice has been created within the President's Committee on Con sumer Interests, Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, committee chairman, announced today.

title: Tigers, Indians Divide
description: DETROIT, June 28 (AP)The Detroit Tigers pounded four Cleveland pitchers in a fiverun sixth inning today and scored a 51 victory after Jack Heide mann's five straight hits led the Indians to an 82 triumph in the opener of a double header.

title: RUMANIAN MEETS ROGERS ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 28 Secretary of State William P. Rogers conferred for 90 minutes here today with Ru mania's Foreign Minister, Cor neliu Manescu, who will meet tomorrow morning with Presi dent Nixon at the Western White House at San Clemente, Calif.

title: DECLINING RATES LIKELY FOR BONDS
description: The Federal Reserve's recent moves toward easier credit conditions and a lighter sched ule of bond sales this week seem likely to combine to keep interest rates tilted downward.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JUNE 29, 1970

title: Year in College to Be Required For a Detroit Police Promotion
description: DETROIT, June 28Detroit's police commissioner has or dered his men to get some college education before pro motion.

title: Miss Tashjian Bride in Jersey
description: TENAFLY, N.J., June 28 Miss Barbara Aim Tashjian, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Haig Tashjian of Leonia, was married at the St. Thomas Armenian Apostolic Church here today to William Saun ders Weismann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Dudley Weismann of Schenectady. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Arnak Kasparian, who was assisted by the Rev. Levon Arakelian.

title: Panama Protests U. S. Aid to Fugitives
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 Panama has handed a strong protest to the United States for giving sanctuary in the Canal Zone to three Panamanian Na tional Guard officers charged with having attempted to over throw Brig. Gen. Omar Torrijos as commander of the Guard and the country's strongman.

title: Giants Sweep Braves, 64, 43
State Plans to Add 4,000 Summer Jobs For Poor Youths
description: A special $1.7million state program designed to provide additional summer jobs for dis advantaged youth was an nounced yesterday by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Nixon Faces Opposition on Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 President Nixon's promised new approach to foreign aid in the Seventies is evoking stiff opposition in Congress even be fore its official unveiling.

title: Furniture Company Backed by Black Athletes
description: When Nate Bowman and Henri Phipps were students at Wichita State in the early nineteensixties, they led very different lives. Mr. Bowman, a star athlete, was busy dunking shots for the basket ball team. Mr. Phipps, an en gineering student, was busy designing furniture.

title: Brazil's Urban Guerrillas Take High Toll in Killings and Thefts
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 28 An underground war without quarter is being fought be tween Brazil's military Govern ment and small cells of radical terrorists in the largest cities.

title: Thre Areas Stressed
description: CINCINNATI, June 28 (UPI) Mr. Wilkins said today that the convention could not hope to cope with all the great prob lems and tensions in America today.

title: Biafran Assets Taken Over
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, June 28 (UPI)Nigeria has established a agency to take control of all assets of the former secessionist Biafran regime, the Government announced today. It said the assets included the University of Nigeria at Nsukka  which the rebels renamed the Univer sity of Biafraand companies and corporations in the former Eastern Region.

title: MANSON GAG RULE BRINGS PROTESTS
description: LOS ANGELES, June 28 While jury selection in the murder trial of Charles M. Man son and three of his young followers goes on here in pub lic at a slow pace, a curtain of judicial silence has been dropped over the legal maneuv ering.

title: GOLDBERG REBUTS GOVERNOR ON WAR
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, the Dem ocratic candidate for Governor, scoffed yesterday at Governor Rockefeller's description of him self as a strong peace candi date.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 29, 1970 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: ExChampion's Future Is at Stake in Jersey City Bout
description: One of boxing's curios, Sonny Liston, who claims to be 38 years old, will be on display tonight in the Jersey City Armory against Chuck Wepner in a 10round heavyweight bout that is more interesting than significant.

title: Roll of Honour Scores by a Neck in $300,000 Paris Race
description: PARIS, June 28  Earl A. Scheib, auto painting executive of Beverly Hills, Calif., paid large, undisclosed sum of mon ey last Friday for a classy Irish colt, Roll of Honour. He recov ered most of his investment to day when the horse won the first prize of $173,000 in the Grand Prix de Paris, run over 1 mile 7 furlongs at Long champ.

title: Wimbledon FreeforAll
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 28Still vibrating with excitement from the shatter ing defeat of the world ten nis champion, Rod Laver, and the subsequent abrupt dis missal of thirdseeded Arthur Ashe yesterday in high dramas on center court, Wim bledon starts its second week tomorrow, wide open for the taking by anyone of the eight remaining men.

title: Jane Konheim Wed To Mondi Elimelech
description: HEWLETT, L. L, June 28 In a garden ceremony at the home here of Mr. and Mrs. Marshall Finck, the bride's uncle and aunt, Miss Jane Konheim of New York and Mondi Elimelech of Tel Aviv were married this afternoon by Rabbi Judah Cahn of the Metropolitan Synagogue of New York.

title: Belgian and Congolese Focus
description: BRUSSELS, June 28Di vided Belgium needs the mon archy, as a former Socialist Premier, Achille van Acker, once observed, as it needs bread.

title: Tennis: A Way of Life for Suburban Matrons
description: They disdain golf, find bridge tiresome and keep in shape without boring work outs in the gym. They're the tennis en thusiasts who don't have to drive to their playing ground, never have to wait for a court and have no trouble finding partners. The tennis court's in the back yardand they wouldn't trade it in for a swimming pool, though some times, of course, they have both.

title: 12THINNING DRIVE TOPS ORIOLES, 43
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) Rick Reichardt belted a two run homer as a pinchhitter in the bottom of the 12th today, giving the Washington Senators a 43 victory over the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Aqueduct to Reopen Today With Exacta Wagering and a Rustic Setting
description: Aqueduct, offering exacta betting and a touch of Bel mont Park greenery, reopens today.

title: Seoul Reports the Capture Of North Korean Spy Boat
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Mon day, June 29 (AP)South Ko rean forces captured a North Korean spy boat off the west coast early today after a two hour gun battle involving ground troops, aircraft and navy boats, a South Korean military spokesman said.

title: London: Putting Criticism to the Test
description: LONDONOne of the pe rennial headaches that rack arts producers in British television involves the best way to project literature, more especially the criticism of books and authors, as moving, talking pictures on a screen. The TV companies, notably the British Broad casting Corpora tion, have done a brave, intelligent, largely successful job of translating novels into seri alsfrom John Galsworthy's Forsyte Saga to Emile Zola's Germinal, from Charlotte Bront's Villette to Henry James's Portrait of a Lady. They have also mounted stylish and serious experiments in TV biography, recreating the life and work of writers like George Eliot, seen through the highly per sonal, partisan lens of direc tors such as Ken Russell who has just blossomed into movies with Women in Love.

title: WINNERS EXTEND STREAK TO SEVEN
description: PITTSBURGH, June 28 (AP) Matty Alou drove in two unearned runs with a bases, loaded single to give Pittsburgh a 41 victory and a double header sweep of the sagging Chicago Cubs today. The Pirates posted their seventh straight victory and handed the Cubs their 10th straight loss in the last day of baseball at 61yearold Forbes Field.

title: JOHN DOCTOROFF
description: CHICAGO, June 28 (AP)  John Doctoroff, who painted portraits of the powerful and the wealthy, died yesterday in a hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Lombardi Doing Well
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) Vince Lombardi, coach of the Washington Redskins, was in very satisfactory condition to day at Georgetown Hospital, Dr. Robert J. Coffey reported. Lombardi underwent surgery for the removal of a tumor from his abdomen yesterday.

title: A Black Man Takes Over a White Church in Atlanta as Part of Methodist Theme
description: ATLANTA, June 28  The new minister of the Calvary Methodist Church stood in its doorway today and accepted congratulations on his first sermon from smiling parishion ers as they filed past his flow ing robes into the hot Georgia sun.

title: Mr. Heath's Foreign Problems
description: LONDONThe members of the new Conservative Govern ment must be reflecting already on how much easier it is to promise in politics than to per form. In their first week in of fice they have had some cool advice from the mandarins of British administration, the top civil servants, on the difficulty of simultaneously cutting taxes, stopping inflation, paying more to protesting doctors and pre venting strikes by others for their piece of the pie.

title: Merger Accounting Is Tightened
description: The accounting profession acted over the weekend to adopt a series of hotly debated proposals designed to make it harder for companies involved in mergers to increaseprofits with a stroke of their accountant's pen.

title: Royals Recall O'Riley
description: KANSAS CITY, June 28 (AP) The Kansas City Royals recalled Don O'Riley, a righthanded pitcher, from their Omaha American Association farm club.

title: Son to S. P. Greenspons
description: A son was born at Lenox Hill Hospital on Wednesday to Mr. and Mrs. Stuart P. Greenspon. The child, whose mother is the former Miss Jacqueline Hays Dryfoos, has been named Michael Stuart. He is the grandson of Mrs. Andrew Heiskell and the late Orvil E. Dryfoos, who was publisher of The New York Times, and the greatgrand son of Mrs. Arthur Hays Sulzberger and the late Mr. Sulzberger, who was pub lisher of The Times and chair man of the board of The New York Times Company. His other grandparents are Mrs. Emanuel Greenspon and the late Dr. Greenspon, who was a physician in Hampton, Va. Mr. Greenspon is assis tant production manager for The Times.

title: The Guam Doctrine: Asian Nations Voice Anxiety
description: TOKYO, June 28 To the countries of East and Southeast Asia, President Nixon's Guam doctrine has an appealing ring, and Asian lip service to the doctrine is enthusiastic.

title: Major Bills in Congress
description: ABBREVIATIONS

title: Births
description: JEANESMr. & Mrs. Marshall M. Jeanes of Bryn Burna, Califon, N.J. an nounce the birth of a second son, Chris topher Baird, on June 12th at the Mor ristown Memorial Hospital, Morristown, N.J. Mrs. Jeanes is the former Eliza beth W. Townsend, daughter of Mr. & Mrs. Henry C. Townserl, Ill of Wayne, Pa. The paternal Grandparents are the late Mr. and Mrs. Henry S. Jeanes of Devon, Pa.

title: PHILIP L. POE
description: BALTIMORE, June 28 (AP) Philip L. Poe, president of the Maryland & Pennsylvania Rail road died on Friday at his home. He was 91 years old.

title: Campers Crowd into Parks in a New National Quest for Nature
description: BARABOO, Wis.By the time the long Northern twi light falls over central Wis consin these days there are few places left in the three sprawling campgrounds at Devils Lake State Park.

title: NEW STEPS TAKEN ON DATA CONCERN
description: Honeywell, Inc., and the General Electric Company announced over the weekend that they have taken the next step in the formation of their new data processing company.

title: MISS MILLS VICTOR IN A 3WAY PLAYOFF
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 28 (UPI)Mary Mills of Laurel, Miss., won a suddendeath play off on the second hole to take the. $20,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association's Immke Buick open today.

title: NEW YORK LEAVES 11 MEN ON BASES
Jewish Group Sees a Drive for Public Aid to Church Schools
description: CLEVELAND, June 28The National Jewish Community Relations Advisory Council told today of a well organized drive and increasing de mands for the use of govern ment funds to assist church related schools.

title: 1,000 Go to Rome To Protest Reform Of Catholic Mass
description: ROME, June 28More than 1,000 Roman Catholic tradition alists from various European countries publicly prayed in Latin today in a sedate protest against what they termed the Montini mass.

title: Mary Palmer Wed Upstate
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 28Miss Mary Ellen Palmer and Second Lieut. David Wil liam McDermott, U.S.A.F., were married here today in the Roman Catholic Chapel of the Holy Trinity. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Robert McCormick.

title: Roosevelt Entries
description: Roosevelt Entries

title: Auditor Criticizes Rapid Pay Rises for City Drug Unit Workers
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame made public an auditors' report yesterday criticizing rapid sal ary increases in the city's Ad diction Services Agency and calling for improved fiscal con trols.

title: Russian Chemist Dies
description: MOSCOW, June 28 (Reuters) Mikhail Shemyakin, a leading Russian organic chemist, has died in the Latvian capital of Riga at 62, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported yester day. Director of the Academy of Sciences Institute for the Chemistry of Natural Com pounds, Mr. Shemyakin had carried out research on anti biotics and vitamins and devel oped methods of ??

title: JERSEY P.B.A. LOCAL BACK ON JOB TODAY
description: TRENTON, June 28 (AP) Striking state correction offi cers voted today to go back to work beginning tomorrow morning, ending a sickcall job action that left some penal institutions dangerously short of personnel for almost two weeks.

title: CASE ASKS FUNDS FOR METROLINER
description: NEWARK, (AP) June 28  Senator Clifford P. Case said yesterday that the Government should allocate another $5mil lion to overhaul troubleprone cars on the Penn Central's Me troliner.

title: Choice of a Regional Capital in Italy Sets Off Riots in a Rival City
description: PESCARA, Italy, June 28  Buses and trucks barricading streets, smashed store windows and overturned burnedout cars have transformed this Adriatic beach city into a guerrilla land scape.

title: GROUND OPERATION BY U.S. IN CAMBODIA TO END TOMORROW
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 28As American troops continued their withdrawal from Cambodia, scheduled to be completed by Tuesday, a slight increase in enemy activity was reported throughout South Viet nam in the last 48 hours.

title: U.S. Track Team
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., June 28 (AP)Composition of the United States track and field team that will tour France, West Germany and the Soviet Union this summer:

title: Cost of Home Mortgages Climbed Again Last Month
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (UPI) The interest cost of conven tional mortgages for the pur chase of new homes increased again last month to a nation wide average of 8.44 per cent, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today.

title: Advertising: A Market Survey of Europe
description: Did you know the average Englishman drank 400 fewer cups of tea last year than a decade ago (especially the eightyearolds), that only 11 per cent of Norwegian homes have central heating, that Italy made more from tour ism in 1968 than any other European country, that only 38 per cent of the Roman Catholics went to church last Christmas?

title: Palestinians Report Attacks
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 28 (Reuters)  Al Fatah guerrillas today repeatedly used heavy rockets on the town of Beisan and Israel settlements in the northern Jordan Valley and up per Galilee, a Palestine Armed Struggle Command spokesman said here. He estimated that the Israelis had suffered heavy casualties.

title: Black Capitalism Program Falling Far Short of Goals
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 The Nixon Administration's plan to produce more minority capitalists, one of the Presi dent's major campaign pledges, has fallen far short of its goals.

title: SAIGON SEES NEED FOR MORE U.S, AID
description: SAIGON, June 28The Gov ernment of South Vietnam plans sweeping economic reforms, but requires at least $200million in emergency aid from the United States to tide it over a severe inflationary crisis, Economics Minister Pham Kim Ngoc said in an interview here.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: EICHSTAEDT NEXT ON PAR70 LAYOUT
description: CLEVELAND, June 28Bruce Devlin made it two victories in a row for foreign golf profes sionals today. By equaling the course record with a final round of 64, the 32yearold Austra lian won the Cleveland open by four strokes and earned the first prize of $30,000 with a 72hole total of 268. A week ago, Tony Jacklin of England captured the United States Open at Chaska, Minn.

title: A Mad Scientist Loose in Salon?
description: Arrive at House of Revlon at 3 P.M., after fattening lunch. Am greeted by cheerful receptionist who says, You're going to try The Machine. You'll love it. Am not so sure.

title: Neighborhoods: The Horne of Harlem's Affluent
description: Black Harlem had its be ginnings more than 60 years ago on 134th Street east of Lenox Avenue.

title: Melville E. Ivey Becomes Bride
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., June 28Miss Melville Eliza beth Ivey and Timothy Peter Boufford, members of the class of '71 at the University of Michigan Medical School, were married here this eve ning. The Rev. Wallace Rob ertson performed the Presby terian ceremony in the Alumni Chapel of Michigan State University, where the bride's father, John E. Ivey Jr. is dean of the College of Education.

title: Senator Urges a Gradual CeaseFire
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 Senator Charles McC. Mathias Jr., Republican of Maryland, proposed today that the United States initiate a graduated ceasefire in Vietnam in an at tempt to improve the climate for a negotiated peace.

title: D'Antuono and Lander Dance Swan Queen for Ballet Theater
description: The American Ballet Thea ter's Swan Lake came up with its refreshingly unneurotic Siegfrieds as usual in yester day's two performances at the State Theater but was mildly disappointing in its two inde finable Swan QueensEleanor D'Antuono in the afternoon and Toni Lander in the evening.

title: Gurney Wins CanAm Race for Team McLaren at Mont Tremblant
description: MONT TREMBLANT, Quebec, June 28Dan Gurney, the new member of the McLaren race team, easily won his second CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup event of the season today after his teammate, Denis Hulme, dropped out with an overheated engine. Gurney drove a bright orange McLaren M8D sportsracing car powered by a 7.5liter Chevrolet engine.

title: Suit to Seek Access to Birth Pill Data
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 A Washington mother said today that she would sue the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare to force it to disclose its records on birth control Dills.

title: Consumer Crossroads
description: The failure for many years of many manufacturers In various fields to turn out safe products, and the inability of traditional Government agencies to pro tect the public from resultant accidents and deaths, are leading to a legislative crossroad.

title: AllNight Shakespeare Enthralls 3,000
description: For nearly 12 hours, from dusk Saturday to dawn yes terday, the clash of broad swords, the flare of torches, the pomp of heraldic banners all the panoply and pag eantry of England racked by the Wars of the Rosesen thralled 3,000 spectators in Central Park.

title: Millions Are Spent To Fight Pollution Of Ocean Beaches
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 25 Tens of thousands of vacation ers were on the beaches here this morning, engaged in the No. 1 American holiday activ itysunbathing. The ocean water that crashed onto the South Florida beaches in five foot waves was clear.

title: Athletics Register Pair of 41 Victories To Sweep Brewers
Personal Finance
description: Babies may have their heavenly aspects, but in the cold world of reality they are expensive. The justmarried June bride and groom ought to be aware of the costs to that they can do some plan ning.

title: The Mood of the Mayors
description: In Denver, on Fifteenth Street between Arapahoe and Curtis, a huge, bearded miner cast in bronze, one hand resting on a pick and the other holding nugget, reminds passersby of the Western city's goldrush be ginnings. Several blocks away, the genuine gold  leaf dome of the State Capitol glistens against an azure sky to attest to the success of the earliest prospec tors.

title: PIERRE MAC ORLAN, FRENCH NOVELIST, 88
description: PARIS, June 28  Pierre Mac Orlan, the French novelist and poet, died last night at the age of 88 after a heart attack at his home at St.Cyrsur Morin.

title: 3 J.D.L. Members, Including Kahane, Seized in Brooklyn
description: Three members of the mili tant Jewish Defense League, including its chairman, Rabbi Meir Kahane, were arrested outside a police station in Brooklyn last night for al legedly hurling bottles at po licemen who attempted to dis perse a crowd of the league's followers.

title: Radicals Map Strategies to End War
description: MILWAUKEE, June 28 Radicals from a wide spectrum of organizations gathered here this weekend to plan new strategies to end the war in Southeast Asia.

title: SHOW PRIZE GOES TO GORDON SETTER
description: ONEONTA, N. Y., June 28 Mrs. Cheever Porter's Gordon setter, Ch. Legend of Gael, C.D., scored a repeat victory today at the DelOtseNango Kennel Club show. The 5yearold dog from New York was chosen best in a field of 920.

title: STUDY DISCOUNTS RISK OF EPILEPSY
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 28A team of Mayo Clinic research ers has found a reassuringly low incidence of recurrent seizures, or epilepsy, in a fol lowup study of 381 children who had been treated as in fants for convulsions associ ated with a high fever.

title: Five Hurt in Racial Brawl
description: KIMBERLEY, South Africa, June 28 (UPI)Five persons were injured yesterday in a racial brawl after a rugby game in which the New Zealand All Blacks defeated Griqualand West, 273, police reported to day.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
Engineer Rescues German Camera Works
description: BRAUNSCHWEIG, West GermanyWest Germany's traditionstepped camera in dustry has a new success story. His name is Dr. Hein rich Peesel, director of the Rollei works in Braunschweig. In his eyes, however, tradi tion alone does not make profits.

title: RYUKUS APPROVES VENTURE BY ALCOA
description: NAHA, Okinawa, June 28 The Government of the Ryuk yus over the weekend gave official approval to the aiumi num Company of America's ap plication for a multimillion dollar investment on the island The action came on the heels of a similar bid by a group or five Japanese aluminum pro ducers which, with their Gov ernment's backing, have beer bitterly opposing a backdoor entry of the American con cern.

title: Heath's Priority for Europe
description: In foreign policy, Edward Heath's personal priority has long been clear. He would like to go down in history as the Prime Minister who took Britain into the European Common Market. He believes this step would provide the best guarantee for future prosperity and a meaningful international political role for Britain.

title: SummerSchool Program Is Expanded Here at the Urging of Local Boards, Nearly Doubling Costs
description: Starting this week, the Board of Education will begin offer ing the most extensive summer program of instruction and rec reational activities in its his tory.

title: REDS' HOMER TOPS ASTROS IN 9TH, 32
description: HOUSTON, June 28 (AP)  Tony Perez led off the ninth inning with his 27th home run of the season today, giving the Cincinnati Reds a 32 victory over the Houston Astros.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: CHILD PLACEMENT SHIFTED BY COURT
description: New moves to reorganize Family Court procedures in cluding entrusting all place ments of neglected and abused children to the city's Commis sioner of Social Serviceswere announced yesterday.

title: Vivian Claire Diamant Is Married
description: Miss Vivian Claire Dia mant, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred J. Diamant of New York, was married here last evening to Albert Cabasso, son of Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Cabasso of Geneva.

title: Israeli Towns Shelled From Lebanon and Jordan
description: JERUSALEM, June 28Pales tinian guerrillas shelled the tex tile mill town of Qiryat Shmona twice with Katyusha rockets launched in Lebanon this morn ing, killing one resident and wounding a woman, an Israeli spokesman said today. Kibbutz Dan in the upper Galilee was also struck with rockets but there were no casualties, he reported.

title: Metropolitan Museum Will Show 70 Films From French Archives
description: Seventy films from the ar chives of the Cinmathque Franaise in Paris will be shown from July 29 through Sept. 3 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art under the joint sponsorship of the museum and the City Center of Music and Drama.

title: Chess:
SUPPORT FOR ISRAEL DRAWS ARAB RETORT
description: A call for United States sup port of Israel, including the ful fillment of Israel's request for jet fightersissued yesterday by a group of Negro leaders was attacked by the spokesman of an Arab group here as hypo critical and escalating war ef forts in the Middle East.

title: RED WING DUO'S 183 TAKES HOCKEY GOLF
description: TORONTO, June 28Frank Mahovlich of the Red Wings, who came closest to getting a holeinone today, and his De troit teammate, Gary Bergman, won the American Airlines golf tournament for hockey players with a 54hole total of 183.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: In Memoriam
description: SCHOENFELDJoseph. Lovingly remembered, always. The Family.

title: O.E.O. Sponsoring 2 Medical Projects To Serve the Poor
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The Office of Economic Opportunity is sponsoring the establishment of two prepaid group medical practices to serve the poor.

title: CHARLES PRANGE, LED DENTURE PLATE FIRM
description: Charles H. Prange, a former alloy, company president, died Saturday at Bryn Mawr (Pa.) Hospital of a heart ailment. He was 78 years old, and lived at 10 Park Avenue, New York. Mr. Prange joined with a brother  in  law, Heiner W. Erdle, in 1928, to form Aus tenal Laboratories, Inc., pro ducer of stainless steel denture plates. He headed the com pany for many years, and was president when it was sold to the Hornet Corporation in 1958, remaining four more years as a consultant before retiring.

title: JOURNALIST WINS RUNOFF IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, June 28JeanJacques ServanSchreiber, the journalist, author and secretary general of the Radical Socialist party, was elected a Deputy in the Nation al Assembly today in Lorraine, in eastern France. His victory was regarded as a provincial revolt against Paris.

title: Bridge:
description: STOCKHOLM, June 28 Waldemar von Zedtwitz of New York, one of the great est figures in the history of bridge, overcame the severe handicap of failing eyesight and scored a magnificent victory in the international mixed pair event here tonight.

title: Anniversaries
description: ZIMMERMANIrene and Sidney. Happy 40th Anniversary To the best parents ever. From your offspring and your interest.

title: BLACK AID AGENCY BOLD IN APPROACH
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., June 28 The Arcata Investment Com pany's simple method of put ting money into the hands of minority businessmen is to toss out the rule book and find and finance them.

title: ANDRETTI TRIUMPHS IN COLORADO EVENT
description: CASTLE ROCK, Colo., June 28 (AP)Mario Andretti over came extreme heat today and won the $60,000 Rocky Moun tain 150mile auto race at Con tinental Divide Raceways.

title: Thousands of Homosexuals Hold A Protest Rally in Central Park
description: Thousands of young men and women homosexuals from all over the Northeast marched from Greenwich Village to the Sheep Meadow in Central Park yesterday proclaiming the new strength and pride of the gay people.

title: Growing Shipments Of Steel Forecast
description: PITTSBURGH, June 28Steel producers are revising their 1970 forecasts upward.

title: Three Candidates Endorsed By Youth Caucus in Boston
description: BOSTON, June 28  The Youth Caucus endorsed today for Congress a Roman Catholic priest, a black lawyer and former school teacher in three Massachusetts Congressional districts.

title: Leila Jones Engaged To Jonathan S. Linen
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 28Gilbert E. Jones, chair man of the board of the I.B.M. World Trade Corpora tion, and Mrs. Jones have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Leila Haven Jones, to Jonathan Scranton Linen, son of James A. Linen 3d, chairman of the executive committee of Time Inc., and Mrs. Linen and nephew of William Warren Scranton, former Governor of Pennsylvania.

title: GiantsSteeters on TV
description: The New York Giants and Pittsburgh Steelers preseason National Football League game on Friday night, Aug. 28, will be televised nationally by ABC from Pittsburgh's new Three Rivers Stadium, starting at 8:30 P.M., Roone Arledge, president of ABC Sports said yesterday.

title: Decatur and Reyer Win
description: Marty Decatur and Artie Rever won the National Ama teur Athletic Union onewall doubles handball title yester day by defeating their 92d Street Y.M.H.A. teammates, Lou Russo and Joel Wisotsky, 1521, 2116, 2114. Third place in the tournament at the Municipal Courts in Coney Island was taken by Mike Dikman and Bob Sparrow of the Brownsville Handball Club, who won by default from Carl and Ruby Obert.

title: MALTA PARLEY URGES DEFENSE OF ANCHOVY
description: VALLETTA, Malta, June 28 Better conservation of the lowly but nutritious anchovy was urged by experts gathering on this Mediterranean island today for a conference on problems of the sea.

title: Danes Confident on Eve Of Market Negotiations
description: COPENHAGEN, June 26  Denmark is approaching the formal opening Tuesday of ne gotiations for membership in the European Economic Com munity with a greater degree of confidence than any of her fellow applicants.

title: Debra Piche Is Bride of Angus Coffey
description: TENAFLY, N. J., June 28 The marriage of Miss Debra Ruth Fiche, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Cole Fiche, to Angus McDonell Coffey took place in the Presbyterian Church here tonight. The bridegrooni is the son of Mrs. Onolee McDonell Coffey of Englewood and Fishers Is land, N. Y., and Thomas Coffey of New York.

title: JUMP TITLE GOES TO TRIPLE CROWN
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 28Triple Crown, owned and ridden by Sam Lehrman, captured the Johnson Park Special for open jumpers today after a grueling 3 hours of competition at the Middlesex County horse show.

title: 62 Mental Health Centers, Built or Expanded With Federal Approval, Face Denial of Promised Funds
description: Citizens' groups interested in mental health in 100 communi ties around the country are waiting in suspense to hear, from the Federal Government in the next few days whether years of painstaking work will end in disappointment.

title: May MachineTool Level Dropped to a 7Year Low
description: An important and closely watched indicator of future business activity, new orders for machine tools, plunged in May to the lowest level in more than seven years.

title: A Shortage of PollutionFree Oil Seen
description: Suppliers of lowsulphur fuel oilneeded to meet airpollu tion controlsreport that they probably will be able to fill only 80 to 90 per cent of the de mand on the East Coast next winter, according to the city's Environmental Protection Ad ministration.

title: 12,000Car Melbourne Jam
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, June 28 (Reuters)Some 12,000 cars jammed 12 miles of a highway outside Melbourne today as the new $45million Tullamarine international airport was open ed. The police spent five hours trying to unblock the road.

title: ItalianAmericans Ready For Colorful Unity Day
description: Members of the Italian American Civil Rights League scrambled over statuary and lampposts in Columbus Circle yesterday to prepare the plaza for today's ItalianAmerican Unity Day rally.

title: HOSPITAL DISPUTE PERILS ABORTIONS
description: None but emergency abor tions will be performed in mu nicipal hospitals here if non medical workers carry out their threat to strike on Wednesday, the day a liberalized abortion law takes effect throughout the state.

title: BIG BOARD READY TO VOTE ON RATES
description: The board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange is scheduled to meet in special session this afternoon to vote on a new commission rate schedule which will be sub mitted to the Securities and Ex change Commission tomorrow.

title: Celler Asks Notice On Price Increases
description: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) A bill that would require companies in basic industries to give advance notice to the President of any proposed price increase will he introduced tomorrow by Representative Emanuel Celler, Democrat of Brooklyn. The bill would re quire a 60day waiting period before any price increase could take effect.

title: BIG TURNOUT SEEN IN VIETNAM VOTE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 28South Vietnamese voted today for city and pro vincial councilmen in an elec tion that has centered on do mestic concerns but that may play an important role in the future of national politics.

title: A Blow to Wage Stability
description: The overwhelming rejection by Chicago truck drivers of a contract that would have given them pay increases of more than 40 per cent over a 45month period is a blow to the Nixon Administration's hopes for wage price stability through the President's new brand of jawboning.

title: A.A.U. MEET SHOWS U.S. TRACK DEPTH
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., June 28 It was the perfect end to an unpredictable track and field meet. Two grown men held hands in the stretch and crossed the finish line together after a sixmile run.

title: PHILS' 5RUN 10TH DOWNS CARDS, 83
description: ST. LOUIS June 28 (AP) The Philadelphia Phillies scored five times in the 10th inning and beat St. Louis, 83, today in the second game of a double header. The Cardinals took the opener, 54.

title: Muncey's Hydroplane Is First In $25,000 Gold Cup Contest
description: DETROIT, June 28  Bill Muncey turned a boat race into a cake walk today as he drove Myr Sheet Metal to victory in the Horace E. Dodge Gold Cup memorial race for unlimited hydroplanes on the Detroit River.

title: NASSER WILL VISIT SOVIET FOR TALKS
description: CAIRO, June 28  President Gamal Abdel Nasser is ex pected to fly to the Soviet Union this week for consulta tions on the military and po litical aspects of a settlement of the ArabIsraeli conflict, but officials here said they had no information about such a trip.

title: DODGERS WIN, 20, FOR 6TH STRAIGHT
description: LOS ANGELES, June 28 (UPI)  The Los Angeles Dodgers scored their sixth straight vic tory today, beating the San Diego Padres, 20, on runs in I the first inning.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Concerts

title: Municipal Workers Increase
description: ALBANY, June 28 (AP)The number of municipal employes throughout the state increased 6.8 per cent last year, accord ing to the State Department of Civil Service. Local municipal civil service commissions em ployed 259,094 in communities outside New York City at the end of 1969.

title: Dalrymple Out for Season
description: BALTIMORE, June 28 (UPI) Clay Dalrymple, the Balti more Orioles' catcher will he sidelined for the remainder of the season with a fractured ankle, sustained in a home plate collision with Mike Epstein of the Washington Senators yesterday.

title: LISTON, WEPNER TO FIGHT TONIGHT
description: LISTON, WEPNER TO FIGHT TONIGHT

title: Rails Appear Ready to Share Lakes Bulk Traffic With Ships
description: CLEVELAND, June 28  Signs of a willingness by rail roads in the Great Lakes area to share dry bulk traffic with steamship operators were re ported here last week.

title: ULSTER ASSUMES UNYIELDING STAND ON CATHOLIC ISSUE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 28  The Unionist Gov ernment of Northern Ireland, apparently seeking support from the new Conservative Govern ment in London, took an un yielding stand today after harrowing night of Catholic Protestant riots, gun battles and widespread arson.

title: ANDRETTI TRIUMPHS IN COLORADO EVENT
description: CASTLE ROCK, Colo., June 28 (AP)Mario Andretti over came extreme heat today and won the $60,000 Rocky Moun tain 150mile auto race at Con tinental Divide Raceways.

title: Johanna Rosenthal Wed to Doctor
description: Miss Johanna Sebastian Rosenthal, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Abraham Rosenthal of Kew Gardens, Queens, was married here yesterday to Dr. Wallace Brand Mendelson, son of Prof. and Mrs. Wal lace Mendelson of Austin, Tex. The ceremony at the Plaza was performed by Rabbi David J. Seligson, cousin of the bride.

title: ROYALS WIN, 131, AFTER 21 DEFEAT
description: KANSAS CITY, June 28 (UPI) Lou Piniella triggered a three run uprising with a homer in the sixth inning of the second game today to pace the Kansas City Royals to a 131 victory and a split of a doubleheader with the California Angels.

title: I.O.S. Says Sales Begin to Outweigh Redemption Drain
description: Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., the ailing international mutual fund complex, has be gun in the last week or so to take in slightly more money from sales of new shares than it pays out for the redemption of old ones.

title: RUDEL'S ENSEMBLE PLAYS AT CARAMOOR
description: Baroque strains filled the chill open air of the Venetian Theater at the Caramoor Festi val in Katonah, N. Y., Saturday night. The conductor Julius Rudel chose a most agreeable selection of music by Telemann, Handel and Pergolesiall of it warmly played by a superla tive chamber orchestra which seemed completely undiscour aged by the cool night breezes.

title: Goldmann Says He Talked With Hassan on the Mideast
description: TEL AVIV, June 28 (Reu ters)  Dr. Nahum Goldmann, president of the World Jewish Congress, confirmed tonight that he talked last Wednesday with King Hassan II of Mo rocco on the Middle East crisis.Interviewed by the Israeli radio in Sirmione, on Italy's Lake Garda, where he is on vacation. Dr. Goldman said he met King Hassan at his palace after the King had sought the meeting through a mutual friend in Paris to dis cuss Dr. Goldmann's ideas on a settlement.

title: California Nears a Vote on Amendment to Give Public Money to Private Colleges and Universities
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 28 The California Legislature is about to propose a state consti tiitional amendment designed to permit direct appropriations of public funds for private colleges and universities.

title: Hanoi Says U.S. Failed
description: TOKYO, June 28 (AP)North Vietnam contended today that the United States had achieved none of its objectives in the military incursion into Cam bodia and was conducting a campaign of deception. A dis patch by the North Vietnamese press agency said that the United States cannot help pull ing its troops out of Cambodia by June 30, although none of its objectives has been at tained.

title: 2 Fresh Enemy Regiments Reported Heading South
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, June 28Two fresh enemy in fantry regiments are making their way from North Vietnam through Laos toward the north ernmost province of South Vietnam, according to high ranking American and Viet namese military men. But they insist they are not worried by this development.

title: Rozelle and Wheelwright Discuss Player's Night Club
description: Commissioner Pete Rozelle and Ernie Wheelwright of the New Orleans Saints met yester day hi the commissioner's New York office to discuss the own ership of a Metairie, La., night club in which the player has an interest. There was no an nouncement as to the result of the discussion.

title: Aetna Life Appoints Senior Vice President
description: Donald G. Conrad, a finan cial executive with the Standard Oil Company, New Jersey, has been appointed senior vice president  finan cial of Aetna Life & Casualty. The 40yearold Mr. Conrad will be responsible for the operations of the financial division.

title: Air Victim to Get $1Million
description: CHICAGO, June 29 (AP)A Circuit Court judge awarded $1million damages today to a passenger injured in a crash of a North Central Airlines plane at O'Hare International Airport in December, 1968. Judge Jo seph J. Wosik said the settle ment for Rebecca Beasley, 27 years old, of Indianapolis, was the largest ever awarded in the nation to a person injured in an airplane crash. Miss, Beasley, a social worker, is paralyzed in both legs from injuries suffered when the plane crashed into a hangar 1,000 feet from a run way.

title: Israelis Press Air Strikes At Targets on Suez Canal
description: TEL AVIV, June 29 (Reuters) Israeli jets today continued their intermittent air strikes against Egyptian military tar gets along the Suez Canal.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Casey Stengel was managing the Brooklyn Dodgers many eons ago, his right fielder was Hack Wilson, a tremen dous homerun hitter. But the short, wide shouldered Hack was then completing the process of drinking his way out of the league. On this particular day he was playing in Philadelphia's band box park, Baker Bowl, and it was to be a rugged afternoon.

title: Dynamite Blast Damages Science Hall at Drake U.
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 29 (AP)Iowa's fourth dynamite bombing in less than two months damaged the Harvey Ingham Hall of Science at Drake University early today.

title: Jayson of Noroton Takes Lead For Hipkins Trophy in Sailing
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., June 29 William S. Jayson of Noroton (Conn.) Yacht Club sailed into a onehalf point lead for the Commodore Hipkins Trophy to day when the 19th annual Long Island Sound men's champion ship regatta began with four races during a ninehour session off Pequot Y. C. Jayson had 18 mints.

title: Mets' Records
Sir David Owen Is Dead at 65; Helped Set Up U.N. Secretariat
description: Sir David Owen, head of the International Planned Parent hood Federation and a former administrator of the United Na tions development program, died of a heart attack yester day in a London hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: Brandt Sees Sign Ulbricht Favors Further Talks
description: BONN, June 29Chancellor Willy Brandt suggested today that Walter Ulbricht, the East German leader, had given a sign that East and West Ger many could proceed now to a third, meaningful round of talks about settling some of the differences that have kept them separated and hostile for the last Quarter of a century.

title: U. S. Awaiting Response
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (Reu ters)  The State Department said today that it did not re gard Premier Meir's rejection of a limited ceasefire as a final answer by Israel to the United States peace plan.

title: Gulf Sets Joint Venture
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation an nounced yesterday it had signed a letter of intent with the Tei koku Oil Company, Ltd., for a joint venture agreement to ex plore for oil in an offshore area extending southwest from Kyu shu Island, Japan. Teikoku has priority as the first applicant for a 4,926squarekilometer block designated as the offshore Amakusa Islands area.

title: OldGuard Faction Urges Front Against Mrs. Gandhi
description: NEW DELHI, June 29  The oldguard faction of the Con gress party, led by opponents of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, called today for a national democratic front to save India from dictatorship and Com munism.

title: British Like Newspapers
description: LONDON, June 29 (Reuters) Newspapers still appeal to a wider audience than television after two decades of television in Britain, according to a book published today. A market re search consultant, James Cur ran, said in the book, Media Sociology, that 81 per cent of the British read a national newspaper on an average day in 1968 while 69 per cent watched television.

title: Expo Displays Everest Rock
description: OSAKA, Japan, June 29 (UPI) A Mount Everest rock has joined a moon rock among the exhibits at Expo '70. The Japan Alpine Club presented a rock from the mountain to the Mat sushita pavilion yesterday at the world's fair. An expedition from the club climbed the 29,028foot peak on May 11.

title: Senate Blocks Move for Early Vote Designed to Kill McGovernHatfield Amendment to End Vietnam War
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 The Senate rebuffed a Republi can attempt today to force an immediate vote on the socalled endthewar amendment, which has become the rallying point for Senate doves.

title: Rebecca Williams Planning Nuptials
description: ST. LOUIS, June 29Mr. and Mrs. Eugene F. Williams Jr. have announced the en gagement their daughter, Miss Rebecca Dixon Williams, to Vicomte Loic de Kertanguy, son of Comte Herve de Kertanguy and the late Com tess de Kertangur of Lyon and Cannes, France.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Israel Indicates Rejection Of U.S. Mideast Proposal
description: JERUSALEM, June 29Pre mier Golda Meir said today that she saw no reason to change Israel's present diplo matic and military policies. She thus appeared to reject that latest United States peace initiative in the Middle East.

title: Jokers in the Mideast Pack
